title: Youth's Methadone. Death in Jail Being Studied
description: George Carlyle had his 18 yearold son, Kenneth Thomas Carlyle, arrested 11 days ago for allegedly punching him in the eye. The father told Man hattan Criminal Court Judge Jerome Vale that he suspected his son of being a drug aildict.

title: 11 Hurt in Oil Tank Blast
description: CHRISTIANSTED, St. Croix, V. I., Nov. 30 (UPI)Eleven men were severely burned to day when a 10milliongallon oil tank exploded at the Hess Oil Company refinery, appar ently as a result of welding work on a firefighting system.

title: Allende Is Meeting Labor Opposition Over Wage Policy
description: SANTIAGO, Chile, Nov. 30 President Salvador Allende Gossens, who says his Govern ment is based on the working class, is running into significant labor opposition.

title: Rockets Beat Braves, 115101
description: BUFFALO, Nov. 30 (AP) The Houston Rockets, with balanced scoring attack, pulled away from the Buffalo Braves in the third quarter and scored a 115101 victory tonight.

title: Progress in Rome
description: At the end of the first day's session of the Group Ten finance ministers in Rome, the United States and its major trading partners appear well on the way toward a resolution of the monetary crisis that has threatened the economic stability of the Western world and Japan.

title: Wagering Records Are Set As Freehold Meeting Ends
description: FREEHOLD, N.J., Nov. 30 Freehold Raceway, the coun try's only harness racing track presenting an extended all afternoon parimutuel meeting, ended its 1971 stand today with 5,242 buffs betting $593, 640.

title: Service for Zez Confrey
description: LAKEWOOD, N. J., Nov. 30 A funeral mass was offered at the Roman Catholic Church of St. Mary of the Lake on Saturday for Zez Confrey, the composer of Kitten on the Keys and other works. Mr. Confrey died Nov. 22 at the age of 76. He leaves his wife, the former Wilhelmina Matthes, who appeared on the Broadway stage as Gloria Beaumont; two sons, Paul and Tom, and two grandsons.

title: Another Village is Reported Captured
description: RAWALPINDI, Pakistan, Nov. 30A military spokesman said today that Pakistani troops had yielded another border village in East Pakistan to attacking Indian forces.

title: 38 STATES WARNED ON NURSING HOMES
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 30  The Nixon Administration de clared today that 38 states had inadequate programs for certi fication of nursing homes and warned that the states must measure up by Feb. 1 or face a possible loss of all Federal Medi caid funds.

title: Gunboat Bill Is Backed
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 30 (AP) The Senate interior Commit tee approved today a bill to au thorize the restoration and ex hibition of the Union Navy gun boat Cairo, which was sunk in the Yazoo River in. Mississippi during the Civil War. The bill would authorize the expendi ture of $2,481,000 for restora tion of the boat and develop ment of an entrance road, park ing lot, fencing and landscap ing.

title: Defendant in Kent State Rioting Is Convicted of a Misdemeanor
description: RAVENNA, Ohio, Nov. 30 The first of the Kent trials ended today with the jury find ing Jerry Rupe guilty of the mis demeanor charge of obstructing firemen during the 1970 riots at Kent State University. But the jury failed to reach a ver dict on three more serious charges against him.

title: Dunbar, Aide of Oswald, Says He Was the Source of Reports That Hostages Throats Had Been
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 30 Walter Dunbar, executive dep uty commissioner of the New York State Department of Cor rectional Services, told a Con gressional committee today that he was the official source of reports that hostages throats had been slashed and that one hostage had been cas trated during the inmate re bellion at Attica. The reports, were erroneous.

title: BAD HANDS TAG UPSETS THOMPSON
description: There was some sage advice in yesterday's horoscopes for Ralph Gary (Rocky) Symonds Thompson, the New York Giants rookie running back, who is better known by his third and fifth names.

title: Iranian Troops Occupy Three Strategic Islands in Persian Gulf, and a Sheikdom Protests
description: TEHERAN, Iran, Nov. 30 (Reuters)Iranlan troops land ed today on three disputed islands strategically situated in the Persian Gulf. The Trucial State of Ras al Khaima Im mediately protested that two of the Islands, Greater Tunb and Lesser Tunb, had been invaded and occupied.

title: MRS. GANDHI BIDS PAKISTAN REMOVE FORCES FROM EAST
description: NEW DELHI, Nov. 30Prime Minister Indira Gandhi called on the Pakistanis today to demon strate their desire for peace by withdrawing their troops from East Pakistan, where Indian supported Bengali insurgents are battling the Pakistani Army.

title: DOW INDEX RISES BY 1.61 TO 831.34
description: Stock prices staged a rally that erased a midsession sinking spell yesterday as hopes re mained alive for a solution to the international currency crisis.

title: F.D.A. Sets Frozen Dinner Nutrition Standards
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 30 Details of the first in a series of nutritional guidelines for processed foods were made public today by the Food and Drug Administration.

title: RULING PARTY'S LEAD HOLDING IN URUGUAY
description: MONTEVIDEO, Uruguay, Nov. 30, (Reuters)The ruling Colorado party still held a nar row but apparently winning lead over the National party to day as the counting of votes in the Uruguayan presidential election continued slowly and amid charges of irregularities.

title: State Department's Drive for Envoy Stirs Congress
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 30A State Department campaign of spontaneous letters and peti tions to help win Senate con firmation for a controversial diplomat has aroused misgiving in Congress.

title: Capture of Town Reported
description: NEW DELHI, Wednesday, Dec. 1 (UPI)The AllIndia radio said today that Mukti Bahini troops had liberated Radhana gar, a town about four miles inside the northern border of East Pakistan and about 25 to 30 miles from the district town of Sylhet.

title: Retroactive Pay Indicated
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 30 (AP) Senator John L. Sparkman, Democrat of Alabama, said to day the Nixon Administration had sent word is accepted a Senate provision designed to in sure that most pay rises nego tiated before the Aug. 15 freeze were received retroactively.

title: Not Political, Aurelio Says
description: Deputy Mayor Richard R. Aurelio said yesterday that the John V. Lindsay Associations had no intention of disclosing their finances, because they were not political organiza tions.

title: Elders' Lib ...
description: The elderly now represent 10 per cent of the popula tion of the United States, cast more than 15 per cent of the vote and are growing fast enough to command major political attention. No doubt these facts account for the emphasis on action instead of rhetoric at the current White House Conference on Aging, the second of its kind. Arthur S. Flemming, its chairman, wants the empha sis to fall on the older citizen's inadequacy of income a mild phrase, considering that onefourth of all Amer icans over 65 are forced to live on a, povertylevel income as defined by the Department of Labor. Many more must make do on fixed incomes little above that level while wrestling with inflationary prices, rising property taxes, wretched transportation systems and even nursing homes that would take a Dickens to excoriate adequately.

title: Colorado Bank Is Closed In Funds Misapplication
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 30 (UPDThe First National Bank of Cripple Creek, Colo., was closed today by the Controller of the Currency and declared insolvent following a misappli cation of about $800,000.

title: Feel Free Wins at Laurel; Victory Is Fourth in Row
description: LAUREL, Md., Nov. 30 (UPI) Feel Free found her stride in the homestretch in the $7,000 allowance feature at Laurel Race Course today and raced to her fourth consecutive tri umph.

title: U.S. and Canada Trade Complaints at a Parley Here
description: A White House official de clared yesterday that Canada was not paying her fair share of North American defense costs. A policy adviser from Ottawa replied that in Canada there was a feeling that there were a lot of other things on which money can be better spent.

title: POLICE ARREST 14 IN BOOKSTORE RAIDS
description: A pornography raid on four Times Square bookshops led to the arrest last night of 14 em ployes or operators, including two men allegedly connected with organizedcrime syndi cates, according to the police.

title: National Youth Caucus Formed To Play Role in 72 Conventions
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 30  Representatives of a committee of 100 student presidents an nounced today the formation of a National Youth Caucus, designed to be a political force in the 1972 Presidential nomi nating conventions.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: Solid Waste Policy

title: Everyone Knows Dolphins Now
description: About Pro Football

title: PreCampaign Resource
description: The John V. Lindsay Associa tionsa loose assortment of liberal Republicans and Demo crats, some city officials and other Lindsay supportersare becoming the Mayor's chief dis penser of political patronage across the city.

title: COURT LIFTS BAN ON MONTICELLO TV
description: A State Supreme. Court jus tice in Sullivan County over ruled the State Harness Racing Commission yesterday and lifted a ban against televising races from Monticello Raceway to New York City.

title: RUSSIANS REPORT EMBLEM ON MARS
description: MOSCOW, Not,. 30  The Soviet Union announced today that one of its two Mars space craft, on reaching the vicinity of the planet on Saturday, eject ed a capsule that placed an emblem displaying the Soviet hammer and sickle on the sur face of Mars. This would be the first manmade object to be landed on Mars.

title: I.O.S. Loss Widens
description: GENEVA, Nov. 30 (Reuters) I.O.S., Ltd., said its total net loss in the third quarter amount ed to $4.8million, in contrast to a $300,000 loss in the sec ond quarter.

title: A Truly French Tragicomedy
description: Books of The Times

title: FRENCH DENY AN AIDE QUIT ON DRUG ISSUE
description: PARIS, Nov. 30 (UPI)Max Fernet, who played a key role in setting up United States French cooperation against narcotics traffic, Is retiring as head of the national investigat ing police, but authorities said today that his action had noth ing to do with a current scan dal in the United States.

title: Economic Analysis
description: Whenever money is involved, gemtlichkeit disap pears, says Walter Scheel, the West German Foreign Min ister, who has been seeking to rebuild a spirit of cooperation among the Common Market nations  toward each other and toward the United States. The Europeans are prepared to move a considerable distance to meet Secretary of the Treas ury John B. Con nally's terms provided that the United States is prepared to make its own contribu tion to a monetary settlement. To the Europeans, the Ameri can contribution must involve two elements: a devaluation of the dollar in terms of gold by 5 to 7 per cent, and an Ameri can agreement to drop the 10 per cent surcharge as soon as currencies are realigned.

title: Prices to Farmers Rose in November
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 30 (AP) Prices farmers received for raw products, exempted from President Nixon's price freeze, rose 1 per cent in November from a month earlier and were 8 per cent more than a year ago, the Agriculture Depart ment announced today.

title: Wilder Gets Eagle, ,Posts 69 to Lead in Senior Golf
description: WEST PALM BEACH, Fla., Nov. 30 (UPI)Web Wilder of San Antonio, Tex., shot an eagle 2 on the seventh hole and went on to a threeunderpar 69 to day to take the lead in the first round of the American Seniors Golf Association tourna ment.

title: NEW BOND ISSUES SELL VERY SLOWLY
description: The credit markets continued to play cat and mouse with in vestors yesterday, tempting them with yields on new issues that seemed just a wee bit less than enough to make them buy.

title: Service for the Kemptons Will Be Held Here Today
description: A memorial service for James Murray Kempton Jr. and his wife, the former Jean Goldschmidt, will be held today at 4:30 P.M. at the Washing ton Square United Methodist Church, 133 West Fourth Street.

title: Accord Reached on Leaves In Catholic Schools Strike
description: A tentative agreement on side issue was reached yester

title: Harkey's Fumble: Distant Replay
description: A lot of people thought they felt bad about it, but nobody felt worse than Steve did. The speaker was Kenny Meyer, offensive backfield coach of the New York Jets.

title: Man in the News
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 30 At a time when the other military forces are relaxing their training and discipline in an effort to attract more recruits, the man named to day to become Commandant of the Marine Corps is likely to retain the corp's Spartan atmosphere. Lieut. Gen. Rob ert Everton Cush man Jr., who was nominated by President Nixon this morning, would not con sent to an interview today. A friend said he was fol lowing protocol and would not become accessible until he is confirmed by the Senate.

title: ISRAELI ART IS GIVEN TO KENNEDY CENTER
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 30 A gift of Israeli art to the John F. Kennedy Center for the Per forming Arts was dedicated to day.

title: DECONGESTANT CITED IN HOUSE TESTIMONY
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 30 (AP)  A report cited in Congres sional testimony says that some preparations for colds and coughs contain the nasal de congestant PPM although safe dosage levels have not been set by the Food and Drug Admin istration.

title: Thai Police Office Burned
description: BANGKOK, Thailand, Nov. 30 (Reuters)Arsonists burned down the office of the police Central Intelligence Division to day. Documents and radio equipment were destroyed.

title: A. DOUGLASS BREWER
description: HARWICH, Mass., Nov. 30 A. Douglass Brewer, a retired advertising man who saw serv ice in both World Wars, died today in Cape Cod Hospital, Hyannis, after a brief illness. He was 75 years old.

title: Ronan Sees Fare of 90c If Unions Get All Demands
description: Dr. William J. Ronan, chair man of the Metropolitan Trans portation Authority, said yes terday that a 90cent fare would be needed to meet the costs of the transit unions new con tract demands.

title: In Soviet Union, Georgian Jews Boast That Their Situation Is Not Too Bad
description: TBILISI, U.S.S.R., Nov. 24 A curlyhaired young Jew burst out of the Interior Ministry and wriggled his way through a subdued but expectant crowd. As he start ed to walk off, a knot of men clustered around him, eagerly examining documents granting his family permis sion to emigrate to Israel.

title: RALLY CONTINUES ON AMEX AND 0TG
description: The rally on the American Stock Exchange and in the overthecounter market con tinued into its fourth day yes terday as both markets made substantial gains in active trading.

title: Rex Stout, 85, Gives Clues on Good Writing
description: DANBURY, Conn., Nov. 30 Orchids tomorrow for Rex Stout.

title: Sanitation Union Ratifies Pact With City
description: Members of the Uniformed Sanitationmen's Association ra tified a new contract with the city yesterday that will give them $,1710 in pay increases during its 27month term.

title: Rockets Defeat Chaps
description: DENVER, Nov. 30 (AP)  Dave Robisch, a rookie, scored 21 points, pulled down 14 re bounds and blocked four shots tonight to spark the Denver Rockets to a 10691 victory over the Dallas Chaparrals.

title: COUPLE FOUND SLAIN; SON, 30, IS CHARGED
description: A 65yearold retired taxi driver and his wife were killed with an axe in the Inwood sec tion of Manhattan early yes terday morning, the police said.

title: Nixon, With Wife, to Visit 3 Chinese Cities in 7 Days
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 30  The White House announced today that President Nixon's journey to China in February would take him to three cities in seven days for freewheel ing discussions with Premier Chou Enlai and Chairman Mao Tsetung. He will be accom panied by Mrs. Nixon.

title: JOHN MILLIS DEAD; FORD OFFICIAL, 58
description: DETROIT, Nov. 30John B. Millis, a public relations offi cial at the Ford Motor Com pany for more than 24 years, died today at the Henry Ford Hospital. He was 58 years old and lived in Bloomfield Hills.

title: Consumers Can Check On Car Makers Claims
description: A consumer who wants to see how Ford proves it has a better idea or why You'll never let go if you get your hands on a Toy( will have that opportunity for the next 15 days.

title: `Bourgeois Father Fails in School Bid; Radical Is Expelled
description: PARIS, Nov. 30Do not cast aside those who at the age of 16 want to remake the world.

title: Harry Rogoff,  88, Former Editor Of The Jewish Forward, Dead
description: Harry Rogoff, editor in chief of The Jewish Daily Forward from 1951 to 1964 and one of its active columnists until his illness this month, died yester day at his home, 258 Riverside Drive. He was 88 years old.

title: Knicks'
description: Not even a 26point lead with 20 minutes to play could pre serve the New York Knicks winning streak last night as they lost to the Seattle Super Sonics, 110109, at Madison Square Garden.

title: G.M. Raises Prices 2.5% As Panel Upholds Request
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 30 The Price Commission approved today a request by the General Motors Corporation to raise the prices of its 1972 cars, trucks and equipment by an average of 2.5 per cent.

title: Gulf and Western Profits Set a Record in Quarter
description: Operations of Gulf and West ern Industries, Inc., for the first fiscal quarter, which ended on Oct. 31, resulted in record earnings despite slightly lower sales, the diversified manu facturing and service company reported yesterday.

title: LEASCO ARRANGES $85MILLION LOAN
description: The Leasco Data Processing Corporation said yesterday that it had completed arrangements to .borrow $85million from 20 domestic and international banks.

title: FOES OF REHNQUIST APPEAL TO SENATE
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 30 The four members of the Sen ate Judiciary Committee who oppose favorable committee ac tion on William H. Rehnquist's nomination to the Supreme Court formally asked the full Senate today to reject the nom ination.

title: S.E.C. Seeks Wider Disclosures by Funds
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 30The Securities and Exchange Com mission proposed today new rules that would require mu tual funds to disclose more about how they vote in take over fights involving the com panies they have invested in and on other matter relating to involvement in the affairs of their portfolio companies.

title: DEFENSE LAWYERS REST MYLAI CASE
description: FORT MEADE, Md., Nov. 30 The defense in the courtmar tial of Col. Oran K. Henderson rested its case today, but it appeared likely that the jury would not retire to consider verdict for more than a week.

title: DEBUT OF READE, CINEMA, DELAYED
description: The 1,500seat movie theater, the Reade, now under con struction in the basement of One Astor Plaza, the 53story building on the former site of the Astor Hotel, will not open on Dec. 21 as previously an nounced.

title: Kahn Sentenced to 5 Years for Bribing Johnstown, Pa., Officials
description: Irving B. Kahn, the longtime head of the Teleprompter Cor oration, was sentenced yester day to five years in prison on charges that he had obtained an exclusive cable television franchise by bribing Johns town, Pa., officials.

title: RULES ON WAR NEWS TIGHTENED BY SAIGON
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, Nov'30 (UPI)South Vietnam insti tuted new ground rules for news coverage of military oper ations today and threatened to expell correspondents for viola tions.

title: Hardy Rugby Fans Turn Out to See Aussies Win Here
description: Last night at Randalls Is land Ted Wolek recalled that earlier this month he had promised to take his son, Ed, to a sports event for his 11th birthday.

title: U.S. RESTS IN TRIAL OF HOUSE MEMBER
description: BALTIMORE, Nov. 30 (AP) The Government rested its case today in the briberyconspiracy trial of Representative John Dowdy, Democrat of Texas, and shortly afterward a Federal judge denied all defense mo tions for dismissal, of charges.

title: GETTY WILL ACCEPT ALL MISSION TENDERS
description: The Getty Oil Company an nounced yesterday that in ac cordance with its tender offer for the common stock of the Mission Corporation at $120 a share, it has elected to pur chase all the 313,913 shares of Mission common stock ten dered. The transaction would involve a payment by Getty of $37.6million. Getty said it would not extend the period of the invitation for tenders.

title: TWO STOCK FIRMS OUSTED BY N.A.S.D.
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 30 (AP)  The National Association of securities Dealers expelled two member firms today, charging both had violated netcapital rules and that one had also violated other regulations.

title: Two Executives of I.O.S. Are Arrested in Geneva
description: GENEVA, Nov. 30Robert L. Vesco, head of Investors Over seas Services, the mutual fund group, and Milton F. Meissner, a close associate, were arrested here today in connection with a complaint alleging miscon duct as directors of an I.O.S. bank.

title: Cooperation Emphasized
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 30 (Reu ters)Henry A. Kissinger, for eign affairs adviser to President Nixon, said today that the United States was approaching the question of international monetary reform with the atti tude that a solution must be found on a cooperative basis.

title: Indian Force in Pakistan for the 4th Day;
description: NEW DELHI. NOV. 30A large combined force of Indian infantry and tanks was fighting in East Pakistan for the fourth day today. In sire and duration the engagement is the gravest so far in the fighting between India and Pakistan.

title: BLACK YOUTH CRISIS OF JOBS HELD WORSE
description: A Twentieth Century Fund study group on unemployment among black youth reported yesterday that despite the sixties, despite all the correc tive action, the employment situation for young black men and women is still social dy namite.

title: Banana Split
description: The Port of New York, limping back to life under pressure of a temporary court order after eight weeks of strike shutdown, has permanently lost one of its commercial mainstays. The United Fruit Company has abandoned the Weehawken terminal it opened two dec ades ago and is now using Albany and Baltimore as distribution centers for the millions of bananas it used to bring to this port from Central and South America.

title: Teleprompter Will Show Nets Basketball Games
description: Teleprompter Corporation has signed a longterm con tract with the New York Nets for exclusive cable television rights to the American Basket ball Association team's home games.

title: Tracks and OTB Near New Pact
description: Racing groups are on the verge of an accommodation with the city's Offtrack Betting Corporation, an executive of the New York Racing Associa tion said here yesterday.

title: Thai Police Office Burned
description: BANGKOK, Thailand, Nov. 30 (Reuters)Arsonists burned down the office of the police Central Intelligence Division to day. Documents and radio equipment were destroyed.

title: Hawks Drop 6th Straight
description: CHICAGO, Nov. 30 (AP)  The Chicago Bulls rallied in the final two minutes tonight to defeat Atlanta, 8685, for the Hawks sixth straight setback, their longest losing streak since entering the National Basket ball Association 25 years ago.

title: Con Ed Is Accused of S.I. Air Pollution
description: The city has charged Consol idated Edison with 22 separate airpollution violations as a re sult of the utility's refusal to limit the use of coalfired boil ers at Arthur Kill, S. I.

title: ...Bombshell in Washington
description: A time bomb for United States relations with many countries, especially those of Latin America, is planted in a littlenoted amendment to the Foreign Assistance Act, now in SenateHouse conference. The amendment, sponsored by Senator Cannon of Nevada, would require immediate suspension of aid to any country that nation alized or expropriated any American property or that repudiated a contract with any American citizen or cor poration.

title: From Fuchs and Balsam, Beautifully Played Music
description: The big piece in the first half of Joseph Fuchs's violin program, Monday night in Tully Hall, was the Bartok Sonata No. 2. But at inter mission, all the lobby talk was about Mozart's A major Sonata (K, 526)about (a) how beautiful the music was, really as modern as the Bartok, no kidding, look at all those wonderful modula tions, and (b) how beautifully Messrs. Fuchs and Balsam had played it.

title: U.S. Judge Declines to Open Persico's Trial to Public Now
description: Despite a plea by newsmen that they were being irrep arably harmed by the con tinued exclusion of the public from the trial of Carmine J. Persico, a Federal judge here refused yesterday to order the immediate reopening of the proceedings.

title: About the Administration's Protectionist Swagger
description: WASHINGTONPrior to Aug. 15, 1971, the Administration's economic policy was one of benign neglect. At home, unemployment was allowed to increase and growth to stagnate in the misguided belief that this would cure inflation. Instead, it produced both 6 per cent unemployment and 6 per cent inflation.

title: COMMODITY PRICES LISTED FOR WEEK
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 30 The Bureau of Labor Statistics reported today the following spot primary prices for the week ended. Nov. 23:

title: Average Mortgage Yields Fall at Fanny May Auction
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 30 Mortgage prices continued to rise and yields to decline at this week's auction of the Fed eral National Mortgage Asso ciation, the association said to day.

title: SCHEDULED AIRLINES LIST BIG PROFIT RISE
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 30. (AP) Scheduled airlines in the United States made 10 times as much money in the first nine months of 1971 as they did in the corresponding period of 1970 despite a decrease in prof its by the 12 major airlines, the Air Transport Association said today.

title: Tax Exemption Is Upheld For Soviet Estate on L.I.
description: The United States Court of Appeals here upheld yesterday a ruling that a 36acre estate owned by the Soviet Union was exempt from taxation by Glen Cove, L.I.

title: Coed Is Golden Gate Suicide
description: SAN FRANCISCO, Nov. 30 (UPI)A 21yearold Mills Col lege coed identified as Juliet Ravlin of San Francisco leaped from the Golden Gate Bridge yesterday. She was the 435th known suicide from the span in the last three decades.

title: Price Board Seeks Delay on Rent Rises
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 30  The chairman of the Price Com mission, C. Jackson Grayson Jr., asked landlords today to post pone rent increases on residen tial properties even if present Federal regulations allowed them.

title: Bridge Strike in 2d Day
description: PHILADELPHIA, Nov. 30 (AP)Traffic on the Benjamin Franklin and Walt Whitman bridges between Philadelphia and New Jersey moved smooth ly today as toll collectors, main tenance workers and policemen for the Delaware River Port Authority continued a strike they started yesterday.

title: Working Toward a Stabilized Economy
description: Letters to the Editor

title: WARRIORS TOPPLE BUCKS BY 106103
description: MILWAUKEE, Nov. 30 (AP) Cazzie Russell scored 22 points, including a key free throw with 10 seconds left to, lead the Golden State Warriors to a 106103 victory over the Milwaukee Bucks in a Na tional Basketball Association game tonight.

title: GRANT OF $250,000 TO AID YOUTH VOTE
description: The Carnegie Corporation of New York announced yester day a grant of $250,000 to the Youth Citizenship Fund for a national, nonpartisan voter education program for youths of voting age.

title: ELIAS SUNSTEIN, 88, PITTSBURGH LAWYER
description: PITTSBURGH, Nov. 30  Elias Sunstein, a lawyer here for 61 years and an investment counselor, died today at his home. He was 88 years old.

title: Bridges: Italians and British Pace European Title Tournament
description: ATHENS, Nov. 30  The lion and the unicorn, in this case Britain and Italy, are fighting here for the Euro pean bridge crown, loftily disregarding the 20 teams now out of contention.

title: Mills Offers a FundSharing Plan Tied to Local Needs
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 30 Representative Wilbur D. Mills disclosed and formally intro duced as legislation today his longpromised substitute for President Nixon's program of revenue sharing.

title: Enter Dr. Kissinger!
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 30Henry Kis singer has now been liberated from the vasty deep of the White House. He has emerged at last in the full blaze of the television cameras as public figure, spokesman for the Presi dent on China and on the tactics and strategy of American foreign policy.

title: NEW CITY JAIL CODE IS EXPECTED SOON
description: A new liberalized correction code to govern operations of the city's jails will be law early next year, the chairman of the City Council's Public Safety committee predicted yesterday.

title: Mrs. Nixon Is Excited About Her Trip to China
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 30 (AP)Mrs. Richard M. Nixon says she's happy about ac companying the President on his weeklong visit to main land China in February.

title: A New Bridge in Tennessee Will End A Century of Isolation for a Village
description: The Talk of Big Springs, Tenn.

title: Twiggy Is Back, And All Set for Her Debut as a Movie Star
description: First, there was Twiggy, the fashion model in 1967, looking like somebody's undernourished kid brother: clipped hair, short pants and stockings bagging around her bony knees. Then a few months later, there was Twiggy, the clothes designer and exploitable per sonality, getting off a plane from Lon don in a headband, a fringed suede tunic and bootsan Indian papoose a squaw would like to fatten up. By 1968, she was Miss Leslie Hornby, 18going on19, one pound over her normal 91 pound weight, embarking on a television film and looking seductive in tangled curls and white pajamas.

title: Dance: Dissimilarities of City Ballet and Be fart
description: It would be difficult to find two large classic ballet companies more dissimilar than are New York City Bal let and Maurice Bjart's Bal let of the 20th Century from Brussels, now visiting the New York City Center. This contrast was demonstrated to me particularly clearly over the weekend when commuted casually between the two companies. Program ing caused my primary al legiance to be with City Bal let at the New York State Theater, but I slipped a couple of times to see what was going on chez Mart.

title: Ocean Ship in Louisville
description: LOUISVILLE, Ky., Nov. 30 (AP)Louisville's port received an oceangoing ship for the first time yesterday. A 206foot Greek freighter docked to un load part of her 1,300ton cargo of agricultural twine from Pro greso, Mexico. The ship is one of a new type that has a flat bottom so can travel fully loaded with 3,000 tons in water only 16 feet deep.

title: Attica Inmate Dropped As Washington Witness
description: Richard Clark, an Attica inmate leader, was among the witnesses scheduled to appear before the House Se lect Committee on Crime to morrow in Washington.

title: Stage Folk Pay Tribute To Porterfield at Sardi's
description: Broadway celebrities, mixing anecdotes with humorous eulo gies, met yesterday in a tribute to the late Robert Porterfield, founder of the Barter Theater of Virginia.

title: How Many Secrecies?
description: LIVERMORE, Calif.Here are three examples: the secrecy of the Kremlin, the secrecy of Washington, and the secrecy of The New York Times.

title: Mrs. Meir Travels to U.S. in an Effort To Create a Solidly Based Relationship
description: JERUSALEM, Nov. 30Pre mier Golda Meir went to Wash ington today on a personal mission to clear the air of the mutual suspicions that have soured relations between Israel and the United States in recent weeks.

title: Rockefeller May Revive Killed Taxes to Fill Deficit
description: Governor Rockefeller main tained silence yesterday on the details of a fiscal plan he says he has worked out to meet an anticipated state deficit of $770million for the fiscal year ending next March 31.

title: HOSPITAL HEADS WEIGH CUTBACKS
description: Directors of the city's mun icipal hospitals, under orders to cut spending by 5 per cent, said yesterday that they hoped to accomplish this by reducing, rather than eliminating, serv ices to patients.

title: Stars Beat Floridians
description: SALT LAKE CITY, Nov. 30 (AP)The Utah Stars fought off the Floridians to score a 127114 victory in an American Basketball Association game to night.

title: Market Place Depresssed Oils:  The Bright Side
description: Look at the market aver ages and you'll find this has been a bluechip rallyun less you focus your attention on the international oil stocks.

title: ...but Not in New York
description: While the problems of the aging are being discussed in Washington, New York's Housing Maintenance Com mission offered a dismal example of the sort of govern mental insensitivity that makes growing old in a cold and thoughtless urban environment so needlessly unpleas ant. As thousands of lowincome persons, 62 years and older, rushed to meet the deadline for the filing of appli cations for partial exemption from rent increases, became evident that few provisions, had been made prevent unnecessary hardships.

title: Hunters Beg 7,164 Deer
description: CONCORD, N. H., Nov. 30 (AP)Despite a season three days shorter than the last, hunters bagged 7,164 deer, nine more than in 1970, the Fish and Game Department said to day.

title: Deep Cut Rallies to Take Feature at Liberty Bell
description: PHILADELPHIA, Nov. 30 Colonial Farm's Deep Cut found a big hole on the rail today and rallied to win the $6,500 Muncy Creek purse at Liberty Bell Race Track by three quarters of a length be fore a crowd of 6,676.

title: TRAUMA CALLED CHIEF U.S. KILLER
description: NEW ORLEANS, Nov. 30 Trauma, a medical category of casualties resulting from a wide variety of injuries, is the lead ing killer of American civilians aged 1 through 38 and is a public health problem of grow ing importance.

title: Filion Wins Seven; Another Gives Him 500 for the Year
description: YONKERS, Nov. 30  Herve Filion, the reinsman who seems to be in the right spot at the right time, will drive six horses at Yonkers Raceway tomorrow night. If the 31yearold native of Angers, Quebec, clicks with one of his charges, five of which are regarded as contend ers, he will have achieved his goal of 500 winners in a single season.

title: Front Page 1  No Title
description: THE CLASSIC LIBERAL ARTS EDUCA TION is alive & well at Elsenhower College. Coed. Write for catalog. Box 361, Seneca Falls, N. Y.

title: 3 HEALTH VIOLATORS LISTED BY THE CITY
description: The Health Services Adminis tration made public yesterday the names of two restaurants and one delicatessen that it said had serious health code viola tions.

title: JAMES TAYLOR SURVIVES FAME
description: JAMES TAYLOR SURVIVES FAME

title: Cancer Kills Heart Patient
description: DENVER, Nov. 30 (UPI) Herbert F. Bartholomew, 50 years old, who lived with a transplanted heart for two years and two months, died last night of cancer, the University of Colorado Medical Center said today. A hospital spokesman said that Mr. Bartholomew's heart appeared normal at death.

title: Smith Heads a Field of 7 In Pepsi Masters Tennis
description: LONDON, Nov. 30 (Reuters) Stan Smith of Pasadena, Calif., heads the seven quali fiers for the second Pepsi Mas ters lawntennis tournament to be played in Paris, starting Sat urday. First prize in the round robin event is $15,000.

title: PAYMENTS SURPLUS IS SHOWN BY JAPAN
description: TOKYO, Nov. 30 (Reuters) Japan had a surplus of $133 million in her balance of pay ments for October due to ac tive export trading, according to revised figures released by the Finance Ministry today. But this was a sharp drop from a $247million surplus a year earlier.

title: U.S.Soviet Pacts Signed
description: MOSCOW, Nov. 30A group of United States concerns signed contracts with the So viet Union today worth a total of $125million in what ap peared to be one of the largest business deals between the two countries in recent years.

title: PATROLMAN FREED IN ROBBERY CASE
description: A Supreme Court jury in the Bronx last night acquitted a suspended patrolman, Louis Farina, of a charge of keeping $50,000 in stolen cash that al legedly had been turned over to him on a Bronx street in May, 1970.

title: Lawyers for Smith and Jersey Negotiating Plea for New Trial
description: TRENTON, Nov. 30  Attor ney General George F. Kugler Jr. today confirmed that plea bargaining was in progress between state attorneys and lawyers representing Edgar Smith, the convicted murderer who has spent 14 years on New 1 Jersey's Death Row.

title: Draft Board Age Lowered to 18
description: Notes on People

title: Medical Students to Get Voting Power in A.M.A.
description: NEW ORLEANS, Nov. 30 (AP)The American Medical Association voted today to give the nation's medical stu dents voting power in the organization's policymaking decisions.

title: 2 Hold Up Queens Bank And Flee With $8,500
description: Two armed men held up the Bayside branch of the National Bank of North America at 19202 Northern Boulevard in Queens yester day afternoon and escaped with about $8,500.

title: RICHARD GREENLEAF
description: Richard Greenleaf, a staff member of The Daily World, a Communist publication, died at Jewish Memorial Hospital of a heart condition yesterday at the age of 59. He lived at 100 Cooper Street, in the Inwood section of Manhattan. Mr. Greenleaf was a member of the Communist

title: BRITAIN AND BLOC SPLIT ON FISHING
description: BRUSSELS, Nov. 30In spite of an allnight negotiating ses sion, talks between Britain and the Common Market on pro tection to be given to British fisheries after Britain joins the trading bloc ended in deadlock today.

title: Neighborhoods: Mt. Morris Park Is Cautious on Effect of Historic Designation
description: For residents of Harlem's Mount Morris Park section, the news that the area had been declared a historic dis trict brought guarded opti mism that their neighborhood could be stabilized and per haps even revitalized with a new infusion of money and homeowners.

title: NOFAULT INSURANCE GIVEN GOOD CHANCE
description: Nofault auto insurance and statewide unitpricing legisla tion have a good chance to pass in the coming session of the Legislature, Assemblyman Fred G. Field Jr., an upstate Republican, said yesterday.

title: Dramatization of Millay Set
description: Dorothy Stickney will pre sent her dramatization of the poems and letters of Edna St. Vincent Millay, A Lovely Light, next Monday at 9 P.M. in the auditorium of the Library and Museum of the Performing Arts at Lincoln Center. Tickets are $10, with all proceeds go ing to the special campaign fund to keep the Research Library of the Performing Arts from closing Jan. 1.

title: Hawks Bow to Canucks
description: VANCOUVER, Nov. 30 (AP) The Vancouver Canucks came up with an outstanding per formance tonight to teat the Chicago Black Hawks, 42.

title: GasImport Plan Advances
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 30 (Reu ter's)A Federal Power Com mission hearing examiner today approved the Northern Natural Gas Company's application to import natural gas from Can ada and the construction of $45million in facilities to han dle the gas, but he pointed out that Canada's National Energy Board had denied requests for natural gas export.

title: Hanna Prices of Iron Ore And Pellets Won't Change
description: The Hanna Mining Company announced yesterday that it plans no changes in its base prices for Lake Superior natu ral iron ore and iron ore pel lets in 1972.

title: Hussein Termed a Target Of Assassins of Premier
description: CAIRO, Nov. 30 (UPI)The four Palestinians who confessed to killing Premier Wasfi Tal of Jordan Sunday planned to as sassinate King Hussein and members of his family, the Egyptian newspaper Al Ahram said today.

title: FILMTV COMPOSERS SCHEDULE A STRIKE
description: LOS ANGELES, Nov. 30The Composers and Lyricists Guild, charging motion picture and television producers with fail ure to bargain in good faith, has scheduled a strike begin ning at midnight tonight.

title: 2Hour Arms Talk in Vienna
description: VIENNA, Nov. 30 (UPI)So viet and United States negotia tors at the talks here on limita tion of strategic arms met for two hours today.

title: Transit Vote Is Affirmed By Atlanta Area Recount
description: ATLANTA, Nov. 30 (AP) Approval of a $1.3billion rapid transit system for part of the metropolitan area has been af firmed by a recount of election returns by Fulton County.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: Imperiled Reapportionment

title: I.B.A. Sets New Rules on School Bonds
description: BOCA RATON, Fla., Nov. 30 Leading investment bankers and lawyers moved today to use new disclosure procedures to sell school bondsa type of basic community financing that has come under a legal cloud during the past three months.

title: Doubleday Gets Rose Kennedy's Book
description: Doubleday & Co. has ac quired the rights to the auto biography of Rose Fitzgerald Kennedy, President Kenne dy's mother, for $1,525,000.

title: WARRANTS REPORTS TO BE MADE HOURLY
description: The New York Stock Ex change announced yesterday that it would begin reporting hourly volume in warrants on its ticker tape as of Jan. 3. At present only the total war rant volume appears on the ticker at the close of the mar ket each day.

title: 4 NAMED IN DEATH OF BRONX FATHER
description: Four persons, Including fugitive, were indicted yester day by a Bronx grand jury on charges of murder and posses sion of illegal weapons in con nection with the death of a man who allegedly angered them in retrieving his son's stolen motorbike.

title: TANZANIA DENOUNCES ACCORD ON RHODESIA
description: UNITED NATIONS, N. Y., Nov. 30  Britain's proposals for settlement of blackwhite relations in Rhodesia were bit terly denounced in the Security Council today by Salim A. Salim of Tanzania.

title: CHARLES S. WOLF, 62; HOTEL CHAIN'S AIDE
description: Charles S. Wolf, vice presi dent of Spencer Taylor, Inc., which operates five hotels in this city, died yesterday in Mount Sinai Hospital. He was 62 years old and lived at the Mayflower Hotel, 15 Central Park West.

title: City Is Given Right to Jail 3 Policemen in Inquiry
description: The Appellate Division yes terday overturned a 14month old decision by State Supreme Court and opened the way for the jailing of three patrolmen who had refused to cooperate in an inquiry by Investigation Commissioner Robert K. Ruskin into alleged payoffs by busi nessmen to city police.

title: Mrs. Meir In Capital
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 30  Mrs. Meir said tonight that Is rael remained actively inter ested in any form of negotia tion with the Arabs that might bring peace.

title: SAM FOX, 89, DIES; MUSIC PUBLISHER
description: Sam Fox, a music publisher who pioneered in producing the scores of film music, died yes terday in San Francisco. He was 89 years old and in recent years had made his home in Miami Beach, Fla.

title: The Proceedings In the U.N. Today
2 NIXON AIDES SEE ALLENDE IN PERIL
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 30  Two top White House aides conveyed to President Nixon today a feeling they had gained during a LatinAmerican trip this month that the So cialist Government of President Salvador Allende Gossens in Chile won't last long.

title: ThreeYear Ban Is Ended
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 30  President Nixon authorized the ExportImport Bank today to extend credits for the sale of United States goods to Ru mania. This ended a threeyear ban on American Government backed credits to Communist bloc nations.

title: UNSAFETIRE CURB MAY BECOME BAN
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 30  The National Highway Traffic Safety Administration has ten tatively decided to ban the sale of automobile tires that do not comply with Federal safety standards.

title: Agnew Welcomes Move
description: HONOLULU, Nov. 30Vice President Agnew said today that the introduction of Mr. Mills's revenuesharing bill was a welcome sign and that the measure could provide the basis for Congressional action.

title: Lanusse Recovering
description: BUENOS AIRES, Nov. 30  President Agustin A. Lanusse, who underwent surgery Friday for the removal of stones from his left kidney, is making rapid recovery, his doctors said today.

title: St. Mary's College And Notre Dame U. Drop Merger Plan
description: SOUTH BEND, Ind., Nov. 30  The University of Notre Dame and St. Mary's College terminated today their six monthold plan to merge.

title: Berenice Bramson, Voice Skills Intact, Returns in Recital
description: Berenice Bramson gave a pair of very well received recitals here in the mid1950's, but does not seem to have been heard from since. A teacher at the Mount Kisco School of Music, the soprano returned to Car negie Recital Hall on Monday night under the school's aus pices, and it is a pleasure to report that she has lost none of her skill and taste as a singer.

title: Twigs, Comedy, to Move
description: Twigs, the George Furth comedy starring Sada Thomp son, will be transferred from the Broadhurst to the Plymouth Theater next month, the date will be announced soon.

title: Michele Ray Kidnapped From Uruguay Home
description: MONTEVIDEO, Uruguay, Nov. 30 (UPI)Michele Ray, a French reporter, was kid napped at gunpoint from her residence yesterday and she was still being sought today.

title: DR. M. A. FEINSTEIN OF BETH ISRAEL, 72
description: Dr. Marcus A. Feinstein, an attending physician in pe ripheral vascular disease at Beth Israel Medical Center and until 1970 the head of medical service at its Bernstein Insti tute, died Monday at his home, 150 East 69th Street. He was 72 years old.

title: 10 Hurt as Gunmen Shoot Way Into and Out of Bank
description: A police sergeant and four civilians were wounded yester day morning as a gang of rob bers, wearing black ski masks and armed with shotguns and automatic rifles, shot their way into and out of a bank on upper Broadway and fled with $16,000.

title: BLUES TRIUMPH OVER SEALS, 52
description: California Golden Seals 2 0 02 St. Louis Blues 3 1 15

title: Democrats Say Opposition to Butz Has Risen to 41 Votes in Senate, but G.O.P. Predicts Confirmation
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 30The number of Senate votes against the confirmation of Dr. Earl L. Butz as Secretary of Agricul ture grew to 41 today, accord ing to some Democratic calcu lations, but Republicans said they expected the nomination to be approved.

title: Two Cosmos Satellites Up
description: MOSCOW, Nov. 30 (Reuters) The Soviet Union put two satellites of its Cosmos series into earth orbit yesterday. The press agency Tass reported yes terday the launching of Cos mos 458 today and announced that Cosmos 459 had also been put into orbit.

title: 4 Nations Account for Most Of Recent U.S. Gold Loss
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 30  Four nations accounted for nearly the whole of the previ ously reported United States godl loss of $299.6million in the third quarter of this year, the Treasury disclosed today.

title: Arms Cost Hearings Set
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 30 (AP) Senator John C. Stennis, Democrat of Mississippi, an nounced today that the Senate Armed Services Committee, of which he is chairman, would begin a week of hearings Fri day on the growing costs of major weapons systems.

title: Czar Here Has Scepter, Will Rule
description: tonal guidance specialists, this is known as hitting the daily double.

title: CUSHMAN NAMED TO HEAD MARINES
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 30 President Nixon selected Lieut. Gen. Robert E. Cushman Jr. today to be the next Com mandant of the Marine Corps.

title: Voil! Les Bureaucrates
description: Although the New York City Board of Education's wellpublicized financial crisis leading to a drastic reduction in teaching staff makes the situation in our city seem fairly ominous, one would like to assume that the Board of Education is working as efficiently as it can under the circumstances, that its main concern is getting the best possible qualified teachers, and that its standards are both of the high est, and reasonable and valid.

title: University Students of Grenoble, Militant for Reforms in 1968, Are Politically Apathetic in 1971
description: GRENOBLE, France, Nov. 20 Three years after the stu dent revolt and general strike that shook France in May and June of 1968, most of the 23,000 university students in this cap ital of the French Alps have fallen into political apathy while the potentially farreach ing university reforms that followed the upheaval go all but ignored.

title: Body Found in Queens
description: The trussed body of a 25 yearold Brooklyn man was found yesterday morning at a vacant lot in Queens near Ken nedy International Airport. The police said the man, whom they identified as Ronald Pollonetti of 29 Bay 40th Street, in the Bath Beach section, had ap parently been shot in the head before the body was dumped on 142d Street between 135th Avenue and North Conduit Boulevard, in South Ozone Park. The victim, according to the police, had a record of arrests.

title: Judge Hoping to Decide Pennsy's Case by Friday
description: PHILADELPHIA, Nov. 30 (AP)  A Federal judge said today he hoped to decide before Friday whether to make perma nent an injunction that has blocked the oftendelayed an nual meeting of the Penn Cen tral Company, parent of Ameri ca's biggest railroad.

title: Gold Found in Arctic Ocean
description: MOSCOW (UPI)Soviet sci entists have found gold on the bottom of the Arctic Ocean, according to Tass, the official Soviet press agency. The sci entists, participants in an arctic sea expedition, found gold de posits in the coastal areas of the Chukotka and East Siberian seas. Tin deposits were also found, Tass said.

title: Board Weighs Reinstatement of Teachers Ousted in '50's
description: The Board of Education is exploring the possibility of reinstating 31 former city teachers who were dismissed during the early mineteen fifties as a result of investiga tions into alleged Communist influence in the school sys tem.

title: IMPROVEMENT SEEN IN U.S.JAPAN TIES
description: Marshall Green, Assistant Secretary of State for East Asia and Pacific Affairs, said yesterday that he had detected an improvement in United StatesJapanese relations in re cent weeks.

title: BOSTON'S SCHOOLS HELD SEGREGATED
description: BOSTON, Nov. 30After an 18month study of the Boston public schools, the United States Department of Health, Education and Welfare has con cluded that official action here has led to a segregated school system.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: Who Deserves What Pay?

title: RENTRELIEF LINES LONG FOR THE AGED
description: Thousands of elderly people  some of them patient, some of them anxious and most of them confused  continued to flock to district rent offices yesterday and wait in long lines to fill out applications for par tial rent exemptions before the Friday deadline.

title: Phase Two Confusion Disgruntles Small Retailers
description: As Phase Two of President Nixon's economic stabiliza tion program moves into gear, a degree of confusion exists within the boardrooms of big business and big labor as to all of its ramifications.

title: Dry Goods Names Director
description: The Associated Dry Goods Corporation has elected as director James F. Kelly, vice president of the department store chain. Joseph J. Schumm Jr. was named secretary to succeed Mr. Kelly.

title: Woman Heads Bar Group
description: NORWALK, Conn., Nov. 30 Miss Margaret Sigsway has been elected president of the NorwalkWilton Bar Associa tion, the first woman named to that post in the association's history. Miss Sigsway, a long time member of the bar asso ciation, is a former prosecutor of the Norwalk City Court, no longer in existence and serves on the Common Council of the city of Norwalk.

title: More Blacks Are Arrested In Greenville, N.C., Protest
description: GREENVILLE, N.C., Nov. 30 (UPI)The police made mass arrests for the second consec utive day today when Negroes attempted to stage a protest march without a parade per mit and then tied up traffic by starting a basketball game at a downtown intersection.

title: Court Supports Exchange Of Staten Island Property
description: A suit seeking to block the exchange of 125 acres on Staten Island for the Willard Hotel property in Washington was dismissed yesterday by Federal Judge Jacob Mishler in Brook lyn.

title: CAMPAIGNING BILL PASSED BY HOUSE
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 30 The House of Representatives approved overwhelmingly to night a bill to limit campaign spending by Presidential, Vice Presidential and Congressional candidates for the first time in American history. The vote was was 372 to 23.

title: Sidney A. Sobel Dies at 70; A B'nai B'rith Governor
description: Sidney A. Sobel, a manu facturer's representative who had been since 1965 a gover nor of the B'nai B'rith district including New Jersey, Pennsyl vania, Delaware and West Vir ginia, died yesterday in Mount Sinai Hospital. He was 70 years old and lived at 95 Gregory Avenue, West Orange, N. J.

title: WILLIAM. F. WELLS
description: ENGLEWOOD, N. J., Nov. 30 William F. Wells, who had been with the National Biscuit Company for 43 years at his retirement last year, died in Englewood Hospital today after a short illness. He was 65 years old and lived at 92 Dwight Place.

title: Another OTB Office
description: The seventh Offtrack Betting Corporation shop manned by Ticketron computers will be open today at 575 Lexington Avenue, near 50th Street.

title: Rodriguez Wins 32d in Row
description: MIAMI BEACH, Nov. 30 (AP) The former world welter weight champion, Luis Rodri guez, scored his 32d consecu tive victory tonight, pounding out a unanimous decision over the Canadian middleweight, Davey Hilton. Rodriguez came out punching and threw wind mill combinations for the next 30 minutes. There were no knockdowns.

title: Screen: Love's Return
description: The saucy, fivenote musical theme of The Battle of Love's Return pegs the spirit of a new satirical comedy, which the Thalia Theater pre sented yesterday in a first run policy departure for the venerable revival showcase uptown. The 25yearold New Yorker, Lloyd Kaufman, who made the picture and plays the lead proves in his com mercial venture that he has enough talent to go places.

title: Group of 10, in Rome, Begins Negotiating Realignment of Currencies
description: ROME, Nov. 30  Treasury Secretary John B. Connally an nounced today that the United States and nine other major nonCommunist countries had started negotiating a realign ment of currencies for the first time since the world monetary crisis broke out last August.

title: JOHN N. G. FINLEY
description: CHARLOTTESVILLE, Va., Nov. 30 (UPI)John N. G. Fin ley, founder and former direc tor of George Mason College, died Saturday at the age of 72.

title: Japan's Elite Police Units Help Keep Riots in Check
description: TOKYO. Nov. 30Japanese streets of Tokyo once again tonight, and the fact that vio lence remained scattered was a tribute to a special mobile police force known as Kidotai.

title: TERRY TURNER, 79, PUBLICITY AGENT
description: Terry Turner, the press agent who took two sets of Siamese twins from carnival obscurity to international fame, died of a stroke yesterday in Water ford, Ontario. He was 79 years old.

title: 4 CONGRESSMEN SEEK A BALL CLUB FOR WASHINGTON
description: PHOENIX, Ariz., Nov. 30  Four members of Congress flew to Arizona tonight to confront the owners of the major league teams about baseball's switch of the Washington Senators franchise to Texas.

title: Psychologist, Rating National Levels of Anxiety, Finds U.S. Is Low
description: LONDON, Nov. 30A British psychologist, analyzing the anxiety level of various na tions, has found Japan, Ger many and France among the nations with the highest stress. The countries studied with the least anxiety include the Unit ed States, Britain and Ireland.

title: Executive Changes
description: The National Sugar Refining Company has elected Donald E. Liederman as chairman of the board. He succeeds Nathan Bilder, who will con tinue as president and chief executive officer. Mr. Liederman is president of Haven Industries, Inc., which owns about 55 per cent of the outstanding National Sugar stock.

title: Calcutta Is Blacked Out In an AirRaid Exercise
description: CALCUTTA, India, Nov. 30 (AP)Sirens sounded a practice airraid alert tonight and for half an hour this city of seven million people was effectively blacked out.

title: U.N. Agency Says More Trade Could Ease the Monetary Problems
description: GENEVA, Nov. 30The af fluent nations could ease their monetary problems by chan neling newly created financial resources to the poorer coun tries to purchase more prod ucts of the industrial world, United Nations experts said to day.

title: TV: 2 Sensitive Subjects Treated
description: unceremoniously dumped by, as it happens, WCBSTV.

title: Plan to Pay Crime Victims Gains Among Democrats
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 30 Democratic leaders, who have been hard pressed to agree on an alternative to the Nixon Ad ministration's lawandorder ap proach to crime, began to find common ground today in the form of a broad Federal pro gram to compensate victims of crime.

title: M'CRACKEN SEES WAGERISE PERIL
description: The chairman of President Nixon's Council of Economic Advisers warned yesterday that labor was in danger of pricing itself out of the market in na tions all over the world.

title: 5CENT RISE ASKED FOR JERSEY BUSES
description: MAPLEWOOD, N. J., Nov. 30 Transport of New Jersey, which is the new name for the former Public Service Co ordinated Transport Company, said today that it would ask the New Jersey Public Utilities Commission for a 5cent in crease in local fares.

title: New Drive Reported Opened in Central Highlands
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, Wednesday, Dec. 1About 15, 000 Government troops have reportedly begun a thrust against enemy forces in the Central Highlands of South Vietnam near the Cambodian border.

title: Advertising:Lennen&NewellGetsPresident
description: Adolph J. Toigo, chief ex ecutive of Lennen & Newell and one of the few sole owners of an agency of any size, will sell twothirds of his stock to key executives, in order to get the company out of its financial troubles.

title: Ties Broken, Iraq Says
description: LONDON, Nov. 30 (AP) Baghdad radio said tonight that Iraq has broken off dip lomatic relations with Britain and Iran because of Iran's seizure of the Persian Gulf Is lands, radio monitors here re ported.

title: EAST BLOC OPENS WARSAW PARLEY
description: WARSAW, Nov. 30The for eign ministers of the seven Warsaw Pact nations began twoday strategy session here today to plan for talks leading to a proposed European secu rity conference.

title: Royals Gain on Bullets
description: BALTIMORE, Nov. 30 (UPI)  Nate Williams scored a sea son high of 29 points and Nate Archibald added 28 as the Cin cinnati Royals beat Baltimore, 118103, tonight and moved to within a halfgame of the first place Bullets in the Central Division.

title: Karl Marx and the Irish
description: OSLOThe interesting thing about current urban guerrilla violence in North Ireland is that Communist move ments abroad seem to have abided by international rules of behavior and have done little to pour oil on the fire.

title: New Format Is Planned For Junior World Series
description: PHOENIX, Ariz., Nov. 30 (UPI)Plans for a World Baseball Classic next Septem ber among the champions of three United States minor base ball leagues and probably the champion of the Mexican League and the champion of the Japanese League were an nounced today.

title: Penn State Soccer Victor
description: PHILADELPHIA, Nov. 30 (UPI)Andy Rymarczuk's goal with 31 seconds left gave Penn State a 21 victory over Penn today and a berth in the re gional final of the National Collegiate soccer tournament against the winner of the Navy Howard game.

title: Britain Expected to Set New Economic Spurs After Rome Meeting
description: LONDON, Nov. 30The Brit ish Government is expected to announce on Thursday a new package of measures to stimu late the economy, including a cut in the bank rate to 4 per cent from 5 per cent.

title: At the Conference To Study Old Age, He's Got Seniority
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 30 (AP)Sporting a white bow tie and dancing the jig for photographers, Justus J. D. Stevens is having the time of his life at the White House Conference on Aging.

title: CONFEREES DELETE BIG REVENUE CUTS FROM THE TAX BILL
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 30 A SenateHouse conference committee agreed today to eliminate from the tax bill most of the big revenuelosing amendments that were added by the Senate.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: For Art's Sake
description: The artist in ancient times in spired his fellow citizens, enter tained them, educated them, helped them live more fully.

title: City Overhauling Management Of the Welfare Administration
description: An overhaul of the city's welfare administration, which has brought in 22 management and systems experts in the last three months, was made known yesterday with appointment of a new deputy human resources administrator Arthur H. Spiegel.

title: SCOTT SCORES 46 AS SQUIRES WIN
description: PITTSBURGH, Nov. 30 (UPI) Charlie Scott scored 46 points tonight to pace the Vir ginia Squires to a 134129 victory over the Pittsburgh Condors in an American Bas ketball Association game.

title: Rousseau Making Points In Comeback as Ranger
description: Perhaps when he retires, Bobby Rousseau said yester day, he will look back at the great years with the Montreal Canadiens.

title: HomeStudy Language Lab Under Investigation
description: A homestudy language institute whose doortodoor salesmen allegedly press Spanishspeaking residents here into buying $562 English courses is currently under investigation by three separate government agencies.

title: Clutter Committee Is Urged
description: Advertising:

title: Art Surrounds Monetary Talks
description: ROME, Dec. 1A statue of Giuseppe Garibaldi, the man who unified Italy, dominates the rambling, honeycolored Palazzo Corsini a few hundred yards from the Tiber River in Rome.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: FORDHAM ROUTS YALE FIVE, 11982
description: NEW HAVEN, Dec. 1Fordham made the debut or its basketball coach, Hal Wissel, a success tonight, routing Yale, 11982; in the season opener for both teams.

title: Kissinger Remarks Seen as Reassurance to China
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 1Foreign policy specialists here speculated today that yesterday's White House statements on China would serve to reassure Peking that the United States neither supports the concept of an independent Taiwan nor considers the island's political separation from the mainland permanent.

title: Gasification Plants Planned in Jersey
description: Plans for building two separate gasification plants in New Jersey were announced yesterday by the Public Service Electric and Gas Company and the Texas Eastern Gas Transmission Corporation and the Consolidated Natural Gas Company.

title: COMMONS ACCEPTS RHODESIA ACCORD
description: LONDON, Dec. 1The House of Commons tonight approved the British Government's plan for a settlement with its breakaway colony of Rhodesia. The vote was 297 to 269.

title: BENJAMIN R. NEWCOMB
description: MOUND BROOK, N.J., Dec. 1 Benjamin R. Newcomb, who was president of the John Waldron Corporation, A large paper manufacturer at Highland Park at his retirement in 1955, died on Monday at his home here. He was 81 years old and lived at 104 Piedmont Drive.

title: Executive Changes
description: Lorne L. Fonteyne has been elected president of the Carte Blanche Corporation, the credit card and travel subsidiary of Avco Corporation: Pieviously an executive vice president and treasurer, Mr. Fonteyne succeeds James E. Hawthorne who has been named vice chairman and will undertake special assignments on longrange planning and development.

title: RED BLOC TALKS END; A REPORT IS AWAITED
description: WARSAW, Dec. 1A two. day meeting of Warsaw Pact foreign ministers ended here today with no indications of the results of their talks on preparations for a European security conference.

title: ROY CHRISTENSEN IN A CELLO DEBUT
description: Roy Christensen, who made his New York debut Tuesday night at Alice Tully Hall, was assistant principal cellist of the Milwaukee Symphony at age 16 and by 22 had served as principal of the Atlanta and Cincinnati symphony orchestras. His performance of a difficult program that included duo sonatas by Bach, Beethoven, Debussy and Britten amply indicated why the young man progressed so fast.

title: GAINS EXTENDED ON AMEX AND 0TC
description: The American Stock Exchange and the overthecounter market posted their fifth consecutive advance yesterday as prices rose sharply in steppedup trading.

title: Bank Robbery Linked to Armory Theft
description: Detectives investigating the robbery Tuesday of the Harlem Savings Bank on upper Broadway said yesterday that physical evidence had been turned up to link the holdup to the theft on Monday of M16 rifles from a Yonkers armory.

title: Jackson Expected To Rule Out Race In New Hampshire
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 1 (AP)  Senator Henry M. Jackson will announce tomorrow that he will not enter the New Hampshire primary next March and will concentrate instead on the Florida primary the following week, sources close to the Jackson campaign said tonight.

title: Marriage: It's Still Popular in the U.S.
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 1 The institution of marriage is more popular with Americans now than at any time in the nation's history, Federal statisticians reported today.

title: Personal Finance
description: New York is supposed to have so high a crime rate that insurance companies are extremely reluctant to sell burglary or robbery insurance.

title: Grant for Jersey Symphony
description: NEWARK, Dec. 1 (AP)The New Jersey Symphony Orchestra will receive a grant of $82,000 from the National Endowment on the Arts to expand its statewide youth concerts.

title: Suns Rout Blazers
description: PHOENIX, Ariz., Dec. 1 (AP) The Phoenix Suns achieved a winning season record tonight by defeating the Portland Trail Blazers, 139103, in a National Basketball Association contest.

title: Market Place:  Dividend Maze  Banker Ponders
description: There's a parttime cow poke up Chicago way who is in a real swivet over the Phase Two limit on dividend increases.

title: Troy Questions Lindsay Use of Funds
description: Councilman Matthew J. Troy, the Queens Democratic leader, charged yesterday that Mayor Lindsay might be guilty of exactly the same thing Thomas Dodd was censured for by the United States Senate  converting campaign funds to his own personal use.

title: Stocks Leap Ahead 14.67 As Volume Rises Sharply
description: Wall Street's latest wonderthe monetary crisis rally kept sending stock prices aloft yesterday in the heaviest volume since midAugust. The DowJones industrial average boomed 14.67 points to close at 846.01, or virtually its best level of a session when the sun seemed to shine on the trading floor of the New York Stock Exchange. the four trading days since Thanksgiving, the Dow has climbed a total of 47.38 points and withstood bursts profittaking as bearmarket clouds were wafted away.

title: Staubach Has Jets on Toes
description: Although the eyes of Irving, Texas, and a national television audience will be on Joe Namath when the Jets play Dallas Saturday, the eyes of the Jet defense will be on Roger Staubach and their legs will be trying to keep up with him.

title: WOMEN'S PROTEST QUELLED IN CHILE
description: SANTIAGO, Chile, Thursday, Dec. 2Policemen fired dozens of teargas grenades yesterday to halt a march by at least 5,000 women on the presidential palace in protest against food shortages and the Chilean visit of Premier Fidel Castro of Cuba.

title: SEARS SCHEDULES A RECORD OUTLAY
description: Sears, Roebuck & Co., the country's largest merchandising concern, yesterday told a private meeting of security analysts here that it would have record capital expenditures exceeding $350million in 1972. This would compare with estimated capital outlays this year of $325million.

title: News of Skiing
description: Now that more than two dozen Eastern downhill skiing centers are off to early starts, thanks to last week's snowstorm in the north country, there is increasing evidence that interest in the sport's crosscountry phase is mushrooming.

title: Royals Get 76er Guard
description: CINCINNATI, Dec. (AP)Jake Jones, waived by the Philadelphia 76ers was picked up today by the Cincinnati Royals of the National Basketball Association.

title: Bulls Trim Royals, 109101
description: CINCINNATI, Dec. 1 (AP)The Chicago Bulls, behind a 24point first half by Bob Love, built a 15  point margin after the first two periods and stopped the Cincinnati Royals, 109101, tonight. Love wound up with 36 points, but Nate Archibald of Cincinnati led all scorers with 42 points.

title: Wabash Pollution Charged
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 1 (AP) The Justice Department has filed suit in Federal District Court charging the Vincennes Paper Mill Co., Inc., of Vincennes, Ind., with polluting the Wabash River by dumping paper fibers, lead and suspended solids into it.

title: Union Loses at Fordham
description: The American Association of University Professors has lost by a vote of 236 to 222 in National Labor Relations Board election its bid to represent the Fordharn University faculty in collective bargaining. The results of the vote on Tuesday were announced yesterday by the university.

title: What Talk of Devaluation Means to Many: Not Much
description: The United States, as the dispatches from Rome indicated yesterday, seems gradually to be moving toward the first formal devaluation of the dollar since 1934. In legal terms, this would require ac tion by Congress to increase the official price of gold. The last time this happened, the event reflected a worldwide economic cataclysm, and, in this country, one of the early results of a decade of stagnation and mass unemployment.

title: U.S. WILL GRANT NO NEW PERMITS FOR INDIAN ARMS
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 1The United States, pointing to Indian troops' crossing of the Pakistani border in recent days, today suspended the licensing of arms shipments to India.

title: WILDCAT STRIKE  HALTS 100 BUSES Bee Line Walkout Affects Riders in Nassau County
description: A wildcat strike by 100 Bee Line bus drivers forced 20,000 Nassau County riders to find alternative means of travel yesterday.

title: Regulating UtilitiesAnd Us
description: WASHINGTONMr. Nixon's new economics constitutes a fundamental alteration in our economy and its relation to Government. Much of the prognostication about its meaning has focused on the country's experience with price controls in a variety of wartime and emergency situations. But Government control of prices has long been traditional in one sector of the economythe Federal, state and local control of the prices of public utilities offering, say, communications, water, gas, electricity, and transportation.

title: FORD WILL IMPORT JAPANESE TRUCKS
description: DETROIT, Dec. 1Two major automakers have decided to turn to Japan to manufacture vehicles for the rapidly growing mini pickup truck market at a time when the Administration is trying to curb imports.

title: Screen: Many Lives of 'The Ski Bum':Work by Bruce Clark Begins Local Run Joseph Mell Plays the Ubiquitous Burt Stone
description: Bruce Clark's "The Ski Bum" ought to have something besides a movie review. It ought to have something on the model of those book-review ads, compulsively readable, that promote a certain kind of unfashionably popular fiction just by listing the lives and loves of the characters.For example: BURT STONEhis money could buy him a mountain, but not the heart of his wife LIZ. Rich and restless, she hardly noticed that her daughter LISA already had the thoughts and the needs of a woman. But SAMANTHA noticed. Swinging hostess of Newday, Colorado's plushest ski resort, she kept a secret, but could she keep peace between Burt Stone and JOHNNYThe Ski Bum, who loved the freedom of the slopes, but wanted Samantha even more than he wanted to be free . . .And so on through a cast of dozens. Samantha's secret, by the way, is a Chinese husband named Otto, who works for Burt Stone, like everybody else in the moviewhich takes us into the story, which is a mistake. For "The Ski Bum," it is much more fun to say who's in it than to tell what's going on.Often you can't really tell what's going on because of a penchant of the filmmakers for starting and stopping each sequence in the middle, without much thought for a beginning or an end. But it is an action of some importance, ultimately stranding Johnny in a lonely phone booth half way up the ski lift in the midst of a raging snowstorm. He has been trying without luck to make a date with Samantha, and his final situation, according to the distributor's plot synopsis (in many ways, better than the movie) is "quietly symbolic of the emotional insularity of Western man today."Almost everybody in "The Ski Bum" is first rate, much too good for the material, with special honors to Joseph Mell as the ubiquitous Burt Stone and Lori Shelle as his emotionally mature daughter. The only performance I didn't like was that of Zalman King, who plays his snow-bound Ski Bum as if he were searching for a viable relation between Hamlet and the Little Match Girl.

title: Senate Will Vote on Butz  Today; His Confirmation Is Held Likely
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 1The Senate took up tonight the nomination of Dr. Earl L. Butz to be Secretary of Agriculture. All indications pointed to confirmation of President Nixon's appointee by a narrow margin.

title: Senate Rebuffs Pay Unit, Backs Retroactive Raises
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 1The Senate voted today to override the Nixon Administration's Pay Board, with the approval of the Administration itself, and grant retro active payment of most wage increases withheld during the wageprice freeze. The Senate acted in a bill extending through April 30, 1973, President Nixon's control over the economy.

title: DAVID L. MOULDS
description: David L. Moulds, a vice president of Ted Bates & Co., New York advertising agency, died on Tuesday in New York Hospital. He was 30 years old and lived in the Amberlands Apartments in CrotononHudson, N. Y.

title: Wild Blue Yonder Revisited
description: The United States Air Force Academy glistens metallically at the foot of an endless range of lovely mountains near Colorado Springs. The chapel building catches your eyes first as you approach it across the valley. Constructed of steel and aluminum, it tapers from a broad base to a series of points thrusting assertively upward toward the wild blue yonder. It was on the steps of this chapel that I, along with several other people, was apprehended by Air Force Security Police last month for distributing a prayer of St. Francis of Assisi and four quotations from the Bible. The prayer is the familiar one that starts out, Lord, make me en instrument of Thy peace. Where there is hatred, let me sow love, etc. The Bible verses had to do with beating swords into plowshares and not studying war anymore.

title: Man Who Refused Youth Money Is Slain in Queens
description: A 51yearold customer in a coinoperated laundry in South Ozone, Queens, was shot and killed and another customer was wounded late yesterday afternoon when a youth opened fire when none of the 10 customers inside would give him money.

title: CONTROL UNIT RULES RISES IN PRICES NEED NOT MATCH INFLATIONARY GAINS IN PAY
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 1The Price Commission warned today that business could not automatically expect price increases to cover inflationary wage increases, even if approved by the Government's Pay Board.

title: Disparities Found in Sentencing of City's Big Pushers
description: Major narcotics dealers arrested for illegal possession of a pound or more of heroin or cocaine receive substantially more lenient treatment in Manhattan and Brooklyn than they do in the Bronx and Queens, according to a study by the Joint Legislative Committee on Crime.

title: Stored Oil Explodes
description: VISALIA, Calif., Dec. 1 (UPI) A series of explosions roared through a bulk gasoline and oil storage yard early today, battering nearby houses with debris and shattering windows a mile away. Ten persons were treated for injuries. The explosions occurred at a Standard Oil Company storage yard.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: Subway Fare: Save It or Drop It?

title: A NEW PENAL LAW URGED IN JERSEY
description: TRENTON, N. J., Dec. 1The New Jersey Criminal Law Revision Commission submitted to the Legislature today its final report, urging a complete overhaul of the state's body of criminal law.

title: St.Mary's Students Demand a Merger With Notre Dame
description: SOUTH BEND. Ind., Dec. 1 (UPI)Twothirds of the student body at St. Mary's College boycotted classes today to protest a decision by the Roman Catholic girls college and the University of Notre Dame not to merge.

title: Orthodox Leaders Ask Help for Jewish Schools
description: LAKEWOOD, N. J., Dec. 1Leaders of Orthodox Judaism demanded today that Jewish federations and welfare funds throughout the country substitute cash for rhetoric in support of Jewish education, particularly a network of allday Jewish schools.

title: Life Magazine  Is Eliminating 80 to 90 Jobs
description: Economy Action Is Said to Affect 60 Persons of Total Staff of 450

title: Kidnappers Free Mexican
description: MEXICO CITY, Dec. 1Dr. Jaime Castrejn Diez, the rector of Guerrero State University, who was kidnapped Nov. 19, was released unharmed today near his home at Taxco, about 90 miles south of here. Dr. Castrejn's wife paid a ransom of $200,000 and on Sunday.

title: Scribner Is Seeking to End Local Board Stalemate
description: Dr. Harvey B. Scribner, the city's School Chancellor, has ordered the Lower East Side community .school board to fill two vacancies that have made it not able to function effectively.

title: Peking Denounces Plotters in Party; Attack on Lin Seen
description: HONG KONG, Dec. 1A joint editorial in Peking's leading publications, apparently connected with the recent disappearance of Defense Minister Lin Piao from public view, charged today that chieftains of opportunist lines were intriguing against Communist unity in China.

title: EAST PAKISTANIS SHOT IN REPRISAL
description: JINJARA, Pakistan, Nov. 30 Soldiers and militiamen under army orders have stepped up a campaign of shooting villagers and burning their houses in retaliation for increased guerrilla activity in the region around Dacca.

title: RANGERS TRIUMPH OVER SABRES, 72, AND RETAIN LEAD
description: When Ranger fans start cheering outoftown results in December, then something special must be happening to their team.

title: Unions Parade in Paris For Full Retirement at 60
description: PARIS, Dec. 1 Organized labor returned today to one of its favorite themes  retirement at 60 with full pensions.
