title: Six Arab Guerrillas Killed By Israelis in Gaza Strip
description: TEL AVIV, Israel, Dec. 1 (Reuters)Israeli troops shot and killed six Arab guerrillas today, bringing to 12 the number killed in the occupied Gaza Strip in the last three days, a military spokesman said.

title: Some Camembert and Brie Cheese Linked to Illness
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 1 he Food and Drug Administration today warned consumers against eating Camembert or Brie cheese of one brand that has been distributed to about 100 retailers and wholesalers throughout the country.

title: McGovern Visits Daley
description: CHICAGO, Dec. (UPI)Senator McGovern told Mayor Richard J. Daley today that he planned to enter the Illinois primary in his quest for the Democratic Presidential nomination. He said Mr. Daley had told him, in effect, to go ahead.

title: Hawks Down Pistons, 117103
description: DETROIT, Dec. 1 (UPI)The Atlanta Hawks received 20 points or more from four starting players and snapped a sixgame losing streak tonight by defeating the Detroit Pistons, 117103.

title: Screen: Born to Win
description: Born to Win, which opened yesterday at the 86th Street East Theater, the Victoria Theater, Broadway and 46th Street, and neighborhood theaters, was shown at the ninth New York Film Festival. The following are excerpts from Roger Greenspun's review, which appeared on Oct. 11, 1971, in The New York Times:

title: JUSTICES ALLOW RULING BY POSTEL
description: The Appellate Division refused by a 4to1 vote yesterday to order State Supreme Court Justice George Postel to reopen the extortion trial of Carmine J. Persico to the public.

title: Smith Sees Long Shift
description: LONDON, Dec. 1 (Reuters)Prime Minister Smith said in a television interview tonight that black Africans would not be in power in Rhodesia for at least 10 years and added that he did not know what the situation would be in 100 or 1,000 years.

title: Hyndman's 141 Leads by 2 In Seniors Golf Tourney
description: WEST PALM BEACH, Fla., Dec. 1 (UPI)Bill Hyndman of Huntingdon Valley, Pa., shot a twounderpar 70 and took the lead in the seventh annual American Seniors Golf Association tournament with a total of 141 today.

title: LowerySays Sick Calls Forced 4 Alarms for OneFire
description: It took four alarms to get the manpower needed to fight a onealarm fire in Harlem yesterday because at least 10 companies had been put out of action by men taking medical leaves, according to Fire Commissioner Robert O. Low ery.

title: MRS. GILBERT CHEVALIER
description: Mrs. Jane Geisman Chevalier, an executive with Crown Publishers for more than seven years, died yesterday in the New York Hospital after a brief illness. She was 37 years old and lived at 460 East 79th Street. She was the wife of Gilbert Chevalier.

title: ExStudent at Kent Makes Guilty Plea On Rioting Charge
description: RAVENNA, Ohio, Dec. 1 (UPI) Larry Shub, a former Kent State University student, pleaded guilty today to firstdegree riot charges growing out of the 1970 campus disorders at the school, where four students were killed by Ohio National Guardsmen.

title: Sports of The Times
description: The Nice Guy Who Finished First

title: BASIL OUTERBRIDGE
description: I TRENTON, Dec. 1  Basil Outerbridge, chairman of the Homasote Company, makers of woodfiber building boards, died today in Helene Fuld Hospital, of which he was also chairman. He was 69 years old and lived at 455 West State Street.

title: STATE APPROVES BANKING MERGERS
description: The New York State Banking Board approved yesterday the proposed acquisition by the $11.6billion Chemical New York Corporation of small banks in Suffolk County on eastern Long Island and in Rockland County, north of the city.

title: FORD PAYS $10,000 IN CLEANAIR CASE
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 1The Ford Motor Company agreed today to pay the Government $10,000 in civil penalties for delivering to dealers last summer 207,500 of its 1972model cars and trucks before receiving certification that they met Federal emission standards under the Clean Air Act of 1970.

title: FILION RECORDS VICTORY NO, 500
description: YONKERS, Dec. 1Thunder Royal, an 11yearold pacer who is the oldest horse in Herve Filion's stable, won the second race, a onemile, $2,750 claiming allowance test, at Yonkers Raceway tonight and carried Filion to his 500th victory of the season.

title: Sotheby's Withdraws a Renoir As $725,000 Bid Proves Low
description: LONDON, Dec. 1 (AP)One of the finest early works of Pierre Auguste Renoir, the French impressionist painter, failed to reach its reserve price at Sotheby's auction today and was withdrawn from the sale.

title: DIRECTORS CHANGED BY UTILITIES CORP.
description: The International Utilities Corporation, which recently moved its headquarters from Canada to the United States, announced yesterday the appointment of two United States citizens to its board and the resignation of three Canadian directors in an action to meet the requirements of the Federal Aviation Act of 1958.

title: RAIL LINE IS CUT, NEW DELHI SAYS
description: NEW DELHI, Dec. 2Indian Government spokesmen said tonight that the large Indian force that entered East Pakistan five days ago had advanced and cut a railroad line that supplies the northwest corner of that country.

title: Bugner Undergoes Surgery
description: EAST GRINSTEAD, England, Dec. 1 (AP)Joe Bugner, the former European heavyweight champion, underwent surgery today on his broken jaw. He fought seven rounds with the injury, before losing on, points to Larry Middleton of Baltimore last week.

title: Shame of the Catholics, Shame of the English
description: To be at the same time a Catholic and an Englishman is today to be ashamed on both counts. As a Catholic one is ashamed that more than a thousand years of Christianity have not abated the brutality of those Catholic women who shaved a yoUng girl's head and poured tar and red lead over her body because she intended to marry an English soldier. As an Englishman the shame is even greater.

title: C.C.N.Y. SURPRISES
description: Loyd's Goal With 0:49 Left Wins ErrorFilled Game36 Turnovers for Lions

title: Girl Who Advertised For Spouse Picks One
description: YUMA, Ariz., Dec. 1 (UPI) Marie Savinon, 18 years old, who advertised for a husband so that she could keep her brothers and sisters together, has chosen a Lebanese premedical student after receiving hundreds of proposals since Monday.

title: Drinking at 18 Rejected
description: SACRAMENTO, Calif., Dec. (UPI)The State Senate Killed today a proposed state constitutional amendment permitting 18yearsolds to drink.

title: Robert Kennedy's Body Now at Permanent Site
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 1 (UPI)The body of Robert F. Kennedy was transferred from a temporary site to a permanent one at Arlington National Cemetery last night.

title: International Paper Sales Increases Newsprint Price
description: MONTREAL, Dec. 1 (UPI)The International Paper Sales Company, Inc., advised its American customers that it was raising the price of newsprint effective Dec. 4.

title: Cornell Tops Scranton, 10890
description: ITHACA, Dec. 1Led by two sophomores, Brian Wright and Jeff Howard, the Cornell basketketball team opened its season with a 10890 triumph over Scranton tonight. Howard scored 19 points and had six assists; Wright 26 points and 11 rebounds.

title: N.C.E. Ousted in Soccer, 21
description: DUNN, N. C., Dec. 1 (UPI)Mikro Grgas scored with 50 seconds left in the fourth overtime period today to give Ottawa University of Kansas 21 triumph over Newark College of Engineering in the National Association of Intercollegiate Athletics soccer tournament.

title: U.S. Has No Comment
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 1The White House said it would have no comment tonight on the Chilean protest.

title: Penguins End Losing Steak
description: PITTSBURGH, Dec. 1 (AP)Bob Leiter scored three goals tonight to lead the Pittsburgh Penguins to a 42 victory over the Detroit Red Wings and snap a sixgame losing streak in National Hockey League action.

title: Salon Hall in Romp
description: SOUTH ORANGE, N.J., Dec. 1Seton Hall University opened its 60th basketball season tonight with a 99.71 victory over Wagner College. All 13 Pirates scored.

title: INVESTORS DRAWN TO TAXEXEMPTS
description: The market for taxexempt bonds, staggering in recent weeks under massive state and municipal demands for credit, may have found the interestrate level at which buyers can be attracted.

title: JOB BIAS AT BELL CHARGED BY PANEL
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 1The Equal Employment Opportunity Commission charged today that the American Telephone and Telegraph Company and its 22 operating companies in the Bell Telephone System were without doubt the largest oppressor of women workers in the United States.

title: ChrisCraft Record Date Set at Dec. 13 for Voting
description: ChrisCraft Industries, Inc., yesterday set Dec. 13 as the record date for voting at its annual meeting in Cortland, N.Y., on Jan. 11.

title: Clash at San Diego Hearing
description: SAN DIEGO, Dec. 1 (UPI)About 75 demonstrators clashed twice with the police at the State Building today during a hearing on a controversial San Diego State College economics professor. The demonstrators were attempting to open what had been declared a closed hearing. The professor, Peter Bohmer, 27 years old, who said he was being persecuted for his political views, faces charges from several students of unprofessional conduct.

title: Utah Player Quits
description: SALT LAKE CITY, Dec: 1 (AP)Larry Green, a 6foot7inch center, quit the University of Utah basketball team today. Green a junior who lost his starting job to Hay Vaughn this week, told Coach Bill Foster that he thought he would not play enough this season.

title: Stage: Two Gentlemen of Verona
description: Most of Papp Retained in St. James Version

title: Presidential Private Enterprise
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 1Not since the Labor Government of Britain nationalized that country's mines, railroads and steel industry has there been such an ambitious attempt to remake a democratic society as we now see embodied in the Democrats bill to let the American public pay for Presidential campaigns.

title: The Proceedings In the U.N. Today
MRS. PERON TO SEE ARGENTINE AIDES
description: MADRID, Dec. 1Juan D. Per6n's wife will go to Buenos Aires at the end of this week to represent the former dictator in negotiations with his divided following and with the Government of President Alejandro A. Lanusse.

title: Douglas, Granting Plea, Halts Southern California Inductions
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 1 Supreme Court Justice William 10. Douglas ordered the Government today to stop drafting men In the Los Angeles area into the Army until some time next year.

title: Pictures of Martian Moon
description: PASADENA, Calif., Dec. 1 (Reuters)The National Aeronautics and Space Administration released today the finest photographs yet taken of the larger Martian moon, Phobos, showing it to be an irregularly shaped chunk of rock with at least one huge crater.

title: Article 1  No Title
description: BEIRUT, Lebanon, Dec. 1Syria called today for an emergency meeting of the Arab League to discuss the landing by Iranian troops yesterday on three islands in the Persian Gulf, the Damascus radio reported.

title: COUGARS DEFEAT CONDORS, 118117
description: CHARLOTTE, N. C., Dec. 1 (AP)The Carolina Cougars, trailing by 13 points early in the fourth quarter, defeated the Pittsburgh Condors, 118117, tonight and moved out of last place in the Eastern Division of the American Basketball Association.

title: Notes on People
description: Christmas shopping at Sears Roebuck store in Washington yesterday were Mrs. Richard M. Nixon and her daughter Mrs. David Eisenhower. They did it to drum up support for stores that have voluntarily kept prices steady in support of the President's economic program. While she was there, Mrs. Nixon bought an electric popcorn popper ($6.88 on sale) for Julie Eisenhower's husband, and Mrs. Eisenhower bought Ensign Eisenhower a striped tie ($5) and her mother some sneakers ($3.99) for Camp David and San Clemente. They're the only ones my mother finds comfortable, Mrs. Eisenhower said.

title: New Pakistani Charge
description: RAWALPINDI, Pakistan, Dec. 1Pakistan charged today that Indian reconnaissance planes escorted by fighters flew over West Pakistan yesterday, penetrating many miles into the Sialkot region adjoining the frontier.

title: DEADLINE NEARS FOR SIX BUS LINES
description: The bankrupt InterCity Bus Lines, which serve 40,000 commuters in Bergen, Passaic, Morris and Essex Counties in New Jersey and Rockland County in New York, have until Monday to find a prospective buyer or go into liquidation.

title: ARTHUR KLOTZ, 60, CIVIL COURT JUDGE
description: Judge Arthur A. Klotz of the New York Civil Court died on Tuesday in New York Hospital after having undergone heart surgery. He would have been 61 years old yesterday. His home was at 165 East 32d Street.

title: Hotel Here May Change To Hospital
description: The massive New Yorker Hotel is tentatively scheduled for sale and conversion into a hospital.

title: THANT RELAYS NOTE ON A PAKISTAN TEAM
description: UNITED NATIONS, N. Y. Dec. 1A United Nations spokesman said today that Secretary General Thant wished to have action by a major organ of the United Nations before sending international observers to the borders of East Pakistan.

title: Arthur Spingarn of N.A.A.C.P. Is Dead
description: Arthur B. Spingarn, a Manhattan lawyer who was a leader in the struggle for equal rights for American Negroes from the foundation of the National Association for the Advancement of Colored People in 1909 to his retirement as its president in 1966, died yesterday at the age of 93 in his home, 60 Gramercy Park.

title: Front Page 1  No Title
description: GREAT GIFT IDEA FOR ANY OCCASION.

title: Patrolman Killed After Aiding Driver, Here Is Honored
description: Patrolman Patrick J. O'Connor, who was killed in an accident Thanksgiving evening after assisting a motorist in distress in Brooklyn, was among those honored yesterday as 2,648 meritorious awards were issued to members of the force.

title: Hussein Foresees New Battle Unless the Israelis Evacuate Occupied Arab Areas
description: BEIRUT, Lebanon, Dec. 1King Hussein of Jordan said today that another battle with Israel was inevitable as long as Israel continued to occupy Arab territory.

title: VOTE FUND ISSUE HOLDS UP ACCORD ON TAX MEASURE
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 1  A Senate and House conference committee reached agreement today on all parts of the tax bill except for the controversial plan to finance Presidential election campaigns out of tax funds.

title: Stockholdings Of Insiders
description: The American Stock Exchange yesterday issued its latest report on changes in stock ownership by major stockholders, directors and officers of its listed companies. The New York Stock Exchange did not issue a report for this week.

title: State Harness Agency To Appeal TV Ruling
description: Robert Glasser, chairman of the State Harness Racing Commission, said yesterday his agency would appeal a court ruling that overrode its authority to prevent the televising of races at Monticello Raceway.

title: BIDS FOR RENT HELP PUSHED BY ELDERLY
description: Elderly people continued to flock by the hundreds to district rent offices and local offices for the. Aging yesterday to fill out applications for partial rent exemptions before the deadline Friday.

title: Soviet Fishing Trawlers Are Targets of Leaflets
description: Two BalticAmerican organizations reported dropping almost 4,000 waterproof leaflets on the Soviet fishing fleet in the Atlantic yesterday.

title: Lewis Carroll in Criticland
description: Books of The Times

title: 76ers Edge Sonics, 10298
description: PHILADELPHIA, Dec. 1 (AP) Billy Cunningham's 32 points in his 500th N.B.A. game led the Philadelphia 76ers to a 10298 victory over the Seattle SuperSonics tonight and Cunningham's jump shot with 18 seconds left clinched the vic tory for the 76ers.

title: Editor of Harper's Bazaar Steps Down
description: Nancy White, who had guided Harper's Bazaar magazine through the glossy waters of New York's fashion world since 1958, resigned yesterday.

title: Stauffer and PPG to Raise Prices for Caustic Soda
description: The Stauffer Chemical Company and PPG Industries, Inc., joined other chemical companies yesterday in raising the price of caustic soda. Both companies emphasized that the moves were in line with Phase Two guidelines and the new prices are essentially the same as those announced recently by the other manufacturers.

title: News of Dogs
description: Geneticist Puts Indelible Mark On Dapple Dachshund Breed

title: Article 3  No Title
description: JERSEY CITY, Dec. 1Richard Cox hit a jump shot with three seconds remaining tonight to give the University of WisconsinMilwaukee an 8180 victory over St. Peter's College at the Jersey City Armory.

title: ISRAEL OFFERS HELP AFTER SHRINE BLAZE
description: JERUSALEM, Dec. 1 The Israeli Government offered assistance today to the Greek Orthodox Church in the rebuilding of firedamaged sections of the Monastary of St. Catherine on Mount Sinai.

title: Stock Prices Soar
description: Stock prices continued their sharp rally yesterday, buoyed mainly by reports of progress toward solving the international currency crisis. The DowJones industrial average soared 14.67 points to 846.01 as volume rose to 21.04 million shares on the New York Stock Exchange. Details on Page 73.

title: Article 2  No Title
description: LONDON, Dec. 1Britain rejected today Iraqi accusations of collusion in Iran's occupation yesterday of the Persian Gulf islands.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: Indictment of U.S.

title: Schocken Diversifying With More of Kafka
description: In an unpretentious office suite on the 12th floor of residential apartment building at Park Avenue and 38th Street, a tweedy, mildmannered man leaned forward in his chair and pointed at row of books by Franz Kafka.

title: HILTON HOTELS BIDS FOR LEISURE SHARES
description: The Hilton Hotels Corporation announced last night that it had offeredto exchange 0.35 of its shares for each share of the International Leisure Corporation that it does not already own. At present, Hilton has more than 5.6 million, or 85.8 per cent, of the almost 6.6 million shares of International Leisure, which operates two hotels in Las Vegas.

title: Buyers See 72 Gain
description: Business in the nation will improve in 1972 but no boom is in sight, according to a survey of purchasing executives.

title: WORK PLAN STIRS A FUROR IN ISRAEL
description: TEL AVIV, Dec. 1A furor has erupted over the Government's decision to assign civilian workin hospitals, schools and welfare institutionsto young women holding religious exemptions from military service.

title: New Zealand in Tennis Rift Over 3 Aussie Women
description: CHRISTCHURCH, New Zealand, Dec. 1 (AP)Mrs. Billie Jean King of Long Beach, Calif., posted an effortless victory today at the start of a women's international tennis tournament.

title: Chess: Science of the Openings  Is Often More of a Fashion
description: A novice who glances through a. copy of Reuben Fine's Modern Chess Openings (a book of more than 500 pages, with lines of play shown in aye parallel columns on almost every page, and a jungle of notes to boot) must come away with the idea that the study of the chess openings is very systematic, even scientific, business.

title: Boston U. Cuts Costs
description: BOSTON, Dec. 1 (AP)Boston University, faced with $4.4million deficit, is dropping its baseball, rifle and golf programs and initiating other economies. The school's President, John R. Silber, said yesterday that the university would also freeze the hiring of secretaries and clerical personnel and curtail faculty telephone service.

title: Le Mans Will Not Shorten 24Hour Endurance Race
description: LE MANS, France, Dec. 1 (UPD)The Le Mans 24  hour endurance race will not be shortened to conform to possible future rules limiting sports car races to six hours, Le Mans organizers said today.

title: TWO STORE OWNERS SHOOT HOLDUP MEN
description: A grocery store owner in the Bronx and a tavern owner in Washington Heights exchanged pistol shots with holdup men last night.

title: For the Nine O'Clocks, Time Is Rolled Back to Paris of the 1920's
description: Paris of the twenties, dressed in gaiety, cloaked in nostalgia and dripping with sentiment, roared into the Plaza Hotel last night. The roar was somewhat more subdued than the original but, as many of the 350 guests said they couldn't really remember that decade of flappers and flamboyance, it didn't much matter.

title: Bishop Costen J. Harrell Of Methodist Church Dies
description: ATLANTA, Dec. 1 (AP).Bishop Costen J. Harrell of the Methodist Church died here Monday at the age of 86.

title: RACING IN DANGER, SAYS SPOKESMAN
description: After a losing football season, Tom Brock used to disarm hostile dinner audiences by giving his definition of good coach.

title: Baseball Urged to Field Washington Club by 73
description: PHOENIX, Ariz., Dec. 1Four members of Congress lectured the owners of the 24 major league teams for one hour today and warned that baseball must restore a club to Washington by 1973.

title: Cavaliers Win 5th in Row
description: CLEVELAND, Dec. 1 (UPI) The Cleveland Cavaliers, who had a wonlost record of 122 at this time last year, gained their fifth straight victory and ninth of the season tonight, 116106, over the Houston Rockets.

title: Mitchell Denies That He'll Quit to Run Campaign
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 1 (UPI) Despite persistent reports to the contrary, Attorney General John N. Mitchell says he knows neither if nor when he might quit the Cabinet to run President Nixon's reelection campaign next year.

title: Columbia Fraternities Ask More Police
description: A group of Columbia University students, shaken by an armed robbery of nine students at a fraternity house last Saturday night, demanded more protection yesterday.

title: What Political Organization?
description: Deputy Mayor Richard R. Aurelio's assertion that the John V. Lindsay Associations are not political organizations . . . as defined by election law, can hardly stand in face of the facts. There is nothing wrong in their being political associations, but there is something wrong in denying it.

title: For Valentino and Cardin, Cinched Waistlines
description: Everywhere you looked, there were camellias. On the chest of a black silk evening dress. On the toes of shoes. On the hips of a bathing suit. On a black silk man's tie. When there weren't camellias, there were V's. Valentino's back in town.

title: Wood, Field and Stream
description: Nearly complete reports on Maine's recent deer season indicate that this year's harvest may be slightly under 19,000 animals.

title: Rogers Ties Security  Talks to Berlin Pact
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 1Secretary of State William P. Rogers said tonight that once the Berlin accord was made final, the United States would favor a special allied meeting to discuss concrete preparations for convening the Conference on European Security and Cooperation, long sought by the Soviet bloc.

title: BOSTON OFFICIALS DENY SEGREGATION
description: BOSTON, Dec. 1  School officials here denounced today Federal charges that they were operating a segregated school system but agreed to work. toward a plan that would eliminate the threat of losing Federal funds.

title: MONETARY BREACH HELD NARROWING
description: ROME, Dec. 1  The United States and other major powers in the West made some progress today in narrowing differences in the international monetary dispute and decided to move their discussions to Washington on Dec. 17 and 18.

title: Dublin Calls for Ulster Brutality Inquiry
description: DUBLIN, Dec. 1The Irish Government has asked the European Commision on Human Rights to investigate charges that British troops have behaved brutally toward Roman Catholic internees in Northern Ireland.

title: Kheel Unavailable To Aid in Mediating City's Transit Pact
description: The cast of mediators in New York City's biennial, New Year's Eve transit drama will not include one .of its regulars, according to an announcement made yesterday by Theodore W. Kheel.

title: IndiaPakistan Combat Called Exaggerated
description: DACCA, East Pakistan, Dec. 1Despite daily pronouncements of major attacks and heavy fighting, the actual level of combat between Pakistani and Indian troops along the border of East Pakistan appears to be fairly light, with both sides placing more emphasis on the propaganda war than on

title: ADAMS IS NAMED CHAIRMAN OF N.B.C.
description: David C. Adams was appointed chairman of the National Broadcasting Company at yesterday, morning's monthly meeting of the board of directors. He succeeds Walter D. Scott, who will remain as a director. Mr. Scott two years ago had advised associates of his plans to phase himself out of his job.

title: Korff Chosen to Head Academy of Sciences
description: Dr. Serge A. Korff was elected president of the New York Academy of Sciences yesterday at the academy's annual meeting, held in the WaldorfAstoria Hotel. He takes office Jan. 1.

title: Wounded Girl Dies
description: BELFAST, Northern Ireland, Dec. 1 (Reuters)A 17yearold girl who was shot when gunmen tried to kill two policemen investigating a traffic accident here last Saturday died tonight.

title: Joseph G. Colozzo, Head Of Longshoremen's Local
description: Joseph G. Colozzo, president of Local .1277 ofthe, International longdhorenien's Association, died of a heart attack at the age of 66 on Nov. 27 while on a Visit to Italy. Mr. Colozzo was long considered to be one of the most powerful men on the Brooklyn waterfront.

title: Queens Jewish Leaders Fear Effects of the Forest Hills Project
description: A substantial number of Jewish religious and civic leaders in Queens contend that the lowrent housing project on which work has already begun in Forest Hills will destroy Jewish community and religious life and culture in that borough and will force middleclass Jews to flee to the suburbs.

title: Presidential Seal to Get Workout on Nixon Trips
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 1The White House is already worrying about an eightounce object made of plaster of paris that may never be seen on Chinese soil but will fly there ahead of President Nixon when he visits China in February.

title: Casey Outlines 72 Steps To Spur Investor. Hopes
description: BOCA RATON, Fla., Dec. 1 The nation's top securities administrator outlined today steps for 1972 designed to restore investor confidence and help American industry to raise $10billion or more a year in new equity capital.

title: War Driving More and More Cambodians From Homes
description: PNOMPENH, Cambodia, Nov. 28As the war in Cambodia drags on, an increasing number of Cambodian families are discovering the harsh life of the refugee on the road and in temporary camps.

title: No Fallout in Canada
description: OTTAWA, Dec. 1 (AP)  The Health Department said today that no radioactive fallout from the United States underground nuclear test on Amchitka Island had been detected in Canada.

title: Thant Urges Revived Jarring Effort in Mideast
description: UNITED NATIONS, N. Y., Dec. 1  Secretary General Thant called today for new and urgent efforts for peace in the Middle East by his special envoy, Dr. Gunnar V. Jarring. Mr. Thant's call for the revival of the Jarring mission was contained in his report to the Security Council and to the General Assembly on the Mideast situation, which the Assembly is scheduled to debate Friday.

title: ROBINSON WARNS OF SCHOOL CUTS
description: The president of the Board of Education warned yesterday that the city school system might be forced to shut down before the end of the academic year if there were substantial cuts in state aid.

title: Foe in Cambodia Renews Heavy Attacks
description: SAIGON, Dec. 1 (AP)North Vietnamese forces renewed heavy attacks along Cambodia's northeastern front today and Cambodian troops were reported retreating from two key towns.

title: Brooklyn Woman Found Slain in Her Apartment
description: A 45yearold Brooklyn woman was found dead yesterday evening,her head battered, in her basement apartment in the Brighton Beach section of Brooklyn.

title: Jessore Threatened
description: JESSORE, Pakistan, Dec. 1 (AP)  Indian infantry units were only four miles from this important garrison town tonight arid Pakistani officers said they expected a heavy Indian attack, apparently in an effort to make Jessore the East Pakistani rebel capital.

title: PAYMENTS FIGURE DEFENDED BY U.S.
description: Walther Lederer, senior economist for the Treasury, declared yesterday that the projected $13billion balanceofnayments deficit the United States is trying to turn around is as real as careful estimates can make it and that the figure contains no artificial cushion to provide bargaining room for American negotiators.

title: A.M.A. Decides to Poll Membership on Change
description: NEW ORLEANS, Dec. (UPI)The American Medical Association wound up its semiannual convention today by deciding to poll its 167,000 members on charges that the organization is in need of major changes.

title: District Attorney Is Slain By Sniper in New Mexico
description: TUCUMCARI, N. M., Dec. 1 (UPI)The District Attorney of this northeastern New Mexico town near the Texas border was shot to death today in front of his home by a sniper using a highpowered rifle, the police said.

title: Nixon Tells Youths They Can Play a Wider Role
description: CHICAGO, Dec. 1President Nixon flew here today to tell an assembly of youths that their generation had the opportunity to participate more fully, in the American adventure than young people have been able to do since Revolutionary times.

title: 30 Prison Guards Protest Brooklyn Jail Overcrowding
description: About 30 offduty correction officers, contending that overcrowding in the Brooklyn House of Detention for Men is worse now than it was just prior to rioting there last fall, demonstrated yesterday in front of the building at Smith Street and Atlantic Avenue in downtown Brooklyn.

title: The Food at the Heart of Commune Life
description: She might have been the heroine in one of those mindless youth movies that came out in the wake of Easy Rider, a girl with long blond hair, granny glasses and a spare pair of jeans thumbing her way from commune to commune in search of some obscure countercultural goal. But in fact, Lucy Horton's odyssey was not an aimless highway pilgrimage. She spent most of this year on the road hunting for country commune recipes. Now she is back East putting together a cookbook.

title: Yale Sextet Ties Record In Routing UConn by 162
description: NEW HAVEN, Dec. 1Yale tied its onegame scoring record tonight by trouncing the University of Connecticut hockey team, 162.

title: Floridians Overtime Victors
description: DALLAS, Dec. 1 (AP)Mack Calvin sank a pair of free throws with 12 seconds remaining tonight to lift the Floridians to a 107106 overtime victory over the Dallas Chaparrals in an American Basketball Association game.

title: MISS MILYKO SINGS WITH STYLE IN DEBUT
description: Good looks, an attractive and poised stage personality and a knowledge of how to approach the music she sang were the positive qualities in Florences Milyko's debut in Carnegie Recital Hall on Tuesday night.

title: Torah Is Destroyed In Brooklyn Fire; 20 Attack Suspect
description: An enraged band of students at a yeshiva in the Williamsburg section of Brooklyn mauled an apparent burglar last night after he allegedly set fire to a torah, or handwritten Biblical scroll, worth $10,000, the police said.

title: Owner Reclaims Museum Brancusi
description: Two deputy sheriffs entered the Guggenheim Museum with a court order yesterday and seized a marble head by Constantin Brancusi, the Rumanian sculptor, that has been the subject of a lengthy legal wrangle.

title: Soviet Discloses Nuclear Blast That Put Out Fire in Gas Field
description: MOSCOW, Dec. 1The Soviet Union has disclosed the detonation of all underground nuclear charge of unprecedented force to extinguish a fire that raged out of control for three years in a natural gas field in Central Asia.

title: ABUSE AT ATTICA SCORED IN RULING BY FEDERAL COURT
description: A ruling to protect prisoners from barbarous abuse by guards at the Attica Correctional Facility was issued here yesterday by the United States Court of Appeals for the Second Circuit.

title: Hurricane Season Over
description: MIAMI, Dec. 1 (AP)The 1971 hurricane season is officially over, leaving nine deaths and an estimated $235million in property damage in the United States. That's pretty small considering we had five storms in a row strike the U.S., a National Hurricane Center forecaster, Paul Hebert, said. The Atlantic season ended last midnight Tuesday after spawning 12 storms, five of them hurricanes, since June 1.

title: Embargo on Foreign Mail Lifted as Dock Strike Ends
description: The embargo on all classes of international surface mail, in effect during the 57day shipping strike here, has been ended, but it is too late for such deliveries to arrive overseas in time for Christmas, George J. Hass, officer in charge of the New York Post Office, announced yesterday.

title: A Threat to the Peace
description: A major victim of the rapidly expanding war between India and Pakistan may yet be the United Nations and the principle of international cooperation for peace which it embodies.

title: Backers of Ulster Minority Getting Up Their Irish Here
description: In 1927, Michael Flannery left Tipperary in the new Republic of Eire, fighting mad, he says, that the Irish had compromised with the British and accepted partition.

title: Exports to East Bloc Up
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 1 (AP) Validated export licenses for shipments to Eastern Europe totaled $206.5million in the third quarter, the highest total since early 1964, the Commerce Department reported today.

title: . . . Hope on Campaigns
description: Fortunately the proposal for financing Presidential campaigns by an income tax checkoff is part of the revenue bill, not of the quite separate measure to control campaign spending, which was passed this week by the House of Representatives. Had checkoff and spending been linked in the same legislation, the President's strong objections to the former would surely have doomed all campaign finance reform for the yearand perhaps for years to come. As it is, Mr. Nixon now has no reason whatever to veto the spending reform bill, whether or not he decides to veto the checkoff the cost of his entire taxreduction program.

title: The Talk of New York
description: Successful businessmen who select politicians as objects of their charity usually cringe in horror at such words as left or even liberal.

title: TALKS ON ELDERLY ROILED BY DISPUTE
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 1Representatives of state agencies that deal with the elderly challenged today the way in which Dr. Arthur S. Flemming, the Administrationappointed chairman of the White House Conference on the Aging, was running the conference.

title: 18YearOld Jurors Gain
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 1 (AP)The Senate voted today to lower the minimum age for serving on Federal court juries from 21 to 18. By voice vote it sent the bill to the House after accepting a Judiciary Committee amendment that requires jury selection lists to be updated by Dec. 31, 1973, with voter registration lists or lists of actual voters from next November's Presidential election.

title: VESCO IS RELEASED ON BAIL IN GENEVA
description: GENEVA, Dec. 1Robert L. Vesco, the head of the Investors Overseas Services mutualfund group, was released on $125,000 bail by a Geneva court today after pleading innocent of any wrongdoing.

title: Man in the News
description: Since he became one of the Nixon Administration's top black officials in the spring of 1969, Arthur Allen Fletcher has had more than his share of arguments with other blacks, which suits him fine, because he loves a good argument. A wellworn scenario would begin with a black man or woman exclaiming, I don't see how any black person can serve with Nixon, and, following the script, Mr. Fletcher would invariably wade right in.

title: ExCity Deputy Mayor To Head Service Unit
description: Robert W. Sweet, who had served in the. Lindsay administration as a Deputy Mayor, has been elected president of the Community Service Society of New York, it was announced yesterday by Robert H. Mulreany, chairman of the organization's board of trustees.

title: Talks Said to Gain
description: EAST BERLIN, Dec. 1 (Reuters)The negotiations between East and West Germany on Berlin settlement took a successful course today and will continue tomorrow, a communiqu said.

title: CANADIEN RAM BEATS KINGS, 53
description: MONTREAL, Dec. 1 (UPI)Jacques Lemaire scored two goals late in the third period tonight as the Montreal Canadiens overcame a twogoal deficit to defeat the Los Angeles Kings, 5.3.

title: Cocoa Official Is Appointed
description: John E. Mattesich has joined the New York Cocoa Exchange as assistant to the secretary, F. J. Brennan. He was formerly chief of compliance in the Eastern region of the Cornmidity Exchange Aurthority.

title: The Blame Game
description: IN THE NATION

title: ROCKEFELLER HAILS MILLS FISCAL PLAN
description: Governor Rockefeller welcomed Representative Wilbur Mills's substitute for President Nixon's Federal revenuesharing program yesterday and said the Representative's office had informed him that passage of the plan could mean $379.5million in new aid for New York State in the 197273 Federal fiscal year.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: Concern Over DDT

title: Henderson Jury Awaits Three New Witnesses
description: FORT MEADE, Md., Dec. 1The military jury at the courtmartial of Col. Oran K. Henderson marked time today while awaiting the arrival of three, witnesses who it expects will shed more light on whether there was a coverup of they Mylai 4 slayings.

title: High Sir, $12.60, Is Victor In Overbrook at Liberty
description: PHILADELPHIA, Dec. 1 (UPI) Mrs. Henry D. Paxson's High Sir triumphed by a halflength over the Jerry Meyertrained Dundas Prince in the $12,000 Overbrook at Liberty Bell Race Track today.

title: Two Worlds East of San Francisco Bay Uneasy Despite Growth
description: UNION CITY, Calif.These days Union City is anything but.

title: CHILE PROTESTS KLEIN STATEMENT
description: SANTIAGO, Chile, Dec. (AP)  Chile issued a formal protest tonight against statements attributed to two high United States officials that Marxist President Salvador Allende's Government won't last long.

title: Nixon Official Will Be Head Of United Negro College Fund
description: Arthur A. Fletcher, one of the highestranking blacks In the Nixon Administration, resigned yesterday to become ex ecutive director of the United Negro College Fund.

title: Walsh, Citing Infractions, Ousts 3 Directors of a Project in Bronx
description: Albert A. Walsh, head of the city's Housing and Development Administration, dismissed the board of directors of a 139apartment project in the Bronx yesterday.

title: LEAFS TRIUMPH OVER BLUES, 42
description: TORONTO, Dec. 1 (UPI)Jim Harrison's goal midway through the second period tonight snapped a 22 tie and helped give the. Toronto Maple Leafs a 4.2 victory over the St. Louis Blues.

title: Deaths
description: BERLINMatilda (Matt) of Hotel Broadmoor, 235 W. 102 St. Cherished niece. Beloved cousin and dear friend Services Park West, 115 W. 79 St., Thurs., Dec 11:30 A.M.

title: Cabaret Satire Sharpens in East Germany as Curbs Are Eased
description: BERLIN, Dec. 1 All at once, after six years of tight controls imposed by the Communist Government, East Germany's artists are being given freer rein.

title: Campaign Money Curb
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 1Despite great Congressional care, the campaign spending bill that the House passed yesterday does not appear to be vetoproof.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: Administration Turns Back Foes Of Policies at Cities Convention
description: HONOLULU, Dec. 1 The Nixon Administration and its supporters have succeeded in turning back bitter opposition to its urban policies from the nation's largest organization of city officials, the National League of Cities.

title: U.S. JUDGE SEVERS TRIAL OF COLOMBO
description: Federal Judge Anthony J. Travia granted yesterday a severance of the trial of Joseph A. Colombo Sr., on charges of gambling conspiracy and ordered sealed a medical report on the reputed Mafia chieflain's condition. The 48yearold Colombo, who shot in the

title: COMMODITY BOARD SUED OVER RATES
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 1The Justice Department filed an antitrust suit against the Chicago Board of Trade today, charging it with illegally fixing the sales commissions its members charge on commodity futures trades. The Board of Trade is the nation's largest commodity market.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: Differences Over the Panama Canal

title: LAKERS SET BACK CELTICS BY 124111
description: BOSTON, Dec. 1 (UPI)Jerry West and Gail Goodrich combined for 78 points to lead the Los Angeles Lakers past the Boston Celtics, 124111, tonight in the National Basketball Association. It was the Lakers 15th conserative victory.

title: Tasks of Soviet Mars 2 Craft Appear Like Those of Mariner
description: MOSCOW, Dec. 1 Scientific commentaries published today indicated that the Soviet spacecraft Mars 2, which went into orbit around the plant Mars on Saturday, would perform many of the same investigations as the United States Mariner 9, in orbit since Nov. 14.

title: Construction Value Up
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 1Manufacturers inventories increased moderately in October, the Commerce Department reported today.

title: Knape &
description: The Knape & Vogt Manufacturing Company said yesterday that it might cut its 35cent quarterly dividend to 30 or 31 cents a share to comply with voluntary dividend restrictions of the Government's Committee on Interest and Dividends.

title: IRAQIS HOLD PROTEST AGAINST IRAN MOVE
description: BAGHDAD, Iraq, Dec. 1Iraqi students, peasants and members of labor and political organizations held a mass demonstration today at Liberation Square to protest the Iranian occupation of three islands in the Persian Gulf as the Government called for a meeting of the United Nations Security Council.

title: OFFER IS EXTENDED BY CITIES SERVICE
description: The Cities Service Company announced yesterday it was extending its offer to exchange its common stock for Atlantic Richfield Company's common stock until 5 P.M. on Dec. 10 unless terminated at an earlier date due to complete subscription.

title: Larry Richardson And Dancers Start 6Program Series
description: Technique in the service of an exhausted esthetic outlook makes Larry Richardson's choreography pleasing to the eye but wearying to the mind. On Tuesday he and his company presented the first of six programs at the theater of the Riverside Church.

title: BADILLO DECRIES ATTICA INACTION
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 1 Representative Herman Badillo told the Congressional committee investigating prison disorders today that the many investigations of the rebellion at the Attica Correctional Facility had served to obfuscate the fact that inmates demands agreed to by the state have not been implemented.

title: Schools in Newark To Display the Flag Of Black Liberation
description: NEWARK, Dec. 1The City Board of Education voted early today to hang the black liberation flag in all schools and classrooms where black students were in the majority.

title: FAIR SHARE PLEDGED BY NIXON ON TRADE
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 1 (AP)President Nixon told Congress today the United States stands ready to do its fair share to improve the world trade and monetary systems.

title: Bridge: British Cut Italians Lead In European Championships
description: ATHENS, Dec. 1The European championship bridge title, which will determine the European representation in the 1973 world championship, seems likely to depend on the lastround match between Italy and Britain on Saturday.

title: Public TV News Salaries Cause Stir
description: The president of the National Public Affairs Center for Television said yesterday that recent disclosures of high salaries among public television news personalities was building up to a tempest in a teapot.

title: BRANIFF BUYS 13 JETS AND SELLS 10 OTHERS
description: Braniff Airways, Inc., said yesterday it was acquiring 13 Boeing 727 trijet aircraft for $87.3million and had sold 10 twoengine and fourengine aircraft for $42.2million.

title: VARIED WORKS GIVEN BY YOUTH ORCHESTRA
description: For its concert at Philharmonic Hall on Tuesday night, the Society of Black Composers invited the Washington Youth Orchestra to play Howard Swanson's Concerto for Orchestra, George Walker's Address for Orchestra, Stephen Chamber's Sound Images and William Fischer's Statement for Voices and Orchestra. The chorus used in the last two works was that of the New York High School of Music and Art.

title: Stars Defeat Seals, 41
description: BLOOMINGTON, Minn., Dec. 1(AP)Bill Goldsworthy scored three goals tonight to power the Minnesota North Stars to a 41 victory over the California Seals and increase their National Hockey League West Division lead over the idle Chicago Black Hawks to three points.

title: DR. FREDERICK ROWE
description: BRONXVILLE, N.Y., Dec. 1The Rev. Dr. Frederick L. Rowe, who had spent 20 years as a missionary in Africa, died of a heart attack today in Mount Vernon Hospital. He was 74 years old and lived at .1133 Midland Aventie.

title: Lubow Becomes Assistant to Chairman at  D.D.B.
description: Advertising:

title: Dividends
description: STOCK

title: Trading in Futures of Pork Bellies Is Begun Here
description: Trading in pork belly futures was begun yesterday for the first time in the East by the International Commercial Exchange at 2 Broadway.

title: Stalemate on Taxes ...
description: A Congressional conference committee has removed $12 billion worth of tax cuts added by the Senate the tax bill that reached it from the House. Even with those cuts eliminated, the total revenue loss from the tax legislation will amount to $26 billion during the first three years.

title: Taylor Leads Princeton
description: PRINCETON, N.J., Dec. 1Brian Taylor, a junior guard, scored a career high of 39 points tonight to tie a Jadwin Gymnasium record and pace Princeton to a 9968 rout of Rutgers before a capacity crowd of 7,550.

title: Stans Begins Trade Talks With Poland
description: WARSAW, Dec. 1Maurice H. Stans, United States Secretary of Commerce, began talks with the Polish. Government today to explore the possibilities of increasing trade and commercial relationships.

title: Egyptians Say Key Suspect In Assassination Left Cairo
description: CAIRO, Dec. 1  Egyptian security authorities have reported that a Palestinian suspected of having planned the assassination of Jordan's Premier, Wasfi Tal, here last Sunday flew abroad less than two hours before the shooting.

title: Mitchum and Brenda Vaccaro Star in 'Going Home'
description: At the age of 6, Jimmy Graham awakens in the middle of the night to hear his father beating his mother. A minute afterwards, she staggers down the stairs  her throat freshly cut  to die at the feet of the stunned child.Thireen years later, Jimmy, the obviously troubled product of county farms and foster homes, seeks out his recently paroled father with some vague ideas of revenge. Jimmy is seething with rage but, for most of "Going Home," he is impotent, trapped by traumatic memories that allow him to do little more than write graffiti on men's walls: "Beware of Harry K. Graham he killed his wife."After this description of the beginning of "Going Home," you will, I hope, be as surprised as I was to learn that it is apparently meant to be an optimistic movie. At the endafter some further melodramatic incidents that I'd just as soon forgetJimmy hits the road, the hint of healthy resolution on his face, older and maybe wiser, but, it would seem to me (if not the movie), sicker than ever."Going Home," which opened yesterday at the Victoria and other theaters around town, is an exceedingly nasty movie. Based on an original screenplay by Lawrence B. Marcus, it is the first directorial effort of Herbert B. Leonard, the producer of "Popi," that lovable, laughable family comedy set in rat-infested Spanish Harlem.Like "Popi," "Going Home" exploits the sorrows of its characters as well as the intelligence of its audience, as much through ineptitude as through conscious decision.In the opening scene, for example, Mr. Leonard chooses to show us the unshowable: Jimmy's mother descending the stairs in a kind of death spasm. Actually she looks as if she just had a bad scratch. This might, I suppose, be interpreted as good taste, since we don't really want to see the blood spurting out. However, by cutting away from the horror on the child's face, which would be enough to set the film's premise, he also introduces a not-so-Grand Guignol effect that simply cheapens the drama.Even worse is Mr. Marcus's explanation of why the father, played by Robert Mitchum as if he were a high school football coach, took the knife to his wife in the first place: He was drunk."Going Home" is more objectionable, more pernicious, than other, much dumber movies because it appears to have some surface intelligence. The film was photographed on location in New Jersey and captures, visually anyway, the feeling of lives lived in trailer camps, bowling alleys, roadhouses and amusement parks. Also, two of its three major performers are exceptionally good.Mitchum has reached that point in his career where he doesn't seem to act as much as inhabit whatever film he's in, whatever role he's playing, whether it's an Irish school-master, an Australian sheepherder or, as here, a nice, well-meaning garage mechanic with a talent for bowling. I also liked Brenda Vaccaro as his mistress, a tough, understanding broad who knows, as we do, that Mitchum couldn't possibly hurt anyone, even when drunk.Unfortunately, Jan-Michael Vincent is impossible as the son, admittedly an impossible role that requires the actor to be simultaneously appealing and psychotic. He's very handsome and very young and he has a lot to learn about acting, including how to hiccup with conviction.

title: Eugene P. Connolly Dead at 70; Labor Figure Sat on City Council
description: Eugene P. Conholly, who was a.4 member of the New York City Council in the early nineteenforties under Mayor Fiorello H. La Guardia, died yesterday at St. Vincent's Hospital. He was 70 years old and lived at 46 Horatio Street in Greenwich Village.

title: Giants Tackle Gives Up Boxing
description: Although Willie Young, the New York Giants offensive tackle, doesn't expect to kiss and make up with Verlon Biggs, the Washington Redskins defensive end, when the teams meet in the nation's capital on Sunday, he is not planning a boxing rematch.

title: $1.5BILLION VOTED TO COMBAT DRUGS
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 2 The Senate voted unanimously today to put broad powers and $1.5billion behind a coordinated Federal campaign against illicit drugs.

title: Detailed Statements On Accounts Sought
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 2 (AP), The Securities and Exchange Commission, reacting to a rash of financial failures among stock brokers in 196970, proposed today a new rule that would require borkers to give their customers detailed statements of their financial condition.

title: U.S. PRESSES ISSUE OF PRISONER MAIL
description: PARIS, Dec. 2William J. Porter, the American delegate to the Vietnam peace talks, pressed North Vietnam again today to permit a normal flow of mail from American prisoners held there.

title: Big Financing Seen
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 2 (AP) Active secondary securities markets will be needed to help meet corporations money needs in the years ahead, an official of American Telephone and Telegraph told the Securities and exchange Commission today.

title: Diamonds Set the Pace at Party Given by Baron de Rothschild
description: PARIS, Dec. 2 (AP)Baron Guy de Rothschild of the banking family gave a fancydress party tonight and his chateau glittered with the bejeweled elite of the international society. The display was topped by Elizabeth Taylor, the actress, in diamonds worth an estimated sum of $3million.

title: PRICE RISE IN CORN FUTURES
description: With very active buying by grain exporters and commission houses, prices of corn futures rose on the Chicago Board of Trade yesterday. At the close, prices were up  cent to 1 cents a bushel, at about the highs of the day.

title: MINOT A. CROFOOT
description: FALMOUTH, Mass., Dec. 2Minot A. Crofoot, a past president of the American Wool Buyers Association, died yesterday in a nursing home here at the age of 84.

title: Court of Appeals To Hear Reporters On Persico Trial
description: The state's highest court agreed yesterday to hear, on the first day of its January term, the case of five local reporters who are seeking access to the trial of Carmine J. Persico.

title: Heavy Casualties Reported
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, Friday, Dec. 3 (AP)A 120man company of South Vietnamese militiamen suffered heavy casualties yesterday in a clash with North Vietnamese troops 48 miles northwest of Saigon, the South Vietnamese command reported today. It said that 24 troops had been killed and 15 had been wounded in the action near the headquarters for current South Vietnamese operations in eastern Cambodia. The command said the militia force killed 32 enemy soldiers.

title: Port Newark Is Sluggish In Aftermath of Walkout
description: PORT NEWARK, Dec. 2The piers herea 700acre swatch of windswept blacktop dotted with cargo sheds and warehousesare ordinarily the busiest in the harbor.

title: FORECASTS DIFFER AT REALTY TRUSTS
description: Differing forecasts of future earnings results were offered yesterday by two large real estate investment trusts.

title: 2 Sides Agree to End Teleprompter Fight
description: The factions in the battle for control of the Teleprompter Corporation reached an amicable settlement yesterday, thus ending the prospect of a bitter proxy fight.

title: Mrs. Gandhi Is Defiant
description: NEW DELHI, Dec. 2Prime Minister Indira Gandhi declared today that the socalled big nations could not give orders to Indians.

title: Books of The Times
description: FLANNERY O'CONNOR: THE COMPLETE STORIES. 555 pages. Farrar, Straus and Giroux. $10.

title: U. N. PAKISTAN AID FEARED NEAR HALT
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 2 Diplomatic informants here said today that the $100million effort of the United Nations re lief agency in East Pakistan is grinding to a halt and that the agency has abandoned 162 new trucks, bought with international relief funds, at Chittagong because of fighting in the area.

title: Department Store Sales Up
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 2The Department of Commerce reported today that department store sales for the latest week, ended Nov. 27, were an estimated $1,065,000,000, an increase of 20 per cent above the $890,000,000 sales for the corresponding week last year. Total retail store sales for the latest week were an estimated $8,374,000,000, an increase of 12 per cent above $7,483,000,000 sales for the same period last year.

title: Farber and Slayton Win
description: The Paris International Dance Festival, now in its ninth year, has awarded its Gold Star prize for Creativity and Expression to Viola Farber and Jeff Slayton of the Viola Farber Dance Company. The American group performed at the start of the festival last month.

title: MRS. MAX HIRTENSTEIN
description: Mrs. Tilda Schiffer Hirtenstein, past president of the sisterhood of the Jamaica Jewish Center and wife of Max Hirtenstein, a retired plastics manufacturer, died Wednesday in New York Hospital. She was 75 years old and lived at 8623 Midland Parkway, Jamaica Estates, Queens.

title: Advertising: Motives for a Short Hop East.
description: When Chalk, Nissen, Hanft, opens its doors Monday they will not be at 666 Fifth Avenue as they have been for three years but at 245 Park Avenue in office space owned by Clyne Maxon, Inc.

title: East Bloc Asks Step to Europe Parley
description: WARSAW, Dec. 2The Soviet bloc's military alliance called today for preliminary consultations of all interested partiet to establish the framework of a European security conference.

title: They Put Verona On Broadway Map
description: Joseph Papp, whose dream envisions shirtsleeved audiences filling theaters bereft of box offices, showed up in white tie and tails at the Broadway opening of Two Gentlemen of Verona Wednesday night.

title: Lindsay Arrives in Tokyo To Begin FourDay Visit
description: TOKYO, Dec. 2 (UPI)Mayor Lindsay of New York arrived here today for a fourday visit as the guest of Gov. Ryokichi Minobe of Tokyo.

title: Annual Income Asked
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 2 (UPI) Delegates to the White House Conference on Aging adopted today a resolution calling for a minimum annual income of $4,500 for each elderly couple, to be financed from general Treasury revenues and included in a single check from the Social Security Administration.

title: Bulls Take on Knicks to Play Basketball, Not Fight
description: CHICAGO, Dec. 2Last Saturday the Knicks played one of their finest games of the National Basketball Association season to edge the Chicago Bulls, 10099, in New York. The victory was an exhilarating one for the Knicks because it extended a winning streak to seven games and came against the team with the third best wonlost record in the league.

title: $50MILLION PLAN FOR JOBS SET UP
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 2 The Nixon Administration announced today an immediate $50million program to create public works jobs in communities with high unemployment.

title: McGovern Aide Here Studying Lindsay Scandal a Day Record
description: In the first direct attack on Mayor Lindsay's record as a Presidential campaign issue, high New York campaign aide of Senator George McGovern declared yesterday that the McGovern forces were scrutinizing the Mayor's City Hall performance and expected that it would be a national issue.

title: Commodity Price Index Off 0.2 From WeekAgo Level
description: The commodity spot market price index of foodstuffs and industrial material fell to 105.7 from 105.9 last week.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: Mrs. Smith to Enter Primary
description: AUGUSTA, Me., Dec. 2 (AP) Senator Margaret Chase Smith, Republican of Maine, has taken out nomination papers for the June primary election. There had been speculation that she would not seek reelection.

title: PROMARKET M.P.'S UPHELD BY LABOR
description: LONDON, Dec. 2Supporters of Britain's entry into the European Common Market held their own tonight as Labor party members of Parliament elected their leaders.

title: Credibility on Controls ...
description: The Price Commission and the Pay Board are both giving evidence this week of renewed determination keep abovelimit price and wage increases from wrecking the antiinflation program.

title: MANHATTAN BOWS TO RHODE ISLAND
description: It took Rhode Island 30 minutes of playing time last night to live up to its preseason ranking as one of the top teams in the East. But once the taller, stronger, talentladen Rams matched their offensive strength with their aggressive defense, they over powered Manhattan in the first game of the opening doubleheader of the Madison Square Garden college basketball season.

title: Mrs. John McCormack, 87, Dies; Wife of Former House Speaker
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 3 (AP) Mrs. Harriet Joyce McCormack, wife of former Speaker John W. McCormack, Democrat of Massachusetts, died today at Providence Hospital. She was 87 years old.

title: Putting On the Dog in More Ways Than One
description: There are times when Josephine Hughes wonders whether the whole thing is worth it.

title: CAMBODIA'S DRIVE COLLAPSES IN FACE OF ENEMY ATTACK
description: PNOMPENH, Cambodia, Dec. 2  Thousands of Cambodian Government troops were reported in disorderly retreat today as a major military campaign north of the capital collapsed in the face of heavy North Vietnamese attacks.

title: 2 PARTY OFFICIALS DIFFER ON ISSUES
description: The chairman of the Democratic Senatorial Campaign Committee said yesterday: that the economy would be the major issue of the Democratic party in the 1972 election.

title: Wood, Field and Stream Otters Can Be Nuisances to Hunters if Downed Fowl Land in Water
description: Hunters and fishermen are marvelously inventive when creating excuses for their failure to bring home fish or game, but one of the more remarkable tales in this genre, remarkable because it is true, came to me the other day from my brother,

title: Rehnquist Nomination Is Opposed by Brooke
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 2 (UPI)Senator Edward W. Brooke of Massachusetts today became the first Republican Senator to announce his opposition to the Supreme Court nomination of William H. Rehnquist.

title: New Zealand Soprano Scores in London Figaro
description: LONDON, Dec. 2A 24yearold soprano from New Zealand scored a triumph as the Countess last night in a new production of Mozart's Le Nozze di Figaro at the Royal Opera House.

title: Soviet Launches Satellite
description: MOSCOW, Dec. 2 (Reuters) The Soviet Union launched Intercosmos 5 today, the latest in the series of research satellites it is developing with its Eastern European allies. Tass, the Soviet press agency, said that the latest space effort was a joint SovietCzechoslovak venture. It will investigate radiation in nearearth space.

title: Astronauts Chapel Urged
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 2 (AP) Senators were asked today to approve legislation authorizing the National Aeronautics and Space Administration to sell land for a Chapel of the Astronauts at the John F. Kennedy Space Center in Florida. The House has passed a measure giving this authorization.

title: Bill's Impact on Individual
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 2The following tables show the income tax that would be paid for 1971 and 1972 by taxpayers at various annual income levels and with various family sizes under the tax bill as approved by a SenateHouse conference committee and, for comparative purposes, their taxes for 1970:

title: Chief Executive Officer Appointed by Texaco, Inc.
description: It took Augustus C. Long just about 15 months to develop himself and the board of Texaco, Inc.

title: American Concern, With U.S. Approval, Plans to Show Aerial Navigation Equipment in Peking in April
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 2An American company announced today that it had received Commerce Department approval to exhibit its aerial navigation equipment at Swedish trade fair in Peking next April.

title: The Screen
description: Prism is a resolutely humorless furrowed brow of a movie about Ben (Paul Geier), a young New York lawyer who devotes himself to helping draft resisters; Sally (Nancy Volkman), his wife, an editor with a weekly newspaper, and Eva (Dale Soules), his mistress, an actress with a radical theater troupe.

title: COUNTER STOCKS EXTEND ADVANCE
description: The overthecounter market outperformed the American Stock Exchange yesterday as most counter issues advanced while the exchange finished mixed.

title: City Center Formally Withdraws Its Beaumont Plan
description: The City Center yesterday formally withdrew its plan for the acquisition and remodeling of the Beaumont Theater at Lincoln Center for the Performing Arts and began intensive work on an alternative threepoint development program.

title: CONFEREES DROP VOTE FUND PLAN FOR '72 CAMPAIGN
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 2The Democratic plan for financing the 1972 Presidential campaign with Federal tax revenue was dropped today by a SenateHouse conference committee at the suggestion of Representative Wilbur D. Mills. However, the panel, in approving the tax bill, included the concept for later Presidential campaigns.

title: The Proceedings In the U.N. Today
Books of The Times
description: TWENTY SILVER GHOSTS: The PreWorld War I RollsRoyce. Paintings by Melbourne Brindle. Text by Phil May. Introduction by Julien Levy. 139 pages. McGrawHill. $39.50 until Dec. 31; $50 after.

title: DRAFT BOARDS TOLD TO HALT INDUCTIONS
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 2 (AP)  The Selective Service System has all but halted inductions throughout the nation this month because local boards have called up draftees faster than anticipated, a spokesman said today.

title: Divisiveness in Newark ...
description: The Newark Board of Education's decree that the black liberation flag be displayed in all schools and classrooms enrolling a majority of black students an unacceptable and intolerable intrusion of political symbolism into the educational system. Proposed by recently appointed 17yearold member of the board, the resolution can only do harm both to the cause youth and the cause of blacks. The sooner it is rescinded, the better for everyone, black and white alike.

title: STUDY FINDS RISK IN ASBESTOS LEVEL
description: Asbestos workers have been found to develop serious lung disease after two decades of breathing air containing asbestos fibers In amounts long considered safe.

title: MARTIN J. KING
description: MOUNTAINSIDE, N. J., Dec. 2Martin J. King, a broker in the Newark office of Halle & Steiglitz, Inc., member of the New York Stock Exchange, died yesterday in Roosevelt Hospital. He was 49 years old and lived at 1113 Sylvan Lane.

title: WASHINGTON
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 2It is now just thirty years since the Japanese attack on Pearl Harbor, and Washington and Tokyo are fussing at each other again over money and trade; but the present squabbles should not be exaggerated. Looking back over this first postwar generation, both countries have behaved very well and have established a relationship which should contribute to the peace and wellbeing of the world in the last thirty years of the century.

title: F.D.A. IS SEEKING WIDER LABEL LAW
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 2The Food and Drug Administration disclosed today that it would seek legislation to require that labels on all food products list all of those products ingredients.

title: President Seeks to Ease School Tax on Property
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 2 President Nixon pledged today to seek reform of school financing in America to reduce the tax burden on property owners, especially the elderly.

title: For an Imaginative Adventurer, 11, New York Still Is Fun City
description: Michael Edmonds, who is 11 years old, has rescued a runaway spider monkey from the upper branches of a maple tree in Riverside Park.

title: Stans Seeks a Rise in U.S.Polish Trade
description: WARSAW, Dec. 2Secretary of Commerce Maurice H. Stans said today that the United States had set its sights on a substantial increase in trade with Poland.

title: Bronx Gang Leader Is Slain Trying to Arrange Peace
description: A 25yearold street gang leader who was trying to mediate between warring street gangs was beaten and stabbed to death yesterday outside southeastern Bronx junior high school.

title: 2 Policemen Accused of Freeing 2 Suspects for $200
description: Two Queens policemen were arrested yesterday on charges of taking $200 to release two burglary suspects.

title: SCHOOL TRUSTEE SUES OVER FLAG
description: NEWARK, Dec. 2  The City Board of Education was ordered today to show cause why it should not rescind its resolution ordering blackliberation flags to be hung in all public schools and classrooms where black students are in the majority.

title: Baseball Trades
description: Fortyfour major league baseball players have been traded in the last four days. The Los Angeles Dodgers acquired Frank Robinson from the Baltimore Orioles and traded Rich Allen to the Chicago White Sox. The Yankees sent Stan Bahnsen to the White Sox Details on Page 51.

title: Raises Proposed for Royal Family
description: Notes on People

title: ALLAN ROOD, AN AIDE AT HARVARD, WAS 77
description: LINCOLN, Mass., Dec. 2Allan Rood, retired director of placement of the Harvard Graduate School of Business Administration, died yesterday. His age was 77.

title: Curious Case of the Exiled Umpires
description: Three years after Joe Cronin discharged him by telephone (he thought the American League's president was calling to invite him to umpire the 1968 World Series), Salerno is working again, operating a small restaurant Herkimer, N. Y. He says that Bill Valentine, who was let go the same day in the same way, has some sort of job with the Republican Party in Little Rock, Ark., his home.

title: DISPUTED CHECK: A pay check that was given to a striking Catholic school teacher
description: The lay teachers union that is on strike against New York's Roman Catholic schools announced yesterday that it had filed a complaint with the State Department of Labor charging the Association of Catholic Schools with willfully and illegally failing to pay proper wages for days actually worked prior to the strike.

title: U.S. Combat Toll for Week Put at 9 Killed, 78 Wounded
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, Dec. 2 (UPI)  The United States command reported today that nine Americans were, killed and 78 wounded in combat in Indochina last week.

title: Sabres Down Kings, 20
description: BUFFALO, Dec. 2 (UPI)Gerry Meehan ended a long scoring drought with a firstperiod goal and Roger Crozier registered his first shutout of the season tonight as the Buffalo Sabres ended a 10game nonwinning string by defeating the Los Angeles Kings, 20.

title: FINANCE SESSION IN ALBANY NEARS
description: Indicating impatience with the leaders of the Legislature, including those of his own party, Governor Rockefeller said yesterday that he had no alternative to calling a special session of the Legislature this month on the state's fiscal crisis.

title: Big Board Proposes Rules For Members Subsidiaries
description: The board of governors of the New York Stock Exchange yesterday proposed rules changes designed to permit one or more member firms to own a subsidiary corporation.

title: Rain Postpones Trial Runs For 500Mile Texas Race
description: COLLEGE STATION, Tex., Dec. 2 (AP)Rain washed out the first round of qualifying for the Texas 500mile stock car race today, leaving Jackie Oliver of England in a state of nervous exhaustion.

title: Bridge: Italians Increase Their Lead Over the British to 23 Points
description: ATHENS, Dec. 2Italy increased her lead over Britain here in the two rounds of the European championships last night and this afternoon, and the lastround clash on Saturday between these two strong teams may prove to be an anticlimax.

title: Fleeing Troops Beg Rides
description: SKOUN, Cambodia, Dec. (Reuters)A long line of bedraggled soldiers in retreat today marked the crumbling of the Cambodian Government's biggest military campaign of the year.

title: I. GEORGE WESTON
description: LONG BRANCH, N. J., Dec. 2I. George Weston, founder and past president of the stock brokerage firm of I. George Weston & Sons, Inc., died yesterday at Monmouth Medical Center. His age was 73.

title: Judge Upholds Klansman
description: CHARLOTTE, N. C., Dec. 2 (UPI)Judge James B. McMillan ruled today in United States. District Court that the city of Charlotte had violated the constitutional rights of the Grand Dragon of the North Carolina Knights of the Ku Klux Klan when he was dismissed because of his klan affiliation. He gave the city until Dec. 9 to settle the issue with attorneys for Harold Murray, who was ousted from his city job as a clerk.

title: Leinsdorf Conducts a Concert Of Schumann and Prokofiev
description: Erich Leinsdorf is largely occupied these days conducting Tristan and Isolde at the Metropolitan Opera. Perhaps that is why the program in which he led the Boston Symphony Orchestra in Philharmonic Hall Wednesday night was relatively brief and unchallenging. It included Schumann's Symphony No. 2 and excerpts from Prokofiev's Romeo and Juliet ballet music.

title: Davis and Elkins Advances
description: DUNN, N. C., Dec. 2 (AP)Davis and Elkins of West Virginia advanced to the final of the National Association of Intercollegiate Athletics soccer championship tonight with 20 victory over Ottawa (Kan.) University. Quincy of Illinois also reached the final.

title: French Women Downhill Skiers Favored in Cup Opener Today
description: ST. MORITZ, Switzerland Dec. 2Avery Brundage and his threats of Olympic expulsion will all but be forgotten tomorrow when the 197172 skiing season begins here with a women's 1 1/2mile downhill race to a finish line above the clouds.

title: Dance: Bejart's Symphonie Pour un Hornme Seul
description: The final new work of the brief season given by Maurice Bejart's Ballet of the 20th Century at the New York City Center, while new to New York was, in fact, the work that first won him some measure of international reputation. It is Sym phonie Pour un Homme Seul, and it had its pre miere on Tuesday night and was repeated, with a different cast, on Wediletday afternoon.

title: Rebel Bombings in Dacca
description: DACCA, Pakistan, Dec. 2 (UPI)Rebel Bengalis exploded four bombs here yesterday, injuring three persons and causing considerable property dam, age, the police reported.

title: Executive Changes
description: The Thomas & Betts Corporation announced yesterday the election of J. David Parkinson as executive vice president. Formerly corporate vice president, Mr. Parkinson will continue in his present capacity as president of the Thomas & Betts Company, the company's major operating division and as head of two subsidiaries, Thomas & Betts International, Inc., and Westline Products.

title: Suspension of Policeman Sought In Slaying of Black Youth on L.I.
description: MINEOLA, L. I., Dec. 2More than 200 protesters demanded yesterday the suspension of a Nassau County policeman who shot and killed a 16yearold black Freeport youth last week after chasing a stolen automobile in which the youth was riding.

title: G. M. Aide Urges Understanding on Profits
description: A top executive of the General Motors Corporation urged fellow business leaders here yesterday to work for greater public Understanding of the profit system before hostility and indifference lead the Government to further limit free. dom of enterprise.

title: Ferre Nephew Found Dead
description: PONCE, P. R., Dec. 2 (AP)Antonio Herman Feud, son of a millionaire industrialist and a nephew of Gov. Luis A. Terre, was found dead today. The district attorney's office said preliminary inquiry indicated he had shot himself. A pistol was at his side. Mr. Peril was 32 years old and the father of five children.

title: DILL SHOOTS A 65 FOR STROKE LEAD
description: ORLANDO, Fla., Dec. 2 Terry Dill, who made Muleshoe, Tex., a household word among golfers when he joined the pro ranks a decade ago, led the Walt Disney world open today with a 65.

title: CITY LOAN CHECK REPORTED BALKED
description: The counsel for the Municipal Loan Program warned two and a half years ago that mortgages for which the city was giving money to loan applicants should be more carefully checked, but he was overruled by his superiors, a City Council committee was told yesterday.

title: RACE BIAS SEEN IN FOREST HILLS
description: The six Queens chapters of the National Association for the Advancement of Colored People declared yesterday that community opposition to a lowincome housing project in Forest Hills was based upon race prejudice.

title: French Priest's Hunger Strike Seeks Care for Drug Addicts
description: MARSEILLES, France, Dec. 2A priest and four young followers, occupying the most centrally situated church in this hub of the narcotics traffic, are holding a hunger strike to protest against what they view as the hypocritical, cruel and negligent attitude of the French Government toward growing drug addiction among French youth.

title: Butz Confirmed as Farm Chief, 51 to 44
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 2The Senate confirmed Dr. Earl L. Butz as Secretary of Agriculture today, 51 to 44.

title: Cowboys Defense Offers a Challenge To Jets Tomorrow
description: The Dallas Cowboys, hoping for another chance in the Super Bowl, could come a cropper in Texas Stadium tomorrow afternoon against the New York Jets.

title: Money Supply Unchanged;
description: Monetary expansion in the United States has for all practical purposes ground to a halt since July, the Federal Reserve System reported yesterday.

title: FORMAT IS SHIFTED BY TBONE WALKER
description: TBone Walker has spent so many years as an itinerant blues man, picking his guitar and singing the bluesmost notably Stormy Monday Blues that it is startling to find him in new setting at the Village Vanguard. Mr. Walker, now 61, has surrounded himself with a superb fourpiece blues band in which he plays piano rather than guitar.

title: Housing Proposal Fought in Brooklyn
description: Two residential Brooklyn communities of $60,000to$100,000 homes are going to court in hopes of blocking construction of a 904unit middleand low  income apartment complex in their midst.

title: Leaders of the House Rebuffed As Subway Funds Are Restored
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 2Two liberal mavericks on the House Appropriations Committee Representatives Robert N. Giaimo and Silvio O. Contesuccessfully challenged the patriarchs of the House today by winning unexpected approval of funds for a subway in the District of Columbia.

title: 15,000 Dimes Spill In Downtown Street; Net Loss: 10 Cents
description: The patrons of the Paris Bar and Grill on South Street, just north of the Fulton Fish Market, talked about the Armored Car Caper yesterday, which is what they're calling it in the Paris.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: Facts on J.F.K.'s Death

title: DR.D. M. CARMICHAEL, A HOSPITAL OFFICIAL
description: PEARL RIVER, N. Y., Dec. 2 Dr. Donald M. Carmichael, the first director of the State Mental Hygiene Department's aftercare clinics in New York City serving discharged patients from mental hospitals throughout southeastern New York, died yesterday. He was 69 years old.

title: Raise the Gold Price? Impact Would Be Faint
description: If the United States were to devalue the dollar formally through an increase in the official $35anounce price of gold, it would be a largely political gesture, with little or no practical impact.

title: BRAVES CONQUER BULLETS, 109105
description: TORONTO, Dec. 2 (AP)The Buffalo Braves rallied in the fourth quarter on the shooting of Elmore Smith to upset the Baltimore Bullets, 109105, in a National Basketball Association game tonight.

title: DUDLEY CARROLL SR., ECONOMICS DEAN, 86
description: WEST CHESTER, Pa., Dec. 2 Dudley D. Carroll Sr., founder and for 32 years dean of the School of Business Administration of the University of North Carolina, died Tuesday in the Chester County Hospital. He was 86 years old.

title: Violations Bureau Berated at Hearing
description: The city's Parking Violations Bureau, which has handled almost as many summonses as there are New Yorkers in its short life span, was described yesterday at a legislative hearing as irksome at best and unconstitutional at worst.

title: Dollar Declines in Trading Amid Talk of Devaluation
