description: PARIS, Dec. 2The dollar fell today to new lows in trading in Europe and Japan following the monetary meeting in Rome at which the United States said it might consider a formal devaluation for the first time since 1934.

title: One More Chance in Uruguay
description: In a record turnout, Uruguay's voters demonstrated emphatically that they have not given up on the country's democratic system and greatly prefer the two traditional parties to a leftist coalition similar to the one now governing Chile. The Frente Amplio (Broad Front), embracing Communists, Socialists, radical Catholics and others, made a respectable showing; but even in Montevideo, where it had hoped to elect a mayor, the Front trailed the governing Colorado party by 50,000 votes.

title: MARGARET CUMMINGS
description: ELIZABETH, N. J., Dec. 2Margaret S. Cummings, head mistress of VailDeane School here from 1942 through 1958, when it had an allgirl enrollment, died Tuesday in Milford Hospital, Milford, Mass. She was 75 years old.

title: Patronage as an Issue
description: News Analysis

title: LELAND M. FEIGEL OF CREDITHRIFT
description: Leland M. Feigel, chairman and chief executive officer of the Credithrift Financial Corporation of Evansville, Ind., died Wednesday in the BeekmanDowntown Hospital, ap parently of a heart attack. He was 61 years old.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: Ending Free Rides

title: An Arab State Is Born Amid Persian Gulf Unrest
description: BEIRUT, Lebanon, Dec. 2A new Arab state has been born, bringing to 18 the number of independent Arab countries.

title: Prosperity Comes to Urban Brazil, and With It Ecological Woes
description: SAO PAULO, Brazil  A wave of prosperity, building for five years, has broken over the cities of Brazil, flooding them with new cars and bringing them new pastimes and a new consumer's way of life modeled directly on the American way.

title: Candles That Look. Like Everything But Candles
description: Shop Talk

title: Early Gain, but No Boom, Seen for Capital Outlays
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 2United States business plans a fairly large increase in investment in plant and equipment in the fourth quarter of the current year and the first half of next year, over the levels that prevailed up to September, the Commerce Department and the Securities and Exchange Commission reported today.

title: Stars Beat Floridians
description: MIAMI BEACH, Dec. 2 (AP) Zelmo Beaty scored 29 points and sparked the Utah Stars to a 9893 victory over the Floridians tonight for their eighth victory in a row.

title: Coal Mine Explosion Kills 40 on Taiwan
description: TAIPEI, Taiwan, Dec. 2 (Reuters)  Rescue workers dug out 41 bodies today after an explosion in a coal mine near Keelung, in northern Taiwan.

title: 6 BREAK INTO PRISON AND KIDNAP CONVICT
description: CRESTVIEW, Fla., Dec. 2, (UPI)Six masked men with shotguns broke into a prison camp, overpowered its guards and dragged away a 37yearold convict today.

title: Vietcong Announces Truces for 3 Holidays
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, Friday, Dec. 3 (AP)The Vietcong's Liberation Radio announced today that Viet, cong troops in South Vietnam would observe ceasefires for the Christmas and New Year's holidays and also for the Tet lunar new year in February.

title: RUSSIANS TESTING MISSILE FOR SUBS
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 2Pentagon analysts say the Soviet Union appears to be nearing the successful conclusion of tests of a new longrange submarine missile and may deploy the weapon next year.

title: No Comment in Geneva
description: GENEVA, Dec. 2An I.O.S. spokesman here declined tonight to comment on the Federal suit. He said the headquarters here had not yet been in touch with the company's lawyers in the United States.

title: Skirmishes in East Cambodia
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, Dec. 2 (PI)  Only minor skirmishes were reported today in the 11dayold South Vietnamese sweep through the rubber plantation country of Eastern Cambodia.

title: MRS. MEIR MEETS WITH PRESIDENT
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 2Premier Golda Meir of Israel conferred privately with President Nixon for two hours today in an effort to reconcile the differences between their Governments.

title: 1,752 Out of 2,321 Applicants Pass Examination for Admission to State Bar
TouristBeset Kennedy Center Asks Aid
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 2Congress was asked today for an emergency $1.5million to keep the John F. Kennedy Center for the Performing Arts open to growing crowds of tourists while curtailing their increasing vandalism.

title: Tito Rebukes Croatian Leaders On Chauvinist Student Strike
description: VIENNA, Dec. 2  President Tito of Yugoslavia has harshly rebuked Croatian regional leaders for not having prevented a student strike in Zagreb, Croatia's capital.

title: Connally Tells of Talks
description: ANDREWS AIR FORCE BASE, Md., Dec. 2Secretary Connally said tonight that the United States had been quite forthcoming in its stand at this week's monetary negotiations in Rome and had retreated from its original position in the interest of reaching agreement.

title: RED WINGS TIED BY FLYERS I TO I
description: PHILADELPHIA, Dec. 2 (AP) Bobby Clarke's fifth goal of the season at 11:23 of the second period earned the Philadelphia Flyers a 11 tie with the Detroit Red Wings before 13,214 fans tonight in a National Hockey League game.

title: Public Broadcasting Salaries Listed for Critics in Congress
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 2The Governmentfunded Corporation for Public Broadcasting gave its Congressional critics today a detailed accounting of executive salaries and talent fees. Though a few star salaries including newsman Sander Vanocur's $85,000approached commercial television's range, the corporation said its pay scales are modeled mainly on those in the Federal bureaucracy.

title: Restaurant Off to a Good Start
description: Restaurants reviewed on this page on Friday are rated both for their food (four stars to none) and for their atmosphere, service and decor (four triangles to none).

title: Sale of Lines Urged
description: TORONTO, Dec. 2 (UPI) Bankrupt Eastern United States railroads, including the Penn Central, cannot survive without taking some drastic action such as selling unprofitable lines segment by segment to high bidders among connector lines, a top rail executive said today.

title: Aurelio Spurns Challenge From Troy to Disclose Finances of Lindsay Clubs
description: Deputy Mayor Richard R. Aurelio rejected a challenge yesterday from Councilman Matthew J. Troy Jr., Queens Democratic leader, to hold a joint news conference Tuesday to make public the finances of the John V. Lindsay Associations and the Queens Democratic Committee.

title: House Unit Backs Economic Extension
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 2The House Banking and Currency Committee, after a few mild compromises with Administration forces, finished work today on legislation to extend economic controls through April 30, 1973.

title: 25 Arrested in Carolina
description: GREENVILLE, N. C., Dec. 2 (UPI)The police arrested 25 more black protesters today, thwarting the fourth attempt in as many days to march to Raleigh. The arrests, for parading without a permit, brought to 143 the number of charges filed since Monday. The march, to protest the slaying of a black farm worker by a state highway patrolman, has turned into a test of the city's parade ordinance.

title: Bus Drivers Vote To Continue Strike In Nassau County
description: Drivers for the Bee Line bus system voted yesterday to continue their wildcat strike in support of a suspended bus driver and union official, foreing 20,000 Nassau County residents to use cars or the Long Island Rail Road for a second day.

title: U.S. Bids Contractors End Sex Discrimination
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 2 (AP).Secretary of Labor James D. Hodgson issued an order today calling on Federal contractors and subcontractors to. take affirmative action to eliminate sex discrimination against the working woman.

title: India's Maharajas Face Loss of Princely Status
description: NEW DELHI, Dec. 2 (AP) The lower house of the Indian Parliament approved a constitutional amendment today to reduce maharajas to commoners by abolishing their $6.4million in annual privy purses and many other princely privileges.

title: MEETING BY PENNSY BARRED BY COURT
description: PHILADELPHIA, Dec. 3 (AP) A Federal judge barred the Penn Central Company today from holding its, stockholder's meeting and vote on a refinancing plan that management says is the only way, to avoid bankruptcy.

title: Prison Is a Real Education
description: Last week, I was continually asked how Rahway State Prison in New Jersey compared with Attica. Since have been meeting with inmates in Rahway for over three years as friend and teacher and was a member of the Attica observers committee, it seemed that a comparison must be offered.

title: P. Burdette Lewis Dies at 69; Personnel Aide at du Pont
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 2  P. Burdette Lewis, retired personnel manager of E. I. du Pont de Nemours & Co. in Wilmington, Del., died here yesterday of a heart attack at his home. He was 69 years old.

title: Apples and Cream Cheese Are Baked in a Pie
description: In the menus below, the dishes marked with an aserisk are followed by recipe.

title: CORNFELD IS SUED BY U.S. OVER GOLD
description: The Federal Government filed a lawsuit yesterday seeking almost $75million from Investors Overseas Services, Ltd., and its former head, Bernard Cornfeld, on a complaint that they had illegally speculated in gold.

title: ... a OneYear Extension ...
description: The overwhelming decision of the Senate to extend for one year, to April 30, 1973, the Administration's authority to control the economy represents a victory for national necessity over the temptation to play partisan politics with the stabilization effort.

title: Coach Takes a Leave
description: CALDWELL, Idaho, Dec. (AP)The College of Idaho's head football coach, Ed Bonaminio, was granted a leave of absence today. He will be succeeded by his assistant, Rod Sears.

title: Body of Adonis Arrives At Kennedy From Italy
description: The body of Joe Adonis, the former East Coast underworld gambling king who died in exile, arrived yesterday at Kennedy International Airport.

title: C. F. HUTCHINSON, U.S. TEATASTER
description: Charles F. Hutchinson, who retired in 1953 after some 40 years as a government teataster, died yesterday in Ellis Hospital, Schenectady, N. Y. He was 86 years old and had been living for the last three years with his daughter, Mrs. Bruce Grassfield, in a Schenectady suburb.

title: HairStyle Case Is Won By Volunteer Fireman
description: MINEOLA, L.I., Dec. 2The constitutional right of a public employe to determine the length of his hair, sideburns, mustache and beard was upheld in State Supreme Court here today.

title: FOREIGN AFFAIRS
description: OSLO, NorwayIn this time of great diplomatic bargaining, shifting power patterns and kaleidoscopic changes on the international scene, the only region where one can reckon there will be no fundamental transformation is Eastern Europe.

title: B.P. REPORTS GAIN OF 74% IN PROFITS
description: The British Petroleum Company, Ltd., realized a 74 per cent increase in thirdquarter earnings on a sales gain of 26.7 per cent, the report from London headquarters disclosed yesterday. The results for the nine months ended with September showed earnings up 108.5 per cent and sales 30.3 per cent ahead of last year's figures.

title: White Sox Add Bahnsen, Ship McKinney to Yanks
description: PHOENIX, Ariz., Dec. 2Two of the most renowned hitters in baseball were traded todayFrank Robinson by the Baltimore Orioles to the Los Angeles Dodgers and Rich

title: SUGAR ADS HELD FALSE BY F. T. O.
description: WASHINGTON. Dec. 2 The Federal Trade Commission accused the sugar industry today of falsely advertising that eating sweets before meals helps people to reduce.

title: Price Group Seeks To Stiffen Pay Unit Against Big Raises
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 2  The Price Commission has decided to push the Pay Board into taking more decisive antiinflationary action by refusing to allow high wage increases to be passed along in the form of higher prices.

title: KNAPP HURLS BACK SLUR ON HEARINGS
description: The chairman of the Knapp Commission, still angry over a charge by the New York Civil Liberties Union last October that the commission hearings into police corruption were form of McCarthyism, accused the union yesterday of practicing McCarthyism, itself.

title: Midland, Mich., Wants Nuclear Plant
description: DETROIT, Dec. 2Who would want a power plant in his community, particularly one with nuclear power?

title: Investment Bankers Set To Join New Association
description: BOCA RATON, Fla., Dec. 2The Securities Industry Assosociation moved past its final organizational hurdle this week as the Investment Bankers Association, in a vote announced today, decided overwhelmingly to dissolve itself and become part of the new group.

title: QUOTA ON 2 DRUGS CUTS OUTPUT 40%
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 2The Federal Government proposed 1972 production quotas today for Amphetamine and methamphetamine drugs about 40 per cent below this year's estimated domestic production.

title: ... and Fairness on Federal Pay
description: Ma nearly unanimous vote in the Senate to give Federal employes a 5.5 per cent wage increase Jan. 1 is warranted acknowledgment of the injustice inflicted on them by the earlier decision of President Nixon and Congress to withhold for six months higher pay due under a law that ties Federal salary scales to those for comparable workers in private industry.

title: Pollution in Italy Puts Mayor in ail for Day
description: CIVITAVECCHIA, Italy, Dec 2This old and somewhat scruffy port city has been shaken by an environmental scandal that landed the Mayor in prison for 30 hours, pitted the administration against the courts and exposed what many saw as bureaucratic indifference to publichealth emergencies.

title: TWO PROVE SKILLS IN SONATA RECITAL
description: A substantial program of sonatas for violin and piano was offered by Leon Temerson and Artur Balsam at Carnegie Recital Hall on Wednesday night. The performances of the two veteran performers had the kind of musical authority that comes from decades of concerned involvement with musicmaking of high quality.

title: Robert W. Schiff is Dead at 85; His Shoe Firm Had 1,000 Stores
description: COLUMBUS, Ohio, Dec. 2Robert W. Schiff, who retired in 1968 as chairman of SCOA Industries, shoe retailers and manufacturers, died yesterday. He was 85 years old.

title: Order to Babcock & Wilcox
description: The Babcock & Wilcox Company reported yesterday receipt of a $15million contract to design and build a power generation system for the Canal Electric Company and the Montaup Electric Company on Cape Cod, Mass. The 560,000 kilowatt plant will be owned jointly and is scheduled to begin operations in July, 1975, at Canal Electric's Canal II station at Sandwich, Mass. It will burn lowsulphur oil.

title: POLICEMAN IS FOUND GUILTY OF PERJURY
description: A New York policeman was found guilty of perjury last night on charges that he had lied to a Bronx grand jury about a series of meetings with Bronx gamblers to determine how much they should pay for protection from arrest.

title: Temple Quintet 7046 Victor
description: PHILADELPHIA, Dec. 2 (AP) Ollie Johnson scored 19 points and grabbed 10 rebounds tonight to lead Temple to a 7046 victory over West Chester State.

title: Merger News
description: The Beecham Group, Ltd., made yesterday one of the biggest British takeover bids in years by offering to acquire the Glaxo Group, Ltd., for stock valued at approximately $737 million.

title: Patrolman in Car Accident Charged With Drunkenness
description: A 32yearold patrolman was arrested as a drunken driver after he allegedly struck a pedestrian and then attempted to leave the scene, the police said yesterday. Several hours after the accident, he was suspended from the force.

title: Brass Strike Is Settled
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 2 (AP) The Federal Mediation and Conciliation Service announced today settlement of a strike affecting 4,500 workers at seven plants of the Anaconda American Brass Company.

title: Summary of Key Provisions of Tax Bill Agreed to by Congressional Conferees
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 2Following is a summary of the major provisions of the tax bill, which was approved in its final version by a SenateHouse conference committee today.

title: JOEL KAPLAN
description: Joel Kaplan, president of Leland Advertising, Inc., of which he was cofounder in 1962, died on Monday in the Florence Nightingale Nursing Home. He was 65 years old and lived at 1161 York Avenue.

title: ...Segregation in Boston
description: Controversy has become a way of life for the Boston public schools. Their neglected facilities and obsolete pedagogical practices have long been under fire from educational reformers.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: LowIncome Housing

title: 139707 Wins in Jersey
description: WOODBRIDGE, N. J., Dec. 2 (UPI)The winning number in this week's New Jersey lottery is 139707. Also chosen today was number 759 to enable those holding the correct two final digits during the last five weeks and holding 759 today to reach the finals of the millionaire lottery, to be held soon.

title: Muskie Gain Made In New Hampshire
description: MANCHESTER, N. H., Dec. 2  Senator Edmund S. Muskie of Maine has moved into a commanding lead in New Hampshire over his rivals for the Democratic Presidential nominationa lead that grew wider today with the withdrawal of Senator Henry M. Jackson of Washington from the primary here.

title: Roy T. Spraggins Dies, 61; Aide of Surrogate's, Court
description: Roy T. Spraggins, the first black law assistant in the Surrogate's Court of New York, died Wednesday apparently of a heart attack, while visiting friends. He was 64 years old and lived at 148 West 131st Street.

title: World Psychiatrists Bar Condemnation of Soviet
description: MEXICO CITY, Dec. 2Despite an undercurrent of pressure from physicians and medical associations in various nations, the World Psychiatric Association has apparently decided that it cannot issue a statement condemning the use of psychiatry as a tool for political repression.

title: Market Place : Gleam of Hope   In the Gloom
description: You talk to the average small businessman and he may tell you that the nation is still in the throes of major recessionwith a possible depression on the way.

title: BILL WOULD LET U.S. VETO MERGER PLANS
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 2 (AP) A major new antitrust law that would require advance approval by the Federal Government of corporate mergers and acquisitions was proposed today by Representative Emanuel Celler, Democrat of New York.

title: Nonunion Status Sought for Principals
description: The Board of Education has asked the State Public Employment Relations Board to classify the city's 900 school principals as managerial employes, thereby exempting them from collective bargaining.

title: Tanzania Airport Opens
description: ARUSHA, Tanzania, Dec. 2 (Agence FrancePresse)President Julius K. Nyerere today opened Kilmanjaro International Airport, built at a cost of $13million. The airport, whose construction was financed through a longterm Italian Government loan, is midway between Arusha and Moshi, in northeastern Tanzania, 300 miles from Dar es Salaam.

title: 3 Tons of Marijuana Seized in Queens
description: Federal agents announced yesterday the seizure of three tons of marijuana at a Long Island City, Queens, warehouse and the arrest of three young men described as the wholesale distributors.

title: Noroton Catholic School To Close Its Doors in June
description: NOROTON, Conn., Dec. 2The Noroton School, a socially prestigious Roman Catholic secondary boarding and day school for girls operated by the Society of the Sacred Heart in Noroton, Conn., will close its doors in June, 1972.

title: Front Page 1  No Title
description: OPEN LETTER TO MRS. GOLDA MEIR. Prime Minister of Israel, page 10. Advt.

title: Welfare Recipient Dies, Leaving $5,764 in Flat
description: A 75yearold welfare recipient who lived alone and kept to himself was found dead of apparently natural causes yesterday in his $38amonth, tworoom tenement apartment in East Harlem. In the flat, the police found the man's uncashed $68 welfare check for Novemberand $5,764 in cash.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: A Profound Dilemma

title: Girl, 12, Hit by Filing Cabinet While Leaving School Here
description: A 12yearold student at Joan of Arc Junior High School was struck on the head by a filing cabinet that was dropped from the sixth floor yesterday afternoon and was admitted to St. Luke's Hospital in serious condition.

title: CHILEAN INCIDENT CLOSED, U.S. SAYS
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 2The State Department said today that it considered as closed an incident with Chile over the public remark by a White House aide that he had obtained the feeling on a LatinAmerican tour that the Socialist regime of President Salvador Allende Gossens would not last long.

title: Firemen Reported Nearing Agreement on Contract
description: Negotiators for the firemen and the city continued their extended bargaining talks yesterday amid reports that they were making progress toward a settlement.

title: RAIL TONMILEAGE OFF FROM 70 LEVEL
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 2Freight traffic on United States railroads in the week ended Nov. 27 was below the volume in the corresponding 1970 week. Intercity truck tonnage in the same period registered an increase.

title: The Lin Piao Mystery
description: HONG KONGAll Chinawatchers have noted recent signs of shifts and changes and particularly the nonappearance of such prominent personages as Vice Chairman Lin Piao, Chief of Staff Huang Yungsheng and other top army men.

title: Forecaster Says 12Inch Snow Is Due to Fall Here Tomorrow
description: ??el Myers. ??e skiminded meteorologist at Penn State University, predicted yesterday that a sizable snowstorm would hit the metropolitan New York area starting at dawn tomorrow. He said the chances of it materializing were about 90 per cent.

title: U. S. Pilots Report First Attack by North Vietnamese MIG on a B52
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, Dec. 2American pilots here said today that a North Vietnamese MIG fighter fired airtoair missiles at an American Air Force B52 bomber over the Ho Chi Minh Trail network in Laos about 10 days ago, but missed and was chased back into North Vietnam.

title: City Says G.O.P.Broke Accord on Fare
description: City officials and local Democratic members of the State Legislature charged yesterday that Governor Rockefeller and the Republican legislative leadership had gone back on their word to support a transitfare package agreed on here.

title: McNeil Eager to Face Giants, and Vice Versa
description: The Now York Times/Patrick A. Burns

title: Big Retail Chains Report Gain in November Sales
description: Several of the country's largest retail chains reported yesterday substantial gains in sales for November, lending additional weight to the expectations for a strong Christmas selling season.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: Middle East Policies and Commitments

title: He Dies Waving to Rescuer
description: SYDNEY, Australia, Dec. 2 (Reuters)  Alan Enver, a 50yearold hiker, survived a sixday ordeal in New South Wales where he and his wife were lost on a snowcovered mountain, only to die today when he fell into a ravine as he waved to a rescue helicopter. His wife, Maibritt, 42, was rescued.

title: Slides Show 2 Sides of a Big City
description: Advertising:

title: E. B. WHITE RECEIVES BOOK GROUP'S MEDAL
description: E. B. White, author, essayist and a longtime pillar of The New Yorker magazine, received yesterday the National Book Committee's bronze Medal for Literature and $5,000 at its annual meeting at the Library and Museum of the Performing Arts at Lincoln Center.

title: Rumania: Where Thinking Is a Crime
description: PARISAfter World War II, most Rumanian intellectuals of the older generation suffered from a guilt complex which the, Government twisted to its advantage. In fact, very few writers were Communists or even leftists before the war; those who had been were quickly disillusioned by the flagrant discrepancies between Marxist theory and Stalinist application. These oldguard writers, frightened and disoriented, constantly menaced because of their political past, were easily subjugated by the apparatchiki. Those who attempted to resist were put in prison, where a number of them have disappeared.

title: Hiltzek Takes Skate Lead After Compulsory Figures
description: COMMACK, L. I., Dec. 2 Dean, Hiltzek, an 18yearold sophomore at Columbia, took the lead in the senior men's competition as the North Atlantic figure skating championships started today at the Long Island Arena.

title: British Reserves Reach Highest Level Since War
description: LONDON, Dec. 2 (AP) British reserves of gold and foreign currency jumped by $377.3million in November to their highest level since World War II, the Treasury announced today.

title: Senate RollCall on Post for Butz
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 2 (AP) Following is the rollcall vote by which the Senate confirmed today the nomination of Earl L. Butz as Secretary of Agriculture.

title: All Areas of Racing Urged to Join Forces for Survival.
description: Members of the Thoroughbred Racing Association listened to three major speeches here yesterday and heard what amounted to a collective repetition of that Revolutionary War motto: United we stand, divided we fall.

title: ALLENDE DECREES EMERGENCY RULE AS RIOTS CONTINUE
description: SANTIAGO, Chile, Dec. 2The army assumed control of public order today in this capital after more than 150 persons had been injured in violence set off by a women's protest march against the Government.

title: COPPER CONCERNS APPEAL IN CHILE
description: SANTIAGO, Chile, Dec. 2The two big United States copper companies whose Major properties were nationalized without compensation in July have started an appeals process in a special Chilean court against the Government's decision.

title: A Navy Jet Crashes Into Atlantic Off Norfolk
description: NORFOLK, Va., Dec. 2 (UPI)A Navy pilot apparently blacked out at the controls of his jet today and the plane streaked across the southeastern United States, from Mobile, Ala., to Virginia, before crashing in the Atlantic Ocean 250 miles off Norfolk.

title: Nixon Nominates 4 for Judgeships, 2 of Them in State
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 2President Nixon today nominated four persons to be Federal District Court judges, two of them in New York.

title: PANEL ASSAILS POLICY ON SOUTHERN AFRICA
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 2 (Reuters)  The Government was urged by a panel of distinguished citizens today to give nonmilitary support to black liberation movements in southern Africa and to tighten economic pressure on whiteminority regimes for social change.

title: City to Try Out a Program To Aid District Services
description: New Yorkers in four pilot neighborhoods will soon be able to take complaints about garbage pickups, park cleanups, police protection and social services to a new city government authority in their community, under a decentralization plan close to being completed by the Lindsay administration.

title: TV: Love Was Link for Tuesday and Wednesday
description: A.B.C.'s Brian's Song Traces a Friendship

title: Vermonter Eyes Race
description: MONTPELIER, Vt., Dec. 2 (AP)Charles R. Ross, a former member of the Federal Power Commission, said today that he might run for Governor next year. The Hinesburg Republican made the comment, at a news conference during which he outlined details for a January conference on electrical energy.

title: PRESIDENT GIVEN A TRADE WEAPON
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 2 SenateHouse conferees on the big taxreduction bill have given President Nixon one new weapon to use in forthcoming foreign trade negotiations but otherwise have eliminated all pro tectionist trade provisions added by the Senate.

title: FremontSmith Quits as Editor Of Little, Brown Book Division
description: Eliot FremontSmith has resigned as editor in chief of the general books division of Little, Brown & Co., the 135yearold Boston publishing house now part of Time Inc.

title: U.S. SEEKS A SLASH IN PAYMENTS TO U.N.
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 2 (AP)  The Nixon Administration said today that it would try to cut the United States annual payment to the United Nations to 25 per cent of the world organization's yearly budget.

title: Senate Approves A Broad Program Of Child Day Care
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 2Despite the threat of a Presidential veto, the Senate approved tonight, 63 to 17, a compromise plan creating a vast new system of day care and other services for the nation's children.

title: BACH ARIA GROUP VARIES APPROACH
description: In a quarter of a century, even Bach changes, or at least our view of him does. The Bach Aria Group, founded in 1946 when Bach's ensemble music did not often appear in concert hills, has been taking a slightly different approach to the composer in recent years.

title: New Units Are Formed
description: NEW DELHI, Dec. 2Both India and Pakistan have been increasing their preparations for the possibility of a general war.

title: Morton Foresees Approval Of Alaska Line in January
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 2 (AP) Secretary of the Interior Rogers C. B. Morton said today that Interior Department approval of the controversial TransAlaska oil pipeline should be given by the end of January, but said later that he did not mean he definitely would approve the project.

title: Miss Davis Is Transferred To Santa Clara County Jail
description: PALO ALTO. Calif., Dec. 2 (UPI)  Angela Davis was moved from the Marin County jail north of San Francisco to the Santa Clara County jail here early today.

title: Newark F.B.I. Man Retiring
description: NEWARK, Dec. 3Ralph W. Bachman, special agent in charge of the Federal Bureau of Investigation for New Jersey will retire effective Jan. 7. Mr. Bachman has been in charge of the Newark office since July 25, 1960. F.B.I. Director, J. Edgar Hoover announced that he

title: U.S. and Canada in Pact on Hijackers
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 3The United States and Canada signed a extradition treaty today covering hijackers of aircraft and assailants of diplomats for the first time.

title: SALES RISE SHOWN FOR SAVINGS BONDS
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 3, (AP) Holdings of United States Savings Bonds and Freedom Shares, spurred by rising sales in November reached a high of $54.7billion, the Treasury announced today.

title: NATO Is Surprised
description: BONN, Nov. 3The omission of any reference to troop cuts in Europe from the Warsaw Alliance's latest call for a European security conference surprised and disappointed members of the North Atlantic Treaty Organization, diplomatic sources said today.

title: New Humanities Chief
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 3 The man defies typecasting. He has been deckhand and Renaissance scholar, bookworm and middledistance running champion, a laborer, a nut about Anthony Trollope, an intellectual conservative who plays golf with his radical students and thinks

title: EGYPT URGES U.N. TO FORCE ISRAEL FROM ARAB AREAS
description: UNITED NATIONS, N. Y., Dec. 3  Egypt called on the United Nations today to take enforcement measures against Israel to compel her to withdraw her military forces from occupied Arab territory. The move was, in effect, a call for sanctions.

title: Trap for Dr. Allende ...
description: Chile's Marxistdominated Government now faces the worst political crisis of its thirteen months in power. President Salvador Allende will not find it easy to extricate his regime from a trap that he himself helped prepare. What is clear is that with his opposition thoroughly aroused at last, he does not dare risk a showdown In the streets of Santiago.

title: Dock Strike Injunction Here Extended Until Feb.
description: Federal Judge Dudley B. Bonsai extended a restraining order against a dock strike here until Feb. 16, and lawyers for both management and labor told him there had been progress in the negotiations for new contract.

title: Bossman Lobell Thwarts Rum Customer's Bid to Join MillionDollar
Seaway Ships Racing Winter Freeze
description: MONTREAL, Dec. 3The skipper of the Greek freighter Monsun stood on deck today as his rusty ship glided out of the St. Lawrence Seaway, looked back briefly, and raised his right arm in a farewell salute as the craft headed for home under a sky filled with winddriven snowflakes.

title: NASA Forms Unit to Apply Space Technology to Earth
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 3 (UPI) The National. Aeronautics and Space Administration announced today the formation of a special office to manage the agency's most important new thrust, application of space technology to the problems of earth.

title: Bucks Crush Royals, 12082
description: MILWAUKEE, Dec. 3 (AP)Bob Dandridge's 25 points led a balanced attack as the Milwaukee Bucks routed the Cincinnati Royals, 12082, tonight. The Bucks played without Kareem Abdul Jabber.

title: Meteor Showers Start In Northeast Next Week
description: CAMBRIDGE, Mass., Dec. 3 (AP)Meteor showers will be visible over the Northeast starting next week, and the show, says the Smithsonian Astrophysical Observatory, could be spectacular.

title: State's Representatives Back Mills Plan for Revenue
description: In a rare display of bipartisan unity, the New York Congressional delegation yesterday endorsed a statement calling for speedy action by Congress on Representative Wilbur D. Mills's substitute for President Nixon's revenuesharing pro

title: Mrs. Gandhi Vows to Repel the Foe
description: NEW DELHI, Saturday, Dec. 4India declared yesterday that Pakistan had launched fullscale war against her.

title: To Right a Wrong
description: The move to reinstate 31 former. New York City teachers who were dismissed almost two decades ago for allegedly subversive views or membership in subversive organizations is a belated effort to repair unconscionable damage to their careers. It is also an essential action to erase a shameful chapter in the school system's history, which was rendered no less offensive by the fact that it reflected a national mood of hysteria.

title: NOVEMBER SALES OF CARS AT PEAK
description: DETROIT, Dec. 3Newcar sales in November continued at a record rate, but some slowing was expected this month.

title: Don't Cut Federal Taxes
description: To the Editor:

title: JOSEPH F. DEEGAN
description: PERTH AMBOY, N. J., Dec. 3Joseph F. Deegan, a retired Navy captain whose son, Joseph F. Deegan Jr., is a Middlesex County Court Judge, died of a heart attack yesterday in Perth Amboy General Hospital. He was 79 years old.

title: Bridge: Dual European Championship  Cinched by Italy at Athens
description: ATHENS, Dec. 3Italy has cinched a rare double victory in the European championships here.

title: Obituary 2  No Title
description: Amer. Hockey League

title: Paris Police Thwart Airliner Hijacking
description: PARIS, Dec. 3  A Pakistani airliner, about to take off, was seized in the name of Bengali rebellion today by an armed, 28yearold Frenchman who terrorized the occupants of the craft, for seven hours before he was overpowered by policemen in a cockpit struggle.

title: FotoMem Funds Exhausted
description: The board of FotoMem, Inc., of Newton, Mass., reported yesterday that the company's funds were essentialy exhausted and that its future was uncertain. No additional financial sources appeared to be available and, while management was continuing actively to seek funds for the company, it could give no assurance of success, the board said, adding that, unless funds were obtained, it would appear that the company would have to cease all operations next week. The company makes microfilm storage and retrieval devices.

title: Industrial Emission Standards For 3 A it Pollutants Proposed
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 3William D. Ruckelshaus, administrator of the Environmental Protection Agency, announced today proposed emission standards for industry on three hazardous air pollutants  asbestos, berryllium and mercury.

title: SHOWCAUSE ORDER GRANTED ON INSURER
description: The American National Insurance Company, a Texasbased insurer with 51.4billion in assets, was ordered in Federal District Court here yesterday to show cause why it should not be prevented from holding a special meeting of stockholders on Dec. 15.

title: Grumman Will Cut Force Up to 2,000 in Next Year
description: BETHPAGE, L. I., Dec. 3The Grumman Corporation plans to cut its work force between 1,500 and 2,000 in the coming year because of anticipated reduced business, a company spokesman said today.

title: Democrats Study Cutback in State Narcotic Control
description: Democratic members of the State Assembly held an unofficial hearing here yesterday to look into the affairs of the State Narcotic Addiction Control Commission.

title: Philharmonic in Photos
description: Fourteen years of photographs by Bert Bial, contrabassoonist with the New York Philharmonic, are on display through Dec. 24 at the Grand Promenade of Philharmonic Hall in Lincoln Center.

title: New Delhi Asserts Enemy Has Raided 12 Airfields
description: India's Prime Minister, Indira Gandhi, accused Pakistan of having begun a fullscale war yesterday, leaving her country no other option but to go on a war footing. Her statement came as both sides reported that Pakistani warplanes had bombed Indian airfields.

title: Managing Forests
description: To the Editor:

title: $1.5Million in Aid To Kennedy Center Is Voted by Senate
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 3 (UPI) The Senate voted today a special $1.5million appropriation to keep the Kennedy Center for the Performing Arts open to tourists.

title: Connally Called Optimistic
description: Charls E. Walker, the Under Secretary of the Treasury, said yesterday that the prospect for an earlier resolution of the international monetary crisis than people had thought is quite good.

title: Soviet Disappoints U.S. on Troop Cuts
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 3Senior State Department officials today expressed disappointment at the Soviet Union's refusal so far to enter into discussions with allied powers on mutual reduction of forces in central Europe.

title: War on the Subcontinent
description: The outbreak of extended fighting between India and Pakistantheir third war since the partition of the Indian subcontinent in 1947is the inevitable consequence of brutal repression by the Government of Pakistan of its own people in East Bengal, of the selfrighteous intransigence of India's response and of the narrowly selfserving policies of the great powers which resulted in an in excusable paralysis at the United Nations.

title: Fire Razes Jersey Store
description: MADISON TOWNSHIP, N. J., Dec. 3(AP)A general alarm fire burned out the Channel Lumber Company store in the Sayre Woods Shopping Center here tonight.

title: Americans at Parley Say Soviet Is Serious on Further Trading
description: MOSCOW, Dec. 3Four days of talks by United States business leaders here this week were described today as having been useful in exposing top American corporate leadership to high Soviet officials.

title: HalfPrice Scheme On Auto Sales Laid To Westchester Man
description: A Westchester County auto salesman has been charged with grand larceny in a purported pyramid scheme in which he allegedly sold Lincoln and Mercury automobiles for as little as half price.

title: FUTURES PRICES FOR GRAINS RISE
description: The belief of many traders that the new Secretary of Agriculture, Earl L. Butz, would increase Government support prices of gains, led to increased volume, and prices for grain and soybean futures on the Chicago Board ot Trade yesterday.

title: Victim of Russian Roulette
description: HARTSHORNE, Okla., Dec. 3 (AP)  While four companions shouted for him to put a pistol down, a young man killed himself today in a demonstration of Russian roulette. The police said that Stephen Carl Gaylor, 21 years old, put a cartridge in the pistol, spun the chamber and fired it, then repeating this twice, despite pleas to stop, before killing himself on the third try. Mr. Gaylor was a Vietnam war veteran.

title: U.C.L.A. Romps in Opener
description: LOS ANGELES, Dec. 3 (AP) Henry Bibby scored 26 points tonight to lead University of California, Los Angeles, to a 105.49 rout of The Citadel in the topranked Bruins opener tonight. The Bruins took a 140 lead before the Bulldogs were able to score.

title: State to Pay Costs of Trial's Of Miss Davis and Magee
description: SACRAMENTO, Calif., Dec. 3 (UPI)Gov. Ronald Reagan has signed a bill requiring the state to bear the costs of the murder and conspiracy trials of Angela Davis and Ruchell Magee.

title: Mayor and Golar Are Sued Over Forest Hills Housing
description: In an effort to halt work on the controversial lowincome housing project in Forest Hills, Queens, opponents filed a complaint yesterday accusing Mayor Lindsay and Simeon Golar, head of the city's Housing Authority, of fraud in pushing the project.

title: Tiffany Shopping Party Aids Cancer Unit
description: It was, according to Walter Hoving, chairman of the board, the first time in its 134year history that Tiffany's had done such a thing.

title: Senate Opens Debate on Court Post for. Powell
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 3The Senate began debate tonight on President Nixon's nomination of Lewis F. Powell Jr. to the Supreme Court and scheduled a vote on him at 4 P.M. Monday.

title: Knickerbocker Hospital Says Debts May Force It to Close
description: Directors of the Knickerbocker Hospital announced yesterday that, short of a miracle, the 109yearold West Harlem institution would close within 30 days.

title: Mrs. Lerner Is Wed
description: Mrs. Caroline S. Lerner, a vice president of Ruder & Finn, Inc., and John F. Goldsmith, editor of House & Home, a McGrawHill magazine, were married yesterday by State Supreme Court Justice Arnold L. Fein in his chambers. The bride, a Cornell graduate, is a daughter of Dr. Reuben Steinholz, a physician of New York and Ridgefield, Corm, and the late Mrs. Steinholz. Mr. Goldsmith, a graduate of the University of Colorado, is a son of Mrs. Morton R. Goldsmith of Scarsdale, N. Y., and the late Mr. Goldsmith. The couple's previous marriages ended in divorce.

title: A Lawyer Challenges the Abortion Law
description: A 40year old professor of law at Fordham University was named special guardian yesterday of all human fetuses between the 4th and 24th weeks of gestation scheduled to be aborted in the municipal hospitals here.

title: PLEAS ARE FUTILE ON RENT DEADLINE
description: Despite lastminute pleas from groups of the elderly and two City Councilmen, the Rent, and Housing Maintenance Commissioner, Benjamin Altman, said yesterday that he was powerless to extend the deadline for the filing of rentincresie exemptions by the elderly beyond last midnight.

title: Voting for Bangla Desh
description: To the Editor:

title: WAITZMAN PLAYS RECORDER IN BOW
description: Because of their relatively pure and uncomplex tones, any fulllength recital on the recorder or the flute is likely to pall. Charmed and soothed at first, the musical ear wants color and interesting overtones after a time; as in other, extramusical, areas of life, purity can become tedious.

title: Buying of Stocks On Credit Eased
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 3The Federal Reserve Board reduced today the margin requirement on stock purchases to 55 per cent from 65 per cent, effective Monday.

title: Where's the Mainstream?
description: To the Editor:

title: David Rabe Named Winner Of HultWrriner Award
description: David Rabe, author of The Basic Training of Pavlo Hummel and Sticks and Bones, both of which are playing at the New York Shakespeare Festival's Public Theater, has been named winner of the Elizabeth Hull  Kate Warriner award. The award, which carries a cash prize of $3,000, is given to the playwright whose work deals with controversial subjects involving the fields of political, religious or social mores of the times.

title: Wayward Ambitions of the Welfare State
description: In classic political theory, from Thomas Hobbes through John Locke to John Stuart Mill, the prime purpose and duty of the state is the protection of the safety of its citizens, their lives and property, from wouldbe attackers, foreign and domestic. The second task of the state is to establish and enforce rules for the ordinary and peaceful conduct of civil affairs and to settle disputes among its citizens.

title: Astros Acquire Roberts And Twins Get Granger
description: PHOENIX, Ariz., Dec. 3 Ten more players  including Dave Roberts and Wayne Granger  were traded today as professional baseball ended its winter business meetings after the most bullish manpower market in the history of the major leagues.

title: Melee Erupts at a Protest Over Slaying of L.I. Youth
description: ROOSEVELT, L. 1., Dec. 4 (AP) A rockandbottlethrowing disorder broke out here tonight during a demonstration by 150 persons protesting the shooting to death of a 15yearold boy by a Nassau County policeman.

title: Soledad Jury Chosen
description: SAN FRANCISCO, Dec. (UPI)Jury selection was completed yesterday for the trial of John Clutchette and Fleeta Drumgo, the two Soledad Brothers accused of killing a prison guard. Four alternate jurors were chosen to complete the panel, and Superior Court Judge S. Lee Vavuris set Dec. 14 for opening arguments in the trial.

title: 6 Jets Hit Srinagar Airport
description: SRINAGAR, Kashmir, Dec. 3 (Reuters) Six Pakistani Sabrejets made a lowlevel bombing raid on Srinagar Airport today and attacked another nearby area, Indian officials said.

title: Colonels Rout Chaparrals
description: DALLAS, Dec. 3 (AP)Dan Issel poured in 34 points and Louie Dampier added 23, including three 3point goals, tonight to lead the Kentucky Colonels to a 10591 triumph over the Dallas Chaparrals.

title: GEORGE LUSKIN
description: George Luskin, the owner of a haberdashery in Williamsburg, Brooklyn, for more than 40 years until his retirement about 1959, died of a heart attack yesterday in Long Island Jewish Hospital. He was 77 years old and lived at 6295 Saunders Street, Rego Park, Queens.

title: Dance: Japanese Mime
description: City Hall has yet to class any of our local dance companies as an intangible culturd treasure. That, however, Is the official, rank of the Taneo Wakayama Company, a troupe from Tokyo specializing in the Shinto dances of Japan. The company made its American deput at Alice Tully Hall Thursday night.

title: Pair Take $100,000 From a Bank's Guard
description: CLEVELAND, Tenn., Dec. AP)Two men, wearing ski masks and armed with shotguns, robbed a bank guard of more than $100,000 today, an official of the Cleveland Bank and Trust Company said.

title: Detective Lays His Ouster to Movie Role
description: When Eddie (Popeye) Egan's image on celluloid caught up with him yesterday, he did not attempt to back away from it with fancy wordsplitting about the difference between appearance and reality or metaphor and fact.

title: Lindsay, in Tokyo Visit, Praises The GunControl Laws in Japan
description: TOKYO, Dec. 3 Mayor Lindsay came out of a twohour meeting with senior Japanese police officials here today with words of praise for Japan's guncontrol laws and Tokyo's low crime rate.

title: $90,000 Is Stolen From Parked Car
description: More than $90,000 in cash left in the trunk of a passenger car by employes of a checkcashing company was stolen yesterday when the car was driven off while the three men assigned to the job were cashing checks for Trans World Airlines employes at Kennedy International Airport.

title: BRANDT IN FRANCE FOR CURRENCY TALKS
description: PARIS, Dec. 3Chancellor Willy Brandt arrived today for two days of conversations with President Pompidou in which the two men hoped to resolve their countries monetary dispute and revive efforts to establish a Western European currency union.

title: Peoples Gas Raises Payout
description: Directors of the Peoples Gas Company, Chicago, today increased the quarterly dividend to 54 cents a common share, or by 3.8 per cent, from the 52cent quarterly rate in effect since September, 1970. The dividend at the new rate, equal to $2.16 a share annually, is payable Jan. 17 holders of record Dec. 17.

title: Acupuncture Is Backed by British Doctor
description: A British doctor who, specializes in acupuncture stood before a packed auditorium at Brooklyn's Downstate Medical Center yesterday and explained how he, like the Chinese who originated the ancient healing art, sticks needles into his patients to cure them of dozens of afflictions.

title: CONFEREES FAIL AGAIN ON AID BILL
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 3  A compromise foreignaid bill that would authorize $2.75billion in economic and military assistance remained blocked today in a House and Senate conference committee by disagreement over an amendment calling for withdrawal of all United States troops from. Indochina within a specified time.

title: Hiltzek Wins Men's Title In Figure Skate Competition
description: COMMACK, L. I, Dec. 3Dean. Hiltzek won the senior men's competition in the North Atlantic figure skating championships at. the, Long Island Arena tonight. Dorothy Hamill of Riverside, Conn., took the lead in the senior women's event.

title: 2 ExCity Youth Workers Get Probation in Drug Case
description: Two former college basketball players, employed by the city last summer to work with young people, were sentenced to five years probation in State Supreme Court in Queens yesterday on charges of attempted criminal possession of drugs.

title: Pistons Down Rockets
description: DETROIT, Dec. 3 (AP)Erwin Mueller, taking over for Bob Lanier, injured center, in the third period, tossed in 16 points tonight to provide the spark that enabled the Detroit Pistons to top the Houston Rockets, 113112. The Pistons snapped a fivegame losing streak.

title: THREE NEW ISSUES ALL CLIMB IN WEEK
description: Only three companies made their first public stock offerings last week, but all were wellreceived.

title: Market Place: Parent's Rescue By Subsidiary?
description: You remember how it all happened. It was back in the heyday of conglomerate takeovers and Loew's Theatres, Inc., had eyes for the Commercial Credit Company, one of the nation's bluechip finance companies.

title: VALUE OF DOLLAR DECLINES AGAIN
description: PARIS, Dec. 3The major foreign currencies, still under the influence of developments at the Rome meeting of finance ministers, again rose to new highs against the dollar today as rumors circulated that some foreign exchange markets might temporarily shut down.

title: Antiques: U.S. Silver Plate of 1880's
description: American silver plate is an intriguing field for those interested in finding bargains that are good examples of Victorian design.

title: Menzies Has Light Stroke
description: MELBOURNE, Australia, Dec. 3 (AP)  Sir Robert Menzies, Australia's former Prime Minister, suffered a stroke Thursday but he is not in serious condition, his wife reported today. Sir Robert, who will be 77 years old on Dec. 20, had a severe stroke in London in 1968 and spent a month in hospital there. His doctor said that he might be out of the hospital in a week.

title: Bathurst to Raise Price of Newsprint
description: ConsolidatedBathurst Newsprint, Ltd., a subsidiary of ConsolidatedBathurst, Ltd., said in Montreal yesterday that it had advised its United States customers that it will raise its newsprint price by $8 a ton in the northern states, effective Dec. 6.

title: She's Fighting Conviction For Aborting Her Child
description: DAYTONA BEACH, Fla., Dec. 3Life for 23yearold Shirley Wheeler has always been on the shadow side of the American dream.

title: MRS. ERNEST J. ARIES
description: Mrs. Gladys Friedman Aries, the wife of Ernest J. Aries, an owner of Aries Associates, a realestate concern in Yonkers, died on Thursday in Montefiore Hospital after a long illness. She was 59 years old and lived at 1200 Midland Avenue, Yonkers.

title: Art:
description: Richard Diebenkorn is one of the best artists the West Coast has produced since the end of World War II. During the last 10 years he has reached a high level of achievement and maintained it with admirable consistency. His current exhibition at the Marlborough Gallery, 41 East 57th Street, is still another triumph that will exhilarate his followers and should immediately convert into a follower anyone who has doubts about Mr. Diebenkorn's

title: Schools in Newark Restrained From Putting Up Black Flags
description: NEWARK, Dec. 3 (UPI)A Superior Court judge signed an order today restraining the Newark Board of Education from implementing its resolution to install the blackliberation flag in all city schools with a majority of black students.

title: In Marble Hill, Entente on Plebiscite
description: The Borough Presidents of the Bronx and Manhattan reported agreement yesterday on allowing Marble Hill's 6,800 residents to have a plebiscite on whether to make their community legally part of the Bronx.

title: Turkish Premier and 13 Ministers Quit
description: ANKARA, Turkey, Dec. 3Turkey's Premier. Nihat Erim, resigned today after more than half his Cabinet had resigned over policy differences. The collapse of the Government renewed the threat of a direct military takeover.

title: Bulls Tight Defense Tops Knicks, 12296
description: CHICAGO, Dec. 3The New York Knicks came here expecting a tough game from the Chicago Bulls, but they were in no way prepared for the 12296 shellacking that the Bulls handed them tonight before a crowd of 15,008 at Chicago Stadium.

title: BEAMON, IN RETURN, FAILS IN HIGH JUMP
description: Bob Beamon, who set a world longjump record of 29 feet 2 inches at the 1968 Olympic. Games, returned to track and field action last night at the 168th Street Armory.. He was one of 1,300 athletes competing in the first of three development meets sponsored by the Metropolitan Amateur Athletic Union.

title: 1971 May Set City Precipitation Record
description: This year may become the city's wettest since the Central Park weather station was established in 1868.

title: Quebec Towns Thrive Despite Mine Woes
description: ROUYN, Quebec  The mines are giving out in this hardrock, lakepocked region of western Quebec faster than the prospecters are discovering new ore bodies.

title: Blazers Repel Warriors
description: PORTLAND, Ore., Dec. 3 (AP) Geoff Petrie and Sidney Wicks combined for 66 points tonight to lead the Portland Trail Blazers to a 115107 victory over the Golden State Warriors.

title: ENTRY 45 CHOICE IN DISPLAY TODAY
description: A triple entry representing Sigmund Sommer and listed as a 45 early choice will head the field for the Display Handicap on the Aqueduct card today. Frank Martin, who trains for Sommer, will send Hitchcock, Paraje and, Big Shot II intothe 2 1/4mile event, now the longest flat race in North America. Previous to this year the Display was a twomile event..

title: A U.S.Soviet Space Pact On Joint Effort Held Near
description: The United States and the Soviet Union are said to be ready to sign an agreement in the next two months that could lead to a joint manned space flight.

title: Berlin Pact Set for Signing, East Germans Say
description: BERLIN, Dec. 3 (AP)East Germany said tonight that it considered completed the talks it held with the West German and West Berlin governments on the fourpower Berlin accord.

title: Rangers Try Once More To Beat Penguins Tonight
description: The New York Rangers, who lead the National Hockey League in goals with 110, have made most of that production against the expansion clubs.

title: Fighting Reported on Kashmir Line
description: RAWALPINDI, Pakistan, Saturday, Dec. 4Pakistan charged last night that the Indian Army had attacked at least four points along West Pakistan's border. The Pakistani Air Force and Army have been given orders to penetrate India as deeply as possible, a Government spokesman said.

title: No Hit, One Error
description: Those great sentimentalists who run the game of baseball appear to have come to a sudden realization that they made a mistake in allowing the Washington Senators to leave the capital. Seeking greener returns, the team has settled in the DallasFort Worth area, where next springbetween innings, as it werethey will turn into the Texas Rangers.

title: JOBLESS RATE UP TO 6% FOR MONTH
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 3 The nation's unemployment rate edged upward in November to 6 per cent of the labor force despite another good gain in the number of people employed, the Labor Department reported today.

title: Harvard Faces Seton Hall Here Today
description: Looking forward to its best season in 70 years of basketball, Harvard will visit Madison Square Garden today for the first time since 1946 to face Seton Hall in the first game of a doubleheader at 1:30 P.M.

title: U.S. AND RUSSIANS IN SEA ENCOUNTER
description: GAETA, Italy, Dec. 3An informal talk at the local Lions Club by a United States Navy officer has disclosed that American and Soviet warships had an encounter off the Italian West coast last week, exchanged messages and shadowed each other for a few days.

title: WORK ON HOUSING IN CITY ASSAILED
description: A spot check of buildings supposedly rehabilitated with money from the Municipal Loan Program was said to have disclosed such inferior work and hazardous conditions that Councilmen who heard it reported yesterday, expressed indignation.

title: Big Board's Bond Trading Tops Record in 11 Months
description: The New York Stock Exchange announced yesterday that the value of bond trading on the exchange had reached $6.01billion for the year, setting an annual record with almost a month of trading left in 1971. The record surpassed by 34 per cent the previous mark of $4.5billion for all of 1970. Daily bond trading averaged a record $25.6million in this year's first 11 months, the exchange said, compared with $17.7million daily in 1970.

title: Lawyer Is Sentenced to 8 Years For Possession of Treasury Bills
description: A lawyer was sentenced in Federal Court here yesterday to eight years in prison for the illegal possession of nine $100,000 United States Treasury bills stolen from the Manufacturers Hanover Trust Company.

title: Change at Newburgh Paper
description: ROCHESTER, Dec. 3 (AP)Brian 3. Donnelly, was named president and publisher of The Newburgh Evening News, re placing Philip T. Gialanella, the Gannett Company, Inc., announced today. Mr. Donnelly is now vice president and assistant general manager of the WestchesterRockland News papers at White Plains, which also belong to the Gannett group. Mr. Gialsnella will move to a new executive post later this month.

title: AT HOME ABROAD
description: LONDON, Dec. 3One of the odd advantages of that constitutional anachronism, the British House of Lords, is that its members, representing no one but themselves, can escape partisan simplicities and speak their minds. And so, the other day, Lord Goodman treated his noble colleagues to a rare examination of the limits on morality in politics.

title: Mrs. Gandhi's Statement
description: NEW DELHI, Dec. 3 (Reuters)Following is the text of Prime Minister Indira Gandhi's radio speech to the nation tonight:

title: Pan Am Halts Flights To India and Pakistan
description: Pan American World Airways announced yesterday that it had suspended its flights to India and Pakistan as those nations reached fullscale warfare.

title: The I.R.A. Frees 3 of Its Top Agents From Belfast Jail
description: BELFAST, Northern Ireland Dec. 3 (AP)  The Irish Republican Army today freed three top I.R.A. operatives, from Belfast's Crumlin Road Prison.

title: Microscope Uses Infrared Rays
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 3Barry G. Cohen, an electrical engineer, has built a business around an infrared microscope for which he was granted a patent this week.

title: $250BILLION LIMIT ON '73 BUDGET SET
description: KEY BISCAYNE, Fla., Dec. 3 The White House said today that President Nixon would submit a budget containing a full employment balance to Congress for the 1973 fiscal year.

title: In Hungary, It's Now a Question Of Making the Best of It
description: For members of the class of 56, going home to Hungary is more than going home to one's birthplace.

title: Second Cosmos in 2 Days
description: MOSCOW, Dec. 3 (AP)The Soviet Union launched another unmanned Cosmos satellite to day, Toss the government press agency, announced. It was the 462d launching reported in the Cosmos series and the second in two days.

title: Cratered Areas on Mars Suggest Extinct Volcanoes
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 3Scientists directing the Mariner 9 spacecraft now orbiting Mars reported today that the planet may he dotted with the shells of extinct volcanoes similar to some on earth.

title: Rain Disrupts Disney Golf; Planned TV Is Canceled
description: ORLANDO, Fla., Dec. 3Heavy rain forced postponement today of the second round of the $150,000 Walt Disney world open golf tournament.

title: Webster Rehired By Giants for 72
description: Alex Webster will coach the New York Giants next season, Wellington Mara, the club owner, said yesterday. There was no formal announcement, and no actual contract signing has taken place. But the question about next year arose naturally after the mathematical elimination of the Giants from this year's race last Sunday, and Mara answered it directly yesterday.

title: GENE CUNEO
description: ERIE, Pa., Dec. 3Gene Cuneo, sports editor of The Erie Times, died of cancer yesterday after a long illness. He was 45 years old.

title: Film: Videotape Show
description: The film programs for the next two weeks at the Whitney Museum will consist not of films but of experimental videotapes broadcast by closed circuit to color TV monitors set in partitioned spaces arranged for intimate viewing. The audience will for the most part be asked to lounge on cushions on the floor.

title: Private Black Colleges in Fight to Survive
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 3 Officials at Allen University, a small, black private college in Columbia, S.C., plan to hire consultants to show them how to conduct a $10million fundraising drive.

title: Times Employe Found Dead
description: A 56yearold deliverer for The New York Times was found dead last night, apparently of a selfinflicted gunshot wound, in a hotel room across the street from the newspaper plant on West 43d Street. The body of the man, Harold Bonaventura of 442 West 47th Street, was found in a 10thfloor room of the Dixie Hotel, between Seventh and Eighth Avenues, at 8:30 P.M., an hour before he was to report for work at The Times. Mr. Bonaventura, who had worked for The Times for 18 years, lived alone after the death of his wife three years ago. They had no children.

title: U.S. WILL BUY CORN TO RAISE PRICES
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 3 The Nixon Administration announced today that the Government would buy corn in a move designed to bolster sagging prices and offset farm belt unrest over low prices and income.

title: NOVEMBER SALES UP AT 3 RETAIL CHAINS
description: Three more retail chains reported yesterday strong gains in November and yeartodate sales, following similar reports by others on Thursday.

title: I.B.A.'s Last President
description: BOCA RATON, Fla., Dec. 3 (AP)The Investment Bankers Association elected today Philip D. Baker as its last president. Mr. Baker, general partner and senior vice president of White, Weld & Co., succeeds Wheelock Whitney. Mr. Baker will serve as the organization's 57th and final president because the I.B.A. voted yesterday to consolidate with the Association of Stock Exchange Firms on Jan. 1, forming a new group, the Securities Industry Association..

title: Bus Drivers Agree To Return to Work At Bee Line System
description: MINEOLA, L. I., Dec. 3A threeday wildcat strike by drivers of the Bee Line bus system ended today when, the drivers agreed to return to work in time for the evening rush hour.

title: SOUTH BRONX GANG SEEKS PEACE ROLE
description: Peace, not revenge, was the message circulated yesterday by leaders of the Ghetto Brothers street gang in the South Bronx as they mourned a member fatally struck down. Thursday as he was trying to be a peacemaker.

title: TRACKS OFFERED MORE OTB MONEY
description: New York's racing industry has been offered a 4 per cent slice of all regular Offtrack Betting Corporation wagers and 6 per cent of the handle on superfecta races, an informed source said yesterday.

title: London Designer Has His Own Idea Of Elegance
description: Mr. Freedom's been to Las Vegas and he's sure it will change his life.

title: CHARLES ISRAEL, 90, A RETIRED EDITOR
description: MIAMI, Dec. 3Charles Israel, a former city editor and sports editor of The Philadelphia Bulletin, who retired in 1946, died of pneumonia in North Shore Hospital today. He was 90 years old.

title: Paris Tourney Starts Today
description: PARIS, Dec. 3 (Reuters)Seven of the world's top tennis players will begin tomorrow a battle for $50,000 in prize money in the Pepsi masters tournament, the grand final of the yearlong tennis Grand Prix.

title: A Correction
description: The North American Rockwell Corporation, which paid 35 cents a share in its September dividend, a rate that this column suggested might be cause for a rollback under Phase Two dividend guidelines, was do fact well within its baseperiod limitations. In 1969, a base year under Phase Two, North American Rockwell paid $2 a share and is thus well within the limit at 35 cents a quarter.

title: Westinghouse Wins Contract
description: The Westinghouse Electric Corporation announced yesterday it had been awarded a $23million contract to supply the automatic train control and communications equipment for the rapidtransit system in Sao Paulo, Brazil. The equipment will be used in the first 14mile segment of a planned 125mile rapidtransit system serving the city. It is expected to be in operation in about two years.

title: Fred Van Deventer Dead at 67; Originated Radio 20 Questions
description: Fred Van Deventer, a former WOR Radio newscaster who originated the radio and TV quiz show Twenty Questions, died Thursday night at his home in Colonial Heights, Va., near Petersburg. He would have been 68 years old tomorrow.

title: Golar Assails Washington
description: ATLANTA, Dec. 3The Forest Hills controversy was cited here tonight by Mr. Golar as evidence that the Nixon Administration was using racial and group antagonisms to create a national political constituency of fear and anger.

title: Castro, in Chilean Talk, Offers Links to Nations Defying U.S.
description: SANTIAGO, Chile, Dec. 3Premier Fidel Castro of Cuba said today that his Government was prepared to establish diplomatic relations with any Latin American country that is willing to defy the United States.

title: How Armed Forces Compare in Strength
description: NEW DELHI, Dec. 3The Indian and Pakistani armed forces are estimated to have the following strength:

title: Japanese Premier Ousts Defense Chief
description: TOKYO, Dec. 3Premier Eisaku Sato dismissed his defense minister and named a successor today, giving Japan its fourth such minister in the last six months.

title: Stony Brook Wins, 8864
description: BINGHAMTON, N. Y., Dec. 3 (AP)Stony Brook broke open the game in the lait few minutes to defeat Hamar, 8864, tonight. Roger Howard and Art King led the visitors with 20 and 17 points, respectively.

title: Talks to Resume Monday In Catholic Schools Strike
description: Contract negotiations between the striking Federation of Catholic Teachers and the Association of Catholic Schools, which lasted four hours yesterday, are scheduled to resume again Monday at 10 A.M. in the offices of the New York State Mediation Board at 270 Broadway.

title: Still Some Differences, Mrs. Meir Says in Capital
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 3Premier Golda Meir of Israel said today that there were still some differences of opinion between the United States and Israel on the Middle East despite her lengthy conversations yesterday with the Nixon Administration.

title: Sharp Clash in Pakistan
description: BHARSHALA, Pakistan, Saturday, Dec. 4 (AP)Pakistani troops, led by two Russianmade tanks, fought a sharp battle more than six miles inside Pakistan yesterday but were forced back by heavy Indian artillery fire. At least two Pakistanis were wounded.

title: Stockport Plays 22 Tie
description: LONDON, Dec. 3 (Reuters)Stockport County and Colchester. United played a 22 tie in an English League Fourth Division soccer match tonight.

title: HelpWanted Advertising Rises Slightly in Month
description: The index of classified helpwanted advertising in 52 cities throughout the country showed no change from September to October, The Conference Board reported yesterday. The index, standing at 80 per cent of the 1967 average, was 3 points higher in October than in the month last year.

title: SONICS TURN BACK BULLETS, 117106
description: BALTIMORE, Dec. 3 (UPI)Spencer Haywood scored 10 of his 35 points in the decisive third quarter as the Seattle Sonics dealt the Baltimore Bullets their third straight defeat tonight, 117106.

title: NETS TURN BACK COUGARS, 134122
description: WEST HEMPSTEAD, L. I., Dec. 3In, complete control Once the second half got under way, the New York Nets snapped their fourgame losing streak with a flourish tonight by defeating the Carolina Cougars, 134122.

title: How a Ride on Subway Could Bring Good Luck
description: City Councilman Monroe Cohen, a Brooklyn Democrat who has proposed several plans for saving the 30cent transit fare in recent weeks, yesterday suggested that subway change booths be used as lottery ticket agencies.

title: I.R.S. SAYS TENANTS CAN REFUSE TO PAY SOME RENT RISES
Senate Hearings Open on Cost of Arms
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 3 The Senate Armed Services Committee, troubled by the increasing costs of Weapons, began hearings today on the procurement procedures of the Defense Department.

title: Foundation Work Discussed
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 3A General Accounting Office report on the Forest Hills project, requested by Representative Rosenthal, suggested that the Department of Housing and Urban Development should obtain written assurances that the New York City Housing Authority would pay any additional costs of abnormal foundation costs in preparing theb uilding site. The G.A.O. report noted that

title: RITA COOLIDGE SINGS IN SOLO SPOTLIGHT
description: At first glance, Rita Coolidge seems to have everything going for her. She is a tall, slender, darkhaired young woman, lovely to look at and, at times, lovely to hear. But in her opening set Thursday night at the Gaslight At The Go Go, Miss Coolidge's charms wore thin too quickly.

title: Music: Bernstein at Best
description: Leonard Bernstein, In an expansive mood, was at his very best in two works of the New York Philharmonic's program Thursday evening. Those were Haydn's Surprise Symphony and the Shostakovich Symphony No. 1. The third work was the Berg Violin Concerto, with Itzhak Perlman as soloist.

title: Pakistan Reported Asking Security Council Meeting
description: UNITED NATIONS, Dec. 3No formal request for a Security Council meeting on the IndianPakistani conflict was forthcoming here today, although the 10 elected, nonpermanent members of the Council met privately to discuss the crisis.

title: Miss Proell Captures Downhill Ski Race
Dance: A Rare Concert
description: THE CONCERT (OR, THE PERILS OF EVERYBODY). Music, Frederic Chopin, choreography, Jerome Robbins, decor, Saul Steinberg, lighting, Ronald Bates, Pianist, Jerry Zimmerman, conductor, Robert Irving.

title: DR. WILLIAM BOLT, AN INSURANCE AIDE
description: Dr. William Bolt, who retired as chief medical examiner of the New York Life Insurance Company in 1959, died yesterday in Doctors Hospital after a brief illness. He was 78 years old and lived at 200 East 66th Street.

title: A Mortgage Scandal in Detroit Could Cost U.S. $200Million
description: DETROIT, Dec. 3A major scandal involving Federal mortgage programs in Detroit has left the Government the owner of thousands of decrepit homes and may cost up to $200million in Federal funds.

title: ...Failure of a Mission
description: Robert H. Finch, Counselor to President Nixon, started his goodwill mission to Latin America by derogating the Good Neighbor policy of Franklin D. Roosevelt and the Alliance for Progress, begun by John F. Kennedy. He said these policies had lumped the LatinAmerican countries together as banana republics.

title: POSTAL LOCAL HERE PUT UNDER PARENT
description: Vincent R. Sombrotto, president, and other officers of Branch 36 here of the National Association of Letter Carriers were removed from their posts yesterday, and the local was put under the direction of trustee.

title: Mrs. Johnstone, Editor, Married
description: ELKTON, Md., Dec. 3Mrs. Rita Olcott Johnstone, associate editor of Advertising News of New York was married in the County Courthouse here this afternoon to Walter J. Carlson, partner in Whipple & Carlson Associates, a New York public relations firm. E. Day Moore, deputy clerk, performed the ceremony.

title: U.S. Cancels Remaining Export Licenses for Shipment of Military Goods to India
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 3The United States announced today that it had canceled remaining export licenses for military and other sensitive equipment for India because of continuing Indian incursions into Pakistan.

title: Mills Expects Amendments To His RevenueSharing Bill
description: Wilbur D. Mills, Democrat of Arkansas, said last night that he could not evaluate the prospects for passage of his revenuesharing bill, but he predicted that there would be some, kind of Federal revenue sharing within the next year.

title: CONTRACT IS NEAR FOR CITY FIREMEN
description: Negotiators for the firemen's union and the city appeared last night to have reached a basis for final settlement of their 13month contract dispute.

title: RALLY CONTINUES IN AMEX TRADING
description: The stock market rally on the American Stock Exchange and on the overthecounter market continued in high gear yesterday as prices made good gains in active trading.

title: Art:
description: The exhibition called The Artist and the American Landscape, which opened this week at the A. M. Sachs Gallery, 29 West 57th Street, is an unexpected pleasure. It is one of those delightful miscellaneous shows that abound in surprises without actually changing one's views of either the artists in question or the general theme.

title: The Proceedings In the U.N. Today
VESCO TO RETIRE FROM O.D.B. BOARD
description: GENEVA, Dec. 3Robert L. Vesco, head of the Investors Overseas Services mutualfund group, is retiring at the end of the month as a director of the Overseas Development Bank of Geneva at the request of the Swiss Federal Banking Commission, a member of the commission said today.

title: Arabs Ask U.N. Session On Persian Gulf Islands
description: UNITED NATIONS, N. Y., Dec. 3 (AP)Four Arab countries asked today for an urgent meeting of the Security Council to consider Iran's occupation of three islands in the Persian Gulf. United Nations sources said the meeting was expected early next week.

title: Alabama Antibusing Law Ruled Unconstitutional by U.S. Judge
description: BIRMINGHAM, Ala., Dec (UPI)A Federal judge struck down today as unconstitutional Alabama's antibusing law.

title: Three Hanged in Liberia
description: MONROVIA, Liberia, Dec. 3 (Reuters)Three men convicted of murderone of them cousin and namesake of President William R. Tolbertwere hanged in public at dawn today. The President's cousin was convicted of killing his wife.

title: A. ALLAN PETERS, 66, LED AD FIRM HERE
description: A. Allan Peters, president of the public and financial relations concern bearing his name, died yesterday of a heart attack at Mount Sinai Hospital. He was 66 years old and lived at 785 Park Avenue.

title: Notes on People
description: Mrs. Spiro T. Agnew showed none of her husband's penchant for loaded language as she spoke at a breakfast at the WaldorfAstoria. Mrs. Agnew, who came to New York with the Vice President for a National Association of Manufacturers meeting, seemed more inclined to lowkey remarks on various subjects.

title: Squires Win in Overtime
description: INDIANAPOLIS, Dec. 3 (UPI) Charlie Scott tallied 37 points and the Virginia Squires pulled away in overtime tonight to score a 128121 victory over the Indiana Pacers.

title: PROS SINK STARS, HALTING STREAK
description: JACKSON, Tenn., Dec. 3 (AP) The Memphis Pros halted Utah's 10game winning streak tonight by posting a 117114 American Basketball Association victory in overtime.

title: Man Held on Bribe Charge; Untaxed Cigarettes Found
description: A 58yearold man was arrested on the Lower East Side last night for allegedly attempting to bribe a policeman who had caught him, the police said, with possession of untaxed cigarettes and obscene materials.

title: Soviet and U.S. Accelerate Talks on Arms Limitation

title: Musings on Monhegan
description: MONHEGAN, Me.Twentyfive years ago I first came here. What it was that drew me to this old gray rock with the pointed spruce on top, sitting eleven miles out from Port Clyde, Me., I'm not just sure. I do know I needed peace and a pretty, unargumentative place to be peaceful in. I was one month beyond fifty months in uniform and Monhegan looked near enough on the map to reach, far enough to regroup my thoughts and themes.

title: Penn State Tops Princeton In Final Seconds, 72 to 70

title: Railroads: Myth of a Golden Age
description: Killing a railroad line is no easy job. It takes concentrated effort by management and employes, especially the operating personnel. The people who run the new Amtrak system can learn how it's done simply by reviewing a few case histories of American railroads. The Chicago & North Western Railway Company, which used to serve my home town of Escanaba, Mich., offers a perfect example.

title: City to Give Extra Day Off

title: Executive Changes
description: The Hertz Corporation, an affiliate of the RCA Corporation, announced yesterday the elections of Ronald 3. Perman as chairman and chief executive officer and Gerald Shapiro as president and chief operating officer. The changes follow the resignation of Robert A. Smalley as president and chief executive officer, who has chosen to pursue other interests. Mr. Perman, who has been with Hertz since 1958, was previously executive vice president, finance and administration, and treasurer of the car rental cornpany. Mr. Shapiro joined Hertz in 1964 and has been executive vice president of operations and marketing since 1968. Mr. Smalley has served as president since 1968 and as chief executive officer since 1969.
