description: Members of the National As sociation of Engine and Boat Manufacturers are determined to carry all the responsibilities under the new Boat Safety Act, according to Peter M. Wilson, executive vicepresident of that boat building organi zation.

title: CourtOrdered Farming
description: ELYRIA, Ohio, Dec. 4 (UPI) Last summer, Michael L. Taylor, 20 years old, drove his car through a field of corn owned by Harold Sweet, who estimated that the car had done $700 damage. Judge Paul J. Mitus on Wednesday ordered Mr. Taylor placed on oneyear probation with the stipulation that he raise a $700 corn crop for Mr. Sweet next year.

title: Recordings
description: GRETA KELLER, in sporty gold pants suit and diamonds, glanced out of the window of her penthouse piedaterre just off Sutton Place. Look, she said, the weather's clearing, and the view is spendid now. Indeed it was. The rain had stopped and the lights of sky scrapers shone like stars in the evening sky.

title: A Theater Buff Goes to London, Moscow and Paris
description: THE last time I drove to New York City to go to the theater, my car was stolen. Not all of you New York theatergoers have this kind of luck. Some of you, I understand, get mugged in the West Forties. And oth ers, luckier still, merely have to put up with surly boxoffice attendants, un availability of tickets to all the worth while shows, inflated ticket prices and astronomical restaurant tabs.

title: Harvard Tops Hartwick, 41, in Soccer
description: CAMBRIDGE, Mass., Dec. 4 (AP)Harvard defeated Hart wick, 41, today to win the National Collegiate Eastern Re gional soccer title and advance to the N.C.A.A. national semi finals in Miami for the second time in three years.

title: Man Killed, 2d Missing In Tugboat Accident
description: A Brooklyn man was fa tally injured and a Staten Island man was lost over board when the wire cable connecting a tugboat to two barges snapped while the barges were being towed out of the Lower Bay early yes terday.

title: Michael Motte Grove to Marry Miss Sheila Marie Connors
description: HAMBURG, N. Y., Dec. 4 The engagement of Miss Sheila Marie Connors to Michael Motte Grove of Mil ford, Conn., has been an nounced by her parents, Mr. and Mrs. Thomas Joseph Connors. Mr. Grove is a son of Mrs. Ludwig King Moore head of New Canaan, Conn., and West Newbury, Vt., and the late Lieut. Comdr. George Wilson Grove, U.S.N.R. of New York and Cornwall, Conn.

title: Rise of Corporate Farming A Worry to Rural America
description: KANSAS CITY, Mo., Dec. 3 Few things are growing fast er down on the farm these days than corporate influence.

title: The Big Certainties
description: The silence has come, the winter quiet that leaves so much room for the cawing of a crow, the twittering a chickadee, the hoot of the barred owl, the whisper the wind. No frogs thump the darkness now, no cricket or katydid scratches the night. Short days lie upon the land, and the countryman has a chance to see the dimen sions of the world and try to understand his own place in it.

title: Education
description: It is generally acknowledged that of all the levels of schooling, high schools are relatively the easiest to integrate. They are bigger and transcend district lines. They usually are not up against demands, made by parents of younger children, to keep pupils in the familiar milieu of the neighborhood schools. They need not rely on busing since teenage students can travel independently by public transportation.

title: Howard Ousts Penn State, 80
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 4 (AP) Howard University downed Penn State, 80, today in the quarterfinals of the N.C.A.A. soccer championships. Keith Aqui, who drew double cov erage throughout the game, scored three goals and Alvin Henderson got two. The loss was Penn State's third in 13 games this season.

title: LETTERS
description: To the Financial Editor:

title: High Schools Said to Overstress College Subjects
description: A report prepared by the curriculum director for the

title: Mills for 5% Devaluation
description: Representative Wilbur D. Mills, chairman of the House Ways and Means Committee, said here yesterday that he had learned that Japanese negotia tors had indicated willingness to bring about an upward re valuation of 12 or 13 per cent in the exchange value of the yen.

title: Loafing in the Alps: Nonskier's Guide To Ski Resorts
description: PONTRESINA, SwitzerlandUsually I am the most conspicuous man in any winter resort's cable car. Dressed in black hat, topcoat, city suit and overshoes, I stand out from the toboggancap/skipants crowd. But in this cable car I saw a man actu ally wearing knickers. And that was not the limit. lie was carrying a Walking stick.

title: A Lear Full of Exquisite Terror
description: WATCHING Peter Brook's film adapta tion of King Lear is a lot like the sen sation of falling from a great height in a dream. It's a furi ous descent into a dark un known (and it is unknown, no matter how well you know the play), full of terror that is all the more exquisite be cause you are aware that, at any time you wish, you can either wake up or walk out

title: PROFESSOR'S OUSTER FOUGHT IN VERMONT
description: BURLINGTON, Vt., Dec. 4 The University of Vermont dis missed a controversial political science professor today and set off a campus uproar.

title: Yahya Vows to Crush Foe
description: KARACHI, Pakistan, Nov. (AP)  President Agha Mo hammed Yahya Khan accused India today of having launched a fullscale war and told his Pakistani countrymen it was time to give a crushing reply to the enemy.

title: Heath: Trade Liberalization
description: LONDON, Dec. 4  The overwhelming concern in Prime Minister Heath's mind as be prepares for his meet ing Dec. 2021 with President Nixon is the world monetary crisis.

title: Grim Portent in Cambodia
description: The rout of Cambodian forces north of their capital despite strong American aerial support and diversionary maneuvers by the South Vietnamese offers fresh evi dence of the terrible vulnerability of President Nixon's Indochina policy.

title: The Last Word: The Book Review Seven
description: The seven books of special significance discussed on Page 2we were tempted to call them The Magnificent Seven and wisely resisted that temptation until nowrepresent a consen sus, not a divine ordination. The consensus was arrived at the way all such consensuses are arrived at, whether among Book Review editors or airlines farefixers or the satraps on Con gressional committees: after lobbying, trades, suasion, fatigue, sulks and dyspeptic lamentation. They agree like bells, says an old English proverb; they want nothing but hanging.

title: Miss Edelman Engaged
description: HARRISON, N. Y., Dec. 4 The engagement of Miss Elizabeth M. Edelman to Jacob Lean Schwarz, son of Mr. and Mrs. Aaron Schwarz of North Plainfield, N. J. has been announced by the future bride's father and stepmother, Mr. and Mrs. Richard S. Edel man of Harrison. Miss Edel man's father is president of Medico Pipes, Inc., New York. Her fianc is president of Ahar Builders in North Plain field.

title: The World
description: So Who's Tense?

title: Lanusse Leaves Hospital
description: BUENOS AIRES, Dec. 4 (Reuters)  President Alejandro A. Lanusse left a hospital to day, eight days after an op eration for removal of a kidney stone. He is expected to spend another week of convalescence at his official home in subur ban Olivos before resuming his duties.

title: Pearl Harbor 30 Years Later
description: PEARL HARBOR, HawaiiBy no stretch of the imagination could you call Pearl Harbor one of Hawaii's loveliest attractions. The beds of pearlbearing oysters that gave this place its name have long since disappeared. There are far fewer palms around than you will find elsewhere in the Hawaiian Islands, for most of the shoreline is covered with mammoth machines that have to do with drydock ing. Everywhere you look, in fact, there is much hustle and bustle; it is all ex tremely unPolynesian.

title: Unusual Extra Session Held In ArmsLimitation Talks
description: VIENNA, Dec. 4 (Reuters) United States and Soviet nego tiators at the talks on limiting strategic arms held a 45minute session at the Soviet Embassy here today in an unusual third meeting this week.

title: TROIS FOR TWO?
description: TO THE EDITOR:

title: L. I. Sound, A Playground For. Porpoises, Is Now a Dump
description: All of us are concerned about numberless regrettable things going on all over our earth, most of which is sur faced with water. Only 29 per cent of it is land. The still smaller proportion that we can call habitable reduces our scant living space even more, and yet the human species seems bent on filling this up with his own kind at a faster rate than ever. We are all aware of the multi plicity of problems that dark en the future, particularly this problem called the pop ulation bomb. Each of us tries, more or less in vain, to think up a solution.

title: Medical Center Names Five Family Doctors
description: Five family doctors, each representing a borough, have been named to an advisory panel on curriculum for the new department of family practice at Downstate Medi cal Center in Brooklyn.

title: India Pakistan
description: Our enemy has once again chal lenged us, Said President Agha Mo hammad Yahya Khan, in a radio ad dress to his countrymen yesterday. India's government has launched a fullscale war on us.... The time has come for the heroic mujahids [follow ers of Islam] of Pakistan to give a crushing reply....

title: Words and Pictures, Modern
description: Probably for the first time since the avalanche of art books began to descend on us a couple of decades agobooks that are often commis sioned in London, written in New York, printed in Tokyo, proofread (if at all) in the monolingual fastness of some Alpine village, and bound (who knows?) in the nether regions of a 747 winging its way to market American art now enjoys a status in some ways equal to that of European art. This is not an equality of num bers, of coursethe European past (even the modern past) still provides a vastly greater number of subjects of conceivable interestbut an equal ity in the kind of attention writers are allowed to give their subjects and in the quality of the production pub lishers are willing to lavish on the results.

title: Elder, With 202, Leads Nigerian Golf by 3 Shots
description: LAGOS, Nigeria, Dec. 4 (AP) Lee Elder of Washington posted a fourunderpar 67 to day to take a threestroke lead after the third round of the 1971 Nigerian open golf cham pionship.

title: JETLINERS TO USE STEWART AIRPORT
description: NEWBURGH, N.Y., Dec. 4 The Metropolitan Transporta tion Authority and Pan Amer ican World Airways have reached agreement on a plan permitting the airline to use Stewart Airport, near here, as an alternate landing field for commercial jets flying to this country from the Caribbean.

title: A Woman in Jersey Is Indicted by Jury As Common Scold
description: FREEHOLD, N. J., Dec. (UPI)A 41yearold Middle town Township woman will be tried on charges of being common scold, a crime she says was once punished by public dunking and which has not been succesfully prosecuted in New Jersey in 80 years.

title: State Forest Preserve Getting A Tract the Size of Manhattan
description: A key section of privately owned wilderness land in the central Adirondacks will be come part of the stateowned Forest Preserve in the six millionacre Adirondack State Park, the Nature Conservancy has announced here.

title: First U.N. 1972 Issues Due in January
description: Stamps

title: Ashe, Pasarell Win
description: ABIDJAN, Ivory Coast, Dec. 4 (Reuters)Arthur Ashe scored a 76, 63 victory over Marty Riessen to reach the final of a tennis tournament among Unit ed States contract pros last night.

title: Victorious in Housing Fight, Lindenwood Residents Pondering Other Issues
description: The residents of Linden wood thank the residents of Forest Hills and wish them luck.

title: Queens Big Spenders: $1 Train Ride To the City
description: As a kid I was always Impressed as I rolled by the grandeur of the Forest Hills station of the Long Island Rail Road. I loved the way the ivy crawled over its brown stucco and onto its red tile roof, matching per fectly the Forest Hills Inn standing majestically across Station Square.

title: MARS CRAFT SPOTS PARTICLE STREAM
description: MOSCOW, Dec. 4The Sovi et Union announced today that its Mars 3 spacecraft, now ap proaching the planet Mars, had detected evidence of the earth's magnetic tail farther out in space than previously recorded.

title: The World
description: Mayor to Jail

title: Poll Finds Public Gets to Know 1972 Aspirants
description: The lesserknown Democratic Presidential hopefuls may not be making startling gains in popular support, but more peo ple are getting to know who they are.

title: Susannah Buck to Wed
description: OYSTER BAY, L. I., Dec. 4 Mr. and Mrs. W. Porter Buck have announced the en gagement of their daughter, Miss Susannah Buck, to Mitchell K. Furman, son of Mr. and Mrs. Arthur Furman of Farmingdale. The prospec tive bridegroom served with the Army in South Vietnam. The wedding is planned for next fall.

title: Campaign Spending: Anyway, It Was A Good Plan
description: WASHINGTON  One evening last summer, a halfdozen Democratic Presidential contenders met with the party's Congressional leaders in the apartment of the National Chairman, Lawrence F. O'Brien, and drew up a secret plan to finance the 1972 cam paign.

title: Words and Pictures, Classic
description: The rarest and most welcome kind of art book is the wellproduced mon ograph on a neglected artist whose name has no sales value  for in stance, the wonderful Michael Pacher. Know him? The next rarest is the book that manages to make a real contribution to the literature on big namefor instance, Goyathat is usually treated by repetition and rehash. Opposed to these is the book that takes a subject as surefire as the Sistine Chapel and hokes it up with a new paint job for the Christ mas sales counter. Examination of specimens in the order listed, plus others, follows herewith:

title: Miss McGiffert Fiancee
description: EASTON, Pa., Dec. 4  Mr. and Mrs. James B. Mc Giffert have announced the engagement of their daugh ter, Miss Julianne McGiffert, to Gerald P. Uehlinger, son of Mrs. Gerald P. Uehlinger of Long Beach, L. I., and the late Mr. Uehlinger. The future bridegroom's father was gen eral manager of the retail division of Horn & Hardardt in New York.

title: New Mexico Ends License Revocation Of Car Passengers
description: SANTA FE, N.M., Dec. 4 David Norvell, the New Mexi co Attorney General, has di rected the State Motor Vehi cle Department to terminate its new practice of revoking the driver licenses of persons convicted of riding with drunken drivers.

title: 230Berth Boat Basin Being Built
description: FREEPORT, L. I.A $1 million marina is being con structed by the Town of Hempstead at the foot of South Grove Street and will be opened to both resident and nonresident boatmen next April.

title: U.S. BUSINESS ROUNDUP
description: President Nixon's nomina tion of Earl L. Butz of Pur due University to succeed Clifford M. Hardin, who re signed to join the Ralston Purina Company, as Secre tary of Agriculture, came when prices for some farm products were weak, when production and costs were up and when some longrange trends in agriculture were be ing bitterly contested, Poli tics aside, these circum stances helped explain the fuss stirred up over the nom ination.

title: Letters
description: TO THE EDITOR:

title: St. Louis wins in Midwest
description: EDWARDSVILLE, Ill., Dec. 4 (AP)  Denny Hadican, a re serve, snapped a 11 tie early in the third period and St. Louis University topped South ern IllinoisEdwardsville, 31, today in the Midwest N.C.A.A. regional soccer final. St. Louis is the defending national cham pion.

title: Agency Says Girls Cost Less to Feed Than Boys
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 4 (AP) It costs about $8,300 to feed a girl from infancy to the age of 18, and about $8,900 for a boy, according to Agriculture Department estimates.

title: Lynn Wiskari Is Affianced to Derek Reid
description: Mr. and Mrs. Werner Wis kari of Flushing, Queens, and Charlestown, K. I, have an nounced the engagement of their daughter, Miss Lynn Eleanor Wiskari, to Derek Jackson Reid, son, of Mr. And Mrs. C. Jackson Reid Jr, of Chalfont, Pa. The wedding is planned for early August,.

title: The Nation
description: WASHINGTON  For a public starved on a diet of high unemploy ment and soaring inflation, the na tion's economists are serving up a cheery Christmas repast. Their predic tion: 1972 will be a very good year for the economy.

title: White House Gets 3 Bills On Veterans Insurance
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 4 (AP) The Senate passed and sent to the White House today three bills relating to different veter ans insurance programs.

title: New York
description: By land, by sea and by airbut mostly by seathe heroin pours into the country. Last week, here and abroad, the traffic pattern was a study in confusion.

title: Mrs. Handley Golf Victor
description: PEBBLE BEACH, Calif., Dec. 4 (UPI)Mrs. Barbara Handley of Carmel Valley scored a major upset today when she defeated 16  year  old Laura Baugh of Long Beach, 3 and 2, to win the California women's amateur golf championship. The 33yearold Mrs. Handley was an alternate on the 1961 Curtis Cup team.

title: John N. Kulas Weds Rosemary McNally
description: SCARSDALE, N.Y., Dec. 4 Miss Rosemary Theresa Mc Nally, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Joseph T. McNally, was married here this morning to Lieut. John N. Kulas, U.S.A.F., son of Mr. and Mrs. John S. Kulas of Brighton, Mass. The Rev. Dermot Brennan per formed the ceremony in the Immaculate Heart of Mary Roman Catholic Church.

title: 6 Traven Novels to Be Published Here
description: Almost three years after his death in Mexico City at the age of 79, the deliberately mysteri ous B. Traven, whose real name may or may not have been Tra ven Torsvan and who may or may not have been a German revolutionary in his youth, is having a literary naissance in the United States through pub lication of six novels he wrote in the nineteenthirties.

title: U.S. Supplies Bulletproof Vests To Some Asian and Latin Chiefs
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 4  Nguyen Van Thieu, the Presi dent of South Vietnam, has a bulletproof vest, supplied by the United States, to wear during public appearances.

title: The World
description: ROME  A thousand Senators, Deputies and regional Representatives will crowd into the Palazzo Monteci torio next Thursday to elect a succes sor to President Giuseppe Saragat, whose sevenyearterm expires this month. Thus, an insiders' drama that has absorbed the politicians for more than a year  amid the yawns of ordinary Italians  is at last reach ing its denouement.

title: Letters
description: To the Editor:

title: POINT OF VIEW
description: The multinational corpora tion today is a force that can serve global needs of man kind far better than the medieval concept of nation states.

title: A Colossus Rises on Hempstead Plains
description: HEMPSTEAD, L. I.While stands the Colosseum, Rome shall stand; when falls the Colosseum, Rome shall fall; and when Rome fallsthe world.

title: 2 NEGROES FREED BY ALABAMA COURT
description: MONTGOMERY, Ala., Dec. 4  Two young Negroes were released from an Alabama prison this week after spending six years under death sentence for rape. A third man convict ed in the same crime remains on death row because of disputed court record.

title: Hospital Feeding
description: General, modified, soft, bland, lowfat, lowcalorie and lowsodium. These ad jectives are used to describe diets in hospitals and, ac cording to those in the food busines, this creates a prob lem for them, as well as for those supervising hospital feeding.

title: Audie Murphy Family Sues
description: CLAREMONT, Calif., Dec. (AP)  The family of Audie Murphy, actor and World War II Medal of Honor winner, has filed a $10million suit in the plane crash that killed Mr. Murphy and six other persons last May. The defendants are the estate of the pilot, Herman Butler; the estates of Claude Crosby and Jack Littleton, busi nessmen who also died in the crash; Aero Commander, Inc.; the Lenoir Corporation; Comps Aircraft Service, Inc.; Colorado Aviation, Inc.; Modular Proper ties Co., Inc.; Dalton Carl Smith and Mike Fitzgerald, businessmen; Telestar, Inc.; Aero Bankers, Inc.; and Ameri can Western Plastics, Inc.

title: Riggs, Sherman Gain Final Of Senior Hardcourt Tennis
description: LA JOLLA, Calif., Dec. 4 (AP) Bobby Riggs, the national men's tennis champion more than three decades ago, earned a berth today in the final of the national senior hardcourt cham pionship.

title: Music
description: Craig McGregor is an Aus tralian who recently spent two years in the United States on a Harkness Fel lowship. Wherever he went, he listened to our pop mu sicfazz, rock, blues, folk, countryand talked with some of its important fig ures. The Times asked hint to set down the musical highlights of his stay. This article is his response.

title: FAILURE
description: TO THE EDITOR:

title: Warsaw Planning 2 New Tourist Hotels
description: WARSAW, Dec. 4Polish authorities have decided to build two Westernstyle ho tels in Warsaw, both in co operation with the Intercon tinental chain, as part of major effort to attract tourists.

title: TICKET SPLITTERS CALLED '70'S KEY
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 4 Swelling numbers of splittick et voters, wellinformed and surprisingly resistant to tele vised political advertising, hold the key to the elections of the seventies, according to a slim, statisticstudded new political book.

title: LAUREL RACE WON BY ASPHALT ROAD
description: LAUREL, Md., Dec. 4As phalt Road, unable to win in five previous starts, registered his first victory today when he closed with a rush in the last 70 yards to account for the $24,650 Senatorial for Marylandbred 2yearolds at Laurel Race Course.

title: He Found Success in Chicago
description: When Ishio Kawamura won the Gold Coast Award in Chicago two weeks ago, he had reason to be elated. He won out over 11 other designers, several of whom had refused to give him job a couple of years ago.

title: PREACHER TO OPEN MICHIGAN COLLEGE
description: MACKINAC ISLAND, Mich., Dec. 4  Mackinac College, founded by Moral ReArmament in 1965 and abandoned more than a year ago, is to reopen under the same name but in a new form next September.

title: Hope for the Very Young Who Are Deaf
description: Twenty special students enrolled at the Lexington School for the Deaf in Jack son Heights, Queens, head for the playroom each day in stead of the classroom.

title: Bridge Is there a doctor  at the table?
description: SUPPOSE you are a bridge patholo gist called in to examine the dead deal shown in the diagram. What con clusions would you reach?

title: LETTERS
description: To the Financial Editor:

title: Mrs. Ruth Smith to Wed
description: Mrs. Ruth Abed Smith of London and Parry Fitzgib bons, an investment banker with Lehman Brothers here, plan to be married. Their en gagement has been an nounced by Lady Huggins, mother of the bridetobe. Mrs. Smith, whose marriage ended in divorce, is the daughter also of the late Sir John Huggins, a former Gov ernor General of Jamaica, W. I. Her fianc is the son of Mrs. Harold E. Fitzgibbons of Duxbury, Mass., and the late Mr. Fitzgibbons.

title: Quincy Takes N.A.I.A. Title
description: DUNN, N. C., Dec. 4 (AP) Quincy Ill., won the National Association of Intercollegate. Athletics championship today by defeating Davis and Elkins of West Virginia, 10. Davis and Ekins was the defending champion.

title: LANDING PARTY FAILS IN DEBUT IN BRITAIN
description: CHEPSTOW, Wales, Dec. 4 (AP)  Landing Party, star American steeplechaser, made a disappointing British debut in a thick fog today.

title: TENANTS ADVISED TO BAR RENT RISE
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 4A tenant representative on the Rent Advisory Board counseled tenants today not to pay rent increases until the board issues comprehensive guidelines.

title: San Francisco Beats U.C.L.A.
description: SAN FRANCISCO, Dec. 4 (UPI)Alex Robustoff scored three goals today in pacing the University of San Francisco to a 62 victory over the Univer sity of California, Los Angeles in the N.C.A.A. Western region soccer playoffs.

title: Girl Blinded in Attack Begins Rehabilitation
description: ST. LOUIS, Dec. 4 (AP) Wilma Chestnut entered the Missouri school for the Blind this week to begin adjusting to life without the use of her eyes.

title: Brian Davis Fiancee Of Meredith Morten
description: DOVER, Mass., Dec. 4 Mr. and Mrs. John F. Morten of Dover and Moultonboro, N. H., made known the en gagement of their daughter, Miss Meredith Morten, to Brian W. Davis. He is the son of Mr. and Mrs. Elmer R. Davis of HastingsonHudson, N. Y. A wedding next June is planned.

title: Art Notes
description: IT'S a neat, suburban split level, as orderly as a Jo sef Albers painting, and the door is opened by Al bers hilmself, snowyhaired and rosyfaced, a cleareyed youth of 83 aware of prom ising future. Upstairs, in a liv ing room furnished in mono chromatic austerity, stands an original Marcel Breuer chair to remind you of Al bers' Bauhaus past. ('The couches are from Blooming dale's, reports his wife, Anni, heimischly materializ ing to offer coffee.) Four Al bers paintings adorn the walls and a few pieces of quiet sculpture, done by students and colleagues at Yale, sit like unobtrusive pets near the fireplace.

title: The Nation
description: A voice with a smile, according to Telephone Company promotion mate rial, is supposed to issue from the ear piece of your handset whenever you vocally encounter your local telephone operator. But, according to a complaint by the national Equal Employment Op portunity Commission last week, the voice has a good deal more cause to grimace than grin.

title: Holly E. Ratliff Plans Nuptials
description: SOUTH NORWALK, Conn., Dec, 4Mr. and Mrs. Philip Grady Amidon Ratliff of Wil son Point here have made known the engagement of their daughter, Miss Holly Everly Ratliff, to Ronald Marvin Klein, son of Mr. and Mrs. Jack Klein of New York. A June wedding is planned.

title: Huntington H.S. Choir Seeks to Tour Europe
description: HUNTINGTON, L. IMem bers of the Huntington High School Choir, which has earned a statewide reputa tion for excellence, are press ing their campaign to raise enough money to tour seven cities in Europe for two weeks next June.

title: Letters:
description: SCARCE IN VIENNA

title: Transport Losing Idea Man
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 4 The resignation of Charles D. Baker, a Staff thinker at the Department of Transporta tion, Strikes many observers here as an occasion for stock taking.

title: Cobble Hill Residents Trying to Save Lab
description: Residents of the Cobble Hill section of Brooklyn have joined architects and medical leaders in an effort to spare from demolition an 83year old landmark, the Dr. Corne lius Hoagland Memorial Lab oratory of Long Island Col lege Hospital.

title: Post Bows to Bridgeport
description: BRIDGEPORT, Conn., Dec. (AP)Bill Rayder scored two free throws just before the final whistle to assure Bridge port of an 8380 victory over C. W. Post tonight.

title: Mester Leads the Juilliard in Premiere of Penderecki's De Natura Sonoris II
description: I dropped into Tully Hall on Friday night primarily to hear the world premiere of Krzysztof Penderecki's De Natura Sonoris II. The work had been commissioned by the Juilliard School and was being performed by the Juilliard Orchestra, con ducted by Jorge Mester.

title: About Football Injuries
description: Mailbox:

title: Sydney Lickle Plans to Wed
description: WILMINGTON, Del., Dec. 4 Miss Sydney Cauffiel Lickle, a student at Bennett Colege in Millbrook, N. Y., plans to be married in June to Daniel F. Lindley, a senior at Williams College.

title: Postal Service Urges Early Christmas Mailing
description: With only 20 days remain ing till Christmas, the United States Postal Service made its annual appeal yesterday for its patrons to shop and mail early to avoid the ava lanche of Christmas cards and gift packages in the final days of the holiday season.

title: Man Is Killed in South Bronx
description: A 19yearold counter man was shot and killed yesterday in a pizzeria in the South Bronx and an unknown amount of money was taken from the cash register, the police said. The victim, Domingo Rosario, was found at 4 A.M., dying, be hind the counter of the restau rant at 1039 East 163d Street by another employe who was coming to work.

title: Pompidou: Monetary Crisis
description: PARIS, Dec. 4How to preserve the world in gen eral and France in particular from a trade slump and an economic recession is the problem that is expected to be uppermost in the mind of President Pompidou when he meets President Nixon in the Azores Dec. 13 and 14.

title: News Bill Passed on Coast
description: SACRAMENTO, Calif., Dec. 4 (UPI)  The State Assembly has approved and sent to Gov. Ronald Reagan legislation pro hibiting a newsman from being held in contempt of court for refusing to identify the sources of information gathered but not used. Newsmen currently cannot be held in contempt for refusing to divulge the source of information that is published I or broadcast. The bill passed Tuesday, would extend that privilege to unused informa tion.

title: Miss Mary Gorman Engaged to Officer
description: MANHASSET, L. I., Dec. 4 Gerard G. Gorman, general manager of trade develop ment for the Port of New York Authority, and Mrs. Gorman of Munsey Park have announced the engagement of their daughter, Miss Mary Lynn Gorman, to Lieut. Mi chael J. McRee, U.S.A., son of Mr. and Mrs. Nevel J. McRee of Millbrae, Calif.

title: Anne Culp and William N. Farran 3d to Wed in May
description: YARDLEY, Pa., Dec. 4 Miss Anne Rawlings Roberts Culp and William Neely Far ran 3d plan to be married on May 20 at the Morrisville Presbyterian Church.

title: Jackson State Trounces Alabama A. and M., 4021
description: MOBILE, Ala., Dec. 4Jack son State scored three touch downs in the first eight min utes today and romped to a 4021 victory over Alabama A. and M. in the first annual Azalea Classic.

title: Surcharge a Boon to Glass
description: The flat  glass industry, which has been hurt by for eign imports for several years, is breathing a little easier these days.

title: Truckers Called Unfair
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 3 (UPI) The Equal Employment Op portunity Commission charged the nation's trucking industry Friday with disgraceful dis crimination in its hiring prac tices. Women, blacks and Spanishsurnamed Americans are excluded from all but the lowestpaying jobs in the indus try, the commission said in brief filed with the Interstate Commerce Commission asking it to bar hiring discrimination among 15,000 interstate truck ing concerns employing over million persons.

title: Bucks Defeat Bulls, 108 to 105, on Allen's Jump Shot With 22 Seconds Left
description: MILWAUKEE, Dec. 4 (AP) Kareem Jabbar, after a oneday bout with the flu, came back with 41 points today as the Milwaukee Bucks scored a 108 1.05 National Basketball Associ ation victory over the Chicago Bulls on Lucius Allen's jump shot with 22 second left.

title: PLAN ON WELFARE IS CRITICIZED HERE
description: At a news conference yes terday, Mitchell I. Ginsberg, a former Human Resources Administrator, said the dem onstration projects were de structive to people, they won't work...they are ad ministratively impossible.

title: Ernest (Punch) Miller, 75, Early Jazz Trumpeter, Dies
description: NEW ORLEANS, Dec. 4 (AP) Ernest (Punch) Miller, one of the old trumpet men who helped spread jazz after World War I, died today in a hospital here. He was 75 years old.

title: Medicine
description: NEW ORLEANSTall, craggyfaced Wesley W. Hall is a surgeon in Reno, Nev., and current president of the American Medical Association. Often when he speaks in public in his slow western drawl with a faint undertone of his native Mississippi, his talk is larded with homely anecdotes and laced with Rotary Club jokes.

title: Announcements 5000
description: Births 5016

title: Coming In on a Wing and A Player
description: DECEMBER 27, 1984: I was inter viewing one of the must glamo rous Broadway superstars in her dressing room aboard a new United Airlines 798 from New York to Los Angeles. Live entertainment had been introduced to the airlines in 1971 when Frank Sinatra Jr. opened his new club act aboard a 747 and the idea had grown until, a few years later, as the planes themselves grew larger and larg er, fullfledged Broadway shows began being produced aboard the aircraft. This new 798 was the largest plane yetap proximately the size of two football fields, a bowling alley and Des Moines, Iowa, laid end to end.

title: Why Jenny can't see (very much)
description: PARENTS take their children to the dentist as a matter of course, complains an ophthahnologist associated with the New York Eye and Ear Infirm ary, but they don't seem to realize that its just as important to take them to the eye doctor.

title: THE creative ad shod making way an
description: Long Island: Dick Commer Advertising. Tel; (516) 6919595,Advt.

title: The World
description: SANTIAGOThe rhythmic pounding of empty pots and pans by thousands of Chilean womenlast week had the sound of war drums. In the most vio lent political demonstrations since President Salvador Allende Gossens took office 13 months ago, the oppo sition Christian Democratic and Na tional parties took to the streets in a protest march by women and stu dents. The incident left more than 100 persons injured, several with gunshot wounds.

title: HIGHLIGHTS OF THE WEEK
description: AMERICAN TELEPHONE said that its financing needs through 1975 might run as high as $25billion and that would rely more heavily on equity financing. . . . Sears, Roebuck said it would have record capital expenditures 1972. . . . International Harvester raised some prices by 3.93 per cent.

title: OBSERVER
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 4Mike was a fan. He cared deeply about the hometown team in any sport that happened to be played by a team in his home town in any given year.

title: Letters:
description: To THE EDITOR:

title: College Hockey, With Canadian Flavor, FastMoving Sport in United States
description: Hockey may be Canadian in origin, but the sport is becoming one of the fastest growing in the United States. No longer do skaters have to wait for frigid winds and freezing temperatures to solidify the ponds and lakes for shinny.

title: Action of Stream Opposed
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 4 (AP) Five environment groups have filed suit against the United States Soil Conserva tion Service to prevent the channelization of Chicod Creek in North Carolina. The groups said Thursday that it was the first legal challenge against the service's stream channelization program that, they said, envis ions the eventual alteration of some 150,000 miles of streams throughout the nation.

title: Youths Meet on 1972 Drive, and Politicians Pay Heed
description: CHICAGO, Dec. 4More than 2,500 young activists are meet ing here this weekend to organ ize a political movement they hope will tap the strength of the nation's 25 million new voters in next year's elections.

title: Planned Parenthood to Open Abortion Clinic Soon
description: Planned Parenthood of New York's new family planning center, which will open on Dec. 15, will be able to per form 8,000 to 10,000 lowcost abortions a year.

title: A Natural Beauty
description: Our new Interest in the natural world has played a part, one can be sure, in the spate of singularly attractive and informative books for those who want to know more about this planet's creatures and the environment they, in cluding man, need in order to survive.

title: Russian Vote in U.N. Kills TroopPullback Proposal
description: UNITED NATIONS, N. Y., Sun day, Dec. 5The Soviet Union vetoed early today in the Se curity, Council an American resolution calling for an im mediate ceasefire in the IndianPakistani conflict and for the withdrawal of the, armed forces of both countries to their own side of the border.

title: 3d Son to the Shannons
description: A son was born on Nov. 26 at Washington's Columbia Hospital to Mr. and Mrs. Wil liam V. Shannon. Mrs. Shan non is the former Miss Eliza beth McNelly, and her hus band is a member of the edi torial board of The New York Times. The child, the couple's third son, has been named David Patrick.

title: Hope Is Mingled With Cynicism as the Security Council, Once More, Meets to Cope With a FlareUp
description: UNITED NATIONS, N.Y., Dec. 4As the Security Council met on the IndianPakistani crisis, diplomats and officials here ex pressed mingled hope and cyni cism as they recalled past United Nations efforts at snuff ing out conflicts.

title: Constance Wise Engaged
description: PHILADELPHIA, Dec. 4 Randolph English Wise, Commissioner of the Phila delphia Department of Pub lic Welfare, and Mrs. Wise have announced the engage ment of their daughter, Miss Constance Randolph Wise, to Dr. Kenneth Michael Klein, a senior resident in pathology at the New York University Bellevue Medical Center. He is the son of Mr. and Mrs. Joseph Bernard Klein of the Bronx, New York. Mr. Klein is a commissioner of the New York City. Board of Standards and Appeals.

title: Progress at the Palazzo Corsini
description: PARISLuigi Barzini ob served in his book, The Ital ians, that while the Italians forget their defeats, the French look for victories.

title: School Ordered to Review Curb on Divorced Students
description: HOUSTON, Dec. 4 (UPI) United States District Judge Allen B. Hanney has told the Channelview, Tex., school dis trict that it ought to review its rules that prohibit divorced students from participating in extracurricular activities.

title: Acme Company Dances Lauren's Dream Nude
description: James Cunningham, a young choreographer who draws heav ily upon pop culture in his work, presented a new group piece by his Acme Dance Com pany as well as an old duet that had a new wrinkle and no clothes on Friday night at Jud son Church.

title: Stamps
description: SOME weeks ago this col umn reported on the Postal Service getting into the business of promoting the use and col lecting of United States post age stamps. There have been huge posters for sale and other gimmickryall good, mind you, if enough are pur chased (and they are) so as to relieve the taxpayer's load in maintaining the Postal Service. (Eventually, the Post al Service is to be a self sustaining quasigovernment corporation, paying its own way, unlike the former Post Office Department, which de pended upon multimillion dollar handouts from Con gress.)

title: NO. I ELEVEN GETS ITS NOTICE TODAY
description: The 14th annual National Football Foundation Hall of Fame awards dinner will be held Tuesday night in the Wal dorfAstoria hotel.

title: Books Can Be A Help
description: Coins

title: TAX RISE SOUGHT
description: Governor Rockefeller ordered the Legislature yesterday to convene in a special session on Dec. 27, saying he would ask it to approve $425million in new but unspecified taxes.

title: Friday Night Fights
description: New York (Felt Forum)George Foster, 139 1/4 pounds, New York. and Josue Marquez 137 1/2, Puerto Rico, drew, 10 rounds; Edwin Viruet, 135, Puerto Rico, and Seoul Mamby, 138, New York, drew, 10.

title: Seven Books of Special Significance Published in 1971
description: The Gift Relationship

title: For Young Readers: Tis the Season
description: There are 15 children's books with Christmas themes piled up in front of me. Three are worth buying, some are worth read ing, and a few are nothing more than the usual halfheart ed attempts to capture part of the Yuletide nostalgia market.

title: In Williamsburg, a School Board Dispute Simmers
description: Community School District 14 (Brooklyn's Williamsburg and Greenpoint sections), one of several in the city in which whites form the majority on boards that serve schools that are largely black and Puerto Rican, seems on the verge of going from one crisis to an other.

title: St. Francis Posts No. 3
description: St. Francis College posted its third victory in three starts last night, beating Le Moyne College of Syracuse, 8579, in a Middle Eastern Conference game.

title: CITY OFFERS PLAN ON CORONA SCHOOL
description: Deputy Mayor Richard R. Aurelio, in one of his last offi cial acts in the Lindsay admin istration, put forward a new compromise plan yesterday to end the fight about construc tion of a high school in the Co rona section of Queens.

title: RUNNING WILD: Cowboys' Ike Thomas begins 101yard scoring return of Jets' opening kickoff at Dallas. Right: Duane Thomas tallies in first period.
Hawks Down 76ers
description: ATLANTA, Dec. 4 (UPI) The Atlanta Hawks, using a new offense for the first time before the home crowd, won their second game in a row to night with a 126109 victory over the Philadelphia 76ers.

title: Typical Queens Ethnic Mix Vowed for Project
description: The New York City Hous ing Authority says it expects to be able to fill the contro versial lowincome housing project in Forest Hills almost entirely with applicants from nearby Queens communities, resulting in an ethnic mix of 65 per cent white and 35 per cent black, or maybe 6040.

title: LookBooks and NonBooks
description: Frankfurt Fair is over; the hectic days, the fevered nights, the intellec tual claustrophobia created by myri ads of books, the agony of being sub jected to constant sales pressure that only for a time submerges the greater anxiety of returning home empty handed. Is there nothing left on the stands of those masters of illustrated history booksWeidenfeld & Nicol son, Phaidon, Montadori, Fischer Ver lag, Hachette, Thames & Hudson and the rest? Every publisher must have two glossy books for the Christmas market, and these are the world's greatest purveyors  even a crumb from (them is welcome. They used to stand head and shoulders above the rest, but now almost every publisher is in the market.

title: More Britons Oppose End Of British Standard Time
description: LONDON, Dec. 4 (UPI)  A month ago, Britain bowed to popular demand and abandoned British Standard Timekeep ing the clock the same all year round like the rest of Western Europe. Clocks were turned back for the winter for the first time in three years.

title: Hoffa Is Upheld by Court On Delegation of Authority
description: CINCINNATI, Dec. 4 (AP) The United States Court of Ap peals for the Sixth Circuit ruled yesterday that James R. Hoffa, former president of the International Brotherhood of Teamsters, had had the power to delegate authority to his vice president, Frank E. Fitz simmons, to impose a trustee ship on Local 327 in Nashville.

title: Jersey School Units Accused Of Discrimination in Hiring
description: NEWARK, Dec. 4 The United States Department of Labor has filed suits in Fed eral District Court against nine New Jersey school districts, charging some with sex dis crimination and some with failing to pay time and a half for overtime after 40 hours.

title: Thieu Rules Out an Imposed Settlement
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, Dec. 4President Nguyen Van Thieu in a speech attempting to allay widespread fears among Viet namese politicians and officials that the United States and China are planning to impose a Viet nam settlement, declared today that any solution for the Viet nam war must come from the Vietnamese people.

title: Sandra Curran, John Nichols Jr. Married Here
description: Miss Alexandra M. Curran and John Doane Nichols Jr. of New York and Newport Beach, Calif., were married here yesterday afternoon in St James' Episcopal Church by the Rev. Ralph R. Warren Jr. A reception was given at the River Club.

title: California Lutheran Wins Football Crown
description: THOUSAND OAKS, Calif., Dec. 4 (AP)Lance Callo way's 93yard kickoff return for a touchdown and Mike Sheppard's score on a fake fieldgoal attempt helped California Lutheran College to beat Westminster of New Wilmington, Pa., 3014 to day for the football title of the National Association of Intercollegiate Athletics.

title: Letters:
description: A LASSERRE LAMENT

title: IN THE NATION
description: WASHINGTONThe Senate ap parently will confirm Lewis Powell next week as an Associate Justice of the Supreme Court. After that, it will either face up to or delay the far more controversial and difficult matter of William Rehnquist, President Nixon's other nominee to the Court.

title: Brooklyn's Ace Remembers
description: When Ace Parker, Brook lyn's Sunday matinee idol of 30 years ago was asked to remember Pearl Harbor, The Ace said his teammates didn't realize anything was up un til about the middle of the second quarterwe started to talk about it in the huddle.

title: Hempstead Town Map Available to Residents
description: HEMPSTEAD, L. I.A de tailed street map showing over 2,500 miles of town, county and state highways in the Town of Hempstead is available free to town resi dents.

title: Miss Spaulding To Be a Bride
description: HINGHAM, Mass., Dec. 4 Miss Martha Ann Spaulding, an alumna of Wheelock Col lege, plans to be married here in March to Charles Fontaine Martin, a doctoral candidate at the University of Califor nia at Berkeley.

title: Modern Museum Four Fridays Widely Acclaimed by Students
description: Danny Miller, a 17yearold student at Samuel Gompers Vo cational and Technical High School in the Bronx, had a great time at the Museum of Modern Art Friday evening. On his first visit there, he caught an hour of short movies by student filmmakers, audited a bouncy concert, Drumming, by a young composer, Steve Reich, checked out a solo dance performance by Merce Cunning ham and wandered through the galleries just looking.

title: Deborah Simmen Married to Francis J. Collin Jr.
description: SAN FRANCISCO, Dec. 4 Miss Deborah Simmen and Francis Joseph Collin Jr. were married here this afternoon in the Episcopal Church of St. Mary the Virgin. The ceremony was performed by the rector, the Rev. Richard P. Fowler, who was assisted by the Rev. John Kavanaugh, a Roman Catholic priest.

title: MAYOR APPROVES
description: The city transit fare would rise to 35 cents Jan. 1and hold there for two yearsun der a plan that Governor Rock efeller said yesterday he would submit to a special session of the state Legislature.

title: Music
description: IT Is just as well that Georg Solti and the Chicago Symphony Orchestra gave a concert performance of Arnold Schoenberg's Moses and Aaron in Carnegie Hall a week ago Saturday. The performance afforded New Yorkers a chance at least to hear the work, for there is no indication that anybody hereabouts is interested in staging it. Certainly neither the Metropolitan Opera nor the New York City Opera has displayed any interest (rumors of the repertory that Gran Gentele will bring to the Metropolitan in his first years do not include mention of the Schoenberg opera). Mr. Gentele may be a brave man, and so is Julius Rudel, but

title: U.S. COURT BACKS ALIEN'S MORALITY
description: An alien has won United States citizenship as a result of a Federal court definition of adultery.

title: Bethany Wins Mineral Bowl From Missouri Valley, 1714
description: EXCELSIOR SPRINGS, Mo., Dec. 4 (UPI)A 24yard field goal by Ken Pabst with six sec onds remaining today gave Bethany College of Lindsborg, Kan., a 1714 victory over Mis souri Valley in the 23d annual Mineral Water Bowl.

title: Bail of $350,000 Set for Suspect In Bank and Armory Robberies
description: A suspect in last Tuesday's holdup of the Harlem Savings Bank and the earlier theft of weapons from a Yonkers ar mory was held in lieu of $350,000 bail set in Manhattan Criminal Court yesterday.

title: McCarthy Campaigns for His Beliefs
description: BEMIDJI, Minn., Dec. 3 The young Minnesota reporter kept pressing former Senator Eugene J. McCarthy for an ex planation of his political in tentions for 1972. Finally, Mr. McCarthy formulated one.

title: Charles Volpe to Marry Joan Marie O'Connell in May
description: WEST CALDWELL, N. J., Dec. 4Mr. and Mrs. John Barry O'Connell have made known the engagement of their daughter, Miss Joan Marie O'Connell, to Charles Michael Volpe, son of Mrs. Charles M. Volpe of West Orange, and the late Mr. Volpe. A May wedding is planned.

title: Minnesota Sports Shifts Involve Warmath, Giel
description: MINNEAPOLIS, Dec. 4 (AP)Paul Giel, a former threesport star for the Uni versity of Minnesota, will succeed Marsh Ryman as the Gophers' athletic director, the Associated Press learned today.

title: Mrs. Sheila J. Dorsey Is Affianced
description: NORTH HAVEN, Conn., Dec. 4Mr. and Mrs. Lionel Stewart. Jackson of North Haven and East Hampton, L. I., have announced the en gagement of their daughter, Mrs. Sheila Jackson Dorsey of New York, to John Mon tague Bates Jr., son of Mr. and Mrs. Bates of Lake Os Wego, Ore.

title: Sailors Who Fled War Duty Are Awaiting Discharge
description: SAN FRANCISCO, Dec. 4 (AP)Eight sailors who re fused to sail for Vietnam on the aircraft carrier Constella tion and sought sanctuary in a San Diego church are await ing discharge at the Treasure Island naval station here, Navy spokesman says.

title: Unstinted Virtuosity Of Guarneri Group Caresses the Ear
description: If an election were to be held soon to choose the string quartet that does the smooth est playing this side of heaven, one of the first groups nomi nated would have to be the Guarneri Quartet. This ensem ble, composed of Arnold Stein hardt and John Dailey, violins; Michael Tree, viola, and David Soyer, cello, has achieved a per formance style that leaves al most nothing to be desired in regard to seemingly effortless technique and homogeneous sound.

title: U.S. Studies Feminine Sprays Safety
description: The vaginal deodorant, product that has grown into $53million business since it was first introduced in 196G, is now under intensive investi gation by the Food and Drug Administration on the ground that it may be hazardous to some women.

title: Esposito Enjoys Ties To Lindsay Association
description: The Democratic leader in Brooklyn, unlike his counter part in Queens, is on friendly terms with the John V. Lind say Association in his county.

title: PARISBONN TALKS ON CURRENCY GAIN
description: PARIS, Dec. 4France and West Germany agreed to monetary truce today after conversations in which the leaders of both countries ex pressed the hope that there would be a realistic realign ment of currencies in the near future.

title: REFUGEE PROBLEM IN CAMBODIA LAID TO ALLIED BOMBS
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 4  A team of Government investiga tors has concluded in a report prepared for the General Ac counting Office that American and South Vietnamese bombing is contributing substantially to the growing refugee problem in Cambodia.

title: A Mansion Symbolizes Hawaii
description: HONOLULUBreakfast for 14 at 6:40 A.M. is not an unusual event at Washington Place, the mansion of the Governor of Hawaii.

title: U.S.Brazil Science Pact Set
description: BRASILIA, Dec. 4 (AP) Brazil and the United States have signed an agreement to advance mutual scientific co operation. According to the terms of the fiveyear accord, each country will offer oppor tunity for interchange of ideas, information and technical re search in the scientific field.

title: Carr Out for a Week
description: CLEVELAND, Dec. 4 (AP) A rookie guard, Austin Carr of the Cleveland Cavaliers, will be out of action at least a week with a sprain of his twicebro ken right foot. Carr, who missed the first month and a half of the National Basketball Association season, suffered the sprain in last night's 9190 loss to the Buffalo Braves.

title: ANITOCH TO OPEN A SCHOOL OF LAW
description: YELLOW SPRINGS, Ohio, Dec. 4Antioch College plans to open in Washington a new law school that it says will be the first in the country to be based upon onthejob rather than classroom education.

title: Iona Tops Marist, 6356
description: POUGHKEEPSIE, N. Y., Dec. 4A secondhalf scoring burst by Gary Torigian sparked Iona College to a 6356 victory over Marist College tonight.

title: Art
description: AMONG a couple of hun dred other princely gewgaws that I wished I could take home with me from the Walters Art Gal lery in Baltimore after a visit last week, there is a sculp ture about 15 inches high as I remember it, extremely elaborate, golden in color (ac tually it is silver, parcel gilt), showing Diana riding a stag accompanied by three dogs and several turtles and other aquatic creatures on the sculpture's base, a cupid with quiver riding the stag's hind quarters, a lot of decorative curlicues, andI know it's hard to believea clockwork mechanism inside by which the whole contraption was geared to move about a din ing table so that any guest whose glass was empty could fill it by arresting this am bulatory pitcher, removing the stag's head, and pouring wine from its neck. All this in GermanyAugsburg about 1610.

title: Yablonski Trial Set Jan. 17
description: WASHINGTON, Pa., Dec. 4 (AP)Paul Gilly, named by a codefendant as one of the as sassins of Joseph A. Yablonski, his wife and daughter, is sched uled to go on trial here Jan. 17, Judge Charles G. Sweet decided yesterday. The judge said he would hold a hearing Jan. 7 to permit Mr. Gilly's two court appointed attorneys to make pretrial motions.

title: HILARIOUS?
description: TO THE EDITOR:

title: Travel Notes: Chinese Ghost Tour, Nostalgia at Sea, Japanese Ecology
description: EVER since our Ping Pong players floun dered against the pen holder grip in Peking last spring, a lot of people in the travel business have been brushing up on their Chinese. A host of travelers who would like to see the Great Wall have had their names put down on provi sional lists drawn up by tour operators who are looking forward to the day when the Peoples' Republic opens its doors to tourists. It is not possible to go there yet, of course; the Chinese are not about to issue visas for va cationers  not yet anyway. However, a number of travel organizations have mapped out phantom tour plans for China  subject, they hur riedly point out, to approval by Peking and visa issue.

title: PANEL MAY RAISE TEXTILE PROFITS
description: The Price Commission, in response to an industrywide request from textile manufac turers, is seriously considering liberalizing one of the rules that limits business profits.

title: More Words and Pictures
description: Popular myth presents the artist as ill at ease with words, a reticent and inarticulate exponent of his own aims and means; yet a treasury of evidence in the form of essays, lectures, memoirs, letters, even poetrywritings with a satisfying and inherent authenticity  proves quite the contrary. The modern period in particular, beset by con troversy, has seen a continual stream of rationalization and, prone to suc cessive palace revolutions, a plenti ful literature of manifestos.

title: Bulgaria Soccer Victor
description: SOFIA, Dec. 4 (AP)Bulgaria defeated France, 2.1, today in Group Two of the European soccer championship qualifica tion round, eliminating France from any chance for group lead ership and establishing Hungary as the group winner.

title: Schoolboy Athletes With Poor Marks Get Prep Help for College
description: A patch of concrete and two tilted backboards. For hundreds, perhaps thousands, of youngsters in Brooklyn this is an oasis in a tene ment wasteland.

title: Pacers Beat Cougars
description: INDIANAPOLIS, Dec. 4 (AP) Mel Daniels scored 27 points and Bob Netolicky and Rick Mount 21 each to lead the Indiana Pacers to a 115108 vic tory over the Carolina Cougers tonight.

title: Studdard of Jets Hospitalized After Having Concussion
description: IRVING, Tex., Dec. 4 Quick action on the sidelines in the fourth quarter of the Jets' game with Dalas today averted possibe serious injury to Vern Studdard, a rookie member of New York's kick ing teams.

title: Television
description: HOW come none of my favorite TV actors are married? my wife Ruth asked. As always, I tried to be patient with such questions. Tony Curtis, I reminded her, has been married several times.

title: ITALY OVERCOMES BRITAIN IN BRIDGE
description: ATHENS, Dec. 4Overcom ing two handicaps, Italy over whelmed her British rivals in the final round of the Europe an contract bridge champion ships today.

title: Baseball Ends Busiest Trade Week Seeking Clues to Revolving Door Policy
description: PHOENIX, Ariz., Dec. 4The busiest week in baseball trad ing history ended today with the general feeling of more to come and the big question was: Why?

title: Speed Skating Mark Set
description: INZELL, West Germany, Dec. 4 (UPI)West Germany's Mon ika Plug turned a 2:21.8 time into a national 1,500meter record at an invitation speed skating meet. The 16yearold girl, a 16th placer in this year's world championships, also held the previous mark of 2:23.0.

title: Gridiron Club to Invite Women Dinner Guests
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 4 The Gridiron Club, an organ ization of 50 prominent news papermen, voted 24 to 17 to day to invite women guests to its annual, spring whitetie dinner.

title: The 8:00 P.M. From Moscow to Peking Is Dead On Time
description: Moscow.

description: To the Editor:

title: Tennille Dix Is Betrothed
description: Mr. and Mrs. Norman Brooke Dix of New York and Westhampton Beach, L. I., have announced the engage ment of their daughter, Miss Joy Tennilie Dix, to Robert Amzallag, son of Mr. and Mrs. Aim Amzallag of Paris, where the wedding will take place next month.

title: 6.7 MILLION CARS FACE G.M. RECALL
description: DETROIT, Dec. 4The Gen eral Motors Corporation said today that it would recall near ly 6.7 million Chevrolet auto mobiles and trucks to correct what the Federal authorities and other critics call a major safety hazard.

title: The World
description: CAIRO  Egyptians shed no tears last week for Wasfi alTal, the Pre mier and Defense Minister of Jordan, who was assassinated at the doorstep of the fashionable Sheraton Hotel. The 51yearold Premier had incurred deep hostility in Egypt and throughout the Arab world by his direction of the Jordanian Government campaign that broke the power of the Palestinian guerrilla movement.

title: JULIAN D. BERNSTEIN
description: Julian a Bernstein, a real estate lawyer in Manhattan for more than 40 years, died yes terday morning at Mount Sinai Hospital after a long illness. He was 66 years old and lived at 315 East 72d Street.

title: Boyle Asks Congress to Set Strong Strip Mining Rules
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 4 (AP) W. A. Boyle, president of the United Mine Workers of Amer ica, urged Congress today to set strong regulations on strip mining.

title: New Troop Cuts Foreseen
description: SAIGON, Dec. 4Authorita tive American officials said today that American troop withdrawals would reduce the number of G.I.'s in Vietnam to 40,000 to 60,000 by next June 30.

title: the traveler's world
description: Examining the Great American Tourist

title: Seventh Ave. West
description: LOS ANGELESA more familiar rhythm greets a New Yorker as he walks south east in downtown Los An geles. At Ninth and Los An geles Streets, the customary casual pace steps up to moderate bustle.

title: 13 Killed and 19 Hurt in Belfast When Explosion Wrecks a Pub
description: BELFAST, Northern Ireland, Sunday, Dec. 5 At least 13 persons were killed by an ex plosion that ripped apart a Bel fast pub last night, wrecking threestory building. Nineteen persons were injured and hours later rescue workers were still searching the rubble for sur vivors.

title: Adelphi's 3 R's (Readin', Ritin on a Railroad) Is Proving a Big Success
description: GARDEN CITY. L. I.,  Adelphi University's program of offering graduate courses in business administration aboard commuting class rooms on the Long Island Railroad has proved so suc cessful that it will be ex panded.

title: Movies
description: JANE FONDA and Donald Sutherland, who have been known to partici pate in activities of a political nature, will soon participate in a movie about a pair of political activists. In Whose Heaven, Whose Earth?, to be adapted from the recently published mem oirs of Thomas and Marjorie Melville, Sutherland and Miss Fonda will play a former Catholic priest and nun who were accused of aiding, leftist groups in Guatemala. Eventu ally, they married and were tried and convicted  along with Father Daniel Berrigan  as members of the Catons ville Nine. The film, to be written by Walter Bernstein, will begin shooting this spring in Latin America for indepen dent producers Hannah Wein stein and Norman Eisner.

title: Providence Defeats Brown
description: PROVIDENCE, R. I., Dec. 4 (AP)The rebounding and scoring of Marvin Barnes led Providence College to an 8161 victory over Brown University in Alumni Hall tonight.

title: Dorothy Mather Kellogg to Marry
description: PALM BEACH, Fla., Dec. 4 Mr. and Mrs. William Charles Torkington have an nounced the engagement of Mr. Torkington's stepdaugh ter, Miss Dorothy Mather Kellogg of New York, to James Robert Borynack, son of Mr. and Mrs. Alexander Paul Borynack of Valley Stream, L. I. The wedding is planned for spring in New York.

title: Can Wages Be Controlled?
description: WASHINGTON REPORT

title: Sato: Worries About Peking
description: TOKYO, Dec. 4Of all the nations affected by president Nixon's trip to Peking, Japan is the most nervous. China is Japan's major rival, for influ ence in Asia and, in the eyes of many Japanese, is becom ing, a worrisome nuclear threat.

title: Chess
description: THE new champion of the U.S.S.R. is 41yearold international mas ter Vladimir Savon, whose name is usually followed, in all but the most knowledgeable of chess circles, by the word Who?

title: Villanova Sets Back Detroit
description: DETROIT, Dec. 4 (UPI) Villanova, paced by Chris Ford, and Hank Siemontkowski, used a fullcourt zone press to over come an early University of Detroit lead and defeat the Titans, 8364, tonight.

title: ScatterSite Project Begun In Greenburgh Ceremony
description: WHITE PLAINS, N. Y., Dec. 4Groundbreaking ceremonies here today marked the start of construction of what Federal officials said was the first scattersite, lowincome hous ing projects the Government has funded in the New York suburbs.

title: Chase Says City Prisons Health Care Is Improving
description: Health Services Administra tor Gordon Chase said yester day that although health care in city prisons was still not nearly good enough, some real improvements are being made.

title: Attempt to Oust Radical Professor Stirs Violence on the Coast
description: SAN DIEGO, Dec. 4Several months of mounting tension at San Diego State College erupted in violence this week at a dis ciplinary hearing for a young economics professor who de scribes himself as a Marxist radical and admirer of Mao Tse tung and Fidel Castro.

title: Racing Is Urged to Attract Young Fans
description: A young visitor from the West Coast surprised a rac ing seminar here the other day by opening and closing his speech with what sounded like a paradox:

title: Miss Mary C. Roudebush Plans Marriage to Walter Nowotny Jr.
description: ST. LOUIS, Dec. 4The engagement of Miss Mary Coleman Roudebush to Wal ter William Nowotny Jr., an assistant Attorney General of Missouri, has been an nounced by her parents, Mr. and Mrs: George Shotwell Roudebush. Mr. Nowotny is a son of Mr. and Mrs. Walter William Nowotny.

title: LAKERS TRIUMPH FOR 17TH IN ROW
description: INGLEWOOD, Calif., Dec. 51 (AP)  Happy Hairston and Jerry West pumped in 20 points apiece as the Los Angeles Lakers scored their 17th con secutive victory by whipping the Portland Trail Blazers, 123107, in the National Bas ketball Association tonight.

title: M'GOVERN FINDING PEACE A BIG ISSUE
description: WAUSAU, Wis., Dec. 5The war in Indochina has always been a special preoccupation of Senator George McGovern.

description: To the Editor:

title: India Summons U. S. Envoy
description: NEW DELHI, Monday, Dec. 6 (Reuters)India's Secretary for Foreign Affairs, T. N. Kaul, has asked the United States Ambassador, Kenneth Keating, to meet him today to receive New Delhi's protest against the United States' criticism of In dia's action in the conflict with Pakistan.

title: DeficitRidden Dance Collection Pins Hopes on a Gala
description: On Jan. 24, Dame Margot. Fonteyn, Violette Verdy, Ed ward Villella, Judith Jamison, Natalia Makarova and other ballet and modern dance stars will shake a collective leg at the City Center, in a gala performance for the benefit of the Dance Col lection of the New York Pub lic Library.

title: Price Panel Likely to Allow 5% Rise in Hospital Costs
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 5The Price Commission is expected to rule this week, in a depar ture from its other decisions during Phase Two of the wage price freeze, that hospital charges will be allowed to rise between 5 and 6 per cent.

title: Vermont Landmark Leveled
description: BURLINGTON, Vt., Dec. 5 (AP)  A fire destroyed the Ethan Allen Club, a landmark near the University of Vermont, early today. The cause of the blaze was not determined, but firemen said it had apparently started in the kitchen area of the twostory brick structure, which was built in 1834. The Ethan Allen Club is a private men's club.

title: CON ED WILL CLOSE S.I. PLANT FEB. 29
description: Consolidated Edison said Yesterday it would shut its controversial coalburning plant at Arthur Kill in Staten Island by Feb. 29 and convert it with in 10 weeks to the use of low pollution oil or gas fuels.

title: CURRENCY TALKS LIFT BOND PRICES
description: The credit markets, though still worried about prospects for, reduced inflation under Phase Two, turned the atten tion last week to the interne tional financial scene, from which they derived a consider able amount of encouragement.

title: GOVERNOR TO SEEK RISE IN SALES TAX OR IN INCOME LEVY
description: State Budget Director Rich ard L. Dunham said yesterday that Governor Rockefeller's proposal for $425million in new state taxes would require increases in either personal in come or sales tax.

title: A Reply to Mr. Davies
description: JERUSALEM  Deputy Assistant Secretary of State Richard T. Davies on Nov. 9 presented an assessment of The Jewish Condition in the U.S.S.R. to a Congressional hearing, and, as a Soviet Jew only recently permitted to emigrate to Israel, I read this im portant policy statement with great care.

title: William Floyd 2, Owner Of lenox Hill book Shop
description: William Floyd 2d, owner of the Lenox Hill Book Shop at 1186 Madison Avenue since 1945, was pronounced dead Sat urday night in Queens Hospital Center, to which he was taken after having suffered a heart attack in the subway. He was 61 years old and lived at 45 East 82d Street.

title: TESTS ON INSECTS HALT LIFE CYCLES
description: MENLO PARK, Calif., Dec. 5  Some initial success with new substances designed to control insects biologically ra ther than chemically was re ported in California last week.

title: Bridge: Italian Stars to Meet the Aces In Las Vegas Tomorrow Night
description: ATHENS, Dec. 5Two in comparable players and in defatigable world travelers left the scene of their Euro pean championship triumph here today. Benito Garozzo and Giorgio Belladonna, both of Rome, are en route to Las Vegas, where they begin play Tuesday evening for the Blue team against the world cham pion Aces.

title: BROWNS TRIUMPH, REACH PLAYOFFS
description: CLEVELAND, Dec. 5Don't go home early. We're going to win this game yet, Dr. Vic Ippolito told the crowd of 82, 705, most of them Browns' fans, at halftime today. The diagnosis proved correct at a time when the Browns were behind Cincinnati, 2014, and badly in need of a transfusion.

title: Flyers Seat Seals, 3.0
description: PHILADELPHIA, Dec. 5 (UPI) Firstperiod powerplay goals by Larry Keenan and Jimmy Johnson paced the Philadelphia Flyers to a 30 victory over the California Golden Seals tonight.

title: WARSAW PACT CHIEFS MEET FOR CONGRESS
description: WARSAW, Dec. 5 (UPI)The leaders of the Warsaw Pact, headed by Leonid I. Brezhnev, the Soviet party chief, arrived today for the sixth congress of the Polish Communist party.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: 5th Ave. Russian Shop Bombed; A 2d Blast Averted Downtown
description: A crude bomb exploded yes terday in the doorway of a Fifth Avenue gift shop special izing in Russian products. No injuries were reported.

title: COMPUTER TO GRADE TESTS OF STUDENTS
description: Community School District 9 in the Bronx has introduced a $1.5  million computer  moni tored reading program to im prove the reading levels of 7, 000 pupils.

title: Farming Cooperatives Offer Hope to Blacks in Mississippi Area
description: MILESTONE, Miss.It was cool for the Mississippi Delta, but Walter Caesar Jr. perspired heavily and bits of cotton clung to his broad, black face as he moved an ungainly me chanical cotton picker back and forth across his 26 acres of ripened cotton.

title: Undertakers' Feud Halted in France
description: FREYMINGMERLEBACH, France. Dec. 1It has been three months since the latest unseemly row over a coffin in FreymingMerlebach. A truce appears to have been imposed in La Guerre des CroqueMortis (The War of the BodySnatchers).

title: Caucus Formed to Organize Youths for '72 Election
description: CHICAGO, Dec. 5  Exactly four years ago, 300 people met here in Chicago to form a movement that many of them credit with forcing President Johnson into retirement. This weekend, 3,000 young political organizers gathered here again, and started another movement to unseat an incumbent Presi dent.

title: City Policeman Indicted
description: Patrolman Joseph Tanner, 26 years old, was arrested yesterday and suspended from the Police Department after a Brooklyn grand jury handed up a sealed indictment charg ing him with robbery, grand larceny, attempted grand lar ceny and assault, the police said. No further details were made public.

title: Article 1  No Title
description: GENEVA, Dec. 5The Inter national Committee of the Red Cross today called on India and Pakistan to comply with the Geneva conventions.

title: 8 Die, 1 Hurt in California As Truck Flips and Burns
description: LIVERMORE, Calif., Dec. 5 (UPI)  Eight persons were killed and one was injured last night when the light van in which they were riding over turned and exploded into flames at Altamont Pass on In terstate 580 near here.

title: 2d Student Hit by Car Dies
description: CHESTER, Pa., Dec. 5 (AP) A second high school stu dent died today of injuries suf fered Friday night when a car plowed through a group of persons as they were leaving a basketball game. The death of 15yearold Judith Brown occurred a day after. Robert Merritt, 35 turned himself in to the police, who charged him with involuntary, manslaugh ter. Nancy Dimmette,15, was pinned under the car and died within hours.

title: Sabres' Ramsay Scores
description: BUFFALO, Dec. 5 (UPI) Craig Ramsay scored three goals tonight, his first goals in the N.H.L., to spark the Buf falo Sabres to a 31 victory over the Minnesota North Stars. The rookie was recalled two weeks ago from thte Sabres' Cincinnati farm team.

title: G.M.'S RECALL COST PUT AT $25MILLION
description: DETROIT, Dec. 5 (AP)Gen eral Motors prepared today to implement the recall of nearly 6.7 million Chevrolets for in stallation of an inexpensive re straint to counter the effects of a possibly defective engine mount.

title: Clouds Over Italy
description: Has Italy become the sick man of Western Europe?

title: Foreigners Evacuated
description: RAWALPINDI, Dec. 5With Indian air attacks over West Pakistani cities apparently in creasing and the Indian Navy threatening Karachi harbor, 378 foreign civilians, mostly Ameri cans, were evacuated from Karachi today.

title: Rehnquist '52 Schools Memo Reported
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 5Wil liam H. Rehnquist was reported today to have argued, when he was a law clerk at the Supreme Court, that the legal challenge to public school segregation then before the Court should be rejected.

title: 2 VIRUSES FOUND IN CANCER STUDIES
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 5 Research workers here and on the West Coast have announced the discovery of two new can didates for the ominous title of human cancer virus.

title: IRVING BAUM
description: Irving Baum, vice president and treasurer of the accounting firm of H. A. Astlett & Co. since 1920, died Saturday in Mai monides Hospital. He was 75 years old and lived at 140 Ocean Parkway, Brooklyn.

title: Alex Rose Rules Out Any Role in Lindsay's Present Presidential Campaign
description: Alex Rose, the Liberal party leader who has been one of Mayor Lindsay's principal ad visers, said yesterday that he would not be involved in the Mayor's unofficial Presidential campaign.

title: Soccer Referees' Sick Call Fails to Disrupt Schedule
description: Despite a massive sick call of soccer referees in the New York metropolitan area, most of the games scheduled yester day were played when the teams used spectators and re tired referees to officiate.

title: Simon and Pucinski Picked For Illinois Democratic Slate
description: CHICAGO, Dec. 5 (AP) Lieut. Gov. Paul Simon was slated for Illinois Governor and United States Representative Roman C. Pucinski of Chicago was picked to run for the Sen ate today by the Democratic party slatemaking subcom mittee.

title: RECOGNITION STEP
description: NEW DELHI, Monday, Dec. 6  India today recognized the East Pakistan rebel move ment as the government of that area as Indian troops con tinued to advance into the eastern province of Pakistan.

title: Ellison Sets Rushing Mark as Rains Win, 4528
description: LOS ANGELES, Dec. 5  Willie Ellison of the Los Angeles Rams set a National Football League rushing record of 247 yards today as the Rams raced to a 4528 victory over the New Orleans Saints.

title: Riggs Takes Senior Title
description: LA JOLLA, Calif., Dec. 5 (UPI)Bobby Riggs of Plan dome, L.I., defeated Bob Sher man of Arcadia, 75, 4.6, 64, to win the national senior hardcourt tennis title today. In the women's final, Barbara Weigandt of North Hollywood beat Nancy Neeld of Albu querque, N.M., 76; 06, 75.

title: LAWMAKERS MEET ON COAST TODAY
description: SACRAMENTO, Calif., Dec. 5 The California Legislature, weary after a nearly year round session, will return to Sacramento tomorrow to a spe cial session ordered by Gov. Ronald Reagan to pass a budgetbalancing tax measure.

title: Foreclosure on Slum: New Housing Move
description: WARMINSTER, Pa.  The Government National Mortgage Association, a Federal agency that holds $5billion in housing mortgages, has for the first time foreclosed on a project for a social, rather than a fi nancial, reason.

title: Niederhoffer Beats Nayar In Final of Gold Racquets
description: CEDARHURST, L. I., Dec. 5 Vic Niederhoffer of New York, competing in his first tourna ment after a fiveyear layoff, won the 40th squash Gold Racquets invitation event to day by defeating Anhil Nayar of Boston, 715, 1511, 915, 1614, 157, at the Rockaway Hunting Club.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: Roosevelt Brown in Crash
description: TEANECK, N. J., Dec. 5 (AP) Roosevelt Brown, the former New York Giants' star tackle, was injured tonight in an auto mobile accident here and under went surgery at Holy Name Hospital. A hospital spokesman said he had been badly hurt.

title: French Satellite Fails
description: PARIS, Dec. 5 (Reuters)  A French scienific satellite failed to go into orbit tonight after a perfect launching from Kou rou in French Guiana, France's national space center an nounced. The cause of the fail ure is believed to have been malfunction of the second stage of a French Diamant B rocket fired from the South American launching site. The 213pound satellite, called the D2A Po laire, was designed to study distribution of hydrogen in the atmosphere.

title: Personal Finance: TaxJuggling Tips
description: There are four weeksto go before 1973 and tithe enough to do some last minute tax planning about income and outgo.

title: Strike Only One Catholic School Problem
description: News Analysis

title: More MIG Activity Over Laos Concerns U.S. Air Chief
description: PHUCAT, South Vietnam, Dec. 5The Secretary of the United States Air Force, Rob ert C. Seamans Jr., expressing concern about the increased ac tivity of North Vietnamese MIG21 fighters over the Ho Chi Minh trail in Laos, said to day that this year, for the first time, the South Vietnamese Air Force would also be bombing the trail.

title: CREDIT UNIONS SET CHECKING SERVICE
description: PROVIDENCE, R. I., Dec 5 Four large state chartered credit unions in Rhode Island are opening checking account serv ices under an enabling statute enacted by the General Assem bly last year.

title: Advertising:
description: Judging from the agency people we've talked to, there seems to be general approval of Life magazine's plan to get more money, from sub scribers.

title: Community Units Demand New Fordham Hospital
description: If we have to riot, loot and demonstrate, to get a long expected new Fordham hospital from the state, Raymond Perez told his neighbor, I guess we're going to do it.

title: Two Greek Ships Strafed
description: ATHENS, Dec. 5 (Reuters) Two Greekowned cargo ships were strafed by Indian aircraft while sailing off the coast of East Pakistan yesterday, a spokesman for the Greek Min istry of Merchant Marine said tonight.

title: Dance: A RollerCoaster
description: There is little in ballet quite like a weekend spent with New York City Ballet. No other company can give you such a rollercoaster trip of goods, bads and indiffer ents quite so passionately. From Friday to Sunday I saw four performances (on Satur day night I played hookey to go to the Met's sumptuous Tristan and Isolde and helped save my sanity), and they certainly did nothing if not vary.

title: IRVING NUSBLATT
description: EAST ROCKAWAY, L.I., Dec. 5Irving Nusblatt, president of the Sweetwater Carpet Cor poration of New York, died to day at his home; Twin Gables. He was 66 years old.

title: 8 Foods Here Are Found With OverCeiling Prices
description: Twenty per cent of 40 com mon pricefrozen food items were sold in some stores here at levels higher than their ceil ing prices after the 90day freeze ended on Nov. 14.

title: General Stability In Exchange Rates Noted in October
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 5Ek cept for Japan and possibly Britain, there was apparently littler or no intervention by foreign, central banks in Octo ber to hold down the upward float of their currencies against the dollar, International Mon etary Fund figures disclosed to day.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: 66 Migrants Held as Aliens
description: APOPKA, Fla., Dec. 5 (AP) Agents of the Border Patrol arrested 66 migrant workers in a labor camp near here early today on charges of violating United States immigration laws.

title: Pope Fears Involvement Of Other Nations in War
description: ROME, Dec. 5Pope Paul VI expressed fear today that the war between India and Pakistan could involve other countries.

title: ANTIWAR GROUPS TO PROTEST HERE
description: CLEVELAND, Dec. 5The antiwar movement, worried about the upcoming election year when many of its sup porters turn to the ballot rather than demonstrations, de cided this weekend to hold its next mass protest in April New York; the movement's traditional stronghold.
