title: Castro Back in Cuba
description: HAVANA, Dec. 5 (Reuters) Premier Fidel Castro arrived home today after a 25day visit to Chile, with brief stops in Peru and Ecuador.

title: Freight Derails Near Seattle
description: EDMONDS, Wash., Dec. 5 (AP) Thirty cars of a Burlington Northern freight train derailed south of here last night and 12 of the cars went over a seawall at the edge of Puget Sound. No one was injured. The route is the only Burlington Northern con nection between Seattle, which is 13 miles south of the wreck site, and Vancouver, British Co lumbia.

title: QUEENS PROTEST DRAWS OVER 1,000
description: More than 1,000 Queens resi dents turned out yesterday for what has become a Sunday morning ritual in Forest Hills a demonstration against the lowincome housing projects being built at 108th Street and the Horace Harding Express way.

title: Liora Sarch, Pianist, Touches Many Bases
description: Liora Sarch, a gifted young pianist who was born in Israel, was raised in Venezuela and at present lives in New York with her husband, Kenneth Sarch, the violinist, made her debut at Alice Tully Hall yesterday after noon. Her short program touched many stylistic bases, all of them effectively, and re vealed an artist of considerable temperament.

title: Lowe Wins Jersey Final
description: MONTCLAIR, N. J., Dec. 5 Arthur Lowe of the Downtown Athletic Club won the Subur ban Invitation squash racquets tournament today by defeating Edward Vaughan of the Uni versity Club, 1513, 1318, 1511, 157, at the Montclair Y.M.C.A.

title: Weeb and Joe at Appomattox, Tex.
description: Sports of The Times

title: Old, Smaller Token Is Expected in City If Fare Goes to 35c
description: If the fare gets larger next month, the token probably will get smaller. In fact, it probably will be the old token, smaller than a dime, in use here when the fare was 20 cents. Most elected officials and transit leaders expect the fare here to go to 35 cents on Jan. 1.

title: A PRAYDA ARTICLE ATTACKS MAOISM
description: MOSCOW, Dec. 5The So viet Union stepped up its ideo logical warfare against China today with the publication of a lengthy article labeling Maoism a utilitarian, pragmatic ide ology that puts the nationalis tic interests op China above everything else.

title: Resolutions Submitted to U.N. Council
description: UNITED NATIONS, N. Y., Dec. 5Following are opera tive portions of resolutions on the IndianPakistani dis pute that were introduced in the Security Council. The resolutions are those of the United States; of the Soviet Union; of eight countries jointly (Argentina, Belgium, Burundi, Italy, Japan, Nica ragua, Sierra Leone and So malia); of five countries jointly (Belgium, Japan, Ni caragua, Sierra Leone and Italy), and of China. The United States, Soviet and eightnation resolutions were defeated, and the Chinese proposal was withdrawn be fore being put to a vote.

title: Hawks Rout Kings, 7.0
description: CHICAGO, Dec. 5 (AP)Bob by Hull and Darryl Maggs scored two goals each and Gary Smith recorded his second shut out of the season tonight as the Chicago Black Hawks beat the Los Angeles Kings, 70.

title: Indian Advance Leaves Bengali Village in Ruins
description: SUADIH, Pakistan, Dec. 5 The ruins of this small East Pakistani village are still smoldering  the mud huts with thatch roofs smashed by Indian artillery shells hom ing in on retreating Paki stani troops.

title: Resolving the Monetary Crisis
description: The Rome meetings of the Group of Ten major finan cial nations have produced a measure of optimism that basically stems from a belief that the international monetary crisis is on its way toward early resolution.

title: BREWER AND SHIPLEY SING ABOUT CANNABIS
description: It was another one of those good vibes nights at Carnegie Hall Friday. Mike Brewer and Tom Shipley, a fine, gentle, ex tremely musical folksinging duo, had me believing, for an hour or so, that peace and love were still alive.

title: Nixon Returns to Capital After Weekend in Florida
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 5 (AP) President Nixon returned to the White House tonight after a threeday Florida weekend.

title: Few Price and Pay Abuses Of U. S. Guidelines Found
description: Although some businessmen complained last week about a sudden rash of higher prices, it appeared that, for the most part, the increases were legal and few of the abuses that had been reported during the World War II and Korean War economiccontrol periods hid appeared.

title: Questions and Answers on Price Control
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 5 Following are questions and answers issued today by the Internal Revenue Service as further explanation of the Government's economic sta bilization program:

title: Advertising:
description: After four years as chair man. of Young & Rubicam, Edward L. Bond Jr. is turn ing, that title over to Edward N. Ney, who for the past year has been president and chief executive.

title: Honored by Jewish Seminary
description: BOSTON, Dec. 5 (AP) The Eternal Light Medal of the Jew ish Theological Seminary of America was awarded today to Ollie A. Cohen, chairman of the board of King's department stores, at a dinner in honor of the retiring chancellor of the seminary in New York. The sem inary is the divinity school for the training of conservative rab bis in the United tSates.

title: John Kemper, Headmaster At Andover, Is Dead at 59
description: ANDOVER, Mass., Dec. 5 John Mason Kemper, for 23 years headmaster of Phillips Academy, the nation's oldest and one of its most prestigious preparatory schools, died last night of cancer at Isham In firmary Hospital On the cam pus. He was 59 years old.

title: Tartans: A Current Fashion With a Long History
description: There are more than 850 clan, district and regimental tartans, and a lot of people are convinced that every one of them has appeared on the fashion scene this season. It isn't so, despite the eye shattering array of crossbarred checks showing up in the stores and on the streets. Tartans are everywherefor all ages and in every price rangeand indi cations are that they will also be popular for spring. But plaid, tartan's first cou sin, is equally visible, and although the two may be synonymous in some minds, no knowledgeable Scot would ever con fuse the two.

title: FINLANDIA HOUSE OPENS IN HELSINKI
description: HELSINKI, Finland, Dec. 5 This Finnish capital, the city of Jean Sibelius, saw the ful fillment of a centuryold dream with the opening last night of Finlandia House, a concert and conference hall.

title: Caroline KennedySees Opera and Tours Arts Center
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 5 Caroline Kennedy saw the Verdi opera Falstaff this afternoon at the John F. Kennedy Center for the Per forming Arts and made a, carefully guarded tour of the center's art and sculpture, including the monumental bust of her father. I like it, she said of the center before politely side stepping reporters who met her at intermission. Was it what she expected? I wasn't expecting anything, she said.

title: DeGo Hubert Named Best at Atlantic City
description: ATLANTIC CITY, Dec. 5A doughty West Highland white terrier, Jane Esther Hender son's Ch. DeGo Hubert from Stockton, N.J., scored over the two topranking dogs in Amer ica tonight at Convention Hall in the Boardwalk Kennel Club fixture.

title: NEBRASKA PASSES ROUT HAWAII, 453
description: HONOLULU, Dec. 5 (UPI) Topranked Nebraska routed Hawaii, 453, last night to close out the regular season with a 120 wonlost record.

title: U.S PANEL SEEKS. REDTAPE CUTTERS
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 5 (UPI) A divided Congressional panel recommended today that the Federal Government put up the money to pay for 40,000 lo cally elected persona to cut red tape and this help citizens to deal with their national Gov ernment.

title: Colony Restaurant Closes Amid Tears
description: The Colony, long con sidered New York's most fashionable restaurant, has closed after 50 years in busi ness.

title: Article 4  No Title
description: PHOENIX, Ariz., Dec. 5 (AP) The Phoenix Suns won their seventh straight game tonight by routing the Golden State Warriors, 12087.

title: Kennedy, in Gallup Poll, Widens Lead Over Muskie to 5 Points
description: Senator Edward M. Kennedy of Massachusetts maintains his lead over Senator Edmund S. Muskie of Maine and Senator Hubert H. Humphrey of Min nesota as the top choice of Democratic voters for the 1972 Presidential nomination, ac cording tb the Gallup poll.

title: Police Keep Apart 2 Pakistani Groups Protesting at U.N.
description: UNITED NATIONS, N. Y., Dec. 5A hundred feet of side walk and a dozen police from the 17th Precinct kept the peace today between rival Pak stani demonstrators marching outside the United Nations.

title: Maurice L. Sindeband Inventor Who Led Holding Concern, Dies
description: Maurice L. Sindeband, an engineer, inventor and busi ness executive, died yesterday in the Harkness Pavilion. He was 84 years old and lived at 340 East 72d Street.

title: Fire at Theater Halts Successful Blue Leaves
description: Fire at Theater Halts Successful Blue Leaves

title: Mrs. Francis Gillet, 75, Dead; Bred Successful Race Horses
description: GLYNDON, Md., Dee. 5 Mrs. Elizabeth Davy Salmon Gillet, widow of Francis War. rington Gillet and an owner of Mereworth Farm near Lexing ton, Ky., died today at Fox Den Farm, her home here. She was 75 years old.

title: Margin Cut a surprise.
description: Economic Analysis

title: Casino Men to Organize
description: RENO, Dec. 5 (UPI)Deal ers and maintenance men at Howard Hughes's Harold's Club have voted 438 to 353, to unionize, the first success ful labor organizing effort at one of Nevada's legal gambling casinos, it was announced yes terday.

title: U.S. Increases Aid to Orchestras 33%
description: An increase of roughly one third in Federal assistance to symphony orchestras was made known yesterday by the National Endowment for the Arts,: which listed, over $5 million in grants to be shared by 93 orchestras next year.

title: Jeremy Greenwood Weds Miss Brause
description: Miss Rachel Brause and Jeremy Greenwood, both of New York, were married here yesterday afternoon at the home of the bride by Mi chael Grupp of the Ethical Culture Society.

title: The Proceedings in the U.N. Today
Errors Help Falcons Halt Raiders, 2413
description: ATLANTA, Dec. 5Oakland and Atlanta, both harboring Super Bowl hopes, put on an excellent demonstration of the art of giving today, but Oak land was just a little more ex cellent at it and that's why Atlanta won, 2413.

title: BRUINS WIN BY 53 ON 2 LATE GOALS
description: BOSTON, Dec. 5 (AP)John ny McKenzie fired in a 25foot er with less than three minutes to play tonight and led the Boston Bruins to a 53 National Hockey League victory over the Pittsburgh Penguins.

title: Queen Ingrid Goes Home
description: BRIDGETOWN, Barbados, Dec. 5 (AP)Queen Ingrid of Denmark, who had been recu perating here from an opera tion undergone in October, flew home today. She had been ac compaiiied here by her daugh ter, Princess Margarethe.

title: Israeli Tractor Fired On
description: TEL AVIV, Dec. 5 (AP) Three shots were fired today from the Egyptian side of the Suez Canal at an Israeli tractor on the east bank, the military command reported. The Israelis said there were no casualties.

title: RecentlyPublished Books
description: GENERAL

title: U.S. TO HELP BUILD HOUSING IN STATE
description: Federal subsidies to help start more than $1billion worth of housing units through out the state were announced yesterday by S. William Green, Regional Administrator of the Department of. Housing and Urban Development.

title: Plane Reaches Teheran
description: TEHERAN, Iran, Dec. 5 (AP) The Pan American airliner carrying foreigners out of Karachi landed at Mehrabad Airport here today. Members of the party des cribed the situation in Karachi as fearful and horrible.

title: Metropolitan to Begin Wing for Lehman Art
description: With the last legal skir mish out of the way, the Metropolitan Museum has be gun construction of its con troversial Lehman Pavilion, an $8million home for the Robert Lehman collection of European art acquired under the terms of the late finan cier's will in 1969.

title: NICKLAUS, ON 205, LEADS BY STROKE
description: ORLANDO, Fla., Dec. 5 Jack Nickl aus had the lead all by himself today after 54 holes of the. Walt Disney World open golf tournament. He also held good field position for over taking Lee Trevino and taking moneywinning honors for 1971.

title: Surcharge of 25% Urged To Prod France on Drugs
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 5 (UPI) Eleven Representatves have introduced a bill that would increase the surcharge on im ported French products to 25 per cent from 10 per cent un til France takes stronger action to fight the processing and traf ficking of heroin.

title: Pakistan: 61 Indian Planes Reported Hit
description: RAWALPINDI, Pakistan, Dec. 5Pakistani troops were re ported today to be advancing along Abe: ceasefire line in Kashmir, the Himalayan state whose status has been the sub ject of two previous Indian Pakistani wars.

title: Unger's Goal Tops Wings
description: DETROIT, Dec. 5 (AP)  Garry Unger scored his sixth goal in seven games to break a 11 deadlock early in the third period tonight and give the St. Louis Blues a 21 triumph over the Detroit Red Wings.

title: Housing Patrolman Seized In Shooting at Midtown Cab
description: After two taxi rdivers re fused to take him to his home in the South Bronx, an off duty Housing Authority patrol man fired three shots yesterday morning at one of the cabs as it drove away from the Port Authority Bus Terminal, the police reported. He was arrested.

title: War at a Glance
description: NEW DELHI India claimed to have achieved complete freedom of tile skie above East Pakistan; and to have destroyed all but four of Pakistan's let bombers in the east. The Indian Navy re ported sinking two of Paki stan's five destroyers.

title: Nilsson and Billioth Buoy Met's Tristan
description: Since good Tristans are In short supply at any time one can only be grateful for Helge Brilloth's admirable perform in the role at the Met ropolitan Opera on Saturday night, despite some vocal in adequacies.

title: CITY PLANS DRIVE ON RELIEF FRAUD
description: The city has promised State Controller Arthur Levitt that it will refer 50 cases a week to District Attorneys in a drive against fraudulent duplications of welfare checks after claims of loss or theft. The city said this would eliminate a sub stantial number of multiple offenders.

title: $1Billion Legacy Makes Foundation the 2d Biggest
description: In 1936 Robert Wood John son, then the chief executive officer of Johnson & Johnson, the manufacturer of surgical dressings, established a founda tion in New Brunswick, N.J.

title: Airliner Involved in Collision Had Been Cleared to Land
description: RALEIGH, N.C., Dec. 5 (AP) An air safety investigator said today that an Eastern, Air, lines DC9 involved in a colli sion yesterday had been cleared to land at the RaleighDurham Airport when the accident oc curred.

title: Scientists Puzzled by Cattle Disease
description: BATON ROUGE, La., Dec. 5 Government scientists are alarmed by a mysterious, un treatable disease that has reached epidemic proportions among cattle eating Bermuda grass. They have been unable to determine what is causing thousands of cows and bulls to stagger, shiver and drop to the ground upon hearing noise such as human hand claps.

title: Sine Nomine Singers Reflect Saltzman's Elan
description: One of the nicest things about the concert given by the Sine Nomine Singers at Tully Hall on Saturday night was the way it reflected the personality and enthusiasm of Harry Saltzman. He is the conductor of the group, and a good one. The 24 singers (men and women, a dozen of each) are pretty good, too, and they could undoubtedly sing well for any capable director, but one has the feeling that with anyone else they would seem considerably interesting than when Mr. Saltzman is there urging them on through the music he chooses so well.

title: SPINGARN'S WORK HAILED AT RITES
description: Associate Justice Thurgood Marshall of the United States Supreme Court and Roy Wil kins, executive director of the National Association for the Advancement of Colored People two longstanding champions of civil rights  yesterday praised the late Arthur B. Spingarn as a pioneer in that cause.

title: Guests of Honor Were Robin Hood and His Men
description: Parochial school isn't what it used to be, at least if you're in the sixth grade at the Convent of the Sacred Heart School at 1 East 91st Street.

title: Barnes and Pizzarelli on Guitar Open Jazz Series With Artistry
description: George Barnes and Bucky Pizzarelli, who play their vir tuoso jazz guitar duets six nights a week in the St. Regis Room of the St. RegisSheraton Hotel, brought a sampling of their special artistry to Carne gie Recital Hall on Friday eve ning to start this season's series of Jazz: The Personal Dimen sion concerts.

title: 4 Arrests and a Slaying Close Case of Harlem Bank Robbery
description: In a series of nighttime raids that continued into early yes terday morning, the police shot one suspect to death and ar rested four others in their in vestigation of a bank robbery last Tuesday on upper Broad way.

title: LOCAL DEBUT MADE BY SCHOTTEN, VIOLIST
description: Yizhak Schotten, an Israeli violist who has been a member of the Boston Symphony Or chestra since 1967, made his New York recital debut at Town Hall late Saturday after noon assisted by Betsy Moyer, horpsichord, Victor Rosenbaum, piano, and Frank Epstein, per cussion.

title: Soviet Policy of Detente Has Diverse Roots
description: News Analysis

title: Mishima's Ashes Found And Returned to Tomb
description: TOKYO, Dec. 5 (UPI)  The remains of the Japanese writer Yukio Mishima, miss ing since Sept. 3, were re turned to his grave in Tama Cemetery near Tokyo today.

title: Launching of an Intelsat 4 Is Delayed by Space Agency
description: CAPE KENNEDY, Fla., Dec. 5The launching of an Intelsat 4 communications satellite, originally scheduled for tomor row night, has been delayed in definitely, the National Aero nautics and Space Administra tion announced today.

title: F.B.I. Inquiry Is Reported In Dispute on Tests of M16
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 5 (UPI) itepresentative James J. Howirk Democrat of New Hampshire, disclosed today that the Federal Bureau of Investi gation was investigating alle gations that the Colt Firearms Ceinipany of Hartford had de liberately cheated on factory tests Of the Army's M16 rifle.

title: Texas Auto Race Off
description: COLLEGE STATION, Tex., Dec. 5 (AP)  The Texas 500 stock car race scheduled for Texas world speedway today was postponed for a week be cause of rain.

title: LeadPoison Study Finds Blacks Suffer at Rate 3 Times Whites
description: A ninemonth study of 79, 199 children by the city's Health Services Administration has found three times as many cases of lead poisoning among black children as among white or Puerto Rican children.

title: Background of Dispute
description: Historical: Bloody strife between Moslems and Hindus had racked the Indian subcontinent for centuries before 1947, when India achieved independence from Britain and a separate Moslem state, Pakistan, was created in two parts, East and West, separated by more than 1,000 miles of Indian territory. India is predominantly Hindu, but has no state religion. Partition was followed by widespread Mos lemHindu fighting.

title: Rare Coins Go to West Point
description: WEST POINT, N. Y., Dec. 5 (UPI)In a highsecurity oper ation this weekend, the Treas ury Department completed moving 2.9 million rare silver dollars worth much more than their face value from Wash ington to the Government's silver bullion depository here. The coins, most of which were minted at the nowclosed Car son City, Nev., mint between 1878 and 1891, will be sold to the public about a year from now. The rarest of the coins may be worth up to $200, officials estimated.

title: Karen Thompson Bride of Jack Greene
description: NEW ROCHELLE, N. Y., Dec. 5Miss Karen Julie Thompson was married this afternoon to Jack Martin Greene. Rabbi Jacob K. Shankman performed the ceremony in Temple Israel of New Rochelle. Cantor Sumner A. Crockett assisted.

title: Heavy Cambodian Casualties Reported
description: PNOMPENH, Cambodia, Dec. 5 (AP)At least 100 Cambodi ans were reported killed or wounded in fighting today and reports from the northeastern front said that hundreds more were killed during last week's retreat along Route 6.

title: Chargers Prevent Vikings From Clinching
description: The Minnesota Vikings let their defenses down yesterday and dropped a chance to clinch the National Football Confer ence Central Division champion ship.

title: Insurance Man Heads Safety Unit
description: The election of Carlton E. Vanderwarker as president of the Greater New York Safety Council was announced yes terday.

title: Rangers' 3 in 2d Period If Overpower Canucks,63
description: Either from nervousness, or surprise at being so close, the Vancouver Canucks failed re peatedly to convert in front of the Ranger goal last night and became another Madison Square Garden victim, bowing by 63.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: Program Seeks Trainees As Urban Administrators
description: Applications are being sought in the New York City area by the National Urban Fellows, a nationwide program designed to meet the shortage of urban ad ministrators and to open leader ship opportunities in govern ment, especially for minority group members.

title: Rise in Crime. Straining Probation System Here
description: Set up decades ago as a humanitarian and common sense alternative to sending criminals to prison, the pro bation network serving the city's criminal courts finds itself today near a state of crisis. Its administrators and staff members say that it has too many cases and too little money and that it is simply not doing its job.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: Canada, on Eve of U.S. Talks: Nationalism vs. a Fear of Economic Loss
description: EDMONTON, Alberta, Dec. 5  Addressing a Canadafor. Canadians forum on the Uni versity of Alberta campus the other night, the speaker waved one of the new Canadian $10 bills.

title: Patriots Down Dolphins, 34 to 13
description: FOXBORO, Mass., Dec. 5 Sabotaged by four fumbles and a Disneyland dwarf, the Miami Dolphins were upset, 3413, by the New England Patriots today after eight consecutive victo ries. The loss narrowed the Dolphins' lead over the Colts to onehalf game for their East ern Division showdown Satur day at Baltimore.

title: U. S. COMPLAINS TO INDIA ON SHIPS
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 5Sec retary of State William P. Rog ers complained here today to Lakshmi Kant Jha, the Indian Ambassador to the United States, that an Indian air at tack had been made on one United States merchant vessel and that an Indian naval ves sel had intercepted another within the last 36 hours.

title: Cynthia Harris Is Bride
description: Miss Cynthia Jo Harris and David King Brenner were married yesterday af ternoon at Temple EmanuEl by Rabbi Ronald Sobel. The parents of the couple are Jo seph Harris of Baldwin, L. I., and the late Mrs. Dorothy Craig Harris and Mrs. John L. Brenner of New York and the late Mr. Brenner, who was a vice president of the Chemical Bank.

title: JOHN HARDY JONES
description: STAMFORD, Conn., Dec. 5 John Hardy Jones, president of Hardy Jones Associates, man agement consultants with head quarters in New York, died yes terday in Stamford Hospital, He was 55 years old, and lived at 252 Brookdale Road.

title: Books of The Times
description: Of course, you might consider giving books you love for Christmas, as opposed to what are senselessly known as gift books. After all, Dostoevski hasn't grown as obsolete as last year's electric juicer (or quite as in need of repair). On the other hand, not everyone loves the novels you love. So the following is a list of slightly more practical gift suggestions, ranged ac cording to the size of your moneybags.

title: Trade Seen as Trudeau's No. 1 Nixon
description: TORONTO, Dec. 5Prime Minister Pierre Elliott Trudeau is expected to advise President Nixon at the White House tomorrow that Canada is will in gto make several types of trade trade Concessions, to help the United States.

title: Embattled Arms Producer In Switzerland Plans Issue
description: GENEVA, Dec. 5While the Swiss Parliament and peo ple are pondering how best to ride herd on the country's ar maments industry, the concern in the center of the debate plans to invite the Swiss in vestor to put his Money in its future.

title: Hair Shifts Performance
description: Starting Dec. 12, Hair, the longrunning rock musical at the Biltmore Theater, will add a 7:30 P.M. performance on Sundays to the regular 3 P.M. matinees but Wednesday ma tinees are to be discontinued.

title: Messiah Is Performed By Masterwork Chorus
description: The 1971 Messiah season opened in respectable fashion at Carnegie Hall Saturday night; as David Randolph and Masterwork Chorus gave the first in the annual aeries of Christmastide performances. (The repeat dates are Dec. 10, 12 and 19, all in Carnegie, and Dec. 28 at Philharmonic Hall).

title: Advent Services Set For L.I.R.R. Riders
description: The Long Island Rail Road, with the help of five church es, will sponsor three ecumen ical Advent services for com muters beginning Dec. 14. Each service will be conduct ed in the rear car of the 7:10 A. M. NorthporttoJamaica train on three successive TuesdaysDec. 14, Dec. 21 and 28.

title: Miss Karen Dee Solomon Married
description: TARRYTOWN, N. Y., Dec. 5Miss Karen Dee Solomon of Boston was married here this afternoon to Morris Edward Zukerman of New York. Rabbi Maurice Davis performed the ceremony at Tarrytown House, a private estate.

title: Two Arabs Killed by Israelis
description: TIBERIAS, Israel, Dec. 5 (AP)  Israeli soldiers, using helicopters and tracking dogs, hunted down and killed two armed Arab guerrillas who in filtrated from Lebanon, the Israelis announced today. The Israelis said the guerrillas ap parently were on an intelli gence or recruiting mission.

title: 9 Jobless Aerospace Engineers Organize Own Concern
description: FREEPORT, L. I.Tucked away in two small rooms of an office building in this vil lage's shopping and business center are nine men who are almost broke, extremely busy but reasonably cheerful.

title: AT HOME ABROAD
description: LONDON, Dec. 5Suppose that Britain, in the 1930's, had responded to Hitler's savagery by the early threat or use of military force instead of appeasement. If the Nixon Adminis tration had been in power in Wash ington at the time, it would presum ably have sent some official out to wring his hands in public and charge Britain with major responsibility for the broader hostilities which have en sued.

title: Article 2  No Title
description: MEMPHIS, Dec. 5 (AP)  Johnny Neumann rallied the Memphis Pros from an 8point deficit in the last five minutes for a 117113 victory over the Virginia Squires tonight.

title: Kosygin Says Jews Ask To Return From Israel
description: AALBORG, Denmark, Dec. 5 (AP)  Premier Aleksei N. Kosygin of the Soviet Union said today that many Jews who emigrated to Israel had been writing to him asking if they could come back. Mr. Kosygin said that the immi grants were being persecuted in Israel.

title: LAW JOURNAL ISSUE ATTACKS NARCOTICS
description: The New York Law Journal is publishing a special edition today consisting of articles by politicians and specialists on the narcotics problem, In an ef fort to generate interest in a second Manhattan Project to attack the issue.

title: Model Recital by Szeryng and Reiner
description: In violin recitals of yore, a pianist could usually be des cribed somewhere in the back ground, plunking unobtrusively away, foot on the soft pedal, while the fiddler dominated the program like a Nero in tails. That school of violin playing is not so prevalent today, and it was the newer style that held the stage yesterday afternoon at Hunter College Assembly Hall, where Henryk Szeryng and Charles Reiner played a program that was a model of shared responsibility and shared glory.

title: Smith and Barthes Notch Second Victories in Paris Tennis
description: PARIS, Dec. 5 (AP)  Stan Smith of Pasadena, Calif., fought off three match points against him today before he rallied and defeated Cliff Richey, of San Angelo, Tex., 46, 63, 97, for his second triumph in the $50, 000 Pepsi Masters Grand Prix tennis tournament.

title: ELIZABETH LUWISCH
description: Elizabeth Luwisch, a third year student at the Phila delphia Medical College and a daughter of Dr. Joachim Lu wisch, an assistant clinical pro fessor of psychiatry at New York University, died yester day in Philadelphia Osteopathic Hospital of injuries suffered in an automobile accident. She was 24 years old.

title: Kent Trial Jury to Be Picked
description: RAVENNA, Ohio, Dec. 5 (UPI) Jury selection begins tomor row in the trial of the first of three women indicted in the May, 1970, disorders at Kent State University that ended when four students were shot to death by Ohio National Guardmen. The defendant, Mary Helen Nicholas, 21 years old, of Akron, Ohio, a sopho more at Kent State, was charged with interfering with a fireman. She and two other women were among 25 persons indicted by a special Portage County grand jury.

title: DUNAS PERFORMS SYMBOLIC TRUST
description: As the movement vocabulary of William Dunas becomes ever more concentrated and restrict ed, his use of symbolic objects becomes more allusive and per sonal. On Saturday evening at Clark Center he presented The Trust: A Poor Fool, the 13th in his series of solo dances that are all like episodes out of a surrealistic Book of Job.

title: Incitement Charged
description: PEKING, Dec. 5 (Agence FrancePresse)  The Soviet Government was, accused by Hsinhua, the official Chinese press agency, today of having incited India to attack Paki stan.

title: Not Much Protection
description: The plight of dolphins, sea otters, whales, polar bears and other ocean mammals has caught the public imag ination in recent months. Television films which depicted the bludgeoning to death of baby seals in the Gulf of St. Lawrence last spring during the annual harvest evoked an outcry in this country as well as Canada.

title: SHANKER BACKING PAROCHIAL STRIKE
description: Albert Shanker, president of the United Federation of Teach ers, told about 400 striking Catholic lay teachers yesterday that they had the full and steadily growing support of the labor movement in their con tract dispute with the Arch diocese of New York.

title: PublicTV Salary Data May Hurt Fund Drive
description: The disclosure of some high salaries among public televi sion's top executives and on air personalities could hardly have come at a worse time for James Day, president of the Educational Broadcasting Cor poration, the umbrella title that covers both National Educa tional Television and Channel 13 here.

title: Pakistanis Warned
description: MOSCOW, Dec. 5 The So viet Union, asserting that its security interests are affected by the Indian  Pakistani war, warned Pakistani leaders today that they were assuming grave responsibility by pursuing the dangerous course of conflict with India.

title: SIMPSON TALLIES 29 IN CONDOR VICTORY
description: PITTSBURGH, Dec. 5 (AP)  Ralph Simpson scored 29 points to lead the Denver Rockets to a 118115 victory over the Pittsburgh Condors in an Amer ican Basketball Association game tonight.

title: Films Will Replace Griffin on Feb. 14
description: The scheduled cancellation of Mery Griffin's lateevening talk show will take place on Feb. 14 with the Columbia Broadcast ing System announcing yester day that it will substitute a package of films obtained from Metro  Goldwyn  Mayer and other producers.

title: Each Side Blaming the Other For Ulster Bombing Fatal to 15
description: BELFAST, Northern Ireland, Dec. 5  Silent, griefstricken crowds gathered on North Queen Street here today in front of the rubble of a Roman Catholic bar in which 15 per sons were killed in a bomb explosion last night.

title: SADAT DECLARES U. S. MISLED HIM ON ISRAELI TALKS
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 5Pres ident Anwar elSadat of Egypt says that on two occasions last summer he promised United States officials that all the Soviet missile crews sta tioned in Egypt would be sent home as soon as Israel carried out the first stage of a with drawal from the Sinai Penin sula.

title: Article 3  No Title
description: CLEVELAND, Dec. 5 (UPI) Lenny Wilkens scored 27 points and Don Smith grabbed 13 re bounds tonight to lead the Se attle SuperSonics to a 9991 National Basketball Association victory over the Cleveland Cav aliers.

title: EXMAYOR T. A. BURKE OF CLEVELAND DIES
description: CLEVELAND, Dec. 5 (Reuters) Thomas A. Burke, four times Mayor of Cleveland and a United States Senator in 1954, died in St. Vincent Hospital to day at the age of 73.

title: Budgetary Carol
description: It is a grim Christmas message that New Yorkers have received from Governor Rockefeller: Taxes will rise, services will decline. The state's acute budgetary crisis a gap of $770 million between revenues and expendi tures in the current fiscal yearnow requires a series of painful adjustments.

title: In the sugarbush they are talking a great deal about the Lindsay Effect. He's the Mayor.
description: BINGHAMTONJohn Lindsay had Just ended his first probe into that part of the upstate New York cane brakes that lies along the Pennsyl vania border when a local lady report er sighed into her typewriter, A wom an wants to mother him and a man wants to be a pal of his.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: U.C.L.A. and Maryland Fives Get Off to HighScoring Starts
description: Question: Is there any doubt about the University of Cali fornia, Los Angeles, scoring power? Answer: The Bruins have gone over 100 points in each of its two victories.

title: Redskins Win, 237, on Giants' Miscues
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 5The New York Giants helped the Washington Redskins to a 23.7 victory today by being inter cepted three times in their own territory in the first 10 minutes of play.

title: Alleged Thief Chooses Police Car to Steal
description: An alleged car thief had the poor judgment yesterday to try to steal an unmarked police car being watched three undercover policemen. He was said to have offered to pay one of the plain clothes Men $2 to watch the car until he returned with a wire to open it the police re ported.

title: PICKUP IN DEMAND FOR STEEL GROWS
description: PITISBURGH, Dec. 3De mand for steel continued its steady rise last week.

title: 2 CITY HOSPITALS DAMAGED BY FIRES
description: Twoalarm fires of undeter mined cause flared up at two municipl hospital facilities yes terday, doing extensive damage on one floor of a nurses' resi dence at Lincoln Hospital in the Bronx and minor damage at Bellevue Hospital construction site in Manhattan.

title: Francis Fink, 64, Official Of Catholic Publishers
description: HUNTINGTON, Ind., Dec. 5 Francis A. Fink; executive vice president of Our Sunday Visitor, a Roman Catholic weekly newspaper published here, and a past president of the Catholic Press Association, died of a heart attack yester day. He was 64 years old.

title: Ufford Squash Victor
description: Charles Ufford of the Harvard club defeated Bill Tully of the New York Athletic Club, 156, 1512, 1415, 158, in the final of the Eastern States veterans' squash racquets tournament at the Yale Club yesterday.

title: White Shirts Replace Purple as Aurelio Era Ends
description: City Hall Notes

title: Chess: World Rating System Puts Fischer Ahead of Spassky
description: According to the Arpad Elo worldwide rating system, appearing in the most recent issue of Chess Express, the international chess magazine, the top 20 players in the world and their ratings are as follows:

title: Miss Durr Beats Mrs. King
description: CHRISTCHURCH, New Zea land, Dec. 5 (AP)Franoise Durr of France used superb baseline play today in a 63, 60 victory over Mrs. Billie Jean King of Long Beach, Calif., in the singles final of an interna tional women's tournament.

title: Nuclear Plant Set In Mexican Power
description: MEXICO CITY, Dec. 5The Mexican Government has given the gohead for the installa tion of the country's first nu clear power plant as part of an effort to solve a growing ener gy crisis.

title: Cooperation in Space
description: News Analysis

title: U.N.: Moscow Again Vetoes Truce Call
description: UNITED NATIONS, N. Y., Dec. 5The Security. Council, meeting for the second consecu tive night on the IndiaPakistan conflict, was unable to agree tonight on any resolution put before it.

title: Rabe Wins $3,000 Award
description: David Rabe, the playwright represented Off Broadway by The Basic Training of Pavlo Hummel and Sticks and Bones, has won the first $3,000 Elizabeth HullKate Warriner Award for work that deals with controversial subjects involv ing the fields of political, re ligious or social mores of our times.

title: Realities in Forest Hills
description: The scattersite concept of locating lowincome hous ing outside the slums and ghettos, which has run into opposition in Forest Hills, is an imaginative effort to erase the terrible divisions of urban America. But it is also an experiment with a high potential for failure. Its success obviously depends on the existing community's capacity and willingness to absorb the newcomers and to help them adjust to the socioeconomic level of their new environment.

title: Russi Takes Ski Race As Swiss Finish 134
description: ST. MORITZ, Switzerland, Dec. 5Bernhard Russi and his Swiss teammates turned their stamping grounds into a play ground today in the opening men's World Cup race of the Alpine ski season.

title: WORKERS RATIFY AEROSPACE PACT
description: LONG BEACH, Calif., Dec. 5 Members of Local 887 of the United Automobile Workers voted overwhelmingly here to day to approve a proposed con tract with the North American Rockwell Corporation. The con tract is expected to set the pat tern for the aerospace industry settlements now being nego tiated.

title: EMERGENCY RULE INVOKED BY SEOUL
description: SEOUL, South Korea, Mon day, Dec. 6President Park Chung Hee declared a state of national emergency today on the ground that South Korea was confronted with a grave situation threatening its na tional security.

title: 9 New City Centers Open For Medicaid Interviews
description: Jule M. Sugarman, the city's Commissioner of Social Serv ices, announced yesterday that nine new centers were being started immediately for inter viewing all new, nonwelfare ap plicants to enroll for Medicaid, Up to now, all applicants here had had to apply at 330 West 34th Street, which will still be available.

title: Neighborhoods: Ozone Park's Stability Belies Its Uneasiness
description: The three men were early for the funeral service, So they strolled about, the area around the church and paro chial school. One of them, about 30 years old, beamed as he watched children play ing in the schoolyard.

title: GENEVA P.O.W. RULES OBSERVED,INDIA SAYS
description: NEW DELHI, Dec. 5A De fense Ministry spokesman said tonight that the Indian Army was conforming to the Geneva conventions in the treatment of Pakistani prisoners.

title: Presiding in a Crisis
description: Man in the News

title: Ann Mitchell Konheim Is Bride Of Robert E. Polansky, Ad Man
description: Miss Ann Mitchell Kon helm, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Ralph Konheim of New York, was married yesterday noon to Robert E. Polansky, son of Mr. and Mrs. Israel Polansky of Newton, Mass. Rabbi Nathan A. Perilman performed the ceremony in the Beth El Chapel of Temple EmanuEl.

title: 2 Leap From Golden Gate
description: SAN FRANCISCO, Dec. 5 (UPI)  A decorated World War II veteran and a middle age woman jumped to her death from the Golden Gate Bridge in separate incidents yesterday. They were the 431st and 432d suicides from the span. Lee Hager, 57 years old, jumped shortly before noon from the bridge's east side. He won a Bronze Star while serv ing in Europe. The second vic tim, Mrs. Delores Bolstad, 49, jumped four hours later from the south end.

title: East Pakistanis Rejoice but They Lack a Leader
description: CALCUTTA, India, Dec. 6 East Pakistanis in Calcutta, the headquarters of the seces sion movement, celebrated India's formal recognition of that government today with happy processions, slogan shouting and dancing and sing ing. But the fivemember cabi net itself was nowhere in sight a situation typical of this group of uncharismatic politi cians waiting for a man in a West Pakistani prison to show them the way.

title: An I.R.A. Chief Defends Ulster Terrorism
description: NAVEN. Ireland, Dec, 1 In a secluded house here, a chunky English born Irish man quietly directs the ter rorist tactics of the Irish Re publican Army Provisionals in Northern Ireland.

title: O.T.B. Advisory Unit to Seek Numbers Legalization
description: The Community Advisory Committee to the OffTrack Betting Corporation announced yesterday that it would work for the legalization of the num bers racket, which is thought to be a $500million annual operation in New York City.

title: I.F. Stone to Suspend 19YearOld Leftist Biweekly
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 6I. F. Stone, an independent journal ist who won a wide following and financial success with a oneman, leftwing newsletter, announced today that his 19 yearold publication would cease with a farewell issue later this month.

title: Market Place: Price Swings: Limit Needed?
description: It's midday and you are casually reading the market quotations over a sandwich at your desk. You take a big bite out of the corned beef the luncheonette sent up and notice the Wrigley price.

title: $2,000 PAINTING SOLD AT $110,000
description: A painting that had been ap praised to yield about $2,000 at auction was the star last Thursday at a sale of old mas ters, bringing $110,000. It was A Landscape by a River, a work attributed to the school of Hercules Seghers, 17thcen tury Dutch artist.

title: HOUSE UNIT ACTS IN AID IMPASSE
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 6With a foreign aid authorization bill still stalled in a joint House Senate conference, the House Appropriations Committee to day sought to get around the deadlock by approving an ap propriation measure that would provide $2.6billion in economic and military assistance.

title: Sub Tests Poseidon Missile
description: CAPE KENNEDY, Fla., Dec. 6 (UPI)The United States sub marine Stonewall Jackson suc cessfully fired its first Poseidon missile today on a test flight to an Atlantic Ocean target area. The Stonewall Jackson was submerged 30 miles east of Cape Kennedy when it launched the 34foot rocket. It was the ninth submarine to fire the new multiwarhead rocket.

title: Iraq Asks Arabs to Break Ties With Britain and Iran
description: CAIRO, Dec. 6Iraq called on Arab countries today to break diplomatic relations with Britain and Iran in retaliation for the occupation by Iranian troops last week of three dis puted islands in the Persian Gulf.

title: Eban Tells U.N. Israel Would Resume Negotiations on Basis of African Plan
description: UNITED NATIONS, N.Y., Dec. 6Israel announced today; that she was prepared to re lame negotiations with Egypt on the basis of a sixpoint program drawn up by the Organisation of African Unity.

title: 6 Killed in Upstate Fire
description: LOCKPORT, N. Y., Dec. (UPI)Five members of a fam ily and a boarder who had just returned from Vietnam died to day when fire swept their two story frame house in Cambria, which is near this seat of Ni agara County. The dead were identified as Charles McLaugh lin, 40 years old, his wife, Louise, 38; their children, Kathy, 15; Charles Jr., 13, and Debra, 8, and the boarder, George Hill, 20.

title: Notes on People
description: Only Mike Mansfield, the majority leader, and Hugh Scott, the minority leader, were on the Senate floor when Mrs. Romana Acosta Bauelos was confirmed as Treasurer of the United States, with no expressed opposition.

title: Nixon Suggests 2d Star For 5 Women Generals
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 6 (AP)  President Nixon met with five women who have been promoted to brigadier general during his Adminis tration and asked them why they did not have two stars on their shoulders instead of one.

title: Error Found in Using Uranium Sands
description: DENVER, Dec. 6The chair man of the Atomic Energy Com mission indicated today for the first time that the use of radio active sands in building houses in Grand Junction, Colo., was a mistake, that action was needed to remove them and that the Federal Government might be willing to pay some of the re moval cost.

title: Swiss Assistance Asked
description: GENEVA, Dec. 6 Pakistan has asked Switzerland to look after her interests in India fol lowing the break in diplomatic relations, a spokesman for the Pakistani Embassy in Berne said today. He said that Swits erland would reply tomorrow.

title: Group Here Sues F.T.C. for List Of 15,000 Consumer Complaints
description: A New York consumer organ ization went to court yesterday in an attempt to force the Fed eral Trade Commission to make public its list of some 15,000 metropolitan area con sumer complaints and the hun dreds of companies that are their targets.

title: Synod Data to Be Printed
description: ROME, Dec. 6The Vatican announced today that it would publish two conclusive docu ments of the recent synod of bishops next Thursday. The documents deal with Roman Catholic priesthood ant. jus tice in the world.

title: Article 6  No Title
description: NEW PALTZ, N. Y., Dec. 6 (AP)New Paltz State lost a 6point halftime lead tonight as Baruch College of New York registered a 9277 victory.

title: Article 5  No Title
description: BLOOMINGTON, Ill., Dec. 6 (UPI)  Steve Downing scored 22 points, including two free throws with three seconds to play, to lead Indiana to a 5956 victory over Kansas tonight.

title: Wood, Field and Stream
description: By now, many fishermen must be pleasantly aware of the spate of new editions of outofprint angling classics, and the latest entry in this field, The Lure and Lore of Trout Fishing, by Dr. Alvin R. Grove (Freshet Press, 518 pages, illustrated $9.95) is most welcome.

title: WAR DEBATE GOES TO U.N. ASSEMBLY
description: UNITED NATIONS, N. Y., Dec. 6The Security Council voted tonight to transfer de bate on the question of the In dianPakistani war to the Gen eral Assembly. The vote in the 15member Council was 11 votes in favor, none against.

title: Smith Is Freed in 1957 Murder After Confessing He Killed Girl
description: HACKENSACK, N. J., Dec. 6Edgar H. Smith Jr., who has spent the last 14 years in pris on, was ordered freed tonight after he testified in State Superior Court here that he fatally bludgeoned Victoria Zielinski, a 15yearold Ramsey high school cheerleader in a Mahwah gravel pit on March 4, 1957.

title: PAKISTAN CLAIMS GAINS IN 2 AREAS;
description: RAWALPINDI, Pakistan, Dec. 6Pakistan broke diplomatic relations with India today as the air war between the two countries continued and the Pakistani Army reported suc cesses on both the eastern and western fronts.

title: She Never Disputes the Bill Now That She Has Pay Phone
description: There they were, popping up regularly on Monica de Hellerman's telephone bill, 200 or 300 extra message units that she swore she hadn't used.

title: Aliens' Wages Scored
description: BOSTON, Dec. 6 (AP)Sen ator Edward W. Brooke, Re publican of Massachusetts, said today that aliens working ille gally in the United States may be taking $5billion a year from American Workers' pock ets in wages. Urging Federal ac tion to combat the problem, Senator Brooke mailed a report to Congress on a study he con ducted on the problem last May in Boston and New Bedford.

title: MRS. HENRY B. KENNEDY
description: GREENWICH, Conn., Dec. 6 Mrs. Lucile Sexton Kennedy, widow of Henry B. Kennedy, former executive vice president of the Frank G. Shattuck Company, operators of the Schrafft's restaurants, and con fectionery chain, died here Sat urday during a visit. Mrs. Kennedy, who was a resident of New York City, and Buck Hill Falls, Pa., was 72 years old.

title: WHELAN ADMITS EVASION OF TAXES
description: NEWARK, Dec. 6Thomas J. Whelan, former Mayor of Jersey City, and Thomas M. Flaherty, former City Council President there, pleaded guilty today in Federal Court here to charges of incometax fraud.

title: Irish Top W. Michigan
description: SOUTH BEND, Ind., Dec. 6 (AP)Willie Townsend, just shaking the effects of the long football season at Notre Dame, broke loose for 21 points and 10 rebounds tonight to lead the Irish to an 8377 victory over Western Michigan.

title: Villanova Stops Oregon
description: PHILADELPHIA, Dec. 6 (UPI) Tom Inglesby paced a bal anced attack with 20 points to night as Villanova held off Oregon, 7873, at the Palestra, spoiling the return of former Penn Coach Dick Harter.

title: RALPH P. CARGILLE
description: LITTLE FALLS, N.J., Dec. 6 Ralph P. Cargille, founder and retired president of the R. P. Cargille Laboratories of Cedar Grove, manufacturer of scien tific products, died yesterday at his home, 123 Prospect Street. His age was 83.

title: General Discharges Given to 8 Sailors Who Avoided War
description: SAN FRANCISCO, Dec. 6 (AP)Eight sailors who sought sanctuary in a San Diego church in October when the carrier Constellation sailed for Southeast Asia were given general discharges under hon orable conditions today, the Navy said.

title: TV: Choice, Not Chance
description: Tonight at 8:30 the Colum bia. Broadcasting System will be presenting Julie and Carol at Lincoln Center. Pure entertainment. Also to night at S:30 Channel 13/WNET's Dateline 13 series will be presenting Calcutta. Superb documentary. So It goes in the land of startling contrasts. Check your mood and make your choice.

title: WOES FOR NAMATH EXTENDED TO ARM
description: Joe Namath got up froin the bench in front of his locker after the noncontest against Dallas last Saturday and tossed his football undershirt toward a large receptacle for dirty clothes about five yards away. The shirt missed going in by several feet.

title: Environment Is Not a Motherhood Issue
description: BOSTONEnvironmental quality is supposed to be an issue which is so innocuous and so free of dangerous controversy that, like motherhood, can be readily discussed without of fense to anyone. Sometimes those of us who emphasize the environmental crisis are accused of diverting atten tion, even deliberately, from really serious and controversial issues, into this benign channel.

title: Colt Players Questioning Value Of Finishing First in Division
description: About Pro Football

title: Seoul Says It Seeks to Alert Koreans to Dangers
description: SEOUL, South Korea, Dec. 6 President Park Chung Hee's office said tonight that his emergency declaration was in tended to make the Korean people look at the rapid changes in the international situation and at the cold reality of the Korean peninsula.

title: House Panel Clears A Bill to Establish National Food Bank
description: WASHINGTON; Dec. 6 (AP)  The House Rules Committee voted 8 to 7 tonight to clear the way for House action on a bill that would set up a national food bank stocked with $ 1.5billion worth of vital grains.

title: Allende to Visit Cuba
description: SANTIAGO, Chile, Dec. 6 (AP)President Salvador Al lende Gossens of Chile will visit Cuba soon as the guest of Pre mier Fidel Castro, the Chilean Government announced today. No date was set.

title: BENJAMIN DANCERS PRESENT SIX WORKS
description: The Fred Benjamin Dance Company, with Mr. Benjamin and his assistant director, Win ston DeWitt Helmsley, guiding its artistic fortunes, presented its first concert of the season at Kaufmann Concert Hall Sun day evening.

title: Orange County Signs OTB Computer Pact
description: A contract to provide an automatic offtrack betting system for Orange County, N. Y., was signed yesterday with the American Totalisator Company (Amtote) of Tow son, Md., a wholly owned subsidiary of General Instru ment Corporation.

title: PNOMPENH STRUCK BY THREE ROCKETS
description: PNOMPENH, Cambodia, Tues day, Dec. 7 (UPI)Three So vietmade 122mm. rockets crashed into Pnompenh, Cam bodia's capital, early today in the first shelling attack of the city in the 20monthlong war. Two, women and two children, all members of a family, were hurt.

title: China Assails Indian Plot
description: HONG KONG, Tuesday, Dec. 7China today denounced In dia's recognition of the rebel Bangla Desh regime, calling it an example of Indian expan sionism and part of a plot by India to annex East Pakistan.

title: Article 2  No Title
description: MILWAUKEE, Dec. 6 (AP) Bernie Smith was assigned to day to Evansville of the Ameri can Association by the Milwau kee Brewers as they reduced their roster to 39 players.

title: DON'T FORGET THE NEEDIEST
description: DON'T FORGET THE NEEDIEST

title: Top Jersey Court Says Students Can Face Anonymous Accusers
description: TRENTON, Dec. 6  The New Jersey Supreme Court today ruled that students had the right to face and cross examine their accusers before they could be suspended or dismissed from school for dis ciplinary reasons.

title: Murphy to Be Vice ChairmanCole Is Still President
description: The General Motors Corpora tion, the world's largest indus trial corporation, named yes terday Richard C. Gerstenberg as chairman and chief execu tive officer.

title: Jan Peerce Will Be Tevye No. 7
description: Jan Peerce, the tenor, will make his Broadway musical theater debut in Fiddler on the Roof, starting next Tues day. The recordbreaking show, which reached its 3,000th performance last Sat urday, is at the Broadway Theater.

title: The Proceedings In the U.N. Today
NEW BULOVA WATCH HAS QUARTZ CRYSTAL
description: The Bulova Watch Company has introduced the first Ameri can quartzcrystal wristwatch designed for volume production. Known as the Accuquartz, it will retail for $395 in 14karat gold.

title: SelfStyled Bookkeeper
description: Man in the News

title: CITY AND FIREMEN IN TENTATIVE PACT
description: Negotiators for the city and the Uniformed Firefighters As sociation reached a tentative settlement in their contract dis pute yesterday.

title: The Egg Is All
description: Ten years ago they pulled the rail road out from under me, and this almost severed my connection with New York. Then sixteen months ago, I met with a motor accident, and this made the highway a problem for me. As for the skies, I quit using the fly ing machines in 1929 after the pilot of one of them, blinded by snow, hand ed the chart to me and asked me to find the Cleveland airport.

title: TIMES WINS AWARD ON PRESS FREEDOM
description: For its publication of the Pentagon papers, The New York Times has been chosen as the recipient of the University of Arizona's annual John Peter Zenger Award for distin guished service to freedom of the press and the people's right to know, the university an nounced yesterday.

title: Advertising:
description: LaRoche, McCaffrey & Mc Call will be losing two of its favorite assignments, Pine Sol and Formica Floor Shine, from the consumer products division of American Cyana mid.

title: A PIANO PROGRAM IN A VELVET MOOD
description: Flavio Varani is an artist with a keen sense of esthetic fitness, obviously. That is to say, if a pianist sets out to per form a program that includes Johann Ladislaus Dussek's La Consolation, Carl Maria Web er's Rondo Brillante, Ignaz Moscheles's Grand Septet in D, Louis Moreau Gottschalk's Ricordati and Franz Liszt's Fantasia sur Don Juan, well, that pianist legitimately may indeed shouldwear a mauve cutvelvet suit.

title: 2 Held in Mailing of Drug
description: A selfemployed Queens cos metics salesman and his wife were arrested yesterday on charges of criminal possession of dangerous drugs after re ceiving by registered mail five tins that the police said were marked fruitcake but con tained 17 pounds of marijuana from Jamaica, West Indies. Herman Robinson, 23 years old, and his wife, Rita, 20, were ar rested by Patrolman Thomas Mulhearn, who posed as a mailman delivering the pack ages to their home at 13044 222d Street, in the Laureiton section.

title: MOST RATES SLIP IN CREDIT MARKETS
description: Interest rates moved down ward yesterday throughout much of the money and capital markets amid speculation that the Federal Reserve would re duce the discount rate and be lief that international financial turmoil seemed headed toward a solution.

title: IN THE NATION
description: At first glance, Senator Edward It Kennedy looks mighty good in the latest Gallup Poll of Democratic Presi dential possibilities. Of the 1,411 Democrats queried in 280 localities in late November, 29 per cent preferred Mr. Kennedy to top the ticket next year, as compared to only 25 per cent who opted for the socalled frontrun ner, Edmund S. Muskie.

title: Orange Bowl Winner Gets MacArthur Prize
description: The National Football Foundation, which presents the MacArthur Bowl each year to the college team it be lieves is national champion, will award the bowl to the winner of the Orange Bowl game between Alabama and Nebraska in Miami.

title: Antiaircraft Fire in Bombay
description: NEW DELHI, Dec. 6 (AP) Antiaircraft guns opened fire tonight in Bombay after radar men reported sighting a flight of Pakistani jet planes sweep ing in from the Arabian Sea.

title: For the Record: The Day's Activities in Washington
T.V.A. SETS POLICY FOR STRIP MINING
description: KNOXVILLE, Tenn., Dec. 6 The Tennessee Valley Author ity issued a new and tougher set of rules today under which companies that supply the agency with 16 million tons a year of stripmined coal must work to reclaim the scarred earth.

title: Front Page 1  No Title
description: DON'T SPEND CHRISTMAS ALONE

title: Price Index Is Studied for Food Chains
description: The Price Commission is for mulating a plan that would re quire major food chains to post prominently in each of their stores an overall price index consisting of a single figure.

title: Final Witness Testifies at Henderson CourtMartial
description: FORT MEADE, Md., Dec. 6 The 106th and final witness testified today at the court martial of Col. OranK. Hender son, and both the defense and the prosecution began to pre pare arguments for the military judge's instructions on the law to the sevenman jury.

title: Morales Wrestling Victor As 22,091 Watch at Garden
description: Last night was no time for professional wrestling's special breed of bad boy to be at Mad ison Square Garden. To the de light of a record crowd of 22, 091, not one of the villains and there is a villain in, every exhibitioncame away the vic tor.

title: 4 Nonmembers Heard In U.N. Council Debate
description: UNITED NATIONS, N. Y., Dec. 6During the three days of meetings on the In diaPakistan dispute the Se curity Council has been ad dressed by four nonmembers.

title: Annual Donors Aid Fund for Neediest
description: The annual donation of Mrs. Merril G. Weiler, 575 Park Avenue, was among the 26 contributions recorded yesterday by The New York Times Neediest Cases Fund.

title: STEEL OUTPUT GAINS 3.4% DURING WEEK
description: Steel production last week rose 3.4 per cent to 1,931,000 tons, the American Iron and Steel Institute reported yester day. This compared with 1, 868,000 tons in the preceding week and was the highest weekly percentage gain since the 6.2 per cent increase in the week ended Sept. 18.

title: F.D.A. Warns on Hexachlorophene Bath
description: The Food and Drug Ad ministration, citing findings of brain damage in baby monkeys, warned yesterday against regular bathing of infants and adults with cleansers containing 3 per cent or more hexachloro phene.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: 2 Accused in School Death
description: HONESDALE, Pa., Dec. 6 (UPI)  Murder charges have been filed against two men for the death of a patient at a school for retarded children in 1970. John Reilly, the former owner of the Hillcrest School, and John Butasek, former nurse, were charged with forc ing the patient, Frank E. Dicker son of Chester, to walk naked in the snow as punishment for unnamed offenses. He died later, of acute pneumonia.

title: Six Seized in Key Biscayne
description: KEY BISCAYNE, Fla., Dec. 7 (AP)Six youths were arrested by narcotics agents after par ents complained about the use of marijuana on Key Biscayne, site of the Florida White House.

title: MISSISSIPPI BLACKS TO SEEK VOTE SUITS
description: JACKSON, Miss., Dec. (AP)An official of the Dem ocratic National Committee says the Justice Department will be asked to look into charges by blacks that they lost some contests in the recent general elections because of fraud and intimidation.

title: RETAILSTORE SALES ROSE FOR NOVEMBER
description: Increased sales in November over the 1970 month were re ported by several leading retail chains, as well as rises in the year thus far. In a number of cases, new stores opened less than a year accounted for significant portion of the higher sales.

title: U.S. Sees No Attack Imminent
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 6The State Department said today that it did not agree with President Park's evaluation of the danger posed by North Korean invasion threats.

title: DPF CHIEF RESIGNS; TO BE A CONSULTANT
description: DPF, Inc., formerly the Data Processing Financial and Gen eral Corporation, announced last night the resignation of Ryal R. Poppa as president, chief executive officer and director, effective Jan. 1. He agreed to remain as a con sultant for one year.

title: Other Members of Mafia Miss Funeral Services for Adonis
description: FORT LEE, N. J., Dec. 6 Giuseppe Antonio Doto, known in life as Jpe Adonis, was bUried here today, accompanied to the windchilled Madonna Roman Catholic Cemetery by members of his immediate family.

title: BRAZILIAN LEADER TO TALK TO NIXON
description: RIO DE JANEIROPresident Emilio G. Medici of Brazil, who begins a twoday state visit to Washington on Dec. 7, will be the first chief of a LatinAmer ican military government in vited to the United States by President Nixon.

title: Dacca Watching the War and Waiting
description: DACCA, Pakistan, Dec. 4 (Delayed)The city is light less at 8:30 P.M. Nothing moves. A 5:30 curfew sent people from the streets. Cur tains are pulled, candles burn shaded from windows. There are few sounds. A dog howls now and then, a jeep or truck slips by, lights out.

title: SUSPECT IS INDICTED IN DRIVER'S SLAYING
description: Carmen Smith of 1316 Morris Avenue, the Bronx was indicted by a Manhattan grand jury yes terday on firstdegree murder charges in connection with a shooting that took place outside The New York Times plant at 229 West 43d Street the night of Nov. 7.

title: MORE JOBLESS PAY IS VOTED BY SENATE
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 6The Senate voted today to extend unemployment compensation payments 26 additional weeks in states with heavy unemploy ment.

title: S.E.C. Files Suit Involving Purchase By Lum's Group
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 6 (AP) The Securities and Exchange Commission filed court action today, to enjoin Lum's, Inc., of Miami, and other concerns and individuals from alleged securi ties violations in connection with the purchase by Lum's of Caesar's Palace, a hotel and gambling casino in Las Vegas.

title: 18 Killed, Saigon Says
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, Dec. 6 (AP)The South Vietnamese command said that air strikes had killed 18 enemy soldiers from 7 to 25 miles inside Cam bodia in a corridor between the Chup and Mimot rubber planta tions. Both plantations are re ported to be base areas for Vietcong and North Vietnamese divisions.

title: Ann M. Schneider Is Married in London
description: Miss Ann Morley Schnei der, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Franz Schneider of Oyster Bay, L. I., was married Nov. 26 in London in a civil cere mony at the Caxton Hall registry office to David Flem ing Wilson, son of Sir Duncan and Lady Wilson of Cam bridge, England, and Islay, Scotland. Sir Duncan, former British Ambassador to the Soviet Union, is master of Corpus Christi College of Cambridge University.

title: Books of The Times
description: THE WHITE NILE. By Alan Moorhead. 368 pager. Illustrated. Harper & Row. $15.

title: CONTRACT AWARDS
description: The Department of Defense said that the General Electric Company had teen selected for a $50million Army contract to develop engines for a new army helicopter.

title: U.N. REFUGEE AID EXPECTED TO HALT
description: GENEVA, Dec. 6War con ditions are expected to force the suspension of United Na tions food shipments to East Pakistani refugees in India un til transportation problems are solved, reliable sources said today.

title: Cambodians Flee Village
description: PNOMPENH Dec. 6 (AP) Cambodian troops fled from Bat Doeung, a town near Pnom penh's outskirts, today after onefourth of their garrison had been killed or wounded in two days of fighting, the Cambodian command reported.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: Germans' Impasse on Visits Continues
description: BERLIN. Dec. 6 The East Germans and the West Berlin city government remained dead locked today on the issue of visiting privileges for West Berliners in the East, but West ern officials said that they ex pected that a fresh approach would he made soon.

title: City Delegation Due to See Volpe Today on Transit Aid
description: A delegation of New York City. Congressmen, including Representative Emanuel Celler and Representative Wililam F. Ryan, both. Democrats, is scheduled to meet with Trans portation Secretary John A. Volpe today to press for in creased Federal aid to New York's masstransit system.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: METHADONE CARE BRINGS WARNING
description: A report of a study of an emergency methadone main tenance program, published in this week's issue of The Journal of the American Medical As sociation, concludes that meth adone treatment by itself is not an answer to heroin addiction and must be accompanied by careful monitoring and follow up of patients.

title: TESORO EARNINGS SURGE IN QUARTER
description: The Tesoro Petroleum Cor poration achieved record sales and earnings in the quarter and year ended Sept. 30.

title: OBSERVER
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 6It is inter esting to turn on the set periodically to see what problems are bothering the people who live in television commer cials. It is not a bad place to live in television commercials, that isif you can tolerate the sudden appearances in your home of those humorless, faintly menacing strangers who pop in and out with problemsolving consumer goods.

title: Death Penalty Supported By New Judges at Parley
description: Support for capital punish ment was expressed yesterday by most of the participants at a judicial conference in the Commodore Hotel.

title: U.S. SAID TO APPROVE PLANES FOR ISRAEL
description: WASHINGTON. Dec. 6State Department officials would not comment tonight on a report that the United States had de cided to sell between 12 and 18 A4 Skyhawk attackbombers to Israel.

title: Hogan's Office Defends Record On Fighting Police Corruption
description: District Attorney Frank S Hogan's chief assistant deliv ered a vigorous defense yes terday of the Manhattan prose cutor's office record of inves tigating graft and corruption in the Police Department.

title: 2,815 UNITS RID OF LEAD HAZARD
description: Nearly 3,400 orders to cover leadpainted walls with wall board to guard against lead poisoning have been issued by the city's Health Department in the last two years, and 2,815 have been carried out so far.

title: Mdici Arrives
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 6 (AP) President Emilio G. Mdci of Brazil arrived today, accom panied by the Foreign Minister, Mario Gibson Barbosa.

title: Article 1  No Title
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 6 (AP) Following are the states that would be covered at once: Alaska, California, Connecticut, Maine, Massachusetts, Michi gan, Nevada, New Jersey, New York, Oregon, Rhode Island, Vermont and Washington. Puerto Rico would also be cov ered. If unemployment rises to the rates that were in effect earlier this year, the following states would also be covered: Arkansas, Kansas, Montana, New Mexico, North Dakota and Wisconsin.

title: JOSEPH R. DURSO
description: HACKENSACK, N. J., Dec. 6 Joseph R. Durso, a retired color chemist and printingink expert for the Interchemical Corporation, died yesterday in Hackensack Hospital after an illness of several weeks. He was 72 years old.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: SUFFOLK WEIGHS RISE IN SALES TAX
description: HAUPPAUGE, L. I., Dec. 6 Suffolk County Executiveelect John V. N. Klein has embarked on a comprehensive study of the county's fiscal crisis, that he said today could lead in January to a onecentonthe dollar increase in the county's sales tax.

title: PROF. THEODORE MEHLIN
description: WILLIAMSTOWN, Mass., Dec. 6 (AP)Dr. Theodore G. Meh lin, Field Memorial Professor of Astronomy at Williams College, died yesterday in North Adams Hospital. He was 65 years old.

title: RussianChinese Clash Steals Council Limelight
description: UNITED NATIONS, N. Y., Dec. 6For three days running a venomous private battle be tween the delegates of China and the Soviet Union has domi nated the emergency session of the Security Council on the IndianPakistani war.

title: Dodge Trucks Recalled
description: DETROIT, Dec. 6 (AP)The Chrysler Corporation announced today that it was recalling 29,696 lightduty, 1972 model Dodge trucks for inspection, to tighen, if necessary, bolts that hold the cargo box to the frame. Chrysler said it expected only a small number of the early production vehicles to have loose bolts, adding that some vehicles in stock had already been fixed.

title: Dr. Eddie Anderson Reminisces On Rockne Years at Notre Dame
description: When Dr. Eddie Anderson, the former Iowa and Holy Cross coach, played with the late Knute Rockne's first Notre Dame eleven in 1918, he never dreamed he was going to spend most of his lifetime in foot ball.

title: Lindsay Asks Legislature For Fiscal Study of State
description: Mayor Lindsay called on the Legislature yesterday to inves tigate the fiscal management of the state government from top to bottom, because of Gover nor Rockefeller's proposal to cut state aid to localities to help meet an estimated state deficit of $770million.

title: TURNOVERS LINKED TO GIANTS DECLINE
description: If you still don't believe that statistics can lie, ask the New York Giants. They have learned, in the most painful way, how misleading blind numbers can be.

title: ROSE BOZIN HEARD IN A SONG RECIT AL
description: There were several plus fac tors to Rose Bozin's debut in Carnegie Recital Hall late Sun day afternoon. One was the imaginative programing: the soprano's choice of material in cluded a number of songs re quiring various instrumental combinations and the contrasts in timbre were most effective.

title: Gierek Opens Party Congress, Stressing Efforts for Better Life
description: WARSAW, Dec. 6Edward Gierek, Poland's _Communist party chief, opened the party's Sixth Congress today, nearly a year after the economic riots that brought him to power, with a program pledged to improv ing basic living conditions.

title: SIHANOUK SEES END OF CAMBODIAN ARMY
description: PEKING, Dec. 6 (Reuters) The exiled former Car,.;oodian ruler, Prince Norodom Sihanouk, asserted today that the Cam bodian Government's army no longer existed following shat tering defeats at the hands of forces loyal to him.

title: BRANDT GETS APPEAL TO HELP END STRIKE
description: BONN, Dec. 6West Ger many's bankers and manufac turers appealed through their national organization to Chan cellor Willy Brandt today to intervene in the strike that has stilled the automobile industry and begun to affect other in dustries across the country.

title: JULIUS C. STREMLAU
description: MERIDEN, Conn., Dec. 6 (UPI)  Julius C. Stremlau, known as the father of Connec ticut's Workmen's Compensa tion Act, died yesterday at a nursing home. He was 94 years old.

title: Princeton Five Upsets North Carolina by 8973
description: PRINCETON, N. J., Dec. 6 Andy Rimol, a 6foot10inch sophomore center, scored 23 points and Ted Manekas added 21 tonight as Princeton upset secondranked North Carolina, tonight, 8973.

title: Spain to Join Airbus Project
description: MADRID, Dec. 6 (AP)The Government has announced that it has approved Spain's participation in the European program for construction of the giant A300B airbus. An an nouncement said that an agree ment with France, West Ger many and the Netherlands would be signed soon in Madrid. Spain is expected to invest $73.5million in the project.

title: NASSAU WILL SUE ITS CITIES ON TAX
description: MINEOLA, L. I., Dec, 6  Nassau County Executive Ralph G. Caso said today that the county would sue in State Su preme Court here this week to prevent Use cities of Glen Cove and Long Beach from illegal ly usurping the county's right to a onecentonthedollar in crease in the sales tax in their jurisdictions.

title: Nixon Amends Phase 2 Order
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 6 (AP) President Nixon amended to day the executive order setting up the Phase Two wage and price control machinery to set the salaries of the Pay Board and Price Commission chairmen at $38,000 a year. The Deputy White House press secretary, Gerald L. Warren, said the ac tion was a temporary measure until the economic stabilization act is passed by Congress. That legislation would set the salaries at $40,000 a year.

title: Andrei A. Andreyev Dies at 76; Former Soviet Deputy Premier
description: MOSCOW, Dec. 6Andrei A. Andreyev, a, former close associate of Stalin and a long time member of the Soviet Un ion's ruling politburo, died yesterday after a long illness. He was 76 years old.

title: SOYBEAN FUTURES HIT BY WAR NEWS
Mitchell Planning a National Corrections Academy to Train Prison Employes
description: WILLIAMSBURG, Va., Dec. 6 Attorney General. John N. Mitchell announced today a se ries of steps that, he said, will help the country's prisons go beyond merely detaining pris oners toward actually rehabili tating them.

title: Girl Dies in Belfast
description: BELFAST, Northern Ireland, Dec. 6 (AP)A Salvation Army girl died today in the rubble of a building that collapsed after two bombs ripped apart a near by shirt factory and touched off a fire.

title: Christmas Shopping Services For Men Only Turn Coed
description: On Saturday, a woman shopper brought her children to Bonwit Teller's 721 Club, which, until then, had been a traditional haven of har ried men Christmas shop pers. The woman got loaded at the club, which one ha bitue refers to as the only place you can get a decent drink on Fifth Avenue.

title: SCRIBNER ISSUES RULE ON DIPLOMAS
description: School Chancellor Harvey B. Scribner directed yesterday that high school diplomas be awarded on the basis of edu cational standards and not be denied, withheld or delayed to punish a student for poor conduct in school.

title: CITY VOICES ALARM OVER GAS SUPPLY
description: The city administration has told Washington it is alarmed by recent events that may seri ously affect the gas supplies to New York City, and it has urged the Government to seek to avert air pollution and health hazards for heavily populated areas.

title: MOST SUBWAY CARS ARE CALLED UNSAFE
description: A survey of 1,751 of the city's estimated total of 6,400 operating subway cars has turned up a number of defects indicating that about twothirds of all the cars are unsafe, ac cording to Assemblyman An drew Stein, a Manhattan Demo crat and a member of the Mayor's Subway Watchdog Commission.

title: Yen at 10.87% High
description: TOKYO, Dec. 6The yen was traded today at its highest rate since it was floated on Aug. 28, 324.70 yen to the dollar, as a result of the heavy sales of American currency in the Tokyo foreignexchange market. Turn over amounted to $148,790,000.

title: U.S. CUTS ECONOMIC AID TO INDIANS
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 6Con tinuing to brand India as the main aggressor in the war with Pakistan, the United States suspended a large part of its economic aid to New Delhi today.

title: CITY IS MODIFYING RULES ON QUOTES
description: The city's Consumer Affairs department has revised its pro posed regulation barring the use of misleading movie, theater and book advertisments, in an effort to quash industry ob jections against the measure.

title: Pedestrian Mall Is Proposed for Madison Ave.
description: The city's Office of Mid town Planning and Develop ment yesterday proposed closing Madison Avenue from 42d to 57th Street to all but bus and emergency traffic next spring and creating a pedestrian mall there graced by trees, sidewalk cafes, decorative pavements, bus shelters, drinking fountains and new forms of lighting.

title: PROJECTIVE WINS AQUEDUCT EVENT
description: On his only mount of the program, Braulio Baeza regis tered a thrilling victory aboard Harry Gordon's Projective in the main event at Aqueduct yesterday. Eight started in the seven furlong race for older horses. The crowd of 20,129 made Projective, racing as an entry with Gay Greeter, the favorite and he returned $3.40 for $2 straight.

title: Escaped Prisoner Captured
description: BATON ROUGE, Dec. 6 (UPI) Federal agents had Wallace McDonald back in custody to day. He was one of two men who escaped from the Florida State Prison at Raiford Nov. 13. He is also wanted in the rob bery of a Memphis bank.

title: HOME ASKS SOLUTION ACCEPTABLE TO EAST
description: LONDON, Dec. 6The For eign Secretary, Sir Alec Doug lasHome, called today for an IndianPakistani solution that takes account of the wishes of the people affected.

title: Worms Found in Jars of Baby food Lids Called the Culprit
description: PRINCETON, N. J., Dec. 6 Thanksgiving began normally for Florence Falk. She roast ed a turkey for her husband, Richard, the Albert G. Mil bank Professor of Inter national Law and Practice at Princeton University, and for her son, Dmitri, 2. But when she opened a jar of baby food for her infant of seven months, Noah, she found a worm on top.

title: VOICE STYLE SHOWN BY ANOTHER TAYLOR
description: Livingston Taylor is a charming, remarkably pleas ant young singer/song writer whose principal handicap is that he is the brother of superstar James Taylor. That, in itself, would not necessarily be a problem if Mr. Taylor's voice was not so eerily similar to that of his sibling.

title: SOVIET SAID TO AVOID BENGALI RECOGNITION
description: MOSCOW, Dec. 6Pakistan privately urged the Soviet Union today not to follow In dia's recognition of East Pakis tan as the independent nation of Bangla Desh, and wellplaced Soviet sources said Soviet rec ognition was not likely in the near future.

title: Albany Mall to Get Its First Legislators
description: ALBANY, Dec. 6After six years and hundreds of millions of dollars, the first suites are being readied here for legisla tors in the controversial South Mall project, the state's mon umental spread of office tow ers, promenades and fountains.

title: Justice's Will Probated
