description: State Supreme Court Justice Frederick Backer, who died Nov. 18 in Mount Sinai Hospital at the age of 62, left an estate valued at more than $1million, according to a will filed for probate yesterday in Manhattan Surrogate's Court. The will, dated Sept. 23, 1969, bequeaths the entire estate to Justice Backer's widow, the former Eleanore Whitney, who lives at the Backer residence at 26 East 63rd Street.

title: Article 4  No Title
description: MORGANTOWN, W. Va., Dec. 6 (AP)West Virginia, trailing by 5245 early in the second half, rode a pressing defense and the sterling play of Will Robinson and Levi Phillips to an 8775 victory over North Carolina State tonight.

title: Advertising:
description: Spurred on by the prospect of major increases in postal rates, the Magazine Publish ers Association is planning a test of an alternate delivery system in Oklahoma City.

title: House Extends Training Act
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 6 (AP) The House sent to the Senate today a bill to extend the Man power Development and Train ing Act. The law provides pro grams of institutional and on thejob training currently being funded at the rate of $750 mil lion annually. The extension would expire on June 30, 1973.

title: Delaware U. Raises Tuition
description: NEWARK, Del. Dec. 6 (AP) The trustees of the University of Delaware have approved tuition increases of 18 per cent. Ontofstate students face an even larger increase of 55 per cent. Under the new prices, Delaware students will pay $500 a year, nonresident un dergraduates will pay $1,500 year and nonresident graduate students will pay $1,700 year.

title: Treasury Bills Yields Fall at Weekly Auction
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 6 Yields on United States Treasury bills fell in the Gov ernment's weekly competitive sale today of these short term securities.

title: Ohio State Triumphs, 7160
description: COLUMBUS, Ohio, Dec. 6 (UPI)Luke Witte and Dan Gerhard scored 20 points apiece to lead fourthranked Ohio State to a 7160 victory over Utah State tonight.

title: Gilbert, Ratelle and Hadfield Set Blistering Pace in Scoring
description: On Sunday night at Madison Square Garden, when the Ran gers were uncharacteristically having difficulty with the Van couver Canucks, they received a shot of instant relief from a familiar source.

title: How Ford Fund's Aid to Arts Grew
description: In the last 14 years the Ford Foundation has com mitted $232million to grants and projects in the artsa record probably unsurpassed in world history, even by the Medicis or the most ambi tious and daring of the Popes.

title: How Not to Write a Tax Bill
description: The 1971 tax bill is now moving through the routine final procedures in Congress toward enactment. By any reasonable standard of responsible legislating, Congress has put on a classic demonstration of how not to write a major bill. Decisions have been secret, arbitrary, unex plained. A few men have wielded enormous power and have been accountable to no one.

title: SENATE CONFIRMS POWELL BY 89 TO 1 FOR BLACK'S SEAT
description: WASHINGTON. Dec. 6The Senate confirmed today the nomination of Lewis F. Powell Jr. to the Supreme Court by a vote of 89 to 1 and im mediately began to debate the more controversial nomination of William H. Rehnquist.

title: Superscope Antitrust Suit Filed Against Sony Corp.
description: Superscope, Inc., a distribu tor of Sony tape recorders, said yesterday that it was filing $149million antitrust suit in Los Angeles District Court against Sony and was seeking to prevent Sony from canceling a distributorship deal expiring Dec. 31, 1974.

title: Still Unresolved
description: Sports of The Times

title: Boards of 2 Banks Again Back Merger
description: Merger News

title: Knicks Will Bid for a Tie For Division Lead Tonight
description: The Knicks will bid for a tie with Boston for the leader ship of the National Basketball Association's Atlantic Division tonight when they oppose the Celtics at Madison Square Garden.

title: Conservatives Planning to Oppose Nixon in Primaries
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 6  A group of rightwing Republi cans, none of them office holders, has tentatively decided to support a conservative can didate against President Nixon in a number of Presidential pri maries next year.

title: Lynch, in London, Presses Unity Issue
description: LONDON, Dec. 6  Prime Minister John Lynch indicated today that the Irish Republic was ready to rewrite its Con stitution to make it more ac ceptable to Protestants.

title: Kosygin, Ill, Will Cut Short His Official Visit to Norway
description: OSLO, Norway, Dec. 6 (AP)  Premier Aleksei N. Kosygin went to bed with flu today and decided to cut short his of ficial visit to Norway by 16 hours and fly home Wednesday.

title: Marks Rise by 13%
description: PARIS, Dec. 6The foreign exchange markets have taken over some of the work of the negotiators in the world mone tary crisis as the major curren cies continue to appreciate against the dollar.

title: House Member Sworn
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 6 (AP) William P. Curlin Jr. was sworn in today as a United States Representative from Ken tucky. Mr. Curlin, the Demo crat, was chosen last Saturday in a special election to succeed the late John Watts, also Democrat, in the sixth Con gressional District.

title: The War Proceeds
description: During a long procedural wrangle at a weekend session of the United Nations Security Council on the IndiaPakistan war, an African delegate abruptly pierced some consciences. While the Council debated procedure, he reminded his colleagues, people were dying on the Indian subcontinent. They are dying in greater numbers now; and still the Council is blocked, by greatpower rivalry, ideological conflict, hypocrisy and indifference, from taking even a modest first step to end the bloodshed.

title: STOCKS OFF A BIT ON PROFIT TAKING
description: Stock prices moved higher early yesterday to stretch the dramatic rally of the last six sessions, but profit taking forced most market averages into minus territory by the clos ing bell.

title: College Sports Notes
description: Maryland and Minnesota dropped their football coaches last week without so much as a thank you and began looking for the men who will coach their teams back to national prominence. Minne sota also blamed its athletic director for football short comings (losses) so it added him to the list of unemployed. Paul Giel, once a soso pitcher with the baseball Giants, replaced Marsh Ryman as the Minne sota athletic director. Giel Was an allAmerica football player for the Gophers. Now he and Jim Kehoe, the Mary land athletic director, can hunt for that miracle man who will do nothing but coach winning football teams.

title: A Bad Year at Albany
description: News Analysis

title: Library Brings Peter Pan Magic Alive
description: A cheerful new central chil dren's room with open stacks, earphones, a rarebook room and a storytelling room will open tomorrow at the Donnell branch of the New York Public Library at 20 West 53d Street.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: CHARLES C. SHEFFERT
description: PORT WASHINGTON, L.I., Dec. 6Charles G. Sheffert, photo retoucher at The New York Times for 35 years till his retirement March 30, 1960, died today at his home here, 43 Park Avenue, after two years illness. His age was 84.

title: Johnson and Mrs, Nixon Lead Mourners at McCormack Rites
description: BOSTON, Dec. 6 (AP)For mer President Lyndon B. Johnson and Mrs. Richard M. Nixon headed a group of Gov ernment officials and friends today at the funeral of the wife of former House Speaker John W. McCormack.

title: Laotian Retreat Reported
description: VIENTIANE, Laos, Dec. (Reuters)Government forces today abandoned the strategic town of Saravane in southern Laos after an attack by two North Vietnamese battalions, informed sources said.

title: Italy's NeoFascists Getting Political Cold Shoulder
description: ROME, Dec. 6The latest word in Italy's political vocab ulary is emarginare  to push out into the cold. It refers to what is happening to the neoFascists.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: Nicklaus Wins and Sets Money Mark
description: ORLANDO, Fla., Dec. 6 Jack Nicklaus brought my best year in golf to an end today by winning the Walt Disney World open tournament by three strokes. His first prize of $30,000 made him the lead ing moneywinner of the year in golf with $244,490.50, a record.

title: Wallace Says Electoral College Deadlock in 1972 Is His Second Goal
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 6Gov. George C. Wallace of Alabama said today that the second best thing for him as a 1972 Presidential candidate would be to deadlock the Electoral Col lege and exact policy commit ments from President Nixon as the price of his reelection.

title: INDICTED POLICEMAN HELPS IN A CAPTURE
description: A police lieutenant who was indicted for perjury and sus pended from the force during the Knapp Commission investi gation last month apprehended an alleged pursesnatcher wield ing a knife and turned him over to a pursuing patrolman in the Bronx yesterday.

title: Mayor Indicates Lindsay Clubs Accepted Improper Donations
description: Mayor Lindsay said yester day that the John V. Lindsay Associations and other political groups should avoid accepting political contributions from peo ple or companies that did busi ness with the city government.

title: CHIEFS TRIUMPH OVER 49ERS, 2641
description: SAN FRANCISCO, Dec. 6 (AP)Otis Taylor scored touch downs on two spectacular plays and Jan Stenerud kicked four field goals tonight as the Kan sas City Chiefs beat the San Francisco 49ers, 2617, in a bat tle of firstplace teams.

title: Brown's Condition Good Following Auto Accident
description: TEANECK, N. J., Dec. 6 (AP) Roosevelt Brown, the former professional football player with the New York Giants who was injured in an automobile accident late yesterday, was resting, comfortably today fol lowing surgery.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: In Brief: Cities of East Pakistan
description: DACCAcapital of East Pakistan ... estimated popu lation:, 1 million . . . situ ated 150 miles northeast of Calcutta, India, on the Burlii Ganga River .. . has both a military and an international airport . . . a center of trade with many jute mills nearby . . . site of Dacca University and main offices of various business concerns.

title: Doc Severinsen a OneMan Show at Copacabana
description: For the last 25 years, Doc Severinsen has been develop ing the trumpet virtuosity that has made him one of the fix tures on the Tonight show on television. And yet, now that he is working in night clubscurrently at the Copa cabanaMr. Severinsen has created an act in which his trumpet playing is simply the icing on his cakeand it's a cake with many layers.

title: A.B.C. Bids to Overhaul Children's TV
description: The American Broadcasting Company proposed yesterday that the television industry substantially overhaul pro graming for children on Satur day and Sunday mornings lest the Federal. Trade Commission or public groups force a change by new rules or legislation.

title: HARPISTS' PROGRAM PROVES SURPRISING
description: Any concert that concludes with Berlioz's Rakoczy March played on four harps automat ically scores a high point in unusual if not bizarre program ing. But the four women of the New York Harp Ensemble had several other surprises for their Carnegie Recital Hall concert Sunday night.

title: Nixon Reassures Trudeau On U.S. Ties With Canada
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 6 Prime Minister Pierre Elliott Trudeau sought and received from President Nixon today what he accepted as reassur ances about the longterm United States attitude toward Canada.

title: DR. ARTHUR ALLISDN; RETIRED PHYSICIAN
description: BRONXVILLE, N. Y., Dec. 6 Dr. Arthur C. Allison, a phy sician who practiced here for many years until his recent re tirement to Siasconset, Nan tucket, Mass., died last night in New England Deaconess Hospital in Boston. He was 66 years old.

title: Solving the Payments Problem
description: Economic Analysis

title: Survivors Reliving the Bombing of Pearl Harbor 30 Years Ago
description: The Talk of Pearl Harbor

title: FOE SAYS GRIFFITH IS AT END OF ERA
description: Emile Griffith has spent the last 14 years in the boxing ring. During that time the native of St. Thomas, Virgin Islands, has held the world welterweight title three times and the mid dleweight title twice. Along the way Griffith has learned just about every ring move in the book.

title: INDIA SEEKING TO RING FOE IN EAST;
description: NEW DELHI, Dec. GThe In dian Army reported today that it was trying to draw a tight ening ring around the isolated Pakistani Army forces in East Pakistan.

title: Cancer Agency Debate: Scientific Stakes Are High
description: News Analysis

title: HIGH COURT RULES IN 2 UNIONS RIFT
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 6 (UPI)  The Supreme Court ruled unanimously today that employ ers were entitled to a voice in National Labor Relations Board hearings in jurisdictional dis putes between unions.

title: BILL KROT
description: Bill Krot, a production stage manager, died Thursday in his sleep at his home, 305 West 45th Street. His age was 45.

title: U.S. Stand Angers India
description: NEW DELHI, Dec. 6A great burst of anger against the United States is being felt in India because of American efforts in the United Nations Security Council to obtain a ceasefire resolution and the withdrawal of hostile forces.

title: Store Here Withdraws. Pirated Solzhenitsyn Book
description: A pirated Germanlanguage edition of Aleksandr Solzhen itsyn's new novel, August 1914, was removed from the display windows of the Rizzoli International Book store yesterday and with drawn from sale.

title: ANTON HORNER DIES; PLAYED SOLO HORN
description: Anton Horner, a member of the Philadelphia Orchestra for 44 years and its solo horn player for 28 years, died Satur day at the age of 94 in Spring field, Pa. Eugene Ormandy, the orchestra's musical director, paid tribute to Mr. Homer yesterday as one of the greatest horn players of all time Mr. Homer retired from the orchestra in 1946.

title: Saigon Is Closing Sleazy Bars for G.I.'s
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, Dec. 6A quiet campaign to close the city's bars and reduce prostitution now that United States troops are scarcer is being carried out by City Hall at the request of President Nguyen Van Thieu.

title: 5TH AVE. LINE FILES TAXREFUND CLAIM
description: S. Hazard Gillespie, trustee and receiver of Fifth Avenue Coach Lines, Inc., and its sub sidiary, Surface Transit, Inc., reported yesterday the filing of a Federal incometaxrefund claim totaling approximately $2.8million on behalf of the companies.

title: A New Pavlo Hummel
description: It has been said that Jo seph Papp believes David Rabe to be the most inter esting American playwright ever not even excluding Eugene O'Neill. Now a mere critic cannot afford to be so expansive, even though Mr. Rabe is possibly the most promising playwright to emerge in the United States since Edward Albee, and Mr. Papp and the New York Shakespeare Festival deserve garlands of roses for having discovered him.

title: A KENT DEFENDANT ADMITS RIOT CHARGE
description: RAVENNA, Ohio, Dec. 6 (AP) One defendant pleaded guilty and another went on trial today in Portage County Common Pleas Court in connection with disorders at Kent State Uni versity in May, 1970.

title: Indians Trade Uhlaender To Reds and Get Wilcox
description: CINCINNATI, Dec. 6 (UPI). The Cincinnati Reds acquired today Ted Uhlaender, an out fielder, from the Cleveland Indians in a trade for Milt Wilcox, a upitcher.

title: Lehman Gets City Study Post
description: Prof. Maxwell Lehman, di rector of the Long Island Uni versity Public Administration Center, has been appointed vice chairman and staff director of the Task Force on Structure and Organization of the Gov ernment of New York City, Stuart N. Scott, the chairman of the State Study Commission, announced yesterday.

title: Ozarks River Bill Gains
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 6 (AP) The House Interior Subcom mittee on National Parks and Recreation approved today a bill to authorize establishment of the Buffalo National River in northwest Arkansas. The na tional river would embrace up to 95,730 acres on both sides of the river in the Ozark Moun tains.

title: A RENT RISE PLAN NEAR IN CAPITAL
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 6  The Rent Advisory. Board will probably recommend to the Price Commission this week a formula for rent control permit ting a small general increase, perhaps 2 or 2.5 per cent.

title: MRS. MARK H. SENIGO
description: PAWLING, N. Y., Dec. 6 Mrs. Marie Lindemann Senigo, wife of Mark H. Senigo, a re tired printing executive in New York City, died yesterday at their home, 26 Pine Drive. She was 81 years old.

title: Article 3  No Title
description: MONTREAL, Dec. 6 (Cana dian Press)The Montreal Ex pos announced today that the contract of Adolfo Phillips has been sold by the Peninsula Whips of the International League to Portland of the Paci fic Coast League.

title: Sickness in City Labor
description: It is a measure of the irrationality in municipal union practice that a tentative wage settlement between the city and its unionized firemen has been made conditional on immediate abandonment of the sick calls the fire union has been keeping at a coercively high rate as a negotiating device.

title: MAYFIELD'S IMPACT AS A SINGER GROWS
description: Curtis Mayfield's 10 years as lead singer with the Impres sions have made him one of the most experienced professionals in pop music. That experience was evident in every note he sang Sunday night in his Phil harmonic Hall concert.

title: Bridge: Most Wanted Man in Game Is British Tourney Director
description: The mostwanted man in the world of bridge is no doubt Britain's Harold Frank lin, who passed through New York yesterday on his way to Las Vegas. Tournament organizers all over the world seek him out to benefit from his experience and expertise in the specialized art of di recting tournaments.

title: War at a Glance
description: NEW DELHIIndia said her forces were pushing for ward in East Pakistan at many points and turning back the Pakistanis in the West.

title: Stars Turn Back Colonels At Salt Lake City, 104100
description: SALT LAKE CITY, Dec. 6 (AP)The Utah Stars resumed their winning ways tonight with a 104100 victory over the Kentucky Colonels in an Amer ican Basketball Association game.

title: Cathedral of St. John Is Site Of a Variegated Peace Rally
description: Norman Mailer saw it as celebration, Tennessee Wil liams as an opportunity to ex press his outrage, and the Right Rev. Paul Moore Jr. as a true and proper use for a great church.

title: Bodies Recovered in Crash
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam.. Dec. 6 (UPI)  The bodies of 34 Americans killed Nov. 29 in the Vietnam war's second worst helicopter crash have been re covered, the United States command said today. Orig inally, only 33 servicemen were thought to have been aboard. The 34th body was found by a search team last week.

title: Executive Changes
description: Donald E. Releheider ter, 62 years old, former ly executive vice presi dent since 1963 and a company director since 1964, has been elected president and chief oper ating officer of the Armco, Steel Corporation, Mid dletown, Ohio. William Verity will continue as chairman and chief ex ecutive officer. Mr. Rei chelderfer, who since 1965 has been, resporisi ble for three of Armco's major divisions, joined the company in 1929 after graduating cum laude from Ohio State University. He later at tended the Harvard University advanced management program for business executives. Rising through the ranks he was named controller in 1951 and elected vice president of fi nance in 1967. The new president of Armco is member of the board of governors of the Middle town Civic Association, of which he had been presi dent for four years.

title: Newsprint Price Up
description: MacMillan Rothesay, Ltd., an nounoed yesterday it would in crease its newsprint prices for the United States East Coast and Southern markets by about 5 per cent, effective today. Prices in the East will increase by $8 a ton.

title: U.S. Asks Stricter Rules In BankHolding Mergers
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 6The Justice Department's anti trust division told the Federal Reserve Board today that it is supposed to apply standards that are considerably stricter than normal antitrust standards to acquisitions of mortgage companies by bank holding companies.

title: ChinaAustralia Talks Off
description: CANBERRA, Australia, Dec. 6 (AP)Prime Minister William McMahon reported today that China had broken off negotia tions to establish diplomatic re lations with Australia. We thought quite frankly we were on the way to some sort of success, he said in a television interview. but the Chinese suddenly cut off without rhyme or reason.

title: 30Mile Penetration
description: DACCA, Pakistan, Dec. 6 (Reuters)A Pakistani general I said today that Indian troops were now 30 miles inside East Pakistan and that Indian war ships were blockading the stra tegic port of Chittagong.

title: Chile, Ready to Devalue, Freezes All Escudo Trading
description: SANTIAGO, Chile, Dec. 6 The Chilean central bank or dered today suspension of all foreignexchange transactions by banks and brokers, in prep aration for a devaluation of the escudo.

title: Background of Dispute
description: HISTORICAL  Bloody strife between Moslems and Hindus had racked the Indian subcontinent for centuries before 1947, when India achieved independence from Britain and a separate Moslem state, Pakistan, was created in two parts, East and West, separated by more than 1,000 miles of Indian territory. India is predominantly Hindu, but has no state religion. Partition was followed by wide spread MoslemHindu fighting. The partition also left areas of Kashmir in dispute and twice, in 194849 and in 1965, this dispute plus constant charges by both sides of religious persecution led to armed conflicts.

title: COACH IS ENJOYING RECRUITLESS FIVE
description: Jack Kaminer is on the other side of the hectic college basketball recruiting scene and enjoying it more.

title: TWO HOTEL MAINS AGREE TO REFUNDS
description: Two major hotel chains agreed in a courtapproved set tlement yesterday to pay over $5million to thousands of hotel guests Who had paid bills that included improper charges.

title: Nixon Weighing SpeedUp for Building Advanced Missile Sub
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 6The Nixon Administration is re portedly considering, for stra tegic and political reasons, substantial speedup in the development and deployment of an advanced missile submarine.

title: Nuclear Pearl Harbor?
description: Thirty years after the Japanese strike at Hawaii that precipitated the United States into World War II, the nation still has failed to shake off its fear of surprise attack. Ever since the early 1950's, when the Soviet Union began to become an atomic power, opinion in the Con gress and the country has been susceptible to warnings of a possible nuclear Pearl Harbor. It has been the Pentagon's surest stock in trade at budget time every year and even, in the form of John F. Kennedy's erroneous charges of a missile gap, a major issue in a Presidential campaign.

title: MAKING A SLATE: ILLINOIS RITUAL
description: CHICAGO, Dec. 6The Il linois Democratic party's hierarchy emerged today from a smokefilled room to an nounce that Lieut. Gov. Paul Simon was the organization's candidate for Governor and that Representative Roman C. Pu cinski of Chicago was its choice for the United States Senate.

title: $100,000 in Jewels Taken
description: Burglars broke into the Ja cobo Jewelry Store at 169 East 116th Street in East Har lem during the weekend and stole $100,000 worth of dia mond rings and watches and $3,000 in cash, according to the police of the East 119th Street station.

title: Ripon Society Urges Nixon To Consider Cahill on Ticket
description: CAMBRIDGE, Mass., Dec. (AP)The Ripon Society, a lib eral Republican research organ ization, said today that Presi dent Nixon should consider Gov. William T. Cahill of New Jersey as a possible running mate next year.

title: Tunney Endorsement of Muskie In 1972 Race Is Reported Near
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 6Sen ator John V. Tunney of Cali fornia will endorse Senator Ed mund S. Muskie of Maine for the Democratic Presidential nomination on Wednesday, au thoritative sources said today.

title: Hungarian Asks Normal Trade Ties
description: A leading Hungarian busi ness official said here yester day that trade between the United States and his country could increase three or four times were normal conditions to prevail.

title: F.T.C. Settles With Gates
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 6 (Reu ters)The Federal Trade Com mission said today it had ac cepted a modified consent or der, requiring the Gates Rub ber Company to dispose of its Nephi, Utah, plant within a year. Gates also was forbidden to make acquisitions in the rubberbelt and hose field for a 10year period, without F.T.C. approval.

title: Police Catch Driver In 5Mile Chase Here
description: With a dozen police cars screaming behind him, the driver of a small automobile led the police on a fivemile chase from Greenwich Vil lage to the Upper East Side last night.

title: Insurgent at ChrisCraft Resigns as Board Candidate
description: A leader of a shareholder group seeking to gain control of ChrisCraft Industries, Inc., yesterday submitted his resig nation as a candidate on the insurgent slate of directors after the company revealed he had been convicted of passing bad checks several years ago.

title: A Screen Test Clears Driver of Being Drunk
description: A video tape was shown yesterday in Criminal Court in Queens, and the star of the film performed so well that the judge dismissed drunken driving charges against him.

title: Amex Stocks Edge Upward as OTC List Slips
description: The American Stock Ex change and the overthecoun ter market finished in opposite directions yesterdaythe Amex rose while the counter issues fell.

title: 2 Harness Groups Choose Albatross As HorseofYear
description: Albatross, the 3yearold pacing colt that earned more money in a single season and raced faster than any other Standardbred in history, has been voted harnesshorseoftheyear for 1971, in balloting conducted by the United States Trotting Association and the United States Harness Writers' Association.

title: MARKET STAGES RALLY AT CLOSE
description: The stock market staged a sharp rally in the final 90 minutes of trading yesterday to turn a drowsy, profittaking session into a peppy, forwardsurging performance.

title: Jackson to Seek Legislation for Speedier Trials
description: Senator Henry M. Jackson, a candidate for the Democratic nomination for President, announced yesterday that he would seek Federal legislation requiring states to, submit detailed programs for achieving trial of criminal cases within 60 to 90 days.

title: Miss Evert in Exhibition
description: HOUSTON, Dec. 7 (UPI)Chris Evert, the 16yearold tennis star from Fort Lauderdale, Fla., will meet Mrs. Nancy Gunter of San Angelo, Tex., in an exhibition match at Rice University on Saturday for the benefit of the Houston Tennis Association.

title: For City's Children, a Gift Waits at Lincoln Center
description: Lincoln Center for the Performing Arts, the citadel of the American cultural Establishment, announced yesterday that for the first time it is opening its doors to neighborhood performing artists.

title: BLACK IN CAPITAL TO ENTER PRIMARY
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 7 Walter E. Fauntroy, the District of Columbia's nonvoting delegate in Congress, announced today that he would run in the District's Democratic Presidential primary next May 2 as a favoriteson candidate.

title: Surgery for Wings' Charron
description: DETROIT, Dec. 7 (UPI)The Detroit Red Wings' left wing, Guy Charron, entered a hospital today for surgery on a facial bone fracture suffered in the Nov. 28 game with the Montreal Canadiens.

title: REGAN ENJOYING HARNESS SUCCESS
description: YONKERS, Dec. 7Around the Yonkers Raceway, George (Buddy) Regan is being compared with the late Hirsch Jacobs of thoroughbred racing as a trainer without peer when it comes to spotting a good claim.

title: German Press Guideline
description: BONN, Dec. 7 (Reuters)The West German Press Council today called on journalists reporting incidents involving United States soldiers to refrain from mentioning their race except for compelling reasons. The Council is an independent selfregulatory body.

title: 2 COMPOSERS' SONGS IN STRIKING PROGRAM
description: Both Elie Siegmeister and Benjamin Lees write solidly and effectively for the voice in very different ways. Since the two composers' styles contrast so vividly, the program of their songs Monday night in Carnegie Recital Hall was a striking one.

title: Bethpage Gaits Title Golf
description: ALBANY, Dec. 7 (UPI)  The 1972 state Professional Golfers' Association championship will be held Sept. 18 to 22 on the Bethpage course on Long Island, it was announced today by Ed Bosse of the Colonie Country Club, chairman of the event.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: U.S. Woman, Reported In Pakistan Jail, Sought
description: Efforts were under way yesterday to determine the whereabouts and condition of an American woman reported jailed in Jessore, East Pakistan.

title: Margaret P. Mead Dead; Former Y.W.C.A. Official
description: Margaret P. Mead, who was first vice president from 1940 to 1945 of the national board of the Young Women's Christian Association and an active member from 1923 to 1958, died yesterday at the Hilaire Farm Nursing Home, Huntington, L.I. She was 84 years old.

title: NEW SECURITIES UNIT ANNOUNCES ITS CHIEF
description: The Association of Stock Exchange Firms and the Investment Bankers Association announced yesterday that Robert M. Gardiner would become the first chairman and chief executive officer of the new Securities Industry Association to be formed Jan. I upon the merger of the other two groups.

title: The Rehnquist Nomination
description: With only one dissenting vote, the Senate has confirmed the nomination of Lewis Powell to the Supreme Court. In this decisive manner, the Senate has shown how false was the imputation that it would not approve Southerner or a conservative. When a nominee is a man of professional stature, wide experience, and with a fundamental belief in the basic guarantees of the Constitution, no regional bias or philosophical disagreement bars his way.

title: Broadcast Journalism Is Found in a State of Siege
description: The annual Alfred I. duPontColumbia University Survey of Broadcast Journalism declared yesterday that in its hour of greatest influence the electrnic medium was in a state of siege.

title: Arson Laid to Porter
description: An 18yearold porter was arrested yesterday for allegedly setting two suspicious fires in Lincoln Hospital in the Bronx Sunday and was charged with arson. Fire and police officials reported that the porter, Felix Castro, of 1019 East 178th Street in the Bronx, had admitted seting he fires on two floors.

title: Norwalk Hospital Elects
description: NORWALK, Conn., Dec. 7The appointment of Norman A. Brady of Princeton, N. J., as director, chief executive officer and trustee of the Norwalk Hospital, was announced today by John H. Woodward, president of the hospital association.

title: State Sees Phone Shortage Even if Strike Is Ended
description: Even if the fourmonth strike of New York Telephone Company workers were to end at onc, a State Public Service Commission report made public by Governor Rockefeller yester day said that telephone facilities might not be adequate fox the busy season next January, February and March or the winter busy season of 1973.

title: War at a Glance
description: CALCUTTAIn the East, India reported the capture of key East Pakistani cities, virtually assuring control of half the province.

title: Rep. Dowdy Is Hospitalized At Trial on Bribery Charge
description: BALTIMORE, Dec. 7 (AP)Representative John Dowdy was hospitalized today after he complained of feeling ill at his trial on bribery conspiracy charges in United States District Court.

title: F.C.C. Asked by A.T. & T. To Approve Atlantic Cable
description: The American Telephone and Telegraph Company filed yesterday with the Federal Communications Commission for authority to build a new transAtlantic undersea cabe. The new cableto be designated TAT6would cost an estimated $145million and through advanced design would have a capacity of 4,000 circuits, or four times the capability of any ItransAtlantic cable now in service.

title: ALLIES IN EUROPE PLAN BILLION RISE IN ARMS BUDGETS
description: BRUSSELS, Dec. 7Ten European members of the North Atlantic Treaty Organization announced today that they planned to increase their defense budgets in 1972 by a total of well over $1billion.

title: Godfather Game Attacked
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 7, (UPI) Representative Mario Biaggi, Democrat of The Bronx, said tday that he has asked the Federal Trade Commission to stop further sales of a game that is packaged in a violin case and whose objective is to become head of a gangland kingdom. He asked the commission to seek an injunction to stop further sales of The Godfather Game, put out by a Cambridge, Mass., concern, Cambridge, Mass., concern, Family Games Inc.

title: ARMY'S QUINTET IS VICTOR, 7971
description: WEST POINT, N. Y., Dec. 7 Army, with all five starters scoring in double figures, turned back the University of California at Irvine, 79.71, for its second victory in three games and the first on its home court for its new coach, Dan Dougherty.

title: Samuel Joroff Dead at 57; S. I. Development Official
description: Samuel Joroff, deputy director of the Office of Staten Island Development, a unit of the Mayor's Office, died yesterday of leukemia in St. Vincent's Medical Center, West Brighton. S.I. He was 57 years old and lived at 12416 84th Road, Kew Gardens, Queens.

title: KYR DEFICIT HITS A RECORD LEVEL
description: New York University disclosed yesterday that it had a record deficit of $6.7million in 197071. It said it had greatly intensified its efforts to obtain increased state support while preserving its independent status.

title: Trevino Accepts Honors in Style
description: More than $230,000 richer than he was on Jan. 1, Lee Trevino held a Dubonnet on the rocks in one hand, a black cigar in the other and said here yesterday: Next year I'm going to go home on Sunday nights.

title: WORTHLESS NOTES ARE LAID TO FUND
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 7Witnesses testified today that the now  bankrupt Baptist Foundation of America issued notes for more than $25million with only $15,000 in assets.

title: Chromalloy Picks President
description: The Chromalloy American Corporation announced yesterday in St. Louis the election of Irving A. Shepard as president. He was formerly senior executive vice president and chief operating officer. Richard P. Seelig, previously president, was elected vice chairman of the boardcorporate development.

title: Foreign Investment Curb Is Indicated by Trudeau
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 7Prime Minister Pierre Elliott Trudeau, assured by President Nixon that the United States did not wish to gobble up Canada, said today that it was up to Canadians to decide what type of foreign investment they would accept.

title: Briton Reports Discovery of a Titian
description: LONDON, Dec. 7A prominent British art historian has claimed the discovery of a lost Titian masterpiece in a British country house.

title: Books of The Times
description: The following books were weeded out of an enormous pile of oversized books that I read my way through in search of some possible gift suggestions (which appeared in this column on Monday). The books included below struck me as noteworthy in one way or another, but I ant not at all sure that everyone would want to give or receive them as gifts. Call them antiChristmas books, then; call this an ungift book roundup. But pause to consider:

title: Block Automation System To Be Marketed in Europe
description: The New York Stock Exchange announced yesterday that its Block Automation System would be marketed and distributed in Europe by the A.P.Dow Jones Financial Wire, a news service jointly operated by The Associated Press and Dow Jones & Co.

title: ... Mending Ties With Canada
description: Prime Minister Trudeau, a man not usually given to inflated rhetoric, says President Nixon in their White House talks offered him a fantastically new statement of United States respect for the political and economic identity of Canada. Mr. Nixon said things to him unequalled by any other President in speaking about Canada, Mr. Trudeau told a news conference.

title: Brazilian President Welcomed by Nixon
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 7President Nixon welcomed President Emilio G. Media of Brazil at the White House today as the latter began a threeday state visit here.

title: FIRESTONE PROFIT RISES IN QUARTER
description: The Firestone Tire and Rubber Company showed a 22.4 per cent increase in operating earnings in the fiscal year ended Oct. 31 on a sales gain of 6.4 per cent, the company reported yesterday from headquarters in Akron, Ohio. Earnings in the final fiscal quarter were up 25.7 per cent while sales rose 10.8 per cent from the yearearlier level.

title: Pressure by Enemy on Pnompenh Is Continuing
description: PNOMPENH, Cambodia, Dec. 7 (AP)Enemy forces kept up pressure near Pnompenh today with rockets, guns and mines. In the eastern part of the country, however, South Vietnamese forces met little resistance.

title: Howard Hughes' Memoirs Are Bought For Book and Serial in Life Magazine
description: The McGrawHill Book Company has acquired world publishing rights to a 230,000word transcript of taped reminiscences of Howard R. Hughes, the Texasborn multimillionaire long considered to be the most determined hermit in the United States.

title: Atlantic City Hotel Sold
description: CAMDEN, N. J., Dec. 7 (UPI) The Mutual Life Insurance Company of New York bought the 634room Atlantic City Ambassador Hotel today for $1.3million at an auction conducted by Federal District Court Judge William Lipking, referee in bankruptcy. The company made the only bid for the 13story structure, which opened in 1919. It has been closed for the last four years.

title: LTV Plans Exchange Offer To Holders of Warrants
description: DALLAS, Dec. 7 (Reuters)LingTemcoVought, Inc., said today a registration statement is being filed with the S.E.C. for a proposed exchange offer to holders of six different classes of company warrants.

title: Sport Clothes: New Emblem Enters Field
description: Despite the fact that he lost that day to Ken Rosewall, Rod Laver recalls the outfit he wore to the World Championship of Tennis in Dallas on Nov. 26 rather fondly.

title: Chicago's Schools Stave Off a Shutdown
description: CHICAGO, Dec., 7Chicago's giant public school system, the nation's third largest, did not close today.

title: Stage: Irving Caesar Relives Career
description: In A Bio in Song, the first in this season's Matinee Series presented Monday nights and Tuesday afternoons by Lucille Lortel at the Theater de Lys, Irving Caesar plays Irving Caesar.

title: U. S. STEEL WINS AN AVERAGE RISE OF 3.6% IN PRICES
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 7The Price Commission granted the nation's largest steel producer an average price increase of. 3.6 per cent today, substantially less than had been expected.

title: Plane Hits Deer on TakeOff
description: NANTUCKET, Mass., Dec. 7 (AP)An Executive Airlines plane attempting a takeoff from Nantucket airport was damaged yesterday when it struck and killed a deer scampering across the runway after eluding hunters. The two men aboard, Ellsworth Keene, the pilot, and Barry Paulson, the copilot, were not hurt. The accident occurred moments before the aircraft reached enough speed to be airborne.

title: Two ExNarcotics Agents Win Dismissal of Extortion Charges
description: An indictment charging two former Federal narcotics agents with extortion and conspiracy was dismissed in Federal Court in Brooklyn yesterday after the Government said there was no realistic possibility of convicting the two in an impending third trial.

title: OIL GROUP'S MEETING HINTS AT PRICE MOVES
description: ABU DHABI, Dec. 7 (AP)The Organization of Petroleum Exporting Countries opened today the first salvo in a new round of demands for higher oil pricas and greater control of the companies operating within the members' borders.

title: Rockland Official Named
description: NEW CITY, N. Y., Dec. 7John B. Lovett, a Republican of Pearl River, was appointed the first Rockland County. Director of General and Fiscal Services by the County Legislature, which created the office today prior to the appointment. The office is similar to the County Executive in other suburban counties.

title: Resolution Of the U.N.
description: UNITED NATIONS, N. Y., Dec. 7Following are excerpts from the resolution adopted by the General Assembly tonight calling for ceasefire between India and Pakistan:

title: PHIL BRITO RETURNS AT CARNEGIE HALL
description: Phil Brito, who made his New York debut in 1943 at La Martinique, the West 57th Street nightclub, returned to 57th Street Monday evening. This time he was in Carnegie Hall.

title: A.E.C. Reorganized In Move Stressing Civilian Programs
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 7The Atomic Energy Commission announced today a major reorganization of its internal structurethe first in a decadethat gives increased emphasis to civilian  oriented programs, rather than those directed toward military objectives.

title: A Study of Fiscal Studies
description: This persistent fiscal crisis is, perhaps, the most fundamental of all the city's problems, says a useful report released yesterday by the Commission on StateCity Relations. Entitled wryly A Study of Studies, it is a terse compilation and comparison of the eight major fiscal studies of New York City's government conducted by various groups and commissions over the last couple of decades. The report comes amid a fresh state and city fiscal crisis and is therefore especially timely.

title: Braves on Top, 11591
description: BUFFALO, Dec. 7 (UPI)Fred Hilton and Elmore Smith, rookies, sparked a faltering Buffalo attack in the third period tonight and led the Braves to a 11591 victory over the Cincinnati Royals.

title: Group Plans Court Fight to Bar New Cuts in State Mental Care
description: Leaders of a recently formed federation of mentalhealth associations and other groups said yesterday they would go to court to try to prevent further cuts in the budgets for state mental institutions.

title: Celtics Subdue Knicks, 10597
description: Not yet ready to relinquish first place in the National Basketball Association's Atlantic Division, the Boston Celtics ran the New York Knicks into submission at Madison Square Garden last night and scored a 10597 victory.

title: 3d Rostropovich Recital Set
description: A third recital at Philharmonic Hall has been scheduled for Mstislav Rostropovich, the Soviet cellist who is to open an American tour tonight in the same hall. The, previously announced second recital, on Jan. 7, is already sold out. The newly announced recital date is Dec. 23, and tickets for it are now on sale at the Philharmonic Hall box office.

title: Bhutan Recognizes Bengalis
description: NEW DELHI, Dec. 7 (AP)The Himalayan mountain kingdom of Bhutan today became the second nation to recognize the People's Republic of Bangla Desh, the name given to East Pakistan by the rebels. Bhutan's action was announced in New Delhi by a spokesman for the Indian Government, which is responsible under a treaty for advising Bhutan on its foreign affairs. Prime Minister Indira Gandhi announced India's recognition of Bangla Desh yesterday.

title: Emergency Action Is Disputed in Seoul
description: SEOUL, South Korea, Dec. 7 Premier Kim Jong Pil and the president of the major opposition party differed in separate interviews today over the necessity of the state of national emergency declared yesterday by President Park Chung Hee.

title: The Mississippi: Highway of Pollution
description: NEW ORLEANS, Dec. 7A government study to be published soon will report that waste dumped into the Mississippi River may be threatening aquatic life in the Gulf of Mexico and human health in southern Louisiana.

title: OTB WILL ACCEPT TROPICAL WAGERS STARTING MONDAY
description: The city's offtrack betting corporation announced plans yesterday to begin its first fullscale wagering on outoftown tracks by taking bets on racing at Tropical Park in Miami starting next Monday.

title: Saigon May Free P.O.W.'s
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, Wednesday, Dec. 8 (AP)South Vietnam is preparing to release scores more North Vietnamese and Vietcong prisoners of war during forthcoming holidays in the hope that Hanoi will reciprocate by freeing American prisoners, official sources said today.

title: Miss Subways of '41, Meet Miss Subways of '71
description: Eleven of the 150 women who have reigned for brief periods as Miss Subways, and whose photographs have enlivened subway cars over the last 30 years, got together yesterday at Johnny Angel's restaurant in midtown Manhattan to lunch and reminisce. They also were there to meet Donna McKechnie, the dancer who plays Miss Turnstiles in the Broadway musical, On The Town.

title: Circle Line Agrees To On Board Plants For Treating Waste
description: The Circle Line agreed yesterday to install federally approved on board sewage treatment facilities on its fleet of sightseeing vessels by next Dec. 1.

title: CONSUMERS SUING BANK OF AMERICA
description: LOS ANGELES, Dec. 7A consumer organization is suing the Bank of America, charging violations of the Federal TruthinLending Act and asking damages that, according to the plaintiff, could total more than $1billion.

title: $1.6Billion Cancer Fund Is Approved by Conferees
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 7  A SenateHouse conference committee agreed today on legislation to sponsor a muchexpanded research attack on cancer. The bill authorizes $1.6billion over the next three years to permit scientists to broaden their efforts and capitalize on many recent scientific advances.

title: Buckley Says White House Is Actively Studying Forest Hills Project
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 7Senator James L. Buckley said today that the White House was actively studying the controversial low income housing project being built in Forest Hills, Queens, and had expressed some concern about it. The ConservativeRepublican Senator from New York, who has opposed construction of the 840unit project in the middleincome area, said he had been advised of the White House study in a telephone call this morning from an aide to President Nixon. Mr. Buckley declined to identify the White House staff member and did not give details of the conversation other than to say: The matter is being actively studied now and there is an expression of concern. The Senator wrote to the President about the Forest Hills project two weeks ago after George Romney, Secretary of Housing and Urban Development, reviewed plans for the project at Mr. Buckley's request and reported finding no basis for which he could halt the construction contracts, which had already been let. At that time, Mr. Buckley said he did not know whether the President, could do anything to halt the Forest Hills project, adding that he hoped that steps could be taken in future projects to permit a greater voice by local communities in the planning for such housing. Until the telephone call this morning, Mr. Buckley had received no response to his letter to Mr. Nixon.

title: U.N. ASSEMBLY, 10411, URGES TRUCE
description: UNITED NATIONS, N.Y. Dec. 7The General Assembly approved tonight a resolution urging. India and Pakistan to stop fighting and pull back their troops.

title: Front Page 2  No Title
description: HELP RETAILERS SELL TOUR PRODUCTS with selfliquidating merch, displays by Krebs (designers/mfrs.) 2473690. Advt.

title: FEARS ON TRAFFIC BALK BERLIN PACT
description: BONN, Dec. 7The deadlock between East Germany and West Berlin on fixing final details of the fourpower accord on Berlin has laid bare a conflict between East and West German interests, in the opinion of experts on both sides.

title: Dec. 31 Merger of Wheat And First Securities Set
description: Wheat & Co. and the First Securities Corporation of North Carolina, both member firms of the New York Stock Exchange, announced yesterday that they would merge Dec. 31. The resulting corporation will be named Wheat, First Securities, Inc. and will be one of the largest securities houses in the Southeast.

title: ExConvicts Tell Police Trainees Of Necessity for Prison Reforms
description: Between a slum born police trainee and a convict, the line is often of necessity thin.

title: JOHN F. RICHARDSON, TAUGHT AT STEVENS
description: Prof. John F. Richardson, secretary of the faculty of Stevens Institute of Technology, died Monday night in New York Infirmary after surgery for cancer. He was 57 years old and lived at 616 River Street on the Stevens campus in Hoboken, N. J.

title: HENDERSON DEFENSE LOSES DISMISSAL BID
description: FORT MEADE, Md., Dec. 7The military judge at the courtmartial of Col. Oran K. Henderson denied today a series of defense motions that sought the dismissal of all charges against the 51yearold combat officer.

title: JONES & LAUGHLIN SIGNS CREDIT DEAL
description: The Tones & Laughlin Steel Corporation announced yesterday the signing of a new sevenyear credit agreement with banks in its existing credit lines. The company, said the new agreement would allow the borrowing of up to $75million on a revolving basis until Dec. 31, 1973, and on fiveyear term loan afterward.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor: Your Nov. 13 editorial on the Highway Trust Fund reveals the same kind of shortsighted refusal to face facts that you attribute to me as a socalled political ally of the voracious highway lobby.

title: Marie Collier, 44, Dies in Fall; Covent Garden Opera Soprano
description: LONDON, Dec. 7Marie Collier, the Australian operatic soprano, fell to her death from her fourthfloor apartment here early today. Her age was 44.

title: Dance: New Ailey Season
description: The Alvin Ailey American Dance Theater, at the top of its form, opened last night at the City Center for a twoweek season through Dec. 19. With Blues Suite, Cry, Choral Dances and Revelations, it offered some of the best programing that has been seen in its recent and, it is to be hoped, frequent, seasons. Suite the kind of sultriness and selfabsorbed concentration that can be found elsewhere only in Spanish flamenco dancing.

title: Acheson Initiated Method of Shifting Deadlocked U.N. Issues to the Assembly
description: UNITED NATIONS, N. Y., Dec. 7The General Assembly meeting today on the IndianPakistan conflict is the sixth in United Nations history called, under a resolution known as Uniting for Peace. Its aim is to permit the Assembly to act when the Security Council is paralyzed by vetoes.

title: Boyden and Reagan Receive Football Awards Here
description: Gov. Ronald Reagan of California and Dr. Frank Boyden, 92yearold headmaster emeritus of historic Deerfield Academy, were among those honored at the colorful National Football Foundation's Hall of Fame Awards dinner at the Waldorf Astoria Hotel last night.

title: Midtown Bank Robbed
description: A man seated himself before the desk of a bank employe at the, First National City Bank branch at 757 Madison Avenue, near 65th Street, this morning as though he were going to apply for a loan. I mean business, he said, according to the police. Take me to a teller. I want this bag filled up with money. The suspect escaped with $3,300.

title: Notes on People
description: The first winner of the Europe Prize for Statesmanship is Prime Minister Heath of Britain. The award, bearing a cash gift of 300,000 Deutschemarks (about $85,000), will be made to Mr. Heath for his work toward carrying Britain into the Common Market and toward unifying Europe.

title: INDIA CLAIMS CAPTURE OF JESSORE, ADMITS A MILE KASHMIR RETREAT;
description: CALCUTTA, India, Dec. 7The Indian Army reported a victory in Jessore tonight that virtually insured it of control of about half of East Pakistan, and the army chief immediately issued a call to the Pakistani forces there to surrender to save their lives.

title: Traynor in Hospital
description: PITTSBURGH, Dec. 7 (UPI)Harold Pie Traynor, 72yearold member of the Baseball Hall of Fame, is in Allegheny General hospital for treatment of a chronic respiratory ailment.

title: Court Stops Stamp Sale
description: OKLAHOMA CITY, Dec. 7 (AP)The Independent Postal System of America was ordered yesterday to stop selling its own stamps. Federal District Judge Fred Daugherty issued a temporary restraining order against the Oklahoma Citybased concern after a suit was filed by the National Association of Letter Carriers. The concern had planned to issue 5cent stamps for Christmas cards and compete with the United States Postal Service for their delivery in several cities.

title: Rain Disrupts Scenario for Brazilian's White House Welcome
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 7  A pelting rainstorm briefly sidetracked today a 75page, minutebyminute scenario complete with maps and diagrams for the threeday state visit of President Emilio G. Medici of Brazil.

title: Study Finds Steady Rise in Whites' Acceptance of Integration
description: A national survey of racial attitudes provides little evidence for the existence of white backlash among white ethnic groups.

title: Brands to Be Combined
description: The KayserRoth Hosiery Company, a division of the KayserRoth Corporation, announced yesterday it would combine its Interwoven and Esquire Socks brands, effective Jan. 1, 1972. The new brand. Interwoven/Esquire Socks, will be the general responsibility of Arnold M. Raphael, executive vice president of the hosiery company, and will be directed by David H. Bowman, general manager.

title: 2 ATLANTA FALCONS ARRESTED IN A RAID
description: MARIETTA, Ga., Dec. 7 (AP) Two members of the Atlanta Falcons, football team, Bob Berry, the quarterback, and Randy Marshall, a defensive end, were arrested last night in a raid on Mr. Marshall's apartment.

title: Art Museum Gets 3 New Trustees
description: In a move to serve, more effectively all areas of the broader public, the Metropolitan Museum has elected three new trustees, two of whom break with the traditional image of the board as a monied Manhattan Elite.

title: 62 Cases of Relief fraud Cited By State, and 59 Are in the City
description: State Welfare Inspector General George F. Berlinger said yesterday that he had submitted 62 cases of apparent welfare frauds to local commissioners, including the case of a Suffolk woman who worked part of the time as a welfare employe while being overpaid $15,141 as a relief recipient under another name.

title: The Proceedings In the U.N. Today
description: Meets at 3 P.M. to discuss Rhodesia.

title: PACERS TRIUMPH OVER NETS, 119114
description: WEST HEMPSTEAD, L. I., Dec. 7 (AP)Roger Brown scored half of his 22 points in the final period to lead the Indiana Pacers to a 119114 victory over the New York Nets tonight in an American Basketball Association game.

title: Rangel Says Lindsay Reneged On Police Corruption Promise
description: A New York Representative has accused the Lindsay administration of reneging on an agreement that it would fight police corruption in return for the Congressman's support during the 1969 mayoral campaign.

title: Bill Aids ExAddicts
description: SACRAMENTO, Calif., Dec. 7 (UPI) Gov. Ronald Reagan signed legislation yesterday authorizing school districts to hire former marijuana users in nonteaching positions. The districts can hire persons who have been convicted of using marijuana if they have been rehabilitated for five years.

title: Women Sworn as Agents
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 7 (AP) Five women were sworn in today as special Customs agents of the Treasury Department. Now the Federal Bureau of Investigation is the last allmale Federal law enforcement agency. The five women are Janet Ingram, 29 years old, who was sworn in less than a year ago as one of the first three sky marshals; Susan Gail Rowley, 25; Geraldine R. Baker, 25; Sara E. Durant, 23, and Phyllis Ann Barrett, 24.

title: Front Page 1  No Title
description: PLAY INDOOR TENNIS on Wall Street. See ad on page 106.Advt.

title: Supreme Court to Consider College Ban, on S.D.S.
description: WASHINGTON, Dec, 7The Supreme Court agreed today to decide if a stateowned college may ban the radical Students for a Democratic Society from holding meetings on its campus.

title: SOYBEAN FUTURES MOSTLY WEAKER
description: The likelihood of curtailed exports if the war between India and Pakistan is prolonged, and talk of trade sanctions the United States might impose against India, involving food arid grain, preoccupied traders in soybean and grain commodity futures yesterday.

title: Advertising:
description: The new breed of young, black magazine publishers appears to be doing all right with its ventures, and at least two new magazines are in the wings.

title: Bolivia to Purchase 18 Jets From Brazil for $10Million
description: LA PAZ, Bolivia, Dec. 7 (AP) Bolivia will purchase 18 Brazilianbuilt jet aircraft valued at more than $10million in a move to modernize her air force, La Paz newspapers reported today.

title: Burger Bids Prison Heads Give Inmates Some Voice
description: WILLIAMSBURG, Va., Dec. 7  Chief Justice Warren E. Burger called upon the nation's prison administrators tonight to start communicating regularly with their prisoners and to let the prisoners regulate some limited part of their lives, however small.

title: Music: Rolf Schulte, Violinist, in Debut
description: There was no Wieniawski on Rolf Schulte's program at Town Hall Monday night. No Sarasate, either, or Paganini. The 22yearold German violinist, who was making his New York debut as a result of winning a Young Concert Artists audition here, plainly wanted to be judged as something other than just another flashy fiddler.

title: PERSICO IS FREED IN A USURY TRIAL
description: Carmine J. Persico was acquitted last night on two counts of conspiracy to commit crimlinal usury. Eight other charges fell by the wayside with the verdict, which was reached after more than 11 hours of deliberation.

title: Vermont U. Faculty Creates Chair for Ousted Professor
description: BURLINGTON, Vt., Dec. 7 (AP)The faculty of the University of Vermont College of Arts and Science voted unanimously last night to create a teaching position for Michael J. Parenti, who was ousted Saturday as a political science professor.

title: In Exile, Lady Fleming Helps Greek Families
description: At the age of 62, Lady Fleming is a frail freedom fighter.

title: Indiana Newspapers Sold
description: AUBURN, Ind., Dec. 7 (UPI) Purchase of the Auburn Printing Company, Inc., publishers of The Evening Star daily newspapers, by George Witwer, publisher of The Kendallville NewsSun, and John Johnston, a Garrett Printing Company owner, has been announced. Mr. Witwer will be editor and publisher of the newspaper and Mr. Johnston will take over the ownership of the commercial printing business.

title: PATROLMAN IS HELD FOR DRUG RAID ROLE
description: A 28yearold Brooklyn patrolman was arrested yesterday on charges of taking $3,400 from a woman seized during a narcotics raid. He was, later suspended from the force.

title: Bridge: American Contract League To Join Exodus From Area
description: A long and close association between the New York metropolitan area and the American Contract Bridge League will end in about a year. At a meeting of the league board of directors in Phoenix, Ariz., last month, the league made a notunexpected decision to move its operations from Greenwich to Memphis.

title: So Little Is Worth Trying
description: LONDONThe war in Vietnam has been a multiple, turning point; also shock to all established habits of political thinking.

title: Yale Football Star Helps Oxford Down Cambridge in Rugby
description: TWICKENHAM, England, Dec. 7 (AP)Tom Neville, an American Rhodes scholar playing with a dislocated shoulder, led Oxford to a 213 rout of Cambridge in their traditional rugby match today.

title: For Colum at 90, Tributes and Memories of Ireland
description: ENFIELD, Conn., Dec. 7  The Irish Ambassador came to Padraic Colum's bedside here today to pay his country's compliments. So did members of the American Irish Foundation, with a gift of $2,500 and a scroll hailing Mr. Colum as Poet, dramatist, storyteller, collector of folklore and critic ... a master writer held in esteem, wherever literature is cherished.

title: ILLINOIS DEMOCRATS ENDORSE ATTORNEY
description: CHICAGO, Dec. 7  The Cook County Democratic Central. Committee endorsed Edward V. Hanrahan today for a second fouryear term as the county's state's attorney despite Criminal Court indictment pending against him and 13 other persons in a case involving a police raid on the Black Panthers two years ago.

title: Azerbaijani Knows How to Get Things Done
description: BAKU, U.S.S.R.In many ways Ahmet Aliyev is a typical Azerbaiyani. He makes more money than most, but like many other young men he loves the fiery, temperamental play of his local soccer team, he is proud of the new apartment developments sprawling around Baku and he knows how to get things done.

title: Kashmir Arena: In Brief
description: GEOGRAPHYThe state of Jammu and Kashmir, call the disputed territory by its official name, has an area of 86,024 square miles, making it slightly smaller in size than Britain. It is bounded on the northeast by the Sinkiang region of China: on the northwest by Afghanistan, on the east by Tibet, on the south by India and on the westits longest borderby Pakistan.

title: Burlington Northern Outlay
description: Directors of Burlington Northern, Inc., yesterday approved a 1972 capital improvement program of $168million. In 1972, Burlington Northern and its subsidiaries will acquire equipment to cost about $102million.

title: Temple Beats Hofstra
description: HEMPSTEAD, L. I., Dec. 7Unbeaten Temple scored its second Middle Atlantic Conference victory tonight, a 7158 decision over Hofstra. Temple's Mike Jones topped the scorers with 17 points. A sophomore, Del Davis, tallied 13 for the Flying Dutchmen.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: Wife Visits Argentina to Unify Peronists
description: BUENOS AIRES, Dec. 7Mrs. Martinez de Peron, third wife of Argentina's exiled dictator, Juan D. Pern arrived here today to try to unify the factionridden Peronist movement.

title: Sacred Heart Downs Post
description: GREENVALE, L. I., Dec. 7Sacred Heart University, led by Ed Czernota's 27 points, edged C. W. Post tonight, 7674. The Pioneers, trailing by as many as 19 in the first half, narrowed the gap to 7068 with three minutes remaining but failed to score for the next two minutes despite five possessions. Pioneers, trailing by as many as 19 in the first half, narrowed the gap to 7068 with three minutes remaining but failed to score for the next two minutes despite five possessions.

title: VIRAL SCARS TIED TO HEART ATTACKS
description: NEW ORLEANS, Dec. 5A leading cardiologist has suggested that heart attacks and arteriosclerosis, which affects millions of older Americans, might be owing in part to damage originally caused by common virus infection suffered as children and young adults.

title: Hawks Could Be Difficult For Rangers on Home Ice
description: The New York Rangers, who do pretty well before their home fans, will collide with the Black Hawks tonight in Chicago Stadium, and there is no more difficult team to beat on its own ice.

title: WAR PAPERS PLEA DENIED BY JUDGE
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 7A A Federal district judge denied today a suit by two Congress. men to compel the release of all or part of the still classified segments of the Pentagon Papers.

title: 2 Uruguayans Who Lost In Vote Also Miss in Duel
description: MONTEVIDEO, Uruguay, Dec. 7 (AP)  Two retired generals who were losers in the presidential election nine days ago fought a pistol duel today. Each man fired two shots but missed.

title: HOUSTON VOTERS REELECT MAYOR
description: HOUSTON, Dec. 7Mayor Louis Welch was elected to a fifth twoyear term today on a platform of city growth and tough law enforcement.

title: About Pro Football
description: The outstanding individual feat of the year in pro football was the 247 yards gained by Willie Ellison of the Los Angeles Rams on Sunday against the New Orleans Saints. Not only did that set a singlegame rushing record for the 51yearold National Football League, but it also projected 26yearold William Henry Ellison of Houston into the category of something special.

title: Woman Named Vice Mayor
description: TOLEDO, Ohio, Dec. 7 (UPI)Mrs. Carol Pietryskowski, a member of the City Council, was appointed yesterday the first woman Vice Mayor in Toledo's history. Mrs. Pietryskownu, known as a water pollution fighter, tallied more than 50,000 votes in the general election in the race for City Council last November to become the leading votegetter.

title: Studdard's Injury Gives Family Fright
description: When Vern Studdard woke up in Baylor Hospital in Dallas last Saturday evening, he thought he had a broken leg.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: UNITED NATIONS
description: UNITED NATIONS, N. Y., Dec. 7The old venomous Cold War rhetoric is back again at the United Nationsthis time between Ambassadors Yakov Malik of the Soviet Union and Huang Hua of Chinabut somehow even the vindictive daily slanging matches between the Communist giants seem a little out of date.

title: Economic Analysis
description: World attention has been so heavily focused on the struggle over the devaluation of the dollar and the revaluation of other currencies that some crucial economic issues involved in the confrontation between the United States and its trading partners and allies have been relatively submerged. But once the realignment of currencies has been achievedas optimists think will happen by the end of this year or early next yearthese other issues will surface. The three most important of the submerged issues are:

title: Donors to Neediest Honor Loved Ones
description: A number of contributors to the 60th annual appeal of the New York Times Neediest Cases Fund yesterday asked that their gifts be recorded in the memory of relatives and friends.

title: Intelsat Changing World's Communications
description: CAPE KENNEDY, Fla., Dec. 7A new communications satellite is awaiting launching here to provide one more link in a global system that is dramatically altering the way men and nations keep in touch.

title: Interest Rise Suggested If Phase 2 Is to Succeed
description: The president of the Federal Reserve Bank of Minneapolis warned yesterday that the nation may well have to accept temporarily higher interest rates in 1972 if President Nixon's Phase Two policy is to succeed in controlling inflation.

title: R.P.I. Names Science Dean
description: The selection of Dr. George H. Handelman to be dean of the School of. Science and Rensselaer Polytechnic Institute in Troy, N. Y., was announced yesterday by Dr. Richard J. Grosh, the institute's president. Dr. Handelman, chairman of the institute's department of mathematics, will succeed Dr. Walter H. Bauer upon Dr. Bauer's retirement next July 1.

title: Wide Range of Securities Advance in Credit Market
description: The credit markets gained strength yesterday as a wide range of fixedincome securitiestaxable and taxexempt, longterm and shorttermall attracted investors.

title: 15 Survivors of the Pearl Harbor Attak Mark It Here
description: Without a trace of rancor, Joseph Medure, a postal clerk who was once a private first class, tossed a floral wreath into the East River yesterday from the fantail of the destroyer Moale at Fort Schuyler in the Bronx, and the ceremony was over.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor: Homer A. Jack's recent letter indicates the need for clarification of this United Nation's new procedures for investigating serious human rights problems.

title: Signals Sent Back
description: W. H. Pickering, director of the United. States Mars program, said today that he was eagerly waiting to see what data the Russian probe sends back from the surface.

title: Pakistan Sets Rules For War Reporters; Denies Censorship
description: RAWALPINDI, Pakistan, Dec. 7Pakistan today announced rules for foreign correspondents covering the war with India.

title: Prisoner Is Found Hanged in His Cell In Jail in the Bronx
description: A 30yearold prisoner who had been under psychiatric observation at the Bronx House of Detention for. Men since Nov. 1 was found hanged with his belt in his cell early yesterday.

title: Miss Myerson Opens Henrings On Health Foods and Costs
description: It was compost heaps vs. chemical fertilizers at the Department of Consumer Affairs yesterday as Commissioner. Bess Myerson began two days of hearings into whether health foods are any healthier, more natural or more organic than ordinary foods.

title: Accord Gives Firemen $14,300, Rise of $2,150
description: Pay increases for the city's firemen would total $2,150 during the new but still unratified 30month contract, sources close to the negotiations said yesterday. The agreement, if finally approved by the union membership, the city administration and the national Pay Board, would raise a fireman's pay to $14,300 in the final stage of the contract.

title: Mrs. Mildred Rainville Dead; Was Active in Charity Groups
description: PALM BEACH, FIL, Dec. 7Mrs. Mildred O'Connell Rainville, a society figure who was active in numerous charity organizations, died at her home here Sunday after a long illness. She was in her sixties.

title: Bucks Rout Sonics
description: MILWAUKEE, Dec. 7 (AP)Hareem Jabbar scored 29 points and Bob Dandridge 28 tonight to lead the Milwaukee Bucks to a 11683 trouncing of the Seattle SuperSonics. It was the Bucks' 24th victory in 28 games.

title: Transit Bond Unit Warned on Donors
description: In a secret and potentially significant postscript to the defeat of the $2.5billion transportation bond issue, the committee that spearheaded the probond campaign has been advised to consider disclosing its corporate contributors.

title: Rutgers Triumphs, 10970
description: NEW BRUNSWICK, N. J., Dec. 7 Rutgers overpowered previously undefeated St. Francis College of Brooklyn tonight, 10970.

title: Retail Arcade Opened at Hotel
description: Lured by 5cent hot dogs and 5cent ice cream cones, New Yorkers yesterday crowded the opening of a shoplined arcade linking 51st and 52d Streets.

title: RICE IS SELECTED AS ANGELS' PILOT
description: ANAHEIM, Calif., Dec. 7Del Rice, the first player to sign a major league contract with the Angels, was named today to manage the California baseball team. Rice, a 49yearold former catcher, received a oneyear contract calling for $55,000. His appointment was announced by Harry Dalton, the Angels general manager.

title: Pakistan Reports 10Mile Thrust
description: RAWALPINDI, Pakistan, Dec. 7. (Reuters)Pakistan said today her forces had thrust 10 miles into Indian territory in Kashmir and blunted a major Indian offensive farther south in West Pakistan.

title: Georgia Democrats Shift To Delegate Election Plan
description: ATLANTA, Dec. 7 (UPI)In a traditionshattering move by Georgia Democrats, the state executive committee has adopted rules requiring electionrather than appointmentof all delegates to the Democratic Na. tional Convention in 1972.

title: Lockhart's Winter of Discontent
description: The winter of Spider Lockhart's discontent may have started some time in the summer when his name was left out of the New York Giants' 1971 press guide.

title: Postal Service Board Member Is Named Postmaster General
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 7The Board of Governors of the United States Postal Service today named one of its members, Elmer T. Kiassen, to become Postmaster General on Jan. 1.

title: BREENEV URGES REPLY ON PARLEY
description: WARSAW, Dec. 7  Leonid I. Brezhnev, the Soviet Communist party leader called today for practical steps by the West in response to the Warsaw Pact's call for a European security conference next year.

title: MRS. DAVID HARRISON
description: FORKED RIVER, N. J., Dec. 7Mrs. Henrietta K. Harrison, an early worker in radio and the first woman program director at WINS, New York, and WCAU, Philadelphia, died today at her home here. She was 76 years old. Her husband, David, a writer, died in 1926.

title: PAKISTANI TROOPS OPEN MAJOR DRIVE
description: NEW DELHI, Dec. 7In her first major offensive of the fourdayold war, Pakistan began a largescale tank and infantry attack today against Indian troops guarding a key road in southwestern Kashmir, India reported.

title: Leading Jockeys Shun the Sands of Florida for Mud of Aqueduct
description: Rain, mud, fog and short fields of bad horses added up to another dreary day at Aqueduct yesterday, raising the question: Why do top jockeys who by now are working for Uncle Sam continue suffering here when they could be sunning themselves in Florida?

title: What We Should Be Doing, Sister
description: CHICAGO, Ill.

title: BLAZERS DEFEAT PISTONS, 131130
description: DETROIT, Dec. 7 (AP)Breaking a jinx in which they had lost their last 11 games on the road, the Portland Trail Blazers scored a 131130 overtime victory over the Detroit Pistons in the National Basketball Association tonight.

title: Enthusiasm and Skepticism
description: OTTAWA, Dec. 7  Prime Minister Pierre Elliott Trudeau's statements that he had won fantastically new assurances respecting Canadian independence were received enthusiastically by Trudeau supporters in Ottawa, but with skepticism by some others.

title: Merger News
description: Fansteel, Inc., said yesterday that it had been approached by the Tool Research and Engineering Corporation regarding a possible purchase of Fansteel stock by Tool Research for $12.50 a share. Based on the 2048,609 common shares outstanding of Fansteel, the transaction, if Tool Research decided to buy all the Fansteel stock, would have a value of $25,607,612. Robert H. Ford, president of Fansteel, said that preliminary discussions had been held and that they would be reviewed by Fansteel directors Dec. 14.

title: African Organization, at U.N., ids Israelis Deny Territorial Aims
description: UNITED NATIONS, N. Y., Dec. 7The Organization of African Unity urged Israel to day to clear the way for: a re sumption of negotiations with Egypt by reaffirming that she did not seek the annexation of Aral territory.

title: Nixon and Italian Premier To Meet but Date Not Set
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 7, (Reuters)  President Nixon will confer with Premier Emilio Colombo of Italy as part of his plan to talk with allied leaders before he visits China and the Soviet Union next year, the White House announced tonight.

title: CON ED GETS STAY IN POLLUTION CASE
description: Consolidated Edison won a temporary restraining order yesterday allowing it to continue full use of its controversial coalburning Arthur Kill generator in Staten Island.

title: Muskie Plans TV Talk To Announce Candidacy
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 7 (UPI)  Senator Edmund S. Muskie will formally announce as a candidate for the Democratic Presidential nomination in a nationwide television address on Jan. 4.

title: Britain and France Set Concorde Pricing Policy
description: PARIS, Dec. 7The British and French Governments today set a pricing policy for their supersonic jet aircraft, the Concorde, that favored airlines that took the first options.

title: CHILDREN INJURED AS BUS OVERTURNS
description: More than a dozen children in a Queens school bus escaped without serious injury yesterday despite the fact that the bus overturned after being in a collision with a passenger car and knocking down a metal streetlight pole.

title: Amtrak Tells States To Supply Subsidy For Chicago Route
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 7Passenger train service between New York and Chicago along the old New York Central route through Buffalo and Cleveland was threatened with extinction again today when Amtrak made a final demand for subsidy support from the five states served.

title: TWO BOMBS DAMAGE BIG ATOM SMASHER
description: STANFORD, Calif., Dec. 7 (AP)Two bombs ripped the Stanford Linear. Accelerator Center today causing what officials estimated as up to $100,000 damage to the world's largest device for atomic particle research.

title: New Atom Submarines To Bear Cities' Names
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 7 (AP) Vessels in the Navys newest class of nuclear attack submarines will be named for cities, with the lead ship to be the Los Angeles, it was announced today.

title: FOREIGN AFFAIRS
description: OSLO, Norway  The late King Haakon of Norway, who was forced to flee this country in 1940 when it was occupied by German invaders assisted by the Quisling fifth column, told me in 1949 that he had personally, urged his Government to abandon its long tradition of neutrality and join the then new North Atlantic Alliance. Although the Norwegian ruler constitutionally has no political powers, his personal authority is important behind the scenes.

title: Network of Malls Urged By City for Midtown Area
description: A vast, Hshaped pedestrian mall that would straddle the heart of midtown Manhattan and transform almost all existing patterns of vehicle and pedestrian movement in the area was proposed yesterday by the City Transportation Administration.

title: MGM Wins Court Round On Las Vegas Investment
description: A shareholders' attempt to block approval of a Las Vegas investment by MetroGoldwynMayer, Inc., was dismissed yesterday by Judge Sylvester J. Ryan in Federal District Court here.

title: PENN STATE TOPS COLUMBIA, 7350
description: Ron Brown of Brooklyn made a triumphant return to his hometown last night, scoring 27 points to lead Penn State to a 7350 victory over Columbia.

title: Officials Expecting Smith's Retraction Of Murder Guilt
description: New Jersey court and prosecuting officials said yesterday that they fully expected Edgar H. Smith Jr. to attempt to retract his confession to the murder of a 15yearold Ramsey high school girl in 1957.

title: Brown and 3 Others Indicted In Holdup and Shootout Here
description: H. Rap Brown and three others were indicted yesterday on attempted murder and robbery charges stemming from a bar holdup and shootout with the police Oct. 16.

title: Rights Agency Assails Schools For Southwest Minority Pupils
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 7The United States Commission on Civil Rights declared today that minority group students in five Southwestern states were receiving an inferior education.

title: STOL Makers Vying on Design
description: A $100million Federal program to build a short takeoff and landing airliner combining hardtocombine virtues speed, quiet, safety and profitability  has moved into the final design stage.

title: White House to Hold Tours Alter Christmas
