description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 7 (UPI)The White House will open for special tours from 6:30 to 9 P.M. Monday and Tuesday, Dec. 27 and 28.

title: 3 U.S. GIRLS WIN AT AUCKLAND NET
description: AUCKLAND, New Zealand, Dec. 7 (AP)Three United States women defeated Anzac rivals today in the $44,800 New Zealand open tennis championships.

title: Parochial Basing In Jersey Stands, High Court Rules
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 7 (UPI) The Supreme Court refused today to disturb a New Jersey providing for free transportation to school for many students of private and parochial schools.

title: California Tax Withholding
description: SACRAMENTO, Calif., Dec. 7 (UPI)California's first income tax withholding system was approved today by both houses of the Legislature and sent to Gov. Ronald Reagan for expected implementation on Jan. 1. The tax collection system was the key part of a $501million tax increase to balance the state budget and finance a construction program.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: ExJustice Ferdinand Pecora, 89, Dead
description: Ferdinand Pecora, the former New York State Supreme Court Justice who rose to national fame for his investigation of Wall Street following the crash of 1929, died yesterday at Polyclinic Hospital. He was 89 years old.

title: Money Growth Seen
description: CHICAGO, Dec. 7 (Reuters) The United States money supply, will show an appreciable increase of about 6 per cent to 7per cent in the early months or 1972, Charles Partee, director of research and statistics for the Federal Reserve Board, said here today.

title: Advertising:
description: The White Motor Corporation has pulled all of its truck lines out of the various agencies that have been handling them, lumped them together and given it all Thomas Murray and Austin Chaney, Inc., Hudson, Ohio. The billings are estimated at $1.3million.

title: Levitt Scores Rockefeller's Fiscal Plan
description: Controller Arthur Levitt yesterday termed Governor Rockefeller's proposals to solve an anticipated $1.5billion budget deficit one more exercise in fiscal gymnasticsit Jumps the hurdles, but gets us nowhere in the long run.

title: U.S. Says India Attacked After Concessions by Foe
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 7The White House, defending its position on the war in the Indian subcontinent, asserted today that the United States was actively promoting apolitical settlement  including some autonomy for East Pakistan  when India attacked Pakistan without justification.

title: Chaparrals Triumph, 113103
description: DALLAS, Dec. 7 (UPI)The Dallas Chaparrals survived a 17point fourth quarter flurry by Virginia's Charlie Scott and rolled to a 113103 triumph over the Squires tonight.

title: Condors Triumph, 122102
description: PITTSBURGH, Dec. 7 (AP)John Brisker's 29 points and a strong defensive team effort led the Pittsburgh Condors to a 122102 victory over the Carolina Cougars tonight.

title: Troy Discloses Finances of His Political Group
description: Councilman Matthew J. Troy Jr., Queens County Democratic leader, disclosed the finances of his organization yesterday at a news conference and again called on the Mayor to order the John V. Lindsay Associaflans, the Mayor's political organization, to disclose their finances.

title: Leftist Students in Rome Stage Protest to Support Little Lenin
description: ROME, Dec. 7  LeftWing radical youths today proclaimed school strikes, scuffled with the police and with neoFacists, and paraded in the streets shouting slogans accusing the official Communist apparatus of collusion with capitalism.

title: OHIO DROPS REST OF KENT GARGES
description: RAVENNA, Ohio, Dec. 7 (AP) The state dismissed today for lack of evidence the 20 remaining cases against persons indicted in the Kent State University disorders of May, 1970.

title: CITY IS CRITICIZED OVER CHILD ABUSE
description: Family Court Judge Nanette Dembitz scored the Department of Social Services yesterday for allegedly failing to report suspected cases of child abuse belore they came to court.

title: CLARA R. GROSS, AVIATION DOCTOR
description: Dr. Clara Regina, Gross, physician who pioneered in aviation medicine, died Monday at her home here, 15 Park Avenue. She was 72 years old.

title: News Analysis
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 7in any other year since war was declared on poverty in 1963, today would have been a time for cheering in the corridors of the Office of Economic Opportunity. After all, the House had, after the nowfamiltor disagreement and photofinh vote, just approved and sent to the President another two year extension of the controversial antipoverty program. But instead of satisfaction, the vote brought only another problem, and a heavy sense of irony, to an agency already tormented with the most, serious operational, morale and philosophical difficulties.

title: Libya Seizes British Oil Concern, Charging a London Conspiracy in Iran's Occupation of 3 Islands
description: CAIRO, Dec. 7  The Libyan revolutionary regime announced tonight that it was nationalizing operations of the British Petroleum Company, Ltd. in retaliation for what was termed Britain's conspiracy in the Iranian occupation last week of three islands in the Persian Gulf that are claimed by Arab emirates.

title: 2D DIVIDEND CUT MADE BY LUDLUM
description: Actions by corporate directors yesterday saw quarterly dividend declarations chopped by two companies, the omission of payment by another and increases of 1 cent and half a cent by two others.

title: Sports of The Times
description: Hank Bauer was manager of the Orioles when a trade with the Reds brought Frank Robinson to Baltimore. He's a ballplayer, a man said to Bauer, but didn's he get a kind. of name for himself in Cincinnati?

title: Executive Change
description: Allegheny Ludlum Industries, Inc., announced yesterday the election of Robert J. Buckley as president and chief operating officer. He was president of the Ingersoll Milling Machine Company. Mr. Buckley replaces Roger S. Ahlbrandt who was elected chairman and will continue as chief executive officer. E. J. Hanley, formerly chairman, was elected chairman of the finance committee. William B. Pierce, who will continue as president of the Allegheny Ludlum Steel Corporation, was made vice chairman of the parent company, Allegheny Ludlum Industries. Ingersoll Milling Machine said that a successor has not yet been named, but Mr. Buckley will remain a member of the board.

title: Senate Unit Votes Presidential WarPower Curb
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 7The Senate Foreign Relations Committee unanimously approved today legislation that would impose Congressional restrictions on the warmaking powers of the Presidency.

title: Stage: A Big City Fable
description: The new Broadway musical, Wild and Wonderful, is wet, windy and wretched. It opened last night at the Lyceum Theater. I shall always try to remember it, and to use it as a yardstick to measure the future.

title: Prohibition Era Gangster Is Granted Parole by Ohio
description: COLUMBUS, Ohio, Dec. 7 (UPI)  Thomas Licavoli, 68 years old, a Prohibition era gangster and former head of the notorious Toledo and Detroit purple Gang, was paroled today after serving 37 years in the Ohio Penitentiary.

title: DOROTHY GREENER
description: Dorothy Greener, an actress and singing comedienne, died of cancer on Monday in St. Vincent's Hospital. She was 54 years old and lived at 117 Christopher Street.

title: Jews Still in Syria Aren't Persecuted, President Asserts
description: BEIRUT, Lebanon, Dec. 7The Syrian President, Lieut. Gen. Hafez alAssad, today dismissed as Zionist propaganda claims that his regime persecuted the 4,000 Jews still in Syria.

title: Man in the News
description: Gen. Emilio Garrastaz M dici has become, in 25 months of government, the most popular of the three army generals who have ruled Brazil with practically unlimited powers since 1964.

title: Ruling Giving City the Power On Meat Labeling Reversed
description: The Appellate Division, reversing a State Supreme Court ruling, held yesterday that the City Department of Health could not enforce meatlabeling regulations that differed from or, were more stringent than Federal or state labeling laws.

title: Rehnquist's Backers Say Critics. Have Begun a Senate Filibuster
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 7Critics of William H. Rehnquist vowed today that they would talk until their arguments caught the Senate's attention, and his supporters charged that a filibuster had begun.

title: Whose Poor Citizenship?
description: Chancellor Harvey B. Scribner followed unassailable logic in his directive to school administrators not to withhold the high school diploma as a penalty for poor conduct or bad citizenship. The order does not imply, as some of the city's principals complain, that proper conduct and good citizenship are secondary concerns the schools. It correctly points out that there are legitimate penalties for misconduct, but that to deny the diploma, which signifies completion of the student's academic work, is not one of these.

title: U.S. Judge Scores Surplus Food Ban For Poor in Seattle
description: SEATTLE, Dec. 7 (AP)The Agriculture Department's refusal to release surplus food to the poor and unemployed in the Seattle area was arbitrary and capricious, a Federal District Court judge has ruled.

title: BROADWAY TO GET MOONCHILDREN
description: The Arena. Stage production of Moonchildren, a new play by Michael Weller, will be brought to Broadway on Feb. 21 by David Merrick, in association with Martin Rosen and London's Royal Court Theater.

title: Cornell Downs Colgate
description: ITHACA, N. Y., Dec. 7  A 28point performance by a sophomore, Jeff Howard, led Cornell to a 9593 victory over Colgate tonight.

title: Holiday Buying Shines Through Raindrops
description: Christmas season on Fulton Street in Brooklyn, one of the city's oldest shopping lanes equally noted for its human mix and its customer loyalty, is as frantic, as congested and as lustily spirited as ever. But this year, after only 10 shopping days in the season, there are two differences, one related to the weather and the other to competition.

title: Mark and Pound Rates Climb Sharply
description: PARIS, Dec. 7As the mark soared at one point today some 13 per cent above its old parity, the Bonn Government under rising pressure from industry served notice that it would actively intervene to roll the rate back.

title: Floridians Edge Rockets
description: MIAMI BEACH, Dec. 7 (AP) Warren Jaball converted two free throws with four seconds to play to break a 105105 tie and give the Floridians a 107105 victory over the Denver Rockets tonight.

title: Survey Finds Newark City Pay Outpaces That in Private Jobs
description: NEWARK, Dec. 7.  Civil Service employes of this financially distressed city enjoy higher pay, shorter working hours and greater fringe benefits on the whole than workers in comparable jobs in private industry here, a study by the United States Department of Labor said today.

title: Soviet Lands Capsule on Mars;
description: MOSCOW, Dec. 7The Soviet Union announced today its spacecraft Mars 3 had released a descent capsule equipped with television, that made a soft landing last Thursday on the surface of the, planet and briefly transmitted signals before contact suddenly ceased.

title: 100th ArmsTalk Session
description: VIENNA, Dec. 7 (AP)American and Soviet delegates to the talks on limitation of strategic arms held their 100th session today.

title: Subsidy Problems Found on a Farm Owned by U.S. Aide
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 7Spot checks on subsidies by the Department of Agriculture have turned up apparent irregularities on a number of big farms in California, including one owned by the administrator of the subsidy program.

title: MARI TSUMURA PUTS COLOR INTO SONATA
description: Where lyricism, color and delicacy were in demand, Mari Tsumura's playing came close to perfection, in her recital at the Rogers Auditorium in the Metropolitan Museum of Art Monday night. The 23yearold Japanese violinist, who won the Merriweather Post contest in 1967, in Washington, is as pretty as a picture, and she performs that way.

title: ASHBROOK WEIGHS RACE IN PRIMARY
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 7 Representative John M. Ashbrook said today that he was weighing the possibility of primary challenges against President Nixon next year on behalf of a rightwing group disen chanted with Administration policies.

title: PRATT FACULTY ASKS PRESIDENT'S OUSTER
description: Eightyfour members of Pratt Institute's faculty called on the board of trustees yesterday to remove Henry Saltzman as president and designate an interim administration.

title: Master Charge Changes
description: CLEVELAND, Dec. 7 (AP)About 700,000 Master Charge cardholders in five states are being notified of changes in billling information and the method of applying interest, following settlement of a damage suit in Federal. District Court here.

title: North Korea Assails Move
description: HONG KONG, Dec. 7 (Reuters)North Korea today denounced the declaration of a state of emergency in South Korea as a provocative measure and strongly denied that it intended to invade the South.

title: Summary of Actions Taken by the Supreme Court
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 7The Supreme Court took the following actions today:

title: SOFTER TRUST FIGHT DENIED BY MITCHELL
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 7 (AP)  Attorney General John N. Mitchell asserted today that the Justice Department had no intention of softening its enforcement of antitrust laws.

title: NIXON AIDES BACK POLLUTION STAND
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 7The Administration's two top environmental officials and its top economic official repeatedly assured the House Public Works Committee today that President Nixon wanted a strong water pollution control bill.

title: City Inquiry on State Concludes State Is Cause of City Fiscal Ills
description: Mayor Lindsay's Commission on StateCity Relations blamed state stingineas yesterday for much of New York City's financial problems.

title: AutoTraip Makes Its VirginiaFlorida Debut
description: SANFORD, Fla., Dec. 7There's a piano in the club car, a movie in the diner, the conductors wear maxi skirts, and at the end of the line, your car is waiting for you.

title: Civilians Named Pakistani Ministers
description: RAWALPINDI, Pakistan, Dec. 7With the war between Paidstan and India reaching a critical phase, Pakistan's President tonight appointed a civilian Prime Minister and Deputy Prime Minister whose immediate task is to plead Pakistan's case before the United Nations.

title: ST. JOHN'S POSTS 107TO67 VICTORY
description: WASHINGTON, D.C., Dec. St. John's University, behind Greg Cluess and Mel Davis, defeated Georgetown University, 10767 tonight.

title: PRICES RISE LATE ON AMEX AND OTC
description: A rally in the last hour of trading enabled the American Stock Exchange and the overthecounter market to finish higher yesterday after both markets had been declining earlier.

title: Penalties for Killing Eagles
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 7 (AP) A House subcommittee approved today a bill increasing the penalties for killing or capturing bald and golden eagles. The measure increases the maximum penalty from $500 and six months in to $5,000 and one year in jail for the first offense.

title: Tate Trial Reporter Clear On Violation of Gag Order
description: LOS ANGELES, Dec. 7 (AP) A Sueprior Court judge has acquitted William Farr, a former reporter for the Los Angeles HeraldExaminer, of a contempt charge accusing him of helping lawyers to violate a gag order during the Shaon Tate murder trial.

title: PLAN ON STADIUM ADVANCED BY CITY
description: The Board of Estimate yesterday advanced the city's plan to purchase and renovate Yankee Stadium in an effort to keep the Yankees from leaving New York.

title: Alienating India ...
description: President Nixon's declaration of absolute neutrality in the IndianPakistani conflict fails to conceal Administration policies, which have, in fact, been obviously biased in favor of the Government of President Yahya Khan in Islamabad.

title: North American Rockwell Reports on Tender Offer
description: The North American Rockwell Corporation announced yesterday that almost 1.5 million shares were tendered in response to its offer to shareowners last month to purchase its common stock at $29 a share.

title: Bulls Rally to Win
description: CHICAGO, Dec. 7 (UPI)The Chicago Bulls, trailing until the final 11 minutes, limited the Cleveland Cavaliers to 13 points while scoring 30 in the final quarter for a 11599 victory tonight, the 12th in their last 14 games.

title: House Clears Poverty Bill Despite Nixon Veto Threat
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 7 Brushing aside threats of a Presidential veto, the House gave final approval today to an overall antipoverty bill creating a vast new program of day care and other services for children of all income levels.

title: U.S. Court Rejects Effort to Void Draft For 90Day Period
description: The United States Court of Appeals ruled here yesterday that there was no merit in a draftee's contention that Army inductions were invalid for the 90day period following the enactment of the Selective Service Law Sept. 28.

title: Market Place: Raiders Poised To Strike Anew?
description: If you think back a way, you'll probably remember that the corporate takeover was big news in the late nineteensixties. A lot of small corporations made the big time with a few deft moves against older and larger companies.

title: Chock Fall o'Nuts Vote Tarns Back Dissidents
description: In a three hour meeting at the International Hotel in Kennedy International Airport, shareholders of the Chock full o'Nuts Corporation yesterday, upheld the selection of the company's board of directors and defeated a number of proposals made by dissident stockholders.

title: Cambodians Trained By U S. in Vietnam
description: LONGHAI, South Vietnam Airborne! Airborne! the Cambodian recruits holler in English as they crawl and wiggle in the mud under a long stretch of barbed wire.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: Top Federal Officials Lunching At Low Cost With Aid of Public
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 8 (AP) Toplevel Government officials are dining well at cut rates In heavily subsidized executive lunchrooms, sometimes sipping free liquor from confiscated Government stocks, the General Accounting Office has reported.

title: Mrs. King Advances
description: AUCKLAND, New Zealand, Dec. 8 (AP)Mrs. Billie Jean King, the favorite, swept into the third round of the $48,000 New Zealand open tennis tournament tonight. She defeated another American, Kris Kernmer of Los Angeles, 62, 64.

title: OBSERVER
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 8For the first week or two, riding the bus between home and office seemed a pleasant change. The car had become hateful. For one thing it was begining to gobble bigger and bigger sums of money. It was secretly supporting a parkinglot operator In byzantine luxury, and what with the tendency of traffic paralysis to last for longer and longer periods and the tendency of gasoline barons to raise prices more and more often, the car's eight big cylinders with their habit of gargling on hightest gasoline were going through the family fortune like a plague of collegeage children.

title: Budget Planning Needed
description: State Controller Arthur Levitt has written a letter sound fiscal advice to members of the State Legislature scheduled to convene in a special session dealing with the state's budgetary crisis later this month. Mr. Levitt has written such letters before. On one occasion, he, suggested that an increase in the state's sales tax might be required to close an impending gap. Republicans happily imposed the tax and called it Levitt's levy.

title: Jury Awards $1.25Million
description: FORT LAUDERDALE, Fla., Dec. 8 (AP)A Broward County Circuit Court jury awarded $1.25million in damages today to Earl L. Lassitter, a field superintendent who said a member of a union beat him for crossing a picket line. Mr. Lassitter alleged that Dennis Walton, a member of Local 675 of the International Union of Operating Engineers, pummeled him at a job site April 10, 1970.

title: White House Says It Won't Intervene On Queens Project
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 8 Ronald L. Ziegler, President Nixon's press secretary, said today that the White House would not intervene to stop construction of the controversial lowincome housing project in the middleincome area of Forest Hills, Queens.

title: Stockholdings Of Insiders
description: The New York and American Stock Exchanges yesterday issued their latest reports on changes in stock ownership by major stockholders, directors and officers of their listed companies. The reports include the following.

title: House Votes Aid Bill as Spur to Senate
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 8A foreign aid appropriation bill that would provide $2.67billion in economic and military assistance was passed by the Houe of Representatives today by a vote of 214 to 179.

title: Poles Say the Good Life Isn't Here Yet
description: WARSAW, Dec. 8  I was optimistic right after the riots, Stanislaw Jankowski said last week as he sat with his wife in their Warsaw apartment, even though we all realized that the chances of real change in our lives were very slim.

title: Jets Draw North's Fire
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, Dec. 8 (AP)The United States command today repulsed three air engagements over North Vietnam yesterday, but said that no American jets were hit by the surfacetoair missiles and antiaircraft artillery fired at them.

title: News Analysis
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 8The endorsement of Senator Edmund S. Muskie by two of California's most prominent Democrats this morning may signal the beginning of a new stage in the contest for the 1972 Democratic Presidential nomination. For Mr. Muskie, capturing the support of Senator John V. Tunney and Robert Moretti, Speaker of the California Assembly, provides not sure votes but a badly needed injection of political adrenalin a month before he announces his candidacy on a national television broadcast next Jan. 4.

title: WHITES ARE KEY TO HOUSTON VOTE
description: HOUSTON, Dec. 8Residents of white middleclass and bluecollar neighborhoods, heeding Mayor Louie Welch's call to go to the polls to combat the bloc vote, provided the 12,000vote margin by which he won a record fifth consecutive twoyear term as Houston's Mayor in yesterday's election.

title: 14Story OfficeGarage Center Planned in Bronx
description: A proposal for a 14story building that would combine a municipal garage, commercial offices and stores was announced by Bronx Borough President Robert Abrams.

title: U.S. Meets Soviet March 17 In Indoor Dual Track Meet
description: INDIANAPOLIS, Dec, 8 (AP)  The first dual indoor track and field meet between the United States and Soviet Union has been scheduled for March 17 at Richmond, the Amateur Athletic Union said today.

title: Ford Criticizes Pay and Price Boards
description: DETROIT, Dec. 8  Henry Ford 2d accused the pay and price boards today of helping to create a depressing uncertainty in the nation that was holding back economic recovery.

title: Jersey School Fete
description: JERSEY CITY, Dec. 8The A. Harry Moore School of Jersey City State College, will mark its 50th year with a special program tomorrow. Established in 1921 as the School for Crippled Children and a part of the college since 1962, it serves as a laboratory for future teachers of handicapped children. The program will include songs and dances presented by the students.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: Winds Fan Fires on Coast
description: LOS ANGELES, Dec. 8 (AP)Powerful winds swept through northeast Los Angeles and the San Gabriel Valley today, knocking down electric lines that at times sparked new fires almost as fast as firefighters could put them out Officials said Los Angeles city firemen answered 61 alarms during a single 12hour period.

title: Fiscal Cuts Hampering Children's Hospital in Queens
description: How can one attendant help 25 kids get to bed lovingly? Dr. Gloria Faretra, a child psychiatrist and director of Queens Children's Hospital, asked yesterday.

title: Fanfani Nominated on Eve of Italy's Presidency Vote
description: ROME, Dec. 8The Christian Democratic party, this country's strongest political force, nominated former Premier Amintore Fanfani tonight as its candidate for President of Italy.

title: Trial Here Allowed In StripMine Suit Against the T.V.A.
description: A Federal judge ruled here yesterday that a lawsuit accusing the Tennessee Valley Authority of ignoring Government environmental protection standards in contracting for supplies of stripmined coal could be heard here.

title: Barbara Cochran Fourth in Slalom; German Is Winner
description: VAL D'ISERE, France, Dec. 8 (AP)  Barbara Cochran of Rutland, Vt., won the second heat today but finished fourth in the women's special slalom event of the Criterium of the First Snow Ski Festival.

title: Sports of The Times
description: If huge George Musso of the Chicago Bears had not been too busy fighting off a pair of Green Bay blockers, he would have rubbed his eyes in disbelief because he was sure those eyes had played a trick on him. They had deluded him into thinking that Clarke Hinkle of the Packers had just flashed past him three times in swift succession, once going forward, once going backward and then going forward again. Or was it really a delusion?

title: Christmas Trees Free From Phase 2 Control
description: The Internal Revenue Service said yesterday that Christmas trees were not subject to any phase of President Nixon's economic program and venders could charge whatever they liked for them.

title: U.S. and Portugal to Sign an Azores Pact
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 8 Senior Administration officials disclosed today that the United States and Portugal had negotiated a fiveyear extension of the wartime agreement granting the United States the use of air and naval bases on, a strategic island in the Azores.

title: Bruins Beat Kings, 53
description: INGLEWOOD, Calif., Dec. 8 (UPI)Boston broke open a 22 tie with three goals in a 2:56 span early in the third period tonight to defeat the Los Angeles Kings, 53, in a match enlivened by the ejection of Derek Sanderson, the Bruin center.

title: Foreigners Leave Karachi
description: KARACHI, Pakistan, Dec. 8 (UPI)Five planes evacuated more than 500 foreign nationals today.

title: Housing in East New York Postponed by the City
description: The Lindsay administration postponed plans yesterday to seek approval for the construction of 16 twofamily houses for lowincome tenants in a middleclass section of East New York, Brooklyn.

title: Mrs. Nixon Accepts Tree
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 8 (UPI) Mrs. Richard M. Nixon today accepted a 20foot Fraser fir Christmas tree for the White House from the North Carolina Christmas tree growers.

title: ULSTER CIVIL STRIFE IS DISCUSSED HERE
description: A panel including British and Irish officials discussed the civil strife in Northern Ireland yesterday during a symposium at Columbia University Law School.

title: Racial Hostility Denied
description: The Queens Jewish Community Council, which says it represents 56 organizations with more than 50,000 members Queens, denied allegations yesterday that opposition to the lowincome housing project for Forest Hills was based on racial hostility.

title: INDIA REPORTS NEW GAINS IN EAST;
description: NEW DELHI, Dec. 8The Indian Army took more towns and more territory in East Pakistan today, but an informed Indian source said that in most cases the Pakistani defenders had escaped and that their army in the area was still largely intact.

title: Front Page 1  No Title
description: THE LOIS AND SAMUEL SILBERMAN FUND. 197071 Annual Report to available on request131 East 79th St., N.Y., N.Y. 10021. S. J. Silberman.Advt.

title: Pan Am Forecasts Cuts in 1971 Deficit
description: Pan American World Airways expects its deficit this year to be smaller than in 1970, when it lost $47,931,000, Najeeb E. Halaby, chairman, said yesterday.

title: Texts of Rehnquist Letter to Senator Eastland and Memo of 1952 on Rights Cases
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 8 Following is the text of a letter from William H. Rehnquist, Supreme Court nominee, to Senator James O. Eastland about a memorandum that has become involved in the Senate debate over his confirmation, and the text of the memorandum:

title: Catholic Group Bids Cooke Disclose School Finances
description: The committee of Concerned Clergy and Religious yesterday sent a statement to Cardinal Cooke, the Roman Catholic hierarchy and all priests in the New York Archdiocese urging full disclosure of the financial and economic problems affecting the parochial schools that were struck by lay teachers two and a half weeks ago.

title: Celtics Beat Cavaliers
description: BOSTON, Dec, 8 (AP)John Havlicek scored 12 of his 28 points in the first quarter tonight as the Boston Celtics easily defeated the Cleveland Cavaliers, 126107.

title: SETON Ha GAINS 94TO86 TRIUMPH
description: SOUTH ORANGE, N. J., Dec. 8 Frank Zelesnik, with 33 points, led undefeated Seton Hall University to a 9486 victory over the University of California, Irvine, tonight. It was the Pirates' third straight triumph and the Anteaters' fourth consecutive loss on their Eastern swing.

title: Fraud Charged by S.E.C. In Pied Piper Stock Sales
description: Seven men and two securities houses were charged yesterday with paying bribes of up to $2.50 a share to sell a $5 new issue to the public and then manipulating the price of the stock up to $15 a share.

title: Advertising:
description: Santa came down the chimney at Young & Rubicam with a sackful of toys and puzzles and games and dolls.

title: MRS. HERBERT A. KENT
description: Mrs. Lily Endress Kent, the widow of Herbert A. Kent, who gave his name to the Kent cigarette, died yesterday at her home in the Gramatan Hotel, Bronxville, N.Y., She was 80 years old.

title: Film: Impersonal Drama
description: There exists in Europe, probably under some neutral Swiss Alp, a giant, fully-equipped, computer-controlled movie studio from which French and Italian producers can obtain their co-productions by mail-order catalogue. That, at least, is the suspicion when I see a film as impersonal and anational as "Someone Behind the Door," a perfunctory sort of suspense melodrama, supposedly set in England but photographed in a recognizable France, where almost everyone speaks American English.It stars Charles Bronson as an escaped lunatic, suffering from amnesia, who is used by an unstable brain surgeon, played by Tony Perkins, to murder the lover of the doctor's wife. This involved a process that Perkins describes, quite seriously, as a personality transplant, which Bronson is too dim to reject.The movie opened yesterday at neighborhood theaters around town and at the New Amsterdam on 42d Street, where, at the lunchtime performance anyway, a lot of people napped.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor: The Administration has announced a policy of strict neutrality in the IndiaPakistan conflict and there must be many others who will join me in wishing that it would observe itand in speech as well as in deed. I am sufficiently on record in my opposition to appeal to military force, whether by India or anyone else (I even opposed its use against Portugal in Goa).

title: HIGH COURT BALKS UNION ON PENSION
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 8 (AP) The Supreme Court ruled today, 6 to 1, that employers are not required to bargain with unions over benefits for retired employes.

title: In Pakistani Kasmir, War Gets Support
description: MUZAFFARABAD, Kashmir, Dec. 8In this capital of the Pakistanicontrolled part of Kashmir, government leaders expressed enthusiasm today over the war with India, called it a jihad, or holy war, and said it would not stop until all of Kashmir was free of Indian dominatian.

title: Leafs Beat North Stars
description: TORONTO, Dec. 8 (UPI)The Toronto Maple Leafs received goals from three linemates, Darryl Sittler, Norm Ullman and Jim Harrison, tonight and held off the challenge of the Minnesota North Stars for a 31 victory.

title: Persico judge Agreed to Void 2 Convictions of Hostile Witnees
description: The transcript of the Carmine J. Persico trialwhich resulted in his acquittal. Tuesday on charges of conspiracy to commit loansharking has disclosed that one of his former codefendants was not only granted immunity to testify but was also offered exoneration for two crimes to which she had already pleaded guilty.

title: Market Place:
description: It was autumn. The combines had lumbered through the fields that day and the air was scented with newmown hay. It was a moment farmers savor.

title: MARINARO SWEEPS RUSHING HONORS
description: Ed Marinaro, Cornell's allAmerican back, has scored a rare triple sweep, according to the final National Collegiate A.A. football statistics issued yesterday.

title: Union of Arab Emirates To Be 132d in the U.N.
description: UNITED NATIONS, N. Y., Dec. 8The Security Council voted unanimously today for the admission of the United Arab Emirates as the 132d member of the United Nations.

title: War on the Subcontinent
description: PRINCETON, N. J.The Nixon Administration's South Asia policy, which had been edging toward disaster for the last eight months, finally, in cloud of pious inanities, plunged over the brink this last weekend. Presumably for the time being the policy is beyond redemption. What now selfishly concerns me as an American is that India's leaders may exaggerate the degree to which the Administration's present aberrations represent thoughtful and enduring American opinion.

title: Turtle inspection Approved
description: MIAMI, Dec. 8 (UPI)Metro commissioners approved yesterday the institution of a $100 fine or 30 days in jail for persons who do not have their turtles inspected. Citing a health hazard, the resolution covers anyone selling or giving away turtles. Final action will be taken Dec. 21.

title: Deputies' Meeting Set
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 8 (UPI) Deputy finance ministers of the Group of 10 will meet in Washington before the finance ministers begin their discussions on world monetary reform, the Treasury Department said today.

title: Protest Set on Governor's Fiscal Plans
description: An emergency meeting to protest Governor Rockefeller's proposed solution to the state's fiscal crisis and to put pressure on the Legislature will be held in Albany next Wednesday by statewide groups representing mayors, county officials, town of fficers and school boards.

title: Wood, Field and Stream
description: More than a decade ago, a crusty Vermonter who valued his privacy was asked what he thought of a superhighway proposed for his corner of the state.

title: STEINGUT SCORED IN CROWN HEIGHTS
description: In one of the shortest bursts of community outrage on record in recent years, the Crown Heights Jewish Community Council yesterday released, then retracted, a denunciation of Stanley Steingut of Brooklyn, the Democratic Assembly minority leader.

title: Barlick Retiring as Umpire
description: SAN FRANCISCO, Dec. 8 (UPI)Al Barlick, the youngest umpire in the National League when he came up at 25 years of age in 1941, is retiring. Charles S. Feeney, league president, said today that Barlick would be retained in a liaison capacity.

title: U.S. Employe Privacy Bill Voted 3d Time by Senate
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 8 (AP) The Senate passed today for a thrid time a bill designed to protect the privacy and the constitutional rights of Federal employes.

title: Howfield and Ewbank Differ on Jets' Kicking
description: Coach Weeb Ewbank says Bobby Howfield's kickoffs are a big improvement over Jim Turner's. Howfield says he's very disappointed with his kickoffs.

title: Murderers, in Study, Called Victims of, Child Abuse
description: A psychiatrist with the State Department of Mental Health said yesterday that his studies of murderers had revealed that, as children, they had been victims of remorseless brutality.

title: Scribner Submits a Record School Budget of $2Billion
description: A record schoolbudget request of more than $2billion for 197273, which would restore essential services cut this year and make possible new and expanded programs, was proposed yesterday by School Chancellor Harvey B. Scribner.

title: Proxmire Decision Criticized
description: MADISON, Wis., Dec. 8Wisconsin's Democratic National Committeeman, Donald O. Paterson, denounced today Senator Proxmire decision to vote for Mr. Rehnquist and urged the Senator to reconsider.

title: WESTBURY SCHOOL IS CLOSED 2D DAY
description: WESTBURY, L. I., Dec. 8Classes at Westbury High School were suspended for the second day today because of series of fights at the school Monday.

title: Mrs. McGovern Has Surgery
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 8 (AP) The wife of Senator George S. McGovern, Democrat of South Dakota, underwent minor corrective surgery at George Washington University yesterday, his office announced today. It is expected that Mrs. McGovern will be released within a week.

title: The Stage
description: Say this for the Four Winds Theater, an off Off Broadway acting unit that roams the city and hits the road to vivify history: Their shows keept fact before fiction. The small unit also can spin an enterprise professionally in dimesized space.

title: Kerkorian Is Victor Over Dissidents at MGM Meeting
description: CULVER CITY, Calif., Dec. 8 As expected, Kirk Kerkorian, owner of 39 per cent of MetroGoldwynMayer, Inc., prevailed at the annual meeting here today. But some stockholders angrily expressed the wish that Mr. Kerkorian had attended the session as well.

title: Group to Help Residents Make Gifts of Improvements to City
description: The Parks Council Announced yesterday a program to permit New Yorkers to buy benches, outdoor sculptures, trees for their block or bicycle racks for their aPartment buildings, or to make any other tangible contributions to improve the quality of life in the city.

title: DR. THOMAS REED, CITIES EXPERT, 90
description: WETHERSFIELD, Conn., Dec. 8Dr. Thomas H. Reed, an authority on municipal government died yesterday in a convalescent home. He was 90 years old.

title: Man In the News
description: Described by close associates as an alternately friendly, alternately stern grizzly bear, Elmer Theodore Klassen demonstrated both traits in 1969 shortly after being named Deputy Postmaster General. Calling a meeting of all department heads in the United States Postal Service, he declared. Now, I want all of you to imagine no matter how long you have been herethat you have just been hired. Go back to your offices, consult with your staffs, and come back to me with goals and programs that will help us do a better job than we have been.

title: Dermatology Group Elects
description: CHICAGO, Dec. 8 (AP)Dr. Walter B. Shelley of Philadelphia was elected president of the American Academy of Dermatology yesterday.

title: Thieu Bids Farewell To Australian Troops
description: VUNGTATI, South Vietnam, Dec. 8 (Reuters)President Nguyen Van Mien bid farewell to the last Australian combat troops in South Vietnam today as they sailed for home on the troopship Sydney.

title: Hunter Edges Pace, 6362
description: Greg Simpson, a 5foot5inch guard, scored 15 points, and John Bradley added 12 more as Hunter College defeated Pace, 6362, last night, in a Knickerbocker Conference game at Hunter.

title: H.E.W. IS SCORED OVER 2 HOSPITALS
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 8The chairman of a House subcommittee on health charged today that the Department of Health, Education and Welfare was trying to dispose of two Public Health Service hospitals without first telling Congress.

title: Egyptian Pipelines Planned
description: The Standard Oil Company (Indiana) announced yesterday that it was planning to build two pipelines in Egypt. The project is expected to cost about $60million and construction is expected to start next year.

title: Dacca Said to Be Quite
description: DACCA, Pakistan, Dec. 8 (UPI)  The rumble of heavy bombing perhaps 20 miles away could be heard in Dacca today, but the city's shops were open and traffic on the streets was heavy.

title: BRITAIN ASKS LIBYA TO EXPLAIN SEIZURE
description: LONDON, Dec. 8 (AP) The British Foreign Office called in the Libyan Ambassador today to demand a full explanation regarding the seizure of assets of the British Petroleum Company in Libya.

title: Federal Panel Hears of Stock Manipulation in Jersey
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 8  A Congressional committee heard testimony today that two alleged organizedcrime figures gained control of a financially hardpressed New Jersey dataprocessing company, merged it with a publicly owned corporate shell and manipulated the price of the stock from $1 a share to as high as $10.

title: PAKISTANI CITIES ALL BUT ISOLATED
description: RAWALPINDI, Pakistan, Dec. 8 (UPI)The adjoining cities of Rawalpindi and Islamabad are virtually cut off from the outside world, and inflation is complicating life here.

title: DRESSER'S PROFIT DOWN 16% IN YEAR
description: Dresser Industries, Inc., in a preliminary report issued yesterday for the fiscal year ended Oct. 31, estimated its earnings at $33million, or $2.26 a share, down 16.4 per cent from the yearearlier $39.52million, or $3 a share.

title: It's Departure Time for Some North Slope Oil Workers
description: DEADHORSE, Alaska It was an expensive crowd, bundled up in parkas, that tramped across the hardpacked ice to a waiting jet liner, which had all the magic of Cinderella's golden coach.

title: Donors to Neediest List Their Reasons
description: Three of the 77 contributors to the New York Times Neediest Cases Fund recorded yesterday also told of the special reasons they found pleasure this year in sending donations for the less fortunate.

title: Article 1  No Title
description: TRIPOLI, Libya, Dec. 8 (Reuters)Libya will compensate the British Petroleum Company for the nationalization of its assets here; according to details disclosed by the Government today.

title: DR. JOSEF CERNY, CZECH PATRIOT, 86
description: Dr. Josef Cerny, the last surviving member of the preWorld War II government of Czechoslovakia living in the free world, died on Tuesday at Goldwater Memorial Hospital. He was 86 years old.

title: Advocates of Child Care Bill Press Nixon to Sign It, but a Veto Appears Likely
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 8 Despite a flurry of efforts today by Congressional and public advocates of the bill, President Nixon appeared extremely likely to veto the massive child development measure passed yesterday by the House.

title: CANADIENS SUBDUE RED WINGS, 4 TO 2
description: MONTREAL, Dec. 8 (UPI) Jean Claude Tremblay, a defenseman, scored his first two goals of the season and added his 23d assist tonight as he powered the Montreal Canadiens to a 42 victory over the Detroit Red Wings.

title: OLIVIERI PRESSES BOND ISSUE FIGHT
description: A Democratic legislator called on Attorney General Louis J. Lefkowitz yesterday to expand his inquiry into the John V. Lindsay Associations to include an investigation of corporations that contributed to the campaign for the $2.5billion transportation bond issue last month.

title: Peter NeroNo Worry About What Pop to Play
description: One of the problems of a pop pianist who is the focal point of a nightclub act is what to play. A jazz pianist can use anything and turn it to his purposes. A classical pianist well, he probably wouldn't be in a nightclub to begin with. But a pop pianistmeaning a pianist who plays popular musicis faced with playing it safe with Kern, Gershwm and Porter, taking a chance with new material that may not be familiar to the kind of audience a pop pianist attracts, or hiding behind a gimmick such as Liberace's glittering camp.

title: SAMUELS BOY FOUND TO BE HEROIN ADDICT
description: Howard C. Samuels, the 19yearold son of Howard J. Samtiels, head of the city's Offtrack Betting Corporation, was described in a court document yesterday as a heroin addct.

title: Bengalis Dance and Shout At Liberation of Jessore
description: JESSORE, Pakistan, Dec. The Bengalis danced on the roofs of buses. They shouted independence slogans in the streets. They embraced, they cheered, they reached out in spontaneous emotion to clasp the hands of visitors from other lands.

title: White House Says Vote in U.N. Supports Its Stand
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 8The Nixon Administration said today that it regarded the General Assembly vote last night for a ceasefire and withdrawal of Indian and Pakistani forces as solid evidence that the majority of nations supported its policy on ending the IndianPakistani conflict.

title: Senate, 810, Votes a Plan To Fight Sickle Cell Anemia
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 8 (UPI) The Senate passed 81 to 0 today a bill authorizing a threeyear, $142million battle against sickle cell anemia, the blood disease that affects one in 10 American blacks.

title: Student Disrupts a Meeting Of O.A.S. During Medici Talk
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 8 (Reuters)A student shouted Long live free Brazilstop the tortures, as President Emilio G. Medici of Brazil ended a speech before a meeting of the Organization of American States here today.

title: Advertising:
description: Television commercials can do more than sell just products or servicesthey can also sell the people who appear in them. A lot of actors have learned that.

title: FACTORIES PLANNING INVENTORY INCREASE
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 8Manufacturers plan their first substantial inventory increase of this year in the fourth quarter, the Commerce Department reported today.

title: High School Student's Death Laid to Cyanide Poisoning
description: The death of a 16yearold student at the High School of Music and the Arts Tuesday was attributed to acute cyanide poisoning, according to Dr. Michael Baden, the deputy chief medical examiner who performed the autopsy yesterday.

title: SLAKEUPPRESSED AT INDIAN BUREAU
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 8  A further shakeup in the Bureau of Indian Affairs to give Indians a dominant role at the top echelon was announced today by the Department of the Interior.

title: Negro TroupeLong, Fruitful Struggle
description: The Negro Ensemble Company was founded five years ago  when blacks were called Negroes, and Negro theater was still something of a cultural oddity. Now the N.E.C. is one of the cornerstones of the flourishing black theater movement, a movement that it has nurtured with its talents. As Douglas Turner Ward, the N.E.C. artistic director says, I don't think there's any black theater that doesn't have an actor or designer that came from us.

title: INTERFAITH UNIT HONORS IAKOVOS
description: Archbishop lakovos, Primate of the Greek Orthodox Archdiocese of North and South America and spiritual leader of 1.5 million churchgoers on two continents, Was named Man of Conscience for 1971 last night by an organization o leading Protestants, Roman Catholics and Jews.

title: NASSAU PLANNERS CAUSE SPLIT ON L.I.
description: HAUPPAUGE, L. I., Dec. 8A conflict between Long Island's two major planning agencies developed today that could, in the words of Nassau County Executive Ralph G. Caso, destroy the NassauSuffolk Regional Planning Board.

title: Personal Finance
description: One of the happiest moments in the life of every teenager is the day he gets his driver's license.

title: Receiving Title Near Tucker's Grasp
description: Even though the New York Giants are not having one of their better years, their tight end, Bob Tucker, is, and he can still find some things to look forward to amid all the wrecked hopes for a division title.

title: Cello, Finance Chief, Elected President of Switzerland
description: GENEVA, Dec. 8  Nello Celio, the Minister of Finance, and the only member of the Cabinet from the Italianspeaking canton of Ticino, was elected President of Switzerland today for a oneyear term, beginning Jan. 1. By tradition, the Presidency rotates among the seven members of the Cabinet.

title: Angela Davis Trial Shifted To San Jose and Set Jan. 31
description: PALO ALTO, Calif., Dec. 8The trial of Angela Davis, the black activist charged with murder, kidnapping and criminal conspiracy, was shifted today to San Jose.

title: 4 YOUTHS INDICTED FOR SLAYING IN BRONX
description: Four teenagers, described by the Bronx District Attorney as members of a youth gang known as the Invaders; were indicted yesterday for murder, attempted murder, assault, attempted assault and possession of a dangerous weapon.

title: Leaders of the Chinese Taste Revolution: Those Elusive Chefs
description: In the days when a Chinese meal was nothing more than chop suey, chow mein, one from column A and one from column B, probably nobody in America ever stopped to think about who the chief was. But now that more or less authentic Chinese food from several region notably Peking and Szechuan has gained a serious, following, the Chinese chefs have emerged as figures of the same importance as French chefs  but the Chinese are much more elusive.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: Carnegie Corporation Elects
description: The Carnegie Corporation or New York announced yesterday the election of three trustees: Dr. Philip R. Lee, chancellor of the University of California, San Francisco Medical Center; Miss Marta Y. Valle, director for continuing education at Columbia University School of Social Work, and Howard D. Samuel, vice president of the Amalgamated Clothing Workers of America.

title: IN THE NATION
description: SAVANNAH, Ga., Dec. 8A few years ago, the Shriners of this city decided to build a new temple and sell the splendid nineteenthcentury mansion on Monterey Square that they had been using. A buyer was right at handArmstrong Junior College, which was established in a block of old houses on another side of the square and which wanted the Shriner? property for a parking lot.

title: U.S. Is Believed Agreeing To Ecuador Fishing Limit
description: LIMA, Peru, Dec. 8Fishing. industry sources here believe that the United States Government is near an agreement with Ecuador that could temporarily halt the conflict over fishing rights in the Pacific Ocean off South America.

title: Brown Defeats Yale, 7268
description: PROVIDENCE, Dec. 8 (AP)Bill Kolkmeyer's jump shot with 13 seconds to play, followed by an interception and two foul shots by Frank Berman, gave Brown a 7268 basketball victory over Yale tonight.

title: MET FINDS AN ASSET IN GILDA CRUZROMO
description: Gilda CruzRomo, a soprano whose allegiance seems about equally divided now between the New York City Opera, where she made her New York debut, and the Metropolitan Opera, which borrowed her later, came into a new major role at the Met on Tuesday when she sang the part of Leonora in Verdi's La Forza del Destino.

title: Bitter Fighting Reported as Foe Opens Nevv Drive on Pnompenh
description: SRE NGEI, Cambodia, Dec. 8 (Reuter)  Fighting raged outside this tiny hamlet nine miles south of Pnompenh this afternoon as 1,000 Government troops moved to block a Communist advance toward the capital from a new quarter.

title: Japanese Bring City Charm and Competition
description: The Japanese business, community, a rapidly growing subculture in the heart of New York, is becoming an increasingly visible ptesence in the narrow streets of the financial district, in modern midtown office buildings and in the anxieties of its American competitors.

title: Chess:
description: Despite the amazing rise in the popularity of chess in America and Western Europe in the last few years, the majority of the top players are still coming out of Eastern Europe, the Soviet Union and Yugoslavia, particularly.

title: Ailey Dancers to Give Mary Lou's Mass
description: Mary Lou Williams has always been with us, Alvin Ailey said. For the 40yearold choreographer whose dance company has turned on the screamers and yellers from the Dnieper to the Potomac in the last year, it was only a matter of time before he would join forces with the Queen of Jazz.

title: Smith Wins 3d in Row, Leads Paris Tennis
description: PARIS, Dec. 8Pfc. Stan Smith looked at his watch and announced:

title: Store Owner, Citing 98c Bread, Calls Health Food Overpriced
description: Health foods are often excessively high priced, identical to cheaper supermarket foods and distributed by companies that refuse to show proof of their products' purity, witnesses from within the healthfood world told the Department of Consumer Affairs yesterday.

title: Dartmouth Wins, 8668
description: HANOVER, N. H., Dec. 9 (AP)  The secondhalf scoring of Bill Raynor and Paul Erland paced Dartmouth to an 8668 Ivy League basketball victory over Harvard tonight.

title: Rangers Tie Hawks on Hadfield's Goal
Family of 7 Found Dead
description: IRONTON, Mo., Dec. 8 (AP) Seven members of the family of Albert Niblack, 23 years old, were found dead in their beds early today, and the Iron County prosecutor said the deaths appeared to have been the re. suit of carbon monoxide poisoining. The dead Included Mr. Niblack, his wife, Carol, 28, and five children. A pair of coveralls was found stuffed in the flue of a stove, and Sheriff Ogie Singer said the former owner of the home had probably stuffed the coveralls into the pipe.

title: BROKERS WARNED ON ACCOUNT USES
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 8 The Securities and Exchange commission warned brokers today that they risked running afoul of several different sections of the securities laws including antifraud provisions  if they tried to persuade customers to make subordinated account agreements.

title: BOOK CALLED A HOAX BY HUGHES COMPANY
description: SAN FRANCISCO, Dec. 8A spokesman for the Hughes Tool Company said today that a book to be offered by the McGrawHill Book Company as an autobiography of Howard R. Hughes was a hoax.

title: ALLENDE IMPOSES CONTROL BY MATE ON SALES OF FOOD
description: SANTIAGO, Chile, Dec. 8President Salvador Allende GosBens announced today that his leftwing Government would take over full control of food distribution In Chile as part of an offensive against Fascist sedition.

title: OWNERS FIGHTING EXEMPTIONS' LOSS
description: The city is encountering opposition in its effort to collect real estate taxes on such previously exempt properties as the building housing Girl Scout headquarters and the Brooklyn buildings owned by Jehovah's

title: The Emergence of Bangla Desh
description: Defying a United Nations plea for a ceasefire, Indian forces appear on the verge of achieving New Delhi's major objectives in East Pakistan. These are the defeat of West Pakistani military repression in the disaffected Bengali province and the creation of conditions that will facilitate the speedy repatriation of nearly ten million refugeesMoslem and Hinduto an independent, friendly and secular Bangla Desh.

title: REFINEDLEAD PRICE REDUCED BY ST. JOE
description: The St. Joe Minerals Corporation announced late yesterday that its price of corroding lead would be 14.30 cents a pound, delivered at the customer's plant anywhere in the United States, effective today. Corroding lead is lead refined to a high degree, of purity.

title: DEMOCRATS PLAN GUARDS AT PARLEY
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 8  The best Democratic intelligence reports indicate that there will be no violence at the party's convention in Miami Beach next July, but more than $600,000 worth of security protection is going to be provided, just in case.

title: PAKISTAN INSISTS HER FORCES HOLD;
description: RAWALPINDI, Pakistan, Dec. 8  A West Pakistani military spokesman reported today that his country's troops in East Pakistan had been fighting without air cover for three days because Indian bombs had damaged the airfield at Dacca.

title: Nehoc's Brother Scores At Aqueduct, Pays $11.80
description: Nehoc's Brother of the Artson Stable adjusted himself favorably to the sprint distance of six furlongs at Aqueduct yesterday.

title: China, at U.N., Sees Collusion By U.S. and Soviet in Mideast
description: UNITED NATIONS, N. Y., Dec. 8China blamed the Soviet Union and the United States equally today for the absence of peace in the Middle East.

title: Boston U., Harvard Tie, 44
description: Boston, Dec. 12Boston University and Harvard played through a 10minute suddendeath overtime to a 44 hockey tie at Walter Brown Arena tonight.

title: IGOR GONDA, EXPERT ON TUBERCULOSIS, 60
description: Dr. Igor Gonna, visiting professor of community medicine at the Mount Sinai School of Medicine of the City University of New York, died yesterday of cancer at Lenox Hill Hospital. He was 60 years old and lived at 30 East End Avenue.

title: In the World of Radio, She's a Rare Bird
description: In the radio world; Alison Steele is something of a rarity. As WNEWFM's selfproclaimed Nightbird, she is the only fulltime woman disk jockey in the city and one of the few in the country. (The National Association of Broadcasters has no precise figures on the number of women disk jockeys).

title: Penguins Tie Golden Seals
description: PITTSBURGH, Dec. 8 (UPI)Bob Leiter's 15foot slap shot with 17:19 gone in the second period gave Pittsburgh a 11 tie with the California Golden Seals tonight and moved the Penguins into third place in the National Hockey League's Western Division.

title: Bridge:
description: LAS VEGAS, Nev., Dec. 8 The Italian Blue team rallied today to take an 11international match point lead in its 140board challenge match with the world champion Aces. The Italians entered the session trailing by 6 points, but scored a 17point victory. The Aces won yesterday, 35 to 29.

title: Morton Assures the East On Offshore Oil Drilling
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 8Secretary of the Interior Rogers C. B. Morton sought today to damp the ire of East Coast members of Congress who fear environmental damage from offshore oil drilling.

title: EQUITY FINANCING
description: Western Pacific Industries, Inc., marketed yesterday. 1.3 million units, one share and one warrant, at $19.50 a unit through an underwriting group managed by Dean Witter and Bear and Stearns.

title: New Jersey Woman, 28, Freed From Jessore Jail
description: A New Jersey woman was freed by East Pakistani guerrillas Tuesday as they swept with the Indian Army into Jessore, where she had been held in a Pakistani jail since October.

title: JAPAN STEEL SALES TO EUROPE CURBED
description: TOKYO, Dec. 8 (AP)Japanese steel producers have agreed to restrict voluntarily their exports to the European Common Market and Britain for the next three years. Yoshi biro Inayama, president of the Japan Iron and Steel Federation, disclosed today.

title: COPTER EVACUATION SUGGESTED FOR U.N.
description: NEW DELHI, Dec. 8India has offered to allow helicopters to evacuate about 150 United Nations employes from East Pakistan, since the Dacca Airport is unserviceable, a spokesman said today.

title: Notes on People
description: Call him Special Ambassador Billy Graham. The evangelist, an old friend of President Nixon's, has been appointed as a member of the official delegation to the inauguration of William R. Tolbert as President of Liberia. The delegation, due in Monrovia Jan. 1, will be led by Mrs. Nixon and will include Bernard J. Lasker, chairman of the board of governors of the New York Stock Exchange; Mrs. John H. Johnson, wife of the publisher of Ebony magazine; and Samuel Z. Westerfield Jr., the Ambassador to Liberia. Special Ambassador Graham will officiate at a thanksgiving service at Providence Baptist Church in Monrovia the day before the inauguration, which is set for Jan. 3.

title: 20 JEWISH CENTERS FACE STRIKE THREAT
description: Employes at 20 Jewish community centers in the city and Westchester County threatened to strike next week if they were not able to obtain a fair ettlement in their bid for improved pay and benefits.

title: VIRGINIA UPSETS MARYLAND, 7857
description: CHARLOTTESVILLE, Va., Dec. 8 (AP)Virginia, shooting 58.6 per cent from the floor, upset fifthranked Maryland, 7857, tonight in an Atlantic Coast Conference game.

title: Princeton Wins in Hockey
description: PRINCETON, N. J., Dec. 8John Hepburn, a senior forward, scored a goal from eight feet tonight to give Princeton University's hockey team a 54 overtime victory over Army.

title: 5 in Jersey Family Slain
description: WESTFIELD, N. J., Dec. 8A woman, her three teenage children and her motherinlaw were found shot to death last night in their home, a decaying 19room frame mansion high on a hill in a quiet residential street.

title: George Widener, Racing Figure, Dies at 82
description: PHILADELPHIA, Dec. 8George D. Widener, one of the most honored figures in thoroughbred racing, died today at Erdenheim Farm, his Chestnut Hill estate. He was 82 years old.

title: GERDA ZIMMERMANN IN DANCE VIGNETTES
description: The tide of impressionist dancers that was once so full has been reduced to a small stream of practitioners who offer their vignettes sporadically. Among the more adept is Gerda Zimmermann, who presented her Kammertanz Theater IV at the Cubiculo Tuesday evening.

title: HitRun Driver Sought
description: A special telephone number has been set up in the East Fifth Street station for public assistance in finding a hitandrun cab driver who killed a 3yearold boy Tuesday night. The police said the driver struck Sanden Sanchez at 10th Street and Avenue A at 5:45 P.M. The number is OR 40770.

title: The Critical First Five Years
description: The child development program which Congress has now sent to the White House honors a firm pledge made by President Nixon. In his message to Congress on April 19, 1969, Mr. Nixon said: So critical is the matter of early growth that we must make a national commitment to providing all American children an opportunity for healthful and stimulating development during the first five years of life.

title: U.S. Reserves Ruling on Suit To Block an ANICO Meeting
description: Judge Sylvester J. Ryan reserved decision in Federal Court here yesterday on a shareholders' suit seeking to block a special Dec. 15 meeting of the American National Insurance Company in Texas.

title: OTC AND AMEX POST PRICE GAINS
description: Most prices on the American Stock Exchange on the overthecounter market moved up yesterday in fairly, active trading.

title: Indians Reported Repulsed
description: DACCA, Dec. 8 (Reuters)The Dacca radio said today that Pakistani forces in East Paldstan were successfully holding off Indian thrusts on almost all fronts.

title: Stage: The Contractor
description: NEW HAVEN  The Long Wharf Theater has done it again, its present success being its first attempt at a new English import. David Storey's The Contractor was seen In London two seasons ago, and it was thought that it would come to New York at about the same time as Mr. Storey's highly successful Home. But for some sad reason The Contractor never arrived, and it has been left to the Long Wharf Theater to give the play its American premiere.

title: St. Lawrence Six Wins
description: POTSDAM, N. Y., Dec. 8 (AP) With eight seconds left in the game, Dan Hanninen slapped in the tiebreaking goal tonight to lift St. Lawrence to 43 college hockey victory over archrival Clarkson.

title: News of Dogs
description: A native of Rottweil wouldn't know a Rottweiler of the canine variety by that name. He would call him a metzgerhund (butcher dog). Coincidentally, Friedrich Berger of Dortmund, known in Germany as Mr. Rottweiler, is a master butcher by trade and a Rottweiler authority by avocation Berger has written the standard for the breed is head warden for the 2,400  member Allgemeiner Deutscher Rottweiler Klub and is recognized as the chief judge of the breed.

title: Suburb Apartments Up by 96% in Decade
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 8.Apartments in the suburbs, once an almost unimaginable sight through the picture window, increased at a spectacular rate in the nineteensixties, according to the first major national housing re, port of the 1970 Census.

title: Rehnquist Says '52 Memo Outlined Jackson's Views
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 8William H. Rehnquist said today that he was expressing the views of the late Justice Robert H. Jacksonnot his own viewswhen he wrote a memorandum in 1952 saying that the separate but equal doctrine underlying school segregation was right and should be reaffirmed.

title: New Brusiein to Open Feb. 1
description: The new production of. The Sign in Sidney Brustein's Window, by the late Lorraine Hansberry, will open Feb. 1 at the Longacre Theater. It will have songs by Gary William Friedman and Ray Errol Fox, which will be sung by four singers in Greek choral fashion commenting on various aspects of the play. Alan Schneider is directing and Robert Renfield will produce the show. Robert Nemiroff has edited the play, assisted by Charlotte Zaltzberg.

title: Berlin Compromise Reached, Then Lost
description: BERLIN, Dec. 8A highlevell East German negotiator, Peter Florin, made an attempt to complete the details of the Berlin agreement early today, only to back off at the last minute.

title: Pakistan's Holy War
description: RAWALPINDI, Dec. 7 (Delayed)  Military spokesmen here have been asked repeatedly for some indication of Pakistan's casualties in the last four days, and tonight one replied:

title: Queens Tops Brooklyn, 7962
description: Queens College ran its undefeated streak to three by defeating Brooklyn College, 7962, on the winners' court last night.

title: Defending the Free World
description: Defending the Free World

title: Books of The Times
description: SEE FOR YOURSELF. By Wilmarth Sheldon Lewis. 118 pages. Illustrated. Harper & Row. $15.

title: FUTURES PRICES IN COTTON EASE
description: Prices of cotton No. 2 futures on the New York Cotton Exchange closed a little lower to unchanged yesterday, following the Agriculture Department's revision downward by 161,500 bales of its 1971 cottoncrop estimate. The news was bearish because traders had expected an even larger drop.

title: LAKES ROIL ON FOR 18TH IN ROW
description: HOUSTON, Dec. 8 (UPI) Gail Goodrich scored 42 points and Jerry West 33 to leadthe Los Angeles Lakers to a 125120 victory over the Housfon Rockets tonight for their 18th straight.

title: U.N.'S CALL FOR TRUCE IS REJECTED
description: UNITED NATIONS, N. Y., Dec. 8Indian delegates today derided the General Assembly's call for a ceasefire in the war with Pakistan and indicated India would not obey it. The Pakistani delegation expressed strong reservations about its terms.

title: Reagan Signs Tax Measure To Balance State's Budget
description: LOS ANGELES, Dec. 8 (AP) Gov. Ronald Reagan signed today the $351million tax bill, imposing payroll withholdingwhich he once opposedand balancing the state's budget.

title: He Has Common Touch
description: NEW DELHI, Dec. 8Shortly before India's diastrous war with China in 1962, the popular commandant of the Army Staff College was accused by the then Defense Minister, V. K. Krishna Menon, of being unpatriotic for hanging portraits of British officers in the mess hall.

title: New Antitrust Policy?
description: Richard W. McLaren's brilliant career as the Nixon Administration's antitrust chief has come to a sudden and unexpected end with his appointment to the Federal judgeship in Chicago currently held by Julius J. Hoffman. The timing and speed of Mr. McLaren's removal from the antitrust jobone of the key economic and Ilegal positions in the Governmentinevitably raises questions about the future of Administration antitrust policy.

title: ENGLISH'S OUSTER IS URGED IN MEMO
description: The ouster of Dr. Joseph T. English as chief of the city's municipal hospital system has been requested in a confidential memorandum distributed this week to the directors of the Health and Hospitals Corporation.

title: EDWARD BURCHARD, PSYCHOLOGIST, DIES
description: Dr. Edward M. L. Burchard, professor of psychology at Queens College, died at his home in Manhattan on Tuesday. He was 62 years old and lived at 1230 Park Avenue.

title: Kchessinska, Famed Ballerina, Dead
description: PARIS, Dec. 8 (Reuters)Mattalde Kchessinska, the ballerina who helped make Russian ballet famous throughout Europe at the start of the century, died here yesterday at the age of 99.

title: Penn Sextet Tops Yale, 43
description: NEW HAVEN, Conn., Dec. 8 Bill MacDonell scored two goals in the third period tonight to break a 22 tie and earn Pennsylvania a 4.3 hockey victory over Yale. MacDonell's tiebreaking goal came at 7:40 of the third period and he added an insurance tally at 18:36.

title: For These Dogs, It's Bombs That Make Them Salivate
description: A German shepherd named Brandy and a Labrador retriever named Sally demonstrated yetserday how they might use their universitytrained noses to sniff out hidden bombs for the police.

title: Knoedler's Bought by Hammer Group
description: When Bernard Danenberg and Victor Hammer, New York art dealers, attended the 40th anniversary celebration of the Joslyn Art Museum in Omaha recently, they spent an entire evening defending the merits of a Stuart Davis painting sold to the museum by the prestigious art concern of Knoedler's.

title: Halston's Revival Of Sweater Girl
description: He's done diaphanous tiedyed chiffon evening dresses, deliciously colored leather jackets, halterneck blouses and dresses that plunge to the waistline. But Halston's spring collection will undoubtedly be remembered as the one that brought back the cashmere sweater set.

title: Conviction of a Mother For Lewdness Upheld
description: TALLAHASSEE, Fla., Dec. 8 (UPI)The Florida Supreme Court upheld today the constitutionality of a lawwunder which a 30yearold woman was sentenced for demonstrating the sex act to her 8yearold son.

title: F.B.I. Lists Serial Numbers Of Money Given to Hijacker
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 8 (AP) The Federal Bureau of Investigation said today that it was distributing a 34page list of serial numbers that correspond to those on the $20 bills paid to the hijacker believed to have parachuted from Boeing 727 aircraft between Seattle and Reno, Nev., last Nov. 24.

title: ExReporter Sentenced
description: PHILADELPHIA, Dec. 8 (UPI) Harry J. Karafin, a former Philadelphia Inquirer reporter, was sentenced today to two to seven years in prison on a perjury conviction stemming from testimony given on blackmail charges. Kardin is serving a fourtonineyear sentence for an October, 1968, conviction on charges of shaking down businessmen by threatening to print unfavorable articles about them.

title: U.N. Struggling With Perennial and Elusive Problem: Defining Aggression
description: UNITED NATIONS, N. Y., Dec. 8Aggression has been around even longer than man, and however hard it may be to resist aggression, the attempt to define it is even more irresistible.

title: India Disputes U.S.
description: NEW DELHI, Dec. 8  A senior Indian spokesman today disputed statements by a White House spokesman that Indian military incursions into East Pakistan had wrecked American efforts to persuade the Bengali insurgents and the Pakistan authorities to reach a political settlement.

title: War on the Subcontinent
description: This article is excerpted from the lead editorial in this week's New Statesman.

title: Shareholders Told Loss Is Expected in 2d Quarter
description: The top management of Columbia Pictures Industries, Inc., voluntarily agreed to take salary cuts until the company returns to profitability, stockholders were told here yesterday at the annual meeting.

title: War Summary
description: NEW DELHI  Continued gains in East Pakistan were reported by Indian troops, but Pakistani forces were said to be withdrawing largely intact to assembly areas near Dacca.

title: Gallic Aura Sought By French Hospital For New Quarters
description: The French and Polyclinic Medical School and Health Center is going to try to put the French back in French Hospital.

title: ROBERT M. WAGNER
description: Robert Murray Wagner, an architect, died yesterday in the Veterans Administration Hospital in the Bronx after a long illness. He was 61 years old and lived in Nyack, N.Y.

title: 80 Housing Projects' Debt To City Put at $15Million
description: Almost threequarters of the city's 112 MitchellLama middleincome housing projects were behind in their mortgage and interest payments to the city as of last July 31, City Controller Abraham D. Beame charged yesterday.

title: I.T.T. Observes Guidelines In Raising Dividend a Cent
description: The International Telephone and Telegraph Corporation raised its dividend yesterday but at a lowerthannormal rate because of the Administration's guidelines.

title: DAY'S FINANCINGS TOP $3.3BILLION New York Phone Bands Lag as Yield Is Set at 7.28%
description: In the last backbreaking schedule of financing activity of 1971, the money and capital markets handled more than $3.3billion of Treasury, taxexempt and corporate notes and bonds yesterday.

title: Indians Report Drive in West
description: JULLUNDUR, India, Dec. 8 (Reuters)Indian troops have pushed six miles into the Sialkot sector of West. Pakistan to protect the trunk road that runs from New Delhi to Srinagar, the capital of Kashmir, a military spokesman said here today.

title: Frank C. Porter, 53, Dead; Washington Post Reporter
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 8Frank C. Porter, a reporter for The Washington Post who specialized in economics and labor and business affairs, died today at the George Washington University Hospital.

title: A Nationwide, Controlled System of Cable TV Is Recommended in Detailed Study by Sloan Commission
description: Cable television has the potential to revolutionize the nation's culture, journalism, politics and community needs and services, according to a study made public yesterday by the Sloan Commission on Cable Communications.

title: Karachi Raid Reported
description: NEW DELHI, Thursday, Dec. 9 (Retiters)Indian aircraft attacked Karachi harbor and city early today, sinking one merchant ship and killing Many. civilians, the Pakistan radio reported.

title: Heads of Black Colleges Discuss Possibility of Merging Some of Their Schools
description: ATLANTA, Dec. 8The possibility of merging some of the nation's 51 Negro private colleges was discussed at a special meeting here of the presidents of black colleges.

title: GAITO GAZDANOV, 68, A NOVELIST IN EXILE
description: Gaito Gazdanov, an expatriate, Russian writer of psychological novels, some of which were published in English and French, died in Munich on Sunday after a long illness. He was 68 years old.

title: 2 Guilty of Using Swiss Bank to Evade Their Taxes
description: Two businessmen from New York have been found guilty of using a sham Liechtenstein corporation and a secret Swiss bank account to evade United States income taxes on millions of dollars in sales to American military post exchanges throughout the world.

title: Judge Suspends Sale Of Electrical Device As a Cure for Ills
description: A Long Island manufacturer who advertised an electrical device as a panacea for human ailments was enjoined yesterday from selling it until scientific proof could be established.

title: Griffin Will Replace Frost March 13 on Channel
description: Mery Griffin will replace David Frost in the 8:30 P.M. time slot on Channel 5 here, starting March 13.

title: Executive Changes
description: The Caterpillar Tractor Company announced yesterday in Peoria, Ill., the election of Virgil V. Grant as executive vice president and a director. Mr. Grant has been a vice president since 1962.

title: TALKS ON TRADE BEGIN IN EUROPE
description: BRUSSELS, Dec. 9President Nixon's special trade representative, William Eberle, accompanied by a highpowered delegation from Washington, began negotiations with Common Market authorities today to construct a trade component for a world monetary agreement.

title: Some Digitalis Pills Found to Have Little Effect
description: Columbia University researchers and Harlem Hospital physicians have discovered that some digitalis pills of a type called digoxin do not always fulfill their purpose of making diseased hearts beat more forcefully to pump the blood needed to nourish the body.

title: Bullets Down Blazers
description: BALTIMORE, Dec. 8 (AP)Archie Clark, with a gamehigh 30 points and 10 assists, led the Baltimore Bullets to a 11597 victory over the Portland Trail Blazers tonight.

title: Maria Taft Wed to John Clemow
description: Miss Maria Herron Taft, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. William Howard Taft 3d of Washington and a greatgranddaughter of President Taft, was married in Paris Dec. 1 to John Clemow, son of the late Mr. and Mrs. Albert George Clemow of London. The ceremony took place at the Mairie of the 15th Arondissement.

title: Car Pools Use Bridge Free in Coast Experiment
description: SAN FRANCISCO, Dec. 8In an experiment to encourage car pooling, cars with three or more occupants, were allowed to cross the San FranbiscoOakland Bay Bridge during rush hours today in reserved lanes and without pairing the 50cent toll.

title: East Mediterranean NATO Fleet Asked
description: BRUSSELS, Dec. 8  Secretary of Defense Melvin R. Laird proposed today the formation of a permanent allied naval force operating in the eastern Mediterranean in cooperation with the United States Sixth Fleet.

title: Synthetic Teeth Termed Breakthrough
description: In George Washington's time, dental practitioners paid poor people 50 cents a tooth and then transplanted the donated teeth into their wealthier patients. In more recent years, dentists tried implanting dog teeth in man.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor: The Army Corps of Engineers plans to dam the Delaware River in the Delaware. Water Gap National Park. The Corps is required by law to show that benefits exceed costs and has justified the Tocks. Island Dam as benefiting recreation, flood control, water supply and power generation.

title: Hodgson Backs Pay Board On Granting of Big Raises
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 8Secretary of Labor James, D. Hodgson said today that the Administration had known that it would have to swallow very large wage Marmeat in coal, aerospace, railroads and several other industries at the outset of Phase Two.

title: Camels, Hippies, Envoys, Buses: War Crowds the Khyber Pass
description: THE KHYBER PASS, Dec. (Delayed)With the war closing Pakistan's airfields and ports, this tortuous mountain road that was once a glory of the British empire and remains a legend of high adventure, has taken on a more practical significance.

title: Robber Slain in Holdup
description: A 56  year  old liquor store owner shot and killed a robber during an attempted holdup yesterday morning at the Gloka Wines and Liquor Store in Chelsea. Frank Hantman, owner of the stare at 112 10th Avenue, at 17th Street, fired three shots during a struggle with a man with a knife, the police said. The dead man still has not been identified. His accomplice, who had a pistol, fled, the police said.

title: Wild and Wonderful Closes
description: Wild and Wonderful, a new musical by Bob Goodman and Phil Phillips, closed after its premiere performance on Tuesday night at the Lyceum Theater. It was presented by Rich Hobard in association with Raymonde Weil.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: PRESIDENT URGES A TAX DEDUCTION TO SPUR PENSIONS
