description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 8President Nixon asked Congress today to help selfreliant Americans prepare for retirement by granting income tax deductions for pension contributions and by preserving the pension rights of workers who leave or change jobs.

title: Old Friend of President
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 8Lieut. Gen. Abdul. Hamid Khan, chief of staff of the Pakistani Army, is described by United State's Government sources as an effective 5dyearold military careerist. He is considered proWestern.

title: STOCKS DECLINE AS TRADING RISES
description: The stock market provided a mixture of profit taking and sharp runups in certain glamour issues yesterday. The DowJones industrial average slipped 2.55 points to finish at 854.85.

title: Cards Seek Clendenon
description: ST. LOUIS, Dec. 8 (AP) The St. Louis Cardinals' general manager, Bing Devine, said today he was negotiating to sign 36yearold Donn Clendenon, who was released by the New York Mets after last season.

title: U.S. Court Rejects Douglas's Restraint On Coast Inductions
description: LOS ANGELES, Dec. 8 (UPI) A United States, District Court rejected today a suit challenging the nation's draft law and set aside a ruling by Associate Justice William O. Douglas of the Supreme Court halting military inductions in California.

title: Mills Sees Fighting Chancel For Democrats Next Year
description: ATLANTA, Dec. 8 (AP) Representative Wilbur D. Mills, Democrat of Arkansas, described President Nixon today as a brilliant strategist but said that the Democrats had a fighting chance of beating him in 1972.

title: McCarthy's Name Entered. In Massachusetts Primary
description: BOSTON, Dec. 8 (AP)Eugene J. McCarthy has formally entered the Massachusetts Presidential primary.

title: Heath to Talk With Trudeaul
description: OTTAWA, Dec. 8 (Reuters)Prime Minister Heath will visit Prime Minister Pierre Elliott Trudeau in Ottawa Dec: 17 and then fly to Brmuda for talks with President Nixon on Dec. 20, it was announced today.

title: PRISON AIDES GET PLEA FOR CANDOR
description: WILLIAMSBURG, Va., Dec. 8The 350 penal experts assembled here by the Justice Department ended their meeting today with a call for a new candor in relations between their profession and the public.

title: India Bank Opens Branch
description: The State Bank of India, a Governmentowned commercial bank, opened a branch office yesterday at 460 Park Avenue at 57th Street. It replaces a representative office, the first of an Indian bank in North America, that operated at 44 Wall Street.

title: Eastern College Football
description: Two years ago, the American Broadcasting Company was on the verge of dropping the ArmyNavy football game from its gameoftheweek television series. A.B.C. sports executives were just about convinced that Army and Navy, no longer national powers, could not attract the Audience to satisfy Madison Avenue executives. But dropping the ArmyNavy game is a lot easier said than done, even if the President of the United States doesn't attend any more. Luckily for A.B.C. Sports and for most football fans, the 1970 and 1971 ArmyNavy games were shown on A.B.C. television.

title: Screen: Hagmann's 'Believe in Me':Work on Drug Culture Begins Local Run Sarrazin Stars in Role of Expelled Interne
description: Not hash, not horse, but speed is of the essence in Stuart Hagmann's "Believe in Me," which opened yesterday at neighborhood theaters. Remy, an interne in a New York City hospital, and Pamela, an editor of children's books, middle class, and by drug-culture standards all but middle-aged, take to each other and take to amphetamines, and thereby lose their jobs, their money, and all their self-respect.Because it avoids most extremes of up or down or in between, "Believe in Me" also avoids some of the melodramatics that plague the drug movie and that tend to take the place of motivation with characters who are always allowed first causes, but rarely genuine motives. Addiction comes with a certain efficient flash (three diet pills, and Pam turns into a full-fledged, paranoid speed freak), but once arrived it settles in without too many predictable surprises or conventional crucial questionssuch as how Pam and Remy stay alive, or why.Given the flatness of her material, Jacqueline Bisset, an actress I normally worship just this side of idolatry, underplays Pamela to the point of indifference. But Michael Sarrazin, who does have some nice hospital bits before he is relieved of his residency, positively improves his chances in a performance that is genuinely understated rather than, as it is written, indistinct."Believe in Me" is full of plot hints dropped and never retrieved, and it seems to have been cutnot so much edited as maimed. When allowed some emotional range (as in a fine violent hallucination sequence by Kurt Dodenhoff, playing a teenage addict) Stuart Hagmann directs a rather decent movie. But such moments are too few, and in suppressing even pathos, the film also suppresses the other feelings that could have made it live.

title: The Proceedings In the U.N. Today
LOCKHEED TOPS LIST IN DEFENSE PACTS
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 9 (UPI) The Lockheed Aircraft Corporation received the most money in military contracts last year, according to Pentagon statistics.

title: A Poor Program Limits Eastman Group
description: If the playing of the Eastman Quartet were as noncommital and uninformative as its name, the ensemble might not have appeared at Tully Hall on Wednesday night. Fortunately, the group does take a worthy stand about music, and, since it is in fact a piano quartet, it occupies a place of distinction among chambermusic organizations.

title: DR. ENGLISH WINS BOARD'S BACKING
description: Dr. Joseph T. English, chief of the city's municipal hospital system, won a vote of confidence yesterday from the board of directors of the Health and Hospitals Corporation.

title: RULES ON ENFORCING RIGHTS ACT ISSUED
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 9  The Federal Government issued a set of regulations today that provide, for the first time uniform rules for enforcement under the Civil Rights Act of 1964.

title: SWIFT & CO. NET ROSE 17% IN YEAR
description: Swift & Co., the nation's largest meat packer with diversified operations in petroleum, chemical, insurance and foods, reported yesterday a 17 per cent increase in profits for the fiscal year ended Oct. 30 despite a 2.1 per cent drop in sales.

title: Frederick B. Llewellyn Dead; ExAide for Bell Laboratories
description: HYANNIS, Mass., Dec. 9Frederick B. Llewellyn, an electronics and radio technician who had served as assistant to the president of Bell Laboratories, died today in a nursing home here. He was 74 years old and had lived in Summit, N.J., since his retirement in 1961.

title: HOSPITAL CLOSING IS FORESTALLED
description: New York City has advanced Knickerbocker Hospital $300,000 and forestalled its closing, the president of the hospital's board of trustees said yesterday.

title: French Prison Riot Quelled By Army and Riot Police
description: TOUL, France, Dec. 9 (Reuters)  Two French Army bulldozers, guarded by riot police, pushed into Toul prison today to put down a riot by youthful prisoners. The inmates surrendered peacefully, but also won two major demands.

title: Mayor Offers Plan to Lift Borrowing Power of City
description: A legislative package that could add billions of dollars to the city's borrowing capacity to build schools, sewers, subway lines and other projects was proposed yesterday by Mayor Lindsay.

title: Herschel Friday Asks Court To Void Integration Ruling
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 9 (AP) Herschel H. Friday, the Little Rock, Ark., bond attorney who was reportedly once President Nixon's top choice for a Supreme Court seat, has asked the high court to overturn a ruling that Little Rock schools must integrate more.

title: CITY RENT RISES ARE RETROACTIVE
description: Rent increases approved for rent  controlled apartments in the city since Aug. 14, and increases allowable in leases signed for rentstabilized apartments since that date must be paid retroactive to Nov. 22, it was announced yesterday by the City Housing and Development Administration and the Internal Revenue Service.

title: Sports of The Times
description: In the office of Howard J. Samuels, president of the New York City Offtrack Betting Corporation, hangs a sketch of a horse drawn in profile with easytoread lettering designating the salient features of the animal's anatomy. That 13, near the head appears the word, front, and near the tail, back.

title: 9 Lawmen Charged in Death of Black Memphis Youth
description: MEMPHIS, Dec. 19 (AP)Three Shelby County sheriff's officersincluding a black lieutenantand a Memphis patrolman were charged with firstdegree murder today in the fatal beating of a black teenager two months ago.

title: NEW PRINCIPALS JOIN MET'S FAUST CAST
description: The Metropolitan Opera's ninth Faust performance of the season offered Teresa ZylisGara as Marguerite and Alfredo Kraus in the title role on Wednesday night, both taking the parts for the first time with the company.

title: KNAPP PANEL DELAYS HEARINGS ONE DAY
description: The Knapp Commission's public hearings, originally scheduled to resume at 10 A.M. on Monday, have been rescheduled for 12:30 P.M. on Tuesday, Dec. 14, it was announced yesterday by Michael F. Armstrong, the commission counsel.

title: Commodity Price Index Is Unchanged From WeekAgo
description: The commodity spot market price index of foodstuff and industrial materials remained unchanged from 105.7 last week.

title: Rogers Reassures NATO Allies On U.S. Commitment to Europe
description: BRUSSELS, Dec. 9  Secretary of State William P. Rogers declared today that changes in United States foreign policy would not diminish American partnership in Europe, support for European unity or commitment to Europe's defense.

title: Met Plans a New Pricing Policy To Offset Attendance Decline
description: Faced with gradually declining attendance over the last five years, the Metropolitan Opera has decided to experiment with a new ticketpricing plan. Beginning Jan. 4, seats wilt be offered in the last five rows of the orchestra and in the grandtier boxes for $12.50 on Tuesday, Wednesday and Thursday nights, rather than at the present $16.50 price.

title: Goldwater Backs Nixon
description: SAN ANTONIO, Tex., Dec. 9 (AP)  Senator Barry Goldwater said last night that conservative critics of President Nixon were a threat to the entire party, the entire country, the entire free world and freedom itself.

title: TaxReduction Bill Is Sent To President by Congress
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 9The first session of the 92d (Congress, fitfully struggling toward adjournment, passed and sent to the White House today the taxreduction legislation President Nixon requested as part of his economic stabilizaition program.

title: Advertising:
description: Certainly few people are more pleased than its publisher that Time has become the world's No. 1 magazine in advertising revenues.

title: Saints Dismiss Schwenk; ExAstronaut May Get Job
description: NEW ORLEANS, Dec. 9 (AP) Vic Schwenk was dismissed today as general manager of the New Orleans Saints and a former astronaut, Dick Gordon, was among those mentioned as a possible replacement for him.

title: STREAKING LAYERS POST 19TH, 124111
description: OAKLAND, Calif., Ded. 9 (AP) Jerry West Gail Goodrich, the Lacer guards, comblued for 74 points and made the last four baskets tonight as Los Angeles won its 19th straight National Basketball Association game, 124111, from the Golden State Warriors.

title: Plunkett Seeks Passing Mark Against Jets
description: Jim Plunkett's voice was raspy when he was awakened at 9:15 yesterday morning, but he quickly pulled himself together and said, with feeling: Who says we've had a losing season? It's not over yet. When I go out there, I think we can win every game.

title: Stage: WightrideNo Apologies and No Regrets
description: Gay liberation has leapt out of the closet like a fillinthebox, and I like this. People have a right to be their own kind of people and to be recognized as such by the world. All adults should have the choice to consent. Which brings me to a new play, Nightride, which opened last night at the Vandam Theater and is, I suspect, the first immature, mature homosexual play.

title: MEDIATORS NAMED IN TRANSIT BOARD
description: Mayor Lindsay named a threemember mediation panel yesterday to assist negotiators for the Transit Authority and subway and bus workers in their efforts to negotiate a new contract before their present agreement expires on New Year's Eve.

title: Pound Demand Strong
description: LONDON, Dec. 9 (Reuters) The effective revaluation of the 10 key nondollar currencies soared to a new peak of 8.6 per cent against the dollar today. Yesterday it was 8.4 per cent.

title: Dr. Bunche of U.N., Nobel Winner, Dies
description: Dr. Ralph J. Bunche, former United Nations Under Secretary General for Special Political Affairs and winner of the 1950 Nobel Peace Prize, died early yesterday in New York Hospital. He was 67 years old.

title: 17 Killed as Plane Crashes After TakeOff in Oklahoma
description: OKLAHOMA CITY, Dec. 9 (UPI)  A private plane lost power soon after takeoff today, crashed in a thick fog and burned. Seven persons died, including two wealthy tile company executives from San Angelo, Tex.

title: Polish Party Leader Engulfed by Women Delegates at Congress
description: WARSAW, Dec. 9The Sixth Congress of the Polish Communist party suddenly came alive today during an intermission when Edward Gierek, the party leader, was engulfed by playful women delegates.

title: U. S. Hopeful on Fishing Pact With Brazil
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 9The White House expressed confidence today that the United States would reach an interim arrangement of some sort with Brazil to permit American fishing fleets to operate off the Brazilian coast.

title: 2 Oppose Rehnquist
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 9The forces opposing William H. Rehnquist's nomination to the Supreme Court picked up their second Republican Senator todayJacob K. Javits of New Yorkand their first Southerner, J. W. Fulbright of Arkansas.

title: A Monitor Trims the Price of Porterhouse
description: CLEVELAND, Dec. 8The shoppers in Geraci's BiRite supermarket can thank Mrs. Marge Cramer for rolling back the price of porterhouse steak from $1.89 to $1.79 a pound.

title: Nixon Proclaims Rights Day
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 9 (AP). President Nixon today proclairned tomorrow as Human Rights Day, commemorating the signing of the United. Nations' Universal Declaration of Human Rights on Dec. 10, 1948. The President also proclaimed the week beginning tomorrow as Human Rights Week, with Dec. 15 designated Bill of Rights Day.

title: Barnard Trustee Elected
description: The board of trustees of Barnard College last night elected Jacques G. Maisonrouge, president of International Business Machines Corporation, Europe, to a oneyear term as a member of the board. The board also voted to allow students, faculty members and administrators to serve as voting representatives to most of the trustees' standing committees.

title: NEED FOR POWER CUT IS CITED AT HEARING
description: State and city officials agreed yesterday that some cutback in electrical use was needed to ease the power crisis, but each said it was up to the other to impose restrictions, which are viewed as politically uncomfortable.

title: . . . Another Blow at the U.N.
description: The House has delivered another blow to the buffeted United Nations this week by eliminating a proposed $100million United States contribution to the United Nations Development Program from the foreign aid appropriation bill.

title: Bridge: Italians Lead Aces by 5 I.M.P. After 60 Boards at Las Vegas
description: LAS VEGAS, Nev., Dec. 9 After 60 boards of the 140board Las Vegas challenge match, the Italian Blue team leads the Dallas Aces by the narrow margin of 103 international match points to 98.

title: FLORIDA'S RUING CLOUDS OTB PLAN
description: TALLAHASSEE, Fla., Dec. 9 (AP)Attorney General Robert Shevin said today it was illegal for Florida horse tracks to transmit information to offtrack betting operations in other states, but a Miami track official said Shevin's ruling would not do much good.

title: S.E.C. Staff Says Great Southwest Overstated Profits
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 9The staff of the Securities and Exchange Commission alleged today that the Great Southwest Corporation, a subsidiary of the Penn Central Company, had materially overstated its earnings in its annual reports for 1968 and 1969. The commission ordered a public hearing on the staff's charges, to begin Jan. 5.

title: Soviet Said to Want Thant to Stay Briefly
description: UNITED NATIONS, N. Y., Dec. 10  Initial efforts by the Big Five to pick a new Secretary General have failed, partly, informants say, because the Soviet Union still wants U Thant to remain on an interim basis.

title: BERTRAM J. CASSIDY
description: BELMAR, N. J., Dec. 9 Bertram J. Cassidy, a broker in municipal bonds, died today at his home after an illness of several months. He was 58 years old and lived at 1211 River Road.

title: M'GOVERN, IN CITY, CRITICIZES MAYOR
description: Senator George McGovern declared yesterday that Mayor Lindsay would be in rough shape if he ran for President on his record here.

title: Second Evans RetrospectiveSmaller but Powerful
description: NEW HAVEN, Dec. 9In the annals of photographic art, 1971 is olearely going down as Walker Evinis year It began in late January, with a large, dazzling retrospective exhibition at the Museum of Modern Art. It is drawing to a close with a smaller but no less dazzling exhibition opening today at the Yale University Art Gallery here. Among this great photographers's other distinctions, be must surely, be the only American artist ever to be subjected to the urderd and the high compliment of two restroapective exhibitions in a single year.

title: A Socialist Leads in Voting For the Presidency of Italy
description: ROME, Dec. 9Deputy Premier Francesco de Martino, chairman of the Socialist Party, led in two inconclusive votes as the election for a new President of the Italian Republic started today.

title: News Analysis
description: PARIS, Dec. 7  To the French money is the root of most evil at the moment, and the bloated dollar, in particular, is the root of most of what ails the Western alliance.

title: Air France and U.S. Carriers Eye Seat Cuts on Paris Route
description: The president of Air France, Pierre D. Cot, has proposed that scheduled airlines flying between Paris and East Coast cities in this country seek an agreement on cutting the costly overabundance of seats offered on the route.

title: C.B.S. and A.B.C. to Document Problem of Invasion of Privacy
description: The growing problem of invasion of privacy by public and private agencies will be the subject of documentaries on the Columbia Broadcasting System and the American Broadcasting Company.

title: Dining on Tandoori Chicken Under Colorful Indian Tent
description: Restaurants reviewed on this page on Friday are rated both for their food (four stars to none) and for their atmosphere, service and decor (four triangles to none).

title: You Can Come Home Again, However briefly
description: LONDONThe city was invented in the ancient Orient to protect the human species, which cowered behind its laboriously constructed moats, battlements and glacis when the enemy approached. Under the exuberant Greeks the city evolved into a cultural showcase designed to preserve the good life.

title: ... the Faith of Ralph Bunche ...
description: For Americans and many others, Ralph J. Bunche was a personification of the United Nations, which he served capably and selflessly for nearly a quartercentury. The decisive role he played in some of the U.N.'s More spectacular political successes had made of him almost a symbol of the United Nations at its best.

title: SQUIRES BEAT NETS IN OVERTIME, 115114
description: RICHMOND, Dec. 9Julius Erving Sank two free throws with three seconds to go in overtime to give the Virginia Squires a 115114 victory over the New Yorks Nets in an American Basketball Association game tonight.

title: Theater: Camus's Caligula Is Staged
description: NEW HAVEN Caligula is a play of ideas and also something of a spectacle. Traditionally, this has allowed critics to accuse the director of the play's failings, to say that directorial flourishes have submerged Camus's ideas.

title: U.S. Trade Demands Pose Threat to Monetary Talks
description: BRUSSELS, Dec 9  The possibility that protracted trade negotiations might delay a settlement of the world monetary crisis emerged today as Common Market sources reacted with dismay to a list of demands on their sixnation trade bloc by the United States.

title: Mitchell Backs Treatment, Not Punishment of Addicts
description: Attorney General John N. Mitchell said last night that he was in favor of treatment and rehabilitation of drug addicts rather than imprisonment, The Associated Press reported.

title: L.I.U. Routs Wagner, 8456
description: STATEN ISLAND, Dec. 9Long Island overwhelmed Wagner, 8456, at the losers' gym tonight. Walter Jones, a forward, and a 6foot7inch center, Harvey Smith, took control of the boards midway in the second half and started a fastbreak that Wagner could not stop.

title: PETER PALM TAKES PACE AT YONKERS
description: YONKERS, Dec. 9Everyone in harness racing knows nearly all there is to be known about Rum, Customer, the horse, and Billy Haughton, who drives the wouldbe millionaire. Comparatively few are fully aware of Palm Peter, a pacer, and fewer know of Edward Sabatini, who owns and at times drives him.

title: Doctors in Vietnam
description: The following letter, signed by fifty commissioned members of the Medical Corps, was read by Senator Mansfield on the Senate floor Wednesday. The Senator withheld the names.

title: DETROIT ROCK BAND OPENS AT GASLIGHT
description: Most of the music that comes out of Detroitfrom rock n roll, to jazzhas uniquely identifiable qualities. It's probably appropriate, therefore, that the typical Detroit rock band that opened at the Gaslight at the Go Go here Wednesday night should be named, that's right, Detroit.

title: Kennedy Attacked in Commons
description: LONDON, Dec. 9  An attack on Senator Kennedy's prig vate behavior aroused fury in the House of Commons today.

title: Suns Take 8th Straight
description: PHOENIX, Ariz., Dec. 9 (AP) The Phoenix Suns won their eighth straight game tonight by checking a late Atlanta rally and beating the Hawks, 135115.

title: Indians Closer to Dacca
description: NEW DELHI, Dec. 9 (Reuters)  Indian troops stood at the gates of Dacca tonight. AllIndia radio reported the capture of the river port of Narayanganj, only five miles south of the East Pakistani capital.

title: Ernest T. Krenkel Dead at 68; Early Russian Polar Explorer
description: MOSCOW, Dec. 9Ernest T. Krenkel, a Soviet polar explorer, died yesterday at the age of 68.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor: It has been suggested that by imposing tolls on the East River bridges the number of private cars entering the city would be reduced. It stands to reason that the greatest reduction would be in the number of cars carrying only one person and that there would be an increase in the average number of persons carried per car.

title: TAX FILING DELAY TO JUNE APPROVED
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 9A new system whereby anyone may take up until June 15 to file his income tax return, provided he pays most of the taxes due by the normal April 15 deadline, was announced today by the Commissioner of Internal Revenue, Johnnie M. Walters.

title: Executive Changes
description: Fleetwood Entelopnses, Inc., announced yesterday the election of Jack E. Dahl as president. Mr. Dahl, formerly executive vice president, succeeds Dale T. Skinner who moves up to vice chairman.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: Senate Votes Bill to Preserve Historic Connecticut Riverway
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 9 The Senate today approved a bill to create an 11mile Connecticut historic riverway, covering some 23,500 acres in the southern part of the state.

title: ARTHUR GREENSTEIN, ORTHODONTIST, DIES
description: Dr. Arthur V. Greenstein, an early practitioner in the field of orthodontics, died Wednesday at his home. He was 90 years old and lived at 1175 York Avenue.

title: OLD AND NEW BLEND IN JAHODA RECITAL
description: What has come to be a pleasant yearly latefall event is recital by Fritz Jahoda, pianist and professor at City College.

title: Pakistani Jets Bring the War And Death to Indian Village
description: ALAMGIR, India, Dec. 9The war with Pakistan, remote affair for most Indians, arrived unexpectedly in this dusty Punjabi village last night when two Pakistani Mirage jet fighters bombed it, leaving 15 dead and eight wounded.

title: Kennedy Center, Pinched, Ending Tours
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 9 The John F. Kennedy Center for the Performing Arts, which has attracted more than half a million sightseers and 400,000 ticketbuyers since it opened three months ago, is canceling all tours and halfprice tickets for the needy as of this Saturday.

title: Market Place: OilProfit Effect Of Libyan Move
Rosalie Schmidt, 31, Dies; A Painter and Illustrator
description: Rosalie Petrash Schmidt, a painter and illustrator, died Wednesday of Hodgkin's disease at Memorial SloanKettering Hospital. She was 31 years old and lived at 3704 Van Nostrand Place, Douglaston, Queens.

title: INDIA REPORTS FOE IN ROUT IN EAST AS ENCIRCLEMENT OF DACCA GAINS;
description: CALCUTTA, India, Dec. 9The commander of India's eastern forces said tonight that the retreat of the Pakistanis in East Pakistan had become a rout as Indian troops continued to push the foe into an evershrinking circle whose center is Dacca, the regional capital.

title: BOMBS RAZE AN ORPHANAGE THERE
description: DACCA, Pakistan, Dec. 9Indian planes, apparently thins to bomb the Dacca airport, hit an orphanage here today. Authorities said they feared as many as 300 of the children had been killed and were buried under tons of rubble.

title: Dancer's Image Derby Case Enters the Stretch in Court
description: FRANKFORT, Ky., Dec. 9 (AP)  The State of Kentucky filed the final brief today in its appeal of a circuit court ruling that held Dancer's. Image's owner, shotkld be given the firstplace purse for winning the 1968 Kentucky Derby.

title: WILLIAM WEINTRAUB OF AD AGENCY DIES
description: William H. Weintraub, who founded the advertising agency of that name in 1941 after serving as a copublisher of Esquire magazine from its foundation in 1933, died Wednesday night in Memorial Hospital. He was 74 years old and lived at 9 Delafield Street in Westhampton, L. I.

title: Latin Investing Is Off Since Mine Seizures
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 9The Overseas Private Investment Corporation, the new arm of government that insures and otherwise fosters private investment in the less developed countries, reported today sharp falling off in investments in much of Latin America since Chile seized United Statesowned copper mines and other foreign businesses.

title: Nastase Tops Kodes in Paris Tennis
description: PARIS, Dec. 9 (AP)  rile Nastase of Rumania defeated Jan Kodes of Czechoslovakia, 57, 62, 62, in the Masters tennis tournament today to join Stan Smith of Pasadena, Calif., at the top of the tourney standings.

title: LAYERING OF MOON LIKE EARTH'S SEEN
description: A team of seismologists, after analyzing tremors induced in the moon by space vehicle impacts, has concluded that the moon has been subdivided into layers by a process much like the one that produced layering within the earth.

title: The Proceedings In the U.N. Today
description: SECURITY COUNCIL

title: Pnompenh Troops Dig In, Refugees Flee
description: PNOMPENH, Cambodia, Dec. 9 (AP)Cambodian troops dug in around an important transmitter near the suburban villa of Premier Lon Nol today while United States and South Vietnamese aircraft tried to drive the enemy from positions west and south of Pnompenh.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor: Governor Rockefeller recently named the members of the new State Permanent Pension Commission, as a result of action by the Legislature.

title: Nixon Weighing Fate of Forest Hills Housing, Ziegler Concedes
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 9Reversing his comments of yesterday, Ronald L. Ziegler, President Nixon's press secretary, acknowledged today that the White House was still reviewing the construction of a large, lowincome housing project in the middleclass area of Forest Hills, Queens.

title: Text of Wage Statement
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 9Following is the text of a Pay Board statement on the approval of a contract granting wage increases to members of the Brotherhood of Railroad Signalmen:

title: FOREIGN AFFAIRS
description: BRUSSELSJoseph Luns, the enormous Dutchman who is NATO's new Secretary General, has a big enough sack of troubles to suit some somber kind of Santa Claus but, as he made clear at the Alliance's current ministerial meeting, the most urgent among all these is monetary.

title: Rabbi Doubles Profits of Textile Complex
description: A textile complex that cut the normal leadtime by onehalf to produce new styles has scooted in and around the major textileindustry concerns and doubled its sales and earnings in a year.

title: Synthetic Fuels Seen as Threat to Oil
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 9 (AP), The in oil company interest in synthetic fuel development may retard competition in the nation's vital energy industries, a special House subcommittee reported today.

title: McCulloch Drills in Alaska
description: LOS ANGELES, Dec. 9 (Reuters)The McCulloch Oil Corporation and Investors Diversified Services said they started drilling this week in two exploratory sites on Alaska's North Slope. One of the wells

title: 2 Rescued After Air Crash
description: JACKSONVILLE, Fla., Dec. 9 (AP)As dense fog swirled around them, a Jacksonville man and woman clung to the wreckage of their light plane for five hours last night before rescuers found them on the edge of a swamp, the police said. Noah M. Ennis, 44 years old, and Naomi Violet Gee, 40, suffered head and leg injuries, but their conditions were described as satisfactory. The plane apparently crashed seconds after taking off from Craig Field Airport here.

title: A Tangy Fruit Soup To Start Off a Meal
description: In the menus below, the dishes marked with an asterisk are followed by a recipe.

title: WEST BERLIN ACTS TO END IMPASSE
description: BERLIN, Dec. 9  Mayor Klaus Schtz of West Berlin made a fresh attempt today to break the deadlock over the disputed details of the Berlin agreement by suggesting to Premier Willi Stoph of East Germany that the continuing difficulties were caused by misunderstanding.

title: Belfast Gunman Kills a PartTime Soldier Before Children's Eyes
description: BELFAST, Northern Ireland, Dec. 9A gunman walked into the home of a quiet family man here last night and executed him in front of his five terrified children.

title: RATES TURN DOWN FOR TAXEXEMPTS
description: State and local government borrowing costs, which climbed steadily during November, have turned downward this week.

title: Vietnam's Korean Solution
description: The Administration's muchbruited concept of a possible Korean solution for Vietnam appears to be taking on a new meaning.

title: About Pro Football
description: Although there are 11 teams in contention for the seven remaining playoff berths, the clinching of three more divisional titles could be accomplished by Minnesota, Miami and Kansas City in winning this weekend. The games on television here will be Detroit at Minnesota, Channel 2, 1 P.M., and Miami at Baltimore, Channel 4, 4 P.M., tomorrow; St. Louis at Philadelphia, Channel 2 at 1 P.M., and Oakland at Kansas City, Channel 4 at P.M., on Sunday, and Washington at Los Angeles, Channel 7 at 9 P.M., on Monday. Here is a preview of all games with wonlosttied records in parentheses:

title: AARON SAPHIER
description: HARTSDALE, N. Y., Dec. 9 Aaron S. Saphier, president and chairman of United Aircraft Products Inc. of Dayton, Ohio, and for many years chairman and chief executive officer of General Bronze Corporation, died today in White Plainsl Hospital. He was 72 years old, and lived at 8 Wood Place here.

title: JOHN HART, 62, AIDE OF GOODRICH, DEAD
description: AKRON, Ohio, Dec. 9John N. Hart, an economist who became controller and then group vice president for finance of the B.F. Goodrich Company, died last night at the age of 62.

title: Three Top Officials Shifted in Prague In Wake of Election
description: PRAGUE, Dec. 9 (Reuters)President Ludvik Svoboda announced three changes in Czechoslovakia's official hierarchy today in the wake of general elections two weeks ago.

title: Two Views of Lindsay
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 8It is beginning to dawn on some observers of the national scene that there are two John V. Lindsays. And there is little resemblance between the two.

title: Mobil Discloses Gift for Transit Drive
description: The Mobil Oil Corporation disclosed yesterday that it had contributed $45,000 to the campaign for the $2.5billion transportation bond issue.

title: Man Is Shot to Death On Sidewalk in Village
description: A 54yearold man whom the police tentatively identified as a homicide suspect was fatally shot three times in the head on a Greenwich Village sidewalk last night.

title: 979026 Wins in Jersey
description: TRENTON, Dec. 9 (UPI) The winning number chosen in the weekly New Jersey State Lottery here today was 979026.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: What are the right formulas for wage and price stabilization? At the heart of the answer is the requirement of maintaining a freeflowing competitive economy.

title: Laotian Positions Harassed
description: VIENTIANE, Laos, Dec. 9 (Agence France  Presse)  All Laotian positions on the Soloven Plateau have been bombarded; harassed and immobilized by North Vietnamese forces, a Government spokesman said today.

title: AILEY'S DANCERS PURSUE AN IDIOM
description: The City Center of Music and Drama invited members of the State Legislature, Congress and the city administration to Wednesday night's performance of the Alvin Ailey American Dance Theater and some of them actually came.

title: Film: Videotape Program at Whitney
description: The second of the Whitney Museum's videotape programs is much like the first, but with the difference, for me, that the medium begins to seem more familiar and freer, less a collection of special effects and more a continuity of gestures and responses. Thus, I found the particolored facial mugging in this week's segment from Nam June Paik's Video Cemmune a considerably more relaxed and pleasant experience than last week's. And the new work by Woody and Steina Vasulka, a gorgeous flux of macrocosmic and microcosmic images called Elements, suggested a compacted power that may have been missing or that I may simply have missed in a previous tape of the Vasulkas.

title: 2 Bases Shelled Near DMZ
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, Dec. 9 (AP)Just south of the demilitarized zone enemy gunners today shelled two South Vietnamese outposts. It was the first such attack in several weeks. The Saigon command said that 50 rocket and mortar rounds hit the two bases, but caused no casualties.

title: Front Page 1  No Title
description: PLAY ?? TENNIS on ?? Street. ??

title: OSCAR F. SHEPARD
description: LANCASTER, Mass., Dec. 9 (AP)Oscar F. Shepard, formerly dean of the Milton Academy and a former president of the Punahau School in Honolulu, died yesterday. He was 74 years old and made his home here.

title: FOUR EGYPTIANS GIVEN LIFE TERMS
description: CAIRO, Dec. 9  Death seri, terices were pronounced today against 4 of 91 former Egyptian Officials accusedof having conspired in May to seize power, but President Anwar elSadat reduced the death sentences to life imprisonment at hard labor.

title: CHAIRMAN CHOSEN BY REPUBLIC CORP.
description: The Republic Corporation announced yesterday in Los Angeles the election of Roderick M. Hills as chairman.

title: Penn Routs Manhattan; Oral Roberts Triumphs
description: Penn has a new coach and three new faces were in its starting lineup last night, but the Quakers' basketball program has lost none of its strength.

title: Mayor Names City Aide
description: Mayor Lindsay yesterday announced the appointment of Marvin Schick as his administrative assistant replacing Sid Davidoff, who resigned effective Monday to join former Deputy Mayor Richard R. Aurelio in assessing the Mayor's Presidential prospects. Mr. Schick, who had been assistant for intergroup relations, will not handle patronage for the Mayor, as Mr. Davidoff did, a spokesman said.

title: KimberlyClark Sets Sale
description: The KimberlyClark Corporation announced yesterday that it had agreed to sell a pulp and paper mill in Anderson, Calif., to the SimpsonLee Paper Company. The terms were not disclosed. The mill has a daily capacity of 150 tons of bleached sulphate pulp and 180 tons of printed coating papers. It is one of four mills that KimberlyClark is seeking to sell under a disposal program announced earlier this year.

title: ACCOUNTING BOARD DROPS RULES FIGHT
description: The Accounting Principles Board abandoned yesterday, under strong protest, its attempt to tighten the rules governing corporate reporting of the 7 per cent job development tax credit in the pending tax bill.

title: Man in the News
description: BRUSSELS, Dec. 9Of course, I am as wax in the ministers' hands, Dr. Joseph M. A. H. Luns, Secretary General of the North Atlantic Treaty Organization, said the other day. But wax when it is cold is tough, yes.

title: RAIL TRAFFIC OFF; TRUCK TONNAGE UP
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 9 Freight traffic on United States railroads last week was below the yearearlier volume. Intercity truck tonnage last week increased.

title: Breathitt Declines to Run
description: FRANKFORT, Ky., Dec. 9 (AP)Former Gov. Edward T. Breathitt withdrew today from contention for the United States Senate, declaring he believed the Democratic party in Kentucky needs a breathing spell.

title: Party to Smuggling Of Drugs in Citroen Given 18Year Term
description: A 28yearold narcotics defendant was sentenced in Federal Court here yesterday to 18 years in prison and fined $40,000 on charges that he had received 206 pounds of pure heroin smuggled into this country in a French automobile.

title: RANGERS TRIUMPH OVER FLYERS, 50, BEHIND VILLEMURE
description: PHILADELPHIA, Dec. 9In a game marked by 21 penalties totaling 85 minutes, the New York Rangers skated to a 50 victory over the Philadelphia Flyers tonight in the Spectrum.

title: PRESIDENT VETOES CHILD CARE PLAN AS IRRESPONSIBLE
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 9In a stinging message, President Nixon vetoed today a Congressionally initiated bill to establish a national system of comprehensive child development and day care.

title: HAKER OF NORWAY IS SLALOM VICTOR
description: VAL D'ISERE, France, Dec. 9 (UPI)Erik Haker, a 19yearold Norwegian, won the first World Cup men's giant slalom ski race today.

title: Factory Workers' Purchasing Power Here Found Stable in October
description: The buying power of New York area factory workers remained unchanged in October, as the 0.2 per cent rise in consumer prices here was balanced by a 37centanhour increase in their average weekly earnings, the Bureau of Labor Statistics reported yesterday.

title: F.T.C SHIFTS RULE ON RATING OF GAS
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 9The Federal Trade Commission issued a revised regulation today to require the posting of octane ratings on gasoline pumps, starting next March 15.

title: Car Sought in Slaying of 5 in Jersey Is Found at Kennedy Airport
description: WESTFIELD, N.J., Dec. 9 The 1963 blue Chevrolet sedan in which John E. List, the 46yearold accountant being sought in the murder here of his wife, mother and three children, was believed to have disappeared last month was found late today in a parking lot at Kennedy International Airport.

title: Congress Expected to Let Foreigners Buy 5 Ships
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 9 Under heavy pressure from the maritime industry, Congress is set to approve legislation this year that would permit five American passenger ships to be sold to foreign interests.

title: Nixon Scored by State Conservatives
description: In an effort to move President Nixon to the right, the state Conservative party disclosed yesterday that it was suspending its support of the Republican President, who was endorsed by the Conservatives in the 1968 Presidential election.

title: Cut in Saccharine Prices
description: The SherwinWilliams Company announced yesterday that it will reduce the price lof certain grades of saccharine by 20 cents a pound in powdered and granular form beginning Monday.

title: Books of The Times
description: WINTER BLOOD. By John Roc. 511 pages. Trident. $7.95.

title: Pistons Top Bulls, 110107
description: DETROIT, Dec. 9 (AP)The Detroit Pistons rallied from deficits of 21 points in the second quarter and 10 with 4:28 left in the game to overtake the Chicago Bulls and post a 110107 victory in a National Basketball Association game tonight.

title: HARRY FELDMAN, LED DELIVERERS
description: Harry Feldman, the second president of the Newspaper and Mail Deliverers Union and later for many years manage, of the Flushing News Company, died yesterday at his home, 67,00 192d Street, Fresh Meadows, Queens. He was 83 years old.

title: Extortion Laid to 3 In Strike at Mobil
description: Three reputed members of organized crime whom the Mobil Oil Corporation hired to break a truck drivers' strike last spring were charged yesterday with extorting money from the company.

title: Bank to Cut I.O.S. Ties; Strickler Leaves Board
description: GENEVA, Dec. 9The Overseas Development Bank announced today that all interlocking managerial or board relationships between it and Investors Overseas Services, Ltd., the mutual fund group, would be terminated at the end of this month.

title: ALLENDE ORDERS END OF EMERGENCY RULE
description: SANTIAGO, Chile, Dec. 9President Salvador Allende Gossens today decreed the end of a weeklong state of emergency under which the army controlled public order in this capital.

title: Film of Vonnegut's 'Wanda June' Arrives
description: In bringing Kurt Vonnegut Jr.'s "Happy Birthday, Wanda June" to the screen, Mark Robson, the director who earlier gave us film versions of "Peyton Place" and "Valley of The Dolls," was apparently attempting to make a movie, something with a lunatic heart and soul it could call its own.It's easy enough to understand what attracted Robson to the Vonnegut comedy, a modern odyssey's end about a Papa Hemingway type, a big game hunter, who comes home, after being lost eight years in the Amazon jungles, to find that he himself has become obsolete, and that his third wife, a former car-hop, has been college-educated into a woman of sense and sensibility. Its lines are funny, its outrage is genuine and its faith in the efficacy of adult re-eduction is most assuring.Instead of a movie, however, Robson has made a highly (and wrongly) mannered cinematic representation of the play. To see it is to observe what amounts to a religious service, a ritualistic exercise that tries, unsuccessfully, to evoke the spirit of a comedy that has been allowed to die in the limbo separating stage and screen.If the manner of the film is reverent (Vonnegut has not, as far as I can tell, altered his play to any major extent), the style is of a high artificiality that is completely beyond the range of the director and of at least half his cast, especially of Rod Steiger.As Ulysses (renamed Harold Ryan), Steiger achieves a new peak in acting that is humorlessly affected. Vonnegut is quoted somewhere as sayingrather apologeticallythat he doesn't write villains, and I assume that for all of Harold Ryan's nitwitted ideas about masculinity, about honor and killing and guns, and about the low estate of women, we are meant to sympathize with this mastadon at the moment of his extinction.Steiger's broad performance effectively massacres not only sympathy, but also the comedy that can still be fitfully seen behind the frantic pacing. The comedy is there, though almost lost, in the lines ("Educating a woman is like pouring honey over a fine Swiss watch  everything stops"), in the crazy set (an apartment that has a lion's roar as a doorbell), in the cuts to heaven (where everyone plays shuffleboard, including Pontius Pilate, and even in a few performances  of Susannah York, as Steiger's liberated Penelope, and William Hickey, as his private helicopter pilot, whose single claim to fame is that he dropped the atom bomb on Nagasaki during World War II.For the most part, however, Robson has permitted (or perhaps encouraged) his actors to behave in the sort of stylized manner that calls more attention to posture and to the reading of the lines than to what the postures and the lines represent. It all becomes very quickly fake and unfunny, like the boy who plays Steiger's son. My impression is that he's an old ham actor, somehow shrunk to child size without actually withering up, as might normally be expected.There is also a certain problem with Vonnegut's original text. His gags and jokes are meaner, funnier and more shocking than the humane impulses he would preserve, impulses that all of us good, decent, gentle, antiwar folk take for granted. That, I suppose, is as much our problem as it is Vonnegut's. So it goes."Happy Birthday, Wanda June" opened yesterday at the Columbia II.

title: Miss Durr Upset
description: AUCKLAND, New Zealand, Dec. 9 (AP)  Francoise Durr of France had an emotional clash with an umpire, Sue Burcher, today in the Benson and Hedges women's singles tennis quarterfinals.

title: HAWKS TOP SABRES ON 2 MIKITA GOALS
description: BUFFALO, Dec. 9 (UPI) Stan Mikita scored two secondperiod goals tonight to give Chicago a 31 victory over the Buffalo Sabres and move the Black Hawks into a firstplace tie with Minnesota in the National Hockey League's West Division.

title: Times Writer Wins Award For Article on Quake Peril
description: Sandra Blakeslee, a writer for The New York Times based on the West Coast, has been named winner of the 1971 American Association for the Advancement of ScienceWestinghouse Science Writing Award for newspapers with daily circulations of more than 100.000.

title: Mine Union Suit Postponed
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 9 (AP)  Trial of the Government's suit to overturn the 1969 election of the United Mine Workers president, W. A. Boyle, was continued today until Jan. 4 because of uncertainty about the outcome of a related matter that the Supreme Court has under consideration.

title: ORDER IS SOUGHT IN ABORTION SUIT
description: A Fordham University law professor who seeks to overturn the state's liberalized law allowing abortions urged a State Supreme Court Justice yesterday to halt all abortions here until a suit he has filed is settled.

title: Wage Flexibility and Firmness
description: Like the reed beside the waters, goes the old labor song, we will not be moved. The Administrationand the Pay Board and Price Commissionappear to be taking this refrain as their own theme song for Phase Two.

title: 3 to Be Named to State Unit on City
description: The State Study Commission) charged by the Legislature with investigating New York City's government is expected to name three additional task force chairmen next week.

title: EPISCOPAL GROUP ASSAILS THE I.R.S.
description: A group of Episcopal lawyers and clergymen here has accused the Internal Revenue Service of making unwarranted threats of the withdrawal of tax exemption against religious organizations involved in social and political issues.

title: Chhamb Battle Continues
description: JAMMU, Kashmir, Dec. 9 (Reuters)  Indian military sources said here today that fighting continued for the fourth day in the embattled Chhamb sector of Kashmir with Indian forces still holding the western side of the Tawi River despite heavy Pakistani pressure.

title: St. Francis Wins, 9290
description: St. Francis College defeated Adelphi, 9290, in two overtime periods last night on the winners' court in Brooklyn.

title: Excerpts From Nixon's Veto Message
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 9Following are excerpts from the text of President Nixon's veto message to the Senate on the Office of Economic Opportunity bill:

title: MEASLES OUTBREAKS STRIKE 3 U.S. AREAS
description: ATLANTA, Dec. 9 (UPI) The National Center for Disease Control reported measles outbreaks in three widely separated communities today and warned that the situation could worsen, especially in areas where few children have been vaccinated.

title: Canada's Tax Bill, With Aid To Her Industry, Passes Test
description: OTTAWA, Dec. 9The Governent's taxreform bill, aimed in part at giving Canadian industry advantages over foreignowned businesses operating in Canada, survived a crucial inprinciple vote in the House of Commons last, night.

title: For Divorced Woman in Suburbs, New Hope for a Better Life
description: It is a classic tale of middleclass suburban divorce: The Nelsons, in their tate 30's, were married 12: years ago, separated, two years ago, and have cently been divorced.

title: Books of The Times
description: HEARTS. Of Surgeons and Transplants, Miracles and Disasters Alone the Cardiac Frontier. By Thomas Thompson. 304 pages. McCall. $7.95.

title: Scientist Takes Helm Of Geological Survey
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 9 Dr. Vincent E. McKelvey was sworn in yesterday as director of the United States Geological Survey.

title: MORE IRON URGED IN BREAD BY F.D.A.
description: WASHINGTON Dec. 9 (UPI)  The Food and Drug Administration has proposed that American bakers be required to double the iron content of their white bread and remove all vitamin D. A spokesman for the American Baker's Association said that the industry would probably support the changes.

title: HEADGEAR CHANGE INJURIOUS TO FILES
description: There was a slightly nasal quality this week in the Arkansas accent of Jim Files, the New York Giants' secondyear linebacker, but apparently it has taught him never to change helmets in midseason.

title: RULES WILL CHANGE ON CAPITAL ABROAD
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 9The Office of Foreign Direct Investment announced today changes in its regulations designed to reduce the huge, normal yearend repatriation of funds from abroad by companies covered by the program. It limits dollar outflows for investments.

title: No Change on Queens Project, Lindsay Vows at Brooklyn Site
description: Mayor Lindsay said yesterday that, there would be no compromise on the controversial low  income housing project just started in Forest Hills, Queens.

title: Front Page 2  No Title
description: Golda Meir:Mass protest against Sherut Leumi pg. 4advt.

title: For the West Pakistanis, War Is Closer to Home
description: RAWALPINDI, Pakistan, Dec. 7Sirens howl day and night over most of West Pakistan and people never know whether there will really be a raid.

title: Neumann Wins Decision
description: NORTH BERGEN, N. J., Dec. 9Randy Neumann of Cliffside Park won a 12round heavyweight decision from Chuck Wepner of Bayonne before a crowd of 2,165 at the Embassy Hall tonight.

title: 60 Civilians Are Reported Dead In Indian Air Attack on Karachi
description: KARACHI, Pakistan, Dec. 3 (Reuters)More than 60 civilians were reported killed here early today as Indian planes bombed this commercial capital of West Pakistan.

title: Many Persico Jurors Didn't Know of Press Ban
description: Many of the jurors in the extortion trial of Carmine J. Persico did not know until it ended that State Supreme Court Justice George Postel had barred the press and public from the proceedingseven though, according to the jury foreman, Justice Posted gave them a one or twosentence explanation the day after he ordered the courtroom closed.

title: TV: Serious Issues in a Recreated Documentary
description: The series is called Appointment With Destiny. Produced by David L. Wolper Productions, it consists of five onehour programs, deScribed as recreating a particular moment in history and reenacted at the actual site of the event.

title: OTC AND AMEX ON AN EVEN KEEL
description: Most prices on the American Stock Exchange and the overthecounter market ended on the fence yesterday in slower trading.

title: Soviet Aide, in U.S., Indicates Likelihood of Big Farm Deals
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 9The Soviet Minister of Agriculture today held out the prospect of large Soviet purchases of feed grain, agricultural machinery and technology from the United States.

title: Lehman Papers Are Getting A5Room Home at Columbia
description: The Herbert H. Lehman papers, a permanently endowed collection of the public and private, papers and memorabilia of the former Governor and United States Senator, will be dedicated at Columbia University this afternoon.

title: Notes on People
description: This year's winner of the Elijah Parish Lovejoy Award, which recognizes a newspaperman of integrity, craftsmanship, character, intelligence and courage, is Erwin D. Canham, editor in chief of The Christian Science Monitor. As the winner, Mr. Canham will address a convocation March 3 at Colby College, which administers the award in memory of Mr. Lovejoy, an 1826 graduate who was killed in Alton, Ill., in 1837 while defending his press against a mob that opposed his editorial stand against slavery.

title: Advertising:
description: The PepsiCola Company has just filled the new post of senior vice president in charge of the total marketing effort.

title: COURT BACKS OTB ON MONTICELLO TV
description: Yonkers Riceway lost its court fight yesterday to bar the New York City Offtrack Betting Corporation from televising races at Monticello Raceway.

title: PERINI CORP. CHECKS STOLEN AND FORGED
description: The Perini Corporation, an international construction and real estate company, confirmed yesterday a $1,129,232 theft and forgery of company checks. The company said it has fidelity and forgery insurance totaling $1million with $2,500 deductible. A spokesman for Perini said the Federal Bureau of Investigation was investigating.

title: The Innocent Victims . . .
description: It is a truism of history that innocent civilians suffer when nations resort to war. To the long list of victims of the Pakistani Government's military repression in East Bengal have now been added the helpless children in a Dacca orphanage that is reported to have been hit squarely by an Indian bomb.

title: Wood, Field and Stream
description: While on a sharkfishing trip in August of 1969 about M. Miles off No Mans Land Island off southern New England, I spent a good deal of my day retching Into the heaving sea.

title: Jury Deliberates 3d Time On Newton Role in Killing
description: OAKLAND, Calif., Dec. 9 (UPI)For the third time a jury is deliberating whether Huey P. Newton, the Black Panther leader, is guilty of killing an Oakland policeman in a scuffle in 1967.

title: Panel Urges a National Drive on Heart Disease as Only Hope of Cutting Toll
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 9  A Governmentsponsored panel, recommended today a largescale national attack on heart disease as the only hope of stemming the present epidemic scope of its toll.

title: 2 Airmen Cleared of Distributing Peace Leaflets at Idaho Base
description: MOUNTAIN HOME AIR FORCE BASE, Idaho, Dec. 9A few of the spectators at a special courtmartial exploded with joy, shouting Wow and pummeling the back of a young airman today as he was cleared of charges of illegally distributing peace literature at this fighter plane base in southwestern Idaho.

title: Pay Board Approves Rife Of 46% Over 42 Months
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 9The Pay Board approved today a contract under which the railroad signalmen would receive wage increases far exceeding its general standard of 5.5 per cent annually.

title: First Postage Takes Sprint by Four Lengths
description: First Postage stamped herself the best of the slim field that competed in the feature race at Aqueduct yesterday, with Bobby Woodhouse riding, the Tartan Stable's filly easily beat four rivals in the sixfurlong sprint for older fillies and mares.

title: Kennedy Bids Nixon Offer to Mediate in Ulster
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 9Senator Edward M. Kennedy urged President Nixon today to offer to mediate the conflict in Northern Ireland when he meets with Prime Minister Heath of Britain this month. The White House, declining comment on the suggestion, refused to say whether the subject of violence in Ulster would be on the agenda when the President and Prime Minister confer Dec. 20 and 21 in Bermuda.

title: U. S. Biased, Moscow says
description: MOSCOW, Dec. 9The Soviet Union asserted today that recent talks between the Israeli Premier Golda Meir, and the Nixon Administration, with the reported result of new American arms supplies for Israel, had undermined Washington's claims of pursuing a balanced policy in the Middle East.

title: Plea for Poor Nations
description: GENEVA, Dec. 9  A highranking United Nations official urged today that the developing countries be given a fair share of the windfall that the monetary reserves of the rich nations would receive from a rise in the price of gold.

title: CONTRACT AWARDS
description: Litton Industries, Inc., said yesterday that it had awarded to the BirdJohnson Company, of Walpole, Mass., a multiyear subcontract with a potential value of about $21.5million to provide twin controllable pitch propellers for 30 U.S. Navy Spruanceclass destroyers.

title: Army Loses, 6766
description: WEST POINT, N. Y., Dec. 9Merrimack College of Massachusetts, trailing by 10 points with little more than four minutes remaining, rallied to defeat Army today in basketball 6766. Army was held scoreless in the last four minutes 21 seconds.

title: Tributes Are Led by Thant and Nixon
description: UNITED NATIONS, N.Y., Dec. 9Shaken by the loss of an incomparable friend and colleague, United Nations Secretary General U Thant described Dr. Ralph J. Bunche today as an international institution in his own right, transcending both nationality and race in a way that is achieved by very few.

title: Rostropovich Cello Speaks Eloquently
description: The applause and cheers that greeted the entrance of Mstislav Rostropovich on Wednesday night in Philharmonic Hall was clearly as much for the man as for the musician. It was the Soviet cellist's first appearance in the United States following his recent difficulties with his Government in connection with the Aleksandr Solzhen itsyn affair.

title: State's Longest Racing Season To Start March 1 at Aqueduct
description: The thoroughbred racing season in this state next year will be the longest in local history, embracing 249 racing days.

title: LINDSAY IMPOSES CONTRACT CURBS ON CONSTRUCTION
description: Mayor Lindsay imposed what, he termed a partial moratorium on the awarding of new construction contracts yester day as the City Planning Commission proposed a $2.3billion capital budget for 197273.

title: Merger News
description: The Standard Oil Company (Indiana) announced yesterday it intends to make a voluntaryexchange offer to minority shareholders of its 68 per centowned subsidiary, the Midwest Oil Corporation.

title: Moslem World League Asks Holy War Against India
description: MECCA, Saudi Arabia, Dec. 9 (Agence FrancePresse)The Moslem World League, an international Islamic religious organization with headquarters here, appealed to all Moslems and Moslem organizations today for a holy war against India.

title: Chain Consolidated
description: The Big Apple chain of superMarkets, acquired by Foodarama Supermarkets, Inc., in May, 1970, and operated as separate division, has been consolidated into the Foodarama corporate organization. Foodarama has stores in New Jersey, Pennsylvania, Connecticut and New York. Big Apple operates in the New York City area.

title: POPE REAFFIRMS CELIBACY POLICY
description: ROME, Dec. 9The Vatican published a pronouncement by Pope Paul VI today strongly restating the Roman Catholic Church's prohibition against married priests in its dominant Western branch, the Latin Rite.

title: EMMY GROUP HERE MAKES 15 AWARDS
description: The New York Chapter of the National Academy of Television Arts and Sciences presented on Channel 13 last night local Emmy Awards to eight programs and seven individuals for excellence in the arts and sciences of television. The awards covered programs produced and shown locally between Sept. 1, 1970, and Aug. 31, 1971.

title: U.S. BUSINESS UNIT IN INDIA BACKS HER
description: NEW DELHI, Dec. 9  The American business community in India, in an unusual step, dissociated itself today with the Nixon Administration on the crisis in the subcontinent and pledged its support to the Indian Government.

title: 2 SENTENCED HERE FOR EVADING TAXES
description: Marvin R. Cole and Arthur A. Fisher, two former advertising executives, were sentenced in Federal Court here yesterday on charges of evading $30,000 in personal and corporate income taxes.

title: Dowdy Trial Delayed
description: BALTIMORE, Dec. 9 (AP)Continuation of the bribery conspiracy trial of Representative John Dowdy was delayed today until Monday by Judge Roszel C. Thomsen, who said that defense witnesses were unable to appear. The Texas legislator is accused of conspiring to accept a $25,000 bribe from a Maryland home improvement concern, Monarch Construction Corporation.

title: Rights Units Say Crime Agency Subsidizes Race and Sex Bias
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 9 (AP) A broad front of civil rights organizations charged the Nixon Administration's anticrime effort today with subsidizing race and sex discrimination with millions of Federal dollars.

title: C.C.N.Y. DEFEATS LEHMAN, 88 TO 69
description: Off to its best start since 1953, City College of New York defeated Lehman College, 88.69, last night at City's Wingate Gym.

title: U.S. WaterPollution Bill Goal Called Impossible by Governor
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 9Governor Rockefeller said today that the goal of a Senatepassed bill to stop the discharge of all pollution into the nation's waterways by 1985 would be totally impossible to achieve.

title: Attica Panel Talking to 3,000 on Revolt
description: The chairman of the state's Special Commission on Attica said yesterday that his staff had begun interviewing 3,000 people on a crash basis about the uprising at the Attica Correctional Facility in September.

title: CHAIRMAN CHOSEN BY REPUBLIC CORP.
description: The Republic Corporation announced yesterday in Los Angeles the election of Roderick M. Hills as chairman.

title: Drillings Find Pacific Floor Reversed Its Drift Direction
description: Because prolific life along the Equator continuously inscribes a chalk line on the moving Pacific floor it has been possible, by deep drilling, to determine the patterns of sea floor movement over the last 135 million years.

title: EQUITY FINANCING
description: Shareholders in SEDCO, Inc., a Dallasbased contract oil and gas drilling concern, disposed yesterday of 590,410 shares of stock marketed by a Goldman, Sachs underwriting group at a price of 39.

title: Washington and Ottawa
description: OTTAWA, Dec. 9The power of the United States is an awesome thing, as everybody knows, but you never really understand how much thump it packs until you see it operating in another capital.

title: Libyan Premier Is Likened To Nasser After Seizure
description: BEIRUT, Lebanon, Dec. 9Libya's Premier, Col. Muammar elQaddafi, has been hailed as another Nasser for nationalizing British oil interests in his country and for withdrawing Libyan funds from British banks.

title: COLUMBIA AGREES TO EQUIP GAY AREA
description: Two Columbia University students staged a sixhour sitin, yesterday at the office of Dr. Carl F. Hovde, dean of Columbia College, and obtained an agreement to provide university furniture for a gay lounge in Furnald Hall, an undergraduate dormitory.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: BigPower Conflict Brings U.N. Impasse
description: UNITED NATIONS, N. Y., Dec. 9As the war continues on the Indian subcontinent, Secretariat officials and delegates here are bitterly asking the question, Why is the United Nations paralyzed?

title: Caterpillar to Expand
description: PEORIA, Ill., Dec. 9 (UPI)The Caterpillar Tractor Company said today it would build an engine and engineparts building at Mossville and an addition to its plant at Gosselies, Belgium. The Mossville plant will cover 1.25 million square feet and will be completed in 1974, a spokesman said. The addition in Belgium will be 880,000 square feet.

title: WHEAT FUTURES ADVANCE SHARPLY
description: Corn and wheat futures prices advanced sharply yesterday on the Chicago Board of Trade following the approval late Wednesday night by the House of Representatives of the strategic grain reserve bill.

title: MRS. WILLIAM LESLIE
description: Mrs. Charlotte Schaffold Leslie, the wife of William H. Leslie, founder and president of Victor Norman & Partners, Inc., a New York advertising agency, died of cancer in Doctors Hospital yesterday. She was 37 years old and lived at 45 East End Avenue.

title: Neutral Zone in Dacca
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 9The State Department said today that a neutral zone had been established in Dacca to protect nearly 500 foreigners, including some 70 Americans, awaiting evacuation by air from the besieged city.

title: News of Skiing
description: Despite the forecast for mild weather today and tomorrow, Ken Quackenbush, the experienced, manager at Mad River Glen in Waitsfield, Vt., yesterday was surprisingly optimistic about this weekend's prospects for reasonably good skiing at his area.

title: PAKISTAN ACCEPTS TRUCE CALL OF U.N.
description: UNITED NATIONS, N. Y., Dec. 9Pakistan informed the United Nations today that she had decided to accept the General Assembly's, call for ceasefire on the Indian subcontinent and for a withdrawal of hostile troops to their own soil.

title: ECONOMISTS PREDICT A 9% GAIN FOR 1972
description: CHICAGO, Dec. 9 (AP)The nation's economy will show a 9 per cent gain next year, but not necessarily because of President Nixon's new economic policies, three business specialists predicted today.

title: Imperiale and Black Leader in Accord
description: NEWARK, Dec. 9A black Democratic Assembly leader and the white militant Assemblymanelect whose help he publicly rejected after last month's elections today shared the dais and some views of this city's problems at a Chamber of Commerce luncheon.

title: ColgatePalmolive Increases Dividend By Guideline Limit
description: The ColgatePalmolive Company raised its quarterly dividend yesterday, while directors of Swank, Inc., declared a yearend extra dividend of 30 cents a share, the same level as year ago.

title: STOCKS OFF A BIT AS TRADING LAGS
description: Stock prices eased slightly yesterday in slower trading. Some glamour issues moved to new highs, but a generally cautious tone ruled the marketplace.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor: I agree with your editorial on Nov. 20 on Phase Two containing far too much elastic. I do want to disagree with your view that industry as well as labor has driven a breach into an equitable system of wageprice restraints.

title: Miss Goolagong Advances
description: BRISBANE, Australia, Dec, 9 (AP)  Evonne Goolagong of Australia got a tough struggle from Mona Schallau of the United States today in the third round of the Queensland grass court tennis championships.

title: PAKISTAN ASSERTS DEFENSE HARDENS
description: RAWALPINDI, Pakistan, Dec. 9Spokesmen reported tonight that Pakistani troops were hardening their lines in East Pakistan despite increasing enemy pressure.

title: Rabbi for Smaller Project
description: A rabbi from the Forest Hills section of Queens who has been one of the strongest supporters of the controversial lowincothe housing project for this middleclass area suggested yesterday that the site of the project be reduced.

title: Chief Executive Officer Elected by B'nai B'rith
description: The election of Rabbi Benjamin M. Kahn as executive vice president of the 500,000member B'nai B'rith was announced yesterday.

title: EGYPT IS BACKED IN U.N. RESOLUTION
description: UNITED NATIONS, N.Y., Dec. 9  A resolution calling on Israel to commit herself to Withdraw from all occupied Arab territory was submitted to the General Assembly today by a group of 16 African and Asian and two European countries.

title: Talks at Paris Fail For 1st Time to Set New Meeting Date
description: PARIS, Dec. 9The Vietnam peace talks ended their 138th session today, and for the first time there was no agreement on when to meet again.

title: ExColleague Says Rehnquist Opposed Segregation
description: LONDON, Dec. 9A former colleague of William H. Rehnquist said tonight that in 1952 Mr. Rehnquist was personally opposed to the legal doctrine of racial segregation.

title: Marine General Backed
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 9 (AP) The Senate Armed Services. Committee approved today the nomination of Lieut. Gen. Robert E. Cushman as the next commandant of the Marine Corps.

title: Pakistan Says She Is Checking Reports of Soviet Fliers in India
description: RAWALPINDI, Pakistan, Dec. 9 A high Government spokesman sharply condemned the Soviet Union tonight for giving political and material assistance to India in the war against Pakistan.

title: ITT Continental Is Ending Conversion Rights Dec. 15
description: The ITT Continental Baking Company issued a notice to holders of its 4 per cent convertible debentures of 1983 that under terms of the indenture, conversion rights will end on bec. 15.

title: Upstate Man Killed in War
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 9 (UPI)  The Defense Department announced today the names of two men, both of the Army, killed in action in southeast Asia. One of them was First Lieut. Richard A. Green of Fultonville, N.Y.

title: Army Drops Charges Against General Accused of Killing 6 South Vietnamese Civilians
description: The Army announced yesterday that it had dismissed murder and assault charges against Brig. Gen. John W. Donaldson, who, as an infantry brigade commander, was accused of killing six South Vietnamese civilians.

title: Lucien Brownstone, 69, Dies; Retailer and Philanthropist
description: Lucien Brownstone, a retailer who became, a philanthropist in his later years, died yesterday at his home, 710 Park Avenue. He was 69 years old.

title: Goldwater Identifies Kissinger as Sources
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 10Senator Barry Goldwater ignored White House rules today and revealed that Henry A. Kissinger, President Nixon's national security adviser, was the White House officials who defended the Administration's policy toward India and Pakistan on Tuesday.

title: Frost's Producers Assure Viewers Show Will Go On
description: Westinghouse Broadcasting Company said yesterday that any replacement of The David Frost Show with Mery Griffin on Metromedia stations in New York, Washington and Los Angeles would not affect the show in other areas.

title: No Review on Iceland Now
description: BRUSSELS, Dec, 10 (AP)Einar Agustsson, Iceland's Foreign Minister, told the ministerial council of the North Atlantic Treaty Organization today that he is not now asking for a review of the agreement setting up the United States base at Keflaviks He belongs to a Government, that took power six months ago, saying the United States must remove its forces from Iceland.

title: College Sues Donaldson On Money Management
description: The trustees of Hanover College, a small liberal arts college in Hanover, Ind., are suing Donaldson, Lufkin Sc Jenrette, Inc., a New York brokerage and moneymanagement firm, for the alleged mishandling of its endowment fund.

title: PEKING ATTEMPTING TO REASSURE PUBLIC
description: HONG KONG. Dec. 10The leadership in Peking has counseled party workers and the Chinese people not to get unduly upset over the factional split In the ruling hierarchy disclosed by the recent eclipse of Defense Minister Lin Piaci and a number of other top military men.

title: EMORY REMINGTON, TROMBONE TEACHER
description: ROCHESTER, Dec. 10Emory Remington, a master trombone teacher who over the last 50 years had trained 25 to 50 per cent of the trombonists in America's symphony orchestras, died tonight of a heart attack. His age was 79. He lived most of his life in Rochester.

title: New Democratic Coalition Lists State Targets
description: The New Democratic Coalition, central organization of the Reform Movement, made public yesterday a special target list of 11 State Senators and 16 Assemblymen, all Republicans, whose defeat it would seek in next year's election.

title: Ruffels Ousts Stolle
description: AUCKLAND, New Zealand, Dec. 10 (AP)  Ray Ruffels of Australia and Onny Parun of New Zealand gained the men's singles semifinals of the Benson and Hedges open tournament today.

title: Theater: A Love Story
description: Want to see a genuine love story about real people, beautifully played and projected? And free? (The Equity Library Theater requests but doesn't demand contributions.)

title: Archer Leads Bahamas Golf by 2 Shots
description: FREEPORT, Bahamas, Dec. 10 (UPI)George Archer, playing with a sore arm picked up in his first appearance on a tennis court, shot a 67 today and took a twostroke lead after 36 holes of the $130,000 Bahamas national open golf tournament.

title: S. E.C. Weighs Guide on Broker Advice
description: William J. Casey, chairman of the Securities and Exchange Commission, indicated yesterday that the S.E.C. was attempting to establish broad new guidelines covering how brokers issue changed research recommendations to their customers.

title: KODES TOPS SMITH IN PARIS NET PLAY
description: PARIS, Dec. 10 When the lights went on again tonight, Stan Smith was upset by. Jan Kodes of Czechoslovakia, 6.4, 3.6, 6.4, and dropped from the lead in the $50,000 Pepsi. Masters tennis tournament.

title: Blazers Edge Braves, 101100
description: BUFFALO, N.Y., Dec. 10 (UPI)Geoff Petrie hit a 14foot jump shot with 21 seconds left in overtime tonight as the Portland Trail Blazers capped a brilliant rally with a 101100 victory over the Buffalo Braves.

title: Haynsworth Backs Tight Judicial Code
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 10Judge Clement F. Haynsworth Jr., who failed to win confirmation to the Supreme Court after his judicial ethics were questioned, has become an advocate of more rigid ethical rules to govern judges conduct.

title: Judge Voids 2 Sections of Florida Abortion Law
description: GAINESVILLE, Fla., Dec. 10 Judge Benjamin M. Tench of the Alachua County Felony Court of Record today declared the first two sections of the Florida abortion law unconstitutional.

title: Koreans Bitter About U. S. Trade Policies
description: SEOUL, KoreaTwo months after an agreement with the United States that limited Korean textile exports to the American market, South Korea officials have assessed the consequences of the pact and do not like what they see.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor: The number of United Nations members is increasing every year. On Sept. 21, three small states  Bahrein, Bhutan and Qatarwith a total population of 1.5 million, became members. It is ironic, that other onceindependent states are not members.

title: Ballet: Ailey Company Dances Mary Lou's Mass
description: Alvin Ailey has a message of true joy for everyone at the New York City Center. It is called Mary Lou's Mass, and it was given its first performance by Mr. Ailey's American Dance Theater on Thursday night. It is a celebration of life, jazz and gospel, an assertively happy work that in some ways stands as a companion piece with Ailey's modern classic Revelations.

title: The Proceedings In the U.N. Today
description: GENERAL ASSEMBLY

title: Reserve Cuts Rate of Discount to 4%
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 10The V'ederal Reserve Board announced today a reduction in the discount rate from 4 to 4 per cent.

title: EAST VILLAGERS ASK CITY FOR PROTECTION
description: Roving bands of teenaged youths beat, rob and threaten elderly persons in the East Village, making them virtual prisoners in their own homes, residents of the area complained yesterday.

title: India Sending High Official To Moscow for Consultation
description: NEW DELHI, Dec. 10 (UPI)India is sending a Foreign Ministry official to Moscow tomorrow for highlevel consultations amid reports of Chinese warnings to India to heed the call of the United Nations General Assembly for a ceasefire in her war with Pakistan or face consequences.

title: Art: Old Drawings That Do Turn Up
description: Old master drawings are more and more difficult for dealers to find, and one who does a good job of hunting them out on excursions to England said this week: I have a new bunch, including a Rembrandt and an Ingres, but there won't be a show. I'm just telephoning my regular customers.

title: OTB IS HEADING FOR A SHOWDOWN ON FLORIDA BETS
description: In executive suites 1,400 miles apart yesterday, the antagonists in the offtrack betting war mapped strategy for their showdown next Monday.

title: A Vindication of the Truth of Islam
description: The game being played by Western political analysts could be called does he or doesn't he? The question refers to President Anwar elSadat's intentions and whether he means what he says about war with Israel. Most observers think he doesn't mean it because they interpret him from within their own secular, political frame of reference rather than his Moslem one. They err in doing so, I think.

title: U. of Pacific Picks Coach
description: STOCKTON, Calif., Dec. 10 (AP)Chester Caddas, 36 years old, was named football coach for the University of the Pacific today. He replaces Homer Smith, who was discharged two weeks ago after compiling an 814 wonlost record over two seasons.

title: Shop Talk
description: Jewelry designers who work with valuable stones rarely deviate from the classic themes. Occasionally, a sculptor tries his hand at jewelrymaking, but then one is likely to get the other extreme: a piece that looks better in a display case than on the body. Those who moan that the art has gone stale and that there are no modern Fabergs might look into the work of Arline Fisch, currently being shown at the Nordness Galleries, 238 East 75th Street.

title: Philadelphia Police Arrests
description: PHILADELPHIA, Dec. 10 (UPI)  The arrests of three city policemen yesterday has brought to seven the number of current and former officers charged since Nov. 16 in a continuing special grand jury investigation of alleged corruption among the police.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: Queens Jews Join Foes Of Forest Hills Project
description: Jewish organizations claiming to represent the vast majority of the 400,000 Jews in Queens joined yesterday in strong opposition to the controversial lowincome housing project for the Forest Hills section of Queens.

title: '76 Commission Head Says All Should Join Celebration
