description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 10 The chairman of the American Revolution Bicentennial Commission expressed concern today over what he described as apathy toward the nation's planned 200th birthday celebration.

title: ChrisCraft Suit Dismissed on Aircraft Acquisition
description: The 35month duel that gave the Bangor Punta Corporation control of the Piper Aircraft Corporation ended yesterday when a Federal District Court judge here dismised cross suits of Bangor Punta and ChrisCraft Industries, Inc.

title: LEONARD E. ULROPE, EXDIRECTOR OP ESSO
description: Leonard E. Ulrope, a retired director and vice president of Esso Standard Oil Company, died Thursday at his home. He was 78 years old and lived at 20 Fairfield Drive, Short Hills, N.J.

title: U.S. Indirectly Calls on India To Obey U.N. Truce Bid Now
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 10The White House indirectly urged India today to comply immediately with the United Nations General Assembly's resolution of last Tuesday calling for anl immediate ceasefire in the IndiaPakistan war.

title: VINCENT DRAYNE, AD EXECUTIVE, 76
description: PITTSBURGH, Dec. 10  H. Vincent Drayne, an advertising executive with the firm of Ketchum, MacLeod & Grove for 43 years until his retirement in 1968, died yesterday at his home in nearby Mount Lebanon. His age was 76.

title: Wallace Requests Study by Senators On Busing Ruling
description: MONTGOMERY, Ala., Dec. 10  Gov. George C. Wallace said today that he had asked Senator James O Eastland, Democrat of Mississippi, chairman of the Senate Judiciary Committee, to investigate the actions of a Federal district judge who, struck down an Alabama law dealing with the busing of schoolchildren.

title: Christian Science Bill Is Sent to White House
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 10 (AP)The Senate completed Congressional action today on a 75year extension of the Christian Science Church's copyright protection on the basic writings of its founder, Mary Baker Eddy.

title: Third Volunteer Soldier Killed In Ulster, Along With Civilian
description: BELFAST, Northern Ireland, Dec. 10 (AP)Guerrillas armed with machine guns killed a parttime soldier and a man riding with him today in the village of Clady in County Tyrone.

title: A Future for Every Child
description: On Dec. 11, 1946, there was born perhaps the most successfuland surely the most appealingof all agencies created by the General Assembly of the United Nations. This was the International Children's Emergency Fund; today, a quarter century later, it is alive and well into its maturity, and known universally as UNICEF.

title: WAY TERMED OPEN
description: CALCUTTA, India, Dec. 10Indian troops crossed a major river obstacle today and were poised for a final drive on Dacca, the capital and bastion of the Pakistani forces in East Pakistan, according to Indian military officials.

title: U.S. STEEL RAISES SOME PRICES 7.7%
description: The United States Steel Corporation increased prices late yesterday by an average of 7.7 per cent on a variety of products used in the automobile and appliance industries.

title: Trailer Homes Spark Debate in Brownsville
description: A new mobilehome park for the poor in the devastated, heart of Brownsvillecriticized by some as a wirefenced concentration camp has received its first tenants.

title: Thieu's Backers Dominate Legislature
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, Dec. 10The legislators of South Vietnam's lower house finally made clear the results of last August's elections by organizing themselves this week into voting blocs that left the Government forces firmly in control.

title: Bengalis Press Cause in U.N. Corridors
description: UNITED NATIONS, N.Y., Dec. 10The Bengali secessionists' aim on East Pakistan is a secular, democratic state seeking good relations with all the countries in the area including China, according to Abu Sayeed Chowdhury, the leader of a delegation seeking to state the movement's case at the United Nations.

title: EXTAIWAN AIDE GETS LIFE IN SEDITION CASE
description: TAIPEI, Taiwan, Dec. 10A prominent journalist, who was a highranking member of Nationalist China's ruling party until his arrest 13 months ago, was convicted of sedition to. day by a military tribunal and sentenced to life imprisonment. Another journalist received fiveyear term.

title: British Public Test of Hovertrain Is Called a Success
description: LONDON, Dec. 10Britain's experimental hovertrain, designed to carry passengers at speeds of up to 300 miles an hour, made its first public run today.

title: TOZZI IS KING MARKE IN TRISTAN AT MET
description: Giorgio Tozzi assumed the role of King Marke for the first time with the Metropolitan Opera in the performance of Wagner's Tristan and Isolde given on Thursday evening.

title: N. C. State Beata Purdue
description: RALEIGH, N. C., Dec. 10 (UPI)Ballhandling by Joe Cafferky and rebounding by Tommy Burleson led the North Carolina State Wolfpack to an 8471 victory over Purdue tonight.

title: Roko Display Honors Tanager Artists
description: Galleries come and go in New York. Some stay a little less. Some stay a little more. Some leave little more than a mist of memory, good and bad. But others leave a lingoring imprint and perhaps even a fondness for things past. The Tanager Gallery was on 10th Street for 10 years, from 1952 until 1962. and its mere mention still evokes reminiscences that belong to a special part of the art world. Founded by a group of artists, it was one of the first cooperative galleries in New York. Its aims were not to further any particular school of art but to encourage artists of many persuasions. In fact, the Tanager had its heyday during the peak period of abstract. expressionism and yet few of its artists embraced that mode of art.

title: Voting for Italian President Still Inconclusive on 2d Day
description: ROME, Dec. 10  The 1,008member Electoral College remained deadlocked today on the second day of voting to choose Italy's sixth president.

title: Dacca at War: Mixture Of Calm and Confusion
description: DACCA, Pakistan, Dec. 10 Some of the doubledecker buses continue their daytime passenger runs around Dacca, but on Government business and under a camouflage coat of mud.

title: OTC AND AMEX POST PRICE GAINS
description: The American Stock Exchange and the overthecounter market ended the week yesterday in a bullish manner as both lists showed good gains in heavier trading.

title: Local School Units Ask Wide Role in Labor Talks
description: A behindthescenes battle of growing magnitude is being waged by the city's 31 community school boards to enlarge their role in the labor negotiations that the central Board of Education conducts with the United Federation of Teachers and 23, other unions.

title: DOW CLIMBS 4.60 AS TRADING RISES
description: A frisky tone pervaded a steadily improving stock market yesterday as some glamour issues boomed to record levels and lowpriced issues dominated the active list.

title: Safety Gear Untried At APower Plants
description: DENVER, Dec. 10Key safety devices at more than a score of nuclear electricpower plants around the country have never been tested.

title: Cornell Five's Black Boycotters Meet With Coach and White Teammates
description: ITHICA, N. Y., Dec. 10Six black members of the Cornell University basketball team boycotted the squad's game against Syracuse University last night, met behind closed doors today with Coach Jerry Lace and with their white teammates.

title: British Cabinet Aide Rides on Concorde, Reaffirms Backing
description: LONDON, Dec. 10The British Government dispelled uncertainties today over the controversial Concorde project by giving its firm support to the supersonic aircraft program.

title: OHIO LAWMAKERS VOTE INCOME TAX
description: COLUMBUS, Ohio, Dec. 10  The Ohio House of Representatives passed tonight budget legislation assuring the first personal and corporate income taxes in the slate's history. The Senate gave its approval yesterday.

title: Germans Agree on Berlin; Pact to Be Initialed Today
description: BERLIN, Dec. 10East German and West German negotiators announced today that they had reached final agreement on subsidiary arrangements to fill out the framework of the Big Four accord on Berlin and to ease the daily lives of the 2 million people of West Berlin.

title: U.S. JEWS URGED TO AID ISRAELIS
description: The American Jewish community was told yesterday that Israel is a long way from selfsufficiency and that $450million must be raised in this country, to enable the Jewish state to cope with pressing social and economic problems.

title: Israel Works to Modify Draft Resolution at U.N.
description: UNITED NATIONS, N.Y., Dec. 10Israel began an intense effort today to persuade members of the General Assembly to delete from a draft resolution on the Middle East any call for an Israeli commitment to withdraw from all occupied Arab territory.

title: Cowboys' Pugh Activated
description: DALLAS, Dec. 10 (AP)  The Dallas Cowboys successfully waived Joe Williams, a running back, through the National Football League today, and sent him to the taxi squad to make room for the return of Jethro Pugh. The ailing defensive tackle will be ready for Sunday's game with the Giants in New York.

title: Henderson Case to Be Sent To the Jury Next Thursday
description: FORT MEADE, Md., Dec. 10 (AP)Closing arguments in the courtmartial of Col. Oran K. Henderson will begin next Wednesday and the case will be submitted to the jury Thursday afternoon, the judge announced today.

title: Rogers Returns to U.S.
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 10 (AP) Secretary of State Rogers said tonight upon returning from Brussels that President Nixon's policies, aimed at redressing the United States balanceofpayments deficits, had brought forth more financial contributions from the NATO allies. He referred to the allies' plans to step up their defense by $1billion and to the West German agreement to provide $2billion to offset costs of United States troops in West Germany.

title: FotoMem Drops Employes
description: The board of FotoMem, Inc., announced yesterday that, the company had released all of its employes and suspended active operation for lack of operating capital. A spokesman for the company said that management was continuing to seek funds but to date these efforts have proved unsuccessful and there is no assurance that they will be successful in the future or that the company will be able to continue in existence.

title: BONN SIGNS PACT TO PAY U.S. MORE FOR TROOP COSTS
description: BRUSSELS, Dec. 10  The United States and West Germany announced today a twoyear agreement under which the Germans would pay more of the costs of maintaining American troops in they country.

title: WILLIAm M'GOWAN, REALTY EXECUTIVE
description: William J. McGowan, long active in realestate development in Brooklyn and in Nassau and Suffolk counties until his retirement in 1965, died yesterday it his home in East Rockaway, L. I., after a long illness. He was 71 year old.

title: Union Here Told to End Strike Termed Aimed at Blacks' Jobs
description: A construction union here was ordered by a Federal judge yesterday, to stop a strike the Government said was designed to force employers to dismiss black and Puerto Rican workmen.

title: WALTER GANS
description: Walter Gans, former controller of American Stevedores, Inc., Gulton Industries, Inc., and Ferrota Enterprises, Inc., died Thursday in Lenox Hill Hospital. He was 64 years old and lived at 3350 159th Street, Flushing, Queens.

title: CLEANAIR PLANS CALLED DEFICIENT
description: Federal environmental officials warned New York and New Jersey yesterday that national cleanair requirements for 1975 would not be met by plans being drawn up by the two states.

title: C.B.S. NEWS STAFF IS REORGANIZED
description: The Columbia Broadcasting System announced yesterday a major reorganization of its television and radio news division including the naming of a new executive product for.The C.B.S. Evening News With Waltar Cronkite.

title: Steady Stream of Mourners Pays Tribute to Dr. Bunche
description: A steady stream of mourners viewed the body of Dr. Ralph J. Bunche, former United Nations Under Secretary General, last night at Frank E. Campbell's on Madison Avenue near 81st Street.

title: Notes On Metropolitan Congressmen
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 10The Congressional. TuesdaytoThursday club isn't what it used to he.

title: CITY AIDE WARNS ON RENT CONTROL
description: Benjamin Altman, the city's Rent Commissioner, said yesterday that he would not object to the Federal regulation of rent??ontrolled apartments if costs were also controlled and tenants were assured of proper maintenance and the same protection they now get.

title: $45,000 Taken in Holdup
description: Three armed men stole a bag containing $45,000 yesterday from a First National City Bank minibranch in the subbasement of 1315 York Avenue, near 70th Street. According to a bank spokesman and detectives, the bandits walked into the bank just after two armed Wells Fargo employes had delivered the money to the head teller. Thirty customers were in the bank at the time.

title: Mobile Denies Knowingly Hiring Crime Members
description: The Mobil Oil Corporation denied yesterday that it knowingly hired members of organized crime to break a fuel drivers' strike last spring.

title: Indians Closing In on Dacca
description: The following pool dispatch was transmitted to the United States today from 13 correspondents in East Pakistan, representing The Associated Press, United Press International, Time, Newsweek, The New York Times, The Los Angeles Times, The Christian Science Monitor, The Wall Street Journal, the American Broadcasting Company, the Columbia Broadcasting System, the National Broadcasting Company and The Washington Post:

title: Books of The Times
description: SELECTED POEMS. By Arthur Gregor. 239 pages, Doubleday. $6.95.

title: Saigon Residents Finding the Price Squeeze Worse Than Ever
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, Dec. 8Truong Hong Bac normally eats two meals a day but he is down to one now, skipping breakfast to save 27 cents a day.

title: Background of Dispute
description: HISTORY  Bloody strife, between Moslems and Hindus had racked the Indian subcontinent for centuries before 1947, when India achieved independence from Britain and a separate Moslem state, Pakistan, was created in two parts, East and West, separated by more than 1,000 miles of Indian territory. India is predominantly Hindu but has no state religion. Partition was followed by widespread MoslemHindu fighting. The partition also left areas of Kashmir in dispute and twice, in 1948.49 and in 1965, that dispute plus constant charges by both sides of religious persecution led to armed conflicts.

title: Gary Replaces Merrill
description: Harold Gary has succeeded Gary Merrill in the title role of Rosebloom, the fourcharacter play by Harvey Perr opening Jan. 5 at the Eastside Playhouse. Sylvia Miles, Ron Rifkin and Regina Baff make up the rest of the cast. The Harlan KleimanPeter Goldfarb production is being staged by Jered Barclay.

title: The Price Men Pay For Supremacy
description: SAN FRANCISCOFeminists have pointed out how men benefit from male supremacy, in time, money, satisfaction, and above all, power; but far less attention has been paid to the price men pay for their power. Understandably so: women have been properly preoccupied with the price they pay. Meanwhile men, trapped in the same system, have been making token adjustments and wishing the whole subject would disappear. But it is long past time for men to reckon with the systematic damage done to their own lies, as well as women's, for most men are simultaneously accomplices and victims.

title: Nobel Prize Presented to Brandt
description: OSLO, Norway, Dec. 10Norway's Nobel Committee presented to Chancellor Willy Brandt its 1971 Peace Prize here today in a ceremony that was heavy with symbolism for the German and Norwegian nations and for the recipient himself.

title: RCA Computer Division Schedules More Layoffs
description: The RCA Corporation's Computer System division announced yesterday further layoffs as it continued its withdrawal from the generalpurpose computer business.

title: LAKES TIE MARK WITH 20TH IN ROW
description: INGLEWOOD, Calif., Dec. 10 (UPI)Gail Goodrich capped a 32point performance with 7 points in the last 2 minutes of overtime tonight as the Los Angeles Lakers equaled Milwaukee's National Basketball Association record of 20 consecutive victories by defeating the Phoenix Suns, 126117.

title: Royal Pay Rise Protested
description: LONDON, Dec. 10  Queen Elizabeth was exposed today to resentment over a reocmmendation in the House of Commons for major pay increases to members of the royal family. As she left Buckingham Palace, her car passed a group of elderly people marching to the palace with a petition contrasting the generosity to the Queen with their meager pensions. The recommendation, and salary increases for Members of Parliament approved this week, have stirred considerable controversy.

title: The Capital Budget Road Proves Too Long for a High School Here
description: During the 1958 Easter vacation, officials of the High School of. Music and Art were summoned to a meeting at school board headquarters and told of tentative plans for a handsome new building at Lincoln Center.

title: VETO NOT PLANNED ON CAMPAIGN BILE
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 10 President Nixon has promised his chief Senate lieutenant that he will not veto the campaign spending bill now taking final form in a SenateHouse conference.

title: MITCHEL PAPPAS, ARTS PROFESSOR
description: HARTFORD, Dec. 10 Mitchel N. Pappas, a member of the faculty at Trinity College since 1947 and associate professor of fine arts since 1959, died of a heart attack today. He was 5.3 years old and lived at 36 Selden Hill Drive, West Hartford.

title: The Strange Case of Edgar Smith
description: The legal odyssey of Edgar H. Smith Jr., who was released from prison after 14 years in death row for the murder of a 15yearold girl in 1957, has left a trail unanswered questions about the processes of justice. Paradoxically, Smith was convicted when he protested his innocence and freed when he admitted his guilt. He had gained national fame from a book written in prison as an expose of alleged injustice.

title: Study Critiaizes F.B.I. Crime Statistics
description: WASHINGTON. Dec. 10A study submitted to the President today by the Commission on Federal Statistics urged that responsibility for gathering and issuing data on crime be transferred from the Federal Bureau of Investigation to an independent agency.

title: The Dispatch of the Grizzlies
description: KANSAS CITY, Mo.Must we lose the grizzly bears of Yellowstone National Park? Two biologists, Drs. John and Frank Craighead, say this could happen rapidly under a management program which the National Park Service says is restoring a natural grizzly population in Yellowstone.

title: Mets Give Up Ryan for Fregosi
description: The New York Mets finally gave up on Nolan Ryan's wandering fastball yesterday. They traded the 24yearold pitcher and three prospects to the California Angels for Jim Fregosi, six times the American League's allstar shortstop.

title: MRS. ROBERT H. KULKA
description: BRISTOL, Pa., Dec. 10Mrs. Sophie. Crystal Kulka, wife of Robert H. Kulke, retired vice president of the Victor Animatograph Corporation, exporters of motion picture sound equipment, died here yesterday at the Medicenter of America after a long illness. She was 74 years old and had lived in New York City for many years. Three months ago the family moved to 34 Linden Lane, Princeton, N. J.

title: A History of Decentralization
description: The city was divided into 31 separate community school districts after the Legislature passed the School Decentralization Act in 1969. Parents of publicschool children and other registered voters in each district participated in elections in 1970 to select nine members for each of the community school boards.

title: Citizen Groups Unite to Fight S.I. Road
description: The longdormant controversy over protecting Staten Island's greenbelt flared up again yesterday when conservation groups assailed the state's proposed Richmond Parkway extension.

title: Reese F. Clifford Is Dead; Western Electric Official
description: FORT LAUDERDALE, Fla., Dec. 10Reese F. Clifford, retired vice president and director of the Western Electric Company, died Wednesday at his home here. He was 80 years old.

title: FANS TAKE STOCK OF GIANTS' FUTURE
description: The future rather than the present (which means facing the Dallas Cowboys tomorrow) dominates the thinking of those New York Giant fans who can still talk about their team today without sputtering.

title: Slight Progress Is Indicated At Korean Red Cross Talks
description: PANMUNJOM, Korea, Dec. 10  North and South Korean Red Cross officials met here today in another weekly session of their preliminary talks on how to arrange reunions of families split in the two parts of Korea. There were no signs that Seoul's declaration of national emergency Monday had interfered with the discussions.

title: Pistons Get Rockets' Davis
description: HOUSTON, Dec. 10 (AP)The Houston Rockets traded Jim Davis, a forward, to Detroit today for the Pistons' No. 1 choice in next year's college draft. The Rockets also signed McCoy McLemore as a free agent.

title: Long Beach Triumphs, 7464
description: LAFAYETTE, La., Dec. 10 (AP)California State at Long Beach took advantage of extensive fouling by. TexasEl Paso tonight and defeated the Texans, 7464, in a firstround game in the Bayou Classic. The victory left Long Beach State with a wonlost record of 30, while the defeat was U.T.E.P.'s first in four games.

title: Backgrounders: Recourse to Anonymity Is Disputed
description: Ronald L. Ziegler, the White House press secretary, brought a guest briefer along with him last Tuesday for Mr. Ziegler's daily 4 P.M. briefing of newsmen on President Nixon's activities.

title: HOUSE VOTE PUTS ALL RENTS IN CITY UNDER PRICE UNIT
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 10The House approved legislation today to continue the economic Stabilization program, adding a provision that would return rentcontrolled, apartments to Federal regulation.

title: Abandoned Commitment
description: President Nixon explained his veto of the child development program by calling the plan too costly, administratively unworkable, professionally illprepared and designed to undermine the American family. The sweeping nature of this attack cannot obscure the fact that the concept of child care and development enjoys broad popular support across, most of the traditional divisions of politics, class, economics and race.

title: Saigon Reports Heaviest Battle Of Its Operation in Cambodia
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, Saturday, Dec. 11 (AP)North and South Vietnamese forces reportedly battled for nine hours yesterday deep inside Cambodia in the heaviest fighting of the Saigon command's threeweekold offensive across the border.

title: Antiques: Silver Spoons
description: It is amazing how much variety you can find collecting American silver spoons.

title: Agreement Reached In German Walkout On 7.5% Wage Rise
description: BONN, Dec. 10  After 19 days of a strike thatput down almost all of West Germany's automobile industry, the metalworkers union and management settled with a compromise today that could be the pattern for wage negotiations over most of the country.

title: Rockets Stop Hawks, 9588
description: HOUSTON, Dec. 10 (AP)The Houston Rockets streaked to a 2711 firstquarter lead tonight and held on for a 9588 victory over the Atlanta Hawks.

title: Uruguay Vote Still Undecided, but Suspense Is Gone
description: MONTEVIDEO, Uruguay, Dec. 10Twelve days after the Uruguayan general election, an official recount required by law took up its slow pace again today. No one was certain who would be the next President and no one was likely to be certain until midJanuary.

title: City Manager of Berkeley tinder Radicals' Fire, Quits
description: BERKELEY, Calif., Dec. 12William C. Hanley, the City Manager of Berkeley who has come under steady attack by radical City Council members, announced his resignation today.

title: SCHWEITZER CALLS CHARGES UNTRUE
description: State Supreme Court Justice Mitchell D. Schweitzer last night denied every charge of misconductranging from the commission of crimes to a broadscale violation of the state's canons of judicial ethics now pending against him before the Court on the Judiciary.

title: ... and Rumble on the Right
description: New York's Conservative party, disturbed by what believes to be President Nixon's leftward drift, is least tentatively withholding its support for his reelection. Its executive committee's announcement to this effect follows preliminary action by an lite band conservative chieftains, already known as the Manhattan 12.

title: Japan's Textile Makers Sue
description: TOKYO, Dec. 10 (Reuters)Japanese textile makers today started court action to try to stop enforcement of the United StatesJapanese agreement on regulating noncotton textile exports to the American market.

title: Red Grooms's Mr. & Mrs. Rembrandt
description: Hilarious, audacious, utterly original  about the work of how many contemporary artists could one honestly apply such a combination of terms? Not very many, you may be certain. But the art of Red Grooms amply qualifies. Mr. Grooms is the real thinga comic artist. He has an authentic and very personal comic vision, and he has the visual resources to carry his work in whatever direction his madcap imagination may lead.

title: Notes on People
description: President Nixon presented the Distinguished Service Medal to Gen. Leonard F. Chapman Jr., who is retiring Dec. 31 after four years as Marine Corps Commandant. At a ceremony in the White House Oval Office, Mr. Nixon said the Commandant had nothing but a record of pride to look back on. General Chapman said that among his fond memories as head of the corps was clearly the performance, dedication and loyalty of the 450,000 Marines who fought in Vietnam.

title: NETS DOWN PROS IN FINAL SECOND
description: WEST HEMPSTEAD, L. I., Dec. 10A onehand jump shot, by Rick Barry from the top of the foul circle just as the final buzzer was sounding tonight gave the New York Nets a 103101 victory over the Memphis Pros.

title: Congress Leaders Break Deadlock Over Aid Funds
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 10A deadlock over foreign aid, the last major obstacle to adjournment, was broken today as Congressional leaders agreed to bypass a Senate amendment on the withdrawal of American troops from Vietnam.

title: ExPoverty Aide Sentenced
description: A former New York City antipoverty official was sentenced to up to five years in prison yesterday for criminal possession of stolen securities and checks totaling more than $1million. Justice Gerald P. Culkin of State Supreme Court in Manhattan imposed the sentence on Howard Fields of 28 Caryl Avenue, Yonkers, a former director of employment and training for HaryouAct, a Harlem antipoverty agency.

title: Claiborne Named Coach Of Maryland's Eleven
description: COLLEGE PARK, Md., Dec. 10 (AP)  Jerry Claiborne was named head football coach at the University of Maryland today as the Teros tried once again to stabilize their uncertain program.

title: Bay State Post Filled
description: BOSTON, Dec. 10 (AP)Gov. Francis W. Sargent rounded out his 10member Cabinet today with the appointment of a Harvard education professor, Joseph M. Cronin, as Massachusetts Secretary of Educational Affairs. The Cabinet was created in April.

title: San Quentin Tells of a Plot To Smuggle In a Shotgun
description: SAN QUENTIN, Calif., Dec. 10 (UPI)A plot to smuggle a stolen police riot shotgun into San Quentin Prison, scene of a violent escape attempt in August, was reported today.

title: Tenants in Queens Assail Golar on Pomonok Houses
description: The tenants council of a Queens public housing project, a State Senator and a clergyman have accused Simeon Golar, chairman of the City Housing Authority, of deliberately misinforming tenants of the Pornonok Houses project by saying that no white, families had applied for apartments there and by implying that only black families Would be moved in.

title: RIGHTS ACCORD SET ON INSURANCE JOBS
description: The State Commissioner of Human Rights, Jack M. Sable, announced yesterday that eight life insurance companies, handluing 80 per cent of the policies in the nation, had agreed to increase their minoritygroup and women workers in higherpaying categories.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor: The United Nations General Assembly adopted on Nov. 22, without opposition, a resolution on the world social situation, recommending farreaching measures to help the developing countries in their efforts to raise living standards. The resolution deals with many of the problems of underdevelopment that James Reston so admirably analyzed in his recent series of articles in The Times.

title: Clete Boyer, 34, Traded To Clab in Japan League
description: HONOLULU, Dec. 10 (UPI) The Hawaii Islanders traded a former major league third baseman, Clete Boyer, to the Taiyo Whales of Japan's Central League for a former Islander, John Werhas, in a straight player deal yesterday. In the past, American players were sent to the Japan league for cash.

title: JABBAR SCORES 55 AS BUCKS TRIUMPH
description: MILWAUKEE, Dec. 10 (AP) Kareem Jabbar scored 113 of his careerhigh of 55 points in the third period tonight, sparking the Milwaukee Bucks to 120.104 victory over the Boston Celtics in a game between National Basketball Association division leaders.

title: The Talk of Steinstucken
description: BERLIN, Dec: 9The old man appeared to waver between confidence and doubt. If the Americans hold out, we'll be all right, he observed. Surely they cannot let us clown at 5 minutes to 12.

title: Eberle Heads U.S. Group
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 10 William D. Eberle, the President's special representative for trade negotiations, will head the United States delegation to the trade talks with Japan in Honolulu.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor: Your editorial Controlling Rent (Nov. 29) displays a regrettable unawareness of the arithmetic which renders Minimum Base Rents (M.B.R.) as only a temporary crutch to a limping housing industry.

title: PRODUCTION OF CARS SHOWS RISE IN WEEK
description: DETROIT, Dec. 10 (AP)Production at domestic auto plants rose this week as the Ford Motor Company's Dearborn assembly lines resumed fiveday operations after a week's shutdown, Automotive News reported yesterday.

title: FILION UNSPOILED BY TROT SUCCESS
description: YONKERS, Dec. 10  As Herve Filion's fame in harness racing spreads, he refuses to rest upon his laurels.

title: U.S. Reverses Stand On Seattle Food Aid After Senate Attack
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 10 (UPI) Senator Warren G. Magnuson, Democrat of Washington, said today that food donations from Japan had made the United States Government look callous and cruel for refusing two food programs for hungry people in Seattle.

title: The Visit of General Medici
description: President Nixon put his talks with President Mdici of Brazil in the context of the vitally important consultations he is conducting with this country's closest friends prior to his visits next year to China and Russia. It was the kind of recognition and association Brazil has long sought from Washington.

title: TRADE POSITION OF E.E.C. DRAFTED
description: BRUSSELS, Dec. 10  The European Economic Community got its cumbersome decisionmaking machinery into operation today, to try to find a compromise with the United States on demands for eliminating restrictive trade practices.

title: INDIANS CROSS WIDE RIVER AND DRIVE TOWARD DACCA; FOE FINDS OUTLOOK GRAVE
description: RAWALPINDI, Pakistan, Dec. 10In his gloomiest assessment so far of the military situation in East Pakistan, the military command spokesman said tonight that Pakistani troops, outnumbered 6 to 1 and overstressed on the ground, were continuing re; sistance against an enemy who possessed overwhelming air support.

title: RollCall Vote in Senate On Rehnquist for Bench
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 10 (AP) Following is the rollcall vote by which the Senate confirmed today the nomination of William H. Rehnquist to the Supreme Court:

title: U. of Minnesota Post Is Rejected by Giel
description: MINNEAPOLIS, Dec. 10 (UPI)Paul Giel, football and baseball star at the University of Minnesota in the early 1950's, withdrew his name as candidate for athletic director of his alma mater to, day because of a dispute over whether he could hire and discharge coaches without regents' approval.

title: Mrs. Gandhi Says Goal Is Freeing of the East
description: NEW DELHI, Dec. 10 (UPI)  Prime Minister Indira Gandhi told 100,000 college students at a rally today that India would keep fighting until Pakistani troops were driven from East Pakistan.

title: Anniversaries
description: PROWLERRose and Bert. Wishing you love and best wishes on your Golden Wedding Anniversary.

title: Dana Net Doubles in Quarter; Absence of Strikes Spurs Rise
description: Opeartions of the Dana Corporation in the first fiscal quarter ended Nov. 30 resulted in a net income of $10.2million, or 74 cents a share, one automobile equipment producer reported yesterday. This more than doubled the $4.1million, or 30 cents a share shown in the comparable three months last year. Sales rose to $193million from $136.3million in the first fiscal quarter of the former year.

title: U.S. Fighter Downed Over Laos By a North Vietnamese Missile
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, Saturday, Dec. 11A United States Air Force jet fighter escorting a B52 raid over the Ho Chi Minh Trail in Laos was hit and destroyed by an enemy surfacetoair missile, the United States command disclosed today.

title: Proposed Changes in Draft Withdrawn
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 10The Selective Service System withdrew today several proposed changes in, regulations governing the draft following complaints from local draft boards and the public.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor: Humanitarian and political reasons support India's military action against her South Asian neighbor. The broad objective is to punish a Pakistani regime that had lost legitimacy by its genocidal treatment of millions of its Bengali citizens, forcing survivors to find refuge in an already strained India. That these people should have safe homeland to return to is a necessary and rightful solution to Pakistan's massive violations of human rights.

title: H. E.W. Denies Deceit in Hospitals Memo
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 10Offioials of the Department of Health, Education and Welfare denied today any Intent to deceive members of Congress in an interoffice memorandum advising the Secretary to offer them as few materials as we can get away with.

title: Reports Deny Deaths In Orphanage Bombing
description: NEW DELHI, Dec. 10 Reports reaching here from the United States consulate in Dacca said today that no one had been killed in the bombing of an orphanage there yesterday.

title: Market Place: 1,100 Dow Index Seen by Banker
description: A favorite market myth is that stock prices feed on inflationthat they rise even faster than the cost of living.

title: Film: Intense, Eclectic
description: Of the four films by Gunvor Nelson currently playing at the Film Forum, two, My Name is Oona and Kirsa Nicholina, have already been shown in a Whitney Museum program and have been reviewed in The New York Times. Two somewhat more ambitious films, Schmeerguntz and Fog Pumas, both codirected by Mrs. Nelson and Dorothy Wiley, are new to us, and both demonstrate an approach to moviemaking that is intense, technically eclectic and much given to a kind of dark free association at the service of either surreal fiction or satire.

title: Final Retailing Figures Show a Dip in October
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 10 (Reuters)Final October retail sales fell. 1 per cent after rising a similar amount in September, the Commerce Department reported today.

title: U. S. and Japan Meeting on Trade Today
description: TOKYO, Dec. 10 (AP)  Representatives of the United States and Japanese Governments will hold trade talks in Honolulu tomorrow and Sunday, the Tokyo Government announced today.

title: 186 Americans in Dacca
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 10 (AP) The State Department reported today that there were 186 American citizens in Dacca, the East Pakistani capital, 125 of them awaiting air evacuation.

title: Merger News
description: The Raytheon Company announced yesterday that it had agreed in principle to acquire the Iowa Manufacturing Company for common stock valued at $43,5million. The merger has been approved by directors of both companies and is subject to approval of the shareholders of Iowa Manufacturing, which makes a wide range of stationary and portable construction equipment and asphalt  paving equipment. Annual sales of Iowa Manufacturing, which has its headquarters in Cedar Rapids, Iowa, and its affiliate, Iowa Steel and Iron Works, Inc., total about $50million. The company employs 1,400 people.

title: Bills Auction Moved Up
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 10 (UPI) The Treasury rescheduled today its regular weekly auction of shortterm bills from Monday, Dec. 20, to Friday, Dec. 17. The day for the auction is being advanced to assure ample time between it and the payment date during the holiday season, the Treasury said. The new payment date for this auction will be Thursday, Dec. 23.

title: MRS. FRED J. ROSSITER
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 10 Mrs. Daisy Mellor Rossiter, the widow of Fred J. Rossiter, a former United States agricultural attach to Canada, died yesterday in Washington Hospital Center of a heart attack. She was 78 years old.

title: Walter Davenport, ExEditor Of Collier's and Liberty, Dies
description: SOUTHERN PINES, N. C., Dec. 10  Walter Davenport, former editor of Collier's weekly and in 1923 the first managing editor of the defunct Liberty magazine, died yesterday in St. Joseph's Hospital after a long illness. He was 82 years old and had lived here since 1958, the year after Collier's closed.

title: ...and a Little Shall Lead Them
description: Sports of The Times

title: Hobeau Farm's Horses Are Favorites Today in Split Handicap at Aqueduct
description: A fillin race, the December Handicap, has proved so popular with horsemen that it will have to be run in two divisions on today's program at Aqueduct. The onemile event was thought up only a fortnight ago in order to present a stakes event on the final Saturday of the extended local season, which ends Wednesday.

title: Executive Changes
description: Robert H. Legg was elected chairman of the board and chief executive officer of the Uris Buildings Corporation at a meeting of the company's board of directors, it was announced yesterday by Harold D. Uris, president. H. D. Harvey, formerly a vice president, was elected chairman of the board and chairman of the executive committee. Mr. Legg, 54 years old, fills the post vacated by the death of Percy Uris on Nov. 20. He joined the investment building company in 1962, was named a director in 1965 and elected executive vice president in August, 1971. Fromnow on he will also serve on the executive committee.

title: Antony and Cleopatra Scenes Please Philharmonic Audience
description: Samuel Barber's Antony and Cleopatra, the work that opened the Metropolitan Opera House at Lincoln Center in 1966 and went over with a nowhistoric thud, made considerably more pleasant sound when the New York Philharmonic presented scenes from the opera Thursday night.

title: Taj Mahal Singing At the Bitter End On Bill With Lamb
description: What a pleasure it is to hear a pop program in which musical values are as important as visual effects and psychic energy. Thursday night at the Bitter End blues singer Taj Mahal and a West Coast rock group named Lamb provided one of those rare evenings in which ability and charisma actually merged.

title: Two Women Who Go to Washington Galas in Homemade Gowns
description: WASHINGTON Once, not too long ago, there was a state dinner hero where four women appeared wearing the same style black and white gown. The only difference was in the sizes, which ranged from a 22 down to a 6. The poor wretches spent the evening in agony arid couldn't wait to get home.

title: Sonics Sink Warriors
description: SEATTLE, Dec. 10 (AP)Spencer Haywood and Lenny Wilkens paced the Seattle Supersonics to a 10594 victory over Golden State tonight, the sixth consecutive loss for the Warriors.

title: Indians Surprised at the Light Resistance
description: JULLUNDER BASE CAMP, Derababa Nanak, India, Dec. 10  The Derababa Nanak bridge, a strategic railway trestle that was captured by Indian troops earlier this week, was quiet today. Lime green parrots screeched in the trees and Indian soldiers bathed in the Rawi River beneath the bridge, two miles inside West Pakistan.

title: Kind Act Benefits Neediest
description: A $25 check honoring an outstandingly neighborly act was among the 150 contributions to The New York Times Neediest Cases Fund recorded yesterday.

title: Patents of the Week
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 10The International Business Machines Corporation was granted a patent this week that is impressive in several ways: it is one of the largest ever issued, it protects not only a big computer but special features of several others, and in stead of the usual single inventor there are 18. Patent 3,626,427 covers primarily the data processor known as 360 Model 75, five of which are used in the Apollo program at Houston. These calculate trajectories and orbits, facilitating control decisions and letting the astronauts know precisely where they are in space.

title: For 6 Chinese Delegates, a TakeOut Banquet
description: U Thant, Secretary General of the United Nations, entertained six of the leading members of the Chinese delegation at a Chinese banquet lunch yesterday. Like many New Yorkers, he ordered out from a nearby Chinese restaurant, in this case Flower Drum.

title: Phone Company Presses Request for U.S. Mediator
description: The New York Telephone Company told negotiators for striking telephone installers yesterday that it saw no purpose in continuing negotiations without a Federal mediator.

title: Parley on Blacks' Health Opens; A Leader Sees Major Struggle
description: NASHVILLE, Dec. 10The Black Congressional Caucus, the two black medical colleges and the black medical and dental associations began today the country's first National Conference on the Status of Health in the Black Community.

title: News Analysis
description: LOS ANGELES, Dec. 10 Former Representative Allard K. Lowenstein, addressing a conference of 3,000 new voters in Chicago last weekend, said, Certainly there is no joy in the White House that this thing is occurring.

title: Penn State, Delaware and Alfred Elevens Honored
description: Penn State, which will face Texas in the Cotton Bowl on Jan. 1, was presented the Lambert Trophy as the outstanding major college football team in the East yesterdat. Joe Paterno, coach of the oncebeaten Nittany Lions, accepted the award and a message of congratulations from President Nixon at the annual Lambert luncheon in the Essex House.

title: PROF. BAYRAM VURAL
description: Prof. Bayram Vural of the School of Engineering and the electrical engineering department of City College, died of a heart attack yesterday. He was 46 years old and lived in Hightstown, N. J.

title: Miss Gould Wins FreeStyle And Medleyin Aussie Swim
description: SYDNEY, Australia, Dec. 10 (AP)Shane Gould, Australia's 15yearold Olympic swimming hopeful, recorded world class times to win the 100meter freeStyle and the 400meter individual medley in an interclub meet at Drummoyne Pool today.

title: Marathon Oil Quits North Slope Hunt
description: The golden dream of an oil bonanza from the Alaskan North Slope grew tarnished yesterday for the Marathon Oil Company. The Ohiobased concern announced that it was writing off its unamortized lease investment of $15.1million in its 13 tracts in the area.

title: EQUITY FINANCING
description: Peachtree Doors, Inc.. made its first public stock offering yesterday with the sale of 325,000 shares priced by a Dominick & Dominick underwriting group at $12. The Georgia company makes door assemblies and closet doors.

title: Numerals Were Misplaced In Map of Ocean Floor Drift
description: In a map published in The New York Times yesterday to illustrate how an otherwise steady northward drift of the Pacific floor reversed direction, two numerals were misplaced. Hence the map seemed to show an unbroken northward movement.

title: MRS. SEYMOUR KNOX
description: BUFFALO, Dec. 10Mrs. Helen Northrup Knox, wife of Seymour H. Knox, chairman emeritus of the Marine Midland Bank, died Monday in Buffalo General Hospital. She was 69 years old.

title: All the Inhabitants of Jerusalem
description: JERUSALEMNothing could be more inaccurate than to assert that the rights of the inhabitants of Jerusalem have been adversely affected by anything done or planned by Israel. Their rights to peaceful life and development, and to a voice in. Jerusalem's affairs, have been fully respectedand, indeed, advancedonly since June, 1967.

title: Nixon Signs TaxReduction Bill; Scores Campaign Funding Plan
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 10President Nixon signed the tax measure today, hailing it as a responsible bill that would grant some tax reduction to practically every American and create new jobs.

title: Bridge: Blue Team Leads the Aces, 229161, in Challenge Match
description: LAS VEGAS, Nev., Dec. 10 After 100 deals of the 140deal challenge match here, the Italian Blue team held a commanding lead of 68 international match points, 229 to 161, over the Dallas Aces.

title: Tass Assails DauglasHome
description: MOSCOW, Dec. 10 (Reuters) Tass, the Soviet press agency, said today in a dispatch from Brussels on the meeting of the NATO ministerial council that the British Foreign Secretary, Sir Alec DouglasHome, had tried to sow doubts with regard to the very idea of a conference on European securityand had tried to present itas a sort of tactical move by the Soviet Union and other socialist countries.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: EDWARD F. COX
description: AUGUSTA, Me., Dec. 10Edward F. Cox, a former newspaper editor, died yesterday in the Augusta General Hospital. He was 45 years old.

title: AT HOME ABROAD
description: LONDON, Dec. 10In the United States the President makes foreign policy. That understanding is fundamental to the constitutional system. In the end the American voice will be heard clearly only when he speaks.

title: Industry Spokesmen Call Pollution Bill Too Costly
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 10Representatives of American industry lined up solidly today behind the Nixon Administration in attacking as impossibly tough and costly the water poltion control bill that was passed unanimously by the Senate last month.

title: 1st TransU.S. Flight Noted
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 10(AP) The National Air and Space Museum noted without ceremony today the 60th anniversary of the first crossing of the North American continent by air. Dr. Paul Garber, the museum's historian emeritus, gave the airplane, the Vin Fiz Flyer, a little polishing and sent off a telegram of remembrance to the widow of Calbraith Perry Rodgers, the hero of the 84day day air journey from Long Island to Long Beach, Cailf.

title: REFINANCING IS SET BY REPUBLIC CORP.
description: The Republic Corporation announced yesterday that it had concluded a fiveyear credit agreement with domestic and foreign leaders covering some, $62million in debt originally due from the end of 1972 through the end of 1973.

title: General Assembly Asks Currency Realignment
description: UNITED NATIONS, N. Y., Dec. 10 (Reuters)The General Assembly's Economic Committee tonight called upon the developed countries to reverse the recent restraints on international trade and to realign their currencies.

title: LOWENTHAL ADDS RECITAL INTEREST
description: Jerome Lowenthal may seem wrongheaded as a pianist at times, but at least he is never dull. In these days, when a good many pianists are carbon copies of one another, holding the listener's interest is quite a virtue, and it was a big one in the artist's recital in Tully Hall Thursday night.

title: Mundine Knocks Out Austin
description: BRISBANE, Australia, Dec. 10 (Reuters) Tony Mundine, the Australian middleweight champion, knocked out Charlie Austin of San Francisco in the second round of their scheduled 10round nontitle fight tonight. Austin weighed 166 pounds, Mundine 161.

title: MRS. S. J. SUTTON SR.
description: Mrs. Lillian V. Sutton, mother of Manhattan Borough President Percy Sutton and Civil Court Judge Oliver Sutton, died Thursday in Bexar County Hospital, San Antonio, Tex., of burns received in a fire two weeks ago in her home in San Antonio. She was the widow of Samuel J. Sutton Sr., a high school principal. A retired teacher, she was 97 years old.

title: U.S. Promises Lisbon Up to $435Million in Credits
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 10The State Department announced today that the United States had promised Portugal up to $435million in economic and social development credits in return for the use of air and naval bases in the Azores until 1974.

title: Cavaliers Top Pistons
description: CLEVELAND, Dec. 10 (UPI) Bobby Washington converted a pair of foul shots with four seconds left tonight to give the Cleveland Cavaliers a 112111 victory over the Detroit Pistons.

title: Hogan Def ends Record on Police Graft
description: District Attorney Frank S. Hogan defended his record on combotting police corruption yesterday, saying that while the Knapp Commission hearings might have hurt his image as a prosecutor, his record showed that he had been doing his job.

title: St. John's Sets Relay Mark, Beats Princeton and Temple
description: PRINCETON, N. J., Dec. 10 (AP)  St. John's twomile relay team, anchored by Phil Nipolitno, set a meet record as the Redmen scored a 5654 victory over Princeton in Jadwin. Gym today.

title: LESTER PRATT DIES; RETIRED ADMIRAL, 86
description: SAN DIEGO, Calif., Dec. 10 Rear Adm. Lester Pratt, U.S.N., retired, who directed the construction of two East Coast naval hospitals in St. Albans, Queens, New York, and Jacksonville, Fla., died at his home here last Friday. He was 86 years old.

title: Bulls Down Bullets, 118102
description: CHICAGO, Dec. 10 (AP)The Chicago Bulls lost a 17 point lead tonight, but stormed back behind three guardsJerry Sloan, Bob Weiss and Jim Kingto defeat the Baltimore Bullets, 118102.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: Big Straw in a Mild Wind ...
description: Senator Muskie's still undeclared Presidential candidacy got one of those lifts this week that are as important for what they say about a man's prospects as they are for any actual benefits they may bring him. The man from Maine has won the endorsement of Senator John V. Tenney of Californiaa freshnian Senator but a power in his state's Democratic party. California will have 271 delegates, the secondlargest bloc at the Miami Beach conventionand they will be chosen in a winnertakeall primary.

title: W. Virginia Routs Columbia, 10653; Rutgers Also Bows
description: MORGANTOWN, W. Va., Dec. 10 (UPI)Will Robinson's 26 points helped West Virginia overwhelm Columbia, 10653, and gained the final of the Mountaineer, Classic against Northwestern, which nipped Rutgtrs, 7268 in the opener of the twoday tournament.

title: Griffith Defeats McAloon Here
description: Emile Griffith, five times a world boxing champion, had an easy time in beating the fighting schoolteacher from the Bronx, Danny McAloon, in Madison Square Garden last night.

title: Rehnquist Confirmed by Senate, 6826
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 10The Senate confirmed today by a vote of 68 to 26 President Nixon's nomination of William H. Rehnquist to fill the Supreme Court vacancy created by the retirement of Justice John. Marshall Harlan.

title: Novel Nutcracker Bows
description: The New York City Ballet took its public on a trip by increasing the sugarplum population in a onceonly special version of The Nutcracker Thursday night at the State Theater.

title: Price of '72 Fords to Rise By Average of 2.6%, or $90
description: DETROIT, Dec. 10 (UPI)The Ford Motor Company announced today that it was increasing the prices of its 1972 model cars by an average of 2.6 per cent, or $90, effective with vehicles shipped to dealers, Nov. 30.

title: Draft Call Filled
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 10 (AP)  Drafting of men into the armed forces stopped today until tt least late next month. The drafting of men was halted for the usual ChristmasNew Year holiday, and Selective Service said the November  December draft call of 10,000 has been filled.

title: ACCUSED HELD SANE IN COAST SLAYINGS
description: REDWOOD CITY, Calif., Dec. 10 (UPI)A jury of eight women and four men decided today that John Linley Frazier was legally sane at the time he murdered Dr. Victor Ohta and four others and dropped their bodies into the doctor's swinmming pool.

title: U.A.W. PRESSES END OF CANADIAN STRIKE
description: DETROIT, Dec. 10  The United Automobile Workers is attempting to force its Canadian local to end a walkout at a Canadian aircrft plant that is threatening the jobs of thousands of American workers.

title: COPPER IS BUOYED BY GERMAN PACT
description: News that the 19day West German metal workers' strike had been settled stimulated purchases by commission hous of copper futures contracts on the Commodity Exchange in New York yesterday.

title: Executive Airlines Asking Voluntary Reorganization
description: Executive Airlines, Inc., which has been cited by Federal officials as a model commuter airline, filed a petition under Chapter XI of the Federal Bankruptcy Act in Boston yesterday.

title: CHILE DEVALUES ESCUDO ABOUT 30%
description: SANTIAGO, Chile, Dec. 10Chile's leftwing Government devalued its currency by some 25 per cent today to stimulate exports, but shielded lowincome consumers from increases in the cost of food and fuel imports by a subsidized rate for these products.

title: Royals Break Slump
description: PHILADELPHIA, Dec. 10 (AP)  The Cincinnati Royals, down by 10 points in the second half, rallied to defeat the Philadelphia 76ers, 113106, in overtime tonight and end a fivegame losing streak.

title: Pakistan's Bhutto Here
description: UNITED NATIONS, N. Y., Dec. 10  Pakistan's Foreign Minister, Zulfikar Ali Bhutto, arrived here today to press his country's case. And India's chief delegate, Samar Sen, indicated that his country would not agree to a ceasefire unless a representative of the East Pakistani separatist regime were formally heard at the United Nations.

title: Montler Is Plunkett LookAlike
description: There's little chance the Jet defense will mistake Mike Monier, New England's left tackle, for Jim Plunkett, New England's quarterback, tomorrow, but if they do, Montler will understand. People have been doing it all season.

title: Presentations Made in Sweden
description: STOCKHOLM, Sweden Dec. 10 (AP  King Gustaf VI Adolf, handed out Nobel Prizes today to four scientists from the United States, Canada and Britain, to an American economist and a Chilean poet.

title: Ruskin Warns Public on Gifts
description: Commissioner of Investigation Robert K. Ruskin warned the public yesterday that gifts and gratuities to city employes are strictly prohibited. Commissioner Ruskin pointed out it is a misdemeanor, punishable by up to one year in prison, for anyone to give gratuities to city employes with whom he has business dealings.

title: Bridge
description: SOME of the timehonored maxims handed down from the days of whist regularly generate confusion and disaster. Always covering an honor with an honor, for example, can be the sign of a steady loser. Even one of the most reliable of these rules of thumb  lead up to weaknesscan represent a trap.

title: India Says Planes Find Orphanage Undamaged
description: NEW DELHI, Dec. 11 (UPI) A Government spokesman said today that Indian aircraft had taken photographs to determine whether a reported air strike against an orphanage near the Dacca airport actually had occurred.

title: Twelve baking days to Christmas
description: ATTER THE TURKETThere's no need to refrigerate this holiday dessert. Wrap it carefully in aluminum foil, pop it into a tightclosing tin, and wait for Santa.

title: KENT IS TROUBLED BY NIXON SILENCE
description: KENT, Ohio, Dec. 11Seven weeks ago Dr. Glenn A. Olds, the new president of Kent State University, and two graduate students flew to Washington and delivered to the White House a petition asking President Nixon to order a grand jury investigation of the killing of four Kent State students by the Ohio National Guard on May 4, 1970.

title: LETTERS
description: To the Financial Editor: Contrary to the statement in Phase II Riches (Dec. 5), the Bureau of National Affairs at no time has had any plans to recoup some of its added labor costs by means of an increase in the price of Environment Reporter.

title: C.W.Post Faculty Shows It Includes Quality Musicians
description: C. W. Post College of Long Island University put on a faculty concert at Carnegie Recital Hall Friday night, and since a number of firstclass singers and instrumentalists teach there, it was an evening of highstandard performances. The music was something else again: apart from the two closing works, Debussy's Sonata for Violin and Piano and four of Alban Berg's Seven Early Songs, there was, much sound and fury but comparatively little substance.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: This city's housing disaster could well do without the article The Lease Under Fire As Unfair To Tenants [Nov. 7]. To the unknowing the reporting conjures up a picture of oppression by New York feudal Lord of the land landlords so as to destroy the poor disenfranchised tenants, further exacerbating the hostility toward landlords in this antilandlord city.

title: Kerr on Camus' Caligula at Yale
description: IT would be easy enough to tell you about all of the spectacular things Christopher Walken is doing in the Yale Repertory Theater's new production of Albert Camus's Caligula  and they are all astonishingly right  but there are two much quieter moments that serve as vital clues to any comprehension of a bizarre emperor who was anything but mad.

title: Progression of Periodontal Disease
description: Half of Americans lose all their teeth by the age of 55. The cause is periodontal disease, a disorder of oral neglect that dentists here said last week was easily prevented in nearly all cases.

title: Bubble, Anyone? New Idea in Tennis
description: Oddlooking bubbles can be seen in many neighborhoods. Some are domeshaped, others resemble sausages. People pass by and wonder about them, and at night they see the soft glow that emanates from them.

title: Johnson Smoking Again; Blames Hectic Holidays
description: AUSTIN, Tex., Dec. 11 (AP) The Christmas season has driven former President Lyndon B. Johnson to take up smoking again after a 15year abstinence,

title: An American Original
description: THE frontier spirit, that almost mystical belief in endless stretches of virgin territory, in the individual's ability to devise his own tools for survival, lingers on. Almost every region of the country has its resident eccentricssculptors of junk art, architects who build constructions in response to some fantastic, mind'seye view, unpublished Toistois and unperformed Ibsens  all passionately convinced that they can do it on their own, outside the traditional confines of their various arts.

title: W. Virginia Wins, 9894
description: MORGANTOWN, W. Va., Dec. 11 (UPI)West Virginia lost 12point lead in the final 10 minutes of regulation play, but rallied behind Mike Heitz and Levi Phillips to beat Northwestern, 98.94, in overtime tonight to take the. Mountaineer Classic.

title: U. of Virginia Appoints A Dean of Medicine
description: CHARLOTTESVILLE, Va., Dec. 11 (AP)Dr. William R. Drucker, the surgeon and authority on shock and trauma, has been named dean of medicine at the University of Virginia School of Medicine.

title: Arkansas Easing OneDay Prison Hazing of Youths After Death of a Black TeenAger
description: LITTLE ROCK, Ark., Dec. 11 Willie E. Stewart, a skinny black youth convicted of burglary, arrived at Cummins Prison Farm before dawn on Nov. 29 to serve a oneday sentence that was supposed to show him the bleakness of life of crime.

title: YearEnd Tax Tips
description: Put aside those Christmas catalogs for a minute and give this idea a little thought. If you spend some time with your taxes now, you may be able to save enough money to pay for Christmas.

title: Obey Rules of the Olympics, Prince Philip Tells Horsemen
description: Prince Philip, president of the Federation Equestre Internationale, the world governing body of equestrian sports, has warned the group's members that it is their duty to see that Olympic rules are not broken.

title: Stamps
description: NPHILEX '71 was a success, a tremendous cultural success, although it is too early to assess its financial success. The underwriters had no illusions other than to avoid too much red Ink for the Anniversary Philatelic Exhibition. Their goal was to display the greatest assemblage of classic postage stamps under one roof. And they did it.

title: Carr Goes on Injured List
description: CLEVELAND, Dec. 11 (AP)The Cleveland Cavaliers today placed an injuryplagued rookie, Austin Carr, on the injured list, reducing their roster to the 12man limit imposed by the National Basketball Association.

title: U.S. Redraws Charts Of Long Island Sound
description: Twenty navigational charts are being revised and six new ones will have to be drawn as the result of a recently completed sixyear Federal study of Long Island Sound.

title: Miss Beverly S. Bissell Is Affianced
description: GREENVILLE, Del., Dec. 11  George Perkins Bissell Jr., board chairman of the Wilmington Trust Company, and. Mrs. Bissell have announced the engagement of their daughter, Miss Beverly Stevenson Bissell, to Arthur Michael Sullivan Jr. of Washington, son of Mr. Sullivan of Providence, R. I., and the late Mrs. Sullivan. A February wedding is planned.

title: A FACTORY DRAMA IS A HIT IN SOVIET
description: MOSCOW, Dec. 11  The Theater on the Malaya Bronnaya, a small Moscow house on a quiet side street, has a successful production on its hands  a hardhitting play about the profitoriented economic reform.

title: Macao Pulls Itself Together and Finds Happiness in Coexistence
description: MACAO, Dec. 3The attitude of China toward Macao these days is one of benign tolerance.

title: JEWISH UNIT ASKS ACTION IN DISPUTT
description: The American Jewish Congress urged Mayor Lindsay yesterday to meet with Forest Hills residents to try to work out changes in the controversial lowincome housing project, and bring an end to the community turmoil.

title: Shall We Tell The Kids The Truth?
description: TWO recent LP's  Bill Cosby Talks to Kids About Drugs (MCA), and The World: Original Cast, Starring Howdy Doody (Leslee Productions)indicate how far we have come in telling it to kids like it is. (They know anyway, so why not?)

title: Miss Cold Duck Sprints To Fair Grounds Victory
description: NEW ORLEANS, Dec. 11 (AP) Miss Cold Duck dashed to the front at the 16th pole and went on to win by three lengths today in the $10,000 added Pontalba Stakes at the Fair Grounds.

title: Rodeo Mark ($33) Takes Handicap at Narragansett
description: PAWTUCKET, R. I., Dec. 11 (AP)Rod. Mark led all the way today to win the $2,400 Consolation Marathon Handicap by nine lengths at Narragansett Park.

title: Domestic Council Moving to Fore
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 11Despite all the fanfare over his forthcoming global summitry, President Nixon is quietly channeling a greater share of his energies into domestic mat tars. And as he has done so the forgotten men of the White House, members of his Domestic Council, have slowly begun to reappear.

title: Education
description: A prominent physics educator noted last week that there are 10 times as many American college students enrolled in astrology courses as in astrophysicsand he said this was a frightening trend for highquality universities and, indeed, for American society.

title: George R. Hoguet Will Marry Miss Marie Isabel Montamat
description: VINEYARD HAVEN, Mass., Dec. 11The engagement of Miss Marie Isabel Montamat to George Roberts Hoguet, son of Mr. and Mrs. Robert L. Hoguet of New York, Syosset, L. I., and Aspen, Colo., has been announced by the future bride's parents, Mr. and Mrs. Harold E. Montamat.

title: New York
description: Governor Rockefeller continued his lament about billiondollar deficits, fiscal crises and Federal aid last week, but many legislators weren't listening. They were playing their own game: What's My Lines?

title: AROUND THE
description: Mom is excused this week to bake her cookies and fruit cakes, while Dad can beg off with trips the post office with cards and packages... If there are a few spare minutes, don't forget to keep soil of African violets, episcia, aralia, orange plants, etc., on the damp side and mist gardenias, gloxinias and ivy every few days.

title: Boston U. Six Triumphs
description: PRINCETON, N. J., Dec. 11Ric Jordan, a junior defenseman, scored two goals today to pace Boston University's defending national champion hockey team to a 61 victory over Princeton.

title: $499,621 Suit Alleges Police Aided Burglary
description: VENTURA, Calif., Dec, 11 (UPI)A homeowner has charged Police Chief David P. Geary and five of his men with permitting a burglary to take place so they could catch the burglar.

title: A Philadelphia housewife could have done better
description: Picture yourself taking off in a jet from Philadelphia. As the wheels retract a voice comes through the p.a. system: This is your Captain, Stuart Saunders. I'm in charge of your flight. Of course, I'm not in the plane because I don't like planesI'm speaking to you from my limousine on the way to a dinner party. But I'll be in charge of your flight and I'll take full responsibility for your safe arrival.

title: WHITESONLY RULE OF ELKS OPPOSED
description: MIDDLEBORO, Mass., Dec. 11A Roman Catholic priest has won the opening round of a battle with the Elks lodge here that began when he proposed an end to the whitesonly membership rule.

title: Dance
description: THE more you see of the work of Maurice Bjart, the less it seems there is to see. His concept of popballet, whatever virtues it has as theatrical staging, is choreographically held back by Bjart's own very marked limitations as a choreographer, and these limitations were all quite mercilessly exposed by the three new works he brought to New York during his brief City Center season, which ended last Sunday.

title: Crash Kills Girl and 4 Boys
description: TOLEDO, Ohio, Dec. 11 (UPI)Five young people returning home from a church meeting were killed today when their automobile was struck by a Penn Central freight train at an unguarded crossing. The police identified the victims as David Myles, 17 years old, the driver; his brothers, Dean, 16, Dwight, 9, and Dennis, 13, all of Toledo; and David's girl friend, Marilyn Donbrosky, 16, of Temperance, Mich.

title: TENNESSEE STATE TAKES RICE BOWL
description: BATON ROUGE, Dec. 11 (AP) Joe Gilliam, at his best tinder pressure, threw three touchdown passes in the second half today to earn Tennessee State a 2623 victory over McNeese State in the Grantland Rice Bowl.

title: WALL STREET
description: Like everyone else, Alan R. Shaw of Harris, Upham & Co., Inc., has heard the various forecasts that the stock market, as measured by the DowJones industrial average, is headed for either 500 or 1000 or more (it closed last week at 856.75).

title: Fire Kills Girl, 16
description: A 16yearold girl identified as Yevete Nieves was killed yesterday in a fire at 313 East 95th Street. She was found in a bedroom of a fourroom apartment on the fifth floor of a sixstory building.

title: MAN IN BUSINESS
description: DETROIT  The crown prince of the General Motors Corporation has a small cartoon clipped to a frame on his desk. I don't do anything, it says, but I do it very efficiently.

title: Boise State Camellia Victor
description: SACRAMENTO, Calif., Dec. 11 (UPI)Boise State turned two fumble recoveries into touchdowns in a 25point fourthquarter today and registered a 3228 victory over Chico State in the annual Camellia Bowl.

title: Toledo Approves Site of Convention For Wallace Party
description: TOLEDO, Ohio, Dec. 11The Toledo Area Convention Bureau's board has announced that the American Independent party, sometimes called the American party, is welcome to hold its nominating convention here next spring.

title: Ben Moyer Fiance Of Frances Sykes
description: DUXBURY, Mass., Dec. 11 Mr. and Mrs. Lawrence A. Sykes of Duxbury and Harbour Island, the Bahamas, have announced the engagement of their daughter, Miss Frances Webb Sykes, to Ben L. Moyer, son of Mr. and Mrs. Benton L. Moyer Jr. of Franconia, N. H. A May wedding is planned.

title: Wider Health Care Urged for Blacks
description: NASHVILLE, Dec. 11 The first national conference on the status of health in the black community ended tonight with a demand for a countrywide comprehensive health care program and a simultaneous attack on major health concerns of black people.

title: What's Opened At the Movies?
description: BLACK BEAUTY, directed by James Hill, based on Anna Sewell's novel, is an uncommonly interesting, handsome and sometimes quite marvelously inventive movie, according to Roger Greenspun. The film's story pays frequent respects to the novel. It is much concerned with the humane treatment of horses. But its stronger interests lie elsewhere; in the romantic intensity, sharp pathos or dark humor of episodes that involve the horse but are not so much about the horse as about the various people who own it, use and cherish or betray it. Whether in the dangers of a fox hunt near the beginning or in the darkness of the local mines where Black Beauty almost ends his days, the film creates an environment that is partly time and place, but is also the understanding of a privileged vision. There is some violence in Black Beauty and also a little sex, and I can't imagine that kids would mind. Thus, Black Beauty is perhaps sexy and violent enough for kids, but pleasant and pastoral enough for their parents. At neighborhood theaters.

title: 18 of a Cycle Gang Seized with Guns At a House on S.I.
description: Eighteen youths, described as members of a motorcycle gang, were arrested in an earlymorning raid yesterday at a twofamily house on Staten Island, where the police said they seized 15 guns of various kinds and a number of knives.

title: About Pro Football
description: Tomorrow night's pro football game has been built into something extra because of the return of George Allen to the home of his former team, the Los Angeles Rams. Coach Allen's present team the Washington Redskins, play the Rams in the Coliseum before a national television audience beginning at 9 o'clock New York time. I think a lot of our players think a great deal of George Allen and I'm sure that some of them are offended by him. said Tommy Prothro, the Ram coach who succeeded Allen. Prothro put the personality issue into proper perspective. Coaching is not a popularity contest.

title: Earlier Flights Barred By SYDNEY H. SCHANBERG
description: CALCUTTA, India. Dec. 11Pakistan refused to let British and Canadian evacuation planes land in besieged Dacca, today, leaving more than 500 foreigners in the East Pakistani capital trapped as potential hostages.

title: Recouping Sundries
description: You find them somewhere near the bottom of hotel billslittle items called sundries or miscellaneous or some such. They generally total between 1 and 3 per cent of the bill, and most hotel guests pay without a grumble. Not so a group of New York, Chicago, Miami and West Coast lawyers who earlier this year filed suits in Federal courts against more than 600 hotels and hotel chains. Their charge: Sundries doesn't stand for anything. Their goal: Recovery of these improper charges for every guest who's stayed in the hotels.

title: Set in the mind of a prisoner
description: Sol Yurick in an Evergreen Review essay on Hubert Selby's first novel, Last Exit to Brooklyn, wrote: The terrible and subversive thing that Selby has done is to make us feel [his] world by stimulating us sexually, and once straight people have been moved to react sexually in straight ways by descriptions of inversion the whole world of engineerreality begins to seem a little weird, itself inverted. The new tragic emotions are violence and sex. Were they ever really pity and terror?

title: Lower East Side Is Split by Rehabilitation Proposal
description: The question of who best represents the 190,000 residents of the racially, ethnically and economically diverse Lower East Side remains unanswered after months of raucous public meetings and quiet private conferences, after claims and counterclaims by various groups and after much namecalling and pleas for a compromise.

title: Anne Bromley Engaged
description: PHILADELPHIA, Dec. 11 Mrs. John Brittain and John Bromley Jr. have announced the engagement of their daughter, Miss Anne Barton. Bromley, to Charles Gellaty Crosby. He is the son of Mrs. Harold J. Crosby of Easton, Conn.,

title: EXECUTIVE'S DEATH STUDIED IN JERSEY
description: HILLSBOROUGH TOWNSHIP, N. J., Dec. 11 (AP)The Somerset County Prosecutor described the death by fire of a Bell Telephone executive inside his flaming auto here yesterday as suspicious and said the police were investigating the possibility of homicide.

title: 9 Areas Eligible for Aid
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 11 (AP) 6Agricultural Secretary Earl L. Butz designated this week nine more Louisiana parishes where residents are eligible for Federal emergency loans because of hurricane damage in September.

title: Plans for a Superhighway on the Left Bank Gain in Paris Municipal Council Depite Strong Opposition
description: PARIS, Dec. 11The Paris Municipal Council has just made another reluctant surrender to the automobile with somewhat anguished approval of the beginnings of an expressway along the Left Bank, through some of the most historic sections of the city.

title: Stricken Subcontinent
description: The third IndianPakistani war appears to be heading toward an early end with victory for Indian arms in East Bengal and apparent failure of the Pakistanis to make serious inroads on the western front. But even with victory, the Indians, who never fail to set themselves up as apostles of peace, will find that the prospects are dim for conditions that will lead to enduring peace on the stricken subcontinent.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor: In your Dec. 4 editorial War on the Subcontinent, as usual you repeat old arguments and blame the Government of Pakistan for brutal repression of its own people. Your newspaper has consistently portrayed India as the champion of freedom and democracy and Pakistan as the villain. Nevertheless, it would take strange logic to justify Indian actions, such as the drive into East Pakistan, as an instrument for solving the present refugee problem. Wars, curiously enough, provide no, means of refuge rehabilitationin fact they create more refugees.

title: MADISON AVE.
description: Now it looks as if Congress and the President have stopped battling each other over a bill to limit the amount of money to be used in political campaigns.

title: Volunteers Needed
description: FREEPORT, L.I.The Long Island Humane Society is in need of volunteer helpers and workers. The organization, at Hanse Avenue and Rider Place here, recently completed a new addition to its building to care for more animals brought in for adoption. Interested parties may call the society at (516) FR 84340.

title: VIRGINIA COLLEGE SCORED ON OUSTER
description: PETERSBURG, Va., Dec. 11.A controversy has broken out at Virginia State College, a predominantly black institution here, over the dismissal of tenured, white professor with acknowledged rightwing views.

title: MASSACHUSETTS U. WIDENS ITS SCOPE
description: BOSTON, Dec. 5The University of Massachusetts plans an ambitious program of change designed to develop a new model of the public university of the nineteenseventies emphasizing undergraduate education and public service.

title: Music
description: FOR a while the letters were coming in steadily, all on one subject: the monstrous thing Pierre Boulez was doing to the Philharmonic, and the monstrous thing the Philharmonic was doing to its subscribers. Some of the complaints approached hate mail, and the sad thing was that very few wrote in approving of the Philharmonic's stand. One would have expected a certain percentage to come to the Philharmonic's defense; perhaps the young people to whom Boulez has always appealed. But no. If ever a proportion was lopsided, this was it.

title: CALIFORNIA FACES DISTRICTING SNAG
description: SACRAMENTO, Calif., Dec. 11  The state of California, whose Legislature failed to produce legislative and Congressional reapportionment plans after 11 months of effort, now faces the prospect of competing plans and an almost certain State Supreme Court battle.

title: Cambodians Retreat From Hill Near Pnompenh's Defense Line
description: PNOMPENH, Cambodia, Dec. 11 (Reuters)Cambodian troops today evacuated a hill commanding Pnompenh's northern defensive perimeter only eight miles outside the city.

title: SPARKMAN FACES WOMAN OPPONENT
description: MONTGOMERY, Ala., Dec. 11 Alabama's State Auditor, Mrs. Melba Till Allen, has announced that she will oppose Alabama's senior United States Senator, John J. Sparkman, next spring in the Democratic primary.

title: Freetex, Eager Exchange Run Dead Heat in $105,350 Stakes at Liberty Bell
description: PHILADELPHIA, Dec. 11Coming from last as he left the backstretch Middletown Stables's Freetex raced to a dead heat with John D. March's Eager Exchange in the Heritage Stakes today at Liberty Bell. The odd result made the 1 1/16mile race for 2yearolds the richest race in Pennsylvania history.

title: Auckland Uranium Reported
description: ROTORUA, New Zealand, Dec. 11 (Reuter)Uranium has been found on the remote and uninhabited Auckland Islands, 850 miles south of New Zealand's southern tip, a mining firm has announced. Australasian Mining and Oil Investments said that samples of the findthe second of uranium in New Zealandwere being tested. Uranium was discovered on South Island in 1955, but mining there has not proved economically feasible.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: Drama Mailbag
description: TO THE EDITOR:

title: Court Action Likely As OTB Prepares For Florida Betting
description: Unless a threatened court injunction blocks it, the Offtrack Betting Corporation will begin accepting separatepool wagers tomorrow on thoroughbred races at Tropical Park in Florida.

title: Forest Hills Is Last in Capital Funds
