description: Of the city's 62 planning districts, the Forest Hills section of Queens is scheduled to receive the smallest amount of money for capital improvements over the next five years, according to the proposed 197273 capital budget made public, last week.

title: Public Role Is Urged in Power Plant Site Decisions
description: A group of engineers and environmentalists, in a study just published by the California Institute of Technology, has concluded that there is a crying need for greater public participation in decisions concerning where to build new electric power plants so they will have the least impact on the environment.

title: FLORIDIANS LOSE TO PACERS, 10596
description: INDIANAPOLIS, Dec. 11 (UPI)  Fred Lewis scored 32 points to lead the Indiana Pacers to a 10596 American Basketball Association victory over the Floridians tonight.

title: Queens High School Aims at Training Blacks for the Aviation Industry
description: In 1968, August Martin, pilot flying for the international Red Cross, was killed trying to land his Super Constellation on a makeshift airfield while taking emergency supplies to Biafra during the Nigerian civil war.

title: Suddenly, the End
description: In Ravenna, Ohio, the courthouse was quiet, the lawyers, reporters and onlookers departed. On the nearby Kent State University campus, where classes were in full swing, there was a kind of bitter relief. The final official words had been said on the tragedy that engulfed the university 19 months ago when four students died and nine were injured by the bullets of National Guardsmen.

title: Guidebooks As Christmas Presents
description: THE purpose of a good guidebook is to help you to stay as far away as possible from the American Express office. At least that's the way I see it. And with that as my principal criterion, here, just in time for Christmas, is a personal appraisal of the leading guidebooks to Europe.

title: The search for the truth about day care
description: WAITING lists at daycare centers in some areas are eight times the capacity, and new centersgood to indifferent  are opening all over the country. But despite all this apparent enthusiasm, day care has its doubtersincluding many of this country's most respected childcare experts.

title: Army Belts Hofstra, 7864
description: WEST, POINT, N. Y. Dec. 11 Army outscored Hofstra, 2414, over the last eight minutes tonight and posted a 7864 victory over the Flying Dutchmen, who suffered their third straight loss and the fourth in five games. Army now has a wonlost record of 32.

title: Strikes Foreseen here it U.S. Blocks Rent Increases Jan. 1
description: Landlord and union leaders warned yesterday of a Bronx apartment workers' strike Jan. 1 and a Manhattan strike possibly later if Federal rent controls prevented increases due Jan. 1 under the city's current rent controls.

title: Vietnam Expert's Bid Stirs Chicago U.
description: CHICAGO, Dec. 11The president of the University of Chicago rejected this week charges that Gerald C. Hickey, an expert on Vietnam, had been denied an academic appointment because of his association with the Rand Corporation, a private research organization under contract to the Defense Department.

title: Television
description: IF that particular image doesn't grab you, try another channel. Anything is possible in the wide, wide world of television. Oddly enough, few things are predictableexcept perhaps a wide, wide spectrum of mediocrity. And, given the tube's astounding capacity to consume material, that is inevitable.

title: The Last Word: Prisoners In, Books Out
description: What do Oscar Lewis, Marshall McLuhan, Erik Erikson, Arthur Koestler and the United Nations Declaration on Human Rights have in common? Imagine what these titles share: The Jefferson Bible, the Blackstone Law Course, Psychology Today, National Geographic, newsletters of the Mattachine and Fortune Societies, Koestler's The Ghost Machine, Gay's The Enlightenment, Ferkiss' Technological Man, Kaslow's The Changeless Order, Carison's Modern Biology, Matson's Being,. Becoming and Behavior, Levitas's Culture and Consciousness, Erikson's Youth and Crisis, LeviStrauss' The Savage Mind, Von Bertalanffy's Robots, Men and Minds, Moorehead's The Fatal Impact, Friedman's To Deny Our Nothingness, Jung's Man and His Symbols, McLuhan's Understanding Media, Langer's Mind: An Essay on Human: Feeling, Bettelheim's The Empty Fortress, Lewis's La Vida, Silberman's Crisis in Black and White, Edwards's The Rape India, Sinclair's The Cry for Justice, and Zaidenberg's The Emotional Self. They are contraband reading in New York State prisons, and are some of the titles listed in a brief filed by lawyers of the. American Civil Liberties Union on behalf prisoners in the penitentiaries at Auburn, Stormville and Attica.

title: Schmitt of Jets Is a OneMan Crusade Against Drugs
description: If Joe Namath were taking drugs, a boy in the second row asked, would the coach kick him off the team?

title: President Reappoints C.A.B. Vice Chairman
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 11 (UPI) President Nixon announced today the reappointment of Whitney Gillilland to a sixyear term cn the Civil Aeronautics Board and redesignated him vice chairman.

title: Spurious AllAmerica Teams
description: Two allAmerica football teams published in last Sunday's New York Times were submitted by spurious sources. The selections were erroneously attributed to the Walter Camp Foundation and a Dayton Daily News poll. No such teams were chosen.

title: City Manager Post Seems on Way Out in Long Beach
description: LONG BEACH, L.I.The city manager form of government, billed as the perfect combination of democracy and efficiency, and making increasingly more appearances in municipalities across the country, appears to be about to bow out from its one Long Island showcase.

title: General Bars Surrender
description: DACCA, Pakistan, Dec. 11Lieut. Gen. A. A. K. Niazi, military commander of East Pakistan, told newsmen today that you will see my dead body, or alive I'll go forward. His statement lessened hopes of surrender before the Dacca battle is joined by advancing Indian troops.

title: The Nation
description: WASHINGTON  Should mothers work? An engrossing moral question, perhaps, but somewhat academic. More than 11 million mothers, many with young children, already work and their numbers are growing steadily.

title: Rees Subdue Pistons
description: DETROIT, Dec. 11 (UPI)Philadelphia pulled away from Detroit for good by scoring 8 straight points in the middle of the fourth period tonight and Bill Bridges and Billy Cunningham led the way as the 76ers beat the Pistons, 118111.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: May I call attention to the amendment of the regulations of the Housing and Development Administration regarding eligibility for tax abatement and exemption for major capital improvement of rentcontrolled properties.

title: DOLPHINS BEATEN, 143, DROP TO 2D
description: BALTIMORE, Dec. 11Playing nearperfect football in a game we wanted so bad, we can't describe it, the Baltimore Colts whipped the Miami Dolphins, 14.3, today and stormed into first place in the American Conference's Eastern Division.

title: Judith Simon Affianced
description: NORTH BALDWIN, L. I., Dec. 11Mr. and Mrs. Albert Simon have announced the engagement of their daughter, Miss Judith Carole Simon, to Lawrence Mark Gross, on of Mr. and Mrs. Murray S. Gross of North Woodmere. Miss Simon and her fianc are seniors at Hofstra University.

title: Nebraska's Football Aides Rewarded With Pay Raises
description: LINCOLN, Neb., Dec. 11 (AP) University of Nebraska regents today rewarded football Coach Bob Devaney's assistants with pay raises ranging up to $1,500 a year, and gave the goahead also for a 9,400seat addition to Memorial Stadium.

title: Dominican Five Wins First
description: COLUMBUS, Ohio, Dec. 11 (AP)Ohio Dominican College's basketball team defeated Bluffton College, 91.88, today to register its first victory against three defeats this season.

title: Nixon's Too LeftWing For William Loeb
description: FOR years William Loeb, the publisher of New Hampshire's most powerful news source, The Manchester Union Leader, worked hard for Richard Nixon. Beginning in 1956, when he conducted a national popularity poll to stop the dumpNixon movement begun in New Hampshire by Harold Stassen, through 1968, when his newspaper undercut George Romney's challenge, Loeb has been as solid as New Hampshire granite for the President. Until 1968, his efforts paid few dividends; the White House was occupied by a succession of men who seemed to Loeb to turn the country over to softheaded intellectuals and black rioters while they devised plans to have the Soviet Union annex the United States.

title: Movies
description: HOLLYWOOD

title: Sports of The Times
description: The first time the oversize Bubba Smith of the Baltimore Colts played against Roger Staubach of the Dallas Cowboys, the 295pound defensive terror offered an observation that others have been echoing ever since.

title: Royals Advance to 2d
description: Cincinnati, Dec. 11 (AP)Nate Archibald poured in 26 points tonight as the Cincinnati Royals stemmed two late charges by the Cleveland Cavaliers to win, 103.95, and take over second place in the Central Division.

title: Lady Day and Peggy Lee
description: RECENTLY, Bessie Smith was introduced to the Rock generation through a series of wellpublicized record reissues, and now Billie Holiday appears to be headed for a similar revival. While several record companies are busy repackaging their Holiday catalogs, the small ESP label has come up with a unique release of unissued radio airchecks, TV performances, and night club appearances made by Lady Day between 1949 and 1952. Titled, The Lady Lives (ESP 3002), this collection picks up Miss Holiday's career as she was ending her long association with Decca Records, a company that seemed intent on converting her into A superstar cranking out million sellers.

title: Smith Downs Graebner in Paris, Will Play Nastase for Top Prize
description: PARIS, Dec. 11Stan Smith almost tripped over the lastplace player today on the way to his deciding match against Ilie Nastase of Rumania in the $50,000 Pepsi Masters tennis tournament.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: Dr. Paul Dudley White's praise of the Chinese Communist revolution for accomplishments in the field of public health (0pEd Dec. 5) is naive, unscientific and misleading.

title: Pleasing To the Palate
description: Judging by the fall flood of cookbooks, the kitchenhelper branch of the publishing industry is alive and well.

title: Into the hive of her anger
description: When Inside the Blood Factory was published in 1968, it was clear that in the poetry of Diane Wakoski a new sort of energy had been tapped. A fierce impulse toward confession and autobiography moved through her poems, but it took unexpected detours into an imagery of elusive beasts, colors and bizarre precious stones. The me she confessed to was not contained by situations; it was not an object of complaint. Although her poems were stirred by angers and fears, they did not include gestures toward suicide, the madhouse or the pill bottle. Instead, she confessed to the hippogriff in her soul, which carried her like an exulting spirit among the men who loved her, or betrayed her. The blend of exotic shards and swift spoken language was often startling, as in Blue Monday:

title: State's Democrats to Ask to Let Delegate Aspirants Tell Choices
description: John J. Burris, Democratic state chairman, announced yesterday that the state committee would ask the courts to permit candidates for delegate from this state to the party's national convention next year to list their preferences for the Presidential nomination on the June primary ballot.

title: Holiday Cheer
description: The more joyful the season, the more poignant the lot of those who must take part in the holiday atmosphere with neither the wherewithal nor the spirit to rejoice. New York has perhaps more than its share of the neglected, the abandoned, the afflicted, the desperate. But if The New York Times Neediest Cases is a criterion, the city likewise has more than its share of the thoughtful and the generous. Last year, for the first time in the history of these annual campaigns, Times readers contributed more than a million dollars, every cent of which was, as always, spent on behalf of the Neediest themselves.

title: FORDHAM DOWNS LAFAYETTE, 8115
description: Fordham has a new coach, but still lacks the big man and makes up for it with the pressing and patient basketball style it employed last season to excite New York when it posted a 263 wonlost record.

title: Research Lab Creating Sonic Booms on Order
description: BALDERSHEIM, France, Dec. 3Unborn chickens do not seem to mind the bang of the Concorde supersonic airliner. But to the human ear; it is something like the unexpected blast of both barrels of a shotgun held a few inches away.

title: Ohio State Bows, 7968
description: ATHENS, Ohio, Dec. 11 (AP) Ohio University upset fourthranked Ohio State, 7968, in college basketball today.

title: Louisiana Tech Wins
description: WICHITA FALLS, Tex., Dec. 11 (UPI)Wenford Wilborn, a freshman cornerback, ran 91 yards on a punt return and sparked the Louisiana Tech Bulldogs Eastern over Easte Michigan, 143, in the first Pioneer Bowl today.

title: Involvement Is Not Just A Cliche At Pratt
description: At Pratt Institute, community involvement is not just a catchwordit's part of the curriculum.

title: A Peking department store.
description: Will we ever understand China? In they century after the Opium War of 1839 increasing numbers of foreign diplomats, businessmen, missionaries, educators, students and soldiers lived there. Even so, the task was difficult. Since coming to power in 1949, however, the Chinese Communists have sharply reduced opportunities for foreigners to reside in China. They have carefully limited the travel of shortterm visitors. And they have imposed such rigid control on information and contact that foreign observers in Peking have for months remained ignorant of dramatic major events that occurred almost under their noses.

title: SHOW SCHEDULE CHANGED AT SECOR
description: Secor Farms in White Plains will hold its first winter indoor horse show today but this year there will not be a monthly series of shows.

title: The World
description: Last May, 91 former Egyptian officials were arrested and accused of conspiring to overthrow President Anwar elSadat. Ostensibly, they objected to Mr. Sadat's decision to link Egypt with Syria and Libya in a federation; but they also were known to oppose the President's policies toward a peaceful settlement with Israel and they resented their loss of influence after their leader, President Gamal Abdel Nasser, died.

title: Heard and Jane Blalock Cited for Golf Progress
description: Two tour golfers, Jerry Heard and Jane Blalock, have been named the most improved professional golfers by Golf Digest magazine.

title: Geraldine Ruggieri Engaged to a Student
description: Mr. and Mrs. Frank Ruggierl of Fresh Meadows, Queens, and Ocean City, N. J., have announced the engagement of their daughter, Miss Geraldine Patricia Ruggieri, to Charles Alexander Gordon 2d, son of Mr. and Mrs. Charles Edwin Gordon of Fresh Meadows. The wedding is planned for May.

title: Home Improvement
description: ALTHOUGH most people find that painting walls and ceilings is a relittively siniple doitProject (due primarily to the Widespread use of latek paints and easytouse rollers or pad type applicators), many still have not mastered the technique of doing a smooth job of patching cracks and small holes so that they do not show through to mar the finished appearance of the freshly painted surfaces.

title: D. J. Monti. Jr. to Marry Miss Nuckolls
description: HAMDEN, Conn., Dec. 11  Mrs. Katherine B. Nuckolls, chairman of the pediatric nursing program at the Yale School of. Nursing, has announced the engagement of her daughter, Miss Katherine Lane Nuckolls, to Daniel J. Monti Jr., son of Mr. and Mrs. Monti of Maywood, N. J. The wedding is planned for Jan. 1 at the home here of the mother of the bridetobe.

title: The World
description: In Calcutta last Thursday, a Britishtrained Indian general gave a terse description of the enemy rout in East Pakistan: When you get outmaneuvered and feel you are going to get beaten badly, a chap says, Let me get the hell out of here and see if I can fight in another place.

title: Stephan Jespersen To Wed Elaine Tate
description: STAMFORD, Conn., Dec. 11Announcement has been made by Mr. and Mrs. William H. Tate of the engagement of their daughter, Miss Elaine Ann Tate, to Stephan E. Jespersen, son of Mrs. Jack William Jespersen and the late Mr. Jespersen, who was a chemist with ChesebroughPonds Inc., here.

title: INDIAN POINT FIRE ASSESSED BY CONED
description: The Consolidated Edison Company reported yesterday that damage caused by a suspicious fire five weeks ago at its new 873.000kilowatt nuclear power plant at Indian Point, N. Y., would cost nearly $5million and require nearly three months to repair.

title: EDWARD M'LOUGHLIN, BROOKLYN LAWYER
description: Edward McLoughlin, State Deputy Superintendent of Insurance from 1933 to 1942 who practiced law in Brooklyn 43 years, died yesterday at his home at 612 Third Street Brooklyn. His age was 68.

title: Kabul Seeks to Cut Smoking
description: KABUL, Afghanistan, Dec. 11 (AP)  The Government has banned radio cigarette commercials in an attempt to curb smoking, but it has allowed cigarette ads In newspapers to continue.

title: Cowboys Favored Over Giants Today
description: The Dallas Cowboys, driving for their sixth straight divisional championship, are heavily favored to defeat the New York Giants by a comfortable margin at Yankee Stadium today at 1 P.M.

title: AppalachiaLike The Flayed Back of a Man
description: LEXINGTON, Ky. DAN GIBSON sold his squirrel gun last month. He sold it for $30 and an old British .303 Enfield to two of his young admirers. Gun buying, trading or swapping is less than unusual in the hills of eastern Kentucky, but Dan Gibson's rifle and what he did with it a few years ago are unusual. With only that rifle as a companion, Gibson, who is in his 80's, stood off 17 state policemen and a coalmining company. He held them off because the miners were going to stripmine his soninlaw's property and the state police were there to back them up. He was finally arrested, but not before he had won his point. The strip miners did not come back.

title: IRAQI JEWS LEAVE IN A STEADY FLOW
description: BAGHDAD, Iraq, Dec. 3It's so terribly lonely here now, an aging Iraqi Jew said, tears coming to his eyes. He has sent his family abroad and hopes to follow soon.

title: OIL TANK DEPOTS SOUGHT IN MAINE
description: SEARSPORT, Me., Dec. 11A Canadian oil refining and marketing company plans to build oil storage tanks here and at Bucksport.

title: WORLD OF SEVENTH AVE.
description: Qiana, a silklike fiber In the nylon family, has come into the wideuse area of manmade fibers, Carl E. Black of E. I. du Pont de Nemours & Co., Inc., said last week. More and more, the fiber is going into apparel fabrics, and particularly knit fabrics, he said.

title: Wood, Field and Stream
description: BOSTONThis year, a 9pound  5  Ounce landlocked salmon was caught in Quabbin Reservoir, three more slightly larger salmon were picked up in the nets of the biologists working on the Quabbin this fall and James M. Shepard, director of the state's Division of Fisheries and Game, is elated.

title: Thirty Years Of Treason
description: While editors all over town were busy hunting new talent via old agents, a genius over at Viking Press had the wit to enlist Brechtscholar Eric Bentley to dip into the public domain and give us Thirty Years of Treason: Excerpts from Hearings Before the House Committee on UnAmerican Activities 19381968. At $20 a book, this particular piece of public domain costs the public approximately 6636 cents a year, but given the high cost of dynamite it is cheap at the price.

title: Chess
description: THE Benoni Defense, Boris Spassky, Soviet chess champion of the world, versus 50,000 readers of a juvenile paper in the U.S.S.R., leads with an exciting and dynamic partie from first move to the end. Commentaries are by Spassky as they appear in the United States Chess Federation's publication, Chess Life and Review.

title: Marjory T. Frankenfelder Is Engaged
description: MAMARONECK, N. Y., Dec. 11 Mrs. Richard Frankenfelder has announced the engagement of her daughter, Miss Marjory Toch Frankenfelder, to Steven Randolph Bleier, son of Mr. and Mrs. Richard M Bleier of Chappuma.

title: Miss Barnette Wed To Robert S. Bruce
description: KIRKWOOD, Mo., Dec. 11 Miss Betsey Barnette of Brentwood, daughter of Mrs. Lawrence B. Myers of Tonawanda, N. Y., and the late Kenneth A. Barnette, was married here this afternoon to Robert S. Bruce of Rolla, son of Mr. and Mrs. Robert D. Bruce of El Dorado Springs.

title: Interne to Wed Enid Cardozo, Student of Law
description: Mr. and Mrs. Benjamin M. Cardozo of 177 East 75th Street and Westport, Conn., have announced the engagement of their daughter, Miss Enid Cardozo, to Dr. Edward Lamon, son of Mr. and Mrs. Isaac Lamon of Larchmont, N. Y. Dr. Lamon's father is an investment banker.

title: L. I. Teacher's Body Found
description: GARDEN CITY, L. I., Dec. 11 The body of a woman, who taught second grade in was Oceanside public schools, as found last night on the tracks of the Long Island Rail Road. The Nassau County police said Mrs. Lorraine Kaye, 54 years old, of 49 Brixton Road South, Garden City. South, had apparently been struck by the westbound train that left the Nassau Boulevard Station at 8:56 P.M.

title: The World
description: A year has passed since Edward, Gierek took power in Poland as Communist party chief in the wake of economic riots in three port cities. It has been a largely successful year, and last week at the sixth party congress in Warsaw  attended by all the Communist bloc leaders, including Leonid Brezhnev of Russia  Mr. Gierek received what amounted to a vote of confidence.

title: Television
description: COMPARED to writing, doing TV sports news is not as satisfying in any way except as ego gratification, said Dick Schaap, the NBC (Channel 4) entry into the New York area 6 o'clock and 11 o'clock contests for the news freak audience. A waitress in the Americana Hotel coffee shop, where Schaap was waiting until Muhammad All arrived for a press conference upstairs, flashed a slip of paper on which she had scrawled, Dick Shaap [sic]. Schaap nodded. You're terrific, she remarked and moved off.

title: The World
description: The ideological squabble between the Soviet Union and Communist China burst into full public view the United Nations last week during the IndiaPakistan debate. The invective reached the point where the Chinese delegate, Huang Rua, referred to the Soviet delegate, Yakov Malik, as Mister rather than Comrade, an especially cutting insult among Communists. Following are some of the, exchanges, reflecting the image (see above) each side has of the other:

title: Dunne Ruffles the G.O.P. Leadership
description: MINEOLA, L. I.State Senator John R. Dunne of Garden City is probably the best known Nassau Republican throughout the state but it is unlikely that he is the Nassau Republican most likely to succeed in statewide politics.

title: MET'S SAMSON WELL PERFORMED
description: Is there any justification for giving SaintSans' Samson et Dalila today? After seeing the Metropolitan Opera's revival on Friday night, well produced and performed though it was, the answer is no.

title: TULSA CONQUERS LA SALLE 80 TO 77
description: PHILADELPHIA, Dec. 11 (AP)Tulsa had to struggle to defeat La Salle, 8077, and record its fourth straight, victoffy tonight in the opener of a college basketball doubleheader at the Palestra.

title: Eloise R. See Married
description: WESTPORT, Conn., Dec. 11Miss Eloise Randolph See and Robert Edward McGaw Jr., son of Mr. and Mrs. McGaw of Windsor, N. C., were married here this afternoon. The Rev. Charles W. Stubbs and the Rev. Theodore Hoskins, officiated at the ceremony in the Sauga tuck Congregational Church. The bride is a daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Edgar Thorp See of Westport.

title: British Planes Begin Evacuating Foreigners From Dacca After Pakistan Lifts Bar
description: CALCUTTA, India, Sunday, Dec. 12 (UPI)About 100 tired but happy people, mostly women and children, arrived in Calcutta today, the first foreigners to be evacuated from the embattled East Pakistan capital of Dacca by shuttle of three British cargo planes.

title: MORE FUNDS SOUGHT FOR BLACK CENTER
description: STAMFORD, Conn., Dec. 11 Community leaders here hope they will be able to raise $600,000 in the near future so that, construction can begin on a projected black neighborhood center to which 1,000 donors have already contributed $1.2million.

title: HOMELAND AREAS KEY TO APARTHEID
description: PRETORIA, South Africa, Dec. 11 (Reuters)  The South African Government has completed its most important attempt yet at interracial dialogue.

title: Gierek Puts Four Younger Men on Polish Politburo
description: WARSAW, Dec. 11Edward Gierek, the leader of the Polish Communist party, offered Poland a younger, more pragmatic leadership today and said he was intent on bringing the nation into the modern age. He presented a new ruling Politburo that more accurately reflected the reformist policies he has introduced since assuming power after the economic riots last December.

title: George Henry Weiler 3d Weds Miss Winifred Ann Walker
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 11Miss Winifred Ann Walker, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Robert A. Walker of Sheffield, Ala., and George Henry Weiler 3d, son of Mr. and Mrs. Weiler Jr. of Ridgewood, N. J., Brodheadsville, Pa., and Orleans, Mass., were married here at noon today in the Great Choir of the Washington Cathedral.

title: Elizabeth L. Richardson Affianced
description: STAMFORD, Conn., Dec. 11Mr. and Mrs. Donald Tower Richardson have made known the engagement of their daughter, Miss Elizabeth Loveland Richardson, to Charles Elting Coates 3d. Ho is the son of Lieut. Col, Charles Elting Coates Jr., U.S.A., retired, and Mrs. Coates of Ipswich, Mass.

title: Ballet: Magic and Mime
description: The New York. City Ballet presented the 644th performance of George Balanchine's production of The Nutcracker Friday night at the State Theater.

title: Retarded to Get Queens Center
description: The State Department of Mental Hygiene has announced plans to establish a residential treatment facility for retarded children and adults at the former Howard Park Central Hospital in the Howard Beach section of Queens.

title: Movies
description: IN The Hellstrom Chronicle, producerdirector Walon Green zeroed in on some of the world's tiniestthough not necessarily weakestinhabitants. Now he is planning to zero out on something that is bigger than all of us: the world itself. Green's new film is titled, simply, The Universe. And that's just what it's all about. Like The Hellstrom Chronicle, the new documentary will be made for David Wolper Productions, and the cameras should start rolling early next year.

title: Nobody cares if I live or die.
description: At 21 Arthur G. is abnormally shy. He was 9 when his mother died after a long and painful illness. After her death his widowed grandmother, Mrs. Sarah D., then 64, moved in to run the home for his father and take care of Arthur and his twin brothers Joseph and Bernard, then 5, and Harry, 3. When Arthur was 14, Mrs. D. died of a stroke and Arthur had to take over the household. There was no time to make friends. Before and after school Arthur had to cook, keep house, and look after his younger brothers. Two years ago his father, a store salesman, remarried.

title: Bundle as Idealistand Realist Mourned by Thant and Wilkins
description: Dr. Ralph J. Bunche, described as both an idealist and a realist, also left an indelible memory of a wonderful man and a legacy of achievement such as few men can bequeath to history, U Thant, the United Nations General Secretary, said yesterday.

title: Big Eight to Use 6 Officials In '72 Conference Football
description: KANSAS CITY, Dec. 11 (UPI)Six football officials will work Big Eight Conference games next fall, Commissioner Chuck Neinas disclosed today at the end of the conference's annual December meetings.

title: BHUTTO SHUNNING CONTACTS AT U.N.
description: UNITED NATIONS, N. Y., Dec. 11Foreign Minister Zulfikar Ali Bhutto of Pakistan, who arrived here yesterday to press his Government's case at the United Nations, remained silent and inaccessible today as Pakistani officials disowned a proposal by a local commander in. East Pakistan for an immediate ceasefire.

title: N.H. L. Fund Earnings Dip as Brawl Market Declines
description: The frenetic, often violent, world of hockey has been in a state of virtual tranquility this season following stiffer rules and public outcries against its brutality.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: Bravo to Ada Louise Huxtable. Her recent articles are good not only for owners of historic houses but also for owners of good modern ones.

title: RANGERS TO HOST PENGUINS TONIGHT
description: The New York Rangers, unbeaten in their last 12 home I games, will play the Pittsburgh Penguins tonight at Madison Square Garden at 7:05 P.M. It will be the fourth meeting of the season between the teams.

title: 63 IS JUST SHORT OF CITY'S RECORD
description: Christmas shoppers basked in balmy weather yesterday as temperatures in the city came close to a record for the day.

title: The World
description: SAIGON  When American and South. Vietnamese troops supposedly cleaned out the enemy's Cambodian border sanctuaries a year ago last May, the Saigon Command called the invasion Operation Total Victory because it seemed like the time to start thinking about a final solution to the Communist threat from Cambodia.

title: Grey Ghost Triumphs
description: SOMERS, N. Y., Dec. 11Grey Ghost, owned by the Strathmore Farms and ridden by Ginger Burr, captured two classes and won the Open Jumper Championship with 10 points today at the Primrose Farms Horse Show.

title: Courtney Babcock Is Betrothed
description: PITTSBURGH, Dec. 11The engagement of Miss Courtney Babcock to Robert George Keough has been announced by Mr. and Mrs. Fred Courtney Babcock of Fox Chapel, parents of the futurebride. Her fiance is the son of Robert E. Keough and the late Mrs. Keough.

title: Boy, 10, Killed by Car
description: NORTH BABYLON, L.I., Dec. 11 (UPI)Tenyearold Gerald Smith was struck and killed by a car today as he tried to cross Sunrise Highway near the Belmont Avenue overpass, the Suffolk County Police reported. They said the boy, who lived here at 111 Terrace Avenue, was hit at 1 P.M. by a car driven by Antonio Firriolo, 47 years old, of 45 Beltair Avenue, in Lindenhurst.

title: Wisconsin Posts No. 4
description: MADISON, Wis., Dec. 11 (UPI)The University of Wisconsin notched its fourth victory of the season today, defeating Northern Michigan University, 10465. The losers made 29 turnovers.

title: Are You Traveling With Me, Jesus?
description: ON my travels I have discovered that I am usually making two simultaneous journeys. One is outside myself, as my eyes search landscapes through train, plane or car windows and I perhaps chat with other passengers over the dinner table. The other is inside myself, where dreams collide with facts, loneliness grapples with a nervous urge to seek relationships, and the question of my real identity overpoweringly asserts itself.

title: OIL FIND MAKES PERU OPTIMISTIC
description: LIMA, Peru, Dec. 7A glow of optimism has spread through Peru since Nov. 16, when the state oil company brought in a gusher in the western reaches of the Amazon basin.

title: Cornell Six Beats Yale
description: ITHACA, N.Y., Dec. 11 (AP) Cornell, with Jim Higgs and Bob Murray scoring two goals apiece, defeated Yale in Ivy League hockey today, 73.

title: Auto Makers Are Changing the Way They Advertise Horsepower
description: DETROIT, Dec. 11A new California law has led to a nationwide change in the way automobile horsepower is advertised.

title: Hempstead Offers Dogs for Adoption
description: WANTAGH, L. I.Hempstead Town's annual adoptapuppy campaign has been launched by the town's animal shelter warden, Anthony J. Ferrara.

title: COLLEAGUES LAUD AN EXEDUCATOR
description: More than 500 former educational colleagues and students called Abraham H. Lass back after nearly two years' retirement yesterday to honor him at a testimonial luncheon at the Plaza Hotel.

title: CHILE SUSPENDS A RADIO STATION
description: SANTIAGO, Chile, Dec. 11Chile's leftwing Government suspended broadcasting today by the radio station of the opposition Christian Democratic party.

title: Super Wave Is Selected HorseofYear in Canada
description: TORONTO, Dec. 11 (Canadian Press)Super Wave, winner of a record $481,293 in his fouryear racing career, has been named harnesshorseof1971 in the annual poll of race secretaries by the Canadian Trottirig Association.

title: BAGARUER DUNDEE WINS AT YONKERS
description: YONKERS, Dec. 11If it is not a Canadian driver, it's a Canadianowned horse who is dominating the spotlight at Yonkers Raceway and tonight was no different. With Herve Filion sitting this one out, the featured Queens Trot, a onemile handicap test for junior freeforallers and class AA staandardbreds, went to Bagaruer Dundee.

title: Police Sergeant Suspended On Charge of Free Meals
description: A police sergeant with 14 years' service was suspended without pay yesterday for allegedly accepting money and food from a Queens, restaurant owner, the police reported.

title: Rainyweather cheer
description: How does one offset London's miserable weather, particularly the dreary rainy autumns and winters? Mary Gilliat, the design writer and decorator, turned her back on the light garden colors usually associated with English interiors and chose a sophisticated palette of reds, oranges, browns and dark greens for her 1850 London townhouse. The warmth of the color scheme is enhanced by the rich textural variety provided by felt, cotton and paper wall coverings. Strong patterns and an abundance of glass, opaque plastic and Plexiglas keep the rooms from any feeling of heaviness. Lighting is a blend of spotlights and recessed lights, some beamed up, others downwith a minimum of lamps and visible fixtures.

title: Youth:
description: LOS ANGELESStudents are more reflective these days, a faculty member at Indiana University said recently. They know that running down to the courthouse and protesting won't change much, and that sitting by a babbling brook in a meadow won't change much either. They want to be realistically progressive.

title: PRINCESS TO OPEN SHOW IN LONDON
description: Princess Margaret will officially open the International Boat Show at London's Earls Court Jan. 5. The Princess, who does quite a lot of holiday boating, will then tour the exhibition.

title: Adam Heyman Will Wed Joanne Parker
description: Mr. and Mrs. Irving Parker of New York and Harrison, N. Y., have announced the engagement of their daughter, Miss Joanne Parker, to Adam C. Heyman, son of Mr. and Mrs. I. George Heyman of New York.

title: IN THE NATION
description: CHATTANOOGA, Tenn.Last September, one of the boys living at the Residential Youth Center in the old Southside Y. M. C. A. here came home despondent. He had been kicked out of school for wearing no socks.

title: Books:
description: The American Kennel Club officially sanctioned junior showmanship this year, standardizing the rules. The activity, which in the past has been shunted from ring to ring, finally became a recognized part of a dog show. So this book takes on added significance. It traces the history of junior showmanship from the late nineteentwenties and tells how what was once a novel contest for children has developed into a highly competitive and sophisticated competition.

title: Boston U. Sextet Wins
description: PRINCETON, N. J., Dec. 11 (AP)Ric Jordan scored two goals to lead Boston University to a 61 rout of the Princeton hockey team in Baker Ring today. The victory was the Terriers' fourth without a loss. They have one tie.

title: FM Station on East End Tries to Stop Unwanted Serenades
description: NORTH SEA, L. I.A sixweekold FM station here is working to correct its interference with television sets of nearby residents who complain they are receiving lullabies with their football games.

title: Reproduction Is All
description: The fame of three illuminated manuscripts and a great example of their oriental counterpart, the picture scroll, Would make critical comment on the originals redundant here even if their celestial esthetic level did not make it impertinent. What we are concerned with is the quality of reproductions in which the publishers have striven for facsimile accuracy.

title: Miss Margaret Willing Hare Married to Spencer Davidson
description: Miss Margaret Willing Hare and Spencer A. Davidson were married here yesterday afternoon in Grace Episcopal Church by the Rev. Timothy B. Cogan.

title: Fleet of 100 Yachts Expected to Compete in SydneytoHobart Race
description: A fleet of more than 100 yachts is expected to participate in this year's SydneytoHobart ocean race, Australia's major bluewater event. The 680mile contest will start on Dec. 26.

title: Rockets Sink Cougars
description: DENVER, Dec. 11 (AP)The Denver Rockets raced to a 20point lead early in the final quarter tonight, then withstood a Carolina rally to post a 130125 victory over the Cougars.

title: Leone Calls for the Internment Of Addicts in War on Violent Crime
description: Brooklyn Borough President Sebastian Leone has called for a crackdown on violent crime by interning hardcore narcotics addicts in treatment camps and arming police with shotguns if that's what they need.

title: The Nation
description: WASHINGTONAs the first session of the 92d Congress sputtered to conclusion, expected early this week, the Democraticcontrolled legislature was something like a dispirited football team at halftime. Its running and passing game had been thwarted and its opponent, that Republican squad down at the White House, was tearing gaping holes in its line.

title: Customs Checks Pier Backlog for Drugs
description: The United States Customs Service has put almost all of its 400man waterfront inspection force here on overtime to search for contraband in the backlog of about 60 ships still tied up in the port in the aftermath of the dock strike.

title: Jehovah's Witnesses To Oppose Tax Move
description: The Watchtower Bible and Tract Society, better known as the Jehovah's Witnesses, has announced that it will resist efforts by the city to put its Brooklyn Heights real estate holdings on tax rolls.

title: Big Ten Game Means Big Time for Toledo
description: TOLEDO, Ohio, Dec. 11 (AP)Toledo, undefeated and ranked No. 13, has cracked the Sig Ten football schedule. A game with Minnesota has been set for Sept. 16, 1978.

title: Rockets Edge Suns, 111110
description: PHOENIX, Ariz., Dec. 11 (AP)  Calvin Murphy and Elvin Hayes pumped in 24 points apiece tonight as the Houston Rockets turned back the Phoenix Suns, 111110.

title: Unemployed Samaritan Tends To Needs of Inmates in Brooklyn
description: The radio that blares soul music to the inmates working in the steamy kitchen of the Men's House of Detention in Brooklyn is Joseph Dunay's.

title: Toward Dignity
description: They make up 10 per cent of the national population and cast 17 per cent of the vote in 1968, but the aged have had limited political clout on the national level. Last week, there was an Indication that they are beginning to be heard. President Nixon, in a special message to Congress, asked the lawmakes to help selfreliant Americans piepare to live out their retirement years with independence and dignity.

title: FOREIGN AFFAIRS
description: BRUSSELSDespite reaffirmations of allied unity, increasing signs of neglect evinced, by the United States toward NATO deeply distress many of its members who rely heavily on American leadership. Because of their longer experience of international involvement they are perhaps more aware than Americans that old allies, like old soldiers, can simply fade away.

title: New York
description: Remember the 20cent subway token? It was about the size of a dimealmost identical, actually, to the German pfennig. Before the slots were changed two years ago to accommodate the 30cent, quartersized token, thousands of pfennigs were tossed into the turnstiles by New Yorkers trying to beat the system. Last week, New Yorkers learned that the old 20cent token may soon be making a comeback, only this time it will retail for 35 cents. The Metropolitan Transportation Authority, which runs the subways and buses, revealed that if the fare goes up to 35 cents, the old tokens are going to come out of the warehouse where 30 Million of them are now in safekeeping. And Governor Rockefeller said he was intending to present the Legislature with a fare package guaranteed to turn that if into when.

title: EUROPEANS TO STRESS WORKING SATELLITES
description: PARIS, Dec. 11 (AP)The 10 member states of the European Space Research Organization have reached agreement here on a future program based on application satellitesfunctional units rather than research efforts.

title: Miss Yinkey Fiancee of C.C. Moore 2d
description: WILTON, Conn., Dec. 11Miss Elizabeth Woods Yinkey and Clement Clarke Moore 2d plan to be married here on Jan. 15.

title: Lewis Gets Title Shot Tuesday
description: LOS ANGELES, Dec. 11Hedgemon Lewis is a 25yearold black fighter who, on Tuesday night at the Forum here, will try to take the welterweight title from Jose Napoles.

title: Apollo Rocket to Be Moved
description: CAPE KENNEDY, Fla., Dec. 11 (AP)The Apollo 16 rocket launching pad tomorrow for a threemonth checkout leading to a March 17 blastoff to the moon. The threeandonehalfmile trip is expected to take about six hours.

title: EUROPE REBUFFS U.S. TRADE PLAN
description: BRUSSELS, Dec. 11  The economic conflict between the United States and Western Europe sharpened today as Common Market ministers refused to draw up a mandate for negotiations next week on trade concessions the United States had demanded as part of settlement of the monetary crisis.

title: Donnan Named Tar Heel Aide
description: CHAPEL HILL, N. C., Dec. 11 (AP)North Carolina football coach Bill Dooley has announced that Jim Donnas, a former quarterback and assistant coach at North Carolina State, had been added to the Tar Heel football coaching staff. The 27yearold Donnan formerly was freshman and varsity assistant coach at State.

title: Freshman Rule Backed
description: BELOIT, Wis. Dec. 11 (AP)Faculty representatives of the Midwest College Conference voted today to permit freshmen to participate in conference football and basketball. The proposed rule change must be ratified by seven of the 10 college faculties for final approval.

title: Home Needs Materials
description: The Neponsit Home foe the Aged needs clay pots and containers of various sizes for use in their arts and crafts activities. Nylon stockings are also needed, for stuffing animals. Anyone with these items to contribute can leave them at the gatehouse of the home, 149th Street and Rockaway Beach Boulevard in Neponsit, Queens.

title: Place Gets P.G.A. Berth
description: Thomas C. Place of Cleveland has been named press secretary of the Professional Golfers Association tournament player division, replacing Ron Coffman, who becomes a tournament official. The appointments are effective Jan. 1. Place, a native of Scotland, has been a golf writer for the Cleveland Plain Dealer and is a member of the board of governors of the Golf Writers Association.

title: Hope Glimmers for Sharing China's Unique Flora
description: THE recent chink in the Great Wall of China encourages us to hope for a new boom in American horticulture. In the past, China has contributed more ornamental plants to our gardens than any other country.

title: Margaret D. Nichols Is a Bride
description: Miss Margaret Duval Nichols and Jack Wendell Carrothers of Seattle were married yesterday afternoon in St. Peter's Roman Catholic Church in New Brighton, S. I. Msgr. Florence D. CohaIan performed the ceremony.

title: PENN COUNCIL VOTES TO CUT R.O.T.C. TIE
description: PHILADELPHIA, Dec. 11The policy council of the University of Pennsylvania has overwhelmingly voted to end military control of the campus unit of the Reserve Officers Training Corps.

title: DEMOCRAT PLANS CONNECTICUT BID
description: HARTFORD, Dec. 11The Democratic town chairman of New Haven announced this week that he was an active candidate for the state chairmanship held since 1946 by John M. Bailey.

title: Black Voters Win Control Of a Town in North Florida
description: GRETNA, Fla., Dec. 11 (AP) Until September, no blacks were registered to vote in this town in northern Florida's Gadgden County. But this week, blacks captured control of the town's government at the ballot box.

title: Losing Streak Hits 100, Bat There's Still Hope
description: SEYMOUR, Tenn., Dec. 11 (UPI)Friendsville Academy plays basketball clean and hard, but not very well.

title: The Ruble's Dollar Troubles
description: VIENNA  Communist countries are making some propaganda capital out of the monetary crisis in the West, but in practical economic terms they have their headaches as well.

title: Monmouth Wins Team Title in Women's Swimming Meet at Queens College
description: Monmouth College of West Long Branch, N. J., won the 12th annual invitation swimming meet for college women today at Queens College.

title: The New York Ten
description: On Aug. 26 of this year, passersby discovered the body of police Sgt. Joseph Morabito in his own car, parked 500 feet off the Belt Parkway in Brooklyn. Sergeant Morabito, with two bullet wounds in his head, became the 10th member of the New York City Police Department to be killed during 1971, more than in any single year since 1930. The city's experience is not unique; policemen are being murdered and assaulted at record levels nationally. Not only lawenforcement people but Congressional investigators have speculated on the existence of a conspiracy against policemen, and the International Association of Chiefs of Police, which keeps track of police casualties, has created a new categoryambushes. Even if no plot threatens what President Nixon labels the peace forces, is there any explanation for the rising toll? Under what circumstances are policemen attacked? Are the assailants somehow connected? Are they pursuing social or political ends, either their own or an organization's? The New York 10 killed in a city prototypical in most urban ills, can serve as a melancholy microcosm for a study of all of the assaults upon policemen. Here are the ways in which they died.

title: The World
description: CALCUTTAAs a war, it's got everythinggood guys and bad guys, little people cheering and hugging the liberators and weeping with joy, battles in which the bad guys win grudging respect by standing and fighting and dying, though vastly outnumbered and outgunned.

title: PRINCETON HALTS VILLANOVA 8268
description: PRINCETON, N. J., Dec. 11Paced by Brian Taylor's 33 points, Princeton handed Villanova its first defeat of the season, 8268, before a sell out crowd of 7,550.

title: Carol M. Smith Married to H. Alexander Dearborn
description: NEW CANAAN, Conn., Dec. 11The Congregational Church of New Canaan was the setting this afternoon for the marriage of Miss Carol Marie Smith, daughter of Mrs. Burnham Smith of New Canaan and Harry L. Smith

title: Unbeaten St. Louis Quintet Sets Back Notre Dame, 9280, for Third Victory
description: SOUTH BEND, Ind., Dec. 11 (AP)  St. Louis University jumped off to a 110 lead after 2 minutes 40 seconds had been played today en route to a 9280 college basketall victory over Notre Dame.

title: Pros Down Chaps, 116105
description: MEMPHIS, Dec. 11 (UPI)Bobby Warren and Larry Cannon accounted for 41 points tonights in pacing the Memphis Pros to a 116105 triumph over the Dallas Chaparrals.

title: Nixon and Friends
description: President Nixon ticked off two more toplevel meetings last, week in his campaign of summitry leading up to his visits to Peking and Moscow next February and May. He conferred in Washington with Canada's Prime Minister Pierre Trudeau (see story on page 2) and Brazil's President Emilio Garrastazu Medici. He was scheduled to arrive in the Azores today for meetings with President Georges Pompidou of France and Premier Marcello Caetano of Portugal.

title: The World
description: Jamil M. Baroody, a small, bespectacled, Lebanese  born New Yorker, has been around the United Nations since its inception as a representative of Saudi Arabia. He is well known for his freewheeling diplomacy and his outspoken barbs no longer surprise the old hands. But last week he astounded many of his colleagues.

title: DEDICATIONS MARK GIFTS TO NEEDIEST
description: Donations of $18,346.30 to the New York Times Neediest Cases Fund recorded yesterday brought the total for the first week of the 60th annual appeal to $419,262.37.

title: Pentagon Reports Spartan Passes Interception Test
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 11 (Reuters)A United States Spartan missile has demonstrated its ability to distinguish between a real warhead and dummies released to confuse radar defenses, the Defense Department said.

title: HOBEAU ENTRIES WIN AT AQUEDUCT
description: The Hobeau Farm took the top money in the feature race presentation at Aqueduct yesterday. The main event, the inaugural of the December Handicap, had to be run in two divisions because of a large turnout of horses, and the Hobeau colorbearers, Peace Corps and Knight in Armor, won the respective divisions.

title: HUNTER IS RAISING FUNDS ON ITS OWN
description: Hunter College, part of the public City University system, has quietly embarked this year on a fundraising campaign with a goal of $15million in private and Federal funds over the next six or seven years.

title: Brookyn's Hiden Art Treasures
description: Many people believe that the only art in Brooklyn is inside the Brooklyn Museum. There are a few cognoscenti, however, who seek out some of Brooklyn's neglected treasures: the sculpture that adorns the borough's buildings, hides in the nooks and crannies of monuments and enhances its parks.

title: New Name Sought For Medical Center
description: The Downstate Medical Center is looking for a new name, and is offering $25 for the best suggestion.

title: Drama Mailbag
description: TO THE EDITOR:

title: Skyes the Limit for Top BreederJudge
description: The name of Mrs. Olga Smid is listed in the American Kennel Club Gazette, currently being distributed, as a judge approved to judge Skye terriers. It has been a long, hard climb for the Czechoslovak expatriate, who left her homeland three years ago and now is living in Chickasha, Okla, In Prague, Mrs. Smid's Olivova Kennel was known as one of the top Skye ter. rier establishments on the Continent. She not only was famous as a breeder and a judge, but also played a leading role in the Czech Hunting Association, the counterpart of the A.K.C. for hunting breeds. For six years, she was in charge of the stud book and signed all pedigrees.

title: Style of Weissenberg Infuses Chopin With Vibrant Feeling
description: Given the extent and nature of the applause at Alexis Welssenberg's Chopin recital at the Metropolitan Museum of Art on Friday night, it could only be concluded that a great majority of the large audience found the pianist's performances very much to its liking.

title: Stewart Ain Fiance Of Meryl Fischman
description: BELLEROSE, L. I., Dec. 11  The engagement of Miss Meryl Adele Fischman to Stewart L. Ain has been announced by Mr. and Mrs. Herbert Fischman, parents of the future bride. Her fianc is the son of Mr. and Mrs. David Ain of Great Neck.

title: U. J. A. Calls for Funds to Meet Needs of Immigrants in Israel
description: Leaders of the United Jewish Appeal said yesterday that the 50,000 newly arrived immigrants in Israel, 9,000 of them Russian Jews who had arrived in the last several months, faced an acute shortage of health and social services.

title: G.I.'s Sentenced in Robbery
description: FAYETTEVILLE, N. C., Dec. 11 (AP)Two Fort Bragg soldiers convicted of robbing a bank of $29,000 last April have been sentenced to 24 years in prison, and a third to 19 years. They also face trial on charges of murdering a military policeman. Francisco Rivera, 18 years old, of Baltimore, and Burton McLain, 21, of Culver City, Calif., got 24 years each, and Willie Womack, 22, of Pensacola, Fla., got 19 years.

title: The Last Trading Days
description: The last day for selling for a gain in the socalled regular way is Dec. 23. That is because the transaction must be cleared to have tax effect. This requires five business days. The markets are closed on Dec. 24, the day before Christmas. Thus, there are only five business days after Dec. 23.

title: MADAGASCAR ASKS FOR ATOMIC ADVICE
description: GENEVA, Dec. 11Four nuclear powersthe United States, the Soviet Union, Britain and Francehave reportedly agreed to help Madagascar determine whether it is feasible to blast out a harbor with nuclear explosion.

title: GEOFFREY P. SHEA
description: Geoffrey P. Shea, who retired 10 years ago as a police inspector at the Empire Boulevard station in Brooklyn, died Friday at his home, 2250 83d Street, Brooklyn. His age was 73.

title: What's new? The middy. The what?
description: The spickandspan middy has been given a new lease on life. These days the loose blouse with its traditional rectangular collar and floppy tie pulls down over widelegged pants or demure, anklelength skirts to make women look as schoolgirlish and fresh as if they had stepped out of the pages grandma's old photograph album.

title: The WhaleKillers
description: Last June the International Whaling Commission, meeting in Washington, heard a plea from Under Secretary of State U. Alexis. Johnson for forthright action to save the world's vanishing population of whales. Since then Congress has passed a joint resolution directing the State Department to seek a tenyear worldwide moratorium on whaling. Yet even modest controls long since accepted by the commission itself continue to be flouted by two of its member nations, with the tragic result that one of the world's most magnificent creatures is farther than ever down the dark road to extinction.

title: Lindsay Proposes a New Code On Fire Safety in Skyscrapers
description: A fire safety code that would cover more than 600 skyscrapers was proposed yesterday by Mayor Lindsay, the outcome of a study started after five persons burned to death in new highrise office towers.

title: Bucks Rally to Defeat Bullets, 107101, After Trailing Most of Game
description: BALTIMORE, Dec. 11 (AP)The Milwaukee Bucks, trailing through most of the game, rallied in the fourth quarter tonight to defeat the Baltimore Bullets, 107101, in a National Basketball Association game.

title: New York Triumphs, 43; In Cup Squash Racquets
description: PHILADELPHIA, Dec. 11New York, the defender, scored a 43 victory over Philadelphia in the opening of a Lockett Cup squash racquets matches today at the University of Pennsylvania.

title: Chris Evert, 17 Soon, Is Polishing Her Serve and Trying to Be Anonymous
description: FORT LAUDERDALE, Fla., Dec. 11The toss was perfect, the motion was fluent, without a hitch or hesitation, and the whip action on the racquet sent a hard, flat serve across the net and deep into the right hand corner of the service box.

title: Miss Paddock Is Affianced
description: LENOX, Mass., Dec. 11Miss Christine Tileston Paddock and Hettert Hastings Foster 3d, son of Mr. Foster Jr. of. Wilton, Conn., and the late Mrs. Joanne Fargo Foster, plan to be married next May.

title: L.I. Concern Fined for Polluting A Creek
description: LINDENHURST, L. I.The Suffolk Milk Processing Company, accused of turning clear, treelined creek in this South Shore village into a virtual sewer, was fined $2,500 last week by the State Department of Environmental Conservation.

title: Name Folk Singers Lure L.I. Growds to Roslyn
description: ROSLYN VILLAGE, L. I. A projected series of Sunday afternoon folk music concerts got off to an auspicious start last Sunday when an audience of more than 200 people, many of them family groups, gathered around the tables in My Father's Place to hear the English singing team of John Roberts and Tony Barrand.

title: Free Course Offered On Classics at Lehman
description: When talk at a cocktail party gets around to Norse myths, Icelandic tales and fellows like Snorri Sturluson are you speechless?

title: Seven Powerboats to Start Today in Final Race of Americas Cup at Miami
description: Offshore powerboat racing fans in Miami will be treated to a rare doubleheader today when the third race of the first Americas Cup regatta is followed by the Orange Blossom Grand Prix, a national title race.

title: Greeks May ReErect The Colossus of Rhodes
description: ATHENS, Dec. 11 (Agence FrancePresse)  The Greek Government is considering a plan to rebuild the Colossus of Rhodes, one of the wonders of the ancient world, which once overlooked Rhodes Harbor.

title: ST. JOHN'S WINS FROM SETON HALL
description: Team and individual records were set by St. John's basketball team last night at its home court in Jamaica, Queens, as the Redmen defeated Seton Hall, 10384, before a crowd of 4,321.

title: COACH RECRUITS ON FAMILY PLAN
description: Instead of traveling the country looking for top prospects, New York University's swimming coach, Sal Variello, has devised a lessexpensive method to attract high school athletes. He calls it his Family Plan and, with it he has successfully recruited Tony Loh, N.Y.U.'s top freshman swimmer this season.

title: Brownsville Foods Reflect Changes
description: Next to the apples, oranges and fresh green beans stacked on fruit stands at the Belmont Market in Brooklyn are malangas, tains, cassabas and yamas.

title: Robert Rid gely Fiance of Julie Ripley
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 11 Miss Julie Dillon Ripley, a debutante of the 1970 season, and Robert S. Ridgely, a 1971 graduate of Princeton University attending the Rutgers University Law School, plan an early summer wedding.

title: Jean Sinnott and Charles Drew, Senior at Harvard, Affianced
description: RUMSON, N. J., Dec. 11Dr. and Mrs. John Sinnott Jr. have announced the engagement of their daughter, Miss Jean Stewart Sinnott, to Charles Davis Drew, son of Capt. Edward Allen Drew, a pilot with Pan American World Airways, and Mrs. Drew of Sea Cliff, L. I.

title: Letters:
description: To THE EDITOR: The old Fitzpatrick Traveltalks described in Those Old Movie Travelogues (Travel section, Nov. 28) brought vicarious pleasure to the moviegoing masses. It seems unfair to downgrade them simply because our present standards and Mere modern screen technoltigly make the aged movies seem corny. Those who have hot grown too blas6 will remember the delight they experienced when they watched the travelogues.

title: HighLevel Soviet Delegation Leaves for Talks in New Delhi
description: MOSCOW, Dec. 11The Soviet Union sent a highlevel delegation to India tonight to confer with the Indian Government and possibly leaders of the Bangle. Desh (Bengal Nation) independence movement on the military progress of the war against Pakistan and political moves.

title: Expert Hails Methadone Center in Long Beach
description: LONG BEACH, L. I. Long Beach Memorial Hospital's methadone treatment program for heroin addicts, said by hospital officials here to be the first such program in a voluntary hospital in the state, was praised last week by an official of the Nixon Administration.

title: Hanoi Said to Harden Stand on P.O.W.'s
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 11 (UPI)  State Department officials said today that North Vietnam had completely dashed Nixon Administration hopes that it had decided to improve the condition of the American prisoners of war.

title: For the Golfer Who Has Everything: Give Him a Pro for a Day
description: For the Christmasshopping woman whose husband has everything, a lastminute gift might he a round of golf with Billy Casper, the twotime United States Open champion. The cost? Only $5,000, plus expenses.

title: Pastor Makes Appeal to Man Being Sought in Murder of 5 in Jersey
description: WESTFIELD, N.J., Dec. 11The pastor of the Redeemer Lutheran Evangelical Church here issued a public appeal today to John E. List to get in touch with him.

title: Books:
description: At the present rate that hockey books are popping out of Publisher's Row (wherever that is), it won't be long before vending machines in the DeKalb Avenue Station will start dispensing them. The trouble with this sudden discovery of Canada's national pastime is that hockey doesn't necessarily prepare its players to be authors.

title: Military Situation in East Termed Grim by Pakistan
description: RAWALPINDI, Pakistan, Dec. 11Pakistan said today that India had landed a brigade of paratroops north of Dacca. A spokesman described the situation in East Pakistan as grim.

title: AGNEW ASKS G.O.P. FOR NIXON CONGRESS
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 11 (AP) Vice President Agnew urged Republicans today not to lose sight of Congressional campaign needs in the 1972 Presidential year.

title: M'DONNELL URGES PHONE STRIKE END
description: The chairman of the State Mediation Board said yesterday that the fivemonthold New York Telephone Company strike was causing hardship to the public and the strikers and he urged union and management to resume their stalemated negotiations.

title: 6 NAMED TO SELECT '72 NIEMAN FELLOWS
description: Three newspapermen and three officers of Harvard University have been appointed to serve on the committee that will select Nieman Fellows for the 197273 academic year.

title: Claire Taylor to Be Bride
description: WEST HARTFORD, Conn., Dec. 11Mr. and Mrs. Henry William Taylor have announced the engagement of their daughter, Miss Claire. Eloise Taylor, to Second Lieut. John Woodson Cassella, U.S.A.F., son of Dr. and Mrs. William Nathan Cassella Jr. of Dobbs Ferry, N. Y. The wedding is planned for May 20 in St. John's Episcopal Church here.

title: Books:
description: SELF  RELIANT INVESTING. By John Ellis. Henry Regnery Company. 219 pages. $5.95.

title: GREEKAMERICANS FACE HOTA TODAY
description: Eight soccer teams of equal strength will compete today in the New York and New Jersey semifinals of the United States Challenge Cup, the most coveted prize in American soccer.

title: Son Born to the Barnards
description: CAPETOWN, Dec. 11 (AP)Mrs. Christiaan N. Barnard, wife of the heart surgeon, has given birth to a boy. Hospital officials said that Mrs. Barnard and the child both were well after the Caesarean birth on Friday.

title: Kathie Strauss Affianced
description: Mr. and Mrs. Joseph Strauss of New York have announced the engagement of their daughter, Miss Kathie Ellen Strauss, to Gerard Brach of New York, so not Mr. and Mrs. Florian Brach of Annecy, France. The bridetobe is a copywriter with the Batten, Barton, Durstine & Osborn, advertising agency. Her fiance is with Restaurant Associates.

title: Bruins Rout Canucks, 6.2
description: VANCOUVER, British Columbia, Dec. 11 (UPI)The Boston Bruins scored two goals in each period tonight, including a pair by Phil Esposito, as they defeated the Vancouver Canucks, 62.

title: McGovern Says India Was Justified in Action
description: SACRAMENTO, Calif., Dec. 11 (UPI)Senator George McGovern said today that India was justified when it invaded Pakistan, and he criticized the Nixon Administration for accusing India of aggression.

title: A Revived Spirit Sparks Lakers During Record String
description: Can a millionaire buy a National Basketball Association championship? The new combination of Bill Sharman, Wilt Chamberlain, Jerry West and Gail Goodrich may soon provide the answer.

title: WASHINGTON REPORT
description: WASHINGTON  Secretary of labor James D. Hodgson's statement the other day, blaming the stickiness of the unemployment rate on the failure of Congress to enact the President's tax program was a bit startling. At the time he spoke, 10 days ago, it was already clear that Congress would do exactly what it has since donethat is, finish its work on the tax bill within a few days.

title: Susan J. McDonald To Be Wed Jan. 15
description: ARMONK, N.Y., Dec. 11Miss Susan Jane McDonald and Lemuel Skidmore 3d of Chatham, N.J., plan to be married Jan. 15 in the Bedford Presbyterian Church in Bedford Village.

title: U. of Vermont Skier Leads Waterville Valley Slalom
description: WATERVILLE VALLEY, N.H., Dec. 11 (AP)Wayne Wright of the University of Vermont led 60 qualifiers in today's round of the Pat Harty Memorial Slalom at the Waterville Valley ski area.

title: St. Peter's Loses, 13192
description: MOREHEAD, Ky., Dec. 11 (AP)Morehead came within 7 points of a school basketball record tonight as the Eagles trounced St. Peter's, 13192.

title: 900 OTTER DEATHS TIED TO ATE TEST
description: ANCHORAGE, Dec. 11Two scientists employed by the Atomic Energy Commission say that the fivemegaton Cannikin nuclear test on Amchitka in the Aleutian Islands National Wildlife Refuge definitely killed from 900 to 1,100 sea otters.

title: PLACEMENT UNIT CHANGES TACTICS
description: WHITE PLAINS, Dec. 11 An organization running a pilot project in Westchester County to help educated women reenter the labor market has concluded that some of its basic assumptions were wrong and that the job is more complicated than it first seemed.

title: Mrs. Peacock Has Son
description: A son was born Nov. 26 to Mr. and Mrs. Donald Peacock of Brooklyn in the Brookdale Hospital. Mrs. Peacock is the former Miss Donna Kennedy. Her husband is with Samincorp, Inc., international ore and metals dealers.

title: The World
description: South Korea's President Park Chung Hee had become uneasy lately because of the shifting among the major nations as they sort out a new balance of power. He felt that the interests of the smaller nations would be overlooked during this period and that the possibilities of an attack from North Koreaalways a worry in Seoulhad increased.

title: Landing Party Is Last In English Steeplechase
description: LINGFIELD, England, Dec. 11 (AP)An American jockey, John Fisher, rode the dual Maryland Cup winner, Landing Party, for the first time in Britain today and was last of six finishers in a 3mile steeplechase. Border Mask, 71, was the winner.

title: Also extravagantly freemale
description: It is 1970 and Swansonhis first name, Carol, to be avoided as feminine, his second, Severin, too arch and foreign, so he has abandoned bothis alone in the Huron Mountains of upper Michigan. Thirtythree years old, he is in the woods to escape, however briefly, a selfcorrupted world for which his contempt mounts with each new experience of it. He is also there to recollect and invent, upon the years 195660, when he was at large in the nation, getting women and booze and drugs and brutish jobs and a heightened awareness of the virtues of keeping his own counsel.

title: 6% ON RELIEF HERE CALLED INELIGIBLE
description: A new state analysis has estimated that nearly 6 per cent of the families on New York City's welfare rolls are ineligible for assistance.

title: Pompidou's Concorde Arrives
description: PARIS, Dec. 11 (Reuters)Concorde supersonic airliner landed at Orly airport today from its home base in Toulouse. President Pompidou will leave here tomorrow for a meeting with President Nixon in the Azores aboard the French prototype of the EnglishFrench airliner.

title: Top Scholars Are Honored Before Miami Bowl Game
description: MIAMI, Dec. 11The top scholars on the Florida A. and M. and Kentucky State College football teams, the rivals in tonight's Orange Blossom Classic, were honored at a players' and coaches' breakfast today.

title: If You Kill Somebody...
description: FIRST there was Pavlo, who doesn't make it back from Vietnam. He's killed by a hand grenade thrown into a brothel. His family, such as it is, will never miss him. Then there was David, who comes home, all right, but who leaves his heart with a Vietnamese girl and his eyesight in a field hospital. His mom, dad and brother are so happy to have him back that they wish he'd died there, even in a brothel making love to one of the yellowskinned people they despise.

title: They Followed an Old New England Tradition
description: NORTHFIELD, Mass. Everybody does what he does best; my job is to yell timber, Robert D. Schapiro of Babyon, L. I., wisecracked as he contemplated a 40foot white birch he gnd his work party of six planned to chop down and saw into yule logs.

title: Margaret W. Fanning Is Betrothed
description: BRIARCLIFF MANOR, N.Y., Dec. 11Mr. and Mrs. William Lincoin Fanning Jr. have announced the engagement of their daughter, Miss Margaret Winchester Fanning, to James Robert Jordan, son of Mr. and Mrs. Robert W. Jardan of Coisicana, Tex.

title: CarsonNewman 543 Victor
description: KNOXVILLE, Tenn., Dec. 11 (UPI)  CarsonNewman turned the first Share Bowl game into a 543 rout over Fairmount State today behind the running of Rodney Wampler and VinDial.

title: Nothing but People
description: The moment my agent phoned the news, I took a cab down to Greenwich Village. I was already that brave thing, a Very Young Novelist. Holiday, then in its heyday (this is 1954), published me as travel sensibility. But a fiction sale to Esquire! Nothing like draping a corner of the Esquire mystique round your shoulder and swaggering with it through Rienzi's.

title: Burma Getting Tokyo Loans
description: TOKYO, Dec. 11 (Reuter)Japan has agreed to supply new economic aid totaling $71million in yen loans to Burma for its fouryear economic development plan, foreign Ministry sources said today. The agreement was reached when the Burmese chief of state, Gen. Ne Win met with Premiere Eisaku Sato today. The sources said. General Ne Win arrived here yesterday on a brief unofficial visit to Japan en route to Europe.

title: Jackson Quits Post at S. C.L.C. In Policy Split With Abernathy
description: CHICAGO, Dec. 11The Rev. Jesse L. Jackson resigned today as national director of Operation Breadbasket, the powerful economic arm of the Southern Christian Leadership Conference.

title: Montana Tribe Wants Its Buffalo Back
description: CROW AGENCY, Mont.For 28 years buffalo grazed a 4,000acre pasture in the Big Horn mountains on this vast Indian reservation. To the Crow Indians who brought them here they represented the return of a lost tradition.

title: FLORIDA AGGIES WIN IN ORANGE BLOSSOM
description: MIAMI, Dec. 11 (UPI)The hard running of James Rackley coupled with successive interceptions by Leroy Powell led Florida A. and M. to a 279 victory over Kentucky State tonight in the 39th annual Orange Blossom Classic.

title: Sweden 31 Hockey Victor
description: VIENNA, Dec. 11 (AP)Sweden scored two goals in the first period today and went on to a 31 ice hockey victory over Czochoslovakia in the first of four matches in Bratislava, the Czechoslovak press agency CTK reported.

title: Fairleigh Dickinson Wins
description: RUTHERFORD, N. J., Dec. 11 Fairleigh Dickinson used clutch foul shooting in the late stages to score a 6257 victory over City College of New York tonight. It was the third straight victory for the Knights, whose senior guard, Lee Shulman, scored 25 points and made 13 of 15 free throws. For City College it was the first defeat suffered in four games.

title: Photography
description: ANEW series of Super 8 zoomlens movie cameras recently introduced by the American Sankyo Corporation offers the home moviemaker several unusually interesting features including at least one that is unique for a movie camera of this type (to this writer's knowledge, no other single lens reflex Super 8 camera has it).

title: Science
description: Once again a synthetic chemical long thought to be beneficial to man is suspect. Its name is hexachlorophene, and it has been widely used for more than two decades to control bacteria that grow on the skin.

title: The Mysterious
description: This is Ellen Raskin's first long book. In her other stories, her artist's imagination, full of visual humor, carried her through. Here she has relied on words, and her visual humor translates admirably into wordplays: puns, puzzles, codes, name games. She has also set up the wackiest cast of characters this side of Charlie and the Chocolate Factory.

title: Indians Reported Stopped
description: RAWALPINDI, Dec. 11 (Reuters)Pakistani forces said today that they had repulsed fresh attacks by helicopterborne Indian troops in the Khulna area of East Pakistan south of Dacca.

title: The World
description: Chile has had economic difficulties since the left wing Government of President Salvador Allende Gossens took power a year ago and began nationalizing large domestic industries as well as foreignowned copper, iron and nitrate properties. One difficulty has been a food shortage, which recently led to a protest March of the Empty Pots by 5,000 women and the Government's imposition of emergency rule. Meat, sugar, coffee and macaroni have been scarce.

title: Study Says State Lags on Social Needs
description: The 1971 session of the State Legislature showed a gross' disregard for social needs, the Community Service Society of New York, one of the city's leading social service agencies, charged yesterday.

title: Doctor Will Marry Laura H. Dingman
description: MIDDLEBURY, Conn., Dec. 11Dr. and Mrs. Peter. Van Cleef Dingman have made known the engagement of their daughter, Miss Laura Hooper Dingman, to Dr. Charles William Sheppard. He is the son of Mr. and Mrs. Charles Sheppard of Springfield, Mo. A wedding in the spring is planned.

title: Peter Carry Weds Miss Sullivan
description: Miss Virginia Ellen Sullivan, daughter of Mrs. Euston A. Sullivan of Towson, Mcl., and the late Mr. Sullivan, was married here yesterday to B. Peter Carry, son of Mrs. William J. Carry of Norwich, N.Y., and Gulfstream, Fla., and the late Mr. Carry. The ceremony in St Monica's Roman Catholic Church was performed by the Rev. Braulio Tolosa.

title: Archer's 71 for 204 Leads Golf by Shot; Goalby Cards a 66
description: FREEPORT, Bahamas, Dec. 11 George Archer withstood eight birdies by Bob Goalby today to hold a onestroke lead after 54 holes of the $130,000 Bahamas national open.

title: THE WEEK IN FINANCE
description: AFTER its spectacular shortterm advance since Thanksgiving, the stock market underwent consolidation phase last week largely because it had no fresh stimulus from either the latest domestic economic data or the international negotiations on trade and currency problems.

title: Waste Plant In Brooklyn Key in Fight On Pollution
description: From the outside, the new brick plant on a landscaped plot resembles one of the corporate headquarters that have been built in rural areas of Westchester.

title: Heat of Battle, $3.40, Wins By HalfLength at Suffolk
description: BOSTON, Dec. 11 (AP)Heat of Battle, the 710 favorite, took the lead shortly after the start and went on to a one bait length victory today in the $5,000 Larry Ellis Handicap at Suffolk Downs.

title: LETTERS
description: To the Financial Editor: Miss Marylin Bender has placed too much emphasis on the obvious deterioration espoused by Brian Roger, editor of the Graduate Business News, in evaluating Columbia's Graduate School of Business. He has managed to pass off a highly unrepresentative view as fact.

title: Block Fetes Overcome Park Slope Solitude
description: There was dancing in the street. Bright balloons and streamers decorated the stoops. Fathers and sons played twohand touch in the street. Preschoolers, with gaily painted faces, swarmed through the parked police car playing with the siren and lights while the patrolmen stood by smiling.

title: The World
description: WASHINGTONFor American officials, the war between India and Pakistan has underscored a sad fact about today's world: The big powers, in their effort to avoid a nuclear confrontation, seem unable to prevent minor powers from engaging in tragic, bloody and wasteful conventional conflicts.

title: Last Hope for
description: ADESPERATE, lastditch effort is in progress to save the doomed ospreys of Long Island Sound. The experimental project, now in its fourth year, is apparently the first attempt to forestall the death of a pesticideburdened bird population. It commands attention because there is growing evidence that not just a few but many kinds of birds are similarly threatened. This puts a premium on the development of methods for preserving those birds that human populations deem worth saving. The ospreys are a first test of whether and how this can be done. The project's success, however, is not certain; there are long odds against it.

title: Lion Sleeps, $25.80, Races to FiveLength Victory in Coral Gables Handicap
description: MIAMI, Dec. 11Sly and the Family Stone have a new hit on the music charts titled Family Affair, and it was strictly a family affair in the $20,000 added Coral Gables Handicap. at Tropical Park today. Lion Sleeps, owned and trained by Celestino DiLibero and ridden by his son, Richard, romped to a fivelength victory as favored Insubordination finished sixth.

title: Berlin Pact Is Initialed; Big 4 Signing Months Off
description: BERLIN, Dec. 11The Governments of West Germany, East Germany and West Berlin initialed two accords here this morning that make possible completion of the Big Four treaty improving the situation of divided Berlin.

title: About Motor Sports
description: Gary Bettenhousen motored back to his home in Tinley Park, Ill., from California Wednesday night after one of the most pleasant automobile rides he had ever had. He had spent a day at he wheel of a Sunoco Special McLarenOffenhauser at the Ontario track, getting the feel of it for his new assignment as a member of the Roger Penskeracing team. He has signed a twoyear contract to race with Mark Donohue in the United States Auto Club Marlboro championship trail events.

title: Drama Mailbag
description: TO THE EDITOR:

title: Simply Carefree, Simply Wonderful
description: I WAS away when Two Gentlemen of Verona opened in Central Park in July and so didn't catch up with it until it played a brief return engagement there at summer's end, warming up, as it were, for the winter. On the night I saw it Mayor Lindsay Wfis present, and when the jumpingjack boys and girls of Verona and Milan ripped into a finale composed of soaring Frisbees, furiously flipped pingpong paddles and showers of shredded flowers, the contagion out front grew so intense that Mr. Lindsay found himself propelled stageward. Hurdling the few tiers of seats that separated him from the gyrating, elbowjogging revelers, he managed to make it to the stage, safe and grinning, where he proceeded to keep pace with the rest and the best of then Ho was luminous, memorable. He was even on beat.

title: Penguins Tie Sabres, 3.3
