description: PITTSBURGH, Dec. 11 (UPI) Syl Apps's 40foot goal with less than five minutes remaining tonight gave Pittsburgh 33 tie with Buffalo, but the Sabres still extended their unbeaten streak against the Penguins to eight games.

title: Agency Would Require Tougher Roofs on Cars
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 11 (AP)The National Highway Traffic Safety Administration proposed today that stronger roofs be required on passenger automobiles after Aug. 15, 1977.

title: For Her, Happiness Means Involvement
description: Eleanor Searie Whitney is rarely what people expect.

title: Portugal Has Economic Stakes In the NixonPompidou Meeting
description: MADRID, Dec. 11  Apart from lending an island, the role of Premier Marcello Caetano at the meeting of Presidents. Nixon and Pompidou in the Azores is expected to be minor.

title: ALIOTO'S LIBEL SUIT SHIFTS TO MONTANA
description: MISSOULA, Mont., Dec. 11Because of the wide publicity given in San Francisco to Mayor Joseph L. Alioto's announcement of an offer to settle in his $12.5million libel suit against Look magazine, the case has been transferred here for trial next May 22.

title: That Western Look Is Going Italian
description: No question about the worldwide impact of fashions from the old corral. Western movies and college students carrying knapsacks have spread the word about blue jeans, bandana prints and fringed leather jackets. Practically every designer worth his needle in the fashion centers of Europe has tried his hand at updating denim and simulating the Western look.

title: REMEMBER THESE: THE CITY'S NEEDIEST
description: THEIR identities have been disguised but they are real peopleshy Arthur G. in the story Nobody cares... at the bottom of this page, and Rose M., the Proud Spirit, who is 90. Their histories, like all the others printed here, have been taken from the files of the voluntary agencies participating in this annual appeal.

title: Ardell Curtis Fiancee of W. H. Holland
description: NEWARK, Dec, 11  M. and Mrs. James A. Curtis have made known the engagement of their daughter, Miss Ardell Susan Curtis, to Wilfred Henry Holland. He is the son of Mr. and Mrs. John H. Holland of Roanoke, Va. University.

title: Nixon Prepares for Trip
description: THURMONT, Md., Dec. 11 (AP)President Nixon, working alone at Camp David, his Faryland retreat, prepared today for his talks Monday and Tuesday in the Azores with President Pompidou, one of Mr. Nixon's consultation with allied leaders before his trips to Peking and Moscow.

title: They Call It The Damndest Place You Ever Saw On the Beach. Where Turtles Come to Cry
description: VERO BEACH, Fla.Few men have left their mark on a town so strongly as Waldo Sexton, who built four of this community's most famous tourist establishments, mostly out of driftwood and other bits of unusual lumber, then decorated them inside and out with objects and oddments collected from estate auctions and flea markets.

title: DRUGS AND SPORTS SHOULDN'T KIN (CONT.)
description: To THE EDITOR: In your article, It's Not How You Play the Game, but What Pill You Take (Oct. 17), the author, Jack Scott, made reference to a statement that I was supposed to have made. This statement remarks that I had used drugs in my performance at Mexico City during the 1968 Olympic Decathlon. I strongly reject this statement and would like to go on record as stating that at no time did I utilize any immoral or unethical drugs or substances to aid my performance. I competed honestly and the record also shows that I was randomly selected for dope testing at the conclusion of each day's competition. The tests bear out the fact that I was not using drugs, and was the only decathlon athlete to have been tested two consecutive days for this random selection.

title: Letters:
description: To THE EDITOR: We, as the author of the Budapest article did, took advantage of the service providing rooms in private homes there. In our enerfenee, however, the atnaisphere Was not at all impersonal; the lady, of the house Was quite concerned about us, gave directions and advice and provided us with fresh fruit. Communication with her was in German, which seems to list the international language in Eastern Europe.

title: Art From Far From Us
description: Anyone remember a classical education nowadays, when the world was divided into Greeks and Barbarians? It's a commonplace that most tribal groups have names for themselves which mean us people or we human beings. The further out one gets from this us, the wilder, fiercer, darker (cannibal if not obscene, who knows!) other tribes seem to get, until they may cease to be human altogether and sink into the animal world. And is it any different with us?

title: Creatures to Stir Early Day Before Christmas
description: The Christmas Eve thoroughbred racing program at Liberty Bell race track in Philadelphia will have an 11 A.M. posttime.

title: Telegram Lost, Man Sues
description: LOS ANGELES, Dec. 11 (UPI)Juan Avelar sued Western Union this week for $6,000 because a telegram was not delivered. Mr. Avelar, a meat cutter, said the telegram was sent in May by his employer, notifying him that he should come back to work after layoff. He said the telegram never reached him and he wants Western Union to reimburse him for eight months' lost wages.

title: Honor for Russell Urged
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 11 (UPI)Democratic leaders have introduced a resolution calling for a portrait of the late Senator Richard B. Russell, Democrat of Georgia, to be hung in the Senate reception room alongside those of five other Senate leaders of the pastHenry Clay of Kentucky, Daniel Webster of Massachusetts, John C. Calhoun of South Carolina, Robert M. LaFollete Sr. of Wisconsin and Robert A. Taft of Ohio.

title: Miss Roberts Boston Bride
description: BOSTON, Dec. 11In the Episcopal Chtrch of the Advent here this morning, Miss Susan Whiting Roberts, daughter of, Mrs. George Whiting Roberts and the late Justice Roberts of the Munucipal Court of Boston was married to Philip Gerard Boyle, son of Mr. and Mrs. Philip Louis Boyle of Randolph.

title: Education
description: CHICAGO  Furrowing his brow as he leaned back in the desk chair of his secondfloor office on the fringe of The Loop last week, the Superintendent of Schools, James F. Redmond, commented, Everybody recognizes that costs increase for everything, everything except education.

title: Miss Knoppers Bride Of R. Craig Woodward
description: SUMMIT, N. J., Dec. 11The marriage of Miss Anneke Cornelie Knoppers, a student at the Columbia Law School, to R. Craig Woodward, who attends the Columbia College of Physicians and Surgeons, took place in the Central Presbyterian Church here today. The Rev. Dr. Robert H. Stephens performed the ceremony.

title: Study Finds Cheating Abounds in Sports
description: BROCKPORT, N. Y., Dec. 11He'll be using rented bowling shoes, but he'll check the wear on your shoes to see what kind of balance you've got.

title: 40 Held on Drugs in Jersey
description: PARSIPPANY  TROY HILLS, N. J., Dec. 11 (UPI)About 150 law enforcement officials from 20 municipalities arrested 40 persons, 15 of them juveniles, today on charges of selling drugs, including heroin, LSD and hashish.

title: INDIANA UPSETS KENTUCKY, 9089
description: LOUISVILLE, Ky., Dec. 11 (UPI)Injured Steve Downing collected 47 points and 25 rebounds tonight to power undefeated Indiana to a 9089 upset over sixthranked Kentucky in double overtime.

title: Holy Cross Beats Yale
description: NEW HAVEN, Dec. 11Holy Cross scored 6 straight points at the start of the overtime period tonight and hung on to defeat Yale, 9490.

title: Architecture
description: THIS is a bit of revisionist history. It is the story of the rehabilitation of the Yale Art and Architecture Building.The Art and Architecture Building has been a symbol and cause clbre in the revolution of the consciousness of man. When Paul Rudolph's celebrated structure burned on the Yale campus two years ago it became a supersymbol. While the official verdict was accident, not arson, it was generally assumed that either an act of God or an act of man had destroyed, with uncanny prescience for the moment and the mood, a monument that embodied the despised Establishment standards and values that the radical young were rejecting on moral and social grounds.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: While reading DDT, the First Domino, by Dr. N. E. Borlaug (OpEd Nov. 21), I was amazed by the lack of coherent reasoning in it. He mentions the conclusion of the Surgeon General that DDT is no imminent health hazard. The word in this statement that needs recognition is imminent. DDT in small quantities (we all have some amount within our bodies obtained from the foods we consume) has virtually no effect. I wish to point out, however, that once DDT is in our system, it is not eliminated but is retained and that accumulations there eventually result in poisoning or even death.

title: Judith Harratz to Wed
description: Mr. and Mrs. Frank Harratz of Far Rockaway, Queens, have announced the engagement of their daughter, Miss Judith Sharon Harratz, to Richard M. Cohen, son of Mr. and Mrs. David Cohen of Searingtown, L. I.

title: 17 WORKERS DEAD IN MICHIGAN BLAST
description: PORT HURON, Mich., Dec. 11An explosion in a water tunnel under construction 250 feet underground near. Port Huron killed 17 workers today, the authorities said. At least 22 workers escaped, eight with injuries.

title: If you don't show violence the way it is, says Roman Polanski, I think that's immoral and harmful. If you don't upset people then that's obscenity
description: LONDON. HE walks quickly along the cobbled mews. Slight, sharpnosed, bobbing his head nervously, he unlocks the house door and steps inside. The rooms are lighted. Music, gentle yet poundingThe Supremesflows from atop the circular staircase. He prowls the living room, dropping his denim jacket on a leather chair, pouring a Coke, sitting for a moment, standing, rubbing his fingers, brushing his hands over his thick, long hair. From upstairs, the Supremes plead: .. . Where has our love gone? ...

title: Second Mistrial Called in Newton Case
description: OAKLAND, Calif. Dec, 11 (AP)A second mistrial was declared today in the manslaughter trial of Heuy P. Newton, the Black Panther leader, in the death of an Oakland policeman in 1967. The jury reported it was utterly impossible to reach a verdict.

title: Brandt Asserts That Both Nixon And Brezhnev Want Force Cuts
description: OSLO, Norway, Dec. 11 (AP) Chancellor Willy Brandt of West Germany said today that private discussions with President Nixon and the Soviet party chairman, Leonid I. Brezhnev, had convinced him both leaders desired mutual and balanced reductions of forces in Europe.

title: Oregon Journal Fills Post
description: PORTLAND, Ore., Dec. 11 (AP)Donald J. Sterlin Jr., executive news editor of The Oregon Journal, will become editor of the Portland Daily Jan. 1. He will take charge of thhe newspaper's news and editorial operations, succeeding William W. Knight, publisher for the last 19 years, who is retiring.

title: POINT OF VIEW
description: While the nation is still trying to work out the means of arresting wage inflation, certain crucial conditions exist that require the development of a longterm solution.

title: U.S. Amateur Skier of Year Will Receive Coronet Trophy
description: A new award, to be made annually, has been established to honor the nation's outstanding amateur alder. The winner will be designated as the Coronet American Skier of the Year.

title: AntiReagan Paintings Removed From a Club
description: SACRAMENTO, Calif., Dec. 11 (AP)Martha Turner has taken her 15 paintings out of a 350member allmale Sacramento social club because directors banned paintings poking fun at Gov. Ronald Reagan, an honorary club member.

title: CRUSADE PLANNED BY PROTESTANTS
description: Plans for the first continentwide evangelistic campaign designed to embrace the entire spectrum of Protestant theology from conservatism to liberalism were disclosed here last week.

title: Scandinavian Stories
description: Long ago man's answer to the question How shall I live? seemed simpler than it now does. The world was peopled with demons, trolls and witches, ready to devour the witless at the least misstep. For a human being to transform mere existence into real life required humility end steadfastness, courage and love. Gladness was not a purchasable commodity, and only a fool believed in an infinitely improvable world. It was cause for celebration when the forces of evil were defeated or merely delayed. Such victories took the shape of stories told over kitchen fires. They became, in the words of this book, a golden thread that shone as brightly against the black cloth as a good deed shines in a naughty world.

title: 7th Child for Couderts
description: GREENWICH, Conn., Dec. 11A daughter was born to. Mr. and Mrs. Victor R. Coudert on Nov. 10 at St. Joseph's Hospital in Stamford. The child, the couple's seventh, is a granddaughter of Mr. and Mrs. Kenneth A. Beach of Old Greenwich.

title: WALLACE SEEKING MORE POLICEMEN
description: MONTGOMERY, Ala., Dec. 11 Having been rebuffed twice earlier this year, Gov. George C. Wallace has again asked the Alabama Legislature to appropriate funds to allow him to increase significantly the size of the Alabama state police force.

title: LAUREL DASH WON BY AMBER PUDDING
description: LAUREL, Md., Dec. 11Amber Pudding, a consistent moneywinner carrying the silks of William S. Farish 3d, scored a surprise today when she held on for a head decision over Camp Glow in the $22,050 First Lady Handicap at Laurel Race Course.

title: Turkey's Premier Forms Government, Says Crisis Is Over
description: ANKARA, Turkey, Dec. 11 (AP)Premier Nihat Erim announced a new Cabinet today and said the Turkish political crisis is finished.

title: Child to the Goldsholles
description: SCARSDALE, N. Y., Dec. 11A daughter was born at Mount Sinai Hospital in New York on Nov. 15 to Mr. and Mrs. Gerald H. Goldsholle. The child has been named Jill Hayley.

title: LANDLORDS AWAIT RENT RISE RULES
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 11Rent increases have resumed on a modest scale across much of the country since the end of the outright wagepricerent freeze, but landlord groups in most cities are awaiting new rent regulations that may be issued as early as next week before applying more general increases.

title: OBSERVER
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 11Once again everybody seems to agree that President Nixon is a brilliantly astute politician. Democrats, if the papers can be believed, can, hardly be restrained from crying gee whiz! at every move the President makes; those Agnevian devils, the columnists and commentators, scarcely let a day pass without addressing themselves in awe to the President's political mastery.

title: U.S. Jet Shot Down
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, Dec. 11 (AP)An intensification of surfacetoair missile attacks against United States warplanes and the first shooting down of an American jet in eight months from North Vietnam could trigger a new round of retaliatory blows against North Vietnam.

title: STATE FIGHTS SUIT AGAINST GOVERNOR
description: Attorney General Louis J. Lefkowitz has filed a brief in State Supreme Court in Manhattan urging dismissal of suit brought by the New York Civil Liberties Union charging that Governor Rockefeller was unconstitutionally acting as a oneman legislature.

title: Letters:
description: To THE EDITOR: I was shocked as much as anyone by the assassination of President Kennedy, but, as an honest American still believing in the ideals and principles of our fothding fathers, I must protest: A man is presumed innocent until proven guilty. Yet, in the Dallas article there were statements such as the minute that Lee. Harvey Oswald squeezed off his first shot, the window from which Oswald fired, etc. The phrase is presumed to have should have been inserted. Oswald, himself the victim of an assassin's bullet, did not stand trial before his peers.

title: Howard Payne Wins, 1613
description: LAWTON, Okla. Dec. 11 (AP)  Ronny Cauliflower passed for one touchdown and ran for another to lead Howard Payne College of Bronford, Tex., to a 1613 victory over Cameron State in the first Cowboy Bowl game today.

title: New Place To See and Be Seen in Forest Hills
description: The stumbling gourmet of Forest Hills is pleased to report that our thriving little community has still another spot for dining out.

title: Coins
description: Known as the Festival of Lights, Hanukkah is observed for a period of eight days. The traditional Menorah or candelabrum holds a prominent place in the festivities. The customary rites call for one candle to be lighted on each of the eight days, although there has been some departure from the old religious tradition over the years. In some cases today, varicolored candles or electric lights are used.

title: Hoarfrost
description: Frosty nights bring frosty dawns, when every bush and weedstem and blade of grass along the brook riverbank is covered with the glittering filigree of hoarfrost. When it happens, the world is a fantastic place, dazzling in first sunlight. But it is even more ephemeral than moonlight on open water. This wonder that came in the damp, chill darkness will vanish with the warmth of midmorning.

title: Amtrak Plans Colorful New Uniforms
description: Amtrak, the quasipublic corporation that took over the nation's passenger rail service May 1, is planning to dress girls in hotpants and give red cap baggage handlers red berets, in hopes of persuading Americans to ride the trains again.

title: Coins in Sea Since 1725 Sold Here
description: On the night of Aug. 25, 1725, a withering southeast gale swirling over the jagged reefs south of Cape Breton, Nova Scotia, engulfed and sank the French armed transport Le Chameau, carrying down 318 passengers and seamen and a cargo of 82,010 gold and silver coins from the treasury of Louis XV.

title: LUCAS ALSO STARS
description: The reserves of the Knickerbockers were no match for the Portland Trail Blazers In the fourth quarter at Madison Square Garden last night, but their ineffectiveness after inheriting a 47point lead only held the Knicks' margin of victory to 134102.

title: JORDAN DENOUNCES ISRAELI VOTE PLANS
description: AMMAN, Jordan, Dec. 11Jordan ar ealed today to Arabs of the Israelioccupied west bank of the Jordan River to boycott municipal elections set for April.

title: CITY HEALTH AGENCY TELLS OF '71 GAINS
description: In a yearend report yesterday, the city's Health Services Administrator said his agency was delivering more for every dollar than it did a year ago, and had effected dramatic rises in productivity.

title: The Elderly In Nassau Widen Horizons
description: EAST MEADOW, L. I.Few people have made a bigger impact in their debut on Broadway than Oscar Esparza, a man whose name never has been in lights.

title: Squires Win in Overtime
description: HAMPTON, Va., Dec. 11 (UPI) Charlie Scott scored 14 of Virginia's 17 points in overtime to lead the Squires to a 128120 victory tonight over the Kentucky Colonels

title: Haack: Can N.Y.S.E. Survive?
description: The New York Stock Exchange has been at the hub of the securities industry since 1792, setting the policies, creating the ground rules and providing the marketplace that enabled capitalism to thrive.

title: Law
description: There had never been any doubt that Virginia lawyer Lewis F. Powell Jr. would be confirmed by the. Senate as an Associate Justice of the Supreme Court; it happened last Monday, by a vote of 89 to 1. His fellow nominee, Assistant Attorney General William H. Rehnquist, was another matter. Some of the same men and organizations that had led the fight to block President Nixon's nomination of Judges Clement Haynsworth and G. Harrold Carswell two years ago had once again entered the lists.

title: CAR DEALER ENDS PAPERWORK FEE
description: Luby Chevrolet, which says it is one of the city's largest auto dealers, has agreed to stop charging its repair customers $2 for paperwork after State Attorney General Louis J. Lefkowitz's consumer frauds bureau ruled the practice illegal.

title: Rhode Island Tops Brown For 4th in Row, 102 to 84
description: KINGSTON, R. I., Dec. 11The University of Rhode Island overcame an early deficit and recorded a 10284 victory over Brown today.

title: Art
description: EVERYTHING about Lois Dodd's current show of paintingsincluding its location, at the obscure but often excellent Green Mountain Gallery on Perry Street in the Villagereinforces a sense of its remoteness from what tends to be regarded as the mainstream of contemporary art. At a time when most new painting is abstract and most new representational art is couched in extreme styles, Dodd works in a mode that is intimate, restrained and frankly backward  looking. And at a time when many painters seemingly must level forests to get enough wood for their stretchers, her canvases are smallsmaller even than the farmhouse windows that are her main current subject matter.

title: L. I. Man, 84, Ordained As an Episcopal Priest
description: FARMINGDALE, L. I., Dec. 11An 84yearold man who had wanted to be an Episcopal priest since boyhood but whose life led him in other directions was ordained today.

title: Negro Leader Sees Chinese As More Free Than Blacks
description: DENVER, Dec. 11 (UPI)A black civil rights leader says that the Chinese people have more freedom than a black living in the ghettos of New York City or Denver.

title: Packard Resigns His Post As Deputy Defense Chief
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 11The White House announced today the resignation of David Packard as Deputy Secretary of Defense after nearly three years in the No. 2 Pentagon post.

title: Catherine L. EarnshawNolte Fiancee of David C. Ridgway
description: GRADYVILLE, Pa., Dec. 11 Mrs. Levis Carter has announced the engagement of her granddaughter, Miss Catherine Levis EarnshawNolte, to David Craig Ridgway, son of Mr. and Mrs. Ellis Branson Ridgway Jr. of Swarthmore, Pa.

title: White House Is Planning a Postwar Relief Program
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 11 President Nixon has ordered United States Government agencies to start preparing plans for huge relief and rehabilitation efforts when the IndianPakistani fighting stops.

title: Wings Down Flyers, 6.3
description: DETROIT, Dec. 11 (UPI)Nick Libett's ninth goal of the season broke a 33 tie in the third period tonight and Marcel Dionne added two as the Detroit Red Wings beat the Philadelphia Flyers, 63.

title: U.N. Observer Unit in Kashmir, Despite Combat, Reports Daily
description: UNITED NATIONS, N.Y., Dec. 11  As the fighting has increased in Kashmir between India and Pakistan, a littleknown band of 45 United Nalions observers has been sending daily reports to New York.

title: Housing Planned Near Gracie Mansion
description: Details of a proposed $50million complex that will provide 1,200 units of lowmoderate and middleincome housing, two schools and a park one block from Gracie Mansion were announced yesterday by the New York City Educational Construction Fund.

title: Letters:
description: TO THE EDITOR: We would like to make one ninon correction to the corhprehensive article about touring the Smithsonian in Washington (Travel section, Nov. 21). The 30by42foot flag on display in the Museum of History and Technology was referred to as Old Glory, but the only proper identification for it is The StarSpangled Banner. It is the original 15star, 15stripe flag made by citizens of Baltimore and flown over Fort McHenry in defiance of the British invasion attempt in 1814. The Old Glory flag, which is.41so in the Smithionianl collection, dates from 1831 and was flown aboard the brig, Charles Doggett, catlinined by William Driver, who Cained the sobriquet, Old Glory.

title: House of Friendly Ghost (And a Painter) Dedicated
description: STONY BROOK, L. I.A house in which the artist William Sidney Mount lived and painted more than a century ago was declared a national historical landmark recently at a ceremony attended by government officials, a handful of admirers, a playful cat and, some insisted, a friendly ghost.

title: Schranz Is Cold to Ban of Skiers
description: PARIS, Dec. 11  Karl Schranz shrugs off the fact that he is the man most likely to succumb to any purge of professionals in skiing.

title: Trustees Overrule Fairfield University President on His Dismissal of Former Priest as a Professor
description: The laydominated board of trustees of Fairfield University has overruled the university's president, the Rev. William McInnes, in his efforts to dismiss a tenured faculty member who left the Jesuit priesthood and abandoned his Roman Catholic faith.

title: Katherine Anne Pettit Is Married
description: ROCKY HILL, N. J., Dec. 11 Miss Katherine Anne Pettit was married here this afternoon to Richard Lowel Cruser by the Rev. Frank J. Bahr in the First Reformed Church.

title: The World
description: In August, a marker was erected in Berlin (To the Dead of the Wall) as a tribute to persons killed while trying to escape the Eastern sector since the Communists erected the wall 10 years ago. The marker symbolized the continuing desires of the German people to improve contacts in the divided city still formally under fourpower control.

title: Jockey Fails in Bid for 1,000
description: CHELTENHAM, England, Dec. 11 (AP)  The historymaking 1,000th winner eluded Stan Mellor again today after five unsuccessful rides at this birthplace of British steeplechasing. Mellor, four times British champion steeplechase jockey, reached 99966 more than any other rider  yesterday.

title: Jersey's Director of Consumer Affairs Wins Praise of Princeton Research Group
description: After holding office as New Jersey's Consumer Affairs Director for only six months, Charles J. Irwin is in the enviable position of having received a favorable report card from a consumer group that was sharply critical of his predecessor.

title: Alison Brooks Has Nuptials
description: CAMBRIDGE, Mass., Dec. 11 Miss Alison Spence Brooks, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Robert Angus Brooks of Cambridge and Washington, was married here this afternoon to John Edward Yellen, son of Dr. and Mrs. Julius Yellen of Brooklyn, New York. The Rev. James Ellison Thomas, senior tutor of Adams House at Harvard University, performed the ceremony in Christ Episcopal Church.

title: Joyce: Trieste Is Waking Rawly...
description: TRIESTE, ItalyPure alr on the upland road, Trieste is waking rawly, raw sunlight over its huddled brown tiled roof, testudoform... James Joyce penned these words more than 50 years ago while standing on the heights of this city at the top of the Adriatic, and the scene is much the same today as it was then. Trieste has changed little.

title: CHART ACHIEVES A DOUBLE TRIUMPH
description: READINGTON, N. J., Dec. 11 Frank Chapot of the United States Equestrian Team scored a double victory at the Four Seasons Farm Horse Show today with two hunters who will be changing their careers next week.

title: Law Students See Ecology Peril In I.C.C. Rail Freight Increases
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 11A group of Jaw students charged today that the Interstate Commerce Commisslon violated the provisions of the National Environmental Policy Act in granting railroad freight rate increases this year.

title: U.S. May Oast Syrian As Romance Collapses
description: SAN DIEGO, Dec. 11 (AP)Adib Darkazalli of Syria avoided deportation from the United States four months ago by advertising for a bride in the newspapers and marrying one of the women who responded.

title: Miss Peters Is Betrothed
description: Mr. and Mrs. Anthony J. Peters of New York and Lakeville, Conn., have announced the engagement of their daughter, Miss Kathleen Marie Peters, to CCT/ Seaman Wayne Raymond Greene, U.S.N., of Canaan, Conn.

title: The Dream Must Be There
description: Harold Wilson may be premature in claiming that the reunification of Ireland is now on the agenda, but his carefully prepared proposals looking to that eventuality have pushed discussions of the Ulster crisis off dead center. The former Prime Minister deserves credit for mentioning what has been unmentionable in Westminster, and for an imaginative approach that has drawn positive responses from the British and Irish Governments.

title: Impact of the Youth Vote Was Felt By the Home of Indiana University
description: BLOOMINGTON, Ind., Dec. 9  On Jan. 1, Francis X. McCloskey, 32 years old, a lawyer less than six months, will become the new Mayor of Bloomington, a town of 44,000 people about 50 miles south of Indianapolis. It is a town known mainly for its stone quarries and its students, 31,000 of them, who attend Indiana University.

title: 59 Whooping Cranes Now
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 11 (UPI)  The Interior Department said today that the population of wild whooping cranes had increased to 59. The Fish and Wildlife Service said that an aerial survey at the whoopers' wintering grounds at the Aransas National Wildlife Refuge in Texas shows 54 adults and five young ones. In 1941 there were only 15 whooping cranes, but the number had grown to 57 by last year.

title: Livingston Takes Title
description: BIRMINGHAM, Ala., Dec 11 (AP)  Livingston University rallied from a 107 halftime deficit today and defeated Arkansas Tech, 1412, for the National Association of Intercollegiate Athletics' national football championship.

title: The Nation
description: WASHINGTON  The Democratic Congress sent the Republican President a tax bill last Thursday. The next day, Mr. Nixon not only signed the bill but went out of his way to praise it, almost extravagantly. His words and demeanor were surprising, in part because he has of late become generally more quarrelsome and consistently more partisan in his relations with Congress. Moreover, it seemed strange that the President did not take advantage of an obvious opportunity to set up some excuses for his Administration should the tax bill fail to perform its assigned task of stimulating a business upturn and a reduction in the unemployment rate. For Congress had made just enough changes in the tax bill he had sought to support an argument that its economic impact may have been altered.

title: Photography
description: WHAT exactly is a concerned photographer? Or to put it another way, is there any such thing as a photographer who is not concerned? The question is raised by Images of Concern, a photographic exhibition to benefit the International Fund for Concerned Photography, Inc., currently at Neikrug Galleries through Jan. 2. Indeed, the question is raised by the very existence of an organization named the International Fund for Concerned Photography, Inc. For isn't everybody concerned these days?

title: Indian Factor Widens Bolivia Bank Woes
description: LA PAZ, Bolivia  An Indian woman dressed in perhaps a dozen skirts, several blankets and shawls over her blouses and equally traditional derby atop her braided hair walked into a North American bank here the other day and asked to speak with a gringo.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: Criticism of the U.S. Forest Service seems to be environmentally popular these days, but I know The Times would want to be fair in its editorial comments. I wish to take issue with your editorial of Nov. 21 entitled Forest Failure.

title: Evacuation From Karachi
description: KARACHI, Pakistan, Dec. 11 (Reuters) The last British evacuation flights out of Karachi left today with British, American, Canadian, Japanese and other foreign nations aboard.

title: MISS WHITE SCORES IN WOMEN'S FENCING
description: The competitors came a greater distance but the results were still, the same at yesterday's Intercollegiate women's Fencing Association Christmas Invitation open at Herbert Lehman College in the Bronx.

title: Science
description: As of this moment, there is a strong possibility that life exists on Marsthough how long it will survive is problematical. For the life is not native to that planet; it arrived as microscopic stowaway aboard one or both of the Soviet capsules dropped onto the Martian surface on Nov. 27 and Dec. 2.

title: The Provensen Book of Fairy Tales
description: This is a pleasurable journey in 12 parts (12 tales by Henry Beston, Hans Christian Andersen, Arthur Beckham, Seumas MacManus, Ruth ManningSanders, Elinor Mordaunt, Parker Fillmore, A. A. Milne, Barbara Leonie Picard, Howard Pyle, Katharine Pyle and Oscar Wilde), with not a single dreary stopover. Whatever the settingChina, Connaught, the Island of Busanwe meet that familiar wood with humble huts and proud castles, where evil, no matter how potent or trickily disguised, is genuine evil and therefore conquerable, where goodness shines forth and absolute values prevail. Who wouldn't want to go there again?

title: Adelphi Loses, 6858
description: GARDEN CITY, L. I., Dec. 11 Bridgeport University, led by Alan Fischer, beat Adelphi tonight, 6858. Fischer led all scorers with 18 points. Wally Young had 13 points and Brian Thomson 11 for the Purple Knights. Bridgeport is now 41 wonlost and 20 in the Northeast League. Adelphi is 01 in the league and 22 overall.

title: Photographs
description: ON READING (Grossman, $5.95.) by Andre Kertesz is an unsimple set of photographs of all sorts of people, plus a cow, reading all sorts of writings. Kertesz took them in various parts of the world between 1915 and now. This quiet little book gets better each time go through it. It shows that entertaining photographs can be intelligent.  Due to the happy perversity of Mr. Kertsz, there are no words in On Reading.

title: MERGER FAILURE ANGERS STUDENTS
description: SOUTH BEND, Ind., Dec. 11 Deborah Youins is an 18yearold Negro freshman who says the chief reason she enrolled at St. Mary's College here was to get a Notre Dame degree.

title: Philadelphia Beats Tuxedo In Court Tennis Doubles
description: PHILADELPHIA, Dec. 11 Philadelphia scored a 163 victory over Tuxedo, N.Y., in the annual intercity court tennis doubles matches today at the Racquet Club. Each set counted one point.

title: Season's Greetings
description: You may call it a Christmas tree. But in the eyes of the Internal Revenue Service, which is policing the President's wageprice program, it's a raw agricultural product. And last week, as the first products of the piney woods of Maine made their appearance in the vacant lots and along the thoroughfares of New York, the I.R.S. offered this bit of Christmas cheer:

title: Women to Shovel Snow
description: MILWAUKEE, Dec. 11 (AP) The city's Bureau of Sanitation has agreed to abandon its prohibition against employing women to shovel snow. The superintendent, Howard Thompson, who rejected job applications from four girls a year ago, said Wednesday that he would hire women shovelers if they were 18 or older, at least taller than the shovel, have a Social Security number, andvery importantcome dressed for the weather.

title: Poor Little Rich U. S.
description: Last Monday, a lugubriously rainy evening in Manhattan, the Cattleman Restaurant, which grants every possible discount on $6 and $8 beef dinners, was jammed to its pseudo Wild West rafters. The Colony, international society's dining room for 50 years, had just gone out of business.

title: U.S. FUNDS FOR LAOS CRITICIZED IN REPORT
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 11 (AP) A Congressional report alleges that the fund used by the United States to channel millions of dollars toward helping stabilize Laos money values promotes rather than discourages fraud, corruption and dishonesty.

title: 4 Killed and 19 Hurt In Belfast Bombing In a Crowded Store
description: BELFAST, Northern Ireland, Dec. 11A bomb exploded in shopping center crowded with Christmas shoppers this afternoon, killing two men and two children.

title: For Losing 120 Pieces of Clothing
description: Most airplane baggage is lost in being transferred on connecting flights. This occurs mainly because of human error in reading the baggage tags or because there is too little time allowed for the actual physical shifting of the luggage from one plane or one airline to another at today's sprawling airports.

title: Carolynne Moran Fiancee
description: Mrs. William T. Moran of Flushing, Queens, has announced the engagement of her daughter, Miss Carolynne Joan Moran, to Gerald Edward Steiniger, a senior at Fordham College. He is the son'of Edward Leo Steiniger, retired board chairman and chief executive of the Sinclair Oil Corporation, and Mrs. Steiniger of New York. The future bride, daughter also of the late Mr. Moran, graduated this year from Thomas More College of Fordham University. A June wedding is planned.

title: Science
description: After months of wrangling, the House, the Senate and the President last week reached an agreement charting a vastly expanded new national attack on cancer. All sides had long ago agreed that such a program was necessary; what they had fought over was the question, who will sit in the driver's seat? The Senate and the President had pushed for a largely independent cancer agency whose director would be equal In rank to the director of the National Institutes of Health (which oversee other biomedical research), and would report directly to the President. The House wanted to expand the current National Cancer Institute but keep it inside the N.I.H. family. After a number of meetings in the last two weeks, a HouseSenate conference committee finally opted for the House version.

title: PRO BOWLING FINAL IN FORUM ON JAN. 8
description: The final of the $100,000 United States Open bowling tournament at Madison Square Garden on Saturday, Jan. 8, will be held on a pair of apedallyconstructed lines in the Felt Forum.

title: N. Carolina Stops V.P.I.
description: CHAPEL HILL, N. C., Dec. 11 (AP)North Carolina, led by Dennis Wuycik and Bobby Jones, defeated Virginia Tech, 9360, tonight.

title: It's Cheaper by Water
description: IT may be that the conductors and managers of America's musical organizations are wondering what is the best way that they can observe our nation's bicentennial in 1976. If so, practically none of their plans has leaked out or been announced. One exception is the Philadelphia Orchestra's commissioning of a work for the occasion from Leonard Bernstein.

title: Secret Cockfights Persist in Saigon, Despite Ban
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, Dec. 11In the 13th century, a popular Vietnamese legend runs, when the Mongols were poised to invade Vietnam, the famous general Tran Hung Dao called on his people to give up their addiction to cockfighting temporarily. The Vietnamese complied, the legend says, and the Mongols were driven back into China.

title: If Elsa Could See Roberto Now
description: APARTIAL listing of Roberto Rossellini's forthcoming projects (most of which are for European television showing) includes films about Sir Thomas More, Descartes, Diderot, the American Revolution, the Industrial Revolution, Marco Polo, St. Augustine (which goes into production Dec. 26 in Algiers) and, most immediately, Pasbal, on which Rossellini completed photography this fall in Italy.

title: M. J. Beer to Marry Miss Thalia Zetlin
description: ROSLYN, L. I., Dec. 11The engagement of Miss Thalia Zetlin to Mitchell J. Beer, son of Mr. and Mrs. Milton Beer of New Hyde Park, has been announced by her parents, Dr. and Mrs. Lev Zetlin of Roslyn and Charlottesville, Va.

title: LETTERS
description: To the Financial Editor: The article on the Columbia University Graduate School of Business (Dec. 5) was not an accurate description of the true state of affairs at the school.

title: I Left Her Alive
description: For 5,296 daysmore than 14 years Edgar H. Smith Jr. sat on Death Row in New Jersey. No man in American penal history has spent so long in the shadow of the executioner. During those years, Smith successfully staved off death in the electric chair through 19 court appeals. And last June, a Federal Court overturned his conviction and death sentence. It held that a confession he had given at the time of his arrest for the murder of a 16yearold high school cheerleader had been coerced, violating his constitutional rights against selfincrimination. The court ordered the state of New Jersey either to give Smith a new trial before the end of the year or set him free.

title: Anna Michelman Grass, Biographer, Is Dead at 73
description: NEW CANAAN, Conn., Dec. 11  Mrs. Anna Michelman Grass, author and the widow of Milton N. Grass, former president of Stylecraft Sales Corporation, died today at her home at Skyview Lane. Her age was 73.

title: Letters
description: TO THE EDITOR: In his article, The Decline and Decline of New York (Nov. 21), Roger Starr overlooked a number of important considerations that should be taken into account for an accurate assessment of the state of New York City.

title: PAPER IS PLANNED FOR EASTCHESTER
description: EASTCHESTER, N. Y., Dec. 11.  How do you buy a free newspaper? the fullpage advertisement asks, and then supplies the answer: You don't You support it.

title: 16 Food Concerns Named as Violators Of City Health Code
description: Sixteen restaurants, delicatessens and groceries in all five boroughs were named yesterday by the city's Health Services Administration for alleged serious violations of the Health Code.

title: Art
description: NOW and then there appears a book so good that to comment on its virtues amounts to presumption. Prints & People by A. Hyatt Mayor; Curator Emeritus of the Department of Prints of the Metropolitan Museum, is such a book. No reviewer should be foolhardy enough to match his perceptions against those of a scholar whose boundless technical and historical knowledge of his subject is not only summarized compactly and with grace but is also spangled from page to page with Comments like one on Brueghel, He did not draw figures like the Italians, as nudes inside drapery, but as though the clothes and flesh had grown together through the habits of the social animal, which says in a sentence what any number of other writers, have tried to say in essays.

title: SKI RACE TAKEN BY MISS ROUVIER
description: VAL d'ISERE, France, Dec. 11 Jacqueline Rouvier of France skied better than ever before today and won a downhill ski race in the World Cup series.

title: The Nation
description: It was one of the darkest days in the history of the United Nations. The year was 1948, and the fledgling world body was besetas it Is todayby turmoil in the Middle East. It had mandated the partition of Palestine into separate Jewish and Arab states, but ancient fears and hostilities had erupted in war. The Security Council's demands for a truce were ignored and, on Sept. 17, its chief mediator, Swedish diplomat Count Folke Bernadotte, was assassinated by Jewish terrorists in Jerusalem. Grave questions were raised as to the validity of the United Nations as a peacekeeping organization.

title: URBAN LEAGUE LISTS RENTALS BY LEFRAK
description: The New York Urban League has announced that more than 200 black and Puerto Rican families have been able to rent apartments in recent months in Brooklyn and Queens apartment buildings owned by the Lefrak Organization.

title: Fairfield Triumphs 86 to 74, as Cornell Coach Fails to Appear for Contest
description: ITHACA, N. Y., Dec. 11Events at Cornell University took another strange turn when the team's head coach, Jerry Lace, failed to appear for tonight's game between Cornell and Fairfield University, won by Fairfield, 8674.

title: Remembrance of Tramps Past
description: TAKING you to meet the bestknown man in the world, the taxi driver points to a treecovered sweep of hillside above the highway and says with pride and a certain amount of reverence, All that belongs to Monsieur Chaplin.

title: W. H. Hays 3d, Lucile Walker Are Wed Here
description: Miss Lucile Thornton Walker was married here yesterday afternoon to William Henry Hays 3d, a widower and lawyer with the New York law firm of Chadbourne, Q'Neill & Thomson.

title: Latins in Brooklyn In Democratic Caucus
description: A Puerto Rican  Hispanic Democratic Caucus has been formed in Brooklyn with Gumersindo Martinez as its chairman.

title: PATRIOTS TO TEST JET PASS DEFENSE
description: Between them, Carl Garrett and Jim Nance, New England's running backs, have caught 29 passes this season, compared with 43 for Randy Vataha, the smallish wide receiver who is the team's leading pass catcher.

title: OTTAWA
description: OTTAWA, Dec. 11In her relations With the United States these days, Canada feels a little like a woman having an affair with the big rich man next door. She depends on him and he's a good provider, butt he has roving eye and a lot of other affairs elsewhere, so there is a problem.

title: Drop in Traffic Deaths Apparently Leveling Off
description: Safety experts say that a downward trend in the number of deaths on the nation's highways that began early last, year appears to have leveled off in the second half of 1971. Nevertheless, they still expect the rate of traffic deaths per mile this year to be the lowest in history.

title: CONNALLY SUGGESTS SHIFT AT TREASURY
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 11Secretary of the Treasury John B. Connally has asked Congress for legislation increasing the number of toplevel jobs in his department and promoting several of its top officials to higher rank.

title: Israel Behind 2 New Proposals At U.N. Urging Peace Talks
description: UNITED NATIONS, N. Y., Dec. 11Two compromise resolutions calling for the resumption of indirect peace talks between Israel and Egypt without preconditions have been submitted to the General Assembly, preparing the way for a final vote in the Middle East debate.

title: Senate Legislation Would Pay Victims Of Violent Crimes
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 11 (AP) Senator John L. McClellan, Democrat of Arkansas, introduced broad legislation today to provide for Federal benefit payments of up to $50,000 for the victims of violent crimes.

title: Recordings
description: IF ever a project deserved an operning fantareon the valveless Baroque trumpet, of courseit is Telefunken's plan to record the complete cantatas of Bach. Under the direction of Nikolas Harnoncourt, the performances will employ original instruments, male singers exclusively in the church works and every available scrap of knowledge of how the cantatas were played in Bach's time. Since there are more than 2.00 existing Bach cantatas, the project is set for a long trajectory, and is expected to require 10 years to complete, It is somehow comforting, for one who often has trouble planning into next week, to know that more methodical types are capable of a longer view, and that come hell or holocaust, Harnoncourt and his oldmusic specialists of the Concentus Musicus will doubtless be down in some hardened silo near Vienna, plugging away at Bach.

title: 4 TO GO TO LIBERIA WITH MRS. NIXON
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 11 (AP) The White House announced this week that a fourmember delegation would accompany Mrs. Nixon to the inaugural ceremonies on Jan. 2 to 4 of the new President of Liberta, William Tolbert will attend.

title: Twice as Mad Triumphs
description: PHOENIX, Ariz., Dec. 11 (AP) Twice as Mad won the feature race at Turf Paradise by five lengths today. The winner ran the 5 furlongs in 1:03.25 and paid $10 for $2 to win.

title: SCHOOL HEAD OUT IN PHILADELPHIA
description: PHILADELPHIA, Dec. 11 Dr. Mark R. Shedd was hailed as an enlightened educator with progressive ideas when became superintendent of Philadelphia's public schools in November of 1966.

title: Waiting for Pinter: A Play
description: author of Mary, Mary

title: DeGo Hubert, West Highland White, Named Best in Show at Philadelphia
description: PHILADELPHIA, Dec. 11 Ch. DeGo Hubert, a small hardy looking terrier, exhibiting great showmanship, took his second top prize in six days today. The West Highland white was named best of 3,212 dogs at the 77th fixture of the Kennel Club of Philadelphia in Exhibition Hall of the Civic Center.

title: Canadiens Edge North Stars, 4 to 3, as Lafleur, a Rookie, Gets Three Goals
description: MONTREAL, Dec. 11 (UPI)Guy Lafleur, a rookie, scored three goals tonight to lead the Montreal Canadiens to a 4.3 victory over the Minnesota North Stars in the National Hockey League.

title: SEOUL IS UNEASY OVER NIXON TRIP
description: SEOUL, South Korea, Dec. 9 Theleaders of South Korea are privately expressing deep anxiety that President Nixon will sacrifice them in the interests of detente with China when he goes to Peking in February.

title: Sara J. Hannan Is Bride of B. D. Colen
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 11 Miss Sara Jeanne Hannan, who forks for the Federal Reserve Board here, was married this evening to B. D. Colen, a reporter on the metropolitan staff of The Washington Post. The Rev. Richard Eick performed the ceremony in the Westmoreland Congregational Church, assisted by William A. Potter, a divinity student.

title: Music
description: ALERT Wagnerites, long fearing the extinction of Homoloudus opeirahelden (Wagnerian tenor), a large male biped, formerly common in the wings of German opera houses, and characterized by enormous lungs and a woeful mating call lasting for hours, have joyously reported the existence of a truly magnificent specimen in Jess Thomas.

title: After the Pentagon Papers
description: NORMAN MAILER and Rip Torn flounder together in the island grass, Mailer bleeding froni his hammered head, Torn's ear half bitten off. They rise and, exchange maledictions:

title: STARS DOWN NETS AS BEATY GETS 24
description: SALT LAKE CITY, Dec. 11 (UPI)  The Utah Stars outscored the New York Nets, 3016, in the third quarter after a close first half tonight and went on to a 10982 American Basketball Association victory.

title: Hart to Head Memphis Pros
description: MEMPHIS, Tenn., Dec. 11 (AP)A. S. (Bert) Hart has been named president of Memphis Area Sports, Inc., owners of the Memphis Pros of the American Basketball Association. Hart, an investment broker, succeeds Herbert Kosten, who resigned for business reasons.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: 15,000 Attend Michigan U. Rally to Protest Jailing of Radical Poet
description: ANN ARBOR, Mich, Dec. 11 John Sinclair, a radical poet, serving the 29th month of a nineandahalf to 10year sentence for possession of marijuana, answered a telephone in prison last night and heard 15,000 young people who were protesting his imprisonment roar, Free John, Free John.

title: War Summary
description: NEW DELHIIndia reported that her army captured five more towns in East Pakistan and took at least 3,000 Pakistani prisoners.

title: Article 1  No Title
description: AUCKLAND, New Zealand, Dec. 11 (AP)Mrs. Billie Jean King defaulted to Kerry Melville of Australia in the third set of the semifinals of the $44,800 New Zealand open tennis tournament today.

title: Art
description: THIS is the time of year when certain galleries, responding to the hiatus in the sale of socalled high art which the Christmas season is said to induce, devote their premises to the exhibition of folk art. There are just now two very interesting exhibitions of this sort: The show of 19thcentury tinsel paintings, from the collection of Edward Leight, at the PeridotWashburn Gallery, 820 Madison Avenue at 68th Street; and a small group of carvings and other folk objects, from the collection of the Stony Point Folk Art Gallery, at the Willard Gallery, 29 East 72d Street.

title: COLUMBIA SWIMMING IN A NEW DIRECTION
description: When the Columbia swimming team recorded a 7142 victory over Lehman College Wednesday, it was the team's first victory since the 196869 season. The man most responsible for the squad's turnabout in form is the newly appointed head coach, Don Galluzzi.

title: Battle at Kashmir River Said to Leave 900 Dead
description: KHOUR, India, Dec. 11Pakistani tanks and infantry launched, a massive attack last night across the shallow, sandy Munnawar Tawi River, leaving behind 600 of their own dead and about 300, Indian dead, Indian field commanders said here today.

title: U.S. Asks Fort Lauderdale To Pay Back School Grant
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 11 (AP) The Office of Education said this week that it was suspending and seeking repayment of a $1.7million desegregation grant to schools in Fort Lauderdale, Fla., for alleged violation of Federal regulations.

title: Criminals At Large
description: Consider the secret agents, those machines for murder everready with the karate chop, the whispering knife, the lethal pressure on the jugular. Consider them especially in SPARGO by Jack Denton Scott (World, $7.95) and THE INFILTRATOR by Andrew York (Doubleday, $5.95.)

title: SEA BUILDUP SET BY SOUTH AFRICA
description: JOHANNESBURG, South Africa, Dec. 11South Africa is to begin building up its naval defenses on the Cape of Good Hope sea route with six corvettes equipped with guided missiles to be built in Portugal and possibly in South Africa itself, it was announced this week by Defense Minister Pieter Willem Botha.

title: FOES OF AID BILL MAY BLOCK PLAN FOR ADJOURNING
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 11Plans for Congressional adjournment next week were threatened today when a small group of Senators decided to fight against Senate adoption of a stopgap resolution permitting the foreign aid program to continue until next March.

title: Books:
description: Analyzing the broad and often turbulent world of or

title: Connecticut Wins, 9861
description: STORRS, Conn., Dec. 11 (AP) Cal Chapman scored 24 points to lead the University of Connecticut to a 9861 victory over Vermont in a Yankee Conference basketball game tonight.

title: Travel Notes: Tours for the Disabled, Cruises Canceled, Songs at a Seaport
description: BEGINNING early next year, Pan American World Airways will offer special group tours of Europe and Hawaii for the physically disabled.

title: M'LEAN SURVIVES TWO OBSTACLES
description: A performer who can survive a bomb scare and an antagonistic audience must be something special. Singersongwriter Don McLean came on stage at Columbia University's Wollman Auditorium Friday night and was greeted by listeners who were justifiably angry about the garish, bright spotlights beaming down on them. Some friends were filming Mr. McLean, and their need for appropriate lighting apparently took precedence over the audience's comfort. Associated with a performer whose psychic antennas are usually highly sensitive to rudeness, it was a peculiarly thoughtless action.

title: Glenwood St a Borderline Case
description: Glenwood Street is a shaded lane with a curiously divided character. It is half Nassau, half Queens, more or less.

title: Dividend Limits: A Pain to Shareholder
description: There are thousands of stockholders who depend on dividends for their living expenses and for the majority of investors a reduction or suspension of such payouts can prove to be traumatic.

title: What's Opened in the Theater?
description: TWO GENTLEMEN OF VERONA, the New York Shakespeare Festival production of a musical adaptation of Shakespeare's comedy, got 10 enthusiastic reviews (Barnes, Times; Watt, News; Watts, Post; Gottfried, Women's Wear; Oppenheimer, Newsday; Raidy, Newhouse Newspapers; Glover, AP;, Gayer, UPI; Harris, CBSTV; Klein, WNEWTV), one mixed (Sanders, ABCTV) and on e negative review (Bookspan, WPIXTV).

title: A UTILITY IN IOWA MUST PAY REFUND
description: DES MOINES, Iowa, Dec. 11 The 28,000 customers of the Davenport (Iowa) Water Company will divide nearly $2million in refunds under a final modification order announced by the Iowa Commerce Commission in the company's fourandahalfyearold rate increase case.

title: ARNOLD PERL, 58, PRODUCER, DEAD
description: Arnold Perl, writer and producer, died yesterday at his home, 305 East 18th Street. He was 58 years old.

title: He's Just Wild About Jazz
description: SPECIAL figures live among us and always have, but none of them are quite so interesting, I think, as those whose passionate regard for an art form sets them apart from nearly all their fellow enthusiasts. I met such a person recently when I talked with Ed Beach, producer and host of the very appropriately titled radio show, Just Jazz. The program, now being broadcast nightly on WRVRFM (10 P.M. to midnight with twohour repeats at noon daily and an eighthour marathon on Saturdays, 10:30 A.M. to 6:30), stands as something of a legend among serious jazz listeners in the metropolitan area, a tribute to Beach's devotion to the music, and his tough, straightahead way of presenting it.

title: District to Subsidize Physician
description: The residents of two Fire Island communities have succeeded in a yearlong effort to gain approval of the creation of a special district the first of its kind in the state  to subsidize a physician in residence for the summer months.

title: Patricia Seligman Wed To J. D. Grant, Lawyer
description: Miss Patricia Seligman, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Malcolm Seligman of New York, was married here last evening to Jerome David Grant, son of Mr. and Mrs. Samuel H. Grant of Brooklyn. Rabbi Daniel Wolk performed the ceremony at the Plaza.

title: A Dogcatcher's Life Is Not a Merry Chase
description: A day in the life of bigcity dogcatcher is changing some these days, but not by much.

title: Birth Notice 1  No Title
description: Births Engagements

title: Coast Guard Elects 2
description: Ray Brown, defensive linebacker and Brian Clark, offensive guard, have been elected cocaptain of the 1972 Coast Guard Academy football team. The Cadets have just completed their best season (82) since Otto Graham coached an undefeated season in 1963.

title: Balcony's Babe Captures Coast Race by HalfLenigth
description: SAN MATEO, Calif., Dec. 11 (UPI)Balcony's Babe fought off the closing challenge of seven tightly bunched horses today to win the $20,000 added Tropicana Handicap at Bay Meadows by half a length.

title: JAMES M'KENNA, 73, A LAWYER 50 YEARS
description: MAPLEWOOD, N.J., Dec. 11 James L. McKenna, a former chief of security of the state Department of Law and Public Safety, died today in St. Barnabas Medical Center, Livingston. He was 73 years old.

title: ARTS SOCIETY GIVES REQUIEM BY FAURE
description: Faurs Requiem, one of the most fragile examples of the species, wilted somewhat in Town Hall Friday night under the ministrations of the New York University Choral Arts Society. The devotional aspect of the performance was appropriate, but not the gratingly offpitch singing of the tenor section, the lack of evenly controlled dynamic contrasts and the muddy choralinstrumental textures. Sylvia Barone and Anthony Lopez sang the brief solos.

title: DOCTOR GIVEN RIGHT TO DONATE $250,000
description: BOSTON, Dec. 11  An unusual award by which the recipient is granted the right of distributing a quarter of a million dollars for projects in child health care has been given to Dr: Charles A. Janeway, a leading Boston pediatrician.

title: Robin Martin of R.P.I. Fiance of Alison Cady
description: KATONAH, N. Y., Dec. 11 Mr. and Mrs. E. Ware Cady Jr. have announced the engagement of their daughter, Miss Alison Cady, to Robin Bradley Martin, son of Mr. and Mrs. Alastair B. Martin and a greatgrandson of the late Henry Phipps, who was a partner of Andrew Carnegie in the steel business.

title: Totem Pole Is Lifted
description: ANCHORAGE, Dec. 11 (UPI) Among the shoplifting complaints on the Police Department desk this week was one that said that a man had strolled down the concourse of the Anchorage International Airport terminal, picked up a 56pound, 7foot totem pole from in front of a gift shop, carried it out the front door, loaded it into a truck and driven away.

title: NORA FAUCHALD, SOPRANO, IS DEAD
description: Nora Fauchald, a soprano who in her later years had been a teacher of voice at St. Margaret's School in Waterbury, Conn., died Friday evening in the SloanKettering Institute for Cancer Research. She was 73 years old and lived at 47 Woodbury Road, Watertown, Conn.

title: The Theater: Moliere in Philadelphia
description: PHILADELPHIA  America has such an insubstantial, even casual, grasp upon its architectural past that any attempt at architectural restoration and restitution is to be applauded. It never ceases to amaze me how much of our history in the streets we have senselessly demolished and how little remains of what was once a rich heritage.

title: Redskins Activate Jordan
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 11 (UPI)  The Washington Redskins placed Jeff Jordan, a running back, on their active roster today and placed Mack Alston, a tight end, on the taxi squad to make room for him. Jordan will see service with the Redskin specialty teams in their Monday night game with the Los Angeles Rams.

title: Defense of Solzhenitsyn Seen in 2 Works by Poet Who Voted to Expel Him From Writers Union in '69
description: MOSCOW, Dec. 11The Moscow literary world is abuzz over the publication of twe poems that are being interpreted by some as a defense of Aleksandr I. Solzhenitsyn, the Nobel Prizewinning novelist whose work is banned in the Soviet Union.

title: Assessing the Pay Board
description: Rocco C. Siciliano, a member of President Nixon's 15man Pay Board, who served until eight months ago as Under Secretary of Commerce, is not yet convinced that the Administration's goal of reducing inflation to 2 to 3 per cent by the end of 1972 can be met.

title: The Games Children Played
description: I ant an alumnus of the Brooklyn streets. They were and still are predominantly the playgrounds of the poor. The block is where the action is. Poor kids everywhere play more than rich kids. They have the leisure time since they don't have to take field trips to recreation areas. This advantage does not negate all the disadvantages, but the fact remains that boredom is not one of the problems of poor city kids.

title: The Biggest Gripe the Airlines Get And What's Being Done About
description: Every regular airline rider has his own terrible tale of baggage woes. Recently, I arrived London only to find my bags were still in Leningrad, leading to the observation: Don't let anyone tell you Aeroflot doesn't compare with Western airlines. They can lose your baggage just like anyone else.

title: LETTERS
description: To the Financial Editor: In Revamping Bankruptcy Laws (Nov. 21) Hugh Slate is quoted to the effect that Courts should have the discretion to waive the prepayment of the bankruptcy filing fee.

title: SEXCOURSE RULINGS EXPECTED IN JERSEY
description: TRENTON, Dec. 11  The courts in New Jersey have indicated that they plan to rule on the controversial issue of sex education in the public schools.

title: U.S. BUSINESS ROUNDUP
description: Governors, legislators and other state officials are hearing from consumers. Their responses so far vary in scope and effectiveness, but it is clear that consumer protection has become an upfront matter at the state level.

title: Letters:
description: To THE EDITOR: The Site of the Most Shocking Single Event of Our Time, the article, about the assassination of President John F. Kennedy (Travel section, Nov. 21) is, I contend, flirther example of the manufacture and perpetuation of an idol where none exists.

title: Mary Counihan to Wed
description: EAST ISLIP, L. I., Dec. 11 Dr. and Mrs. Thomas R. Counihan have announced the engagement of their daughter, Miss Mary Elizabeth Counihan, to Michael Joseph Tangney, son of Mrs. Joseph J. Tangney of North Andover, Mass., and the late Mr. Tangney.

title: Patrick Egan Weds Margaret Moriarty
description: Miss Margaret Julia Moriarty was married here yesterday afternoon to Patrick Owen Egan. The Rev. Gerard C. Reedy performed the ceremony in the Roman Catholic Church of St. Ignatius Loyola.

title: A Contract Yields Parole in Minnesota
description: STILLWATER, Minn., Dec. 10Prisoner X, like most of the inmates at Stillwater Prison, is about 32 years old, white, unskilled, and has a ninthgrade education. He has probably been a burglar and, like 80 per cent of his fellow inmates, he has been convicted at least twice and probably has a drug or an alcohol problem.

title: Sports of The Times
description: In his own way, each is carrying on the tradition of their father. And yet each is so different. Upton Bell of the New England Patriots is flamboyant and energetic, at 33 the National Football League's youngest general manager, still a romanticist. His older brother, Bert Bell Jr., once the Baltimore Colts' business manager, is a disillusioned dropout from the establishment, now one of its most caustic critics. Their father, of course, was the N.F.L. Commissioner for 14 years until he collapsed and died at a game in Philadelphia in 1959.

title: Insurers' Cash Flood
description: Businessmen looking for expansion capital are beginning to find out that it is not exactly a buyer's market yet but that it is the closest thing to it in well over a year.

title: Letters:
description: To THE EDITOR: Richard Sasanow, who wrote Budapest on a Shoestring (Travel section, Nov. 21), should be reminded that most of the music heard in Budapest is not gypsy but Hungarian. There is a considerable difference, as Bartok and Kodaly, who devoted so much scholarship to the subject, proved long ago. The author found nothing to say about the city of Eger except that it was crowded; it is one of the most interesting places in Hungary, for in addition to a medieval fortress it contains numerous charming examples of baroque architecture.

title: Delaware Trounces C. W. Post, 7222, in Boardwalk Bowl
description: ATLANTIC CITY, Dec. 11Delaware's strong, balanced football team, ranked as the No. 1 smallcollege group in the land, stormed through C.W. Post for five secondquarter touchdowns on the way to a 7222 victory in the annual Boardwalk Bowl today. The game was played in the Convention Hall, where Miss Americas are crowned.

title: CHIEFS, RAIDERS IN KEY STRUGGLE
description: The Kansas City Chiefs are slight favorites to defeat the Oakland Raiders and clinch their division title today in one of the key National Football League games.

title: First Woman Officer Chosen by Press Club
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 11 (UPI)Helen Thomas, White House correspondent for United Press International, became the first woman officer of the National Press Club in elections last night that upset the club's advancement tradition.

title: Charleston Post to Goodrich
description: CHARLESTON, W. Va., Dec. 11 (AP)Ward Carlton Goodrich, a minor league baseball administrator, has been named general manager of the Charleston Charlies of baseball's Class AAA International League.

title: 5 TOWNS CAPTURED
description: NEW DELHI, Dec. 11The Indian Army captured five more towns in East Pakistan and took at least 3,000 Pakistani soldiers prisoner in the last 24 hours, Indian spokesmen said today.

title: Thoughts on Nuclear Plumbing.
description: Computerage nuclear power plants have run into plumbing problems which raise doubts about situating reactors close to cities.

title: The World
description: OTTAWACartoonists called it Santa Claus mission in reverse, Conservatives said it was pleasant but ineffective, members of the New Democratic party found it humiliating and Prime Minister Pierre Elliott Trudeau hailed it as a fantastic success.

title: CHARLES A. GIBBONS 3D
description: Charles A. Gibbons 3d, a partner in Havens and Emerson, Ltd., environmental engineers at 233 Broadway, died yesterday in Memorial Hospital. He was 51 years old and lived at 61 Oliver Street, Brooklyn.

title: BEAME MISLEADS, WALSH CHARGES
description: A report that more than twothirds of New York's MitchellLama housing projects were behind in their payments to the city was criticized as seriously misleading yesterday by Albert A. Walsh, the Housing and Development Administrator.

title: Controls Are Found to Win Growing Support Despite Widespread Distaste
description: A mood of grudging acceptance of the Administration's economic controls program seems to be emerging in the nation nearly four months after President Nixon imposed wage and price controls on almost every segment of the economy.

title: LETTERS
description: To the Financial Editor: Miss Marylin Bender described precisely the current atmosphere at the Columbia Graduate School of Business.

title: It Is Now Post Time Will Be Losing Some of Its Twang on Wednesday at Aqueduct
description: Fred Capossela, who is rounding out his career as announcer at the New York Racing Association tracks with the end of the season on Wednesday, was the guest at a luncheon by the Association before yesterday's Aqueduct program.

title: Elizabeth Baer To Be a Bride
description: DUXBURY, Mass., Dec. 11 Mr. and Mrs. Robert Andrew Baer, formerly of Summit, N. J., have made known the engagement of their daughter, Miss Elizabeth Ann Baer, to John Thorne Perkin, son of Mrs. Richard Scott Perkin of New Canaan, Conn., and the late Mr. Perkin, who founded the PerkinElmer Corporation of Norwalk, Conn., manufacturers of scientific instruments. Mr. Perkin was for many years president and board chairman of the concern.

title: Amber Wong, Owen Nee Jr. Are Married
description: RYE, N. Y., Dec. 11Miss Amber Wong was married here this afternoon to Owen Dawes Nee Jr., who taught English at the Chinese University of Hong Kong while his wife was a student at its Chung Chi College.

title: Humphrey Plans '72 Bid; Enters Race Next Month
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 11Senator Hubert H. Humphrey will announce his candidacy for the Democratic Presidential nomination in midJanuary. He plans an allout primary campaign with major efforts in Florida and Wiscbnsin.

title: New York
description: The memory of that first night in an unfamiliar City Hall has always haunted the Lindsay Administration. The outgoing Democrats had left the place spanking clean, but without pencils or telephone directories. The newcomers found a tiny metal shamrock looking up from a fresh blotter on the Mayor's deska mocking hint of Mr. Lindsay's troubles with the Transport Workers Union led by Irish Mike Quilland they knew the subway trains soon would stop running.

title: Bulls Conquer Celtics
description: BOSTON, Dec. 11 (UPI)Jerry Sloan, Bob Love and Chet Walker combined for 69 points tonight to pace the Chicago Bulls to a 11599 victory over the Boston Celtics.

title: Blood Bank Bill Sponsored
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 11 (UPI)  Representative Robert H. Steele, Republican of Connecticut, cosponsored legislation today that would establish a nationwide program to license, inspect and regulate all blood banks. Mr. Steele contended that some commercial blood banks were spreading communicable serum hepatitis by attracting skid row derelicts and drug addicts who sell their blood for the price of a bottle or a fix.

title: He's just wild about writing
description: William S. Burroughs is a great autoeroticistof writing, not sex. He gets astral kicks by composing in blocks, scenes, repetitive and identical memories galvanizing themselves into violent fantasies, the wild mixing of pictures, words, the echoes of popular speech. It is impossible to suspect him of any base erotic motives in his innumerable scenes of one adolescent boy servicing another like a piece of plumbing; nor should one expect a book from him different from his others. Burroughs is the purest writer in Barney Rosset's grove, and not just because in this book he more than ever turns his obsession with cold, callous homosexual coupling into a piece of American science fiction.

title: DEFENSE EXCELS
description: BLOOMINGTON, Minn., Dec 11  The Minnesota Vikings, a football team indifferent to its anemic offense, scored a touchdown from a blocked Viking fieldgoal attempt in defeating the Detroit Lions, 2910, today.

title: Hussein Calls Arabs Unfit Fora War With Israel Now
description: AMMAN, Jordan, Dec. 10King Hussein has declared that the Arabs are not ready for war with Israel and that Jordan for one will not let herself be dragged into a conflict at this time.

title: Michael Panio to Wed Rosanne Di Fabio
description: YONKERS, Dec. 11Dr. Anthony J. Di Fabio has announced the engagement of his daughter, Miss Rosanne Frances Di Fabio, to Michael William Panio, son of Dr. and Mrs. Joseph Panio of Yonkers. The wedding is planned for Sept. 30 in Crestwood.

title: L.I. Feeling Impact of the Youth Culture
description: Collectives, free schools, peace movement centers and head shops have been springing up in Nassau and Suffolk Counties at a time when the police in the Haight  Asbury section of San Francisco and the East Village section of New York City report an exodus of teenagers that almost amounts to the end of urban hippie life.

title: the travelar's world
description: ACAPULCO, MexicoA new Aztec pyramid, 15 stories high, has risen here on Revolcadero Beach beside the Pacific, with its long sides facing the ocean and the mountains to the east of this resort. Not a belated archeological discovery, it is one of two buildings constituting the new Acapulco tangular bulding contains 252 rooms guest rooms. An adjacent, modern rectangular building contains 252 rooms plus restaurants, ballrooms and vast convention facilities.

title: Amy Rosenberg to Wed
description: BETHESDA, Md., Dec. 11Dr. and Mrs. Charles A. Rosenberg fiave announced the engagement of their daughter, Miss Amy Jo Rosenberg, to Michael Joel Bloom, son of Mr. and Mrs. Arthur M. Bloom of New York. The wedding is planned for January. The prospective bride is a senior at Syracuse University College of Liberal Arts. Her fiance was graduated from Syracuse, where he is attending the College of New York. The wedding is planned for January. The prospective bride is a senior at Syracuse University College of Liberal Arts. Her fiance was graduated from Syracuse, where he is attending the College of Law.

title: Hulks of Confederate Blockade Runners Yield Cargo
description: CHARLESTON, S. C., Dec. 11  Confederate blockade runners destined for Charleston more than 100 years ago finally are yielding their cargoes.

title: W. ATLEE BURPEE 3D, SEED FIRM OFFICIAL
description: W. Atlee Burpee 3d, a senior vice president of the W. Atlee Burpee Seed Company of Philadelphia and a grandson of the concern's founder, died yesterday at his home in Doylestown, Pa. His age was 54.

title: STOKE CITY HELD TO 11 SOCCER TIE
description: LONDON, Dec. 11 (Reuters)Firstplace Manchester United faltered in its march toward the English Soccer League's First Division championship today when it was held to a 11 draw by Stoke City.

title: MRS. MEIR HINTS AT NEW U.S. HELP
description: Israeli Premier Goida Meir hinted tonight that she had received additional assurances of military assistance from the Nixon Administration.

title: NEW EMIRATE UNION OFFERS IRAN AMITY
description: TEHERAN, Iran, Dec. 11 (AP) The President of the newly formed Union of Arab Emirates has cabled the Shah of Iran pledging willingness to strengthen relations with Iran.

title: The Nation
description: Some of our people literally have not had a day off since the 14th of November, said the executive vicepresident of a large Midwest consumer products company last week, as he pored through the latest Government regulations on price increases.

title: ACADEMY OF ARTS JOINS WITH PACE
description: The American Academy of Dramatic Arts, one of the oldest institutions of its kind in the western world, and Pace College have entered into an affiliation agreement, to share programs and facilities that will lead to an associate of arts degree in the performing arts.

title: Religion
description: In July, 1969, the Communications Office of the United Church of Christ announced its desire to testify before a Senate subcommittee considering legislation on the renewal of television licenses. Two weeks later, the office received a letter from the Internal Revenue Service warning that excessive activity in the legislative area could lead to a loss of the church's taxexempt status.

title: Syracuse Defeats Navy
description: SYRACUSE, Dec. 11 (AP)Syracuse continued its winning streak tonight with a 9080 victory over Navy.

title: Hawks Down Leafs, 3.1
description: TORONTO, Dec. 11 (UP1)Pit Martin's shot from just inside the blue line at 9:34 of the third period was the goahead goal as the Chicago Black Hawks beat the Toronto Maple Leafs, 31, tonight.

title: Kathy L. Daley Plans Nuptials
description: BRONXVILLE, N. Y., Dec. 11Mr. and Mrs. Charles G, Daley have made known the engagement of their daughter, Miss Kathy Lew Daley, to Theodore G. Bohnen, son of Mrs. Theodore G. Bohnen of Scarsdale and the late Mr. Bohnen.

title: Books:
description: Capsizing should be considered part of the fun of sailing, we are told here, and the first indication of seasickness is usually a greenish pallor, followed by yawning, drowsiness, salivation, weakness, loss of attention, deep breathing, cold sweat, giddiness, inability to function, occasionally hiccoughing, dizziness and vomiting.

title: Penn Central Will Restore 17 OffPeakHour Trains
description: Seventeen offpeakhour trains between North White Plains and New York City and between Brewster and New York City will be restored to service Dec. 20, the Penn Central Transportation Company announced yesterday.

title: Russians Here Pray And Then Protest Policies in Soviet
description: Russian churchgoers celebrated the divine liturgy, lighted candles and prayed yesterday for nonviolent dissenters of all faiths and nationalities languishing in Soviet punitive and psychiatric institutions.

title: STANS IS LINKED TO THAI COMPANY
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 12 (AP) Shortly after Maurice H. Stans took office as Secretary of Commerce, the private foundation that he controls acquired a financial interest in a Thailand paper company that benefits directly from United States Government money and management assistance.

title: SADAT SAYS SOVIET WILL RETAIN USE OF BASES IN EGYPT
description: CAIRO, Dec. 10President Anwar elSadat has promised the Soviet Union that he will continue to give naval facilities to its Mediterranean fleet even after a possible settlement with Israel. At the same time, President Sadat said in a lengthy interview here, he intends to keep Soviet advisers attached to the Egyptian Army because war is a science now.

title: SOVIET FINISHES BIG SIBERIA PLANT
description: MOSCOW, Dec. 12The Soviet Union announced today the completion of the world's, largest hydroelectric plant, al Siberian station that has three times the rated capacity of the Grand Coulee Dam in the United States.

title: Alicia Patterson Awards Won by Five Journalists
description: Five journalists have been named to receive Alicia Patterson Fund fellowships for travel and study in 1972, it was announced yesterday by Joseph P. Albright, president of the fund.

title: Islamic Past of Azerbai jan Republic Frustrates Moscow's Marxist Plans
description: BAKU, U.S.S.R.Half a century of Soviet power has done, much to modernize the Azerbaijan Republic, but the Azerbaijani style of life, refleeting centuries of Moslem influence, refuses to conform to the Communist model.

title: Unions Agree to Contract At Lockheed and McDowell
description: LOS ANGELES, Dec. 12 (AP)  Unions representing 44,500 aerospace workers voted to accept new threeyear contracts with the Lockheed Aircraft Company and the McDonnell Douglas Aircraft Corporation.

title: 6 Teenagers Killed and 2 Hurt In a 1Car Crash in Connecticut
