Mr. Peiffer's conceit was to couch his improvisations in quasiclassical frameworks  Bach pieces, Chopin pieces and the like. But the French pianist really was doing nothing more than improvising in a highly technical, rhythmically sterile and emotionally vacuous style that substituted pianistics for feeling.

title: OPENING GAIN CUB ON AMEX AND OTC
description: The American Stock Exchange and the overthecounter market opened slightly higher yesterday but then prices reversed and moved mostly lower throughout the session.

title: Serpico Tells of Delay on Police Inquiry
description: A detective told the Knapp Commission yesterday that at least five months passed between the time he complained to high city officials of widespread police corruption and the opening of an official investigation of the charge.

title: 18YearOlds Get Rights
description: SACRAMENTO, Calif., Dec. 14 (UPI)Gov. Ronald Reagan today signed legislation making 18yearolds adults in nearly all respects except the right to buy a drink. They will be able to sign contracts, serve on juries and marry without parental consent. They already have the vote.

title: A TermandaHalf for President
description: A sixyear term for the American President, with ineligibility for reelection, has become an active public issue. Senators Mansfield and Aiken, two of that parliamentary chamber's most respected members, are now urging this on Congress. This kind of sponsorship persuades us that serious thought be given, particularly by those who believe the torment and risk that resides in today's problems force new ideas upon a reluctant Congress and its constituency.

title: ULTRALEFT GROUP ACCUSED IN ITALY
description: ROME, Dec. 14An ultraleftist movement that calls itself Workers Power and is said to count a rich leftwing nobleman and many intellectuals among its backers is under police investigation on allegations that it has organized violence.

title: Drive to Unseat Delaney Set by Queens Democrats
description: A campaign to oust Representative James J. Delaney, a conservative minded Democratic member of the House Rules Committee, will be waged next year by the Queens Democratic organization.

title: Significant Step Seen
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 14 (UPI) Secretary of the Treasury Connally said today that the move toward devaluation of the dollar and realignment of other currencies was a very significant step forward. He predicted that substantial progress would be made this weekend when the finance ministers of the major industrial nations meet here.

title: Bay State Car Insurers Must Cut Rates
description: BOSTON, Dec. 14 (AP)State officials today ordered a 27.6 per cent reduction, and proposed a further 27.6 per cent cut, in 1972 premium costs for compulsory bodily injury auto insurance. They attributed the reduction to the state's nofault automobile insurance payment system.

title: LAWMAKERS MEET TO REDRAW LIES
description: ALBANY, Wednesday, Dec. 15The State Legislature gathered here fruitlessly during the night to receive a Republicanengineered reapportionment proposal reflecting a diminution of New York City's power because of suburban population growth.

title: Year After Riots That Shook Poland, Gdansk Finds Things Better, but ...
description: GDANSK, Poland, Dec. 14 One year ago today a group of workers stormed out of the Lenin Shipyards in this port city to confront Communist party leaders downtown with longstanding complaints over low wages, rising prices, food shortages and dismal working conditions.

title: Methane Gas Was Present In Air Vent of Huron Tunnel
description: PORT HURON, Mich., Dec. 14 (UPI)Deadly methane gas was present in an air vent drilled through the Lake Huron water tunnel shortly before an explosion in the tunnel killed 22 workers, the State Health Department said today.

title: Liner Hotel Lease Approved
description: LONG REACH, Calif., Dec. 14 (AP)The City Council voted unanimously today to approve a 25year lease allowing Pacific Southwest Airlines to operate 400room hotel on the retired ocean liner Queen Mary. The ship is at permanent anchor at a pier here.

title: Books of The Times
description: The French have always made a fetish of conversation, unhesitatingly proclaiming themselves masters of this art. Between 1862 and 1872, a number of Paris's greatest causeurs met regularly for dinner at Magny's, a small restaurant on the Left Bank. They included Flaubert, the expatriated Turgenev, George Sand, SaintBeuve, Theophile Gautier, Ernest Renan, Hippolyte Taine and the Goncourt brothers, as well as a number of lesser lights. Robert Baldick, a writer deservedly known for his works on French literature, had the happy idea of researching these famous evenings and reconstructing six of them from journals, diaries, notebooks, memoirs, letters and actual recorded exchanges. If Dinner at Magny's is disappointing, it is not Mr. Baldick's fault. His part of the job is almost a tour de force: It is the principals who have let us down. At one moment, their conversation sounds like lockerroom talk after quite a few Scotches at the 19th hole; at another, they huff, puff and pontificate like so many old duffers in rockers on a porch.

title: Japan Anticipates a Settlement Soon of World Monetary Crisis
description: TOKYO, (Wednesday), Dec. 15  Japanese Government officials, businessmen and bankers said this morning that President Nixon's decision to devalue the dollar had increased the prospects for an early settlement of the international currency crisis.

title: Lonely Truckers Teaming Up With Wives
description: MESQUITE, Tex.There are two things that Mrs. Roy Hodge doesn't like about her new job: If she's not careful, she gets her clothes greasy. And sometimes, when she's 2,500 miles from home and behind the wheel of giant diesel rig with 16 gears and a cargo of 16 tons, she wishes she could stop to visit a beauty parlor.

title: Dollar Devaluation...
description: The joint announcement from the Azores by President Nixon and President Pompidou of France that, in cooperation with other nations, they have reached broad agreement on a prompt realignment of currencies is encouraging news. Even so, a shockwave ran around the world yesterday with the realization that the dollar would be formally devalued for the first time since President Roosevelt's devaluation at the bottom of the Depression.

title: A Traitor Speaks
description: KATZENELNBOGEN, West Germany As a traitor who was once unmasked by Herr Richard Gehlen, the retired German intelligence chief, I would like to say something about Herr Gehlen's memoirs, already published in West Germany and soon to be published in unexpurgated form in the United States.

title: EDITOR TO START HIS OWN IMPRINT
description: Richard W. Seaver, for more than a decade a leading promoter of avantgarde literature, has resigned as vice president and senior editor of Grove Press in order to start his own imprint in partnership with the Viking Press.

title: LEAFS' 42 VICTORY ENDS BLUES' SKEIN
description: ST. LOUIS, Dec. 14 (UPI)Ron Ellis, Dave Keon, Paul Henderson and Jim Harrison scored the goals that gave the Toronto Maple Leafs a 42 victory over the St. Louis Blues tonight.

title: Boxing Writers' Unit Picks Frazier as Fighter of Year
description: Joe Frazier was named yesterday as fighter of the year by the Boxing Writers Association.

title: Peru to Get Chinese Loan
description: LIMA, Peru, Dec. 14 (AP)China has agreed to grant Peru a 20year, interestfree loan totaling $42.5million, the Mining and Energy Minister, Jorge Pernndez Maldonado, announced yesterday on his return from a twoweek visit to China, Japan and the Soviet Union.

title: Jersey Courts Will Have Longer Sessions in Future
description: TRENTON, Dec. 14Longer days and shorter and fewer vacations are in store for New Jersey courts to reduce the backlog of cases jamming the calendars.

title: Train Crash in Spain Kills 4
description: SARAGOSSA, Spain, Dec. 14 (AP)Four persons were killed and 18 injured today when the BilbaotoBarcelona express and a freight train collided headon at Gallur station, about 18 miles north of Saragossa, railway officials reported. They said the cause of the accident was not known.

title: Long Defense Pledged
description: RAWALPINDI, Pakistan, Dec. 14 (Reuters)A Pakistani military spokesman reported fierce fighting today between Pakistani force and an Indian paratroop brigade dropped north of Dacca.

title: Meaning of Devaluation: Questions and Answers
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 14Following are questions and answers on the monetary decisions announced today.

title: Fox to Join Cubs' Farm
description: JACKSONVILLE, Fla., Dec. 14 (UPI)  Marshall Fox, the owner and general manager of the Southern League Jacksonville Suns, announced today he would become general manager of the Chicago Cubs' American Association farm team in Wichita, Kan. Fox is expected to sell the Suns on Friday.

title: Pirates Name Morgan Coach
description: PITTSBURGH, Dec. 14 (UPI) Joe Morgan, the manager of the Pittsburgh Pirates' top tripleA farm club the last two seasons, was named today to the Pirates' coaching staff for the 1972 season. The other coaches, all holdovers, are Don Osborn, Frank Occak, Don Leppert and Dave Ricketts.

title: G.E. DEMONSTRATES NEW SEMICONDUCTOR
description: The General Electric Company demonstrated yesterday in the Hotel Pierre here a new family of semiconductor devices designed to protect electronic and electrical equipment against power surges.

title: Indian Frigate Sunk
description: NEW DELHI, Dec. 14 (UPI)Defense Minister Jagjivan Ram said today that the Indian frigate Khukri had been sunk in the Arabian Sea while on an operation off West Pakistan.

title: War on Poverty Unfashionable, ExOfficial Tells Jewish Group
description: The war against poverty is no longer fashionable and attitudes about the poor have never been so hostile, the city's former Human Resources Administrator, Mitchell I. Ginsberg, asserted yesterday.

title: WASHINGTON
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 14With his decision to devalue the almost mighty dollar, President Nixon has now agreed to do just about everything he insisted he would never do. And the odd thing its that he hasn't been devalued in the process.

title: Study Made for Savings Banks Urges Radical Shifts in Setups
description: An upstate professor recommended yesterday a number of radical changes in the structure and operation of savings banks, challenging such traditional tenets as their specialization in housing and their mutual form of ownership.

title: CONSERVATIVE UNIT CITES CONGRESSMEN
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 14 (AP)Americans for Constitutional Action announced today that it was giving its biennial distinguished service award to 168 members of Congress for their conservative voting records.

title: $200,000 Track Winner Gets Year for Conspiracy
description: A Queens man who reportedly won more than $200,000 in several years on twindouble tickets at race tracks received a oneyear prison sentence here yesterday for conspiracy to conceal tax information.

title: Pakistani Pilot Describes Downing of an Indian MIG
description: AT A FIGHTER BASE, in West Pakistan, Dec. 14  A jubilant Pakistani pilot landed his Chinesebuilt MIG19 fighter here today and described how he had just fired an Americanmade Sidewinder missile into an Indian MIG21, destroying the enemy aircraft.

title: 2 LARGE FUNDS GIVE 22 RESEARCH AWARDS
description: The Ford and Rockefeller Foundations yesterday announced 22 research awards to encourage the systematic study of population policy issues.

title: COMMODITY PRICES LISTED FOR WEEK
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 14The Bureau of Labor Statistics reported today the following, spot primary prices for the week ended Dec. 7:

title: Notes on People
description: President and Mrs. Nixon let their fellow Americans, some of whom will bet the real thing, have a look at the First Family's 1971 Christmas card.

title: Dance: Ailey Revives Suspensions
description: A choreographer can occasionally be ahead of his or her time, and this, it seems, is what happened to May O'Donnell, a former dancer with Martha Graham who later formed her own troupe. Last night at the City Center, Alvin Ailey's American Dance Theater gave the first performance of its new production of Miss O'Donnell's Suspension.

title: India Says Her Troops, Driving From the North, Are Within Six Miles of Dacca
description: NEW DELHI, Dec. 14India reported today that her troops, advancing rapidly from the north and the northeast despite heavy fighting, had reached within six miles of Dacca, the East Pakistani capital.

title: SAMUEL FLEISCHER
description: Samuel Fleischer, an employe of the composing room of The New York Times since March 1, 1955, died on Sunday. He was 69 years old and lived at 9608 57th Avenue, Rego Park, Queens.

title: REUSS ASKS NIXON TO BOVE ON SOLD
description: A leading Congressional authority on international finance called on President Nixon yesterday to move at once to obtain authority to Increase the price of gold.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: Chup, in Cambodia, Seized, Saigon Says
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, Dec. 14 (AP) New fighting broke out on Cambodia's northeastern front today after South Vietnamese troops reported capturing the rubber plantation town of Chup in their offensive into eastern Cambodia.

title: ADVANCES AMAZE FREED AMERICANS
description: PHILADELPHIA, Dec. 14 (AP)An energetic young woman, showing little signs of her ordeal, and an Army civilian employe expressed wonderment today at United States technological advances during their imprisonment by the Chinese Communists.

title: 8 Die in Mexican Crash
description: MEXICO CITY, Dec. 14 (AP) Eight persons were killed and 46 injured yesterday when a bus overturned on a highway 35 miles northwest of here, a spokesman for the Red Cross said.

title: Front Page 1  No Title
description: Stop work and start dancing: Wednesday discotheque 6 to mid. All the crepes you can eat $3. L'Etolle, 1 E. 59 St. ADVT.

title: Soviet Says That U.S. and Britain Raise New Barriers to a Security Conference
description: MOSCOW, Dec. 14  The Soviet Union, criticizing the line taken by the Atlantic alliance at Brussels last weekend, accused the United States and Britain today of raising new obstacles to a European security conference.

title: Panel Delays Action on Aerospace Pay
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 14The Pay Board voted today to postpone action on a key contract in the aerospace industry despite assurances from officials of North American Rockwell Corporation and union officers that the contract involves wage increases below the board's 5.5 per cent guideline.

title: Eritrean Liberation Group Is Pursuing its Struggle at the U.N.
description: UNITED NATIONS, N. Y., Dec. 14  More solemn than most delegates and more drably dressed, three quiet men move unobtrusively through the corridors of the United Nations.

title: ATTITUDE OF PUBLIC ON BUSINESS DECRIED
description: The American Telephone and Telegraph Company voiced serious concern here yesterday over what it viewed as the steadily worsening attitude of the public toward big business.

title: 93 HELD IN ZAGREB AS RIOTING ERUPTS
description: ZAGREB, Yugoslavia, Dec. 14 (Reuters)Ninetythree persons were arrested on Zagreb's main square tonight after disturbances broke out for the second consecutive night, the Yugoslav press agency Tanyug reported.

title: Market in Bonds Steady In Face of Dollar Stand
description: The credit markets, faced yesterday with President Nixon's formal announcement that the United States was prepared to devalue the dollaran action Wall Street has already assumed unavoidable, did not move much yesterday.

title: Judge George Timone, 68, Dies; Served the Family Court Here
description: Judge George A. Timone of the Family Court, a former vice president of the Board of Education and a prominent Roman Catholic layman, died of a heart attack Monday night near the Fordham Law Library at Lincoln Center. He was 68 years old and lived at 250 Riverside Drive.

title: Rum Customer's Last Bid To Reach Million Tonight
description: YONKERS, Dec. 14When the third session of its harnessracing season ends tomorrow night, Yonkers Raceway will show a drop of about 8.88 per cent in average attendance and a decline of about 3.41 per cent in average betting handle compared with the corresponding operating dates in 1969.

title: 6 Private University Heads Offer a Plan For State Action to Ease Rising Deficits
description: Warning of the impending financial collapse of many private colleges, the presidents of six of the state's largest and most prestigious universities proposed yesterday a series of state measures to eliminate the schools mounting deficits and assure future growth.

title: Rising to the Occasion for Met's Tristan
description: From out front in the darkened Metropolitan Opera House it all looks like magic, and in a way it is. As the lovedrugged Tristan and Isolde embrace in the spectacular new Wagnerian production, they almost imperceptibly leave the mundane earth, rising as they sing the mighty. Act Two duet, O, sink upon us, night of love.

title: Sioux City Journal Is Sold To 11State Chain of Papers
description: SIOUX CITY, Iowa, Dec. 14 (UPI) Iowa's third largest newspaper, The Sioux City Journal, has been sold to the ScrippsIIagadone Group, which consists of 15 papers in 11 states.

title: TriCity Clearing Exchange Seeks Admission to C.C.S.
description: The New York Stock Exchange announced yesterday that the Clearing Corporation of the PhiladelphiaBaltimoreWashington Stock Exchange had applied for membership in the New York exchange's Central Certificate Service.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor: May I suggest that one way of controlling electioncampaign expenses would be to have all bills for campaign services paid through a public Campaign Expenditures Authority.

title: AGNEW ATTACKS UTOPIAN LEFTISTS
description: Vice President Agnew yesterday vigorously attacked the utopian leftists who despair at how far we fall short of the ideal instead of howl close we have come to achieving it.

title: Hofstra Triumphs, 6960
description: HEMPSTEAD, L. I., Dec. 14Hofstra displayed a balanced attack, with Dave Bell's 14 points putting his career total at 1,004, to defeat Manhattan tonight, 6960. It was the Dutchmen's first victory over the Jaspers in nine years.

title: S.E.C. TO DISCLOSE A TRADING STUDY
description: The Securities and Exchange Commission will make public today the contents of a study ion socalled offboard trading conducted by its staff in 1965, it confirmed yesterday.

title: A Nixon Workday Will Be Shown by N.B.C. Tuesday
description: President Nixon's working day of Dec. 6 has been filmed by the National Broadcasting Company. Cut to an hour, It will be shown at 7:30 P.M. next Tuesday, according to an announcement yesterday by Reu von Frank, N.B.C. News president.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: Plea to U. S. and China
description: KARACHI, Pakistan, Dec. 14 (AP)Heads of seven political parties constituting the United Coalition headed by Prime Minister Nurul Amin, appealed to the United States and China today to urgently arrange for practical help to Pakistan.

title: Sifting of Calls to 911 Aids Police Efficiency
description: Eliminating unnecessary calls to 911, the police emergency telephone number by screening and evaluation kept patrol cars available for real emergencies in more than 50,000 instances, Commissioner Patrick V. Murphy said yesterday.

title: A Federal Financing Bank Proposed by Administration
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 14 (Reuters)  The Administration today proposed legislation to set up a Federal financing bank.

title: Helping Women Keep Ex in Front of Convict
description: Pour years ago, Tracy Brown was an affluent prostitute. She worked the East Side, the West Side, and she says, all around the town, and she sometimes earned $300 a day. Then one night one of her tricks tried to rob her in a hotel room, and she stabbed him to death.

title: University Head Resigns
description: DARTMOUTH Mass., Dec. 14 (AP)Dr. Joseph L. Driscoll said today that he wag resigning at the end of this month as president of Southeastern Massachusetts University and from his post as Commonwealth Professor at the school. He cited reasons of health, family considerations and our perception of what is best for the university and its future.

title: Rates Drop for 9th Time At Fanny May's Auction
description: WASHINGTON, Dec, 14Mortage interest rates declined further at this week's auction of the Federal National Mortgage Association, it was disclosed today.

title: Martin W. Benson Dead; Agriculturist, Teacher, 72
description: Martin W. Benson, a retired agriculturalist and teacher, died of a heart attack at his lhome, 315 East 72d Street, on Monday. He was 72 years old.

title: Gold Producers Expect slight Effect
description: The pending devaluation of the dollar, which will probably result in a higher official dollar price for gold, will have only a limited effect on domestic gold producers and users, and could result temporarily in lower gold prices on the free market, according to a top goldindustry executive.

title: Lincoln Center Caroling
description: Lincoln Center has invited its neighbors and friends to a caroling session around a 25foot Christmas tree in its plaza next Wednesday from 6:30 to 7:15 P.M. Leonard de Paur, director of comunity relations for the center, will conduct the Juilliard School's New Age Brass Ensemble and the assembled singers from the portico of Philharmonic Hall.

title: Realism in the Middle East
description: With one major war in South Asia already on their hands and an even more dangerous conflict threatening in the Middle East, delegates to the United Nations this week have displayed a disheartening preference for rhetoric over realism in their efforts to open avenues to peace.

title: Tentative Accord on Suits
description: The American District Telegraph company announced yesterday that it had reached a tentative agreement on certain antitrust problems that had been pending since July, 1967, on three major classaction suits brought on behalf of a substantial majority of A.D.T. subscribers. The settlement, subject to final judicial approval, would require the company to pay $4,850,000, over three years with interest accruing from the date of the final judgment dismissing all claims.

title: Sandlot Player Dies
description: BAKERSFIELD, Calif., Dec. 14 (AP)  John Vaughn, 16 years old, died in a hospital last night from head injuries received while tackling another player during a sandlot football game.

title: Two Women Seized in Alleged Kidnap Tied to Prostitution
description: Policemen equipped for a riot crashed into a 20thfloor midtown apartment yesterday, seized two young women and accused them of kidnapping a third woman and holding her there as a hostage.

title: Connally Sees Benefit
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 14Secretary of the Treasury Connally said on a National Broadcasting Company interview program tonight that devaluation of the dollar would be very, very beneficial to the United States. He added, I don't think the average American will even be conscious of it.

title: Bill to Widen Buses Opposed at Hearing By A.A.A. Official
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 14 (AP) The American Automobile Association said today that if Congress considered changing the size of buses it should require them to be smaller, not larger.

title: ... Extending Economic Controls
description: Considering the lack of deliberation with which both House and Senate have been revising economic controls of profound consequence to millions, the extended stabilization law adopted by Congress yesterday is a remarkably sound document. To be sure, the bill stumbled briefly as a result of a surprise discovery that the conference committee violated legislative rules by smuggling in a Christmas giveaway to ranking Congressional aidesa pay sweetener that neither chamber had included in its original bills.

title: MARKET IS LOWER AS DOW SLIPS 3.65
description: Stock prices moved lower after a fairly firm opening yesterday as glamour issues led the retreat.

title: BILL ON CONTROLS PASSES CONGRESS
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 14Congress gave its final approval tonight to legislation extending through April, 1973, the Presidential authority to control wages, prices and rents.

title: GRECHKO ARRIVES FOR VISIT TO IRAQ
description: BEIRUT, Lebanon, Dec. 14Marshal Andrei A. Grechko, the Soviet Defense Minister, arrived in Baghdad today on fourclay official visit to Iraq accompanied by a large military delegation.

title: COURT TO REVIEW WIRETAP APPEALS
description: WASMINGTON, Dee, 14The Supreme Court agreed today to decide if witnesses subpoenaed before grand juries might legally refuse to testify until the Government showed that they had not been victims of illegal eavesdropping.

title: PennDixie Drops Plans To Sell Its Callahan Unit
description: Jerome Castle, chairman of the PennDixie Cement Corporation, announced yesterday that as a result of the completion of a major financing program, it was no longer necessary to sell its Callanan Industries division.

title: Reporters' Suit on Persico Trial Is Held Moot by Federal Judge
description: A Federal Court judge here dismissed yesterday a suit brought by five reporters who had sought access to the extortion trial of Carmine J. Persico.

title: Executive Changes
description: Drown Brothers Harriman & Co., private banking firm, announced yesterday the appointment of Peter B. Bartlett, Alan Crawford Jr., Eibridge T. Gerry Jr., Noah T. Herndon, Hector P. Prud'homme, and Laurence F. Whittemore as general managers, effective Jan. The position of general manager Is a new one, and is second in rank to that of partner.

title: NETS BOW DESPITE BARRY'S 48 POINTS
description: DENVER, Dec. 14Ralph Simpson sank a 14foot jump shot with 23 seconds remaining to give the Denver Rockets a 119118 victory over the New York Nets in an American Basketball Association game tonight.

title: NAPES DEFEATS LEWIS ON COAST
description: INGLEWOOD, Calif., Dec. 14 (UPI)The welterweight champion, Jose Napoles, scored a close but unanimous decision over Hedgemon Lewish of Los Angeles to retain his title in a 15round bout at the Forum tonight.

title: No Longer Deny the Charges
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 14 (AP)  United States officials declined today to concede that Mr. Fecteau had been on an espionage mission, but it was disclosed privately that they no longer deny the charges.

title: TAPE ALLEGING BRIBE DISPUTED BY DOWDY
description: BALTIMORE, Dec. 14 (UPI)Representative John Dowdy, Democrat of Texas, contradicted today at his briberyconspiracy trial a transcript of an alleged taperecorded conversation between him and man who testified he had paid the Congressman a $25,000 bribe.

title: Williams Places Faith In Hustling Texas Team
description: ARLINGTON, Tex., Dec. 14 (UPI)  Ted Williams said today he was bringing a hustling, young baseball team to Texas that might not be a winner this season. But he believes the former Washington Senators will be a division contender soon because of recent trades and a change in the schedule.

title: Alan Hyman Weds Andrea Stavin
description: Miss Andrea Kasman Stavin, daughter of Mrs. Maurice V. Stavin of New York and the late Dr. Stavin, was married here last evening to Alan Ivor Hyman, son of Dr. and Mrs. Arthur B. Hyman, of New York. The ceremony ta the Fifth Avenue Synagogue was performed by Rabbi Hillel Medali, chief rabbi of Antwerp, Belgium.

title: Bunce Wins Voit Trophy
description: LOS ANGELES, Dec. 14 (UPI) Don Bunce, the Stanford quarterback who led the Pacific8 in total offense and passing as the Indians clinched their second straight Rose Bowl trip this season, won the Voit Memorial Trophy today as the conference's player of the year.

title: Former Paris Police Expert Accuses U.S. Narcotics Aide
description: PARIS, Dec. 14 The to United States narcotics investigator in Europe was accused today by a former high French police official of having failed to understand the essentials of his job and of having transferred an American problem to France.

title: Japan's Lower House Approves 4 Bills for New Okinawa Status
description: TOKYO, Dec. 14 (AP)Japan's House of Representatives today approved four bills concerning the return of Okinawa to Japanese rule in 1972. The vote was 258 to 168.

title: Kinney Seeks Name Change
description: Directors of Kinney Services, Inc., have recommended that shareholders vote to change the company's name to Warner Bros. Communications, Inc., Steven J. Ross, president, announced yesterday. Shareholders will vote on the change at the annual meeting on Feb. 10.

title: Moderat on Berkeley Council; Impasse Ends as Radicals Lose
description: BERKELEY, Calif., Dec. 14The Berkeley City Council, divided since May by a 4to4 radicalmoderate split, filled its vacant seat with a moderate tonight.

title: Donors to Neediest Counting Blessings
description: Each year your plea for the neediest families increases our family's awareness allow fortunate we are, wrote Mrs. Caroline S. Peterson, Weston, Conn., in a letter accompanying one of the 209 contributions to The New York Times Neediest Cases Fund recorded yesterday.

title: Nixon May Review Trip Unless Soviet Curbs. India
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 14The White House is letting it be known that President Nixon will reconsider his planned trip to Moscow unless the Soviet Union uses its influence with India to bring about ceasefire in her war with Pakistan.

title: War a Part of Faith for the Moslems
description: RAWALPINDI, Pakistan, Dec. 14War is a part of the Islamic faith throughout the Moslem world, but nowhere more so than in Pakistan, a nation that needs no draft to maintain an army.

title: Serpico's Lonely Journey to Knapp Witness Stand
description: Finally Frank Serpico got to, testify before the Knapp Commission, and if he was not asked all the questions he wanted to answer, the experience was, he said yesterday, after five years of battling police corruption, a relief.

title: Studies Find Decline in Freshmen at 4Year Colleges
description: A decrease in the number of firsttime freshmen entering the country's fouryear collegen and universities is pointed up by two studies being issued today.

title: Stans Calls Article on His Fund Distorted, Dishonest Reporting
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 15 (AP)  Secretary of Commerce Maurice H. Stans has accused The Associated Press of a distorted and dishonest piece of journalism because of an article disclosing that his private foundation holds an interest in a Thailand paper company that benefits from United States Government assistance.

title: ExPoliceman Gets 10 Years for Sating Heroin
description: A 22yearold probationary patrolman was sentenced in Supreme Court in Brooklyn yesterday to 10 years in prison for selling heroin to a Police Department undercover agent.

title: Enemy Is Reported to Cut Off Big Cambodian Force
description: PNOMPENH, Cambodia (UPI) Dec. 15Communist forces firing mortar and rocket barrages have cut off some three brigades of Cambodian troops at the forward position of Taing Kauk, 50 miles northeast of Pnompenh, military spokesmen reported today.

title: Radicals in Berkeley Angered by Defeat
description: BERKELEY, Dec. 15The appointment by the Berkeley City Council of a moderate to its vacant seat, breaking a 4 to 4 deadlock between radicals and moderates, touched off angry criticism yesterday by the radical council members.

title: CITY UNITS REQUEST MORE FUNDS FOR '72
description: Contending that his department was lame and shackled, City Sheriff H. William Kehl asked yesterday for an increase of $278,838 in his $1.7million austerity expense budget request for 197273.

title: PRICE PANEL ACTS TO CUT INFLATION IN MEDICAL COSTS
Children's Effort Aids Fund for Neediest Cases
description: Contributions to the New York Times Neediest Cases Fund recorded yesterday ranged from $1 to $1,000, with many donors writing of the special effort they had made to contribute.

title: Blast Toll Lowered to 21
description: PORT HURON, Mich., Dec. 15 (AP)Authorities investigating the deadly weekend explosion in a water tunnel have revised the death toll from 22 to 21, a spokesman for the St. Clair County sheriff's department said today. Invesiigation showed that an error had occurred in the identification of bodies.

title: JOINT RELIGION PANEL PLANS FILM AWARDS
description: Representatives of the three major faiths have formed the Interreligious Film Award Committee. The committee, organized after months of consultations among the Division for Film and Broadcasting of the United States Catholic Conference, the Broadcasting and Film Commission of the National Churches of Christ in America and the Synagogue Council of America, will make its first presentations, from this year's films, on a National Broadcasting Company telecast March 26.

title: Florida Vacation for Brandt
description: BONN, Dec. 15 (AP)Chancellor Willy Brandt will vacation at Sarasota, Fla., following his talks with President Nixon at Key Biscayne Dec. 2829. The Government spokesman, Rdiger Von Wechmer, said today that Mr. Brandt would stay I at Sarasota through the New Year's holiday. He will be accompanied by his wife, Rut, and may be joined by one of his sons, Mr. Von Wechmer added.

title: KAMCHATKA AREA ROCKED BY QUAKE
description: PALMER, Alaska, Dec. 15 (AP)A strong earthquake was recorded last night off the east coast of Siberia's Kamchatka Peninsula, the Palmer Observatory reported.

title: Group Bids F.C.C. End Ads on Children's TV
description: Action for Children's Television petitioned the Federal Trade Commission yesterday to eliminate all toy advertising from children's television programs.

title: Notes on People
description: It was reunion time for Vladimir V. Matskevich, the Soviet Minister of Agriculture, and some of the people who welcomed him, back in 1955, to Iowa. His hosts treated him to an Americanstyle birthday party, with a cake ablaze with 62 candles. Mr. Matskevich, who is in this country to study ways to increase livestock and poultry production in the Soviet Union, recalled that when he was in Iowa 16 years ago, Richard Alleman, then 3 years old, presented him with an car of corn. I had nothing to give you, he told the now19yearold, bearded Mr. Alleman. Now I give you my watch. It isn't much to look at, but it keeps good time. His birthday party hosts gave Mr. Matskevich a typically Ameririfle.

title: Zulfikar Ali Bhutto denouncing U.N. Security Council
description: UNITED NATIONS, N. Y., Dec. 15Pakistan's Foreign Minister, Zulfikar All Bhutto, his face streaked with tears, walked out of the Security Council today after accusing it of legalizing aggression.

title: Juilliard CompanyA School for Stars
description: Anyone worried about the future of the American theater should see the new Juilliard Acting Company in action. This company of fourthyear students in the Drama Division at the Juilliard School is presenting (through tomorrow evening) a season of true repertoryand doing it splendidly.

title: Knight Newspapers Board Votes 2for1 Stock Split
description: Directors of the Knight Newspapers, Inc., voted yesterday a twoforone stock split, subject to shareholder approval of an increase in the authorized shares to 20 million from 10 million. Stockholders will vote on the proposal at the annual meeting April 11. The split would be paid to holders of record April 11.

title: Super Wave is Retired
description: Super Wave, 5yearold 1971 pacing champion, has been retired to stand stud at the Lana Lobell Farms at Hanover, Pa., it was announced yesterday. Lobell Farms has leased Super Wave from Dr. George K. Boyce of London, Ontario, the owner. Super Wave won $481,293 in 85 starts.

title: Rangers Triumph Over Flyers, 6 to 2
description: For 20 minutes last night in Madison Square Garden, the Philadelphia Flyers skated the New York Rangers on even terms. Jimmy Johnson had matched Brad Park's 11th goal of the season, and both scores came on power plays.

title: Port Authority Fills Vacancy
description: The appointment of Matthias E. Lukens, deputy executive director of the Port Authority, as acting executive director to fill the vacancy left by the retirement of Austin J. Tobin, was announced yesterday. A special committee of the authority's board of commissioners will be formed to recommend a permanent successor to Mr. Tobin, who has announced his retirement effective March 31, 1972. Mr. Lukens, who is 59 years old, has been deputy executive director since 1961.

title: Richard Gilman Receives Nathan Criticism Award
description: Richard Gilman, professor of playwriting and criticism at the Yale Drama School, has been named winner of the 197071 George Jean Nathan award for drama criticism. The prize, richest in the American theater, carries a cash award of $5,000.

title: McPartland Piano And AllStar Rand Join at Town Hall
description: The good news from Town Hall is that it has replaced one of the worst sound systems in town with one that is, essentially, excellent. The only drawback is that it picks up a radio signal, which provides a somewhat disquieting background for whatever is being played on the stage.

title: Dick Tiger, 42, Nigerian Boxer Who Won World Titles, Dead
description: Dick Tiger, twice the world middleweight boxing champion and once the lightheavyweight titleholder, died of a liver ailment Monday night at his home in Aba, Nigeria. He was 42 years old.

title: 12 Bolivians Die in Accident
description: LA PAZ, Bolivia, Dec. 15 (UPI)  Twelve persons were killed and 33 injued today when two rail cars became disengaged from a train at Cerdas, in Southern Bolivia 280 miles from here, and weer hit by a passenger train coming from Uyuni.

title: AMINE HOLDERS VOTE FOR MERGER
description: Merger News

title: Sports of The Times
description: Brooklyn is the only big league town, wrote the droll Eddie Murphy many years ago, which doesn't have a railroad terminal, a newspaper or a regular left fielder.

title: French Academy Makes Rubinstein Associate Member
description: PARIS, Dec. 15Artur Rubinstein was welcomed today to the Academy of Fine Arts, to which he had been elected as an associate foreign member earlier in the year.

title: BONN PUTS STRESS ON ARMY QUALITY
description: BONN, Dec. 5  West Germany's military services, for years the largest in Central Europe, have raised the standards of their training and equipment at a critical moment for the defenses of the North Atlantic Treaty Organization on the Continent.

title: NETS TURN BACK PROS, 109 TO 100
description: MEMPHIS, Dec. 15The New York Nets, in front almost all the way, snapped a twogame losing streak by defeating the Memphis Pros, 109100, in an American Basketball Association game tonight.

title: WILLIAM M. COTTON
description: William M. Cotton, founder in 1938 of the Ideal Publishing Corporation and its former publisher, president and chairman, died Friday at his home in College Grove, Tenn., after a long illness. He was 67 years old.

title: DR. C. B. MANDELBAUM
description: Dr. Charles Brodie Mandelbaum, a dentist and a teacher, died on Monday at Lenox Hill Hospital after a long illness. He was 75 years old and lived at 235 West End Avenue.

title: McGovern Gives Lesson in Patience
description: LOS ANGELES, Dec. 15 At the end of his first full year of Presidential campaigning, Senator George McGovern of South Dakota has done virtually everything that a candidate hopes to do except what seems the most important thing of all: to demonstrate substantial public support.

title: City Hall Parley Held on Arbitration Bill
description: A private City Hall meeting on the controversial bill to require arbitration of labor disputes between the city and some 300,000 unionized employes broke up yesterday without agreement.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: Garrison Pleads Not Guilty; Says He Is Being Repressed
description: NEW ORLEANS, Dec. 15 (UPI)District Attorney Jim Garrison pleaded not guilty to day to Federal bribery and gambling charges. He said he was a victim of repression practiced by a Government that was involved in the assassination of President Kennedy.

title: Soviet Ignores Warnings
description: MOSCOW, Dec. 15The Soviet Union today publicly ignored leaked warnings from the White House that continued Soviet encouragement of Indian military actions in East Pakistan could lead to reconsideration of President Nixon's visit to Moscow next May.

title: Berrigan Defense Is Given Government's Witness List
description: HARRISBURG, Pa., Dec. 15 (AP)  Defense lawyers said today that the Government had turned over to them a list of 95 possible prosecution witnesses in the coming trial of the Rev. Philip F. Berrigan and say others on charges of plotting to kidnap Henry Kissinger.

title: Rep. Lennon to Leave House
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 15 (AP)  Representative Alton A. Lennon, Democrat from North Carolina's Seventh District, has announced that he will not seek reelection next year. He has been in the House since first elected in 1956.

title: CAR MAKERS PLAN BRISK PRODUCTION
description: DETROIT, Dec. 15  The American automobile manufacturers are programing strong firstquarter car production. But Detroit's effort probably won't be enough to create the tens of thousands of new jobs that are associated with an auto boom.

title: Waterfront Development Is Planned by Jersey City
description: JERSEY CITY, Dec. 15 Mayor Paul T. Jordan said today that the city expected to begin negotiating soon with the Federal Government for the purchase of a 217acre site as part of a proposed redevelopment of the dilipated and economically unproductive waterfront here.

title: Trafalgar Hospital Plans Move To the West Side of Manhattan
description: Trafalgar Hospital, a 145bed private nonprofit institution at 161 East 90th Street, has formally sought permission to move to Manhattan's West Side.

title: TEXAS INSURER VOTE BACKS REALIGNMENT
description: The American National Insurance Company, a major Texas insured, voted in a special meeting yesterday to restructure the company as a wholly owned subsidiary of the American National Financial Corporation.

title: Brink's Guards Robbed
description: BOSTON, Dec. 15 (AP) Pour men, two of them armed with German Lugerstyle hand guns, disarmed two Brink's Inc., guards today as they were making a payroll delivery to the H. B. Hood and Sons Co. in the Charlestown section and escaped with $10,000 in cash, the police said.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: PURGE IN CROATIA FOLLOWS RIOTING
description: VIENNA, Dec. 15Yugoslav Communist leaders asserted today that they had succeeded just in time in curbing a nationalist and secessionist movement in Croatia, the nation's secondlargest republic.

title: Bucks Trim Braves
description: MADISON. Wis., Dec. 15 (AP) Kareem AbdulJabbar scored 35 points to lead the Milwaukee Bucks to a 122108 victory over the Buffalo Braves tonight.

title: College Building Burned Out
description: CASTLETON, Vt., Dec. 15 (AP)  A threestory brick administration building at Castleton State College was burned out by fire early today. It was the worst fire at the college in 47 years. Colleg officials estimated the damage at more than $1million.

title: Anxiety Increases in Lahore as Indian Bombs Take Rising Toll
description: ALAHORE, Pakistan, Dec. 15  This teeming city of 23 million in West Pakistan lies 12 miles from the Indian border and war comes to it many times daily. Yesterday, 10 children, 10 women and five men were killed and 28 persons were injured when an Indian bomb hit a suburban railway station.

title: Olympia Theater Slates a Festival Of Cuban Movies
description: The first Cuban film festival in the United States since the Cuban revolution will be held here at the Olympia Theater, Broadway and 107th Street, from March 24 to April 2.

title: Ballet Theater to Present Two Premieres Next Month
description: American Ballet Theater will present two premieres, two new productions and two revivals during its season at the City Center from Jan. 4 through Jan. 30.

title: November Gain Reported For Industrial Production
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 15Industrial production recorded a large gain in November, only about onequarter of which was traceable to the end of the coal strike, the Federal Reserve Board said today.

title: Personal Finance: Survivors' Benefits
description: Helen and Irene are neighbors in a middleclass suburb not too far from here. Both are 30 years old and both had husbands who earned $12,000 a year.

title: Wood, Field and Stream
description: VIRGINIA BEACH, Va. When the soft winds of midMay touch New England, the first northward migrations of striped bass appear and anglers rejoice, but all too soon, by early November, shorter days and chilling waters have driven the fish offshore and south.

title: Year's TV: The Programing Is Embarrassingly Dull
description: What sort of year has it been for television? Though sporadically filled with those events that alter and illuminate our time it has not been a year like all years.

title: PRICES RISE A BIT ON AMEX AND OTC
description: Prices on the American Stock Exchange and in the overthecounter makret moved mostly higher after a lower opening yesterday in moderate trading.

title: Kertesz Leads Philadelphians In a MildMannered Concert
description: Polite, mildmannered musicmaking was provided by the Philadelphia Orchestra at Philharmonic Hall Tuesday night when it played under the direction of a guest conductor, Istvn Kertsz.

title: Article 3  No Title
description: OLEAN, N. Y., Dec. 15 (UPI) With Glenn Price hitting on five shots in a row early in the game, St. Bonaventure easily defeated De Paul tonight, 8066. Price got 20 points. Nick Hirtvig of De. Paul led all scorers with 22.

title: DISSIDENT RESIGNING IN CHRISCRAFT FIGHT
description: In a surprise move, Richard O. Kelly, active in the fight for control of ChrisCraft Industries, Inc., resigned yesterday as a member of the independent stockholders committee and withdrew his name as a nominee for director on the antimanagement slate.

title: Businessmen Optimistic
description: CHICAGO, Dec. 15Optimistic forecasts for business in 1972 prevailed among top business executives taking part today in the annual business outlook luncheon of the First National Bank of Chicago in the Palmer House.

title: Inwood Mills Announces ShrinkResistant Fabric
description: Inwood Knitting Mills, Inc., a subsidiary of the National Distillers and Chemical corpoation, announced yesterday the development of a new cotton knitted outerwear fabric, guaranteed to resist shrinkage. The fabric, the concern said, is suitable for dress shirts, dresses and other apparel, and would withstand machine washing and machine drying.

title: McCloskey to Enter Tests
description: BANGOR, Me., Dec. 15 (AP)  Representative Paul N. McCloskey Jr., Republican of California told newsmen today that he would enter Presidential, primaries in Massachusetts and Rhode Island in addition to New Hampshire's firstinthenation primary next March. He spoke at a news conference.

title: Voters in Connecticut Bar Building Bridge to Island
description: ESSEX, Conn., Dec. 15Town voters yesterday turned down a proposal to build a bridge from one of the main streets here to a marina on Essex Island in the Connecticut River.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: Duryea Seeks More Data On Governor's Fiscal Plan
description: ALBANY, Dec. 15Resistance to Governor Rockefeller's emergency fiscal program stiffened today within the ranks of his fellow Republicans in the Assembly, as Speaker Perry B. Duryea described the plan as feathery and pressed the Governor's office for details.

title: His District in 2 Boroughs and on 3 Islands, Senator Bookson Feels Wronged
description: ALBANY, Dec. 15Senator Paul P. E. Bookson today assessed the prospect of representing a chunk of lower Manhattan, where he is known; a slice of Brooklyn, where his profile is low enough to be invisible, and the meager voting populations of three islandsEllis, Governors and Liberty.

title: Youths Protest at the U.N. On Behalf of Syrian Jews
description: UNITED NATIONS, N.Y., Dec. 15  Several hundred young Jews demonstrated here tonight in spite of icy rain to call attention to the plight of the Jews in Syria, who they say are persecuted by their Government and jailed if they try to lave Syria.

title: Article 1  No Title
description: BRISBANE, Australia, Dec. 15 (UPI)Evonne Goolagong, the Wimbledon champion, easily defeated Betty Delaway, 63, 60, to advance in the Australian hardcourt championship today.

title: Agnew to Light Tree
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 15 (UPI) Vice President Agnew will do the honors tomorrow at the annual lighting of the national Christmas tree on the Ellipse behind the White House.

title: U.S. Judge Advises Steamfitters To Return to Work Here Today
description: Judge Dudley B. Bonsai told more than 100 union steamfitters who were seated and standing in his Federal courtroom yesterday that he saw no reason for their work stoppage, and that they should go back to work today.

title: Sudan Troops Said to Battle Secessionists Inside Uganda
description: KAMPALA, Uganda, Dec. 15 (Reuters)Fierce fighting has been taking place just inside Uganda for the past two days between Sudanese troops and southern Saudanese secessionists, a Ugandan military spokesman announced tonight.

title: OTB TO TAKE BETS ON LAUREL RACES
description: The Offtrack Betting Corporation, shuffling its wares faster than a wheelingdealing peddler on a street corner, initiated wagering on the superfecta at Monticello Raceway yesterday and today adds Laurel Race Course in Maryland and a nightly television program to its betting lineup.

title: Disk Tiger Dies at 42
description: Dick Tiger, twice the world middleweight boxing champion and once the lightheavyweight titleholder, died of a liver ailment Monday night. Tiger, who was 42 years old, died at his home in Alba, Nigeria. Obituary on Page 38.

title: U.S. Steel Tells of Plan
description: The United States Steel Corporation, the nation's largest steel producer, announced yesterday it would install at its Fairfield, Ala., facility a highvolume, lowcost steelmaking process Invented by a West German company. It also will convert other furnaces to the process.

title: Sugarman Praises Federal Welfare Work Plan
description: A new Federal work or training plan for employable welfare recipients, passed unexpectedly by Congress on Tuesday, was welcomed yesterday by Jule M. Sugarman, the City Human Resources Administrator and Commissioner of Social Services.

title: GOLD TRADING HECTIC FOR SOUTH AFRICANS
description: JOHANNESBURG, South Africa, Dec. 15Stock exchange dealers shouted and jostled in hectic buying of gold shares today as the market reacted to the proposed devaluation of the dollar and the rise in the gold price.

title: Control Data Sets Order
description: MINNEAPOLIS, Dec. 15 (Reuters)  The Control Data Corp. said today the Union Bank of Switzerland purchased a $12.3million multicomputer system, scheduled for early 1973 installation in Zurich.

title: New U.S. Narcotics Chief Takes Over Post in Europe
description: PARIS, Dec. 15 (AP)Paul E. Knight became regional director of the United States Narcotics Bureau in Europe today. He replaced John T. Cusack, who is returning to Washington next month.

title: Consumer Discord Prevails at Model City Mall
description: COLUMBIA, Md., Dec. 15The customer is unhappy.

title: SUGAR FUTURES CLIMB TO RECORD
description: For the second consecutive day, the New York Coffee and Sugar Exchange yesterday reported the largest trading volume in its history for the world sugar contract No. 11, and for any other single futures contract traded on the exchange.

title: The Barrels of Indian Guns
description: CHICAGOI am among the few West Pakistanis to have denounced the rigid policies and criminal conduct of our military government. The army intervened in East Bengal to offset the results of Pakistan's first freely held elections, transforming the demand for autonomy into a movement for independence.

title: Another Step Toward Detente
description: Mayor Klaus Schutz of West Berlin spoke candidly when he summed up the intraGerman agreements on Berlin as imperfect in comparison to the ideal, satisfactory in view of the realities. Foremost among the realities was the chronic fear on the part of East Germany's Communist leaders of the impact on the people they rule of greatly expanded contacts with West Berliners and West Germans.

title: Text of Price Commission's Policy on Health Care Charges
description: WASHINGTON. Dec. 15Following is the text of the Price Commission's policy regulating charges for health care services during the second phase of the Nixon Administration's economic stabilization program:

title: Pool Dispatch From Dacca
description: DACCA, Pakistan, Dec. 15Pakistan is seeking to negotiate separate terms in the Eastern region so she can continue fighting in the West.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: LOCKHEED PROGRESS IMPRESSES LENDERS
description: BURBANK, Calif., Dec. 15 (Reuters)  Representatives of Federal agencies and 24 lending banks said today that they were impressed by the progress of the Lockheed Aircraft Corporation since it received Government guarantees for $250million in additional private financing in September.

title: Dollar Sags Sharply as Nations Move Closer to Monetary Pact
description: PARIS, Dec. 15The dollar again slumped in the major currency centers as the United States and its trading partners, after President Nixon's decision to devalue, moved closer to a multilateral realignment of parities, to be agreed on perhaps this weekend.

title: U.S. Seeks Trade Talks
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 15 (Reuters)A Treasury spokesman said today the United States wants to hold bilateral trade talks with its major trading partners during the Group of 10 meeting here. He said that any devaluation of the dollar against gold depends on trade and burdensharingit's still very much a package.

title: Gruesome Goodies
description: One need not be overwhelmed by the spirit of Christmas to be shaken up by some of the toys available to this year's young. There is, notably, a hobby kit called Monster Scenes for ages eight to twelve. This little number comes complete with torture devicesguillotine, hanging cage and other gruesome goodies, as the brochure describes the easily assembled equipmentalong with plastic female figures that can be dismembered and snapped together again for hours of innocent play.

title: Mayor Sets Talks for Tomorrow In Forest Hills Housing Dispute
description: Mayor Lindsay's office said last night that proponents and opponents of the controversial lowincome housing project in Forest Hills would meet at City Hall tomorrow morning to discuss the project.

title: Bridge: TopSeeded Teams Leading In $15,000 Knockout Event
description: LAS VEGAS, Nev., Dec. 15 Quality rather thin quantity is the hallmark of the Knockout Team Championship being contested at the International Hotel here this week.

title: Philippines, in Shift, to Seek Ties in East Europe
description: MANILA, Dec. 15The Philippine Government decided today to establish formal diplomatic and trade relations with some Eastern European countries, ending a quartercentury of isolation from Communist nations.

title: World Cup Downhill Race Is Canceled
description: SESTRIERE, Italy, Dec. 15 (AP)Freddy Fuchs of Switzerland, the delegate of the International Ski Federation, today canceled the men's World Cup downhill ski race in Sestriere.

title: Algeria and France Settle Bitter Dispute on Oil
description: ALGIERS, Dec. 15The national oil companies of France and Algeria signed an agreement today ending a harsh dispute set off by President Houari Boumediene's nationalization of French oil and gas interests in this country six months ago.

title: EDLEFSEN IS BEATEN IN S. AFRICA TENNIS
description: BLOEMFONTEIN, South Africa, Dec. 15 (AP)Tom Edictsen, America's 11thranking player, was beaten by Andrew Pattison of Rhodesia, 64, 63, in the quarterfinals of the Sugar tennis tournament today. Juan Gisbert of Spain gained the semifinals by eliminating two South Africans. He beat Peter Tudhope, 75, 64, and Rohan Summers, 61, 62. Nick Kalo of Greece ousted Francois Jauffret of France, 6.0, 61.

title: MATHIAS DOUBTFUL ON PURGE BY PARTY
description: BALTIMORE, Dec. 15 (AP)Senator Charles McC. Mathias Jr., of Maryland, a liberal Republican who has endorsed the reelection of President Nixon, said today that he was convinced there was no plan to purge him from the party, a move that has been reported in recent weeks.

title: HAWKS TRIUMPH OVER SABRES, 21
description: CHICAGO, Dec. 15 (UPI) Bobby Hull scored his 18th and 19th goals tonight to give the Chicago Black Hawks a 21 victory over the Buffalo Sabres, keeping the Hawks unbeaten at home this season with 13 triumphs and two ties.

title: Pabst Steps Down as President at Bromley
description: News of Skiing

title: New Plan Will Aid Arts in Deprived Areas
description: The National Endowment for the Arts has established a new program, funded at $1million, that will concentrate on the arts of the ghetto and of deprived rural areas.

title: Advertising:
description: A campaign of weekly ads aimed at keeping business in New York is being planned by the Association for a Better New York.

title: Stern Honored for Aid to Israel
description: Isaac Stern received the King Solomon Award from the AmericaIsrael Cultural Foundation last night. It is given every year for contributions to Israel's cultural life, and when the celebrated violinist received it at a dinner in the Plaza Hotel, it was something of a family affair.

title: Market place:
description: Morris Mendelson, 49yearold associate professor of finance at the Wharton School of Finance and Commerce, University of Pennsylvania, has taken a long look at the William McChesney Martin Jr. study of the securities markets and has allowed himself a professorial tsk, tsk.

title: J.V.L. Clubs Agree To File Statements On Their Finances
description: The John V. Lindsay Associations, the Mayor's chief patronage dispensers and a major source of Mr. Lindsay's precampaign funds, agreed yesterday to file financial statements to avoid a possible ruling by the State Attorney General that they were violating the state election law.

title: Russians in India for Talks Delay Their Departure Again
description: NEW DELHI, Dec. 15 (AP)A senior Soviet delegation delayed its departure for home today for the second time to continue talks with Indian officials on the IndianPakistani War.

title: Advertising:
description: Ogilvy & Mather yesterday picked up the General Foods' Burger Chef account which was resigned by McCannErickson. Billings are estimated at over $2.5million.

title: New Rates Due Jan. 1
description: The Republic Steel Corporation said yesterday that it would put into effect on Jan. 1 price increases on sheet and strip products that it had originally announced on Aug. 2. However, the price rises on Icold rolled sheet products will be held back until Feb. 2.

title: Gilmore Leads Colonels
description: LOUISVILLE, Ky., Dec. 15 (UPI)Artis Gilmore scored 34 points, grabbed 25 rebounds and blocked nine shots tonight in leading Kentucky to a 13793 rout of the Carolina Cougars for the Colonels' largest victory margin ever.

title: Pipeline Alternative
description: Secretary of the Interior Morton and others have indicated that a decision on the proposed oil pipeline across the state of Alaska is imminent. But no matter what that decision is, the Alyeska Pipeline Service Company should not count on laying pipe in the immediate future.

title: Robert L. Maclellan, Provident Life Head, Dies
description: Robert L. Maclellan, chairman and chief executive officer of the Provident Life and Accident Insurance Company of Chattanooga, Tenn., died yesterday morning. He had been attending an industry association meeting in this city.

title: ELLINGTON BACK WITH 9 JAZZMEN
description: Duke Ellington, back from his tour of the Soviet Union, has moved into the Rainbow Grill for the holidays, bringing with him nine men from his orchestra. The makeup of the group is somewhat unusualsix saxophones, one trumpet and a rhythm section  but since it is in the saxophone section that the present Ellington band has its greatest depth and experience, the results are properly Ellingtonian.

title: President Flies to Florida; Will Prepare for Heath Visit
description: HOMESTEAD, Fla., Dec. 15 (AP)  President Nixon arrived at Homestead Air Force Base in his jet today and immediately flew by helicopter to Key Biscayne, where he will spend several days preparing for a meetingnext week with Prime Minister Heath of Britain.

title: Floridians Win, 119105
description: TAMPA, Fla., Dec. 15 (AP)Ron Franz, who missed the last four games with a liver ailment, came off the bench tonight to spark the Floridians to a 119105 viotory over the Virginia Squires. Franz scored 10 of his 14 points in a fourthperiod rally.

title: Article 2  No Title
description: LOS ANGELES, Dec. 15 (Reuters)  Mrs. Billie Jean King and Rosemary Casals have followed their September walkout in the final of the Pacific Southwest open championship with a $108,000 damage suit against the tournament organizers and the Southern California Tennis Association.

title: Galbraith Finds Pitfalls For Economic Planners
description: John Kenneth Galbraith yesterday described the Administration's new economic program as the culminating step in a long but still only dimly perceived shift to a system in which planning assumes more importance than freemarket forces.

title: Boy Scout, 11, Credited With Rescuing 2 Divers
description: TIBURON, Calf., Dec. 15 (UPI)Two scuba divers today credited an 11yearold Boy Scout with saving their lives at the peril of his own.

title: Cenco Earnings Climb; Other Companies Report
Dance: Playfully Seizing on a Ritual
description: Igor Stravinsky, or his American literary amanuensis, once called the composer's Symphonies of Wind Instruments an austere ritual. It is in part this aspect of the music that Alvin Ailey has seized upon in his ballet Myth, given for the first time last night at the New York City Center by the Alvin Ailey American Dance Theater.

title: OBSERVER
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 15Isn't there anybody left in the United States who feels himself the victim of injustice?

title: ' Honky' Depicts Interracial Love
description: "Honky" is awful. It also happens to be an interracial love story, about the kindest comment it warrants. Most of the time, two high school students amble around a "typical" today community in a state of stunned tenderness. The girl, who is black, has converted her white sweetheart to "grass." which may account for their lethargy and the picture's moltenlead tempo.The kids are just misunderstood, see? Anyway, every adult in view, both sets of parents included, is either a reactionary, square or worse. Two mean white rednecks ring in the climactic clich. As actors, both Brenda Sykes, a pretty girl with a sweet smile, and young John Neilson are hopeless, but no more so than the vacuous dialogue. One real crime has been committedthe waste of that fine Negro actor William Marshall in a brief return to the screen. Otherwise, "Honky" tonks out.

title: Diplomatic Debacle
description: The Pakistani military debacle in East Bengal is at the same time a diplomatic debacle for the United States. Futile lastminute White House warnings to Moscow restrain the Indians in their hour of victory and the provocative dispatch of a carrier task force to the Bay of Bengal can neither conceal nor alleviate this disaster to American prestige and posture throughout the democratic world.

title: POLICEMAN CLEARED IN L.I. YOUTH'S DEATH
description: MINEOLA, L. I., Dec. 15A white Nassau County policeman who shot and killed a 16yearold black Freeport boy was absolved of any wrongdoing by a grand jury here today.

title: Killer of Eye Doctor And Four on Coast Is Sentenced to Die
description: REDWOOD CITY, Calif., Dec. 15 (UPI)John Linley Frazier was condemned today to die in the San Quentin gas chamber for killing Dr. Victor Ohta, a wealthy eye surgeon, and four others.

title: U. N. Votes Broad Effort to Plan for Disasters and Alleviate Suffering
description: UNITED NATIONS, N.Y., Dec. 15On a Sunday in May, 1970, northern Peru was rocked by an earthquake that, buried entire villages under avalanches. The death toll was 50,000.

title: COLUMBIA FACES RUTGERS TONIGHT
description: Columbia's basketball team, which hasn't won in five starts this season, is not expected to continue the university's Madison Square Garden winning streak of seven when the Lions meet Rutgers in the second of two college games there tonight.

title: Rondon, 175, Stops Baird in 8th Round And Retains Title
description: CLEVELAND, Dec. 15 (UPI) Vicente Rondon, the World Boxing Association lightheavyweight champion, successfully defended his title tonight by knocking out Doyle Baird of Akron, Ohio, at 2 minutes 10 seconds of the eighth round.

title: CONGRESS PASSES MORE JOBLESS AID FOR NEEDY AREAS
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 15 Congress voted today to extend unemployment compensation benefits in areas of high joblessness, with the Federal Treasury underwriting the estimated cost of $274million.

title: NEVER LOST HOPE, FECTEAU ASSERTS
description: PHOENIXVILLE. Pa., Dec. 15 (UPI)Richard G. Fecteau said today that during his 19 years of imprisonment in China I was in solitary for so much time I'm not used to conversation.

title: Capossela Calls Finish for Last Time
description: It was 10:15 A.M. when The Voice reached Aqueduct yesterday, parking his 1968 Volvo in the lot reserved for working press.

title: Cosmos No. 465
description: MOSCOW, Dec. 15 (AP)The Soviet Union launched another unmaned Cosmos space satellite today, Tass, the official Soviet press agency, annoupnced. It said Cosmos 465 was functioning normaly.

title: YALE TURNS BACK BROWN, 73 TO 70
description: NEW HAVEN, Dec. 15Scott Michel's layup with 8 seconds left broke a 7070 tie tonight and helped Yale beat Brown, 7370.

title: Florida Vacation for Brandt
description: BONN, Dec. 15 (AP)Chancellor Willy Brandt will vacation at Sarasota. Fla., following his talks with President Nixon at Key Biscayne Dec. 2829. The Government spokesman, Rudiger Von Wechmer, said today that Mr. Brandt would stay at Sarasota through the New Year's holiday. He will be accompanied by his wife, Rut, and may be joined by one of his sons, Mr. Von Wechmer added.

title: Sponsor Leaves Auto Racing: It Just Isn't Marlboro Country
description: Marlboro cigarettes, which spent $500,000 a year sponsoring somo of the United States Auto Club's competition, announced yesterday it was dropping out of the sport. The reason was that Viceroy cigarettes had moved into big auto racing Tuesday when it became the financial backer for Mario Andretti and Al Unser, two of the leading drivers on the circuit.

title: Jacksonville Team Folds
description: JACKSONVILLE. Fla., Dec. 15 (UPI)The Eastern Hockey folded after eight seasons marked byp or teams and a shaky financial operation. It was announced that efforts to sell the team had failed.

title: Never Underestimate Power of a Woman, Even at Princeton
description: When Abby Rubenfeld's campaign leaflets began showing up on the Princeton campus to announce she was running for freshman class president this fall, some frosh thought that Abby, like Abbie Hoffman, was a man.

title: Tuesday Night Fights
description: Inglewood, Calif.Jos Napoles, 145 pounds, Mexico City, outpointed Harlgemon Lewis, 145, Los Angeles, 15 rounds; Nappies retained world welterweight title; Ruben Olivares, 118, Mexican City, knocked out Jesus Pimental, 116 Mexicali, Mexico, 11; Oliyares retained world bantamweight title.

title: Some School Boards Refusing To Increase Fees for Meetings
description: After threatening to charge as much as $85 a night for the use of school facilities after regular hours, most community school boards have found ways to charge the city's youth organizations little more than they did did last year for such use.

title: $500,000 IN $10'S, WORTH $0, SEIZED
description: Secret Service agents exchanged gunfire with three counterfeiting suspects yesterday as they attempted to complete what one agent described as a brazen transfer of a halfmillion dollars in bogus $10 bills on a Brooklyn street.

title: Couple Sentencing Delayed
description: The sentencing of Joseph and Sylvia Winograd on 37 counts of usury and conspiracy was postponed for the third time yesterday by State Supreme Court Justice George Postel in Manhattan. It is now scheduled for Jan. 3. The couple were named in the loanshark indictment with the reputed underworld figure Carmine J. Persico and Samuel Lessner in 1969. Persico was acquitted earlier this month on reduced charges in a closed trial. Mr. Lessner has disappeared.

title: Attacks Suspended
description: NEW DELHI, India, Dec. 15Indian officials said tonight that the commander of Pakistani forces in the besieged city of Dacca had asked for a ceasefire, but that India had demanded a complete surrender of the enemy army in East Pakistan.

title: Greek Officer Is Guilty Of Move Against Regime
description: ATHENS, Dec. 15The commander of a tank battalion who allegedly tried to overthrow the militarybacked Government was sentenced to 14 months' imprisonment by a courtmartial in Salonika last night.

title: Senate Unit Supports Rise For Corn and Wheat Loans
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 15 (AP)  A Senate Agriculture subcommittee approved unanimously today a measure to raise by about 25 per cent price support loans on wheat and corn.

title: 700 at Sarnoff Service in EmanuEl
description: Governor Rockefeller gave the principal eulogy at the funeral yesterday of David Sarnoff, the immigrant telegrapher who founded the electronic communications industry.

title: Merrill Lynch Sees Peaks For '71, More Gains in '72
description: Merrill Lynch, Pierce, Fenner & Smith, Inc., the nation's largest brokerage house, will achieve record earnings this year and expects further gains in 1972, Donald T. Regan, chairman and chief executive officer, said yesterday.

title: Federal Judge Kerner Indicted On Bribe, Perjury, Tax Charges
description: CHICAGO, Dec. 15Judge Otto Kerner of the United States Court of Appeals for the Seventh Circuit was indicted today by a Federal grand jury on charges of conspiracy, bribery, perjury, mail fraud and income tax evasion.

title: Rockets Win in Overtime
description: ATLANTA, Dec. 15 (AP)The Houston Rockets defeated the Atlanta Hawks, 117115, tonight in the last four seconds of overtime. The victory came on a baseline jump shot by Cliff Meely after the Rockets had lost an 18point lead in nine minutes of the fourthquarter.

title: Cold Front Will Dissipate Area's Fog Patches Today
description: Fog patches that have banked in the metropolitan area since early yesterday should disappear by early today as a cold front from the west sweeps away a warm front that has remained stationary south of the city.

title: Vatican Aide Doubts Any Change in Peking's Attitude on Religion
description: ROME, Dec. 15An authoritative Vatican official declared today that no change could be expected in Peking's basic attitude toward religion and the Roman Catholic Church despite its dialogue with Washington and its membership in the United Nations.

title: Democrats Say 25 States Heed '72 Rule
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 15 (UPI)  Democratic party leaders reported today that 25 states were in full compliance with delegate selection standand for the 1972 convention, and that nine others were close.

title: Stockholdings Of Insiders
description: The New York and American Stock Exchanges yesterday issued their latest reports on changes in stock ownership by major stockholders, directors, and officers of listed companies. The reports include the following:

title: PACEI FAILS IN BID FOR MILLION MARK
description: YONKERS, Dec. 15If Rum Customer, a 6yearold pacer, is to be retired to stud shortly, it will not be as one of harness racing's millionaires.

title: Party of Year for Harrimans
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 15 It was billed as a small, informal supper for a few friends, but one guest on entering threw open her arms and exclaimed, This is the party of the year.

title: Dun & Bradstreet Verdict Set Aside
description: A State Supreme Court justice yesterday set aside a $6,610,000 damage verdict against Dun & Bradstreet, Inc., and ordered a new trial of defamation charges against the creditreporting agency.

title: West German Metalworkers Return to Jobs After Strike
description: STUTTGART, Germany, Dec. 15 UPI)Thousands of metalworkers in the south German regions of North Baden and North Wiirttemberg returned to work today following a threeweek strike that put 600,000 West German factory employes out of work.

title: 150 Multiheaded Missiles Installed in North Dakota
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 15 (UPI)  The Air Force announced today that it had completed installation of 150 Minuteman 3 multiheaded missiles at Minot Air Force Base in North Dakota.

title: Chess: Is the Game Art or Science? It Can Be Bothor Neither
description: The safest answer to the old question Is chess an art or a science? is the noncommittal It's a sport. But there are features of chess that link it to the fine arts on the one hand, and the sciences on the other, and they can hardly be ignored.

title: Advertising:
description: The New York District Ford Dealers Association account is going to the Gallagher Group, a new agency being founded by a man who worked on the account at J. Walter Thompson.

title: An Expert Sees Youths Turning to Barbiturates
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 15In the world of illicit drug use, 1972 may well become the year of the barbiturate, an expert told a Senate subcommittee today.

title: MARKFRANC RATE IS REPORTED FIXED
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 15A reported compromise between France and West Germany on the new exchange rate to be established between the franc and the mark indicated further progress today toward an eventual world monetary agreement.

title: COOLINGOFF SET IN DOCK WALKOUT
description: MIAMI, Dec. 15 (AP)An 80day coolingoff period under the Taft Hartley Act was invoked by a Federal judge in Miami today to give shippers and longshoremen in Florida's ports time to resolve their differences.

title: Text of Indian Message
description: NEW DELHI, Dec. 15 (AP)Following is the text of a message sent by Gen. S. H. F. J. Manekshaw, Indian Chief of Staff, to Lieut. Gen. A. A. K.'Niazi, Pakistani commander in East Pakistan, who had proposed a ceasefire:

title: Southern Christian Leadership Conference Rejects Resignation of Jackson
description: ATLANTA, Dec. 15The executive committee of the Southern Christian Leadership Conference reacted today with a combination of chagrin and forebearance to the resignation of the organization's chief Northern official.

title: Bronx and Westchester Raids Net $6Million in Uncut Heroin
description: The police fired a halfdozen shots in a Bronx chase yesterday and seized a man with three kilograms of heroin on the front seat of his car to bring to a climax a joint BronxWestchester County crackdown on narcotics peddlers.

title: Police Commissioners of 6 Major Cities, Meeting in Wilmington, Del., Call for Federal Control of Handguns
description: WILMINGTON, Del., Dec. 15  The police commissioners of six major cities called today for Federal control of handguns.

title: JERSEY MAY HELP PRIVATE COLLEGES
description: TRENTON, Dec. 15  Gov. William T. Cahill said today that he would probably propose legislation next year providing state aid to private colleges and universities in New Jersey.

title: MORTGAGE AGENCY ENTERS NEW FIELD
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 15 (AP) The Federal National Mortgage Association, a quasipublic agency that buys and sells Governmentbacked Mortgages, will open on Feb. 14 a secondary market involving conventional mortgages on singlefamily, existing homes.

title: A Computer Outperforms 10 Radiologists in a Heart Disease Test
description: A University of Missouri radiologist said yesterday that he and his colleagues had developed an experimental computer program that could accurately diagnose one type of heart disease on Xray films of the chest.

title: Japanese Shape Trade Offer to Limit Yen Shift
description: TOKYO, Dec. 15 (UP)Japan is prepared to open her doors to more American farm products to avoid an excessive upward revaluation of the Japanese yen, Government sources said today.

title: Beatty and Goldie Hawn Star in Caper Movie, $
description: They're spoofing! They're spoofing! He, he! chortled a woman in the row behind me at the preview screening. But she was chortling in the dark, because they weren't spoofing, at least not the way she meant. Halfway through the climax to Richard Brooks's $, with Warren Beatty trapped on thin ice (literally), I think all of us would have taken a joke at any level to escape the strenuous and interminable chase sequence that spells coronaries for the cast, ennui for the audience and the elephantine enlargement of what had been an amiable little caper movie.

title: Freighter Is Reported Attacked And Seized by Cuban Gunboat
description: MIAMI, Dec. 15  A Cuban gunboat attacked a Miamibased freighter today in Bahamian waters and took possession of the vessel after wounding the captain and two crewmen, the United States Coast Guard reported.

title: Cattle Guarantee in Texas
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 15 (AP) A Federal quarantine has been imposed on cattle in 34 Texas counties in an effort to curb outbreaks of scabies, a disease caused by tiny mites that burrow into the skin of animals, the Agriculture Department announced today.

title: Film:
description: There is genuine tragedy in the idea of a once noted director driven daft and now living disjointedly in the flickering glories of his past, as is indicated by B. J. Lang Presents, which opened at local theaters yesterday. But with an unkempt, wildeyed, graybearded Mickey Rooney and Yabo Yablonsky, the writer  director, indulging themselves recklessly, tragedy is supplanted by a plethora of playacting, confusing editing, camera tricks and a distracting musical and sound background.

title: Jackson Names Florida Aide
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 15 (AP) Senator Henry M. Jackson, Democrat of Washington, named J. Richard Sewell today as executive director of his Florida campaign for the March 14 Presidential primary.

title: Man In the News
description: There is one word that almost everyone  no matter how they assess his performanceuses to describe John J. Burns, and the word is likable.

title: STOCKS POST GAIN AS PACE QUICKENS
description: The stock market, its hopes fanned for a preliminary settlement of the world currency crisis, produced a strong gain yesterday, with glamour issues, depressed issues and some blue chips in the vanguard.

title: Honeywell in Joint Venture
