description: MINNEAPOLIS, Dec. 15 (Reuters)Honeywell, Inc., said today it had entered a joint venture to run its controlssystems business in New Zealand. Honeywell's partner is Motors Specialties Industries, Ltd., whose subsidiary, Paykel Brothers, Ltd., is the Honeywell distributor in New Zealand. The joint venture will be known as PaykelHoneywell (N.Z.), Ltd.

title: MARTIN SADDLES 5 WINNERS HERE
description: Frank (Pancho) Martin left his fans laughing as he said, goodby to the local season at Aqueduct yesterday. The Cubanborn trainer came through with the recordhreaking achievement of sending out five winners on the ninerace card, a feat never before performed in modern thoroughbred racing.

title: Navarro of Columbia Voted Coach of Year
description: Eastern College Football

title: Excerpts From Testimony by Inspector Behan Before the Knapp Commission
description: Following are excerpts from testimony before the Knapp Commission on the second day of its second series of public hearings arising from its inquiry into police corruption here. The commission heard nine days of testimony in October.

title: Police Trainees' Wives and Fiancees Are Urged to Help Fight Corruption
description: The secondhighest official in the Police Department appealed to police trainees' wives and fiances yesterday to try to steer the trainees away from corruption.

title: Yanks' McKinney Suffers Leg Burns in Puerto Rico
description: Rich McKinney, the 25yearold infielder acquired by the New York Yankees two weeks ago, was reported yesterday to have suffered ankle burns in Puerto Rico and was ending his winter baseball season.

title: MILITARY BACKING TURKISH PREMIER
description: ANKARA, Turkey, Dec. 15Premier Nihat Erim said today that he was undertaking to govern with a reorganized Cabinet in complete understanding with the military commanders.

title: Brewing by Schlitz Ceases in Brooklyn
description: Brewing operations at the Jos. Schlitz Brewing Company's plant in Brooklyn closed down yesterday. And all packaging operations there will halt at the end of this month if the company is unable to find a buyer to run the plant.

title: Vienna Arms Negotiators Hold 2d Session in 2 Days
description: VIENNA, Dec. 15 (UPI)Soviet and American negotiators at the talks on limit action of strategic arms met for 90 minutes today for their second meeting in two days. They scheduled another meeting for Friday.

title: Soviet Georgia Goes Own Way, Does Well
description: TBILISI, U.S.S.R.  In 1839 an anonymous French traveler recorded that this city had 126 tailors, 104 bootmakers, 40 barbers, 4 master goldsmiths, clockmakers, 16 painters and 18 balalaika players, testifying to the Georgian taste for finery and the good life.

title: 14Seat G.O.P. Gain In Legislature Seen Under Redistricting
description: ALBANY, Dec. 15Republicans could increase their majorities in both houses of the Legislature by up to 10 Assembly and four State Senate seats as a result of the new legislative district lines that were finally unveiled today amid the expected chorus of Democratic protests.

title: St. Francis Victor
description: St. Francis College staged a secondhalf rally to defeat New Hampshire; 6664, on the winner's court in Brooklyn last night. The Terriers, trailing by 13 points with seven minutes to play, won on a long shot by Dennis McDermott with two seconds remaining.

title: Colonel Called a Disgrace and Great in Trial Debate
description: FORT MEADE, Md., Dec. 15,  Col. Oran K. Henderson was portrayed today as a man who had brought dishonor, disgrace and humiliation to the uniform of the United States Army by his alleged concealment of the mass slaying of South Vietnamest civilians by American troops in the hamlet of Mylai 4.

title: U.S. MOVES TO GET DOCTORS FOR POOR
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 15 (AP) Regulations will be published tomorrow under which Governmentpaid physicians, dentists and nurses will begin providing health care in city slums and rural areas.

title: D. A. Campbell, Broker, Weds Miss Kent Taylor in London
description: Miss Allegra Kent Taylor and Douglas Argyll Campbell, a stockbroker with offices in New York, Los Angeles and London, were married in London yesterday. The Anglican ceremony in the Chelsea Old Church was performed by the Rev. C. E. Leighton. A reception for some 500 guests followed at Crosby Hall, next door.

title: ST. PAUL'S SEXTET BEATS CHOATE, 32
description: St. Paul's of New Hampshire delighted many of the 2,100 hockey fans at Madison Square Garden yesterday with a 32 victory over Choate.

title: A Brooklyn Senator Shows Car Registration Fallibility
description: State Senator Albert B. Lewis affixed an Alabama license plate to a stolen automobile yesterday outside City Hall with three policemen watching, but nobody stopped him.

title: AirBag Advances Shown by Allied
description: KNOXVILLE, Tenn., Dec. 15 The Allied Chemical Corporation today demonstrated some major breakthroughs in airbag technology and its engineers predicted that there was a good chance that they would be used by the auto industry to meet new safety standards in 1976.

title: CELTICS SET BACK SONICS, 112 TO 100
description: BOSTON, Dec. 15 (AP)The Boston Celtics got 20 or more points from four of their five starters tonight in a 112100 decision over the Seattle SuperSonics in a National Basketball Association game. It was the Celtics' third victory in a row.

title: U.S. Proposes Peace Talks Be Put Oil to Deco 30
description: PARIS, Dec. 15William J. Porter who has been harsh with the Vietnamese Communists ever since he became the chief of the American delegation at the peace talks more than two months ago, was harsh with them again today. He proposed in effect a threeweek break in the discussions.

title: LOCAL UNIT BACKS MALL ON MADISON
description: Community Board 5 gave the crucial green light yesterday to construction of a Madison Avenue Mall between 42d and 57th Streets.

title: Ford Names New Truck
description: DETROIT, Dec. 15 (A15)The Ford Motor Company announced today that its new imported light truck would be called the Courier. The truck, manufactured in Japan by Toyo Kogyo, Ltd., will go on sale early next year at selected West Coast Ford dealers.

title: She Needled Way Through 22 Cities
description: Pearlie Mae's back in town to promote her latest book, her newest hobby and an old friend, Pearl Bailey. It comes to her as naturally as breathing.

title: Enterprise Is Flagship
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 15A United States naval task force of eight ships, led by the nuclear aircraft carrier Enterprise and transporting 2,000 marines, steamed northwest in the Bay of Bengal today toward India and East Pakistan.

title: Film:
description: Even Dwarfs Started Small, which opened yesterday at the St. Marks Cinema, was shown at the eighth New York Film Festival. Following are excerpts from Vincent Canby's review, which appeared on Sept. 17, 1970, in The New York Times:

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: Canadiens Down Kings
description: INGLEWOOD, Calif., Dec. 15 (UPI)Ken Dryden lost a bid for his fourth shutout of the year with 7:28 to go tonight, but he put his name into the National Hockey League record book by tying a mark for most assists by a goalie in a season as the Montreal Canadiens scored a 31 victory over the Los Angeles Kings.

title: BOND PRICES DIP ON CROWDED LIST
description: Bond prices declined and interest rates inched upward yesterday. The heavy supply of new, fixedincome securities being sold this week has proved unappetizing to investors so far.

title: Leafs Down Penguins, 32
description: TORONTO, Dec. 15 (UPI) Paul Henderson's 18th goal of the season at 13:50 of the third period proved to be the winner tonight as the Toronto Maple Leafs beat the Pittsburgh Penguins, 32.

title: Chinese Delegation to U.N. Officially Greeted by Mayor
description: Mayor Lindsay officially greeted China's delegates to the United Nations yesterday and renewed the city's invitation for a cultural exchange with Peking.

title: City and State U. Heads Oppose Plan for Aiding Private Schools
description: Strongly worded statements were issued yesterday by the chancellors of the City University and the State University, criticizing proposals made Tuesday by the heads of six major private universities who called upon New York State to help them eliminate mountng deficits at their institutions.

title: SUIT FILED TO BLOCK CON EDISON'S PLANT
description: Environmental groups led by the Scenic Hudson Preservation Conference filed suit in State Supreme Court in Albany yesterday challenging a state ruling that Consolidated Edison's controversial Storm King power plant would not violate water quality standards.

title: IN THE NATION
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 15Dr. Henry Kissinger can get into and out of China in high secrecy, but lately he can't seem to give a backgrounder without having his cover blown. Maybe he ought to draw the conclusion that he and what he usually has to say are too big to hide.

title: Unfinished Budgetary Bridge
description: Governor Rockefeller's tax package for bridging the gap between estimated state revenues and expenditures is generally good so far as it goes. The problem is, regrettably, that the tax package may not go far enough. Even so, it is not yet sure that the state's legislative leaders will approve it.

title: Australia Sets a Meeting On Revaluation of Dollar
description: SYDNEY, Australia, Dec. 15 The Australian cabinet will meet in Canberra tomorrow to discuss revaluation of the American dollar but will make no decision on revaluing the (Australian dollar until at least next week.

title: Burns Named National Coordinator for the Lindsay '72 Committee
description: John J. Burns, Democratic state chairman, was named national coordinator for the Lindsay '72 Committee yesterday and given the task of drumming up support for the Mayor for the Democratic nomination for President.

title: Indian Animosity Grows
description: NEW DELHI, Dec. 15If the American aircraft carrier Enterprise dares to intervene in the IndianPakistani war, a member of the Indian Parliament said today, the Government should not hesitate to blast it out of the water.

title: BOY SHOOTS UP HOME, THEN IS FOUND DEAD
description: AMITYVILLE, L.I., Dec. 15A 16yearold boy fired more than 50 shots into the walls of his house here last night and was found dead, apparently of a selfinflicted shotgun wound, when the police finally broke in after pumping six teargas canisters into the rooms where the shots were heard, police officials said today.

title: Helena, Countess of Kintore, 95; Former Duchess of Manchester
description: Helena, Countess of Kintore, widow of the 10th Earl of Kintore and former Duchess of Manchester, died yesterday at the family seat, Keith Hall, Inverurle, Aberdeenshire, Scotland, at the age of 95.

title: U.S. to Buy Fresh Pears
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 15 (AP) The Agriculture Department plans to buy an unspecified quantity of fresh winter pears for distribution through school lunch and other food aid programs. Details and specifications of the purchase plan will be mailed soon to pear growers, producer associations and agents.

title: 12 NURSING HOES FACE FUND CUTOFF
description: A dozen New York State government nursing homes, with 16,000 beds, may lose their Federal reimbursement for care of Medicaid patients on Dec. 31 because of noncompliance with Federal standards.

title: EQUITY FINANCING
description: SBD Electronic Systems, Inc., Amityville, L. I. offered 110,000 shares at $5, also an initial offering. Philips, Appel & Walden headed the group.

title: McCarthy Exhorts Youths to Remain Active in Politics
description: Former Senator Eugene J. McCarthy said yesterday that if the nation's 18to20yearold youths merely waited passively to exercise their newly won right to vote on Election Day and did not remain active in politics, we might have well been better off without it.

title: DoubleDeck Buses May Return Here
description: The doubledeck busa New York institution that endowed a ride along Fifth Avenue and Riverside Drive with a special glamour for 46 years until economics killed it in 1953may be rolling again on the city's streets within a year.

title: First Boston Corp. Elects
description: J. Howard Laerl, who retired as vice chairman of the First National City Corporation and its principal subsidairy, First National City Bank, in April of this year, was elected yesterday a director of the First Boston Corporation.

title: Bomb Found at Bank
description: CAMBRIDGE. Mass., Dec. 15 (AP)An 18inch, pipetype bomb with a wristwatch as a timing device was discovered early this morning against a side door of the Harvard Trust Company in Central Square. A state police bomb squad dismantled it. An unidentified man called The Associated Press earlier to say that he represented the Sons of Liberty and that the bomb had been placed to protest the bank's policy, of oppression of the masses.

title: Suns Defeat Royals
description: CINCINNATI, Dec. 15 (AP)Dick Van Arsdale had 31 points and Otto Moore and Paul Silas led a 13point third period breakout tonight as the Phoenix Suns beat the Cincinnati Royals, 127108. Van Arsdale made 11 of 17 shots.

title: Defense Budget of $70.5Billion Is Voted
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 15 An adjournmentminded Congress approved today a $70.5billion appropriations bill for the Defense Department but remained snagged on funds for the foreign aid program.

title: Pacers Defeat Chaps
description: ANDERSON, Ind., Dec. 15 (AP)The Indiana Pacers put six men in double figures tonight to beat the Dallas Chaparrals, 124110, for the second straight night.

title: Newton Is Cleared of Charges in Slaying
description: OAKLAND, Calif., Dec. 15After spending nearly two years in prison and standing trial three times, Huey P. Newton, the Black Panther leader, today won a dismissal of charges that he killed an Oakland policeman.

title: C.M. Says Tax on Its Cars Was Turned Over to U.S.
description: DETROIT, Dec, 15 (AP)A spokesman for the General Motors Corporation said today that the company had not kept any of the excise tax collected on new cars since President Nixon announced Aug. 15 that he would seek repeal of the levy.

title: GUARDS IN NEWARK FACING AN INQUIRY
description: NEWARK, Dec. 15  The Essex County Prosecutor's office is investigating reports that the Newark Board of Education is paying for a noshow night security force, some of whose members have criminal records.

title: 3 JAIL GUARDS PLEAD TO REDUCED CHARGES
description: Three prison guards accused of using unnecessary force against inmates after the riot at the Queens House of Detention last fall were permitted at a Department of Correction hearing yesterday to plead guilty to lesser charges. A fourth guard pleaded guilty to the unnecessaryforce charge.

title: Kerner Only the 4th U. S. Judge In History to Have Been Indicted
description: Including Judge Otto Kerner, who was charged yesterday by a Federal grand jury in Chicago with conspiracy, perjury and income tax evasion, only four Federal judges have ever been indicted.

title: MAGIC FESTIVAL APPEARS AT FELT
description: The shades of Chandu, Mandrake, Wanda the Witch and other legendary masters of the ancient art of prestidigitation have found fleshy embodiment at the Felt Forum, where the World Festival of Magic and Occult took up residence Tuesday for the start of a 24performance run that will take it through Jan. 2. Its sponsors, including Budd Filippo, who produced the 2 hour and 15 minute show, say it is the first time that so many topranked magicians have appeared together in New York.

title: A's Hire Adair as Coach
description: OAKLAND, Calif, Dec. 15 (UPI)Jerry Adair, a major league infield for 10 years, was hired today by the Oakland A's as firstbase coach.

title: City College Honors a Pragelmatist
description: Raymond Reuben Haber, who has been selling bagels, or rather pretzelswell, actually pragelsat City College for the last 25 years, was presented yesterday with an honorary bachelor's degree in pretzel purveyance by the college's president, Dr. R.E. Marshak. He was also given a bronze bagel.

title: Yorty Calls Muskie Naive
description: EXETER, N. H., Dec. 15 (AP)  Mayor Sam Yorty of Los Angeles, winding up his threeday campaign in New Hampshire, charged today that Senator Edmund S. Muskie of Maine, who also is expected to seek the Democratic Presidential nomination, was naive in the area of world affairs.

title: Concorde Jet Priced at Record $31.2Million
description: PARIS, Dec. 15The builders of the Concorde supersonic airliner today posted a price of $31.2million for it, a record for a civilian aircraft, and said that the first halfdozen craft would be ready for service by October, 1974.

title: Charleston Reelects Mayor As Bid by Coalition Fails
description: CHARLESTON, S. C., Dec. 15Mayor J. Palmer Gaillard beat back a coalition attempt to unseat his 12yearold Democratic administration yesterday.

title: U.S. Says Possibility of Canceling Moscow Trip Is Not Live Issue
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 15The White House, seeking to clear up confusion caused by two senior aides yesterday, affirmed its Unhappiness today with the Soviet Union's strong support for India but said that the possibility of canceling President Nixon's trip to Moscow was not a live issue.

title: Executive Changes
description: The SherwinWilliams Company announced yesterday following its annual meeting in Cleveland, the election of Walter O. Spencer as chief executive officer. Mr. Spencer will continue as president, a post he has held since 1969. The action was taken in line with a plan for the orderly transition of management initiated by E. Colin Baldwin, chairman, who has been chief executive officer since 1965. William C. Fine was elected senior vice president of finance and administration.

title: Books of The Times
description: Last Tuesday, this column described briefly seven children's picture booksthe best of this year's rather mediocre crop. What follows is what struck me as the best of the children's books published this year that depend primarily on text to tell their stories. They are ranked roughly according to the degree of their sophistication, with the simplest described first. None of them will endure as classics, but all reveal at least the spark of originality that was missing from most of what I read.

title: Hambro Reports the Failure Of Bid to End U.N. Deficit
description: UNITED NATIONS. N. Y., Dec. 15Edvard Hambro, Norway's chief delegate, reported today the failure of his sevenmonth effort to settle the financial crisis of the United Nations. He urged that a group be set up by Secretary General Thant to make new proposals before the 1972 General Assembly session.

title: ShowMe Stance Adopted By Business on Devaluing
description: The business and financial community appears to be treat ing Tuesday's formal an nouncement of United States willingness to devalue the dollar as an interesting appetizer, but it is awaiting a more sub stantive main course before becoming enthusiastic about the whole menu.

title: When It Comes to Kitchenware, Nobody Has Everything
description: By now the ideal Christmas shopper has already stocked up on ties that will never be worn, phials of ether sold as perfume and erector sets with directions written by a Japanese who studied  briefly  in our country at U.C.L.A. and apparently majored in black comedy. Once again, the base of the typical American Christmas tree is turning into a white elephant graveyard.

title: Fair Housing Code Negotiated in St. Louis Area
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 15 (AP) The Just:.ce Department said today that it had negotiated a fair housing code with the real estate dealers in metropolitan St. Louis.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: The Immorality of AntiLaws

title: The Proceedings In the U.N. Today
Early Discharge Available For Officers in Air Force
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 15 (AP) Cutting back to meet budget requirements, the Air Force announced today that officers scheduled for discharge prior to June 30 may apply for immediate cischarge.

title: S.E.C. GIVES DATA ON TRADING BAR
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 15 The staff of the Securities and Exchange Commission concluded, in 1965, that a sinceamended rule of the New York Stock Exchange is geared to the economic interests of exchange members.

title: Troops Prepare for Final Drivel
description: The following pool dispatch was received in New Delhi from a group of news correspondents.

title: LAO REFORM LAG FOUND IN VIETNAM
description: PLEIKU, South Vietnam, Dec. 13  An Americansponsored program of land reform here is giving far less land than initially intended to the montagnards, the mountain people of Central Vietnam.

title: Maudling Statement Arouses Ulster Parliament
description: BELFAST, Northern Ireland Dec. 15The British Horne Secretary, Reginald Maudling, created a furor in the Northern Ireland Parliament today over his admission that the British Army might not be able to eliminate terrorism completely.

title: COMMUNITY AIDE TELLS OF ATTACK
description: The chairman of Community Board 2 in Greenwich Village said yesterday that a shot was fired into her bedroom wall Saturday night. The board has been criticized recently by a group of residents who charge that it has failed to represent the community properly.

title: Official's Daughter Pleads Guilty to Murder in Holdup
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 15 Heidi Ann Fletcher. 21 years old, daughter of Thomas W. Fletcher, the city manager of San Jose, Calif., today pleaded guilty to murder, armed robbery and other charges stemming from the holdup last May of a savings and loan office in which a guard was shot to death.

title: 2d Lawsuit Is Filed by U.S. Charging Phase 2 Violation
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 15 (UPI) The Justice Department, in its second lawsuit enforcing economic controls in Phase Two, charged a Wilmington, Del., apartment owner today with raising rents illegally.

title: Jarring Resumes Mideast Peace Bid in Talk With Riad
description: UNITED NATIONS, N. Y., Dec. 15Dr. Gunnar V. Jarring, Secretary General Thant's special representative for the Middie East, resumed his peacemaking efforts today with an hourlong meeting with Mahmoud Riad, the Egyptian Foreign Minister.

title: JORDANIAN ENVOY IS SHOT IN LONDON
description: LONDON, Dec. 15Jordan's Ambassador to Britain, Zaid alRifal was shot and wounded today by a gunman waiting in ambush near a crowded London intersection.

title: JAPAN COOL TO U.S. ON CARRIER SHIFTS
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 15The Navy's hopes for a new concept of overseas basing have run into possibly temporary obstacles in Japan, according American and Japanese sources.

title: Westchester Notes Elderly White Rise Along With Blacks
description: WHITE PLAINS, Dec. 15White people over the age of 54 and nonwhites of all ages accounted for virtually all of Westchester County's population growth in the second half of the nineteensixties, according to the County Planning Department.

title: Stars Defeat Blues, 41
description: BLOOMINGTON, Minn., Dec. 15 (AP)The Minnesota North Stars ended a fourgame losing streak tonight with a 4.1 victory over the St. Louis Blues behind Murray Oliver's two goals.

title: Members of Big Board Bach Multiple Owners
description: The New York Stock Exchange announced yesterday that its members had approved an amendment to the exchange's constitution that would allow member orgaizations to participate in the ownership of other member organizations.

title: Big Chemical Blast Set Off To Test Weapons Defense
description: MERCURY, Nev., Dec. 15 (AP)The Department of Defense said it detonated 120 tons of chemical high explosives at the Atomic Energy Commission's Nevada Test Site today as part of an experiment to evaluate the vulnerability of weapons systems to nuclear attack.

title: Missile Site Attacked
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, Dec. 15 (UPI)No major fighting was reported in.South Vietnam today. But the United States Command in Saigon, in a delayed report, said that two United States Navy A7 Intruder jets fired on two North Vietnamese antiaircraft bases about 85 miles north of the demilitarized zone on Monday.

title: 11th, 12th Ballots in Italy Fail to Name a President
description: ROME, Dec. 15  Italy's presidential balloting continued for the seventh day today with two inconclusive rounds of voting by the 1,008member electoral college.

title: 2 Hostages Seized At Prison in Jersey
description: YARDVILLE, N.J., Thursday, Dec. 16About 100 inmates rioted late yesterday afternoon at the State Youth Reception and Correction Center here and, later, seized the assistant superintendent and a correction officer as hostages.

title: Talk Isn't Cheap: The Lecture Circuit Is Big Business
description: PALO ALTO, Calif., Dec. 15  Riding the waves of confrontations and crises that have swept the country in the last few years, the lecture circuit has become big business, with millions of dollars worth of annual bookings and top performers earning sixfigure salaries.

title: U.S. Man in Argentina Gets 5 Years in Longest Hijacking
description: LA PLATA, Argentina, Dec. 15 (Reuters)Robert Lee Jackson, of Alcoa, Tim., was sent to prison for five years today for his part last July in the longest hijacking on record.

title: Rockefeller to Head State's Nixon Drive
description: ALBANY, Dec. 15In the latest display of their new amity, Governor Rockefeller said today that he would be chairman of the New York State campaign to reelect President Nixon next year.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: Furniture Designer Convicted In Homosexual Attack on Boy
description: John Vesey, the furniture designer and decorator, has been convicted in State Supreme Court in Manhattan of assault in the second degree for severely injuring a 17yearold boy.

title: KNAPP PANEL TOLD OF INQUIRY DELAY
description: A New York police inspector testified yesterday that he had passed on reports of widespread corruption to the secondhighest official in the Police Department eight months before an investigation was begun.

title: Accuracy of the House's Voting Records Disputed at Dowdy Trial
description: BALTIMORE, Dec. 15  A dispute over the timing of Representative John Dowdy's activities on the clay he allegedly accepted a $25,000 bribe centered today on the accuracy of records of votes in the House of Representatives.

title: Admiring Laughter For Nancy Green In Dance Program
description: Rich, unforced and admiring laughter was the background to Nancy Green's concert, Just Dancing, Tuesday evening at the Cubiculo. Miss Green offered a varied program of solos for the most part choreographed by or for her, in addition to a strikingly good revival of Yvonne Rainer's Three Sortie Spoons.

title: MidOcean Club Captures Bermuda Golf by Stroke
description: HAMILTON, Bermuda, Dec. 15MidOcean, the host club, carded a final round of 62 today to win the 19th Bermuda Goodwill golf tournament by a stroke with a total of 245.

title: Those Rumblings on Mr. Nixon's Right
description: WASHINGTONIn early 1968, when it appeared that the Ohio delegation to the Republican National Convention would not go for Richard Nixon, I opposed the organization slate and was elected as a free and independent delegate. At Miami, candidate Nixon received two Ohio votes, mine and the other district delegate who was elected on my independent slate.

title: PAKISTAN SEEKING INDIAN GUARANTEE
description: RAWALPINDI, Pakistan, Dec. 15With the fall of Pakistani forces in East Pakistan seemingly only hours away, Pakistan's central Government here tonight demanded proper treatment by the victorious Indians of prisoners of war and of minority groups.

title: Lending Unit Is Formed
description: BankAmerica Corporation and Laurentide Financial Corporation, Ltd., of Vancouver, British Columbia, have formed a new commercial lending and industrial leasing company in Canada. The company, North Continent Capital, Ltd., will have an initial capitalization of $2 million.

title: Enthusiasm in Season Again for Eastern Dog Club Holiday Show
description: News of Dogs

title: U.S. FEARS YAHYA WON'T QUIT WAR
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 16 State Department officials expressed concern tonight that the IndianPakistani war might continue in the West because Pakistan might refuse immediately to abide by the ceasefire declared by India earlier today.

title: Dr. Eduard Kutscher Dies; Professor of Philology, 62
description: Dr. Eduard E. Kutscher, professor of philology at the Hebrew University, Jerusalem, since 1949, and author of The Language and Linguistic Background of the Isaiah Scroll (One of the Dead Sea Scrolls), died, Sunday in Los Angeles, while on a lecture tour. His age was 62.

title: Hill Passes Test in Shift to Right
description: Switching Winston Hill from left tackle to right tackle isn't quite as momentous as it would be if the Jets were to make Joe Namath a cornerback. But for Hill the move meant more than simply changing from one side of the line to the other.

title: Poland One Year Later
description: A year has passed since the angry workers of Poland's Baltic ports revolted and brought about the replacement of Wladyslave Gomulka by Edward Gierek. The dividends from that revolt are evident.

title: Lindsay Denies Reaching Decision on the Primaries
description: WILMINGTON, Del., Dec. 16 Mayor Lindsay denied today reports that he had decided to enter Presidential primaries in seven states.

title: Nixon Plans Address To Congress Jan. 20
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 16 (AP)White House sources said today that President Nixon planned to address joint session of Congress at 12:30 P.M. Thursday, Jan. 20.

title: About Pro Football
description: Seven of the eight teams for the playoffs have been decided and the eighth, Los Angeles or San Francisco, will he determined in their games on Sunday. The 49ersDetroit contest will be televised here on Channel 2 at 4 P.M. Other TV games are St. Louis at Dallas, Channel

title: Faster Evening Service Set for Buses to Queens
description: A plan to save about 10 minutes every evening for more than 6,000 Queens residents homebound from Manhattan on express buses will go into effect Monday, Mayor Lindsay announced yesterday.

title: Soviet Said to Let Man Join His Wife in U.S.
description: GREAT NECK, L. I., Dec. 16  Deborah Brackman Kremniova, who has been struggling with Soviet bureaucracy since her marriage to a Russian medical student in Leningrad last summer, said today that Soviet authorities had granted her husband permission to come to the United States to stay permanently.

title: Arena Stage: Success and Problems
description: WASHINGTON  Michael Weller's Moonchildren is the third new play by a young American writer to receive its American premiere at the Arena Stage and then to be transferred to Broadway. At the same time that the Arena is on the verge of this major national exposure, the theater is faced with financial problems.

title: Advertising:
description: Fill in the Blanks: requests the fullpage ad in the current issue of Editor & Publisher and follows it with ... leenex tissues . . leenex towels otex feminine napkins . . . imberlyClark.

title: NixonConnally Stand on Labor
description: Alfred Baker Lewis' antilabor charge against President Nixon and Secretary Connally [letter Dec. 13] is more properly directed at himself for he is the victim of some distorted economic conclusions. Actually, the President's continued reluctance to invoke an incomes policy provided labor with a threeyear opportunity to hoist itself on its own petard of wagepush inflation, thus not only reducing its members' real wages, but also undercutting takehome income for the remainder of our citizenry.

title: Chairman Has Resigned At Quebec Stock Agency
description: MONTREAL, Dec. 16Marcel Lajeunesse has resigned as chairman of the Quebec Securities Commission for health reasons, Robert Bourassa, Quebec Premier, told the National Assembly in Quebec City today.

title: MASSACHUSETTS, COLUMBIA SCORE
description: Massachusetts, which has won all its games, and Columbia, loser of its five previous starts, scored victories last night in a college basketball doubleheader at Madison Square Garden.

title: Freeing of Hostages Ends Uprising at Jersey Prison
description: YARDVILLE, N.J., Dec. 16 An uprising at the State Youth Reception and Correction Center here ended this morning, less than 24 hours after it began, when two hostages were released unharmed by rebelling prisoners.

title: Guns in Dallas and Elsewhere
description: Letters to the Editor

title: JOSEPH WEINBERGER
description: Joseph Weinberger, a retired manufacturing chemist, formerly president of Washine National Sands, now part of Mallinckrodt Chemical Works, died Wednesday at his home, 1453 Walton Avenue, the Bronx. He was 93 years old.

title: Books of The Times
description: Country surrealism is a good definition of the quality James Dickey wants to develop in his poems. Although he does not define it, I take it to mean something unexpected or Incongruous that is to be found, not forced, and that will come not out of literary affectation but nature itself. Country surrealism would resemble the light a painter such as Edward Hopper brought to smalltown life. It would make the pastoral poem at once more primitive and more sophisticated, and certainly less complacent.

title: As in Christmases Past, They Still Buy Presents
description: With lists in their hands, shopping bags on their arms and fire in their eyes, hundreds of thousands of Christmas shoppers are swarming through the glittering stores as if the recession, unemployment, fear of the streets and the vogue to denigrate middleclass values all belonged to the Ghosts of Christmas Past.

title: Sprechen Sie Deutsch?
description: ZURICH, Switzerland, Dec. 16 (AP)  Muhammad Ali arrived here today for his Dec. 26 bout with Jurgen Blin of West Germany, but Swiss and German reporters were disappointed when he had nothing to say.

title: El Morocco Reopens as a Private Cluband Siberia Has Been Banished
Special Spirit CitedPlans to Compose
description: If it had been Broadway they would have said that Leonard Bernstein brought the house down Wednesday night when he played his 1,000th concert with the New York Philharmonic, leading the orchestra through Mahler's Second, or Resurrection, Symphony.

title: BUCKLEY FORESEES '72 NIXON VICTORY
description: Senator James L. Buckley declared yesterday that he would put good odds on the reelection of President Nixon next year and that Vice President Agnew would be a definile asset if he were on the ticket.

title: Appeal by Pope Calls for Peace Based on Justice, Not on Power
description: ROME, Dec. 16Pope Paul VI today called for peace based on justice, not peace imposed only by superiority of power and force.

title: Wood, Field and Stream
description: VIRGINIA BEACH, Va.The clay was unusually warm, in the mid70's, and we had been trolling for striped bass five miles offshore and eight miles south of Rudee Inlet at Virginia Beach with no success when one of our four rods shuddered from the force of a heavy strike.

title: SKATE TRIALS WON BY ANNE HENNING
description: MILWAUKEE, Dec. 16 (AP) Anne Henning of Northbrook, Ill., the woman's world recordholder at 500 meters in speed skating, was clocked in 43.9 seconds in her specialty today as trials opened for the 1972 United States Olympic team.

title: Stony Brook Takes Final
description: FARMINGDALE, L. I., Dec. 16Stony Brook State University, led by Art King's 29 points and 17 rebounds, defeated C. W. Post, 7556, to win the second Schaefer Long Island tournament tonight.

title: U.S. Lists Another Huge Payments Gap
POLICEMAN ADMITS GUILT IN BRIBE CASE
Dr. BuncheInternationalist
description: The Times is to be commended for its interpretative account of the life of Dr. Ralph Bunche. Well conveyed were his unique talents and the kind of man he was, whose stature did not derive from efforts specifically in behalf of his race but as a true internationalist, a man of all seasons, above race and country, a distinction history has bestowed on very few.

title: John D. Fennebresque Is Dead; Engineer Led Mobil Chemical
description: WEST REDDING, Conn., Dec. 16John D. Fennebresque, who received a Yale Engineering Association award in 1950 for helping develop synthetic rubber in World War II, died yesterday of a heart attack on a visit to Asheville, N. C. He was 54 years old and lived here and formerly in Oyster Bay, L. I.

title: Steel Price Rise Approved
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 16 (AP) The Price Commission approved today an 8 per cent increase for sheet steel products made by the National Steel Corporation.

title: Divided Marble Hill Now Leaning Toward Partition
description: SOMEWHERE ON THE BRONXMANHATTAN BORDER, Dec. 16It may be like slicing up Lilliputia, like splitting the atomor hairsbut some residents of polarized Marble Hill, that tiny enclave of Manhattan surrounded on three sides by the Bronx, are now saying that partition is the only solution to their problem.

title: Impeccable Food in Cozy Surroundings
description: Restaurants reviewed on this page on Friday are rated both for their food (four stars to none) and for their atmosphere, service and decor (four triangles to none.)

title: Floridians Crush Condors
description: MIAMI BEACH, Dec. 16 (AP) Mack Calvin drilled in 29 points to lead the Floridians on a 129.103 romp over the Pittsburgh Condors tonight in an American Basketball Association contest.

title: Production of Oil in Texas Is Raised to Meet Demand
description: AUSTIN, Tex., Dec. 16Texas oil wells will be opened up Jan. 1 to meet rising demand for crude oil from purchasers.

title: Warriors End Slide
description: OAKLAND, Calif., Dec. 16 (UPI)Cazzie Russell's thirdperiod shooting helped Golden State to a 11393 N.B.A. victory over the Philadelphia 76ers tonight, snapping the Warriors sixgame losing streak.

title: Text of Chinese Statement on the War
description: UNITED NATIONS, N. Y., Dec. 16Following is the text of a statement by the Government of China in a translation issued by its delegation here today. The statement was also distributed from Peking by Hsinhua, the Chinese press agency.

title: PHELPS DODGE GIVES EARNINGS ESTIMATE
description: The Phelps Dodge Corporation expects this year's earnings to be in the range of $3.65 to $3.80 a share, George B. Munroe, president, told a meeting of the Financial Analysts of Philadelphia yesterday.

title: New York Life Promotes 2
description: The New York Life Insurance Company has promoted Walter Shur and Edward B. Williams to senior vice presidents. Mr. Shur was vice president in charge of group insurance and Mr. Williams was a vice president and controller.

title: White House Response
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 16 (AP) Ronald L. Ziegler, the White House press secretary, had sharp immediate response when asked about a letter that Mrs. Gandhi sent Mr. Nixon contending that the war could have been avoided if the United States and other countries had used their influence to release Sheik Mujibur Rahman.

title: TAXEXEMPT LIST REGISTERS A GAIN
description: The taxexempt bond market, emerging from its heaviest weekly financing in history, caught fire late yesterday afternoon. Price rose, interest rates fell and new bond issues started to sell quickly.

title: Joy and Marigolds
description: DACCA, Pakistan, Dec. 16 Shouting Joi Bangla! and waving the Bangladesh flag, Indian troops in trucks and buses poured into the Pakistani military camp north of town today just after the Pakistanis had accepted an ultimatum to surrender.

title: Article 1  No Title
description: KEY BISCAYNE, Fla., Dec. 16 (Reuters)  President Nixon has signed into law a bill giving special copyright protection to the book Science and Health, regarded as the guide to the faith of the Christian Science Church, White House officials said today.

title: Mead Lifts Paper Price
description: The Mead Corporation has notified its customers of a $10a  ton price increase on all weights of publication enameline for letterpress and gravure, a publishing paper used in magazines and books.

title: Holds Secret Parley Here to Block RightWing Bid
description: AGNEW CONFERS WITH NIXON FOESWASHINGTON, Dec. 16  Vice President Agnew met secretly in New York yesterday with two leaders of the rightwing Republican group that is searching for a candidate to oppose President Nixon in next year's primary elections.

title: French Launch Rocket
description: KOUROU, French Guiana, Dec. 16 (Reuters)The French space center launched a Veronique 71 rocket today, its last launching of the year. In the last six months 25 launchings have been made from the Kourou center and the Soviet research ship Professor Subov in a joint program.

title: WALKOUT IS ENDED BY STEAMFITTERS
description: Steamfitters and other construction workers at the World Trade Center returned to work yesterday, ending a fiveday strike.

title: Penn Central Meeting Off
description: Officials of the Penn Central Company said that the company's onagain, offagain annual meeting scheduled for today will again be adjourned pending approval of additional proxy information. The delay is one of a monthlong series. Officials of the carrier indicated it may be January before the meeting is actually held.

title: Two Americans Killed In Combat Last Week
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, Dec. 16 (AP)The United States command announced today that two Americans were killed in action in Vietnam last week, equaling the lowest official weekly toll in nearly seven years.

title: W. BARTON LEACH, A LAW PROFESSOR
description: CAMBRIDGE, Mass., Dec. 16  Prof. W. Barton Leach of the Harvard University Law School, en authority on property law and estate planning, died yesterday at the Waltham Hospital. He was 71 years old and lived in Weston.

title: What Innate Goodness?
description: Dr. Harvey Cox stated in his Dec. OpEd article that if the ordinary Americans knew what was going on in Cambodia, Laos and Vietnam, they would be as outraged and shocked as they were over Mylai.

title: Article 2  No Title
description: MILWAUKEE, Dec. 16Richard D. Cudahy announced today that he and other key members of the Wisconsin Proxmire for President Committee were endorsing Senator Muskie now that Senator William Proxmire, Democrat of Wisconsin, had dropped out of the race.

title: CONCERN ON P.O.W.'S VOICED BY RED CROSS
description: UNITED NATIONS, N. Y., Dec. 16India and Pakistan are being pressed by the International Red Cross to give assurances that they will observe the Geneva conventions.

title: Store Sales Increase
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 16 The Department of Commerce reported today that retail store sales for the week ended Dec. 11 were an estimated $9,344,000,000, an increase of 9 per cent from the $8,547,000,000 sales for the corresponding week last year. Total department store sales for the week were an estimated $1,502,000,000, an increase of 10 per cent above the $1.37billion sales for the corresponding period last year.

title: Aides to M'Closkey Say Muskie's Staff Edited Radio Tape
description: CONCORD, N.H., Dec. 16 (UPI),  Aicles to Representative Paul N. McCloskey said today that staff of Senator Edmund S. Muskie had edited a radio tape to make a favorable comment sound like an endorsement.

title: House Panel Rebuffs Nixon and Supports Senate on Stiff Water Pollution Bill
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 16The House Committee on Public Works delivered a setback to the Nixon Administration today by approving a water pollution control bill that, in its essentials, followed the legislation unanimously passed by the Senate last month.

title: Prof. Antoine Lacassagne, Cancer Researcher, Dead
description: PARIS, Dec. 16  Prof. Antoine Lacassagne, an internationally known pioneer in cancer research, committed suicide here last night by jumping from a window of his sixthfloor apartment. His age was 87. He had told friends he would take his life once he felt his mental powers were failing.

title: FIREDUP PISTONS TRIUMPH, 107101
description: DETROIT, Dec. 16 (AP) Jimmy Walker, a guardreportedly among the Detroit Pistons under fire earlier in the day for preferring to party instead of playled a finalperiod flurry tonight that beat the Cincinnati Royals 107101 in a National Basketball Association game.

title: Monthly Record Set For Housing Starts
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 16  Home building reached a monthly high in November, practically insuring that 1971 will be a record year, George Romney, Secretary of Housing and Urban Development, announced today at an odd, hastily called news conference.

title: Paine, Webber Arranges To Acquire Abacus Fund
description: Paine, Webber, Jackson & Curtis, Inc., one of the nation's largest investment banking and brokerage concerns, and the Abacus Fund, Inc., a closedend investment company, announced yesterday that they had agreed to merge.

title: CONGRESS BREAKS FOREIGN AID JAM; SEEKS TO AMON
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 16  Congress apparently broke today the impasse on foreign aid legislation that has been holding up adjournment as the House unexpectedly met Senate demands for a vote on an amendment on Vietnam troop withdrawal.

title: KNICKS, NETS FACE PROFITABLE NIGHT
description: Both the Knicks and the Nets, New York's two professional basketball teams, will be matched with weak opposition tonight and both are hopeful of using the opportunity to make progress in their divisional standings.

title: OFFICER OUSTED BY PEROT IS SUING
description: Edmond du Pont, former chairman of F. I. duPont Glore Forgan & Co., filed a suit in Federal District Court here yesterday in which he charged that H. Ross Perot and various associate had acted wrongfully in acquiring control of the large brokerage house.

title: Mrs. Gandhi Writes President: U.S. Could Have Averted War
description: NEW DELHI, Dec. 16Prime Minister Indira Gandhi has written to President Nixon, in a letter released today, that the war between India and Pakistan could have been avoided if the United States had used its power, influence and authority to achieve a political solution to the crisis in East Pakistan.

title: ANACONDA FAVORS U.S. AIR STANDARD
description: HELENA, Mont., Dec. 16A hearing this week before the State Board of Health on a request to lower Montana's strict sulphur emission standards drew a capacity crowd of 450 spectators and witnesses. The majority emphatically opposed the industrysought change.

title: Lindsay and Troy at Yule Party Catch a Bit of Spirit of Goodwill
description: Mayor Lindsay exchanged perfunctory greetings with Councilman Matthew J. Troy Jr., the Queens Democratic leader, at the annual City CouncilCity Hall reporters Christmas party last night at Antun's Restaurant in Queens.

title: $165,461 WAGERED ON SUPERFECTA FOR OTB TELECAST
description: Offtrack betting's No 1 story, yesterday was a 16word message that read:

title: Goldsmith Bros. Elects
description: Goldsmith Bros., stationers, announced yesterday the election of John K. Wetzel as president and as director. He had been executive vice president. James E. Keenan, previously controller, was elected treasurer.

title: RICHARD S. BONOFF
description: Richard S. Bonoff, president of General Linen Supply and Laundry Company, Inc., 835 Myrtle Avenue, Brooklyn, died Wednesday in Presbyterian Hospital after a heart attack. He was 48 years old and lived at 175 East 62d Street, and in Milford, Pa.

title: News of Skiing
description: FRANCONIA, N. H., Dec. 16Bill Norton, the enterprising manager of the stateowned Cannon Mountain, appears to be holding a pat hand. He believes his area will boast some of the best ski conditions in the east this weekend. I like to think I played it smart, he said this afternoon. When New England was hit by its one big storm of the season last Thanksgiving, I kept the upper part of my mountain closed. And, it's still closed.

title: Temperature,at 63, Breaks a Record Set 80 Years Ago
description: June Is Bustin Out All Over seemed more appropriate to the season than Jingle Bells yesterday as the temperature reached a record high of 63 degrees.

title: Head of Joint Chiefs Authorized to Act Alone in Emergencies
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 16 The Defense Department issued a new directive today aimed at improving the nation's worldwide command communications system and making it more responsibe in fastbreaking crisis situations.

title: No Relief in Sight for One Giant Back
description: Now that his brotherinlaw, Bobby Duhon, is out of action with damaged cartilage in the left knee, Tucker Frederickson reigns as the New York Giants leading abletoplay rusher. But he doesn't consider it an appropriate ending for a lessthansatisfactory year.

title: Marland Indicates Nixon Plans Increase in Federal School Aid
Monetary Parley
description: The Group of Ten assembles in Washington today for one more effort to resolve the international monetary crisis. Hopes for a speedy settlement have risen sharply since the Azores meeting earlier this week, after which President Nixon and President Pompidou said they had reached broad agreement on a prompt realignment currencies.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: Recently you pleaded Give me the liberty to know . . . above all other liberties. . . As you have given space in so many editorials and articles this month to attacks on the recent moves to dispense with sanctions against Rhodesia, and as an AngloRhodesian agreement has now been announced, perhaps it is appropriate to present the antisanotions argument.

title: Drain Cover Kills Man, 60; Outside Macy's in Queens
description: A 60yearold man walking in the Christmas shopping crowd outside Macy's department store in Rego Park, Queens, was killed instantly yesterday when he was struck on the head by a 20pound castiron drain cover that the police said had been thrown either from the store's roof or from one of the three levels of its parking facility.

title: FUNDS RELEASED FOR MENTAL CARE
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 16  The Nixon Administration has approved spending about $56million appropriated for mental health programs that proponents of these programs had feared would never be released.

title: Trading in Wheat Futures Is Limited in Chicago
description: In order to maintain the orderly liquidation of the December, 1971, wheat futures, the Chicago Board of Trade yesterday limited trading m those futures to liquidation purposes only. They were still deliberatling late yesterday afternoon whether to continue the limited trading today.

title: Rangers, Rocked by FourGoal Burst In First Period, Bow to Bruins, 8 to 1
description: BOSTON, Dec. 16The New York Rangers dropped in on one of the older National Hockey League teams in the Boston Garden tonight and the thud was felt all the way to Madison Square Garden.

title: Advertising:
description: The Dictaphone Corporation is pulling together all of its advertising needs and putting them in one basketScali, McCabe, Slovesas of Feb. 1. The client says it will be spending from $1million to $1.5million for advertising in the coming year.

title: 2 Primaries in Week Peril Muskie's Hopes
description: MIAMI, Dec. 16At a meeting in Jacksonville a few days ago, Senator Edmund S. Muskie was told repeatedly that he must spend more time in Florida than he currently plans if he seriously hopes to win the state's March 14 primary.

title: Filion Tops Hickok Poll
description: The Hickok professional athlete of the month poll for November was topped by the harnessracing driver, Herve Filion, who drove his 500th winner of the year during the month.

title: 5 Members Demand Azores Pact Go to the Senate
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 16  Five prominent Senators demanded today that the Nixon Administration seek Senate approval of a recent agreement under which economic aid would be given to Portugal in return for continued United States use of military bases in the Azores.

title: Rehabilitation Leader in Newark Among 55 Seized in Drug Raids
description: NEWARK, Dec. 16  The head of a drug rehabilitation program that operated out of the office of Mayor Kenneth A. Gibson was among 55 persons suspected of dealing in narcotics arrested today in a series of raids in the city and seven suburban towns.

title: WASTE PACT DUE IN WESTCHESTER
description: WHITE PLAINS, Dec. 16 The Westchester County Board of Legislators authorized the county today to contract with the state for shipping the county's solid waste upstate for the next 20 years.

title: Pay Board Relaxes its Rule on Raises
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 16 (UPI) The Pay Board adopted today rules that, under certain circumstances, would allow wage increases of up to 7 per cent a year, in excess of its general guideline of 5.5 per cent.

title: ' Garden of the Finzi Continis'
description: The garden of the Finzi Continis, owned by a rich, intellectual Jewish-Italian family, is a sylvan sanctuary in the ducal town of Ferrara in 1938. Outside its walls, the good gentile citizens of Ferrara parade Fascist banners and slogans and prepare for war, but these things are barely acknowledged by the Finzi Continis, who have their gardens and woods, a huge main house, a smaller but still imposing summer lodge, and a private tennis court.When the tennis club, observing Mussolini's new anti-Semitic laws, drops the Finzi Continis from its rolls, Micol Finzi Contini (Dominique Sanda) and her brother, Alberto (Helmut Berger), make a tentative gesture towards ending their aristocratic isolation. They invite friendsgentiles as well as Jewishinto their sanctuary to play tennis on long, lovely, hot summer afternoons. Micol is paid romantic court by Giorgio (Lino Capolicchio), the narrator of the film, a nice young Jewish boy, but she has midnight assignations with Malnate, a gentile whom she can never marry.There are no commitments in such liaisons, and although Micol and Alberto are fond of their friends, they are different from them, even from their Jewish friends. They are aware of something that is apparent to no one else. They are dying but will do nothing about it."The Garden of the Finzi Continis," adapted from Giorgio Bassani's highly regarded novol (which I have not read), is certainly the best film that Vittorio De Sica has made in years, but the shabby habits he acquired when directing such things as "Sunflower" and "A Place for Lovers" keep intruding upon this new, much more ambitious work to render it less affecting than it has every right to be.Mr. De Sica's way with end-of-an-era romance is to shoot almost everything in soft focus, as if he didn't trust the validity of the emotions in what seems to be a perfectly decent screenplay. The film's mood of impending doom is not discovered by the viewer, but imposed on him, by a syrupy musical score and by a camera that keeps panning to and from the sky, and shots of the sun, seen through the same sort of treetops that hover over the actors in the world of Newport cigarettes.This is particularly frustrating because it has the effect of constantly reducing and denying the complexities of the characters and the performances. One suspects that Miss Sanda's Micol is a very special personwise, sensuous and possessed with some kind of awful foresightyet, in the context of popular movie fiction, she seems simply willful and cruel. Whan the movie means to hint, as it does that Micol and Alberto are something more than just fond siblings, it does so with such bluntness that any ambiguity seems merely arbitrary story-telling.All of the other major performances are similarly reduced in dimensionHelmut Berger's tubercular Alberto, who is literally dying; Fabio Testi's Malnate, a gentile as doomed as the Finzi Continis, and Lino Capolicchio's Giorgio, through whose eyes we watch the downfall of the Finzi Continis, aristocrats fatally anesthetized against the realities of the world around them."The Garden of the Finzi Continis," which opened yesterday at the Plaza Theater, is a very melanoholy movie, but its sentiments are essentially those contained on Micol's 78 r.p.m. recording of Tommy Dorsey's "Getting Sentimental Over You." They are prettily expressed but not profoundly moving.

title: EXPANSION PLANS LISTED BY PENNEY
description: The J. C. Penney Company, Inc., one of the nation's largest chainstore organizations, would increase its domestic store space by almost 7 million square feet during the 1972 fiscal year starting Jan. 30.

title: India Denies Charge
description: NEW DELHI, Dec. 16 (Reuters)India today rejected as totally without foundation a Chinese accusation that Indian armed personnel had intruded into Chinese territory along the border with Sikkim.

title: Statements by Mrs. Gandhi on Truce and Surrender
description: NEW DELHI, Dec. 16 (UPI) Following are the texts of a statement issued today by Prime Minister Indira Gandhi on the ceasefire on the western front and of her announcement in Parliament on the Pakistani surrender in the East:

title: 480522 Wins in Jersey
description: VOORHEES, N. J. (UPI)The winning number in this week's New Jersey State Lottery is 480522. The number was chosen today in a drawing at Echelon Mall in this Camden County community.

title: Agnew Lights Yule Tree
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 16 (UPI)Vice President Agnew lighted the national Christmas tree tonight. About 10,000 persons gathered on the Ellipse, south of the White House, to watch the ceremony.

title: Garagiola Swears. Taping Commercial And It Goes on Air
description: Joe Garagiola, the St. Louis Cardinals baseball catcher turned TV performer, blew his lines taping a television commercial, cursed and, through a technical error, the strong language went on the air yesterday.

title: DR. ROBERT M'CUNE, A SURGEON HERE, 47
description: Dr. Robert M. McCune, a member of the staff of the New York HospitalCornell Medical Center since 1949, died on Wednesday. He was 47 years old and lived at 445 East 68th Street.

title: 2 See Gallocher Post 71 For Lead in Morocco Golf
description: RABAT, Morocco, Dec. 16 (AP) Bernard Gallacher, watched by a gallery of two, took onestroke lead today in the first round of the first Morocco golf Grand Prix tournament. The 22yearold Scottish Ryder Cup player, with a 71, and Jean Garaialde of France, with a 72, were the only players in the 25man international field to better par 73 on the new 7,501yard Royal Rabat course nearly void of spectators and barren of television cameras.

title: Powell and Rehnquist To Take Oath Jan. 7
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 16 (AP)Lewis F. Powell Jr. of Virginia and William H. Rehnquist of Arizona will be sworn in as Supreme Court Justices Jan. 7.

title: FORDHAM VICTOR OVER CITY, 9071
description: Riding on Kenny Charles's careerhigh of 28 points, the Fordham Rams coasted to their fifth straight victory by defeating City College, 9071, last night in Rose Hill gym.

title: MULLIGAN IS GIVEN THREEYEAR TERM
description: Hugh Mulligan, described by lawenforcement officials as a major bookmaker and a key corrupter of policemen, was sentenced yesterday to three years in prison on 12 counts of criminal contempt.

title: Statement by Bethlehem
description: Bethlehem Steel, the nation's secondlargest steehnaker, said yesterday that its price increases on sheet and strip products, which were announced on Aug. 2, would become effective Jan. 1, except for increases on coldrolled sheet products, which become effective Feb. 1.

title: Stage: Two Iphigenias for Festival
description: The Wedding of Iphigenia plus Iphigenia in Concert, which opened last night at the New York Shakespeare Festival Public Theater, is wrongheaded. But the wrong head is not at all bad looking.

title: Seamans Says BuildUp At Hanoi Suggests Push
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 16  Secretary of the Air Force Robert C. Seamans Jr. said today that United States aircraft have observed a buildup of Sovietmade and Chinesemade transport trucks around Hanoi and Haiphong.

title: Who Won in India?
description: UNITED NATIONS, N. Y., Dec. 16 India has won the battle for East Pakistan, but in the larger perspectives of world politics, this is not the main thing. For the Soviet Union has emerged from this avoidable and tragic conflict as the military arsenal and political defender of India, with access for Moscow's rising naval power to the Indian Ocean, and base of political and military operations on China's southern flank.

title: GENERAL MULCAHY OF IRISH REVOLUTION
description: DUBLIN, Dec. 16Gen. Richard Mulcahy, a prominent Irish leader in the war of independence against Britain from 1916 to 1921, died here, today. He was 86 years old.

title: Foster Stops Kelly in 3d to Retain Title
description: OKLAHOMA CITY, Dec. 16 (AP)Bob Foster scored a technical knockout over Brian Kelly, a 23yearold Cushing, Okla., youth director, with 1:56 elapsed in the third round tonight to successfully defend his version of the lightheavyweight championship.

title: A Fish Swallower Aids the Neediest
BILLS ON PENSIONS TIED UP IN ALBANY
description: ALBANY, Dec. 16  Leaders of the Legislature said today that there was little likelihood of action in the new session on a jam of controversial pension bills that were placed in limbo in the last session.

title: President Named by SCM To Replace Mead as Chief
description: Emerson E. Mead disclosed yesterday his resignation as the president, chairman and chief executive officer of the SCM Corporation, effective Jan. I. The company's board announced the election of Paul H. Elicker as president and chief executive officer. The post of chairman will remain vacant.

title: The Meaning of Brown Eggs
description: LONDONHere in England most of us, all ages, prefer brown eggs to white eggs. In America, brown eggs are despised, sold off cheaply, perhaps sometimes thrown away. Can any sense be made out of this queer difference in taster I believe it can. But will it take us anywhere? Yes, I believe it will. Not only that behavioral sciences, please noteit will move us almost at once from the visible world of white eggs and brown eggs into the vast invisible realm where our lives are shaped.

title: Walsh at Hearing: Forgot Graft Report
description: Former First Deputy Police Commissioner John F. Walsh admitted in sworn testimony yesterday that he had received a report of widespread police corruption in the Bronx at least six months before any police investigation was begun.

title: DACCA CAPTURED
description: NEW DELHI, Dec. 16India today ordered a complete ceasefire in the war with Pakistan after seizing Dacca, the East Pakistani capital, and accepting the surrender of Pakistan's forces there.

title: Patrolmn and Brother Cleared Of Attempted Extortion in Bronx
description: Patrolman Daniel L. Love and his brother Nathaniel W., an employe of the Narcotics Addiction Control Commission, won acquittal yesterday on all counts of an indictment for attempted extortion and related offenses.

title: He's the Legal Guardian for the Fetuses About to Be Aborted
description: Robert M. Byrn, who proudly says that ho is probably New York's No.1 foe of abortion, is an Irishman with en easy smile who keeps right on smiling even when he hears for the umpteenth time an innuendoladen description of himself: A 40yearold bachelor Catholic law professor.

title: Dollars Acquired Heavily By Foreign Central Banks
description: Foreign central banks continued to acquire huge amounts of dollars during the week ended Wednesday they attempted to arrest the decline of the United States dollar in foreign exchange markets to protect their countries' trade positions.

title: Special Bus Lane to Tunnel to Be Kept
description: The exclusive bus lane on the New Jersey approach to the Lincoln Tunnel, a yearlong experiment, has been adjudged a success and will become a permanent operation.

title: 2 Named to Reserve Board
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 16 (AP)  Secretary of Defense Melvin R. Laird today appointed Maj. Gen. Nicholas P. Kafkalas of the Pennsylvania Army National Guard and Brig Gen. Frederick P. Wenger of the Ohio Air National Guard to threeyear terms on the Reserve Forces Policy Board.

title: The Proceedings In the U.N. Today
Other Indictments Expected In Illinois Race Track Case
description: CHICAGO, Dec. 16 (UPI) The indictments of Judge Otto ICerner of the United States Court of Appeals for the Seventh Circuit and four political associates may be only the opening salvo of grand jury charges against politicians and public figures in an Illinois race track stock scandal, an investigator said today.

title: The Russians on the Nile
description: CAIROPresident Anwar elSadat was surely speaking the truth when he told me Soviet Russia did not want to keep substantial military contingents in Egypt and was continuing to maintain a considerable force here only in response to persistent Egyptian persuasion.

title: LOUIS J. ZWAHL
description: RIDGEWOOD, N. J., Dec. 16 Louis J. Zwahl, who retired in 1966 as a partner in Mabon, Nugent & Co., member of the New York Stock Exchange and other exchanges, died today of a heart attack at Valley Hospital. He was 63 years old and lived at 360 Beechwood Road.

title: REGION'S FUTURUE CALLED UNCERTAIN
description: UNITED NATIONS, N. Y., Dec. 16The future of East Pakistan if it becomes an independent country is politically cloudy and economically uncertain.

title: SENATOR KINTYRE SUPPORTING MUSKIE
description: BEDFORD, N. H., Dec. 16 (AP)Senator Edmund S. Muskie received today the endorsement of Senator Thomas J. McIntyre, Democrat of New Hampshire, for the Democratic Presidential nomination.

title: Wind Loss at $2Mililon
description: CINCINNATI, Dec. 16 (AP)High winds and tornadoes that hit seven states last weekend caused $2million in insured losses, the Insurance Information Institute said today. The winds hit parts of Ohio, Kantucky, Michigan, Arkansas, Missouri, Illinois and Indiana.

title: DECEPTION ON TRIP DENIED BY DOWDY
description: BALTIMORE, Dec. 16 Representative John Dowdy denied today an accusation that he falsified travel vouchers so as to conceal a 1965 trip to Atlanta.

title: HILTZIK, MISS COHEN TAKE SKATING LEADS
Balanced Transportation
description: The principle that you advocate in the recent editorial Testing Transit Theories  that automobile users should subsidize mass transit systems is based on the assumption that mass transit's problems are directly attributable to the automobile and its popularity with the American commuter.

title: JORDANIANS' OFFICE BLASTED IN GENEVA
description: GENEVA, Dec. 16A parcel mailed to the Jordanian Ambassador exploded today in the hall outside Jordan's mission to the United Nations, injuring two policemen and a fireman.

title: Nixon Pledges to Seek Release Of Skipper of Ship Cuba Seized
description: KEY BISCAYNE, Fla., Dec. 16  President Nixon pledged today that he would do what he could to seek the release of Jose Villa, the captain of a Miamibased freighter attacked by a Cuban gunboat and seized yesterday in the Bahamas.

title: U.S. F4 Downed at Pnompenh; 2 Cambodian Units Surrounded
description: PNOMPENH, Cambodia, Dec. 16 (AP)A United States Air Force fighterbomber crashed within sight of Pnompenh today while supporting Cambodian troops. Military sources said, that the plane had been hit by enemy ground fire.

title: CHINESE CHARGE INDIAN INCURSION
description: HONG KONG, Dec. 16 China, in a formal Government statement today on the IndianPakistani war, predicted a turbulent future for India. At the same time, the Chinese pointed toward a possible trouble zone by filing a strong protest in New Delhi over alleged Indian incursions from Sikkim into Tibet.

title: HipPocket Management
description: This merry chronicle of the Penn Central from merger to bankruptcy kept reminding me of Tom Stoppard's Rosencrantz and Guildenstern Are Dead. All the leading actors in this charade, as well as those with only walkon roles, thought they made up the main event, but they really turned out to be part of the sideshow. The real show was in the steady, doomlike, relentless attrition of the Penn Central that eventually brought the great enterprise to bankruptcy. Those in charge helped her get there a lot faster, but in a sense the line was wrecked before we turn to the first page. What this study does is chart the way those railroad men found out what they were doing.

title: Patient Army Judge in Mylai Case Peter Stanislaus Wondolowski
description: FORT MEADE, Md., Dec. 16For almost four months now, Col. Peter Stanislaus Wondolowski, employing a judicious mixture of wisdom, patience and humor, has kept the courtmartial of Col. Oran K. Henderson moving steadily toward a verdict.

title: GLAMOUR ISSUES LEAD STOCK RISE
description: The stock market's yearend rally for 1971 continued to boom yesterday with glamour issues setting the pace and many blue chips moving up more modestly.

title: Market Bid Gains in Denmark
description: COPENHAGEN, Denmark, Dec. 16 (Reuters)The Danish Parliament tonight voted overwhelmingly in favor of Denmark's membership in the European Common Market. The Parliament will vote again on ratification in May and then the issue will go to a binding referendum by the electorate.

title: Feldman, 39, Named Baylor Football Coach
description: WACO, Tex., Dec. 16 (AP)  Rudy Feldman, 39 years old, head coach at the University of New Mexico, was selected today as head football coach at Baylor, succeeding Bill Beall, whose contract was terminated after his third losing season.

title: Estimate Board Postpones Plan on Hotel for Aged
description: The Lindsay administration failed yesterday to obtain vote on a plan to condemn West Side hotel and use it predominantly for housing for the elderly.

title: Executive Changes
description: The Mead Corporation announced yesterday the election of James W. McSwiney as chairman and chief executive officer. Paul V. Allemang succeeds Mr. McSwiney as president, a position he held since 1968. The company also elected William W. Wommeek as vice chairman and as the officer in charge of strategy. Mr. Allemang, like Mr. Wommack, was previously an executive vice president. He will be the officer in charge of operations. The position of chairman had been vacant since the retirement in 1968 of Howard E. Whitaker.

title: A. T. &T.'s Earnings Rise;
description: The American Telephone and Telegraph Company reported yesterday higher operating revenues and earnings for the three and 12 months ended Nov. 30. However, share earnings in the quarter dropped by 1 cent because of the company's initial preferred dividend requirement amounting to $27.5million.

title: Serpico a Live Grenade to Top Officers
description: By the time the Knapp Commission corruption hearings had recessed for the day yesterday, it was clear that to the Police Department's Old Guard, Detective Frank Serpico fit the description by a commission investigator: He was a live hand grenade.

title: Harvester Sales at Peak
description: The International Harvester Company, the world's largest producer of farm equipment and the nation's second biggest manufacturer of trucks, exceeded $3billion in sales for the first time in its fiscal year ended Oct. 31.

title: SUSPECT INDICTED IN KILLING OF FIVE
description: ELIZABETH, N. J., Dec. 16 A Union County grand jury today indicted John E. List, a 46yearold accountant, on charges of having murdered with premeditation his mother, wife and three children last Nov. 9 in the family, home in Westfield.

title: WEST TO FIGHT ON
description: RAWALPINDI, Pakistan, Dec. 16President Agha Mohammad Yahya Khan acknowledged tonight that his forces in East Pakistan had been overwhelmed but pledged to continue the war against India until final victory.

title: G.I. INSURANCE BILL IS SIGNED BY NIXON
description: KEY BISCAYNE, Fla., Dec. 16President Nixon signed into law today a bill to permit holders of National Service Life, Insurance policies to use their dividends to purchase additional paidup insurance.

title: Soviet Pledges to Back Egypt in War or Peace
description: CAIRO, Dec. 16The Soviet Ambassador to Egypt, Vladimir M. Vinogradov, stressed in a meeting with Egyptian journalists today that the Soviet Union would back the Egyptians in whatever action they chose to seek recovery of the territory occupied by Israel in 1967.

title: The Surrender Document
description: NEW DELHI, Dec. 16Following is the text of the instrument of surrender signed today by the Pakistani and Indian commanders in East Pakistan:

title: Prof. Robert Le Bidois, 74, Authority on Good French
description: PARIS, Dec. 16Robert Le Bidois, a top authority on what is good French and what isn't, died here last night at the age of 74.

title: Marinaro Voted No. 1 By Maxwell Selectors
description: PHILADELPHIA, Dec. 16 (AP)Ed Marinaro of Cornell was named the top college football player of 1971 and the Dallas quarterback, Roger Staubach, was chosen the outstanding pro today by the Maxwell Football Club.

title: Malle Documentary Calcutta Opens at New Yorker
description: To its great credit, the passage of time has not noticeably affected Calcutta, which was filmed early in 1968 by the French director Louis Malle with the assistance of just a cameraman and sound technician. It is still that rarity, a provocative, largely objective documentary that is forcefully effective without striving for editorial conclusions.

title: Text of Yahya's Address to the Nation
description: UNITED NATIONS, N. Y., Dec. 16Following is the text of a broadcast today by President Agha Mohammad Yahya Khan in a translation by the Pakistan mission at the United Nations:

title: In Triumph, He Sets Mark at Philharmonic
TopsyTurvy Welfare Bill
description: For more than two years the Senate has been finding one excuse after another for failing to join the Administration and the House in support of a program for genuine welfare reform. Now the overriding priority on Capitol Hill for clearing the calendar and getting away for Christmas has enabled Senate conservatives to rush through a bill that seems plainly intended to make more dubious than ever the chances for mustering a majority in favor of meaningful reform.

title: Time to Talk
description: Shortly before the surrender of the Pakistani forces in Dacca, capital of emerging Bangladesh, the commander of Indian forces in the eastern region said the West Pakistani troops: They are very gallant fighters with good discipline. But there is no hope for them. The people are against them.

title: TENNESSEE BEGINS INQUIRY ON BONDS
description: NASHVILLE, Dec. 16 (AP) A joint HouseSenate subcommittee of the Tennessee Legislature has begun an investigation into complaints of unethical dealers in municipal bonds in Tennessee, particularly in Memphis.

title: DEADLOCK IN ITALY ON PRESIDENT HOLDS
description: ROME, Dec. 16A continuing deadlock in the 1,008member electoral college, on the eighth day of its laborious attempts to decide on Italy's sixth president, led today to the cancellation of a scheduled evening ballot and to a flare of temper in a voting session.

title: EQUITY FINANCING
description: Iroquois Industries, Inc., sold 200,000 common shares and stockholders an additional 225,000 in an offering at $20 by an Eastman Dillon, Union Securities underwriting group. The Greenwich, Conn.based company makes and markets vitamins and health food supplements.

title: City Speeds Repair On Garbage Trucks
description: Sanitation Department officials here believe they are on the way to solving one of their most persistent problemsthe inordinate number of collection trucks awaiting repairs in the department's shops.

title: 1972 BLACK DRIVE FOR NIXON MAPPED
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 16 The White House is organizing black Republicans who hold high state office into a political propaganda network to help sell President Nixon's civil rights record to the voters in 1972.

title: A Landmark Restaurant Is Reopened in Harlem
description: Eight months ago Frank's Restaurant was closed for alterations, and many of its patrons were resigned to the thought that they would never see the inside of it again.

description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 16 Freight traffic on United States railroads during the week ended Dec. 11 was considerably above the volume in the corresponding week of last year. Intercity truck tonnage in the same period also registered an increase.

title: SYDNEY TO GO AHEAD WITH F111 PURCHASE
description: SYDNEY, Australia, Dec. 16 The Australian Government announced today its decision to go ahead with the purchase of 24 F111C fighterbombers ordered from the United States eight years ago.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: Dance Workshop and Church Offer 2 Choreographers Work
description: Dance Theater Workshop and the Washington Square Methodist Church presented dance works by Tina Croll and Jan Van Dyke Wednesday night at the church, 133 West Fourth Street.

description: STANFORDVILLE, N. Y., Dec. 16Arthur Stout, a Dutchess County newspaperman and real estate broker, died Monday in Sharon (Conn.) Hospital. His age was 76.
