description: FORT MEADE, Md., Dec. 16  The case of Col. Oran K. Henderson went to a jury of two generals and five colonels this afternoon in the last courtmartial to arise from the slaying of South Vietnamese civilians by American troops at Mylai 4.

title: Bridge: Three TopSeeded Teams Win In Quarter Finals at Las Vegas
description: LAS VEGAS, Nev., Dec. 16  Three of the four top seeded teams survived hard struggles in the quarterfinal stage of the Open Knockout Team Championship hero today.

title: PreHoliday Duck Filled With Fruit
description: In the menus below, the dishes marked with an asterisk are followed by a recipe.

title: Forest Hills Meeting Boycotted
description: Several Jewish organizations declared yesterday that they would not attend a meeting called for today by Mayor Lindsay to discuss the controversial lowincome housing project for the Forest Hills section of Queens.

title: 2 Australians Plead Guilty In $560,000 Airliner Hoax
description: SYDNEY Australia, Dec. 16 (AP)  Two men pleaded guilty today to extorting $560,000 from Qantas Airlines in a bomb hoax based on the movie Doomsday Flight. The two, Peter Pasquale Macari, 36, years old, and Raymond James Pynting, 28, were held for sentencing, but no date was set.

title: Health Aides Back Curbs on Inflation But See Dangers
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 16  Doctors and hospital officials were generally sympathetic today to the Government's new health care guidelines, but many warned that applying them might be difficult and harmful.

title: F. HAMILTON PECK, A FAWCETT EDITOR
description: F. Hamilton Peck, who retired some years ago as an editor of Fawcett Publications, died yesterday in St. Luke's Hospital after a brief illness. He was 72 years old and lived at 915 West End Avenue.

title: Nixon Is Brought Into Dispute on Background Briefings of Press
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 16  President Nixon was brought today into the controversy over whether newsmen should report information and points of view supplied by officials on other than an ontherecord basis.

title: Perils of Life Along Venice's Grand Canal
description: The trouble with being the owner of dozens of fine paintings is that other people will often go to great lengths, such as stealing, to own them.

title: 3 Men Save Mother, 23, From River
description: A Secret Service agent, a window washer and a patrolman plunged into the swift current of the East River yesterday and saved a young woman who had jumped in after leaving her 3yearold daughter on shore.

title: Agency Will Insure U.S. Expropriations
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 16 The Overseas Private Investment Corporation announced today a reinsurance agreement with Lloyds of London under which Lloyds will pay a minority share of valid insurance claims in cases where American investments are expropriated without compensation in lessdeveloped countries.

title: TRADETALK STAND ADOPTED BY E.E.C.
description: BRUSSELS, Dec. 16  The six permanent representatives of the European Economic Community approved today a negotiating mandate for trade talks that the United States wants to accompany an international monetary settlement.

title: Firemen, at Noisy Session, Vote for Mail Poll on Pact
description: City firemen voted at a nosiy, unruly meeting yesterday to poll the entire membership of their union by mail on a proposed contract that would increase their annual pay to $14,300 in the final stage of a 30month agreement.

title: U.S. Instails a Consul General In Berlin, Upgrading Office
description: BERLIN, Dec. 16The United States announced today that it had raised its consulate in West Berlin to the status of consulate general, a move seen as a consequence of the fourpower accord on Berlin.

title: The Impact of Highways
description: The Environmental Defense Fund, flushed with legal victories over less formidable foes, intends now to challenge the $5billion Highway Trust Fund. Since passage of the Environmental Policy Act, proposals for new federally funded roads have generally had to be accompanied in each case by an environmental impact statement, but this was largely a matter of form. And even the rejection of a proposed road meant only the shifting of concrete from one locality in a state to another, such is the lure of available Federal highway dollars.

title: HENRY HEWETSON,75, OF JERSEY STANDARD
description: Henry H. Hewetson, a retired vice president and director of the Standard Oil Company (New Jersey), died yesterday at New York University Hospital after a brief illness. He was 75 years old.

title: Court Halts Sale of Offshore Oil Leases
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 16  Three conservation groups won today a Federal court order halting a scheduled sale of offshore oil and gas leases in the Gulf of Mexico until further arguments were held on pos sible environmental damage.

title: PREY INTERPRETS SCHUBERT CYCLE
description: Schubert's cycle of 20 romantic songs, Die Schne Mllerin, can be interpreted in as many subtly different ways as an incometax law. The poems themselves, by Wilhelm Muller, are so charmingly vapid that tremendous latitude is granted the singer. Since he is seldom tied down to any deeply meaningful point, that also puts a tremendous burden on the interpreter: He must fill the nearly empty cup with his own ideas.

title: U.S. Opposes Moves to Let Nations in O.A.S. Lift Sanctions Against Cubans
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 16  The United States declared opposition today to moves that might permit members of the Organization of American States to act individually to remove sanctions against Cuba.

title: Film: 'The Boy Friend':Twiggy Plays Polly in Russell Screenplay
description: The problem of how to adapt a stage musical to the screen is commonly settled by default. More money, more cast, more orchestra, and locationsand suddenly you should have cinema where before you had theater. In point of fact you usually have nothing, not even an original cast album.Ken Russell doesn't settle things by default, and he understands, perhaps too well, that film is also theater. It follows that his version of Sandy Wilson's 1950's musical about the 1920's, "The Boy Friend," is not so much an adaptation as almost total transformation  honorable transformation, for the most part.The movie concerns a down-at-the-heels British troupe who are doing a musical called "The Boy Friend" somewhere in the provinces, too far from London. One fateful day the leading lady catches her high heel in a trolley track and Polly, the mousey little assistant stage manager, must go on in her place. "You're going out there a youngster; you've got to come back a star," cautions her boss.But Polly is not only shy, and mostly ignorant of her part; she is also desperately, transparently in love with Tony, the leading man. And on her day of torment, who should show up in the stage box but the great talkingpicture director, De Thrill. Of course nobody will play the play; everyone plays for De Thrillexcept Tony, who is too nice, and Polly, who is too simple.I do not wish to spoil anyone's pleasure by giving away the secrets of the plot (whom Tony loves; who finally gets the Hollywood offer; etc.), but you can imagine the pleasure Mr. Russell must have had in filming a musical that takes place onstage, backstage, in Polly's romantic imagination, in the film fantasies of De Thrill, in the eye of the beholder, and of course in the mind of the maker, Mr. Russell  whose meditation on the history of the movie musical from "42nd Street" to "The Bandwagon" (at least) this movie so very largely is.Therefore, "The Boy Friend" contains enough for 20 ordinary movie musicals. There are production numbers within production numbers and styles within stylesbeginning with the stage properties of the poor provincial troupe (which look elaborate enough to bankrupt all of Broadway) and proceeding to the kind of calculated excess in which, for example, one giant phonograph turntable spinning a geometric arrangement of chorus girls suddenly splits, amoeba-like, into two giant turntablesas if the first commandment of cinema were: "Be fruitful all, and multiply."You will say, "Busby Berkeley." But with Mr. Russell, what goes in as Busby Berkeley comes out feeling Venusberg in a road company "Tannhuser"an arrangement that may not be to everyone's taste. I am surprised to find that it is rather greatly to my taste; partly because it is often as witty as it is elaborate, partly because it works its variations on the fully recognizable and still quite wonderful Sandy Wilson words and music, and partly because it is supported by a charming and energetic cast.As the central question in that cast Twiggy succeeds beyond all expectation. She dances well, sings well enough, acts with a natural grace, and offers a face that perfectly resists the sometimes exploitative exaggerations of Mr. Russell's camera.

title: Amex and OTC Advance in Steppedup Trading
description: The American Stock Exchange and the overthecounter market finished higher yesterday in steppedup trading.

title: For an Expanded Methadone Program
description: The epidemic of heroin addiction continues to rage unchecked throughout New York City. Despite an aroused citizenry, heightened official vigor and a thorough airing of many of the known (and speculative) aspects of the narcotics problem, little headway seems to have been made.

title: Market Place: Picking Brokers: Do's and Don'ts
description: If you're convinced the Wall Street blood bath is over and you're casting about for a broker, you may want to reflect a bit on what Don, ald T. Regan had to say about picking a broker the other day.

title: REFUSE CENTERS TO INCREASE HERE
description: The Environmental Action Coalition, which organized the first Earth Day here in 1970, announced yesterday a major new recycling program that would more than double the scrap collection centers and for the first time put them where they are really needed.

title: Job Rights Pledge Made
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 16 (UPI)  Ambac Industries Inc., has agreed to stop discriminating against Negroes and Puerto Ricans in employment at its Springfield, Mass., plant Attorney General John N. Mitchell announced today. A consent decree prohibiting the company from discrimination was entered in United States District Court in Boston to conclude a civil rights suit filed by the Government June 28, 1968.

title: New President Elected By Chock Full O'Nuts
description: Directors of Chock Full O'Nuts Corporation elected Syemour S. Mindel as president, it was announced yesterday by William Black, chairman, who relinquished the office. Mr. Mindel, a vice president and director for the last three years has headed its coffee roasting and marketing activities. He joined the company in 1969 after acquisition of Coffee Instants, Inc., a private label producer of instant and regular coffees that Mr. Mindel founded and managed for 15 years.

title: Light Action at Chup
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, Dec. 16 (AP)  South Vietnamese spokesmen reported today that a 6,000man task force pushing through the Chup rubber plantation in eastern Cambodia had reached the east bank of the Mekong River, diectly across from Kompong Cham.

title: Pay Board Grants Raises To Salvation Army Officers
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 16 (UPI)  The Pay Board ruled yesterday that a $2aweek increase in the allowance of Salvation Army lieutenant would not be inflationary.

title: East Pakistan: In Brief
description: Pakistan's Eastern region, seized by India yesterday support of Bengali secession, is one of the world's most populous, and least prosperous, areas, a vast, humid delta whose more than 70 million inhabitants have a per capita income of only $77 a year.

title: 2 Men at a Table
description: DACCA, Pakistan, Dec. 16 On a broad grassy field in central Dacca known as the Race Course, the Pakistani forces formally surrendered today, 13 days after the Indian Army began its drive into East Pakistan.

title: Text of Prime Minister Gandhi's Letter to President
Fox Board Favors West Coast Move
description: The Twentieth CenturyFox Film Corporation dropped the first shoe yesterday on the longrumored move of its headquarters from New York to the West Coast.

title: Board in Philadelphia Names School Chief
description: PHILADELPHIA, Dec. 16 (AP)The Board of Education unanimously appointed Matthew W. Costanza superintendent of schools today at a salary of $38,000 a year.

title: RUMSFELD DOUBTS APPROVAL OF PACT
description: Donald Rumsfeld, executive director of the Cost of Living Council, commenting yesterday on a pending case before the Pay Board, said that he would be surprised if the contract between the North American Rockwell Corporation and the United Automobile Workers is approved the way it went In.

title: Croatian Capital Is Quiet After 4 Nights of Riots Stirred by Nationalist Resentment Against Belgrade
description: ZAGREB, Yugoslavia, Dec. 16, The downtown streets of this provincial capital were relativuly quiet this evening for the first time this week, following four nights of violent demonstrations by Croatian nationalists, most of them young students.

title: Jones & Laughlin Agrees To Treat Plant Discharges
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 16 (AP)  The Jones & Laughlin Steel Corporation agreed today to install a workable system for treating discharges from its Cleveland plant into the Cuyahoga River.

title: Magazine Chief Heads Red Cross Campaign
description: The appointment of Fred D. Thompson as general chairman for the 1972 fund campaign of the American Red Cross in Greater New York was announced yesterday by James H. Evans, chairman of the executive board.

title: ARTHUR R. FLANNERY, AIDE OF BANKING FIRM
description: JERSEY CITY, Dec. 17 Arthur R. Flannery, a deputy manager of Brown Brothers Harriman & Co., private banking firm, died yesterday of a heart attack at his home, 77 Sanford Plate. He was 62 years old.

title: Security Council Fails to Agree In Session on Thant's Successor
description: UNITED. NATIONS, N.Y. Dec. 17  The Security Council, meeting in a fourhour executive session today, failed to agree in their first attempt to select a new secretary General for the United Nations.

title: Peking Shows Vietcong Film
description: PEKING, Dec. 17 (Reuters) Representatives of diplomatic missions in Peking tonight were shown a film taken by a Vietcong camera team in South Vietnam of guerrillas operating openly in a village only two miles from an American base in the Central Highlands.

title: The Bonus: Alive and Well on Wall St.
description: Yearend bonuses, a tradition in the Wall Street financial community, have not been phased out by Phase Two. The tradition is being observed again this year, though some who reported the fact were a bit reluctant to be identified.

title: Portuguese Aftermath
description: When Representative Charles C. Diggs Jr. of Detroit accepted en appointment as a United States delegate to the United Nations this year he knew he would have to follow instructions. Where he erred was in taking seriously the Administration's rhetoric against apartheid and white minority rule in southern Africa, as well as its promises to consult members of the delegation in advance about positions to be taken in the General Assembly.

title: It's DogGiving Time  And Also Time for the Buyer to Beware
description: The puppy under the Christmas tree, adorable and frolicsome, perhaps the most appealing gift of all. But beware.

title: FLORIDA OPPOSES ARMY FIVE TODAY
description: Dartmouth and Florida, undefeated basketball teams with three victories each, hope to extend their success during the college doubleheader at Madison Square Garden today. Dartmouth faces Seton Hall in the first game at 1:30 and Florida meets Army in the second game.

Those taking part am Karen Altman, Colette Boky, Gail Robinson, Barbara Shuttleworth, Federica von Stade and Theodor Upptnan.

title: Market Place: Keeping Track Of the Shorts
description: You're sitting out there in portfolio land watching the market go up like a house afire and wondering how long it can continue.

title: Arms Talks to Take Break
description: VIENNA, Dec. 17 (AP)Amerlean and Soviet negotiators at the talks on limitation of strategic arms held a twohour meeting today and agreed on a Christmas break proposed by the United States, a conference source said.

title: Lindsay Asserts a Compromise At Forest Hills Is Impossible
description: The first City Hall meeting of supporters and opponents of the controversial lowincome housing project for Forest Hills, Queens, ended yesterday with Mayor Lindsay saying that compromise was impossible and with the leader of the opposition calling the session a lot of hogwash.

title: CURB ON THE I.R.A. IN SOUTH PLEDGED
description: DUBLIN, Dec. 17Prime Minister John Lynch bitterly criticized the Irish Republican Army tonight and warned that the Irish Republic was preparing to curb the activities of the, underground terrorist organization within its borders.

title: 2 Share Auckland Lead
description: AUCKLAND, New Zealand, Dec. 17 (AP)Guy Wolstenholme of England and Prank Phillips of Australia shared the secondround lead in the $16,860 City of Auckland golf championship today at 135.

title: BLUES TO OPPOSE RANGERS TONIGHT
description: The St. Louis Blues have lost three straight games and have been without a victory in their last five. It is a situation not conducive to the wellbeing of the New York Rangers.

title: Mujib's Family Rescued
description: NEW DELHI, Dec. 17 (Reuters)AllIndia Radio reported that Sheik Mujibur Rahman's wife and two daughters had been rescued in Dacca today by a squad of Indian soldiers.

title: Suns Rout Pistons, 123102
description: PHOENIX, Ariz., Dec. 17 (UPI)The Phoenix Suns, with five players scoring in double figures, trounced the Detroit Pistons, 123102, tonight. Dick Van Arsdale led the Suns with 26 points. Clem Haskins and Neal Walk scored 20 apiece.

title: A Benign Bond:007 Stars in 'Diamonds Are Forever'
description: "Diamonds Are Forever," the eighth James Bond movie, the seventh to be produced by Albert R. Broccoli and Harry Saltzman, and the sixth to star Sean Connery, is a nostalgic journey down memory laneby jet, by helicopter, by hearse, by moon machine, and by bare foot across deep-pile rugs to king-sized beds in hotel rooms as big as Nevada.A lot of things have changed since "You Only Live Twice" (1967), the last real Bond adventure, but 007 has remained a steadfast agent for the military-industrial complex, a friend to the C.I.A. and a triumphant sexist. It's enough to make one weepy with gratitude. I mean, not everything must be mutable."Diamonds Are Forever" is also great, absurd fun, not only because it recalls the moods and manners of the sixties (which, being over, now seem safely comprehensible), but also because all of the people connected with the movie obviously know what they are up to.This includes Mr. Connery, who must reconcile himself to the fact that nothing becomes him as much as the character he wanted to leave; Guy Hamilton, the director, whose "Goldfinger" was the best of the earlier Bonds; Richard Maibaum and Tom Mankiewicz, who know exactly when a screenplay should make sense and when it's a waste of time, and Maurice Bender, the designer of the main titles that so brilliantly reflect the make-belive violence, vulgarity and humor of the film that follows.The story, which may or may not have much to do with Ian Fleming's novel published here in 1956, begins as a conventional diamond smuggling caper but quickly evolves into another one of the positively immortal Blofeld's schemes to dominate the world, this time by something that I can only describe as a death-ray-carrying, diamond-encrusted sputnik.The locales shift from London to South Africa to Amsterdam, before more or less settling down in Las Vegas, which, with its disposable facades, its arbitrary payoffs, its magnificent assortment of available women, and its implication that this is civilization's end, is the perfect setting for the kind of doomsdays that always threaten Bond's world.In addition to several Blofelds (all played by Charles Gray), the characters include a nice little old lady named Mrs. Whistler, who teaches school to South Africans when she is not smuggling diamonds to Europe; two gentle gunmen, who are fond of their jobs (and in love with each other); a mysterious Las Vegas millionaire named Willard Whyte (played by Jimmy Dean); a couple of butch beauties named Thumper and Bambi, and Lana Wood and Jill St. John, as the two principal women in James's life.The movie's momentum is such that one never has much time to react to its lack of reason, only to its sensations of speed and narrow escape, and to the splendor of its crazy gadgets and dcor. It may be that I've become jaded, or that I've forgotten the details of all but the last (and worst) Bond film ("On His Majesty's Secret Service," which featured a vivid sequence in which a man got chopped up by the blades of a snow-removal machine), but "Diamonds Are Forever" does seem comparatively benign. I'd almost call it a movie to play hookey for.It opened yesterday at the DeMille and other theaters around town.

title: West Coast Dockers Reject Contract
description: SAN FRANCISCO, Dec. 17 (UPI)The National Labor Relations Board said today that West Coast longshoremen had overwhelmingly rejected a final offer from employers, setting the stage for resumption of their dock strike early In 1972.

title: A JUDGESHIP BID LINKED TO LINDSAY
description: The president of a Brooklyn Reform Democratic club said yesterday that high Lindsay administration officials had promised him a Criminal Court judgeship 11 months ago if he linedup proLindsay delegates to the 1972 Democratic National Conventional.

title: Boston Museum Aide Quits in Dispute
description: In the wake of an incident involving the alleged smuggling of a painting from Italy to the United States, Perry T. Rathbone, director of the Boston Museum of Fine Arts, has announced his plans for retirement in order to write and pursue independent research.

title: Nathan Sachs of Glemby, Beauty Salon Operators
description: Nathan Sachs, senior vice president of the Glemby Company, Inc., international concessionnaires of beauty salons in department and specialty stores, died Wednesday of a heart attack at his winter home in Palm Beach, Fla. He was 74 years old.

title: CONGRESS PASSES EXTENSION OF AID; ADJOURNS SESSION
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 17 The first session of the 92d Congress adjourned today after resolving the foreign aid controversy by temporarily extending the current program.

title: Not All Patents Are Prosaic
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 17  Patents are generally serious and prosaic, but about one in, a thousand brings a smile. Often the amusement is sympathetic, because the invention is directed at children or animals, and sometimes it merely reflects surprise at the incongruous or unexpected.

title: ROCKEFELLER SET FOR FISCAL PARLEY
description: ALBANY, Dec. 17Governor Rockefeller plans to issue the formal summons for a Dec. 27 emergency legislative session on fiscal affairs tomorrow during the special reapportionment session.

title: C. Ray Smith, Critic and Editor, Marries Mrs. Leslie A. Cortesi
description: The marriage of Mrs. Leslie Armstrong Cortesi, an architect, to C. Ray Smith, writer, critic and editor in the fields of architecture, the theater and the arts, took place here yesterday. Millard L. Midonick, Family Court Judge and Surrogateelect of New York County, performed the ceremony at the home of Gregory 13. Smith, a friend of the couple.

title: Philadelphia Police Officials Transferred After Testimony
description: PHILADELPHIA, Dec. 17 (AP) The commander of 19 of the city's 22 police districts and the chief inspectors of all seven police districts were ordered transferred today in what Police Commissioner Joseph F. O'Neill called routine changes in the patrol bureau:

title: Sun Gives Power for Vibrating Ski Slope
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 17 Future skiers may be able to glide over slopes made practically frictionless with ultrasonic vibration powered by the sun. Leonard W. Suroff will be granted Patent 3,628,789 next week, assigning it to Ultrasonic Systems, Inc., FarmIngdale. L. I., of which he is vice president.

title: Jesse Jackson Refuses To Return to S.C.L.C.
description: CHICAGO, Dec. 17 (AP)The Rev. Jesse L. Jackson, who resigned last Saturday as head of the Southern Christian Leadership Conference's ecnomic arm, Operation Breadbasket, said today that he had no intention of returning to the conference.

title: Some Very Old Carols Sung By Earlham College Ensemble
description: When a vocalinstrumental ensemble from a small college explores a repertory from 13thcentury plain song to baque masterpieces, it is obviously in good hands. The Earlham College Chamber Singers and Musicians, from Richmond, Ind., presented just such material in Carnegie Hall Recital Thursday night, under the direction of Leonard Holvik. The result was both musical and appealing.

title: American Policy Toward India
description: America's admirable economic assistance programs in India have been undermined by our military alliance with Pakistan and encouragement of a costly and now tragic arms race. This readiness to arm one side, against the advice of a series of unusually able Ambassadors to India, makes one wonder about our critical capacity in foreign policy.

title: AUSTRIAN GIRL, 18, ADDS TO SKI LEAD
description: SESTRIERE, Italy, Dec. 17 (AP)  AnneMarie Proell of Austria captured the Sestriere AlbergKandahar downhill ski race today, winning from the strong French team and further increasing her lead in the 1972 women's World Cup. The Americans had withdrawn claiming the 8.943foot course With a 2,092foot drop was too risky.

title: JOHN H. MILLIKEN
description: WESTBRROK, Me., Dec. 16John H. Milliken, manager of community relations for the S. D. Warren Company, died in his home here yesterday. He was 61 years old.

title: Artistry in Enamel or Crushed Tinfoil
description: Great artisan that he was, Camille Faure received only modest recognition in his lifetime. Now, 15 years after his death, the revival of Art Deco has uncovered a legacy of his extraordinary enameled objects, assuring him a secure place in art history. No wonder the Sonnabend Gallery, 924 Mad73d Street) has ison Avenue (at chosen the French enamelist's work to inaugurate a series of Art Deco exhibitions. Faure's designs are spectacular. Classic as ancient Chinese vases in form, they dance with an explosion of jewel colors. And the icy textures marry beautifully with the cubistic patterns, considered his finest work.

title: Heard's 71 for 144 Leads in Morocco; Gallacher Has 145
description: RABAT, Morocco, Dec. 17 (UPI)  Jerry Heard of the United States shot a 71 to grab the lead from Scotland's Bernard Gallacher today in the second round of the $50,000 international Moroccan golf grand prix.

title: The City's Crime WaveOne Company's Experiences
description: There has been considerable publicity given to the problem of crime in New York City, and visible evidence of our crime wave can be seen by the many guarded store fronts that have appeared all over the metropolitan area.

title: Foster Stops Kelly in 3d to Retain Title
description: OKLAHOMA CITY, Dec. 16 (AP)Bob Foster scored a technical knockout over Brian Kelly, a 23yearold Cushing, Okla., youth director, with 1:56 elapsed in the third round tonight to successfully defend his version of the lightheavyweight championship.

title: Amex Declares. Jacobson Must Resign and Sell Seat
description: The American Stock ENchange announced yesterday that its board of governors had found that Donald D. Jacobson violated exchange rules. It ordered him to resign his membership immediately.

title: Lebanon Fears Influx of Soviet Jews Into Israel
description: BEIRUT, Lebanon, Dec. 17 Lebanon, expressing concern over the emigration of Soviet Jews to Israel, told a visiting Soviet delegation yesterday that manpower was more serious than weapons in Israeli expansion and aggression.

title: Mary Rohde Bride Of D. F. Jennings
description: NEW CANAAN, Conn., Dec. 17  Miss Mary Katherine Rohde, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Harvey L. Rohde, was married here tonight to Douglas Field Jennings, son of Mr. and Mrs. Frederick M. Jennings. The ceremony in the First Presbyterian Church was performed by the Rev. T. Guthrie Spears Jr., assisted by the Rev. Vincent O'Connor, a Roman Catholic priest.

title: Auto Production Down
description: DETROIT, Dec. 17 (AP) Automobile production fell slightly this week as the industry completed its final full week of operations of the year.

title: Prosecutor Upheld On Chicago Jurors In' 69 Panther Raid
description: SPRINGFIELD, III Dec. 17 The Illinois Supreme Court upheld today the special prosecutor of a grand jury that indieted Edward V. Hanrahan, Cook County State's Attorney, and 13 other law enforcement officers in connection with a 1969 raid on a Black Panther headquarters in Chicago.

title: LAKERS TRIUMPH FOR 23D STRAIGHT
description: LOS ANGELES, Dec. 17 (AP) The Los Angeles Lakers ran their National Basketball Association record winning streak to 23 games tonight as they routed the Golden State Warriors, 12999.

title: Carly Simon Sings At the Bitter End; She's Flying High
description: The holiday season started early this week at the Bitter End with the arrival of a lovely present in the form of a singer, songwriter and explosive new star, Carly Simon.

title: Carnevale Quitting N.Y.U. For William and Mary Job
description: Ben Carnevale, the director of athletics at New York University, his alma mater, will leave that financially troubled institution July 1 to become athletic director of the wellrounded athletic program at the College of William and Mary.

title: President Goes Boating; Shooting Rumor Denied
description: KEY BISCAYNE, Fla., Dec. 17For the second day in succession, President Nixon slipped away from the Florida White House to go boating in the Atlantic without the knowledge of members of his staff.

title: Notes on People
description: President Nixon and the entire First Family will spend this weekend on the town in New York.

title: RESNIK PRESENTS VENICE 'ELEKTRA
description: VENICE, Italy, Dec. 17  Venetian opera lovers nearly had to feel their way to the lovely old Teatro La Fenice for Wednesday night's premiere of Regina Resnik's first venture in directing in Italy, the Richard Strauss opera Elektra. An all but impenetrable fog had closed transport in and out of this lagoon city, and movement along the grand canal and its myriad subsidiaries was suspended.

title: HUMPHREY TALKS TO JERSEY CHIEFS
description: NEWARK, Dec. 17Senator Hubert H. Humphrey tested the sentiment of new voters and oldline party leaders today in his second brief political visit to New Jersey in a month.

title: Airlines Are Pulling Out of an Economic Decline
description: The aviation world is in all but unanimous agreement that the nation's airlines  or at least most of themhave begun to pull out of the economic tail spin they fell into more than 18 mohths ago.

title: Saigon Forces Leave Chup
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, Dec. 17 (UPI)  South Vietnamese and Cambodian forces pulled out of the Chup rubber plantation today after failing to find an estimated 9,000 North Vietnamese troops reported by Allied intelligence to be hiding in the Communist sanctuary in eastern Cambodia.

title: SUGAR FUTURES RISE DAILY LIMIT
description: Prices of the No. 11 world sugar futures rose the daily limit of  cent a pound in the principal contracts traded on the New York Coffee and Sugar Exchange yesterday in very active trading that advanced prices to the highest levels since 1964.

title: Hofstra Tops Adelphi
description: GARDEN CITY, L. I., Dec. 17Hofstra scored 30 points to Ade1phi's 8 in the first eight minutes of the second half tonight to erase a 2925 halftime deficit on the way to a 7855 victory. Quinas Brower led the Dutchmen with 19 points.

title: U.S. Aides Cite Recognition Guidelines
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 17  Although the chances are slim that President Nixon will recognize the Bengali rebels regime any time soon, as the Indian Government has done, legal experts in the State Department have already begun studying the process under which a new state wins acceptance in the international community and the steps Mr. Nixon might take if he wishes to grant recognition.

title: Hansberry's Story to Open Biography Series on TV
Dave Anderson
description: In the empty rows at Madison Square Garden, women in plain dresses were mopping the cement floor under the folded seats. On the polished basketball court, several Knicks were shooting before practice, their sneakers squeaking on the wood, the ball creating a hollow sound when it was dribbled. Out from the hallway to the locker room, Willis Reed emerged in a dark green rubber sweat suit.

title: HILTZIK IS VICTOR IN EAST SKATING
description: HERSHEY, Dec. 17 Skaters from Long Island took championships in the senior men's and junior women's events tonight at the Eastern sectional figureskating championships at the Hershey Sports Arena.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: As an urban pedestrian and a landscape architect (Paley Park) I protest the proliferation of the boring empty spaces, euphemistically called plazas, which now occur at the base of almost every new business building.

title: Suggestions for the Stocking
description: It cannot be said that the daily book page has flinched from its duty this season in guiding readers of various tastes to books for Yuletide giving. The titles have ranged from the predictable, sumptuous art hooks, to those that are close to the spirit of the season though they may make harrowing reading, to something decent for the young folk. And some guidelines have been laid clown to indicate that a gift book ought to reflect the personality of the giver as much as that of the receiver.

title: Reporters Found the Indians Helpful in Covering War
description: NEW DELHI, Dec. 17The Indian Government's press policy during the 15day war with Pakistan made news itself. For India reversed the restrictive practices she followed in past wars and made a considerable effort to permit and assist war reporting.

title: The Season for Accommodation
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 17  Governor Rockefeller, working for the support of the New York Congressional delegation on a topic close to his heartrevenue sharing, has agreed to give the Representatives a greater voice in a subject close to their heartsreapportionment. At the suggestion of Representative Ogden R. Reid, Republican of Westchester County, and others, who noted that the Governor was making demands on the delegation at a time when the Representatives were concerned about how the Legislature in Albany would reshape their districts, Mr. Rockefeller is said to have agreed to the following arrangement:

title: The Pay Board and Its Critical Votes
description: WASHINGTONA fundamental principle of civilized government is that no man shall be a judge in his own cause. The tripartite structure of the Pay Board, coupled with the President's commitment to George Meany that will exercise final authority in specific cases, permits serious violations of this principle. When someone aggrieved by a specific decision presents a suitable challenge the courts may find it very difficult to sustain such a clear denial of due process of law.

title: Penney Meeting Adjourned
description: PHILADELPHIA, Dec. 17 (AP) The Penn Central Company annual stockholders meeting was convened today and immediately adjourned until Dec. 30 in compliance with a court order. The injunction was handed down Dec. 2 by United States District Court Judge Joseph S. Lord III blocking the meeting pending settlement of a stockholders suit.

title: US WARNS CUBA ON SHIP ATTACKS
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 17The United States warned Cuba today that it would take all measures under international law to protect American and other ships in the Caribbean from any new attacks by the Cubans.

title: Soldier Dies in Belfast
description: BELFAST, Northern Ireland, Dec. 17 (UPI)A British sotdier died of gunshot wounds today, raising the death toll in the Northern Ireland conflict this year to 165.

title: Personal Income Showed Moderate November Rise
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 17 (AP) National personal income showed a moderate increase in November as the thaw from President Nixon's wageprice freeze began to take effect, the Commerce Department reported today.

title: Col. Henderson Acquitted In Last of the Mylai Cases
description: FORT MEADE, Md., Dec. 17 Col. Oran K. Henderson, the infantry brigade commander whose troops shot down more than 100 civilians in the South Vietnamese hamlet of Mylai 4 in March, 19G8, was acquitted today of charges that he had covered up the killings by an inadequate investigation.

title: Tittle's Son Is Stabbed
description: REDWOOD CITY, Calif., Dec. 17 (UPI)Patrick A. Tittle, 18yearold son of Y. A. Tittle, former profootball star, was reported in good condition today at Kaiser Hospital after being stabbed in the chest last night during a fight in a theater. The knife blade narrowly missed his lung.

title: Cards Are Last Obstacle In Cowboy East Title Bid
description: DALLAS, Dec. 17 (UPI)  The St. Louis Cardinals will try to put a brake tomorrow on the momentum the Dallas Cowboys hope will keep them surging toward their second straight Super Bowl.

title: Dublin Accuses Britain
description: PARIS, Dec. 17 (Reuters)The Irish Republic accused Britain today of brutality and other violations of the European Human Rights Convention in northern Ireland.

title: 2 IN QUEENS FREED OVER STOPPING CARS
description: A Queens County grand jury has refused to indict a Queens couple arrested last summer after they allegedly blocked traffic in front of their Springfield Gardens house to prevent cars from going through a large puddle and flooding their basement.

title: United Merchants Elects Four Officers to New Pests
description: United Merchants and Manufacturers, Inc., annouced yesterday a restructuring of its domestic textile operations and elected four senior vice presidents to newly created posts. The move folloWs the retirement from active management as of June 30, 1972 of Sanford S. Agate and Abbot J. Copeland as executive vice presidents.

title: Reelection of Nixon Is Urged By New Hampshire Governor
description: CONCORD, N. H., Dec. 17 President Nixon's bid for reelection picked up the support today of New Hampshire's moderate Republican Governor, Walter R. Peterson.

title: News Analysis
description: BRUSSELS, Dec. 15  The Nixon Admintstratien's most fateful question about. Europe is not yet uttered aloud at the White House and it does not even appear on the agenda of the President's meetings with three allied leaders this month. Starkly put, the question concerns whether the economic union of Western Europe I. Still good for America, But the whispered doubts in Washington have beenclearly heard here at the headquarters of the European Economic Community. The fading American enthusiasm for the six allies trading club has been unmistakably evident in the sweeping changes in club rules demanded by White House emissaries in connection with the current monetary crisis. And the Europeans are coming to suspect that the American disenchanment will not disappear with a resolution of that crisis.

title: Residents in Fort Greene Call .l. U. Student Good Fellow
description: John Hamilton Sr. sat in the dimly lighted kitchen of his Brooklyn apartment yesterday, sipping cup after cup of coffee and talking about his oldest son, John Jr., who was shot tol death by the police earlier in the day on nearby Long Island University campus.

title: Gisbert and Cramer Reach South African Tennis Final
description: BLOEMFONTEIN, South Africa, Dec. 19 (AP)  Juan Gisbert of Spain, the secondseeded player, defested Nikki Kalogeropoulos of Greece, 1.6, 75, 64, today in the semifinal round of the Sugar Tennis tournament.

title: Statement by Yahya Khan
description: RAWALPINDI, Pakistan, Dec. 17 (Reuters)Following is the official text of the statement issued by President Agha Mohammad Yaltya Khan today ordering a ceasefire in the West:

title: PLAY BY PICASSO OPENS IN LONDON
description: LONDON, Dec. 17Spectators crawling through a fourfoot doorway into the Open Space Theater find themselves in pop art Arcadia, loud with hells and birdsong and beset with trees sprouting insects wings and with hillocks of strawcovered foam rubber where they can sit about like picnickers. This is the setting for the world premiere of The Four Little Girls as specified by its author, Picasso.

title: Bridge: Blue Team Wins and the Aces Lose in Semifinal of Knockout
description: LAS VEGAS, Nev., Dec. 17 In sensational secondhalf turnabouts, the world champion Aces lost and the Italian Blue team won in the semifinal stage of the Open Knockout Team Championship here today.

title: Benjamin D. Boyd 3d Dies; Led Grolier Military Sales
description: Benjamin D. Boyd ad, vice president of Grolier Interstate, Inc., publisher of encyclopedias and reference works, died Tuesday in Fort Lauderdale, Fla., after a long illness. He was 57 years old and lived also in Kansas City., Mo.

title: Soviet American Church Is Confident and Strong
description: ECHMIADZIN, U.S.S.R.  A young Armenian couple, bridegroom in a cutaway and bride in a lemoncolored formal gown brought from America by friends, bowed toward each other until their foreheads touched. The best man held an ornate silver cross over them as an elderly bluerobed priest said prayers and, peering over his bifocals, held out a jeweled Bible for each to kiss.

title: Article 1  No Title
description: PITTSBURGH Dec. 17 (AP)  Jim MeDaniels and Joe Caldwell led a lastminute surge as the Carolina Cougars downed the Pittsburgh Condors, 146143, in overtime tonight.

title: U.S. Envoy to Spain Quitting To Go Into G.O.P. Politics
description: MADRID, Dec. 17Ambassador Robert C. Hill of the United States has submitted his resignation and will return home early next month.

title: Oil Well Fire Kills Man
description: SANTA FE SPRINGS, Calif., Dec. 17 (AP)  Flames burst from an abandoned oil well yesterday while a work crew was filling it with concrete, killing one man, injuring eight and causing about $200,000 in damage, officials said. The fire in the Union Oil Company well was touched off when an undetected pocket of escaping gas was apparently ignited by a spark from a truck used by the work crew.

title: U.S. Treasurer Is Sworn In
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 17 (AP) Mrs. Romana Banuelos was sworn in today as the 34th Treasurer of the United States. Secretary of the Treasury John B. Connally, in administering the oath, said that he knew she will bring a high measure of grace and quality to the Treasury.

title: SoftSpoken lack Congressman Charles Coles Diggs Jr.
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 17 As chairman of the Congressional Black Caucus, Representative Charles C. Diggs Jr, has unsettled some of the younger, more militant members. A natty dresser who is something of a loner, he irritated caucus members by failing to consult them on his

title: Modest Rescuer Acted on Impulse To Aid Classmate
description: James Ribas is still not completely clear about what happened Monday at the IND station at 161st Street and River Avenue. The 16yearold sophomore at All Hallows Institute remembers running across three tracks to a fallen classmate, then a train coming and people yelling, Get up, get up. Then he was at Morrisania Hospital and they were calling him a hero.

title: Rockets Rout Bulls, 10998
description: CHICAGO, Dec. 17 (AP) The Houston Rockets, led by Stu Lantz and Calvin Murphy, rallied after losing a 14point lead to defeat the Chicago Bulls, 10998, tonight.

title: PRICES MOVE UP IN AMEX TRADING
description: Stocks on the American Stock Exchange and the overthecounter market made good gains yesterday on moderate trading.

title: ... and Inaction in the Council
description: The uproarious meeting of New York's unionized firemen and the doubt it has cast on ratification of their costly new contract only emphasize the need for City Council adoption of the longpending bill to make arbitration the last step in municipal labor contracts.

title: COUNCIL PRESSES LINDSAY ON ISSUE
description: Bowing to the insistence of a City Council committee considering a bill that would bar discrimination against hiring homosexuals, the Lindsay administration yesterday directed the Police, Fire and Correction Department Commissioners or their representatives to testify.

title: Republicans Add Bipartisan Touch to Redistricting
description: Even with the Supreme Court's oneman, onevote ruling hanging over them, Republican map makers managed to inject a generous amount of politics into the reapportionment of the legislature districts that is scheduled to be approved by the Senate and Assembly today. The politics included some back  scratching with Democratic legislators and county chairmen, although the Leg

title: F.C.C. RESTRICTS OTB'S TELECASTS
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 17 (AP)  New York City's Offtrack Betting Corporation was authorized today to televise live the last horse race each day from tracks with which it had contracts and to give the results and prices paid for all races on which OTB accepted bets.

title: BerlinAccess Agreement Signed by Both Germanys
description: BONN, Dec. I7The two Germanys formally signed an agreement today governing access through Communist East German territory to the isolated nonCommunist sectors of Berlin.

title: Law Professor a Statistician?
description: Your Dec. 11 news story reports that a study by Hans Zeisel, Professor of Law at the University of Chicagowhich urges that responsibility for issuing data on crime be transferred from the Federal Bureau of Investigation to an independent agencywas submitted to the President by the Commission on Federal Statistics. This muchneeded study apparently does not sit well with the F.B.I. For the same news story reports that The F.B.I.'s spokesman, Thomas E. Bishop, who is also the assistant director in charge of crime records, took unusually sharp exception to the Zeisel study. Mr. Bishop then went on to confess that he could not understand what Law Professor Hans Zeisel's qualifications as a statistician consist of.

title: Keyserling Says Pay Demand Of Transit Workers Is Justified.
description: An economic consultant for the Transport Workers Union said yesterday that pay increases of bus and subway workers in the last three years had been wiped out by the rise in the cost of living and that the 30 per cent pay increase that they are now seeking was justified.

title: U.N., Pressed by Peking, Ousts Two Taipei Newsmen
description: UNITED NATIONS, N. Y., Dec. 17The United Nations today ousted the two Nationalist Chinese correspondents working at this headquarters, as a result of pressure by the Chinese Communists.

description: To the Editor:

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: PAY BOARD PLACES EXECUTIVE RAISES UNDER 5.5% RULING
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 17 Judge George H. Boldt, chairman of the Pay Board, announced today that the board would limit increases in executive compensation, including salaries and benefits, to the same 5.5 per cent guideline that it has applied to wageearners in general.

title: BONANNOS GUILTY IN EXTORTION CASE
description: SAN JOSE, Calif., Dec. 17 (UPI)The two sons of Joseph (Joe Bananas) Bonanno, onetime Mafia leader, were convicted today on.. Federal charges of extortion and conspiracy.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: Screen:
description: As the last program in its current videotape series, the Whitney Museum presented yesterday and will present again tomorrow a selection of four rather ambitious tapes ranging from 15 to 30 minutes in length.

title: Missile Is Destroyed Aloft
description: CAPE KENNEDY. Fla., Dec. 17 (UPI)A. Poseidon missile launched from a submerged submarine was blown apart high above the Atlantic today when its second stage failed. The 34foot missile was successfully launched from the U.S.S. Nathaniel Greene at 4:45 P.M., but 143 seconds after launching, a malfunction occurred in the rocket's upper stage.

title: CHRISTMAS BUSINESS AT FEDERATED RISES
description: Ralph Lazarus, chairman of Federated Department Stores, Inc., which includes Bloomingdale's and Abraham & Straus in its nationwide chain, said yesterday that our Christmas business is running 11 per cent fahead of last year's strong performanee.

title: Accounting Request Made
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 17  The Securities and Exchange Commission wants insurance companies to stick to their traditional accounting methods until a controversy over changing these methods is resolved.

title: Article 2  No Title
description: INDIANAPOLIS, Dec. 17 (AP) The Indiana Pacers rallied from 17 points behind tonight for a 9492 victory over the Memphis Pros.

title: Second Thoughts on Tax Vote Haunt Atlanta
description: ATLANTA, Dec. 16  Atlantans, who have bought most of their Christmas gifts, are astir about one that they recently voted themshelves by a paperthin marginan increased sates tax.

title: Scribner Proposes a Lincoln Center Site for Drama High School
description: High school drama students would use the Vivian Beaumont Theater for a classroom and Lincoln Center for a campus under a proposal made yesterday by Dr. Harvey B. Scribner, Chancellor of the city's public schools.

title: RAIN DETHRONES BODELL IN MADRID
description: MADRID, Saturday, Dec. 18 Jose Manuel Ibar (Urtain) the storied stone lifter from the Spanish Basque country, knocked out Jack Bodell of England in the second round this morning to regain the European heavyweight boxing championship and start the legends all over.

title: John W. E. Griemsmann Dies; Early Microwave Technologist
description: Dr. John W. S. Griemsmann, a pioneer in microwave technology and professor of electrophysics at Polytechnic Institute of Brooklyn, died of a heart attack at the wheel of his automobile in Queens on Thursday evening. He was alone and the car went into bushes. Dr. Griemsmann, was 55 years old and lived at 9118 Hollis Court Boulevard, Queens Village.

title: An Enemy Missile Downs U.S Plane, Second in a Week
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, Saturday, Dec. 19A North Vietnamese surfacetoair missile downed a United States Air Force F4 fighterbomber on the Laotian border late last night, and another missile was fired at the rescue forces that picked up the two crewmembers in Laos this morning, the United States; command said today.

title: To jet Foes, Thomas's Corner Looms as Difficult One to Pass
Israeli Army Officials Expect Collapse of Arab Guerrilia Organization in Gaza
Feldman in Reversal, Declines Baylor Job
description: ALBUQUERQUE, N. M., Dec. 17 (UPI) The University of New Mexico head football coach, Rudy Feldman, noting he had made a premature decision, said today he would not accept the head coaching post at Baylor University

title: Matching Up Mothers Who Need Baby Sitters
description: Dating services match up men and women who have marriage in mind. Bernice Lask matches up mothers of young children who would like to exchange babysitting chores.

title: NETS BEAT CHAPS AS PAULTZ STARS
description: WEST HEMPSTEAD, L. I., Dec. 17 (AP)Bill Paultz pumped In 27 points and hauled down a teamrecord 33 rebounds tonight to lead the New York Nets to a 9083 victory over the Dallas Chaparrals in the American Basketball Association.

title: Knicks Win, 11595, From Braves
description: BUFFALO, Dec. 17  The New York Knicks, paced by an amazing display of shooting by Walt Frazier, won their first National Basketball Association game in this city tonight bytrouncing the Buffalo Braves, 11595, at Memorial Auditorium.

title: GIANTS ATHAS ILL, MAY MISS FINALE
description: Pete Athas takes up only one spot on the Giants decimated roster, but if a severe bronchial infection prevents him from playing against Philadelphia tomorrow, the Giants would be out two players.

title: U.S. PROSECUTOR ON COAST RESIGNS
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 17 United States Attorney Robert L. Meyer of Los Angeles resigned today, and reliable sources said one reason was that he disagreed with the Justice Department's decision to prosecute Dr. Daniel Ellsberg.

title: Pound Tops $2.52
description: BRUSSELS, Dec. 17The Bank of England signaled today to the currency markets that the devaluation of the United States dollar would be at least 5.4 per cent when final decisions on a parity realignment were taken, perhaps this weekend in Washington.

title: Display by Nancy Graves Adds Vitality to Art Series
description: The Museum of Modern Art initiated this year a series of exhibitions called Projects that enable contemporary artists to show their latest work in two rooms of the museum's main floor. The artists, according to the precepts of the program, are supposed to create works for the space allotted them. Although most of the exhibitions have left something to be desired, the idea that inspired them is, nevertheless, a good one. A part of the museum becomes at once a studio for the artist and a gallery for the viewer, generating a kind of immediate vitality within the museum.

title: JORDAN ACCUSES FATAH IN SLAYING
description: BEIRUT, Lebanon, Dec. 17 Jordan tonight formally accused Al Fatah, the main Palestinian guerrilla organization, of responsibility for assassination and sabotage activities.

title: Come Now, Professor Hook
description: WASHINGTONProf. Sidney Hook has written a piece of fiction (OpEd Page, Nov. 5) that has been greeted with approval by some segments of the academic community.

title: Agency Lists Oases of Bias Against Workers Over Age
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 17 (UPI) The Labor, Department said today it had found 2,522 employers, labor unions and employment agencies discriminating against workers aged 40 to 65 because of their age during the fiscal year that ended June 30.

title: BRANDEIS CHOOSES FOURTH PRESIDENT
description: WALTHAM, Mass., Dec. 17 Dr. Marver H. Bernstein, a 52yearold political scientist and Jewish lay leader, was appointed today as president of Brandeis University.

title: WARBURG GETS POST WITH METROPOLITAN
description: Edward M. M. Warburg active for many years in cultural and educational affairs, has been elected vice director of public affairs at the Metropolitan Museum of Art. He succeeds George Trescher, who has resigned to open his own business, but will continue to serve the museum as consultant.

title: Two Men Indicted in Brooklyn On Charge of Smuggling Heroin
description: A Federal grand jury in Brooklyn filed a twocount indictment yesterday charging two men with offenses involving more than 156 pounds of heroin smuggled into the United States last summer.

title: Stage: Musical of a Story by Grimm
President Signs Bill to Protect Wild Horses on Federal Lands
description: KEY BISCAYNE, Fla., Dec. 17Presdent Nixon, taking note of countless letters from young Americans urging protection of wild horses and burros, signed into law today a bill making it a Federal crime to kill or harass the animals on Federal lands.

title: INDIA LISTS LOSSES
description: NEW DELHI, Dec. 17India marked her triumph quietly today and disclosed that in the two weeks of fighting with Pakistan 2,307 Indians were killed, 6,163 wounded and 2,163 were missing. India also said she had lost 73 tanks and 45 aircraft.

title: On Teacher Reinstatement
description: I am very much upset and concerned by your Dec, 4 editorial To Right a Wrong. How can a great newspaper like yours approve the employment of subversives in our public schools? This is what your editorial implies.

title: In Dacca, Killings Amid the Revelry
City Hail Role Fascinating to jay Kriegel
description: One of the most elusive subspecies of governmental fauna is the staff man. The powers he wields and the risks he takes can be tremendous, but they are never his own.

title: ST. JOHN'S WINS; DAVIS SCORES 24
description: HUNTINGTON, W. Va., Dec. 17St. John's opened the fifth annual Marshall University memorial basketball tournament tonight with an 8575 victory over Rhode Isand before a capacity crowd of 6,500.

title: Art: Varied Changes in Baskin's Work
description: During the 1950's and 60's, when in the eyes of the New York Establishment an American artist might as well have been a leper as a humanist, Leonard Baskin not only carried the humanistic banner like a leper's bell but also became one of the country's most conspicuous sculptors by doing so. His persistent demonstration that an awareness of the present need not preclude a sympathetic acquaintance with the past, his conviction that to study the philosophers of antiquity and the documents of the JudaeoChristian thought and Renaissance treatises on both might he as rewarding as to follow the neopunditry of Art Nevis and Art Forum magazines, did not endear him to a group of critics who could tell you all about Jackson Pollock but were a little fuzzy as to just who Thomas Aquinas had been.

title: Mitchell Levitsky, 63, Dies; A Yiddish Announcer Here
description: Mitchell Levitsky, a pioneer radio announcer in Yiddish and English, died of cancer yesterday in Mount Sinai Hospital after a long illness. He was 63 years old and lived at 6348 Elwell Crescent, Rego Park, Queens.

title: AT HOME ABROAD
description: LONDON, Dec. 17When he took office as Prime Minister in June of 1970, Edward Heath was disturbed to find the old pattern of easy twoway communication between Britain and the United States deteriorated sadly. So he put it six months later in an interview with Joseph Fromm of U. S. News and World Report.

title: Cannon Traded for Sidle
description: MEMPHIS, Dec. 17 (AP)The Memphis Pros of the American Basketball Association traded Larry Cannon, a guard, to the Indiana Pacers today for Don Sidle, a 6footSinch center. Cannon averaged 26.6 points a game last season.

title: ADDICT'S ARREST LINKED TO SLAYING
description: The arrest of a 22yearold addict who served as an informant for Sgt. Joseph V. Morabito, the narcotics detective found shot to death in his car in Brooklyn last August, may have provided new leads in the investigation of his murder, the police said last night.

title: YONKERS SLATES OLD GLORY SALE
description: YONKERS, Dec. 17Fortyseven yearlings will be among the 284 standardbreds auctioned off at the winter segment of the Old Glory Horse Sale at Yonkers Raceway tomorrow. The vendue will start at 10 A.M. and is expected to last about eight hours. Laddie Dance will be the auctioneer.

title: REFORM DEMOCRATS SEEK DELAY ON VOTE
description: Reform Democrats yesterday called on John J. Burns, the state chairman, to postpone the Dec. 28 meeting at which his successor will be chosen. The purpose would be to give the party more time to study the qualifications of candidates.

title: MORE BIG BANKS CUT PRIME RATES
description: Faced with a demand for business loans that at best can be described as unexciting, a number of major banks across the country reduced their minimum charges on business loans to 5 per cent from 5 per centeffective immediately in some cases and on Monday in others.

title: A Grim Midnight Tour at a City Hospital
A CAMPUS PAPER ACCUSED OF BIAS
description: A group of Queens College students charged, yesterday that a campus newspaper, The Voice of SEEK, published antiSemitic statements in its Dec. 15 issue.

title: Ahern of New Haven In Field for Post Here
description: James F. Ahern, the former Police Chief of New Haven who served on the President's Commission on Campus Unrest, is being considered for the post of Corrections Commissioner in New York, Mayor Lindsay's office said yesterday.

title: U.S., in 3d Phase 2 Suit, Accuses Ohio Bus Company on Fares
description: WASHINGTON,. Dec. 17 The Government filed suit today for the third time under Phase Two of the economic stabilization program, charging a transit system in Cincinnati with illegally raising fares and reducing service.

title: Need for Eurobonds Seen Even if Stability Returns
description: LUXEMBOURG, Dec. 17One of Luxembourg's top currency experts said today that the world will still need Eurobonds if international monetary stability is fully restored after the devaluation of the dollar.

title: U.S. REVIVES EFFORT FOR A SUEZ ACCORD
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 17 (Reuters)Secretary of State William P. Rogers has begun a new United States effort to bring about an interim peace settlement in the Middle East, the State Department announced today.

title: Indiana Gas Net at Peak
description: The Indiana Gas Company reported yesterday a new high of $52,708,393 for the fiscal year ended Sept. 30. This compared with $50,058,711 a year earlier. However, net income slipped to $5,550,549, or $2.98 a share, from the $5,708,258, or $3.07 a share, reported in the fiscal year ended Sept. 30, 1970.

title: Princeton in Romp
description: LEXINGTON, Ky., Dec. 17, (UPI)Brian Taylor and Ted Manakas combined for 50 points tonight to lead Princeton to an 8559 victory over errorplagued California in the opening game of the University of Kentucky invitation tournament.

title: E.E.C. NATIONS CLEAR TRADEPARLEY PLANS
description: BRUSSELS, Dec. 17The six member states of the European Economic Community, approving the action of their permanent representatives in Brussels yesterday, formally agreed today to a mandate for immediate trade negotiations with the United States.

title: Swedes Uneasy Over Role in a Changing Europe
description: STOCKHOLM, Dec. 11 Sweden, wrapped in neutrality for more than 150 years and now steering a comfortable course between East and West, is anxious and uneasy about her role in a rapidly changing Europe.

title: A. HAYNEDEYAMPERT, TRIAL LAWYER HERE
description: A. Hayne deYampert, a New York trial lawyer, died Thursday at his home, 36 West 12th Street. He was 73 years old.

title: L.I.U. Senior Slain In Narcotics Arrest
description: A plainclothes patrolman shot and killed a student on the Brooklyn Center campus of Long Island University yesterday morning when, the police said, he tried to escape arrest on a narcotics charge.

title: Park Roads Open
description: Central Park roadways will be open to automobile traffic today to help ease the holiday traffic, the Parks Department said. Normally the roads are closed to traffic so they can be used by bicyclists from sunrise to sunset on Saturdays and Sundays. The roads return to the closing schedule tomorrow.

title: JOSEPH STERN
description: Joseph Stern, who for many years operated Acousticon of Flushing, Inc., a hearingaid store, died of a heart attack in Flushing Hospital on Wednesday. He was 68 years old and lived at 14343 41st Avenue, Flushing, Queens.

title: A USURY SUSPECT CHANGES HIS PLEA
description: An alleged associate of Carmine J. Persico pleaded guilty yesterday to two counts of usury in the same reputed loansharking scheme for which Persico was recently tried and acquitted.

title: Only Caney Among 25 in Mylai Cases Was Convicted
description: With the acquittal yesterday of Col. Oran K. Henderson, First Lieut. William L. Calley Jr. remains the only man to have been convicted of criminal charges for his role in the attack on the South Vietnamese hamlet of Mylai 4 in March, 1968.

title: American Eagle Takes Lead In Australian Ocean Race
description: SYDNEY, Australia, Dec. 17 (AP)Arnerican Eagle, a 68foot yacht skippered by Ted Turner of Atlanta, led a field of 20 tonight on the first day of the opening 180mile race of the Southern Cross Cup off the New South Wales coast.

title: Clash in Delta Reported
description: SAIGON, Dec. 17 (AP)New fighting was reported today In the U Minh Forest.

title: Marcia Luria, J. A. Purdy Jr. Wed in Suburbs
description: GREENWICH, Conn., Dec. 17  Miss Marcia Gordon Luria, daughter of Henry Theodore Luria and Mrs. William Earl McCreery, was married here tonight to James Arthur Purdy Jr., son of Mr. and Mrs. Purdy. The Rev. Bradford Hastings performed the ceremony in Christ Episcopal Church.

title: Harvard Six Victor, 72
description: CAMBRIDGE, Mass., Dec. 17 Bill Corkery scored two goals to lead the Harvard hockey team to a 72 victory over Princeton tonight at Watson Rink. Princeton's goalie, Phil Robinson, made 46 saves for the Tigers.

title: Bhutto Presses Appeal for Negotiations Between Pakistan and the Insurgents
Brooklyn Detective Is Held On Gambling Payoff Charge
description: A 41yearold Brooklyn detective, who was allegedly being paid off by a gambler, was arrested yesterday, Police Headquarters announced.

title: Kuznetzov Returns Home
description: NEW DELHI, Dec. 17 (UPI)The First Deputy Foreign Minister of the Soviet Union, Vasily V. Kuznetzov, returned to Moscow today after six days of talks with Indian officials under the IndianSoviet friendship treaty.

title: Mrs. Webster Wed To Gerrish Thurber
description: PRINCETON, N. J., Dec. 17 Mrs. Jeanette Scott Webster, widow of Lawrence Barns Webster, was married here this morning to Gerrish Thurber of Lawrenceville, a widower and librarian of the Lawrenceville School. The Rev. Dr. Donald M. Meisel performed the ceremony in the Princeton Hospital, where the bridegroom is a patient.

title: Dr. Richard I. Kilstein, 65, Gastroenterologist, Is Dead
description: Dr. Richard I. Kilstein, a gastroenterologist, died Thursday in Mount Sinai Hospital. He was 65 years old and lived at 2 East 86th Street. His office was at 16 East 72d Street.

title: McCarthy, Casually, Enters the '72 Race
description: BOSTON, Dec. 17Eugene J. McCarthy eased himself into the running for the Democratic Presidential nomination today by announcing his candidacy in the Massachusetts primary April 25.

title: MONETARY TALKS MAKE SLOW START
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 17  Finance ministers of the leading industrial nations pursued snail's pace negotiations on the world monetary problem late tonight, with no announcement of results.

title: DYCE'S 9:04 TAKES TWOMILE RUN HERE
description: Byron Dyce of the United Athletic Association lowered his best time for the twomile run by 5.5 seconds last night in a development track meet sponsored, by the Metropolitan Amateur Athletic Union at the 168th Street Armory.

title: Cosmos No. 467
description: MOSCOW, Dec. 17 (AP) The Soviet Union announced today the launching of Cosmos satellite No. 467. It was the seventh Cosmos shot announced this month and the third in three days. The Russians use Cosmos as a name for a wide range of space experiments.

title: Science Placed on Trial in State University Course at Stony Brook
description: STONY BROOK, L. I., Dec. 17Dr. Leonard Eisenbudphysicist, scientist, rationalistspent last semester creating antiscientists.

title: Croatian Charges Nationalists Hoped for Foreign Intervention
description: ZAGREB, Yugoslavia, Dec. 17  One of the Croatian region's new Communist leaders charged today that nationalist forces in his republic had wanted to create a situation inviting foreign intervention.

title: RICHARDSON SAYS HE'LL FIGHT CUTS
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 17  Elliot L. Richardson, Secretaty of Health, Education and Welfare, said today that he would fight a White House order for a cut of 11,400 departmental jobs by next summer.

title: Allied Chiefs Meet in Pnompenh As Cambodian Posts Weaken
description: PNOMPENH, Cambodia, Dec. 17, (UPI)Cambodian positions on Route 6 north of Pnompenh deteriorated today under Com; munist pressure, according to military sources, who added that highlevel delegations of American and South Vietnamese officers had arrived here apparently to confer on the threat.

title: Young Troupe Pays Armstrong Tribute At Night for Jazz
description: A Night for Jazz is what it was called, and the title was well chosen. Jazz Interactions, Inc., a nonprofit organization that sponsors jazz concerts and runs an educational program for young musicians, gave program at Alice Tully Hall Wednesday night to showcase their talented students and pay homage to Louis Armstrong.

title: Bucks Win 8th in Row, 120113
description: MILWAUKEE, Dec. 17 (AP)Kareera AbdulJabbar scored 44 points tonight and sparked a fourthquarter rally that carried the Milwaukee Bucks to their eighth straight victory, 120.113, over the Seattle SuperSonics.

title: Doomed Man Gets Life
description: PUEBLO, Colo., Dec. 17 (AP) Joe Albert Segura of Pueblo, who for the last 81/2 years has been awaiting execution at the Colorado State Penitentiary for the slaying of his son, had his sentence changed to life imprisonment yesterday. The resentencing, which resulted from a Supreme Court decision, may be appealed.

title: MARKET FORGES ANOTHER ADVANCE
description: Wall Street kept one eye on the monetary negotiations in Washington yesterday as stock prices forged ahead in heavy trading. Glamour issues continued to pace the market.

title: SOUTH AFRICA HALTS CURRENCY TRADING
description: JOHANNESBURG, South Africa, Dec. 17The South African Reserve Bank suspended foreignexchange dealings until further notice today.

title: Man Accused of Attempting To Set Jet Afire in Flight
description: A 35yearold employe of a Queens moving company failed in an attempt to set afire an Eastern Airline 747 jet over the Atlantic on its way here from San Juan, customs officials reported Friday night.

title: Hearings Planned in Hawaii
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 17 (AP) A Senate Commerce subcommittee will hold hearings in Honolulu next month on a bill designed to protect Hawaii from the harmful effects of shipping tieups.

title: TOUGH RULES SET ON NEW APLANTS
description: The Atomic Energy Commission is going to take a much tougher stand on new applications for nuclear power plants, Wilfred E. Johnson, a member of the commisson, said here yesterday.

title: Bullets Stop Hawks, 114103
description: BALTIMORE, Dec. 17 (UPI) Jack Marin and Stan Love, rookie, sparked a fourthquarter rally that led the Baltimore Bullets to a 114103 victory over the Atlanta Hawks tonight.

title: Empire Sinfonietta Is Led by Copland; Bartok Stands Out
description: The Empire Sinfonietta, an enterprising chamber orchestra composed of young but more than ordinarily capable players, gave its second Tully Hall concert of the season Thursday night with Aaron Copland, the composer, as guest conductor. It was not his birthday, and the program was not devoted to his music, to American music or even to contemporary music. He was simply there as a journeyman conductor, a role he had played with increasing frequency in the last few years.

title: GOT GRAFT REPORT, FRAIMAN TESTIFIES
description: Mayor Lindsay's top investigator from 1966 until the end of 1968 acknowledged yesterday that he had received a report of widespread corruption from a plainclothes policeman but neither investigated it on his own nor referred the allegation to another agency.

title: IRA MANGEL DEAD; ARMSTRONG AIDE
description: Ira Mangel, who was Louis Armstrong's manager for the last 10 years before the trumpeter's death in July, died yesterday of heart failure at his home, 244 West 72d Street. He, was 61 years old.

title: RICHARD S. CHAPMAN, MAINE CHIEF JUDGE
description: CAPE ELIZABETH, Mc., Dec. 16Richard S. Chapman, chief judge of the Maine district court system, died today at his home here. He was 64 years old.

title: Antiques: One of a Kind
description: Daguerreotypes,ambortypes and tintypes are early, oneofakind photographs that appeal to collectors as much for their cases as their subject matter.

title: CHARLES L. PERRET
description: CLEARWATER, Fla., Dec. 17 Charles L. Perret, a coowner and retired operator of the PerretStecle & Wolff Produce Company, the Bronx Terminal Market, died today at the Morton F. Plant Hospital here. He was 73 years old and lived at 1661 Algonquin Drive.

title: Colonels Down Squires
description: LOUISVILLE, Ky. Dec. 17 (AP)  Dan Issel and Louie Dampier scored 29 points each and Artis Gilmore added 27 tonight to lead the Kentucky Colonels to a 128104 victory over the Virginia Squires.

title: MOSCOW IS TAKING A MODERATE LINE
description: MOSCOW, Saturday, Dec. 18 The Soviet Union asserted early today that the Indian victory in East Pakistan had cleared the way for the legally elected representatives of the East Pakistani people to take power in their region.

title: Action on Transport Strikes ...
description: The overwhelming vote of West Coast longshoremen to reject proffered wage increases that run nearly triple the Pay Board's basic 5.5 per cent guidepost confronts the country with the prospect of a new dock strike after the present eightyday injunction under the TaftHartley Act expires on Christmas Day.

title: Newsmen Seek Accord On Background Briefing
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 17 (AP)  The State Department Correspondents Association considered but failed to adopt resolutions today, aimed at countering The Washington Post policy of attributing background news to United States officials.

title: China and the Subcontinent
description: China's long statement on the IndianPakistani war just ended betrays more malaise than belligerence. Peking has ample reason to be disturbed by the triumph of Indian arms over Pakistan, which had received strong verbal and some material support from the Chinese.

title: Rep. Diggs Resigns As a U.N. Delegate
description: UNITED NATIONS, N. Y., Dec. 17 A black member of the House of Representative resigned from the United States delegation to the United Nations today to protest what he called the stifling hypocrisy of the Nixon Administration's policy toward black Africa.

title: Executive Changes
description: Robert J. Richardson, executive vice president Du Pont of Canada, Ltd., was elected president and chief executive officer in Montreal yesterday. He succeeds E. H. Blackwell, who Is retiring but will remain a director.

title: Stars Sink Rockets, 136109
description: SALT LAKE CITY, Dec. 17 (AP)Paced by Glen Combs' 33 points, including a clubrecord seven threepoint baskets, the Utah Stars crushed the Denver Rockets, 136109, tonight.

title: Jews and Catholics Set a Study on Land
description: Representatives of world Jewish organizations and the Vatican have agreed to sponsor a joint study on the controversial topic of the religious significance of land, including the territory of Israel.

title: CHOU ASSAILS SOVIET, 8 ENVOYS WALK OUT
description: PEKING, Dec. 17 (Reuters) Enoys of the Soviet Union, six Soviet bloc countries and India walked out of a state dinner tonight when Premier Chou Enlai bitterly atthcked Moscow's support of Indian aggression against Pakistan.

title: Bengali Asks US. Recognition and Aid
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 17The chief representative of Bangladesh in Washington called a news conference today to ask for diplomatic recognition and economic assistance from the United States.

title: Christmas Rappings, an Oratorio for the Secular, Reopens Here
description: Although most of the Rev. Al Carmines's stage sallies have been secular and, he cheerfully admits, irreverent, a different goal prompted Christmas Rappings, the oratorio that reopened yesterday at the Judson Memorial Church, where he is associate minister.

title: KOEHRING SHOWS 3MONTH PROFIT
description: The Koohring Company, a diversified manufacturer of construction and industrial machinery, reported yesterday an operating profit of $1,221,000 for the fourth fiscal quarter ended Nov. 30. In the yearearlier period, the company lost $303,000.

title: Italian Presidential Voting Inconclusive on Ninth Day
description: ROME, Dec. 17The ninth day of Italy's presidential election today was again inconclusive. The 1,000member electoral college held only one ballot and was scheduled to resume voting tomorrow morning.

title: EQUITY FINANCING
description: The Larwin Realty & Mortgage Trust raised $60million yesterday with an initial public offering of 3 million units composed of one share of beneficial interest and one warrant. DuPont Glore Forgan, Inc., which managed the underwriting at $20, reported the issue oversubscribed. The warrants are exercisable before Dec. 28, 1976, at $20.

title: Trying to Restore Order
description: DACCA, Dec. 17Indian officers and local guerrilla leaders attempted to restore order here today and the situation appeared to be slowly calming down. However scattered street fighting continued, with pockets of soldiers unable or unwilling to surrender.

title: Equity Aids Collection
description: Actors Equity Association is contributing $5,000 to keep the Theater Collection at Lincoln Center open. Sada Thompson, star of Twigs, will present an Equity check to Paul Myers, curator for the collection, at tonight's Crisis Concert starring Betty Cowden and Adolph Green at the Juilliard Theater.

title: Modest Cards Aid Fund for Neediest
Roosevelt Raceway to Grant Stall Space to Abbatiello
description: WESTBURY, L.I., Dec. 17Carmine Abbatiello will be granted stall space when Roosevelt Raceway opens its winter harness racing meeting on Jan. 3.

title: MSGR. NATUCCI, 100, DEVIL'S ADVOCATE
description: ROME, Dec. 17 (UPI)Msgr. Salvatore Natucci, for 33 years the Devil's Advocate in the Vatican, died today. He was 100 years old.

title: Is Not the Typewriter Mightier Than the Gun?
description: CLAREMONT, Calif.I have a solution for the problem of cruel, devastating wars. It has to do with the typewriter and something that has been overlooked for a hundred years.

title: The Proceedings In the U.N. Today
Neighbors Assist Seattle's Jobless
description: SEATTLE, Dec. 17Preparing dinner is a simple matter these days for Patricia Vick. To feed her husband, Dale, and their three children, Robert, 10, Rita, 7 and Connie, 6, Mrs. Vick merely opens three cans of vegetables. That is all there is most nights.

title: HOLIDAY SHOPPERS CAUTIONED ON FOIL
description: State Attorney General Louis J. Lefkowitz warned holiday shoppers yesterday against buying leaded foil icicles for decorations because of a potential health hazard to children.

title: CANADA REASSURED BY HEATH ON MARKET
description: OTTAWA, Dec. 17 (Canadian Press)Relations between Britain and Canada will continue as close as ever after Britain joins the European Common Market, Prime Minister Heath said Friday night.

title: CELLER ASKS A BAR TO AIRLINE MERGER
description: Representative Emanuel Celler, Democrat of New York and the chairman of the House Judiciary Antitrust subcommittee, yesterday in Washington urged the Justice Department to prevent the proposed merger of National Airlines into Northwest Airlines, Inc. Mr. Celler said the proposal, following closely another planned merger between Delta Airlines and Northeast Airlines, indicated a trend that would lessen competition in the airlines industry unless stopped in its tracks in the not too distant future.

title: Thursday Night Fights
description: Rapallo, Italy  Domonico Tiberia, 153, Italy, knocked out Also Battistutta, 151, Italy, 11.

title: Treasury Bill Rates Rise at Weekly Auction
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 17 Yields on United States Treasury bills rose in the Government's weekly competitive sale today of these shortterm securities.

title: Polish Party Apparently Seeks Sharp Tightening al Structure
description: WARSAW, Dec. 17Poland's new economic and social reforms are apparently to be accompanied by a sharp tightening of the internal structure of the Communist party.
