title: Republican Reapportionment
description: One of the newly reapportioned legislative districts of the State of New York is shaped like a horseshoe, perhaps for good luck; another resembles an arrow; still another defies description though tabbed two hotdogs on a string by disgruntled Democrats. These are the weird results of the Republican party's reapportionment. Unveiled in the form of bills introduced at a special session of the Legislature earlier this week, they are scheduled to be rammed into law today.

title: Celtics Top Cavaliers, 114103
description: CLVELAND, Dec. 17 (AP)Two baskets in the last minute by Don Chancy, one of them coming on a controversial goaltending call against Walt Wesley, gave the Boston Celtics a 115109 National Basketball Association victory over the Cleveland Cavaliers tonight.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: Your Dec. 1 article entitled Board Weighs Reinstatement of Teachers Ousted in Fifties was viewed by me with extreme excitement. I also wish to commend you on the splendid editorial of Dec. 4 regarding this matter.

title: Durk's Career as a Politician Emerges
description: A selfportrait of Detective, Sgt. David Durk as a lobbyist and political operative moving through the corridors of power in the Lindsay administration emerged yesterday in his testimoney before the Knapp Commission.

title: Coed to Run for City Post
description: JOHNSON CITY, Term., Dec. 17 (AP)An 18yearsold East Tennessee State University freshman coed has qualified for the Jan. 27 special election to fill a vacancy on the City Commission. Bette Shulman became the first to qualify for the election.

title: Third Suspect in Seizure Of Bogus Money Gives Up
description: A third suspect in Wednesday's seizure of half a million dollars in counterfeit $10 bills by Secret Service agents on a Brooklyn street surrendered yesterday to authorities and was arraigned in Federal Court.

title: A Cooky That Stands 19 Inches High
description: Every Christmas for the last 17 years, Mrs. Joseph Low has dusted off the antique cooky mold that hangs in her kitchen and used it to turn out 19inchhigh figures she baked as gifts for special friends.

title: GEORGE A. FLYNN, 65, A CALTEX OFFICIAL
description: George Alfred Flynn, retired aviation sales manager of Caltex Petroleum Corporation, died Thursday in Amsterdam. (N.Y.) Hospital. He was 65 years old and lived in Speculator, N.Y.

title: Army Concedes the Use Of Metal Crates as Cells
House Panel Continues Its Study of C .B S. News
description: The House Interstate and Foreign Commerce Committee, which suffered defeat in its attempt to cite Dr. Frank Stanton, vice chairman of the Columbia Broadcasting System, for contempt of Congress, is continuing its investigation of C.B.S. for possible staging of news events.

title: Finland Chills Soviet Six
description: MOSCOW, Dec. 17 (AP)Finland's ice hockey team defeated the Soviet Union for the first time today, winning, 42. In another match, Czechoslovakia crushed Sweden's junior team, 81.

title: UNREST REPORTED
description: RAWALPINDI, Pakistan, Dec. 17President Agha Mohammad Yahya Khan announced Pakistan's acceptance of a ceasefire today after 15 days of war with India. Thus, a day after the unconditional surrender of Pakistan's eastern territory, 1,000 miles away, fighting also halted here in the west.

title: The Nation
description: WASHINGTONWhen the flood of rhetoric subsides and the ark of Con gress comes to rest at the end of a year, strange companion legislation emerges.

title: Yachting
description: Sorcery, James Baldwin's new 61foot sloop, made a smashing debut in the Southern Ocean Racing Conference by winning the first race, but when the sixevent series was over in early March, Jakob Isbrandtsen's yearold aluminum boat, Running Tide, had captured the overall prize. The 60foot Tide took only one race, but that was the longest onethe MiamiNassauas she out scored another newcomer, Yankee Girl, Dora, and American Eagle, last year's S.O.R.C. champion, in that order.

title: Andrew S. Gunsberg, Teacher, Marries Miss Alison Crombie
description: STAMFORD, Conn., Dec. 18 Miss Alison Crombie and Andrew S. Gunsberg were married here this afternoon in Our Lady Star of the Sea Roman Catholic Church by the Rev. Edmund Hussey, the pastor.

title: Paul Brodeur Jr. Weds Margaret Ann Staats
description: Miss Margaret Ann Staats and Paul Adrian Brodeur Jr. were married here yesterday afternoon in St. James Episcopal Church by the Rev. Ernest James Reed.

title: 3 LowCost Antitank Weapons Devised by Bonn
description: LONDON, Dec. 17  West Germany has developed three weapons that could provide North Atlantic alliance forces with a relatively cheap means of stopping Soviet tank of fensives.

title: IMPROVED EAGLES Al FULL STRENGTH
description: The New York Giants close their 1971 season at Yankee Stadium today against the im proved Philadelphia Eagles.

title: The mental set of an elderly absolute monarch
description: Memoirs, Harold Wilson has quipped, are for one's anecdotage. This is a personal record, a crisp businesslike account (insofar as 800 pages can possess crispness) of his deeds and days in power. Unfortu nately, it is still his account, and it was notnot quitehis government.

title: Bhutto Considered Tough And Politically Ambitious
description: The political life of Zulfikar Ali Bhutto, Pakistan's Deputy Prime Minister and Foreign Minister, began in his student days at the University of Cali fornia at Berkeley in 1950 when he became a campaign worker for the Congressional candidacy of Helen Gahagan Douglas. The winner of that race was Rich ard M. Nixon.

title: Bobby Jones: Widely Acclaimed by Both Fans and His Fellow Golfers
description: ST. ANDREWS, Scotland, Dec. 18 (AP)The town of St. An drews and the Royal and An cient Golf Club, headquarters of the game, mourned the great Bobby Jones today.

title: U.S. BUSINESS ROUNDUP
description: Statistical support for economic analysis, the series of numbers with and with out dollar signs, comes from a variety of sources A host of government agencies pro duce vast amounts of data. In the hands of skilled econ omists, these data may he used to sift out trends, pin point areas of strength, of promise or weakness.

title: New York
description: The policemen who had gone knock ing from door to door with their tales of corruption had their innings before the Knapp Commission last week in hearings that posed some inevitable questions. Is police corruption, shock ing as it is, only a small part of over all city corruption? And is this cor ruption so endemic and so pervasive that high officials hesitate to lift the lid for fear of the mess that may come bubbling forth?

title: Phillips Andover Wins, 8.0, From Toronto in Hockey
description: PRINCETON, N.J., Dec. 18 Kevin Burke and Craig Brickley scored two goals each today as Phillips  Andover Academy routed the University of To ronto, 8.0, to capture the Law renceville Invitational hockey tournament.

title: Nixons Visit the City to Attend a Musical
description: President and Mrs. Nixon flew into the city last night to see a play and attend church with their family.

title: To an OTB Buff, She Was a Ship Of Pools
description: CAN a refugee from OTB find happi ness away from New York City on vacation? You bet he can especially if he, goes to Mexico and goes by ship. As luck would have it, I did exactly that and never saw so much action in my life.

title: Rae Farrell Married
description: In St. Patrick's Cathedral yesterday, Miss Rao Jeanne Farrell and Thomas Duffy Gill Jr., 1971 graduates of the Columbia Law School, were married by the Rev. James Cleary. Tho bride is the daughter of Mrs. Rich and Martin Farrell of Allen town, Pa., and the late Mr. Farrell. Her husband's par ents are Thomas D. Gill, Chief Judge of the Juvenile Court of Connecticut, and Mrs. Gill of West Hartford.

title: An Unknown Hijacker is Romanlicized
description: SEATTLE, Dec. 18The name of D. B. Cooper is not legendary yet. It hardly ranks up there with Jesse James or Black Bart, but it is catching up.

title: Hardy Hikers Drawn To the Morton Refuge
description: NOYACK, L. I.  Bundled against a nippy wind and booted for the wetlands, GO diverse people were intro duced to the complexities of nature last Saturday at the Morton National Wildlife Re fuge here. Most of people were young  some carried children in backslings  but there was also a sprinkling of whitehaired senior citi zens.

title: European Hopes Buoyed
description: PARIS. Dec. 18A pickup in business confidence in Europe and a huge tide of money flow ing from Europe to the United States were seen tonight as two of the major positive developments that would emerge from the monetary accord announced in Washington.

title: Army Discharges Many Addicts in Vietnam Despite U.S. Pledges
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, Dec. 18The United States Army in Vietnam is discharging large numbers of heroin users despite pledges from President Nixon and the Pentagon to keep drug addicts in the Army for special help and rehabilitation.

title: BIRBACH'S OFFICE PICKETED BY 200
description: More than 200 supporters of the lowincome housing project in Forest Hills, Queens, demon strated yesterday on the West Side of Manhattan, outside the closed real estate office of the leader of the opposition to the project.

title: Article 4  No Title
description: LOUISVILLE, Ky., Dec. 18 (AP)Les Hunter, a reserve for lward, scored 17 points in the final period tonight to pace the Kentucky Cougars in a 9484 victory over the Dallas Chapar

title: Miss Allaire D. Wallace Bride Of James Patrick Filzmorris
description: JACKSON, Wyo., Dec. 18 Miss Allaire Devereau Wallace, granddaughter of the late Vice President Henry Agard Wallace, was married here today to James Patrick Fitzmorris, son of Mrs. Emory Jacobson of Jackson and Robert L. Fitzmorris.

title: Brooklynites Mobilize Against Sugar Refinery
description: Residents of the Bay Ridge and Sunset Park sections of Brooklyn are protesting what they contend are firm plans by the city to build a $35 million sugar refinery in their neighborhood without con sulting them, but city offi cials deny that any decisions have been made.

title: Tennis
description: While surveys concluded that tennis was more popular than ever as a par ticipant sport, money became the root of excitement and tumult at the organ ized level during 1971.

title: Horse Racing
description: A marked decrease hi patronage and betting at the New York Racing As sociation tracks In the metropolitan area, Aqueduct and Belmont Park, was one of the most significant develop ments of the year in thoroughbred racing. The decrease began after the in troduction of off course betting in June. Previously the N.Y.R.A. betting handle was confortably higher than last year's and so was the attendance.

title: Letters
description: To THE EDITOR: We would like to express our dismay at an omission in Roger Starr's impressive article on the decay of New York as a cosmopolis. He neglected to mention the crisis facing the New York Public Library, the institution which above all the rest has long expressed the quality, the breadth and the importance of New York's cosmopolitanism. If Mr. Starr is unaware of the impoverishment, the cut back in hours, the dwindling services, and the proximate closing of two of the most valuable specialized sections of New York's great library public only in its concept of service, not in its source of fundsthen this, too, is a sign of the decay of New York's cosmopolitan spirit.

title: Charles Bohlen jr. Weds Miss Rowan
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 18 St. Paul's Episcopal Church on K Street N. W. was the setting here this afternoon for the marriage of Miss Lor raine Hovey Rowan to Charles Eustis Bohlen Jr., son of the former Ambassador to the Soviet Union, the Philippines and France, and Mrs. Bohlen of Georgetown.

title: To THE EDITOR
description: To THE EDITOR: I read the interview with Rabbi Kahane. I wonder why it is that the moment this man opens his mouth, I am vividly reminded of William Steig's cartoon, Rationale of the Villain. The only other words that invariably evoke this image for me are some from Henry V:

title: Changing Pattern in Oil Deals?
description: A breach was made last week in the traditional pat terns of world oil trade.

title: Star of a Golden Age
description: In the decade following World War I, America luxuriated in the Golden Era of Sports and its greatest collection of super athletes: Babe Ruth and Ty Cobb in baseball, Jack Dempsey and Gene Tunney in boxing, Bill Tilden in tennis, Red Grange in football and Bobby Jones in golf.

title: Longtime Board Vacancy Is Filled by Its Creator
description: Stephen Samboy of Long Island City is the newest member of Community School Board 30 in western Queens, filling a vacancy that was created by his own resignation from the board almost a year and a half ago.

title: Movies
description: I HAVE just seen Frank D. Gilroy's Desperate Char acters for the second time, and have been brooding about why it is such a strangely satisfying movie. What it deals with is so plain, so familiar, and yet there is this startling sense of discovery. I did not real ize what it meant until I saw Carnal Knowledge, that pretentious, arty, sex ploiting spectacular which with all its closeups of man and woman in sexual gym nastics, in full color and with graphic sound effects seemed antisexual, out of focus and sterile.

title: San Francisco Makes Its Own Cable Cars to Replace the Old, WornOut Models
description: SAN FRANCISCO, Dec. 18 (UPI)Ever wonder why San Francisco's cable cars don't just wear out, one by one?

title: Gardens
description: THE season that has come to be known as Christ mastime has so mushroomed into a pageant near ing hysteria that the simple birth in the town of Bethlehem in ancient. Judea is almost obscured. The compounding of customs and festivities through the centuries is what has provided us with all the Christmas traditions, but none truely stem from that historic event.

title: LATE V.S.U. DRIVE BEATSIOWA STATE
description: EL PASO, Tex., Dec. 18 Bert Jones picked apart Iowa State's young defensive sec ondary for three secondhalf touchdown passes and ran for another score today to lead Louisiana State to a 3315 vic tory in the 37th annual Sun Bowl game.

title: OBSERVER
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 18The Durability of Rudolph the RedNosed Reindeer must say something about the American spirit. Wasn't it Gene Autry, back in the Stone Age of 78 r.p.m.'s, whose recording first established the thing as a success?

title: SCIENTISTS SEEK A WATCHDOG PLAN
description: A group of concerned scien tists, worried that unbridled science and technology could do more harm than good for mankind, have proposed that scientific societies establish some kind of watchdog system to alert the public to potential dangers brewing in laborato ries.

title: POLE VAULT ON BY BLAIR OF PENN
description: PRINCETON, N. J., Dec. 18 Tom Blair of the University of Pennsylvania sailed over 16 feet 9 inches on his first at tempt today to win the pole vault in the Princeton indoor relays held at Princeton Uni versity's Jadwin Gymnasium.

title: Letters:
description: To THE EDITOR: While car shuttling can be cheap, as was said in the re port on this subject (Travel section, Nov. 28), it can also be filled with many hassles. On two of the trips I took the driver's agreement that I signed had a clause saying that I would have to pay for any minor repairs up to $20; this can prove costly if sev eral things go wrong. Al though the driver does not have to pay for major re pairs, he must contact the owner before any work can be done. If the owner happens to be a company, you may have to spend the weekend in some small town before you can get in touch with the owner. Even then, you will have to shell out the money for the repairs until you deliver the car. On one occasion I picked up a car from a company only to dis cover that it did not have license plates. I had to pay $10 for a temporary sticker.

title: Et Al.
description: Hy Kraft has done just about everything in his long show biz career: music critic, book ing agent, producer, writer, etc. His book is a fast Broad way romp, and occasionally the record may be stretched to make room for a gag. But there are good things here. The chapter on Theodore Dreiser, introducing the great man urinating into the wind, his many girls stashed all over town, his causes and projects, research on a film about the Kentucky tobacco war that re veals his deep compassion and sense of social injustice. En tertaining stuff of a fasttalk ing kind.

title: I Hope to Pollute Death
description: WE all know that life is corrupt, and scarcely need the 80 characters, 17 scenes, and five hours play ing time of Jean Genet's The Screens to tell us so. But that, if I read the sprawling, circusy, symbolic, carefully obscene canvas aright, is not at all what M. Genet means to tell us. He means to tell us the life Is not yet corrupt enough, that we have not yet accepted evil as the vital principle it is, the one mov ing force in the universe, and that until we do so accept it we shall never be healthy, let alone honest. Indeed, he goes beyond that. When we have finished corrupting life, we must corrupt death, too.

title: Stamps
description: FiORELLO LAGUARDIA, who read comic strips over the radio to New York children, and was affectionately called The Lit tle Flower by New Yorkers of another generation, was mayor of this city from 1934 to 1945 and will be included in the Prominent Americans definitive postage stamp ser ies next yearalong with Benjamin Franklin.

title: CURRENCY STRAINS DATE FROM 1960'S
description: This weekend's deliberations in Washington on world mone tary problems by the Group of 10 finance ministers grew out of a series of stresses and strains the international cur rency markets have been sub jected to in recent years.

title: Drama Mailbag
description: To THE EDITOR: ISAW Harold Pinter's Old Times at a preview. Though I listened almost breathlessly, I was so angry at the end that  for the first time, despite the beautiful performance I re fused to applaud. I thought, This is nothing, nothing. I have been had. I wrote an appealing letter to Miss Ure. Then I read Clive Barnes's re view, which said it was a great play. Since I respect Barnes, I was baffled. The Emperor's new clothes, I thought.

title: DEFAULTS BY CHILE URGED IN REPRISAL
description: SANTIAGO, Chile, Dec. 18 The Socialist party, the largest in the governing leftwing coa lition, declared today that Chile had the right to refuse to pay debts of more than $2 billion to the United States if North American imperialism continues economic and diplo matic aggression against Chile.

title: Smoldering Dispute Over Polar Trips of Byrd and Peary Revived in Print
description: After years of smoldering controversy, it is now being ar gued openly, and hotly denied, that two of America's national heroes, Admirals Robert E. Peary and Richard E. Byrd both failed in attempts to reach their avpwed goalthe North Pole.

title: Dione Lucas, TV Cooking Teacher, 62
description: Dione Lucas, the doyenne of haut cuisine here, who had op erated cooking schools and fine restaurants while writing gour metrecipe books and demon strating the culinary art on television, died yesterday of pneumonia in London. She was 62 years old and had lived at 200 East 51st Street.

title: 3 Rob Canadian Bank; Loot May Be $1 Million
description: WINDSOR, Ontario, Dec. 18 (Canadian Press)Three men posing as cleaners robbed the main Windsor branch of the Royal Bank of Canada today of a sum the bank manager said could be SImillion.

title: The Long 92d
description: It has been a long, long trail awinding for the mem bers of the 92d Congress since they convened last Janu ary. The big surprise of this protracted, eventful first session has been President Nixon's adoption of most the economic programs put forward by the Democratic opposition: wageprice controls, lower taxes, public serv ice jobs for the unemployed, a radically unbalanced budget. Mr. Nixon has traveled far from old conservative orthodoxy in these eleven months.

title: Et Al.
description: The life of Josephine Butler, the 19thcentury reformer. Mrs. Butler's cause was prostitu tion. Why should prostitutes be confined and inspected while the men who infected them be let off? It was not the kind of thing a lady did, but Mrs. Butler was supported by her husband, by her deep religious faith and by the im periousness of her class. She was a beautiful, sociable lady, at times overzealous but on the whole effective. Another in the list of outstanding 19th century women who defied Victorian respectability.

title: Art
description: FOR the sheer pleasure of just see ing, all other pleasures aside for the moment, you are not likely to find right now or for the rest of the season in New York or any where else a show more beautiful to walk into than the Brooklyn Museum's Peruvian Colonial Painting, a not very, big exhibition that opened last week to run until January 23, 1972. It will be traveling to the University Art Museum in Austin, Texas (February 20March 26) and the Isaac Delgado Museum of Art in New Orleans (April 15May 28), and both those institutions would do well to study the Brooklyn installa tion by Bernard Wolff. For that mat ter, anyone involved in the business of hanging pictures could learn something here about the virtues of directness and economy backed up by perfect selec tion of colors and just the right adjust ment of lights  all based on respect for the material being displayed.

title: Hawks Down Bullets
description: ATLANTA, Dec. 18 (UP1) The Atlanta Hawks beat the Baltimore Bullets, 12394, to night. The victory broke a five game Hawks losing streak.

title: It's delimit, it's deluxe, it's delovely
description: If you want to know just how good Cole is, try reading a page of this book without singing.

title: Pro Basketball
description: Major shifts of power and pattern marked professional basketball during 1971, commercially the most successful year the sport has ever enjoyed.

title: 6TH CROWN IN ROW
description: IRVING, Tex., Dec. 18 Duane Thomas collected four touchdowns today as the Dallas Cowboys clinched their sixth consecutive Eastern Division title in the National Football League with a 3112 victory over the St. Louis Cardinals.

title: Oregon Barrel Jumper Wins World Title on Record Leap
description: GROSSINGER, N.Y., Dec. 18 (AP)Roger Wood, a 22year old insurance salesman from Portland, Ore., cleared 16 bar rels and set a distance record of 29 feet 3 inches today to win the 22d annual world bar reljumping championship.

title: The WorkObsessed
description: In the current recessionary environment, the workob sessed individual surfaces as an acute management prob lem. Petrified by the pros pects of layoffs, forced re tirement and furloughs, he now does his thing with a vengeance, retreating into longer hours, coming into the office on weekends and holi days, dramatizing his role of corporate martyr.

title: Edward L. Glazer Dead; Nassau Deputy Attorney
description: MASSAPEQUA, L. I., Dec. 18 Edward L. Glazer, chief deputy county attorney of Nas sau, died Thursday after a long illness. He was 46 years old and lived at 271 Hunter Ridge Road East.

title: Tickets Are on Sale For Millrose Games
description: Tickets for the 65th annual Wanamaker Millrose Games, which open the Madison Square Garden indoor track season on Friday, Jan. 28, are on sale at the Millrose office in John Wanamaker's, Cross County Center, Yonkers.

title: The World
description: PARISBarely two months ago, Marshal Josip Broz Tito was asked what he considered his highest achievement in 30 years as Yugo slavia's most illustrious leader. With out hesitation, the 79yearold Presi denthe had led tha resistance to Hitler, defied Stalin and organized worldwide movement of nonaligned neutral nationsreplied that he was most proud of having solved the problem of nationalist antagonisms in side Yugoslavia itself.

title: One Harold had small successes, the other had large
description: There is a photograph in this book that shows the author in the white fur hat he wore for his celebrated visit to Moscow in 1959, standing beaming with Mr. Khrushchev. In the light of all that has happened since, it is a poignant picture, from an other agesimultaneously a record both of Mr. Macmillan's own finest hour, and of almost the last moment when Britain could, in his words, be regarded as still a great and domi nating nation.

title: BRITISH SLOOP FIRST IN RACE TO SYDNEY
description: SYDNEY, Australia, Dec. 18 (AP)The 40foot British sloop Cervantes Four sailed into Syd ney tonight a provisional handi cap winner of the 180mile Southern Cross Cup race.

title: Business and Public Interest
description: CHICAGOBusinessmen contributing money to sup port a corps of reformers who are taking after some of Chicago's business and po litical giants?

title: WALL STREET
description: A pool of cash looking for an operating company.

title: Murphy Among The MeatEaters
description: The baby is safe, chief, and we've got the kidnapers.

title: Student Weds Peggy Cowden
description: WESTPORT, Conn., Dec. 18 Miss Peggy Frost Cowden, a junior at Ohio University, was married here this morn ing.to Gene Verney Baker, a senior at the university. The Rev. Cornelius Looney per formed the ceremony in St. Luke's Roman Catholic Chapel.

title: Et Al.
description: An indispensable guide to European and American drama since World War II. In suc cinctly written and alphabeti cally arranged articles that deal with ideas as well as facts, all the latest develop ments from the Theater of the Absurd to the Theater of Fact and the La MaMa experiments are discussed; all the leading playwrights of our day are in telligently analyzed. For both students and serious theater goers.

title: H.U.D. TO GIVE POOR FUNDS FOR HOMES
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 18In the largest experiment it has ever undertaken, the Depart ment of Housing and Urban Development will soon begin a nationwide test of housing al lowances seeking for the first time to meet the needs of the poor with money instead of buildings.

title: Twigs and Tree Are Sada T.
description: WHEN Sada Thompson walked into Joe Allen's bar the night she opened in Twigs, smiling like something Cartier's should package for Christmas, every patron in the place stood up and cheered. Nothing quite so spontaneous had ever hap pened before in Allen's, haunt of actors actors, who don't usually become stars overnight in their first big Broadway roles and are not known for their excessive generosity toward those who do. But Sada wasn't stir prised.

title: West German Revaluation
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 13 (Reuters)The deutsche mark will be revalued by 4.61 per cent under the international monetary agreement reached today, Karl Schiller, the Ger man Finance Minister, an nounced tonight.

title: Baseball
description: Vida Blue's the namea $13,000a year lefthander out of Mansfield, La., with two brief trials in the major leagues behind him and only 21 years old as the 1971 baseball season begins in April. Not so hot. The Washington Senators, who have not won an opening game in nine years, dispatch the youngster inside two innings with three hits, four walks and four runs. They take the game, 80, over the Oakland Athletics. Then Blue waits three days, pitches again, wins nine straight and by June becomes the commanding figure of a business beset by legal troubles and cry ing for heroes.

title: Safety Investigation Set On Air Taxi Operators
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 1B (UPI)The National Trans portation Safety Board an nounced yesterday a special safety investigation of the nation's 160 scheduled air taxi operators. It is a result of evidence uncovered in the crash of a Chicago and South ern air taxi earlier this year.

title: In a Trailer ark, Camaraderie and Peace
description: GUADALAJARA, MexicoFrom a loudspeaker somewhere comes the sound of Fred Waring's Pennsylvanians singing Adeste Fideles. The shortorder cook at Denny's pops on more french fries for a gaggle of high school girls who have just come out of Woolworth's across the street, and people, crowding the street under Christmas lights, lug shopping bags, children and little fir trees. Overhead, signs advise the world to drink Pepsi, 7Up and Squirt.

title: States Curtailing Polluters On Pollution Control Units
description: Across the country, a percep tible swing is developing away from what pollution fighters consider a major obstacle to environmental reform: the rep resentation of polluting inter lests on state boards that deal with pollution.

title: Vermont Bridge Sought
description: BURLINGTON, Vt., Dec. 18 (AP)The City of Burlington has decided to seek Federal funds for the construction of a bridge across Lake Champlain, Mayor Gordon Paquette says.

title: YOUTHS TUTORED ON VOTING RIGHTS
description: Efforts are being intensified here to register the 18to21 yearolds so they can exercise their newly won franchise in the 1972 Presidential election.

title: Sweet singer of
description: When Huddle Ledbetter wasn't fawning, he was a proud, almost arrogant man, the king of the twelvestring guitar as he told Alan and John Lomax in the summer of 1933 in Lou isiana's Angola Penitentiary where he was serving a 6to10 year sentence for assault to murder. They listened to him play and agreed. Before long, many others conceded that, true to his boast, he was about the best country blues singer of all time.

title: Letters
description: TO THE EDITOR: I read with great interest Roger Starr's article, The De cline and Decline of New York (Nov. 21). For any one who is concerned about New York, or curious about its problems, Mr. Starr's arti cle is both useful and enlight ening. However, I should like to comment on one of his ob servations.

title: Reader's Report
description: Betsy is one of the few fe malenamed protagonists who fail to experience tumescence in this latest Harold Robbins enterprise. That is because Betsy is a motorcar.

title: Pailots, F.A.A. Clash on Safety
description: NEW HAVENAbout a mile from where an Alleghe ny Airlines Convafir plummet ed to earth in flames last June 7 in a dense fog, work men are installing a network of electronic circuitry and antennas that will create an invisible slide through the sky.

title: Celtics Trounce Braves
description: BOSTON, Dec. 18 (AP) The Boston Celtics scored 20 con secutive points, including 10 by Flaybeek and 6 by Jo Jo White, in the third period tonight and trounced the Buffalo Braves, 12491, for their fifth straight victory in the National Basket ball Association.

title: Marquette Subdues Fordham;
description: MILWAUKEE, Dec. 18 (AP) Secondranked Marquette, held to a 48.48 halftime by Fordham, limited the Rams to one field goal in the first 10 minutes 7 seconds of the second half tonight and rolled to an 8768 victory, its fifth without defeat. Fordham lost for the first time in six games.

title: Track and Field
description: Track and field produced a Dream Mile, a man named Meriwether and flawless worldrecord exhibitions of hurdling and highjumping by Rod Mil burn and Pat Matzdorf in Its final fling for American athletes before serious Olympic training. Marty Liguori and Jim Ryun, America's premier milers, had their first meeting in two years at Franklin Field, Philadelphia, during the Dr. Martin Luther King Games last May, and the race surpassed expectations.

title: Miss Godfrey Fiancee
description: PASADENA, Calif., Dec. 11 Announcement has been made of the engagement of Miss Judith Godfrey, daugh ter of Mrs. Richard Calvert Godfrey of Pasadena, for merly of New York, and of the late Mr. Godfrey, a vice president of Loews Theaters and Hotels, Inc., to David Henley Day, son of Mrs. Hen ley French Day of Winston Salem, N. C., and the late Mr. Day.

title: Organized Crime Selling Official (Forged) Papers
description: Organized crime members are going into the business of selling a vast variety of official identification documents accord ing to law enforcement officials.

title: Guerrillas Gone From Jordan; Palestinians Still a Big Factor
description: AMMAN, Jordan, Dec. 11 The Palestinian commandos, with their black and white headgear, olivegreen jackets and blue sneakers, have disap peared from the scene in Jordan, but the Palestinians nevertheless are a dominant factor in this country's polit ical life.

title: IndiaPakistan
description: RAWALPINDI, PakistanIf Pakis tan had been a corporation divesting itself of a highly unprofitable subsid iary, the past week could have been one of the happiest in the nation's his tory.

title: The Continuity
description: We come this week to another solstice, another time when the great rhythms and cycles of the universe we know pass another of the markers of our year. Winter, by the almanac, begins in our Northern Hemisphere this coming Wednesday morning. In practical terms we have had winter almost a month, but this is a matter of day light and darkness, not temperature and snowfall.

title: The Nation
description: OAKLAND, Calif.The courtroom proceedings were quiet and swift. And when they ended last Wednesday, Huey P. Newton walked forth a free man. The charges that he had killed an Oakland policeman had been dis missed.

title: The Pedlar Of Swaffham
description: Like most folk tales (indeed, like history itself) The Pedlar of Swaff ham exists in several versions. Kevin Crossley  Holland has retold one of the longer, more interesting ones: more characters, more inci dents, more details of medieval English life.

title: 4 Civilians Are Killed by Bombs in Northern Ireland
description: BELFAST, Northern Ireland, Dec. 18 (AP) Four persons were killed by bombs and an other was shot in the abdomen today in renewed violence that ranged across Northern Ireland.

title: Mary Royer Is Wed Here
description: Miss Mary Susan Royer, Candless of Essex Fells, N. J., daughter of Mrs. John A. Mc and the late Robert Royer, was married here yesterday afternoon to Kenneth H. Walker, son of Mr. and Mrs. Marty Walker of New York, at the River Club by Sur rogate S. Samuel DiFalco.

title: How the White Man Painted the Red
description: HSTORY Is, largely, what you make of it. Judging from the current spate of books by and about the In dian and Indian life, the his tory of the red man in white America is in the process of being rewritten. The literary activity, however, presents only one aspect of the resur gence of interest in the fate of the Indian in American culture. The Whitney Mu seum's current exhibition, Two Hundred Years of North American Art, for ex ample, takes a lookwith stunning resultsat the usu ally neglected subject of the art works of northern Indian tribes following the advent of the white man. Generally, the preconquest arts of Mex ico and South America re ceive most of the attention.

title: Letters:
description: To THE EDITOR: While my wife and I gen erally enjoyed our first Am trak experience recently a round trip by rail between New York and Indianapolis  the absence of certain amenities did detract from the kind of comfort we think should be standard. Coffee in the westbound club car was not ready for several hours while other more ex pensive drinks were being dis pensed. Coach pillows and blankets were hawked in stead of being lent out gralis. Reading lamps were turned on and off brusquely by at tendants and conductor in stead of their use being left to the passenger's discretion.

title: Hospital Director Disputes Charges Of City Officials
description: Gordon Derzon, executive di rector of Kings County Hos pital Center, said yesterday that an unannounced tour of the in stitution early Friday was un authorized and that the public officials involved had made certain inaccurate statements.

title: Drama Mailbag
description: To THE EDITOR: I believe that the aim of illusion in art is to emphasize one or more aspects of real ity, but to do so in a unique manner. Prospero's use of magick is illusion, yet it shows, for example, the ar tist's imaginative power to create. In Old Times one would think that the purpose of illusion is to create con fusion. What is real? What really happened? Who and what are we?

title: BRUINS WIN, 43, FROM PENGUINS
description: PITTSBURGH, Dec. 18 (UPI) John McKenzie scored hir, sec ond goal of the game at 10:47 of the third period to snap a 22 tie and lead the Boston Bruins to a 43 victory over the Pitts burgh Penguins tonight in a Na tional Hockey League game.

title: IRAQI ART RETURNS TO ARABIAN NIGHTS
description: BAGHDAD, Iraq, Dec. 3 Ali Baba, Sheherazade, Sinhad the Sailor and a host of other figures from Arabian classics are returning today in the valley of the Tigris and Euphrates.

title: It's Tennis vs. Subways As Club Fightsto Survive
description: The Knickerbocker Field Club, which was founded in 1889 as Brooklyn's first ten ??? club, is fighting for sur vival.

title: LIMITOPEN EN FINISHES IN TIE
description: POTTERSVILLE, N. J., Dec. 18Mr. and Mrs. Sam Spate's In The Prime and Twin Dykes Farms Downtown Seneca won a class each and finished second in another event to tie for the limitopen jumper championship today at the Tewksbury Farms indoor horse show.

title: 3D PERIOD DECIDES
description: For the second night in a row, the Knicks ran up a 20 point victory over a National Basketball Association second year franchise when they han dled the Cleveland Cavaliers with comparative ease, 10484, last night at Madison Square Garden.

title: He Speaks for Fashion's Perverse Truth
description: LONDONFashion does not have anything to do with women, said the voice be hind the single longstemmed rose. It has to do with artistry. It's just one long paradox.

title: Manhattan Routs Wagner
description: Richie Garner's 28 points last night led Manhattan to a 119 69 victory over Wagner at the Jaspers Alumni Gymnasium.

title: China's Prisoners:
description: Speaking barely above a whisper and wringing his hands nervously, Richard G. Fecteau last Wednesday held his first meeting with reporters following his release from 19 years of imprisonment in China. When asked whether he had been a spy, as the Chinese charged, Mr. Fecteau replied almost inaudibly: No comment.

title: College Basketball
description: The University of California, Los Angeles rooters wore buttons at the Houston Astrodome that read, Gimme Five.

title: Drama Mailbag
description: To THE EDITOR: Recently my family and I had the most pleasant even ing in the theater for many a year. We went to a perform ance of To Live Another Summer, To Pass Another Winter at the Helen Hayes.

title: Jersey Writers Honor Marinaro and Downing
description: ATLANTIC CITY, Dec. 18 (AP)The New Jersey Sports writers Association has named Ed Mariner, Cornell's recordbreaking halfback, and the Los Angeles Dodger pitcher, Al Downing, as the state's athletes of the year.

title: EVANDER CHILDS WINS SWIM TITLE
description: Evander Childs High School of the Bronx ended James Mon roe's threeyear reign as team champion in yesterday's city wide Public Schools Athletic League individual swimming championships at the Queens College pool.

title: Started as a Pianist
description: Diana Lynn broke into the movies as a musician at the age of 13. A child violinist was being auditioned for a part in There's Magic in Music, a film about Michigan's Inter lochen Music Camp, and Diana agreed to accompany her on the piano.

title: Some old Greek routines
description: In the late fall of 1967 Norman Mailer spoke at Yale. The Law School auditorium was packed with a nerv ous audience, many of whom had never read a word Mailer had writ ten, but all eagerly waiting for a show, knowing that he always made a spectacle of himself. Mailer didn't let them down. Rocking back and forth towards the microphone as though unwilling to rest ton close or too far from his audience, he began a rambling series of good jokes and bad ones, sly attacks on Yale at the expense of Harvard, and casually slipped in obscenities.

title: Law / Medicine
description: Even before the confirmation of Louis Powell and William Rehnquist to the Supreme Court, civil liberties and civil rights organizations have quietly been meeting over the past several weeks to plan strategies for coping with the new Court. The seven fat years are over, quipped one lawyer, referring to the period between the ap pointment of Arthur Goldberg in 1962 and the resignation of Earl Warren in 1969. Now we have to brace for some lean ones.

title: Soviet Cruiser Spotted
description: SINGAPORE, Dec. 18 (AP) Military sources here said that a 6,000ton Soviet cruiser steamed through the Strait of Malacca toward the Indian Ocean today, three days after United States Seventh Fleet ships had transited the passage.

title: CUBAN IN LONDON DEFECTS TO U. S.
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 18The State Department said today that a senior officer of the Cuban intelligence service had defected to the United States.

title: Letters:
description: TO THE EDITOR: I resent the pseudointel lectual, iconoclastic attitude of Thomas Meehan in describ ing Those Old Movie Trayelogues (Travel section, Nov. 28). FitzPatrick's travel shorts were refreshing and enlight ening to those of us who did little traveling overseas. In the same vein, I do not see any harm to our gen eration caused by the books of Horatio Alger or the ex ploits of Frank Merriwell. Even comic books were not detrimental to our thinking process. Just because we didn't make waves, but rather followed the mainstream, did not tend to make us unhappy. If some people wish to open Pandora's boxes, they have only to look around to see the results.

title: Et Al.
description: An indictment of regional water policies by three knowl edgeable conservation writers. John Graves describes the Tex as Water Plan, which, he claims, would do away with the natural waterways in two thirds of eastern Texas; T. H. Watkins describes the urge of the urban planners in Califor nia to lay hands on unspoiled water resources to the north; Robert H. Boyle, an expert on the Hudson, demonstrates that, despite Rockefeller purewater legislation, conservation ef forts have been poorly planned. The underlying mes sage is that many currently concerned parties seem more interested in exploiting than preserving.

title: Columnist and City Editor Are Leading Figures in Village Voice Factionalism
description: The Village Voice, the pros perous and proudly contentious Greenwich Village weekly news paper, has been beset recently by a rash of internal factional ism, according to staff members.

title: Rowing
description: Crew racing is having no trouble broadening its base on the domestic club and collegiate level but great diffi culty in producing elite oarsmen who can compete on international standards. These factors were evident when United States crews were soundly beaten in the European and world youth cham pionships and failed to win one gold medal at the PanAmerican Games where the competition was less.

title: Recordings
description: BEVERLY SILLS'S formi dable performance and spectacular success as Queen Elizabeth I in Donizetti's Roberto Dave reux has led the New York City Opera to plan two more Donizetti works based on Tudor royalty. This coming spring she will sing the title role in Maria Stuarda and in the fall of 1973 the title role in Anna Bolena. This may prove to be too much of a good thing.

title: STATE CONCLUDES LILCO HEARINGS
description: HAUPPAUGE, L. I., Dec. 18 After three and a half months, the state's Department of Environmental Conservation ended its hearings yesterday into the effects of the Long Is land Lighting Company's pro posed nuclearpower generating station at Shoreham, L. I.

title: REDISTRICTING BILL HELPFUL TO 6.0.P, PASSED IN ALBANY
description: ALBANY, Dec. 18After pre dictable rounds of charges of Republican gerrymandering, the Legislature passed at a special session today a bill remapping the state's legislative districts and making them favorable to the Republican majority in both houses.

title: Grant Lifts Hempstead's Program For Handicapped
description: LIDO BEACH, L.I.The winter stillness of this lonely stretch of oceanfront is bro ken only by the screams of wheeling gulls and the whine of the restless sands.

title: Phase 2:
description: The spirit of Santa Claus was little in evidence at the Price Commission and the Pay Board last week as the Nixon Administration's antiinflation watchdogs moved to get tough in po licing Phase Two increases in prices and wages.

title: Britain Sets Market Date
description: BRUSSELS, Dec. 18 (AP) The European Common Market and Britain have decided they will sign Britain's treaty of ac cession to the Common Market Jan. 22 at Brussels Egmont Palace.

title: Helene Brent, M. B. Jeffers Are Affianced
description: Miss Helene Brent and Michael Bogue Jeffers will be married here next month.

title: Leafs Crush Sabres
description: TORONTO, Dec. 18 (UPI) Dave Neon and Denis Dupere collected two goals each to night as the Toronto Maple Leafs crushed the Buffalo Sabres, 81.

title: ADDICT PLAN AIMS TO AID VETERANS
description: A proposal for a drug treat ment program for veterans in the city that would cost an es timated total of $14.5million a year and be financed by the Federal Government was made public yesterday at City Hall.

title: News of the Rialto
description: IN this socalled ago of anxiety, why not cut down on the anxiety? But in the theater how do you do that, how do you escape the pressure and tu mult of production? Two of our more prominent play weights, Tennessee Williams and Tom Stoppard, think they may find the answers this season Off Broadway.

title: 15 L. I. Youths Crash Party And Escape With Valuables
description: MASSAPEQUA, L. I., Dec. 18 Fifteen young men and wo men crashed a teenage party here last night and escaped with assorted jewelry, liquor and keys to a truck.

title: Naotake Sato, Diplomat, Dies; Was Envoy to Soviet 194245
description: TOKYO, Dec. 18 (UPD)Nao fake Sato, the Ambassador to Moscow when the Soviet Union, declared war against Japan a week before the end of World War II in 1945, died of a heart ailment today. He was 89 years.

title: ' Nick the Knife'
description: A FEW Sunday afternoons ago, a big New York Jet tackle, Roger Finnie, defending against an end sweep, was clipped to the turf, where national television pic tured him writhing in agony. Time was called, and onto the San Diego field trotted both the Jets trainer, Jeff Snedeker, and their orthopedic surgeon, Dr. James A. Nicholas. The latter, a baldish man wearing glasses and a business suit, observed that Finnie's leg was bent from the knee at an abnormal angle and quickly diagnosed not only torn ligaments but a dislocated kneecap that ac counted for the excruciating pain. Nicholas first put his own legs be neath Finnie's knee, in order to take weight off the damaged leg, and then put his hand on the kneecap and delicately moved it back into place, reducing dislocation and somewhat easing Finnie's discomfort.

title: NO CASE
description: To THE EDITOR: In his piece on the Bern stein Mass, Howard Klein makes the point that the concern embodied in it (a concern for peace) is more important than the Mass it self.

title: An early reridering of the Rheingold Brewery
description: Brewing Company. There was Abbot and Katz's Brewery, the Eastern Brewing Com pany and Fries Brewery. There was the Claus Brewing Company and the hundreds of beer halls and taverns at tached to the breweries. And the Trommers Brewing Com pany, which made that icy beer you remember picking up at the delicatessen on Sun day afternoons.

title: Claudio Bruno Weds Claudia Lazzaro
description: PRINCETON, N. J., Dec. 18Miss Claudia Lazzaro and Claudio Bruno were married here today in the Princeton University Chapel. The Rev. William Skudlarek performed the Roman Catho lic ceremony.

title: Mississippi Drills Hard
description: OXFORD, Miss., Dec. 18 (AP) Mississippi returned to con tact work today as it continued preparations for the Dec. 30 Peach Bowl game with Georgia Tech.

title: Dance
description: TIILRF, were times when it seemed as though the entire audience was convulsed with laugh ter. It was louder than for Neil Simon and lovably rau cous. Jerome Robbins's The Concert had returned to town after 13 years absence. After the first perform ance of this new produc tion by New York City Bal let, a friend asked me: Are there many funny ballets? And, while I must say it had never particularly occurred to me, the answer is No.

title: Travel Notes: crossing the Continent By Air at a OneWay Saving of $33
description: THERE is very little being said about it (and no advertising of the fact), but it is possible to save $33 on a oneway plane trip between New York and the West Coast. The trick, as some travel agents have been pointing out to their clients, is to utilize night coach, a service offered regionally by domestic airlines but not on nonstop transcontinental trips.

title: Tribesmen's Walkout Halts a SouthWest African Copper Mine
description: JOHANNESBURG, South Africa, Dec. 18  Walkouts by laborers in SouthWest African industry have spread to the territory's largest copper mine, the Americanowned Tsumeb Corporation. Almost the entire Ovambu work force of nearly 4,000 at the mine has struck, halting production of copper and other mineral processing.

title: Miss Joan Saracino Fiancee
description: BELLMORE, L. I., Dec. 18 Mr. and Mrs. Joseph Sara cino, have announced the en gagement of their daughter, Miss Joan Ann Saraeino, to Christofer Sabb, son of Mr. and Mrs. R. Sabb of Hunting ton.

title: 125 Slain in Dacca Area Believed Elite of Bengal
description: DACCA, Pakistan, Dec. 18 At least 125 persons, be lieved to be physicians, pro fessors, writers and teachers, were found murdered today in a field outside Dacca.

title: Movies
description: MIISLED by that arrogantly inept pseudoscholar, Jan Kott, the aptly pretentious stage and screen director, Peter Brook, has given us a film version of King Lear that is a catastrophe and a scan dal. One of the world's greatest plays perhaps the greatestis reduced here to a tricky and prosaic little film, whose only and dubious raison d'etre is to pro mote the talent of Peter Brook at the expense of the genius of Shakespeare.

title: New Delhi Says Western Front Is Quiet, With Only A Few CauseFare Breaches
description: NEW DELHI, Dec. 18The western front between India and Pakistan was reported quiet today, with only a 'few minor breaches of the cease fire that went into effect yes terday, an official Indian spokesman said.

title: Mrs. Nathans Has Son
description: A son was born to Dr. and Mrs. Michael L. Nathans of Bayside, Queens, on Dec. 8 in Mount Sinai Hospital.

title: Drama Mailbag
description: To THE EDITOR: The long silent take. Dorothy Greener had perfect ed it into an art. While other comediennes relied on unin hibited mugging and grotesque posturing, Dorothy's forte was the long lingering look, eyes twinkling and full of unspoken hilarity and in variably evoking more laugh ter from an audience than pratfall or a beating with rubber bladder.

title: ITALIANS NEARING VICTORY IN BRIDGE
description: LAS VEGAS, Nev., Dec. 18 The Italian Blue team, winners of 12 world bridge titles in the fifties and sixties, headed con fidently for victory in the final of the open knockout team championship here tonight.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor: Senator McClellan, in anointing the two new Justices of the Supreme Court (0pEd Nov. 9), by implication at tributes the appalling rise in serious crimes to decisions of the Court. In short, he implies that criminals have been encouraged to expand their ac tivities by certain rulings of the Court.

title: Six Scenarios for 1980
description: WHEN you have eliminated the impossible, Sherlock Holmes told his friend Watson, what ever remains, however improbable, must be the truth. But the master sleuth was commenting on the past; as far as the future is concerned there is more than the truth. Or as Prof. Karl Popper put it in the third of his statements on Indeterminism: We cannot predict the future course of human history. But even though we cannot predict we can guess and anticipate, bearing in mind, of course, that there is always more than one possibility. Individuals may refrain from thinking about the future, but a state, a society cannot. And every form of planning ahead is, of course, based on certain assumptions; even the philosopher who has proved that prediction is a priori impossible will retire from his chair only on the assumption that he will receive a pension. There are, in other words, degrees of probability.

title: Pamela A. MacIrztyre, Teacher, Fiancee of Wilfred K. Pattison
description: SCARSDALE, N. Y., Dec. 18Miss Pamela Ames Mac Intyro and Wilfred Keith Pattison, both of Brussels, plan to be married here next spring in the chapel of the Hitchcock Presbyterian Church.

title: Over the river
description: to grandfather's house we'll go. And we'll gather round the piano and sing Christmas carols. Very definitely in tune are the new holiday clothes we'll be wearing. Orange velvet trimmed with white lace is for the littlest girl. It's $20 at Saks Fifth Avenue, second floor. Grandmother plays the piano in a white satin shirt and long tweed skirt from Davidow. Blouse, 628; skirt, $75. In Coun try Clothes, fifth floor, Lord & Taylor New York. The cellist may be short on technique, but she's long on styleher middy and navy skirt are by Stan Her man for Mr. Mort. $75. Evening Shop, Lord & Taylor in February. Our young father got his silkdotted velvet jacket and silk print shirt at Madonna, 220 East 60th Street. Shirt, $40; jacket, $165. Grand father's green velvet embroidered jacket, $165, is also from Madonna. The young mother wears a plaid taffeta blazer and black pleated skirt by Calvin Klein. $165. Fifth floor, Lord & TaylorNew York. Her little boy's black velvet Eton suit is $28 at Saks Fifth. Her younger brother's maroon velvet suit is $80 at Saks. All jewelry worn by these lucky people is from Van Cleef & Arpels. Photographed by Morgan Rank at Harkness Bouse for Ballet Arts.

title: Devine: A Strange First Season as Packer Coach
description: MIAMI, Dec. 18As Dan Devine walked toward the dressing room at halftime of the Green BayChicago foot ball game recently, he heard a familiar voice behind him.

title: Daughter to Mrs. Gold
description: A daughter was horn to Mr. and Mrs. Stewart B. Gold of South Orange, N. J., on Dec. 9 in St. Barnabas Hospital in Livingston, N. J.

title: Music
description: WHEN tenor Andrea Velis takes on the role of the Witch in Humper dinck's Hansel and Gretel at the Metropolitan on Wednesday night for the first time, his biggest prob lem won't stem from the fact that it's woman's rolemen have sung Humper dinck's crone beforebut from his urge to do his own flying onstage. Flying is easy if you don't have to sing, the slight, voluble Velis deserves. The difficulty about doing both is the heavy harness you must wear around your diaphragm; it has to be tight. I'm acrobatic enough, but can I fly and sing a B natural?

title: Miss Wasilik a Bride
description: Miss Elizabeth Wasilik, a freelance advertising copy writer, was married here yes terday to George Sereni, an investment banker. Family Court Judge John Reilly per formed the ceremony at the home of Mr. and Mrs. Dario Soria, uncle and aunt of the bridegroom. The bride is the daughter of the late Mr. and Mrs. John Wasilik of Frank lin, N. C., and the bridegroom the eon of Mrs. Paola Soria Sereni and the late Angelo Pierre Sereni of Rome and New York.

title: A Christmas Tree Grows on L.I.
description: GREENLAWN, L. I.Sal D'Angelo still has the first Christmas tree he ever bought for his home here. It is 10 years old, 15 feet high, and twice as wide around the bottom at one of Scarlett O'Hara's hoopskirts.

title: Article 2  No Title
description: Kenny Lam and Ron Jones led St. Francis to a 101.79 vic tory over Queens College on the winners count last night. Lam had 24 points and Jones 21 as the Terriers posted their sixth victory in seven games.

title: Reader's Report
description: Has anyone ever loved me? wonders George Kane, in one of the reprises of his past. Mr. Muller supplies multiple answers to this question in brilliantly orchestrated tour de force.

title: Art Auction Today to Aid Brooklyn Museum Gallery
description: The Brooklyn Museum's Community Gallery, which shows the work of neighbor hood artists from the metro politan area, will hold a bene fit art auction today from 1 to 5 P.M.

title: Manchester United Eleven Held to a Scoreless Deadlock in English Soccer
description: LONDON, Dec. 18 (Reuters) There were no changes at the top of the Eng'ish League's First Division in soccer today as the three leading clubs drew.

title: PanAmerican Games
description: The sixth PanAmerican Games, held in colorful Cali, Colombia, provided a significant preview of United States hopes for the 1972 Olympics. It also unveiled a new sports power for the AmericasCuba. In its first organized attempt at interna tional sports, the Cubans, with the assist of coaches from the Soviet Union and East Germany, won 30 gold medals, 50 silver and 25 bronze and finished a surprising second to the United States in the medal competition.

title: Campaign Notes
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 18 Further evidence of Mayor Lindsay's determination to seek the Presidency, if any is needed, becomes available almost daily. A Washington office will soon be opened under the direction of Clar ence Martin, a Washington lawyer who was formerly with the cam paign of Senator Birch Bayh of Indiana. Arthur Kaminsky, an aide to Allard K. Lowenstein, chairman of Americans for Democratic Action, has also signed on and was dispatched this weekend to Arizona to scout the prospects there.

title: WASHINGTON
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 18These are hard days for men and women who believe in the moral judgments of his tory and cling, for all our doubts, to the Christmas ideal of world unity and brotherhood.

title: I.R.S. Notifies Stores of Price Posting
description: The Internal Revenue Serv ice began sending its agents out calling on retailers last week to explain a new rule that will re quire them to post their base prices for the information of the shopper. The rule goes into ef fect Jan. 1.

title: RABBI KAHANE AND THE J.D.L
description: To THE EDITOR: Walter Goodman's excellent article, I'd Love to See the J.D.L. Fold Up. But  (Nov. 21), made it much easier for me to understand Rabbi Ka hane, but no easier for me to agree with him. According to Rabbi Kahane, the most im portant accomplishment of the Jewish Defense League has been to give American Jews  particularly the youthsomething Jewish to be proud of. Since when are bombings, shootings and van dalism something to be proud of? And, especially consider ing that the Russian intellec tuals comprise one of the largest groups in the Soviet Union generally sympathetic to the Jews there, since when is the disruption of perform ances of Soviet dancers and singers something to be proud of? The fact that Rabbi Ka hane's young followers are contributing their bombmak ing and heckling skills to a Jewish cause is no excuse for the violence they espouse and perpetrate.

title: Stifling Hyprocrisy
description: There was some surprise in Wash ington earlier this year when Repre sentative Charles C. Diggs Jr., a Detroit Democrat who is chairman of the Congressional Black Caucus, was appointed by the Nixon Administration as a member of the United States delegation to the United Nations. But there was even more surprise last Friday when the softspoken Mr. Diggs resigned from the United Nations post to protest what he called the stifling hypocrisy of Washington's policy toward Africa. He is the first member of an American delegation to quit publicly over policy.

title: The Nation
description: ATLANTAThe Southern Christian Leadership Conference has never been a particularly smooth running, well oiled machine  but while Martin Luther King Jr. lived, it seemed to mat ter little.

title: Senators Study Pleas To Allow Wider Buses
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 18A Senate subcommittee is weighing testimony in a con tinuing controversy over a Housepassed measure to al low wider buses to operate on the interstate highway system.

title: Hockey
description: Did More mean Better? That's the question the National Hockey League faced during the 197071 campaign, and one it will confront again in the coming years.

title: GIFTS TO NEEDIEST AID THE GIVER, TOO
description: Many of the contributors to the New York Times Neediest Cases Fund recorded yesterday sent short messages along with their donations extolling the virtues of giving.

title: Memphis State Triumphs Over San Joseb State, 28to9, in Pasadena Bowl
description: PASADENA, Calif., Dec. 18 (UPI)Torn Carison blocked a punt and recovered it for touchdown for Memphis State in the opening quarter and the Tigers went on to intercept four passes and pick up a fumble for a 289 victory over San Jose State in the Pasadena Bowl today.

title: Kennedy Charges justice Department Hides Extent of Wiretaps
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 18 Senator Edward M. Kennedy said today that the Justice De partment ordered 207 electronic surveillances in 1969 and 1970 under executive authority, near ly equal to the 210 approved; by the Federal courts.

title: Factors for Success
description: Professor Brzezinski lists 20 causes that cumulatively contributed to Japan's postwar economic success. During the nineteenseventies, he writes, only four have a high probability of remaining operative; 10 are doubtful, and six can be assumed to be negative.

title: Another Look at the Cereal Debate
description: A year and a half after breakfast cereal manufac turers were attacked at a Senate hearing for selling products with little nutritional value, most of the companies have fortified their products with vitamins and minerals.

title: Pamela Marvinney Is Bride in Jersey
description: SHORT HILLS, N. J., Dec. 18Miss Pamela Marvinney and Paul Underwood were married here this evening in Christ Episcopal Church by the Rev. Richard Andersen.

title: Effect of Washington Agreement
description: To devalue the dollar formally, the Administration will have to submit legislation to Congress asking for a change in the official price of gold, raising it to $38 an ounce from the level of $35 that has prevailed since 1934.

title: IndiaPakistan
description: CALCUTTAThe war ended as it began, with the Bengali people of Bangladesh, formerly East Pakistan, embracing and kissing their liberators, the Indian Army.

title: Dear Mrs. Goldsmith, Or, How To Stalk Wild Game in Africa Without a Gun Or Camera
description: ON a blackboard in the lobby of the Paraa Safari Lodge, a pleas ant oasis in the Murchison Falls game park of northwestern Ugan da, is posted the suggestion, If you have seen any interesting game while on safari in the park, please make note of your observation on this board. This may help other visitors. Helpful sojourners are invited to inscribe on the slate the date, the time and the place for each unusual animal they've spotted.

title: RED SHOES SCORES AT LIBERTY BELL
description: PHILADELPHIA, Dec. 18 For the second week in a row, Anthony Loguercio, a jockey, reached the winner's circle in the stakes race at Liberty Bell Racetrack.

title: New York
description: Gerrymandering was supposed to be a thing of the past when the United States Supreme Court laid down its oneman, onevote dictum for legislative and Congressional district mapmakers. Maybe so, but it would be hard to convince State Senator Murray Schwartz of Queens and some of his Democratic colleagues.

title: GAS FOR APARTMENTS IS CURBED BY P.S.C.
description: ALBANY, Dec. 19The Pub lic Service Commission has re jected a request from the New York State Builders Association to exclude new apartment houses whose owners want to heat with gas from the com mission's limiting of the use of natural gas.

title: Record of the First Session of the 92d Congress
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 18Following is a summary of Pres'dent Nixon's major legislative proposals and of the action taken by Congress during its 1971 session, along with bills that are pending or defeated:

title: Judi Rolin Is Bride Of Dr. E. B. Self Jr.
description: DOBBS FERRY, N. Y., Dec. 18Miss Judith Marie Rolin, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Kenneth Carl Rolin of Delray Beach, Fla., was married in the South Presbyterian Church here this afternoon to Dr. E. Baldwin Self Jr. He is the son of Dr. and Mrs. Edward Baldwin Self of Dobbs Ferry and Edgartown, Mass.

title: Anne Henning Triumphs Twice in Olympic SpeedSkating Trials
description: MILWAUKEE, Dec. 18 (AP) Anne Henning virtually clinched an Olympic berth with two more victories today, giv ing her a sweep of nil four women's events at the halfway point of the United States Olympic speed skating trials.

title: Sports of The Times
description: Even now the danger is that people are beginning to believe what Muham mad Ali proclaims rather than what really happened.

title: Boston Writers Cite Lewis
description: BOSTON, Dec. 18 (AP)  George E. (Duffy) Lewis, 83 years old, a former Boston Red Sox star who spent 54 years in baseball until his retirement as traveling secretary for the Mil waukee Braves, was named winner of the Boston Baseball Writers annual Judge Emil Fuchs Award today.

title: SCRIBNER ORDERS REVIEW OF PACTS
description: School Chancellor Harvey B. Scribner has ordered a com plete review of how the school system awards millions of dol lars of contracts to outside con cerns to evaluate federally and statefunded education pro grams.

title: L.I.U. Defeats C.C.N.Y.
description: Long Island University con tained City College's fullcourt press and pulled away in the second half to a 7758 victory last night at Founders Hall Gymnasium in Brooklyn.

title: Letters:
description: TO THE EDITOR: I don't know how educe tional FitzPatrick's Travel talks were but I do recall that they were preceded by groans of disappointment (that a cartoon or comedy was omitted) and that the final As the sun sinks slow ly  was met by cheers. I can appreciate Mr. Mee han's disgust with the view of the world as portrayed in these movies.

title: Jarring Reported in Lead for Thant's Job
description: UNITED NATIONS, N. Y., Dec. 18Dr. Gunnar V. Jarring, the 64yearold Swedish diplo mat who has been the special United Nations special repre sentative for the Middle East for the last four years, emerged four years, was reported today to have emerged as the leading candidate for the post of Secre tary General of the world organization.

title: Arline Davidow Wed To Norman S. Shaffer
description: Miss Arline Newman Dav idow, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Sanford L. Davidow of Patchogue, L. I., was mar ried at the St. RegisShera ton Hotel last night to Nor man Stuart Shaffer, son of Mr. and Mrs. Leon R. Shaf fer of West Orange, N. J. Rabbi Reuven Siegel per formed the ceremony.

title: Cable Abundance
description: The future of cable broadcasting is still up in the air but at least the options before the White House and Con gress are now in better focus. Early next year the Fed eral Communications Commission is expected to issue rules that will expandor limitthe choices on the dial for American viewers. It is essential that, above all else, the rules keep the people on the receiving end in mind.

title: MRS. HARRY WEINER
description: Mrs. Jennie Weiner, widow of Harry Weiner an insurance and real estate broker, and mother of Elihu Weiner, a writer and a member of the President's Council on the Arts, died yes terday in New York Hospital. She was 86 years old and lived at 222 West 83d Street.

title: criminals At Large
description: With the credibility gap agitating all thoughtful Ameri cans, with a growing cyni cism about politicians expressed in all quarters, with what seems to be an actual need (especially among liberals) to believe the worst, it is no longer surprising that even the Presidency be exposed as hide ously corrupt by mystery writers. Only a few months ago, Tom Ardies, in Their Man in the White House was explaining how the Russians could achieve global domina tion by putting in their own man as President. And now comes THE JUPITER CRI SIS by William Harrington (McKay, $6.95).

title: Article 3  No Title
description: MIAMI BEACH, Dec. 18 (AP) Warren Jabali, Larry Jones and Ira Harge combined for 48 points in the second half to lead the Floridians to a 117107 victory over the Indiana Pacers toni ht.

title: Offtrack Betting
description: In eight months of bumpy operation, the Offtrack Betting Corporation has succeeded in confirming both the fears of its critics and the hopes (to a lesser degree) of its proponents.

title: History Runs Afoul of L. I. Progress
description: ROSLYN, L. I.The speed limit on historic Main Street here is 25 miles an hour, but to many residents the cars, motorcycles and fire trucks wheeling down the winding, treeshaded road are more than just another reminder of suburban America.

title: Ellen Murphy Is Betrothed
description: Mr. and Mrs. Grayson MP. Murphy of New York and Sandy Hook, Conn., have announced the engagement of their daughter, Miss Ellen Cabeen Murphy, to Miner Hill Warner, son of Mr. and Mrs. Bradford A. Warner of New York and Oyster Bay, L. I.

title: Healthy Growth Seen Aided by a Setting Of Space and Calm
description: A psychoanalytic consideration of normal growth and develop ment of children would include constitutional factors, the inner drives of the child, and the en vironment. This discussion about suburban living would naturally only be concerned with favorable and unfavorable factors in the environment.

title: Hogarth: The Anxious Genius
description: ROGER FRY, the dis tinguished art critic and one of the bright est members of the Bloomsbury Circle, was a man about whom his friends always loved to tell stories. One such anecdote concerned a lecture he was said to have delivered to a somewhat un sophisticated audience, made up of enthusiastic old ladies, in which he had endeavored to explain the formal virtues of a famous work by Rubens. The artist's subject was the Deposition from the Cross, end, having discussed the subsidiary parts of the de sign, he had announced, stab bing at the center of the can vas and raising his voice to the peculiarly resonant level that all good Bloomsburians then affected: And now, ladies, we must examine the imposing central mass. This application of the doctrine of significant form to the im age of their Saviour had struck Roger Fry's audience as strikingly irreverent.

title: Miss Johnson Wed to G. F. Baker 3d
description: HOUSTON, Dec. 18Mr. and Mrs. Lewis Johnson have announced the engagement of their daughter, Miss Mari anna Johnson, to George F. Baker Sd, greatgrandson of George F. Baker, the finan cier who was a founder and board chairman of the First National Bank, now the First National City Bank of New York. The wedding is planned for April 1 in Philadelphia.

title: Too Few For Drums
description: Old soldier stories never die. The best of them merely take time out periodically for a little wellearned R&R, then it's back into uniform for the next campaign, whether on paper, film or stage. They're tough, those old vets: the P.O.W. scenario, the sweeping beachheadtoconquest saga, the team of unlikely heroes.

title: A Touch Of Frisco In Brooklyn Is Proposed
description: Can a bit of the charm of an Francisco's Fisher men's Wharf and Ghiradelll Square be transplanted along a rundown strip of Brooklyn waterfront between the Brooklyn and Manhattan Bridges?

title: Tanzania Cuts Travel Funds
description: DAR ES SALAAM, Tanzania, Dec. 18 (Agence FrancePresse) Foreign tourist travel allow ances for Tanzanians were cut in half this week, from 200 to 100 (about $240).

title: Hawks Down Stars, 41
description: BLOOMINGTON, Minn., Dec. 18 (AP) The Chicago Black Hawks blitzed Minnesota with three firstperiod goals tonight and posted a 41 victory that increased their West Division lead over the North Stars to points.

title: Steelers Activate Al Young
description: PITTSBURGH, Dec. 18 (AP) The Pittsburgh Steelers of the National Football League activated today Al Young, a rockie wide receiver, for the final game tomorrow against the Los Angeles Rams. Young will replace Terry Hanratty, re serve quarterback who suffered a fractured left collarbone last Sunday in Cincinnati.

title: IN THE NATION
description: Prof. Herman Schwartz of the law faculty at the State University of New York in Buffalo is a busy man. He has been working nonstop this fall to protect the legal rights and in some cases the physical wellbeing of pris oners who were in revolt at Attica last September. He is also managing several suits by reporters for better access to prisons and prisoners, and now he has compiled the most com plete figures available on the extent, cost and results of electronic surveil lance in America. They are shocking.

title: Cinoirmati Bows, 8279
description: LAWRENCE, Kan., Dec. 18 (AP)Kresimir Cosic hit four free throws in the last three minutes that brought Brigham Young an 8279 victory over Cincinnati for third place in the Jayhawk Basketball Tourna ment tonight.

title: Miss Ann Blair Married on L.I. To a Rhodesian
description: COLD SPRING HARBOR, L. I., Dec. 18Miss Ann Wyndham Blair, daughter of Frederic Roberts Blair of Lloyd Harbor, Huntington, and of Mrs. Johnson Blair of Pine Knots, Va., was married here today to Anthony St. Vincent de la Rue, son of Mr. and Mrs. Ian Hector de la Rue of Ruware Ranch, Chiredzi, Rhodesia.

title: Bettors Are Off and Running From Big A
description: The lottery ed in the sub way car read: Tis the Sea son to Have Money, but few of the, horseplayers no ticed it.

title: Pro Awards to Trevino And Kathy Whitworth
description: Lee Trevino has been named winner of the Byron Nelson Award and Kathy Whitworth, winner of the Mickey Wright Award by Golf Digest magazine.

title: Jones's Route to the Grand Slam
description: ATLANTA, Dec. 18 (AP) Bobby Jones won golf's only grand slam, in 1930. Here is how he did it:

title: THE WEEK IN FINANCE
description: FINANCIAL and business authorities around the world were highly elated last week when President Nixon proclaimed the United States willingness to devalue the dollar for the first time in nearly four decades as a catalyst for achieving a new international monetary order.

title: Mrs. Barbara Smith Bride of Lawyer
description: Mrs. Barbara DeWitt Smith was married here yesterday afternoon to Peter Frank Rient, an Assistant United States Attorney for the Southern District of New York and its chief appellate attorney.

title: Shelter Isle Still Doesn't Know Who Won Vote
description: SHELTER ISLAND, L. I. The residents of this small town still didn't know last week who their next Town Supervisor would be  the popular owner of a moving and storage concern or a cheerful checkout man at the island's only supermarket.

title: Text of communique on Monetary Talks
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 18 (UPI)Following is the com muniqud issued by the minis ters at the monetary meetings:

title: Deadline on Film Site Nears
description: It's closed now and empty of people. It has been since June. Its complex of build ings that house motion pic ture sound stages: film, tape and sound equipmentdead storage grid entertainment history  are enclosed by wire and guarded by mili tary policemen. The Army Pictorial Center in Astoria, Queens, waits for its even tual fate.

title: Music
description: NEXT Tuesday Alex ander Schneider will be 63 years old. As in the past two years, he will spend his birthday leading the young, instruct ing and conducting the 56 musicians (average age, 17) in the Christmas String Semi nar. Not without reason, one of his administrative associates, Frank Salomon, thinks that a good sobriquet for the violinistconductor is The Pied Piper of Vilna (Vilna being his birthplace).

title: FOREIGN AFFAIRS
description: CAIROEgypt is the world's oldest nationstate and its Nile Valley is the center of the oldest legends. More over, the habit of developing excellent myths partly rooted in truth is still an Egyptian habit. Current mythology sees a powerful but foolish United States, guilelessly led around by Israel, causing this country's contemporary misfortunes.

title: Learning Techniques of Deaf Demonstrated at L5.155 in Bronx
description: The National Theater of the Deaf showed some seventh and eighth graders in Intermediate School 155 in the Bronx last week how to talk with their hands, and eyes and faces and bodies.

title: Garner: Why Interview Me?
description: THEY told me, from New York, to go to Universal Studios, but they were wrong. They don't know anything back East, except how to be lib eral, and their mistake put me in a mean temper. Uni versal is plastic and deca dent, and I had been look ing forward to an afternoon doing something plastic and decadent, and getting paid for it, never mind the pal try sum. Instead, I learned, I was supposed to go to Warner Brothers, and that's serious. Movies are made there.

title: MILWAUKEE MAYOR TO SHUN REPORTERS
description: MILWAUKEE, Dec. 18 (UPI) Mayor Henry Maier said yes terday that he would no longer answer any questions asked by reporters from The Milwaukee Journal, The Milwaukee Senti nel or the Journal Company's television and radio stations.

title: NETS TURN BM COUGARS, 118106
description: CHARLOTTE, N. C., Dec. 18 Melchionni, who led all scorers with 28 points, com bined with John Roche tonight to lead the New York Nets to a 118106 American Basketball Association victory over the Carolina Cougars.

title: A Black View
description: NEIL SIMON and Amer icaquiet as it's kept invented each other. Have patents and ??? I mean you can't Iook, cannot have looked, at the man's work these few yeas gone by and not rec ognize that some eerie sort of relationship exists between Simon's fascinating ability to manipulate citizens the na tion over into believing he is amusing them, and Amer ica's equally facile gift for creating such men as he to help her believe the world need not be taken seriously.

title: Massachusetts Democrats Change Rules for Delegates
description: BOSTON, Dec. 18 (AP)The state Democratic Committee broke with tradition today and voted unanimously not to en dorse candidates for delegate and alternate to the party's na tional convention. In past years, endorsements have been ap proved automatically.

title: Teacher Weds Melissa Smith
description: BLOOMFIELD, Conn., Dec. 18  Miss Melissa Clinton Smith, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Edward Lee Smith, was married here this afternoon to Frost Wheeler Hubbard, son of Mr. and Mrs. Allen S. Hubbard Jr. of New York.

title: Ann Clifford Boothby Is Affianced
description: PHILADELPHIA, Dec. 18 Willard Sands Boothby Jr., president of the investment banking house of Eastman Dillon, Union Securities & Co., and Mrs. Boothby of Chestnut Hill have announced the engagement of their daughter, Miss Ann Clifford Boothby, to Francis Daniels Moore Jr., a senior at Harvard University. He is the son of Dr. and Mrs. Francis D. Moore of Brookline and Marion, Mass. His father is chief of surgery at the Peter Bent Brigham Hospital in Boston and Moseley Professor of Surgery at the Harvard Medical School.

title: Richard I. Burnham Is Fiance Of Miss Fanchon M. Watkins
