title: ROBERT R. MILLER, 68, OF AEROSPACE FIRM
description: LOS ANGELES, Dec. 20  Robert R. Miller, aerospace in dustry executive, died yester day in Santa Monica Hospital. He was 68 years old and lived here.

title: Johnny Addle, 69, Announcer At Garden Boxing Bouts, Dead
description: Johnny. Addie, the ring an nouncer for more than 100 world championship bouts at, Madison Square Garden and other boxing arenas in New York during the last 25 years, died of a blood infection yes terday at the age of 69.

title: Advertising:
description: Adolph J. Toigo has re leased 75 per cent of his stock in Lennen & Newell and relinquished his chief execu tive title, according to Wil liam C. Lyddan, president and new chief executive.

title: 65 Debutantes Bow at Cotillion
description: The Debutante Cotillion and Christmas Ball, annual benefit for the New York In firmary, went its traditional way last night at the Wal dorfAstoria, where the de cor was, as usual, in shades of pink. Sixty  five young women wearing full  length white ball gowns and long white gloves were presented at the 36th event.

title: George Rubinovitz, 57, Dies; Aide at Chemical Concern
description: George Rubinovitz, corporate secretary of Witco Chemical Corporation, died Friday of a heart attack in Manhasset (L.I.) General Hospital. He was 57 years old and lived at 17 Southgate Road, Great Neck, L.I.

title: Walter Leichter, 68, Led Jersey Bar Association
description: ENGLEWOOD, N.J., Dec. 20 Walter Leichter, president of the New Jersey Bar Association in 196364 and a member of the Union City law firm of Hol lander & Leichter, died of a stroke today in Englewood Hospital. He was 68 years old and lived at 94 Dwight Place.

title: Democrats Redistrict California, But Veto by Reagan Is Expected
description: SACRAMENTO, Calif., Dec. 20  The Democratic  con trolled Legislature ended a special session on reapportion ment early this morning, hours after the Democrats were suc cessful in passing three reap portionment bills designed to assure them of a majority in Congressional, State Senate and Assembly districts.

title: ENVOY IN WARSAW RECALLED BY PEKING
description: WARSAW, Dec. 20Peking's Ambassador to Poland, Yao Kuang, left Warsaw today after a brief 16month assignment. His recall prompted speculation that China was reducing the level of diplomatic representa tion here.

title: Film: Polanski's and Tynan's Macbeth
description: So much has been written and rumored about the nudity and violence of Roman Po lanski's Macbeth that it seems worth insisting that the film is neither especially nude nor unnecessarily vio lent. There is some nudity the sleepwalkers scene; a steaming coven of perhaps three dozen weird sisters; more importantly, the naked chest of Duncan before it re ceives the dagger. And there is much quite energetic vio lence. But the nakedness seems natural to Polanski's construction of the single state of man. And the vio lence, together with the blood it makes flow, is surely part of what Macbeth is all about.

title: Shop Talk
description: At this time of year, Irene Allen Inc., normally a fash ion boutique at 150 East 54th Street, takes on the look of a general store. Not just any general store, mind you, but a city slicker's version of one, with homemade cookies and children's felt aprons and baskets of dried flowers and a collection of Victorian objects and needlepoint designs and homemade can dies all in a jumble with some of the most sophisticated clothes in town.

title: 19 SWORN TO PANEL FOR NATIONAL PARK
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 20 Hailing the end of a long struggle, Secretary of the In terior Rogers C. B. Morton swore in the 19 members of the Chesepeake and Ohio National Historical Park Commission to day.

title: HIALEAH TO EQUAL 1970 PURSE MEL
description: MIAMI, Dec. 20Hialeah Race Course, forced by court order to accept racing dates in the last third of the season for the first time in its 47year history, announced today its 11972 stakes schedule. The track maintained the purse level of its 1970 meeting, when it had the lucrative middle dates.

title: West Side Debate Echoes Forest Hills
description: The West Side Urban Re newal area, the largest and most highly lauded model of integrated community planning in the country, is split by an angry debate that in its most emotional moments echoes the furor of Forest Hills.

title: Hammer Bequeaths $12Million in Art to 2 Museums
description: Dr. Armand Hammer, the West Coast industrialist who with associates recently pur chased the Knoedler Art Gal leries here, has bequeathed a multimilliondollar art collec tion to two museums, the Los Angeles County Museum of Art and the National Gallery of Art in Washington.

title: LUMINOUS LAGOON VICTOR AT LAUREL
description: LAUREL, Md., Dec. 20wal ter D. Fletcher's Luminous La goon, the 9.10 favorite, galloped to a 1  length victory over Mad Cutie today on a sloppy track at Laurel Race course.

description: Jay L. Kriegel, one of Mayor Lindsay's closest advisers, yes terday denied his own previous sworn testimony that he once told Mr. Lindsay about an al legation that the Police De partment was not properly in vestigating a report of wide spread corruption within its ranks.

description: CLEVELAND, Dec. 20 (UPI) The National Basketball As sociation informed the Cleve land Cavaliers today that their protest of a game with the Buf falo Braves Dec. 3 had been upheld by the league.

title: Picking Up the Pieces
description: A divided and debtridden United Nations finally took a positive step toward useful action when the General Assembly voted with nearunanimity to create new machinery to deal more effectively with natural disasters of international importance.

title: Warriors Get Right to Sue To Keep Barry From Nets
description: SAN FRANCISCO, Dec. 20 (UPI)A Federal judge weaved today the threads of the com plicated fiveyear lawsuits in volving the Golden State War riors and Rick Barry.

title: Young Outsiders Try Sensitive, job of Mine Inspector
description: BECKLEY, W. Va., Dec. 8 When Bryan Sargeant was growing up in New Hamp shire; the only time he ever saw coal was when an occa sional freight car passed through town.

title: Governor Seeks Votes on Fiscal Plan
description: Governor Rockefeller quietly began yesterday to round up votes for his emergency fiscal program at the special session of the Legislature that will con vene next Monday.

title: 4 in Plane Land on Road
description: CHARLOTTE, N.C., Dec. 20 (UPI)A small plane with four men from Chesapeake, Va., aboard made an emergency crash landing on a sixlane downtown thoroughfare today when it ran out of gasoline three miles from the Douglas Airport. No one was seriously hurt.

title: BUTZ REJECTS CALL TO SUSPEND AN AIDE
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 20 (UPI) The Secretary of Agriculture, Earl L. Butz, rejected today Senator's request to suspend top aide, pending completion of investigations into alleged violations of farm subsidy rules by farmers in Kern County, Calif.

title: Coast Pilots Defy Order
description: SAN FRANCISCO, Dec. 20 (UPI)  An attempt by Hughes Airwest Airlines to resume service today during a mechan ics strike failed when pilots did not report for work despite a court order. A court order issued in Los Angeles last weekend prohibited the Airline pilots Association from order ing its members to respect the picket lines of the Aircraft Mechanics Fraternal Associa tion.

title: U.S. Recognition Foreseen
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 20 (Reu ters) The United States will have no difficulty recognizing the new Pakistani Government under President Bhutto, the State Department said today.

title: U.N. Bids Israelis Rescind Annexation of Arab Lands
description: UNITED NATIONS, N.Y., Dec. 20  The General Assembly voted 53 to 20 today to call on Israel to rescind policies lead ing to the annexation of Arab lands, the deportation of its Arab residents and establish ment of Israeli settlements. Fortysix countries abstained.

title: BUDGET APPROVED IN WESTCHESTER
description: WHITE PLAINS, Dec, 20 The Westchester County Board of Legislators today approved a record budget for 1972, while directing the county adminis tration to cut proposed higher property taxes by $2million.

title: U.S. Supports Protest Against Ouster by U.N. of Two Taiwan Correspondents
description: UNITED NATIONS, N. Y., Dec. 20  A spokesman for the United States mission said to day that the Government fully supports protests made by American and foreign journal ists over the disaccreditationl of two Chinese Nationalist cor respondents here on the de mand of the Peking Govern ment.

title: COSTELLO RESIGNS AS DEPUTY MAYOR
description: Deputy Mayor and City Ad ministrator Timothy W. Cos tello, one of the members of the original Lindsay cabinet in 1966, announced yesterday that he would resign in April to be come president of Adelphi Uni versity in Garden City, L. I.

title: GERMAN OFFICIALS SIGN BERLIN PACT
description: BERLIN, Dec. 20 (Reuters) German negotiators today com pleted their contribution to an overall Berlin settlement by signing agreements on West Berliners visits to the East, and straightening out some border anomalies.

title: NATO Europe: Area of Peace
description: The turbulent quartercentury since. World War II has brought armed conflict to many areas of the globe Southeast Asia, the Middle East, Africa and, most recently, to the Indian subcontinent. But Western Europe, the one regton that earlier, twice in a generation, had plunged the whole world into war and is still today the most vital stake in the rivalry of the superpowers, has remained throughout this period an area of peace.

title: MOSCOW SAYS U.S. PROVOKES HAVANA
description: MOSCOW, Dec. 20The So viet Union charged today that the United States had intensi fied tensions with Cuba without justification as part of an effort to prevent LatinAmerican na tions from restoring normal dip lomatic relations with Havana.

title: TAKERS ARE NEAR PRO TEAM MARK
description: The Los Angelbs Lakers, who have not been beaten in 50 days and have won 25 straight Na tional Basketball Association games, have come east on a record hunting tour.

title: Elder Hopeful of Bid to Masters

description: CRANFORD, N.J., Dec. 20 Charles J. Gallagher of 207 Maple Place, for 23 years a public relations representative for the Port of New York Au thority, died Saturday after ap parently suffering a heart at tack at his home. He was 46 years old.

title: Article 3  No Title
description: HUNTINGTON, W. Va., Dec. 20 (AP)Marshall University overwhelmed Maine tonight with a firsthalf pressing de fense to coast to its seventh consecutive victory, 10068.

title: The Roots of Freedom
description: OTTAWAI think that in the free societies we have to realize more and more the uncertainties, the credibility gaps, particularly the gap between ris ing expectations on the one hand and the possibility of fulfilling those ex pectations. We are in some danger, I think, of destroying the roots of free dom from which our societies grow.

title: Daniel Berrigan Parole Rehearing Due
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 20 The United States Board of Parole agreed today, for medical reasons, to reopen the case of the Rev. Daniel Berrigan, a Roman Catholic priest now im prisoned for his part in de stroying draft records in Mary land.

title: Toward Campaign Reform
description: The campaign spending bill agreed upon by House Senate conferees greatly improves existing law while till falling short of the reforms required.

title: EWBANK TO STAY AS JETS COACH
description: Weeb Ewbank will return as coach of the Jets next year and hell have Joe Namath as his quarterbackunless $42million worth of oil wells spring up in Nainaths way.

title: 5 Held as Suspects in Shooting Of Two Policemen in Newark
description: NEWARK, Dec. 20Five men have been arrested in connec tion with the shooting yesterday of two plainclothes policemen.

title: Neglected by Their Parents, They Suffer at Hands of Society
description: DETROITI haven't had nay birthday celebrated in four years. Four years, Mark; an 11yearold boy con fined to the Youth Home here, said in a recent interview. It sometimes passed and I didn't even know it.

title: An Appraisal
description: There is a 40foot hole in the ground at 111 West 46th Street that may be the most important thing that has happened to American thea ter in a long time. It con tains a 290seat house with six levels above it, making a neat package of stage and rehearsal spaces, offices, services, Iounge, cafe and cabaret, and it is the first new theater built under commercial auspices In New York since 1928. It is the American Place Theater, for merly of St. Clement's Church, farther west on 46th Street, a nonprofit, subscrip tion group specializing in the work of living American playwrights. Its new $1.8 million home, which adjoins and is part of a new office tower, was officially dedi cated by Mayor Lindsay at special performance last night.

title: War Swirls Into Hotel Neutral Zone; Shooting and Looting Mark Last aLLU. LAJULing drK Laast uays
description: DACCA, Pakistan, Dec. 20 Notes on a stay in Dacca dur ing the IndianPakistani war:

title: Powell Visits High Court
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 20 (UPI) Lewis F. Powell Jr., who will become a Justice of the Su preme Court on Jan, 7, visited the court building today to find my way around.

title: Dollar Flow From Europe To U.S. Is Seen Beginning
description: PARIS, Dec. 20  What is expected to be a great reverse tide of money, this time across the Atlantic and into the United States, apparently began mov ing today even as most foreign exchange markets were closed in Europe following the week end currency realignment.

title: Bridge: Two Married Couples Take Swiss Mixed Team Laurels
description: The Swiss mixed team championship, an event that concluded the Greater New York Bridge Association's winter regionals at the New York Hilton Sunday, was won by two married couples, Paul and Abby Heitner of Mount Vernon and Ken and Judy Parker of Byram, Conn. Five board matches, scored on a boardamatch basis, were played, and the victors took nine of 10 to head a field of 136 teams.

title: 7 Companies Donated $159,000 To State Transport Bond Fight
description: Three utilities, three oil com panies and the Metropolitan, Life Insurance Company con tributed a total of $159,000 to the committee that spearheaded the unsuccessful campaign for the $2.5billion state transpor tation bond issue, it was dis closed yesterday.

title: Soviet Imposes an 8% Charge On Changing Dollars to Rubles
description: MOSCOW, Dec. 20The So viet Union moved toward an upward adjustment of the ruble dollar exchange rate today by imposing an 8 per cent hank charge on all conversions from dollars into Soviet currency.

title: 2 DEPUTIES NAMED TO URBAN LEAGUE
description: Vernon E. Jordan Jr., who will become executive director of the National Urban League on. Jan. 1, announced yester day the appointment of two deputy directors and a genera; counsel.

title: Executive Changes
description: Leslie Fay, Inc., announced yesterday the election of John J. Pomerantz as president of the apparel manufacturer. Formerly an executive vice president, he succeeds Zachary Buchalter who died last Friday. Mr. Pomerantz, 36 years old and son of the chair man, Fred P. Pomerantz, in recent months during Mr. Buchalter's illness has served as chief operating officer. He is also president of the Joan Leslie Divi sion, which he started in 1962. Walter Leiter, vice presidentfinance, was elected executive vice president and a director.

title: children Tell Why They Aid Neediest
description: Some of the children wanted peace in the world; some sought more love among people; a few of the young donors wanted more friends while other students wanted less homework; and one 10 yearold wanted lifetime tick ets to future Jets and Super bowl football games.

title: FUTURES PRICES DECLINE SHARPLY
description: Cotton futures No. 2 closed 0.05 cent to 0.75 cent a pound lower on the New York Cotton Exchange yesterday. The mar ket was under heavy commis sionhouse liquidation, with some trade hedging. Losses ranged as much as $6.35 a bale during trading.

title: IN THE NATION
description: Earlier this year, following the con viction of Lieut. William Calley for murdering 22 civilians during the mas sacre at Mylei, I was asked to uphold in a television debate the position that Calley was being made a scape goat for the guilt of many others, and should therefore be freed.

title: CANADIAN DOLLAR FLOATS STEADILY
description: TORONTO, Dec. 20 Cana da's. Minister of Finance, Edgar J. Benson, made a new rhetor ical effort today to nudge the floating Canadian dollar lower in foreignexchange trading, but the market wasn't listen ing.

title: Moraites Is Freed on Parole
description: DANBURY, Conn., Dec. 20 (AP)  Peter Moraites, former Speaker of the New Jersey As sembly was released on parole today after serving nearly nine months of a 16month sentence at the Federal Correctional Institution here. Moraites be gan serving the term on March 26, after pleading guilty to ac cepting $1,600 from a shipping company that had sought loans from the Midland Bank & Trust Company, of which he was di rector.

title: COURT TO REVIEW CRIME PATIENTS
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 20The Supreme Court has decided to determine whether the United States legal system will permit the indefinite incarceration of compulsive lawbreakers for psy chiatric rehabilitation, even though they are not legally in sane.

title: DAVID M. BORCINA
description: David MacMillan Borcina, who retired Oct. 1 as secretary treasurer of the Lead Indus tries Association, died Sunday in Long Island College Hos pital. He was 57 years old and lived at 3405 Avenue U in Brooklyn, of which he was a lifelong resident.

title: Frogman Is Among 9 Persons Convicted of Cocaine Smuggling
description: Nine members of a Chilean cocainesmuggling ring, who hired a frogman to carry the drug at midnight from a freight er to a deserted dock in Brook lyn, were convicted last night of conspiracy by a Federal Dis trict Court jury.

title: Italian Electors' Impasse May Break 1964 Record
description: ROME, Dec. 20When Italy's 1,008. grand electors meet again tomorrow in the fishbowl atmosphere of the Chamber of Deputies hall for their 19th round of voting in their search for a new head of state, they have a good chance of breaking a record.

title: Girl Caroler, 9, Killed by Car
description: BOYD, Tex., Dec. 20 (UPI)  A car plowed into a group of children singing Christmas car lois outside a church late yes terday, killing a 9yearold girl, Seven other children and a 19 yearold girl were injured.

title: News Analysis
description: LONDON, Dec. 19Britain's essential'problem with the Unit ed States these days can be stated fairly simply: The people are indifferent toward almost anything American, the Govern ment is annoyed with much that is done in Washington and the official policy is to do everything possible to keep American troops and commitments fully engaged in Europe, In fact, nervousness about a reduction of the American forceseven a reduc tion matched by Soviet disen gagement in Central Europe is the most conspicuous com mon element in the current policies of Britain, France and West Germany.

title: Shattered Dream
description: To the sordid record of police corruption unveiled by the Knapp Commission has now been added an even more depressing saga of official indifference born of the apparent belief that graft was so ingrained it was better left unchallenged.

title: Mrs. Abzug Attacks Ruling on Rents, but State Housing Aide Voices Approval
description: Representative Bella S. Ab zug charged last night that the Price Commission's ruling on rentcontrolled apartments was an outrageous disregard of the will of Congress, and she said that she would announce today plans for major action against the ruling.

title: EXIMBANK TO OFFER NEW DISCOUNT PLAN
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 20 The ExportImport Bank an nounced today that next month it would begin operating a new discount program for short term export credits (those run ning up to one year).

title: Supreme Court Actions.
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 20 The Supreme Court took the following actions today:

title: SOVIET ARRIVALS PUT AT 12,000 BY ISRAELI
description: TEL AVIV, Dec. 20 (Reuters) A record number of Jewish immigrants12,000have en tered Israel from the Soviet Union so far this year as a re sult of the liberalization of So viet emigration policy over the last feW months, a Jewish Agency official said last night.

title: Legislators Tour School for the Retarded
description: A delegation of state legisla tors, touring the Willowbrook State School for the mentally, retarded yesterday, walked into a ward where 65 profoundly retarded and disturbed men were being cared for by two attendants, one of them a wo man.

title: Pennsy PensionFund Misuse Alleged
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 20 The staff of the Interstate Commerce Commission said to day that former top officers of the Penn Central Transporta tion Company had probably been guilty of a conflict of in terest when they invested funds from the employe pen sion plan in stocks they were also buying for themselves.

title: Stocks Climb in Heavy Trading
description: Foreignexchange trading here yesterday provided the first market response to the weekend's currency realign ment. The response was not unexpected: The dollar im proved a bit, foreign curren cies moved to approximate their new official values and trading activity was subdued and cautious.

title: GROWTH IN MONEY VOTED BY RESERVE
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 20  (Reuters)The Federal Reserve Open Market Commitee unan imously voted to work to ward achieving moderate growth in the money supply at its Sept. 21 meeting, the Federal. Reserve reported today.

title: 4 POLICE AMONG 5 SEIZED IN BRIBERY
description: Four plainclothes men and the owner of a Manhattan cocktail lounge were arrested yesterday on bribery charges stemming from the testimony of Patrolman William R. Phil lips before the Knapp Commis sion last October.

title: Johnny Addie Dies at 69
description: Johnny Addie, the ring an nouncer at more than 100 world championship bouts at arenas in New York during the last 25 years, died yes terday of a blood infection at the age of 69. Obituary on Page 38.

title: CURRENCY ACCORD SENDS STOCKS UP IN HEAVY TRADING
description: The historic monetary agree ment reached over the weekend led to extremely heavy trad ing and sharp price fluctuations yesterday on the New York Stock Exchange amid indi cations of renewed confidence, from foreign investors.

title: Wishbone Inventor Named Texas Aggies Head Coach
description: COLLEGE STATION, Tex., Dec. 20 (UPI)  Emory Bel lard, the offensive aide who in troduced the wishboneT attack to college football at the Uni versity of Texas, accepted a fiveyear contract today to be come head coach and athletics director at Texas A. and M. University.

title: JOSEPH REYSON OF REVLON DIES
description: Joseph Revson, a founder of Revlon, Inc., the cosmetic con cern, died Sunday of a heart attack at his apartment in Carlton House. He was 66 years old.

title: Excerpts From Testimony Before Knapp Commission
description: Following are excerpts from testimony yesterday before the Knapp Commission on the fifth day of its second series of public hearings aris ing from its inquiry into po lice corruption here. The com mission heard nine days of testimony in October.

title: JOHNSON'S LIBRARY TO OPEN DOCUMENTS
description: AUSTIN, Tex., Dec, 20For mer President Lyndon B. John son announced today that his Presidential library would open the 250,000 documents on his education activities to the pub lic and scholars on Jan. 26.

title: KODAK AND FOTOMAT SETTLE LITIGATION
description: The Eastman Kodak Company and the Fotomat Corporation of Los Angeles announced yester day that they had reached a settlement on all outstanding litigation between the two com panies. They had been engaged in a series of legal battles since Kodak sued Fotomat in Feb ruary, 1970, charging trademark infringement, alleging that Fotomat had misused the Kodak name on certain facilities.

title: Allende's Rally Smaller Than Planned
description: SANTIAGO, Chile, Dec. 20 Fewer than 20,000 people turned out today for a rally called by the leftwing Govern ment of Chile as a demonstra tion of support for President Salvador Allende Gossens.

title: U.S. Yachts Finish 123 In Southern Cross Race
description: SYDNEY, Australia, Dec. 20 (AP)The United States team had the, first three finishers to day in the third race of the Southern Cross oceanyachting series.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor: With starvation in Vietnam, Pakis tan, India and in parts of our own United States, it seems heartless for us to anticipate and celebrate Christ mas by buying yet another plastic toy, another jewel, another gadget we will use and enjoy for a while and then set aside on the shelf.

title: P.S.C. Aide Terms Repair Work Lag Threat to. Con Ed
description: ALBANY, Dec. 20A Public Service Commission engineer testified today at a hearing that power production by the Con solidated Edison Company has been endangered by the gen erally poor condition of the company's generating equip ment.

title: Saigon Asks Students Abroad to Return
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, Dec. 20  Early next year a South Vietnamese Government delegation will leave on roundtheworld tour to per suade thousands of expatriate students to leave the comfort, fun and safety cf foreign uni versity life and go home.

title: Chastity Ruled Unrelated to Tenancy
description: The chastity of a tenant is not essential to the preserva tion of her lease with the landlord, a Civil Court judge has ruled in a decision made public yesterday.

title: India Censors Execution Photos As Harrniul to National Interest
description: CALCUTTA, India, Dec. 20 (AP) Indian telegraphic au thorities told The Associated Press today that five photo graphs showing the executions of suspected East Pakistani col laborators in Dacca could riot be transmitted because they were detrimental to the na tional interests.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor: The editorial page of The Times of Thursday, Dec. 16, included a letter purportedly written by me with re spect to the effect of the recent school budget cuts on the city's edu cational program in general and at the High School of Art and Design in particular.

title: Yen Trades Below Parity
description: TOKYO, Tuesday, Dec. 21 The yen was traded at 314 to the dollar when the Tokyo for eignexchange market was re opened today after being closed yesterday. The rate was lower than the new parity, which had been set at 308 yen to the dollar.

title: Police Station Blasted
description: CAMBRIDGE, Mass., Dec. 20 (AP)  A pipe bomb exploded outside police headquarters to day, partly disrupting commu nications, breaking two win dows, damaging woodwork and bending iron grillwork. No one was injured.

title: 9,200 Troops Pulled Out; U.S. Level Now 162,500
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam Dec. 20 (UPI)  Some 9,200 United States troops in the war zone, of South Vietnam last week in the largest sevenday with drawal of Americans since 10, 200 servicemen left in a single week in April, 1970, the United States command said today.

title: U.S.JAPANESE TALKS PUT OFF TO THURSDAY
description: WASHINGTON, Dec, 20 Trade talks between the United States and Japan scheduled for today were called off, an Amer ican spokesman disclosed.

title: A.CL.U. Suit Fights Federal Dismissals For Homosexuality
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 20 The American Civil Liberties Union filed suit in the United States District Court here today to stop the Federal Government from dismissing employes solely because they are homosexuals.

title: Newest Intelsat Satellite Put in a Stationary Orbit
description: CAPE KENNEDY, Dec. 20 (UPI)Scientists fired a rocket motor by remote control today, and placed the newest Intelsat 4 communications satellite in a stationary orbit 22,300 miles over the Equator in the Atlantic Ocean.

title: TEXAS GULF LOSES BID IN HIGH COURT
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 20 (AP) The Texas Gulf Sulphur Com pany and nine officials and em ployes were denied a hearing today by the Supreme Court in a case that may set a precedent governing tha stock  market trading of corporate insiders.

title: Wood, Field and Stream
description: My yearlong struggle to mare a hunting dog out of a house pet has failed, much to the delight of my two daugh ters.

title: GRENADE WRECKS POLICE CAR HERE
description: A police car chasing three men and a woman in a stolen car was demolished yesterday morning when the fugitives threw a fragmentation grenade at the police car as the two autos sped along a busy street in the Maspeth section of Queens.

title: Stage: Congo in Turmoil
description: It was only 10 years ago a little morethat it seemed that the Congo was about to erupt into a major war, and the world watched fascinated and horrified while the United Nations performed itss only major police ac tion. Who was right, who was wrong? A black nation alist hero, Patrice Lumumba, was assassinated by political enemies. The Secretary Gen eral of the United Nations, Dag Hammarskjold, was later killed in an apparently mys terious plane crash.

title: In 24 Years, Pakistan Has Had 6 Governments
description: In the 24 years Pakistan has been an independent state, her people have been ruled by a variety of re gimes, both civilian and mil itary, under several constitu tions, and have only once been given the chance to vote directly for their national leaders.

title: News Analysis
description: CHICAGO, Dec. 19The size, shape and texture of the newly announced black eco nomic and political develop ment organizationOperation Pushwere not made clear during the revivallike mass meeting of 4,000 Chicagoans yesterday. But some clear in dications of what the new group will at tempt to be have emerged from a number of inter views here, from activities of its successful predecessor, Opera tion Breadbasket, and from the philosophy of the Rev. Jesse L. Jackson, the principal driving force for both groups.

title: MRS. SMITH CHIDES SENATE ABSENTEES
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 20 Senator Margaret Chase Smith proposed today a constitutional amendment that would require Congress to expel any member who missed more than 40 per cent of the votes in any ses sion.

title: lgsgr. George Dawson Dies at 80; LongTime Pastor in Brooklyn
description: Msgr. George A. Dawson, pastor emeritus of Good Shep herd Roman Catholic Church, 1950 Batchelder Street, Brook lyn, died Sunday in the rectory. He would have been 31 years old Friday.

title: PAKISTAN SWEARS BHUTTO AS CHIEF, REPLACING YAHYA
description: RAWALPINDI, Pakistan, Dec. 20Zulfikar Ali Bhutto was sworn in today as President and MartialLaw Administrator of Pakistan, returning the nation to civilian rule for the first time since 1958.

title: Railroad Sets Capital Plans
description: Illinois Central Industries, Inc., announced yesterday that it had budgeted capital ex penditures of $116million for 1972, an increase of 33 per cent over anticipated 1971 spending. The plans include $76.7million for Illinois Central railroad rolling stock and track and roadway improvement.

title: Merger News
description: The Controller of the Cur rency, William B. Camp, ap proved yesterday the proposed acquisition of the $1billion First Western Bank and Trust Company of Los Angeles by the $6.5billion Wells Fargo Bank of San Francisco.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor: Without going into the many rami fications regarding the Forest Hills lowincome project, it is my sincere belief that the proper solution for this most unhappy situationunhappy for the pros, unhappy for the cons would be the construction of a twelve tofourteenstory project atop a high school.

title: School Closing Over Gang Threat Asked in Bronx
description: Parents and teachers at em battled Intermediate School 162 in the southeast Bronx banded together yesterday to close the school in protest over lack of police protection from a ma rateling teenage gang.

title: Argentine Joins Race for U.N. Post as Voting Goes On
description: UNITED NATIONS, N. Y., Dec. 20  A career diplomat frcim Argentina was added to the field of contenders for theI post of United Nations Secre tary General today as the Secu rity Council again failed to make its choice.

title: Man in the News
description: Two years ago, any read ing of the Chicago political charts would have placed Edward V. Hanrahan near the top of the ruling Irish hierarchy. The Cook County State's Attorney had been a rising protg of Mayor Richard J. Daley for more than a decade and was widely considered the probable choice of the Democrat ic organization to run for Gover nor of Illinois in 1972. Yesterday, however, the 50yearold prosecutor's long and carefully nurtured political ascendancy suffered a damaging, if not fatal, blow when the Cook County Democratic Central Commit tee, controlled by Mayor Daley, withdrew its endorse ment of Mr. Hanrahan's candidacy for a second four year term.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor: Gen. E. R. Quesada's contention in a recent letter that because the nu clear blast on Amchitka did not pro voke a catastrophic reaction from na ture it was therefore justified is utter ly ludicrous. It is analogous to en couraging a person to play Russian roulette and then gloating because the firing pin struck a blank chamber.

title: Drink Preservative Found To Produce a Carcinogen
description: An ideal food preservative, believed to be widely used in wines, draft beer and noncar bonated fruit drinks, has been found to produce a cancer causing chemical in several of the beverages in which it is used.

title: Article 2  No Title
description: ROANOKE, Va., Dec. 20 (AP)  Unbeaten and nationally ranked Virginia took a quick lead tonight and then stretched it as the Cavaliers scored a 93 51 victory over Virginia Mili tary in the Roanoke Classic.

title: 7Man High Court Splits on LiberalConservative Lines in Criminal Rulings
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 20 The sevenmember Supreme Court, meeting today for the last time before it gains its full complement of nine Jus tices, divided along liberal conservative lines as it ruled on six criminal appeals.

title: STEEL PRODUCTION RISES 3.6% IN WEEK
description: Steel production for the week ended Dec. 18 rose by 3.6 per cent to 2,028,000 net tons, the American Iron and Steel In stitute reported yesterday. This compared with 1,958,000 tons in the preceding week.

title: IMPORT SURTAX ENDED BY NIXON
description: HAMILTON, Bermuda, Dec. 20  President Nixon formally announced today the lifting of the 10 per cent surcharge on importsa measure that had been bitterly opposed by the United States trading partners as excessively protectionist.

title: STOCKS POST GAIN ON AMEX AND OTC
description: The United States agreement to devalue the dollar an nounced over the weekend sent most stocks on the American Stock Exchange and in the overthecounter market higher yesterday in heavy trading.

title: PEACE CORPS SLASH IN STAFF IS FEARED
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 20 Joseph H. Blatchford, director of the Peace Corps's parent or ganization, said today that the corps was threatened with a onethird reduction in its vol unteer force or with cancella tion of programs in at least 15 countries as a result of budget cuts imposed by Congress last week.

title: Boston & Maine Trustees Assert Line Can Be Saved
description: BOSTON, Dec. 20 (AP)The courtappointed trustees of the Boston & Maine Railroad said today that the bankrupt line can be saved and set Jan. 1, 1975, for its emergence from bankruptcy with $6.5 million in net operating in come.

title: PRIEST NAMED DEAN AT LEHMAN COLLEGE
description: Appointment of the Rev. Neil G. McCluskey, a Jesuit priest, as first dean of the department of education at Herbert H. Leh man College, was approved last night by the Board of Higher Education. The college is part of the City University.

title: J. MURRAY FELDMAN
description: J. Murray Feldman, controller of Local 99, International Ladies Garment Workers Union, died of a heart attack Sunday at Mary Immaculate Hospital, Jamaica, Queens. He was 59 years old and lived at 8226 146th Street, Jamaica.

title: Birbach and Ohrenstein at Odds In ScatterSite Housing Inquiry
description: State Senator Roy M. Good man said yesterday, as he opened a hearing on scatter site housing, that its purpose was not to question the de sirability of such housing as a concept but to explore me ticulously the true feeling of the Forest Hills combatants.

title: Red Chinese Moves Reported
description: TOKYO, Dec. 20 (AP)Com munist China's foreignex change bank has temporarily suspended conversion of all currencies except the French franc, British pound and Hong Kong dollar, a Japanese report from Peking said today.

title: TV: Season Within the Season on Home Screen
description: Tis the season, and in tele vision that generally means it is the season within the season, a time for budget conscious reruns, a time for recordpuffing news specials. Forget the audience ratings. It is also a time, as it hap pens, for some of the major rating surveys to take a brief vacation.

title: Two Ways of Housing LowIncome Tenants
description: There are two primary forms of lowincome housing used in the Upper West Side Urban Renewal area.

title: Crash Kills Stunting Pilot
description: PORTLAND, Ore., Dec. 20. (UPI)The pilot of a light plane was killed last night when his craft struck a power line and crashed as he buzzed his girl friend's apartment house com plex, the police reported. The pilot was Identified as William F. Storey, 29 years old, of Oregon City, Ore. The accident caused a power failure over eight square miles.

title: Leary Asks Why He Wasn't Told of Police Corruption in the Bronx Early Enough
description: When he had finished testi fying yesterday before the Knapp Commission, former Po lice Commissioner Howard B. Leary remarked, in sadness, that if only he had been told early enough about police cor ruption in the Bronx, the de partment would not have had to suffer this tremendous, jus tifiable criticism of delay.

title: STERLING STOPPED IN 14TH BY BOUTTIER
description: PARIS, Dec. 20JeanClaude Bouttier of France, outboxed for most of 12 rounds, knocked Bunny Sterling down three times in then 13th and out in the 14th tonight to retain his Euro pean middleweight boxing title.

title: Bobby Short Is Feted At New York in 30's
description: Bobby Short, the coal min er's son from Danville, Ill., who grew up to become the darling of the powerful and the playful, was feted by his friends at a New York in the Thirties dance Monday night, and nobody had a better time than Bobby did.

title: DOLLAR IS FIRM AS MARKETS OPEN
description: PARIS, Dec, 21Most of the world's currency markets re opened today and immediately bore out expectations that the dollar would hold up firmly after the general realignment that was set last Saturday in Washington.

title: $212,000 IS RAISED FOR LIBRARY DRIVE
description: Thor E. Wood, chief of the Research Library of the Per forming Arts at Lincoln Center, reported yesterday that its campaign of raise $240,000 to save the library thus far has netted $212,000. The money has been collected through in dividual contributions, organi zational grants and special pre sentations.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor: In your recent editorial entitled Whose Poor Citizenship you assail high school principals for opposing Chancellor Scribner's removal of the traditional requirement of satisfactory behavior and citizenship as one of the conditions for meriting a high school diploma.

title: Amber Hawk Captures Laurel Dash, Pays $13
description: LAUREL, Md., Dec. 21 (UPI)  Amber Hawk found the mud dy racing strip to his liking to day at Laurel, rallying from just off the pace to capture the $11, 000 allowance feature at seven furlongs.

title: Mr. Bhutto's New Pakistan
description: Zulfikar All Bhutto, the shrewd politician who has inherited power from the military regime in Islamabad, has prescribed a fundamental overhaul of Pakistan's Internal and foreign policies, including imminent release of the Bengali independence leader, Sheik Mujibur Rahman.

title: Patriots Rehire Mazur At an Increase in Salary
description: FOXBORO, Mass., Dec. 21 (AP) John Mazur, who coached the New England Patriots this season to a 68 wonlost rec ord, their best since 1966, was rehired for next season today by the National Foot ball League team. The Patri ots said he would get a sub stantial increase in salary.

title: Man, 72, Who Slew Intruder Booked in Homicide
description: A 72yearold man who lives alone on the Upper West Side and who had been the victim of both a mugging and a robbery within the last two years bought a pistol two months ago to protect himself.

title: Republic Steel Elects
description: H. Stuart Harrison, president and chief executive officer of the Cleveland  Cliffs Iron Company, yesterday was elec ted a director of the Republic Steel Corporation.

title: 5 Vikings Are Selected On AllConference Team
description: The Minnesota Vikings, who have won 35 regularseason games in the last three years, but are still looking for their first Super Bowl victory, placed five players yesterday on the United Press International Na tional Football Conference All Star team.

title: Flying Tiger Unit to Spend
description: The Flying Tiger Corporation announced yesterday that the 1972 capital budget of its North American Car Corporation sub sidiary has been increased to $77million from $41million in 1971. Flying Tiger said that $50million will be earmarked for North American Car equip ment purchases and $27million for the capital budget of Na tional Equipment Rental, Ltd., a North American Car subsidi ary acquired in October.

title: Bridge: Suggestions for Christmas Cover Wide Range of Gifts
description: Those seeking Christmas presents for bridgeplaying friends and relations have, as always, had a wide range of choices this year. For the big spender, the best buy is no doubt The Official Ency clopedia of Bridge, which provides the answers to al most any question about the game.

title: S. E. C. PROPOSES NEW PROXY RULES
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 21 The Securities and Exchange Commission issued today, for public study and comment, pro posed new rules dealing with the matters that stockholders may bring before the annual meetings of corporations, and the means by which they do so.

title: It's Yuletide, and Spirits Are High on the Plaza
description: It is the holiday season around Central Park South and Fifth Avenue, it is late afternoon and it is grand. There is old money about, and new money, too, and a great many people with hardly any money at all.

title: An Addict Choir Sings Carols at Bloomingdale's
description: Are you sure they're addicts? a woman shopper in Bloomingdale's asked yesterday as 30 members of the Odyssey House Choir, 9 to 18 years old, sang carols from the bal cony.

title: Roy O. Disney, Aide of Cartoonist Brother, Dies at 78
description: BURBANK, Calif., Dec. 21 (UPI)Roy O. Disney, whose behindthescenes business acu men built an entertainment empire on his younger brother Walt's talent for drawing lov able talking animals and mak ing innocent dreams come true, died of a cerebral hemhorrage late last night at St. Joseph's Hospital. He was 78 years old.

title: Frontier at Turtle Bay
description: Article 19 of the Declaration of Human Rights, adopted by the United Nations General Assembly at Paris in 1948, said the universal right to freedom of expression in cludes freedom to  seek, receive and impart infor mation and ideas through any media and regardless of frontiers.

title: Kent State Offers Thant Post After Retirement
description: KENT, Ohio, Dec. 21Sec retary General Thant of the United Nations has been of fered a post at Kent State University when he retires from the United Nations on Dec. 31, Glenn A. Olds, the university president, said to day.

title: Executive Changes
description: Columbia Broadcasting System, Inc., announced yesterday that Renville H. McMann Jr., has been appointed president of CBS Laboratories, suc ceeding Dr. Peter C. Gold mark, Mr. McMann, exec; utive vice president, will replace Dr. Goldmark, who has headed the Lab oratories since its forma tion in 1937, on Jan. 1. Mr. McMann, 44 years old, joined CBS Labora tories in 1955 and be came director of engineer ing in 1960. He was made a vice president in 1965 and became executive vice president earlier this year. The company said Dr. Goldmark is responsible for the development of the 33 rpm longplaying record, the first success ful color television broadcasting system, and elec tronic video recording.

title: HOUSE UNIT SCORES TESTING OF NAVY JET
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 21 (AP) House investigators have called unfounded an allegatfon, that a flaw was found in the Navy's F14 Jet fighter two weeks before the defect caused one of the planes to crash a year ago.

title: Chiefs Taylor Spells Trouble for Dolphins on Saturday
description: Don Shula, coach of the Miami Dolphins, who won the Eastern Division title of the American Conference in a lastminute surprise, has never sent a team out to play the Kansas City Chiefs.

title: Bay State Official Labels 2 Ecology Kits Hazardous
description: BOSTON, Dec. 21 (AP) Two ecology kits produced by a Cambridge concern have been labeled extremely haz ardous by State Attorney Gen oral Robert H. Quinn. Mr. Quinn said he would seek an immediate embargo on the sale of the kits in Massachusetts.

title: NoFault Insurance Gaining Acceptance
description: With what may be the inevi tability of an idea whose time has come, the innovation of nofault automobile insurance has pushed ahead despite pow erful opposition.

title: FOX REPORTS A CUT IN LONGTERM DEBT
description: Members of the New York Society of Security Analysts were told yesterday that the Twentieth CenturyFox Film Corporation paid down about $30million of its ongterm debt in the current quarterbring ing its total repayments to over $100million in the last two years.

title: HOGAN IS STUDYING KNAPP TRANSCRIPT FOR ANY CONFLICTS
description: District Attorney Frank S. Hogan said yesterday that he was studying the transcripts of the Knapp Commission hear ings and other evidence to see whether there were discrepan cies that should be referred to a grand jury.

title: Victoria Rogers, Medical Student, Is Bride of Earl Edward McEvoy
description: RYE, N. Y., Dec. 21Miss Victoria Rogers and Earl Ed ward McEvoy were married here this afternoon in the Roman Catholic Church of the Resurrection by the Rev. James F. Rowane. The Rev. Dr. Wendell W. Phillips, rec tor of Christ Episcopal Church here, bestowed the blessing.

title: Seoul Offers Legislation for Tight Curbs
description: SEOUL, South Korea, Dec. 21President Park Chung Hee's Democratic Republican party submitted to the National Assembly today a bill to give him extraordinary powers to control the economy, the press and labor and to curb demon strations.

title: 13 Debutantes Presented At the 14th Mistletoe Ball
description: The 14th Mistletoe Ball was held last night in the Pierre's Grand Ballroom, where 13 young women were presented.

title: C. C. N. Y. Wins, 8065
description: City College of New York took advantage of a mistake plagued Wagner College team last night and scored an 8065 triumph at the loser's gymnasi um. The Seahawks held a 3631 halftime lead but committed 37 turnovers, 21 in the second Jlalf. Otis Loyd led the Beavers with 26 points.

title: Plan to Clean City Streets Offered
description: A system of block super intendents, or supersupers, was proposed yesterday by the city as a way to cut down on dirty streets and building decay.

title: PRINCETON DOWNS STANFORD, 8885
description: PRINCETON, N. J., Dec. 21 Ted Manakas sank both ends of a oneandone foul situation with five seconds remaining to night to insure Princeton an 8885 victory over a Stanford team that had outscored the Tigers, 235 in the game's final 5 minutes 40 seconds.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor: If Steven V. Roberts's Dec. 11 as sessment of Senator George McGovern as a major victim of a growing mood of realism among the delegates to the youth conference in Chicago is correct, I doubt that such a pheno menon could be representative of the outlook of most college students. In a poll published this week in The Yale Daily News, Senator McGovern was indicated the Presidential choice of 31 per cent of the nearly 2,000 Yale undergraduates polled, receiving close to three times the approval of Senator Muskie, at 12 per cent, his closest rival.

title: Advertising:
description: Norton Garfinkle has noti fied the customers of his Brand Rating Index, a syndi cated marketing and media study, that the annual report will not be coming out as usual in 1972.

title: Dividend Rules Revised To Prevent Forced Cuts
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 21The Committee on Interest and Div dends revised its rules today to make sure that no company would be forced to cut its divi dends.

title: CATHOLIC ACCORD ON SCHOOLS IS SET
description: The monthlong strike by unionized lay teachers against 314 schools run by the Roman Catholic Archdiocese ended last night when the union mem bership reluctantly voted to ac icept a wage package proposed by the archdiocese.

title: For Privacy From Cranks, Creeps and Crooks, Millions Getting Unlisted Phone Numbers
description: LOS ANGELES, Dec. 21 Cary Grant is listed in the Los Angeles telephone direc tory. But if you want to speak to the actor, that is not the number to call. Cary Grant's private number is not listed. And the Cary Grant who is in the book has had his listed number discon nected.

title: WASHINGTON
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 21Peace this Christmas is something more than a pious hope. It is not assured, and is certainly not accompanied by much goodwill among men, but there are some solid reasons for believing that, while short and vicious wars for lim ited ends will probably always be with us, we may very well avoid in the last third of the century the wars of the giant nations that convulsed the world in the first and second thirds of the twentieth century.

title: The Right to Strike
description: The dictum, one cannot strike against the Government, has long been regarded as an article of faith. Yet each year the number of strikes by public employes is counted by the hundred.

title: A WITNESS BACKS DOWDY TESTIMONY
description: BALTIMORE, Dec. 21  A real estate salesman today sup ported Representative John Dowdy's version of his activi ties on Sept. 22, 1965, the day he allegedly accepted a $25, 000 bribe.

title: Hole in the Mailbox
description: When the new United States Postal Service came into being as a quasiindependent public utility last July 1, the theory was that it would make mail delivery more efficient by the adoption of businesslike practices.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: Letters to the Editor

title: Paris Suburb Blast Kills 6, Hurts 107
description: ARGENTEUIL, France, Dec. 21 (AP)An explosion in a 13 story apartment building today showered nearby streets with bodies, broken glass and Christ mas trees. Officials counted dead and 107 injured, 45 seri ously.

title: KNICKS CONQUER WARRIORS, 11381
description: OAKLAND, Calif., Dec. 21 (AP)Walt Frazier and Dick Barnett combined for 45 points tonight to lead the New York Knicks to a 11387 victory over the Golden State Warriors in a National Basketball Association game.

title: Notes on People
description: At a Federal Bar Associa tion luncheon in Washington honoring Lewis F. Powell Jr. and William H. Rehnquist, who will become Supreme Court Justices Jan. 7, Attor ney General John N. Mitchell predicted that the two will prove to be eminently unpre dictable in their court de cisions.

title: Sports of The Times
description: Well, the coach said, it took us prettinear all season, but we finally put it all together and for once we got a few bounces so maybe somebody up there thinks we must be doing something right, after all. It was a team effort. It shows what we can do when the horse's healthy and let's hope this is only the beginning.

title: City Picks 5 Areas for Tests on Decentralization
description: Five neighborhoods were an nounced yesterday as the sites for the city's longdelayed test of the first stage of decentrald ized government.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor: Your editorial comment (Nov. 30) on the prison rebellion at Rahway, N. J. took note of the lessons we may have learned since the Attica uprising. Isn't it possible that the Rahway inmates also learned something from Attica, namely that intransigence and threats to hostages will not be rewarded?

title: An Opera Voice to Mark 40 Years on Air
description: Milton Cross is appearing in a rerun that may hold the longdistance record.

title: INCREASES URGED IN CAPITAL BUDGET
description: An array of city residents and public officials offered a grim picture yesterday of crumbling courtrooms, crowded classrooms, decaying hospitals, vandalized parks, backedup sewers and other assorted as pects of city life to support their appeals for increases in the proposed 197273 capital budget.

title: ALL 13 ARE RESCUED FROM SINKING SHIP
description: Thirteen persons abandoned a sinking Norwegian freighter in the Atlantic Ocean yesterday and were rescued by the British vessel Suevic, which spotted them in a lifeboat, the Coast Guard said.

title: Zambia Devalues by 7.89%
description: LUSAKA, Zambia, Dec. 21 Finance Minister Wesley Nyi renda announced today that the Zambian kwacha would be devalued by 7,89 per cent rela tive to gold.

title: Merger News
description: The Chrysler Corporation an nounced yesterday that it had acquired a controlling interest in Fabricas AutoMex, S.A., a large Mexican concern based in Mexico City. Chrysler, which had owned 46 per cent of the Mexican company's stock, said iL had acquired an additional 20 per cent of Fabricas Auto  Mex shares in ex change for Chrys ler stock from a group of Mexi cans, headed by, Gaston Azcnraga, a business man, that owned 54 per cent. Fabricas AutoMex makes Plym outh and Dodge vehicles for the Mexican market and ex ports motors to this country The sale, which was approved eight days ago by the Mexican Government, came as a sur prise since Luis Echeverria the President of Mexica, has fre quently expressed the view that Mexicans should not sell their companies to foreigners.

title: The Proceedings In the U.N. Today
description: General Assembly Meets at 10:30 A.M.

title: Yugoslavia Devalues by 18.73%
description: BELGRADE, Yugoslavia, Dec. 21 (Reuthers)The Yugoslav dinar has been devalued by 18.73 per cent relative to gold, Tanjug, the Yugoslav agency, announced today. The new ex change rate will be 17 dinars to the dollar.

title: Film: Rotten Way of Life
description: Richard Messinger, the art director of a national maga zine and the author of a best selling children's book, Me linda Melancholy and The Magic Melon Patch, enters lower Fifth Avenue Hospi tal onsaya Tuesday morn ing for the removal of a benign mole. Two days later he is dying, the victim of a series of small mistakes (the surgeon nicked an artery) and unlikely reactions (an allergy to blood given him in a trans fusion), which, in turn, led to what one doctor poetically describes as a massive insult to the liver, kidney failure and, finally, an attack on the heart.

title: Market Place:
description: The sudden interest in Du Pont  the price of the stock, jumped five and quarter points to 144 yester dayis probably institution al. You don't find an old lady from Dubuque coughing tip $14,400 to buy a stock too often. But the question is, where are those institutions situated?

title: Nowadays, a Girl's Best Friend May Indeed Be Jade
description: The Chinese call jade the stone of heaven and prize it above diamonds. Chinese empresses have rarely worn any other stone, and peasant families have treasured tiny bits of it. The Chinese word for jadeytlalso means prec ious stone.

title: Orders for Durable Goods Up Strongly in November
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 21  New orders received by dur ablegoods manufacturers rose strongly in November to a rec ord $32.2billion, the Commerce Department reported today.

title: Theater: Sally, George and Martha
description: Could such an honest fel low as George Washington ever dabble in sexual dalli ance? As Sam Dann, the author of Sally, George and Martha sees George, he couldand did.

title: About Motor Sports
description: John Cooper, a 39year old advertising entrepreneur who has been in auto racing 16 years, will inherit on New Year's Day one of the big gest headaches in the sport the presidency of Ontario Motor Speedway, the gaudy, multipurpose Southern Cali fornia track that opened in September, 1970. He urgently needs to find ways of making money for Ontario, which had to dip into its reserves last week to pay $965,000 semiannual in terest on its bonds.

title: Surgeon Marries Susan Cosgrove
description: Miss Susan Scott Cosgrove, daughter of Mrs. M. Bjorkren Cosgrove of Royal Oak, Mich., was married in a civil ceremony in London Monday to Dr. Andrew W. Saxe, son of Dr. and Mrs. David H. Saxe of New York. A recep tion took place at the Savoy Hotel.

title: Zaire Keeps Dollar Parity
description: KINSHASA. Zaire, Dec. 21 (Agence FrancePresse)  The Zaire Republic decided today to maintain the parity of the zaire with the dollar by devaluing its currency by 7.89 per cent rela tive to gold.

title: EQUITY FINANCING
description: The Equitable Savings & Loan Association marketed 901,621 capital shares, all but 50,000 on behalf of the GAC Corporation, its principal stock holder, at a price of $27. Kid der, Peabody and Salomon Brothers were managers. There had been no significant public market for the shares since GAC acquired its shares of the Portland, Ore., association in 1969.

title: RAND IS DEVALUED BY SOUTH AFRICA
description: PRETORIA, South Africa, Dec. 21 (Reuters)The South African Government devalued the rand today by 12.28 per cent in terms of gold, which immediately set off a burst of new activity on the longde pressed Johannesburg stock exchange.

title: BOMB AND SOLDIERS KILL TWO IN BELFAST
description: BELFAST, Northern Ireland, Dec. 21 (Reuters)A man was fatally wounded by British troops and another was killed by a bomb today as a pre Christmas wave of violence continued here.

title: 2 SUSPECTS NAMED IN GRENADE ATTACK
description: The police announced yester day that a man and a woman had been identifie.d as two of the four suspects wanted in connection with the destruc tion of a police car by a hand grenade Monday in Maspeth, Queens.

title: Warning for Politicians With Heart Ills
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 21.  A leading medical journal ad vises the politician who has heart disease that he should probably relax his grip on the cocktail glass and on his con stituent's hand.

title: Abraham E. Kazan Dies at 82; Master Coop Housing Builder
description: Abraham Eli Kazan, who pioneered and developed much of the middleincome coopera tive housing in New York City, died yesterday at Beth Israel Hospital. He was 82 years old.

title: Mrs. Frances Nash Watson, 81; General's Widow Was Pianist
description: CHARLOTTESVILLE, Va., Dec. 21Mrs. Frances Nash Watson, widow of Maj. Gen. Edwin M. Watson, who was military aide and secretary to President Franklin D. Roose velt, died here yesterday at the age of 81. She lived at Ken wood, the house that the couple built on part of Thomas Jeffer son's original land and where President Roosevelt used to visit them, and in Washington.

title: UPSWING HALTED ON AMEX AND 0TO
description: The American Stock Ex change and the overthecounter market tried to continue their recent upswing yesterday but didn't quite make it.

title: Pakistan Aide in Poland Changes His Allegiance
description: WARSAW, Dec. 21The Pakistani Ambassador to Po land, Bashirul Alam, declared his loyalty to the seccession ist movement in East Paki stan today, but not before withdrawing his embassy's funds from the bank.

title: KRIESS, EDELFSEN WIN IN SO. AFRICA
description: EAST LONDON, South Africa Dec. 21 (AP)Mike Kriess of Bel Air, Calif., and Tom Edel fsen of Los Angeles advanced to the fourth round of the Free State Sugar tennis champion ships today, while Sally Walsh of San Rafael, Calif., gained the third round of the women's singles event.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor: Since Senate Democrats have been at such great pains to sprinkle them selves with holy water over the nomi nation of Agriculture Secretary Earl Butz and their love for rural America, perhaps now is an appropriate time to harken back to their record of the recent past on rural America.

title: Note From Troy to Hogan
description: The Knapp Commission hearings were a vulgar, clumsy coverup. Your office should commence an immedi ate, thorough investigation to determine if the serious crimes of perjury, malfea sance, and/or misfeasance by high public officials have been committed in New York County.

title: MRS. PETER SALAMONE
description: Mrs. Rosina Salamone, the widow of Peter Salamone, who died in 1943, and the mother of Paul A. Salamone, president of Gimbels New York, died yester day at Clara Maas Hospital, Belleville, N. J. She was 77 years old.

title: Bhutto Appoints a Bengali To Serve as Vice President
description: RAWALPINDI, Pakistan, Dec. 21Pakistan's new Presi dent, Zulfikar All Bhutto, appointed a Bengali as Vice President today and declared that the Bengali secessionist leader, Sheik Mujibur Rah man, would soon be moved from prison to house arrest.

title: TWO AIRLINES ASK END OF GROUP FARE
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 21 (AP)  Two airlines serving Hawaii, United and Western, proposed today to discontinue group fares in the California Hawaii markets on Feb. 1.

title: Judge and State Bar Head Rebut Murphy on Courts
description: A highranking appellate justice suggested yesterday that: Police Commissioner Patrick V. Murphy's indictment of courts for a rise in local crime might be an attempt swing the spotlight away from the investigation of po lice corruption.

title: INCO REVISES PLAN ON NEW CALEDONIA
description: The International Nickel Company of Canada, Ltd., said yesterday that it had submit ted new proposals to the French Government for a New Cale donia nickel project.

title: Baker and Son Win $1Million; Lottery Mixed Blessing to Some
description: William Brajczewski of Bris tol, Conn., and his father, Adam, who will be 77 years old on Christmas, won $1million in the New York Slate lottery yes terday.

title: Man in the News
description: When Kurt Waldheim said yesterday that he would try to carry otu the duties of his new post as Secretary Gen eral of the United Nations in the right way, both his choice of words and the philosophy they reflected seemed characteristic of the man. The words often used to describe the 53 yearold Austrian and they are often used to getherare cor rect and diplo mat. Even during his two years as Austria's Foreign Minister, he has appeared to see his function as that of carrying out policy rather than making it.

title: Books of The Times
description: PROBLEMS OF KNOWLEDGE AND FREEDOM. The Russell Lectures. By Noma ClIonisley. 111 pages. Pantheon. $4.95.

title: Stone Walls  nor Iron Bars
description: Attica, the Tombs, Rahway have alerted the nation to the need for prison reform. For this government is called upon to study the penal system and institute programs that will emphasize the rehabilitation of inmates.

title: Emigrant Bank Promotes
description: The Emigrant Savings Bank announced yesterday the pro motion of the following execu tives to vice presidents: Fred A. Bambino, John M. Kemp, Edward S. McLellan, George F. Rickey, John W. Swanson and George T. Wittschen.

title: Nixon Returns to U.S.
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 21 (AP) President Nixon returned to the United States today after two days of talks with Prime Minister Heath in Bermuda. The Presidential plane landed at nearby Andrews Air Force Base in subuiban Maryland at 5:40 P.M.

title: Columbia Loses, 6842
description: STORRS, Conn., Dec. 21 The University of Connecticut withstood a late Columbia rally and posted a 6862 victory to night.

title: Lindsay Plans to Restructure Administrator's Office
description: Mayor Lindsay said yester day that the Office of the City Administrator, set up to man age the operations of city agencies, would soon be re structured.

title: Laos Reports Enemy Drive
description: VIENTIANE, Laos, Dec. 21 (Reuters)  North Vietnamese troops have begun a general offensive in Laos following their capture of the Plaine des Jarres in the north, a Laotian Government spokesman said here today.

title: ASSISTS PROVE KEY AS STARS TOP KINGS
description: BLOOMINGTON, Minn., Dec. 21 (AP)  Lou Nanne, Murray Oliver and Dean Prentice set up one another for goals tonight as the Minnesota North Stars de feated the Los Angeles Kings, 32, in a National Hockey League game.

title: Boston, U. and R.P.I. Sixes Win in Boston Tournament
description: BOSTON, Dec. 21 (AP)Bos ton University, the defending National Collegeiate hockey champion, bunched four goals in the second period tonight for a 41 victory over Northeastern in the opening round of the Christmas tournament at Bos ton Garden. In another open inground contest, Greg Bull, Jack Decloe and Don Hearns scored thirdperiod goals giving Rensselaer Polytechnic Institute a 53 victory over New Hamp shire. R.P.I. and B.U. will play in the final tomorrow night.

title: Bonn and Algeria Resume Relations After 7 Years
description: BONN, Dec. 21West Ger many and Algeria announced today that they had resumed diplomatic relations after an in terruption of seven years.

title: Bengalis Hunt Down Biharis, Who Aided Foe
description: KHULNA, Pakistan, Dec. 19 With the surrender of West Pakistani forces, nationalist Bengalis, armed with guns and knives, have been roaming the streets in this eastern town, hounding out members of the Bihari minority who collabora ted over the last nine months in the suppression of the East Pakistani autonomy movement.

title: Lakers 26th Ties Pro Sports Mark
description: BUFFALO, Dec. 21 (UPI)Wilt Chamberlain converted a pair of 3point plays within 22 seconds tonight to spark a 15point third period rally as the Los Angeles Lakers tied a majorleague professional sports record of 26 straight victories with a 117103 tri umph over the Buffalo Braves.

title: FreightRate Rise Of 15% Announced By ShipLine Group
description: The North Atlantic Mediter ranean Freight Conference said yesterday that its 10 steamship line members would increase freight rates by 15 per cent, effective March 15.

title: Aides Guarding Chavez In Assassination Plot
description: LOS ANGELES, Dec. 21 (AP)  Cesar Chavez, the farm labor leader, is being guarded by his followers against what they believe is an assassination plot.

title: Cambodians Along Route 6 Fear They Are Forgotten
description: ON ROUTE 6, south of Kom pong Thom, Cambodia, Dec. 16 The front line is a blownup bridge, and the enemy is less than a mile away in the tree line. There is so little food for the Cambodians on the bridge that each day a volunteer must jog, crawl and run through the rice paddies and brush for two hours to reach Kompong Thom and return with fish and rice strapped to his pack.

title: SIGNS IN LAHORE NOW ASK REVENGE
description: LAHORE, Pakistan, Dec. 21 The Crush India! signs are being taken down all over this sprawling city of 2.3 million and are being replaced by signs demanding Revenge!

title: FOREST HILLS SITE. SCORED BY BLACKS
description: A black organization con demned scattersite housing as genocide yesterday before a State Senate committee explor ing the federally mandated housing policy and the con troversy it has touched off in Forest Hills, Queens.

title: Jim Walter Corp. Gains in Quarter Net and Sales
description: The Jim Walter. Corporation, a leading producer of building materials, realized a 32 per cent increase in earnings for its first fiscal quarter ended Nov. 30 on a sales gain of 5.8 per cent, James W. Walter, chairman, reported yesterday) from the company's Tampa, Fla., headquarters.

title: PISTONS ROUTED BY BULLS, 12792
description: CHICAGO, Dec. 21 (UPI) The Chicago Bulls, playing everybody on the roster, posted a 12792 triumph over the De troit Pistons tonight.

title: ECONOMISTS URGE LIST OF REFORMS
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 21 A group of 12 internationally known economists from the United States, Western Europe, Japan and Canada unanimous ly recommended today a series of major changes in world eco nomic relations covering not only monetary reform but also trade, aid, international invest ment and defense.

title: Javits Says Nixon Is Taking a More Liberal Position
description: Senator Jacob K. Davits de clared yesterday that President Nixon had moved toward a more liberal position in the last six months and thereby en hanced his chances of reelec tion next year.

title: HalfMillion Is Donated To Neediest
description: We hope you can turn what might have been 10 friv olous dollars into 10 impor tant ones, wrote Ralph and Janet Novak of Little Ferry, N. J., in a note accompanying their donation to the New York Times Neediest Cases Fund.

title: Iona Loses, 88 to 73
description: NEW ROCHELLE, N. Y., Dec. 21Dean Gravlin connceted on 10 of 12 fieldgoal attempts and scored 28 points to lead Illinois Wesleyan to an 8873 victory over Iona College tonight. Jim Riches led Iona with 24.

title: SUGAR GROUP ACTS TO SUSPEND QUOTA
description: The executive committee of the International Sugar Orga nization announced in London yesterday the suspension of all sugar quotas to free markets, effective Jan. 1.

title: Excerpts From Comment By Mayor on Knapp Unit
description: Following are excerpts from the portion of Mayor Lindsay's news conference yesterday that dealt with the public hearings of the Knapp Commission into allegations of police corruption:

title: Iowa Tops Nebraska
description: IOWA CITY, Iowa, Dec. 21 (AP)The Iowa Hawkeyes, led by the 28point effort of Rick Williams, defeated Nebraska, 8677, in a nonconference game tonight.

title: Solzhenitsyn Goes to Tvardovsky Rites
description: MOSCOW, Dec. 21The Un ion of Soviet Writers sought to give a circumspect state fu neral today to the prominent poet and controversial editor Aleksandr T. Tvardovsky. But the ceremony was pervaded by the spirit of cultural freedom that he had championed, which was left unmentioned in offi cial eulogies.

title: Exchange Is Questioning Martin's Board Proposal
description: A key proposal in William McChesney Martin Jr.'s report on the securities markets has aroused deepseated controversy in Wall Street and may he modified by the New York Stock Exchange.

title: Fire in Bay Shore School
description: BAY SHORE, L. I., Dec. 21 (UPI)More than 1,788 stu dents were temporarily evacu ated late this morning when a fire was reported in a high school here. It was the second fire within one week in the school and both have been listed as suspicious by the Suffolk County police arson squad. Damage resulting from today's fire was described as minor.

title: Advance Is Shown in Short Interest
description: Shortinterest positions on the New York Stock Exchange on Dec. 8 were at a sixmonth high of 17,709,521 shares, the exchange reported yesterday.

title: Theater: Folksy Charms of Anne of Green Gables
description: Where has innocence fled? Well, a large slice of it has turned up at the New York City Center, in the form and shape of a little Canadian musical, Anne of Green Gables. This is a curious little musical, almost a curios ity of a musical. Written by Donald Harron, the Canadian actor, and Norman Campbell, one of Canada's bestknown TV directors, this was creat ed for the Charlottetown Fes tival on Prince Edward Island.

title: Transit Authority, at Contract Talks, Pledges to Improve Service
description: The Transit Authority began its presentation in contract ne gotiations yesterday by empha sizing its determination to im prove the performance of the transit system and service to riders.

title: Oilers Are Reported Set To Dismiss Coach Hughes
description: The Houston Oilers have de cided to dismiss Coach Ed Hughes with four years re maining on his fiveyear con tract, The Associated Press re ported last night.

title: Vidal Satire, Evening With Nixon, Set for Broadway
description: Gore Vidal, the novelist playwright, has written a po litical satire, An Evening With Richard Nixon, that has been acquired for Broad way presentation next March by Hillard Elkins.

title: Nixon and Heath End Talks in Bermuda
description: HAMILTON, Bermuda, Dec. 21President Nixon and Prime Minister Heath ended more than nine hours of intensive private discussions today with a joint pledge to set aside tacti cal differences and to work to gether for a strengthened At lantic alliance.

title: Marquette Keeps Winning
description: MILWAUKEE, Dec. 21 (AP) Secondranked Marquette, be hind 22 points by Bob Lackey and a pressure defense that baf fled taller but slower Minnesota defeated the Gophers, 5540, to night.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor: It is beyond my imagination how the contract signed between the Din ing Room Employes Union and the Restaurant League of New York last year was the cause of the closing of the Colony. This contract gave waiters a $5 a week increase in salary. This obviously was not the reason for the closing of a restaurant where dinner for two ran an average of $50 to $60.

title: Gross Named to Head Guggenheim Foundation
description: Dr. Mason W. Gross, for mer president of Rutgers University, has been elected president of the Harry Frank Guggenheim Foundation, Pe ter O. LawsonJohnston, chairman of the board of directors, announced yester day.

title: Court Reverses Reinstatement of Head of College
description: The Appellate Division yes terday reversed a State Su preme Court decision that had reinstated Dr. Theodore Powell as president of Kingsborough Community College after his ouster last July 15 by the Board of Higher Education.

title: Civil Rights Leaders Here Back Lindsay in Forest Hills Dispute
description: Civil rights leaders, headed by Roy Wilkins, executive di rector of the National Associa tion for the Advancement of Colored People, met yesterday with Mayor Lindsay at City Hall to support him in his de termination to build a lowin come housing project in the middleclass community of Forest Hills, Queens.

title: TV: Vietnam Hindsight on the Kennedy Years
description: A twohour documentary by the National Broadcasting Company on the Vietnam de cisions of the Kennedy Ad ministration illustrates the limits television faces in seeking to meld into good history narration, film clips and retrospective interviews with surviving participants.

title: Giving the Military a Break
description: ANNAPOLIS, Md.Scholars have long recognized the contradiction between the requirements of an ef fective American militarynaval estab lishment and the liberal ideals of our society. The contradiction is deep and has philosophic roots; there can be no doubt about that. The military pro fession must subordinate the individual to the group and its goals; the tra ditional civilian point of view is essen tially the opposite. The military pro fession sees itself as being realistically dedicated to the protection of our na tional security in a dangerous world. Some segments of our society are more apt to see the military profession as a group interested in fomenting war to further its own selfish ends.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor: It has become increasingly clear that President Nixon's tactics visvis Peking have turned our Asian rela tions virtually upside down. It would be like Alice in Wonderland were it not so dangerous for the United States position in Asia. For it is evident that the governing consideration in U.S. Government actions and attitudes in the IndianPakistani crisis has been Pe king's ties with Pakistan together with Mr. Nixon's fear of rankling Peking, at least until his visit there has been consummated. His Peking trip has also been a major factor, of course, in the deterioration of our relations with Japan.

title: Medical Manpower Found To Be Misused in Military
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 21 (UPI)The General Accounting Office told Congress today that too many military doctors, den tists and nurses were wasting their time on paperwork when they could be treating patients.

title: EDWARD W. ZELLER
description: Edward W. Zeller, vice presi dent of Zeller Marine Equip ment, Inc., a barge concern, died of a heart attack Monday night at his home, 6325 Saun ders Street, Forest Hills, Queens. He was 70 years old.

title: CITY IS CRITICIZED ON DAYCARE PLAN
description: The city's directlease day care program, started three years ago as a crash program to build more daycare centers, has been criticized in a report by the Department of Investi gation.

title: Governor Bids Legislature Pass NoFault Insurance as Priority
description: Facing certain opposition from trial lawyers and legisla tors, Governor Rockefeller yes terday revived his campaign to replace the present courtori ented auto insurance system with a nofault program.

title: Venezuela Revalues by 2%
description: CARACAS, Venezuela, Dec. 21 (UPI)President Rafael Cal dera announced today that the Venezuelan bolivar, Latin America's strongest currency, was being revalued by 2 per cent to 4.40 to the dollar.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor: In a recent column Guns and Principles James Reston began to raise the most important question of the nineteenseventies: What really threat ens the security of the American peo ple? Mr. Reston correctly identified the two opinions which are now head ing, we hope, for a sustained public confrontation. The first holds that the major threat still lies in the rising military, and particularly the naval power of the Soviet Union. The sec ond holds that it lies in the internal divisions of the nation and in the social, political and economic derange ment of an overpopulated world.

title: WITNESS ACCUSES GUARDS OF BEATINGS
description: A prosecution witness testi fied at a departmental trial of 14 correction officers yesterday that guards poked him with clubs and beat other inmates during an evacuation of the Queens House of Detention fol lowing a fourday rampage there in October, 1970.

title: Cairo Indicates Rejection of Revived U.S. Effort
description: CAIRO, Dec. 21The Egyp tian'Government's press spokes man, Tahsin Bashir, appeared tonight to reject ambitions of the United States to resume contacts with Cairo toward an interim arrangement for a re opening of the Suez Canal.

title: Monday Night Fight
description: PARISJean Claude Bouttier, 159 pounds, France, knocked out (Bunny Sterling, 159, England, 14 rounds.

title: Uncle of Sihanouk Killed in Pnompenh By Terrorist Blast
description: PNOMPENH, Cambodia, Dec. 21 (UPI)Prince Sisowath Rat tasa, an uncle of the deposed chief of state, Prince Norodom Sihanouk, was assassinated to day by a grenadethrowing ter rorist on a main street near the royal palace, the police re ported.
