title: PRICES FOR BONDS MOSTLY STEADY
description: The credit markets continued to hibernate yesterday, dozing through another lateintheyear trading day without moving far up or down.

title: Guerrillas in Dacca Scorn the Exile Regime
description: DACCA, Pakistan, Dec. 21 A tense and possibly dangerous situation has developed be tween Bengali officials still in Calcutta and the young guer rillas who hold Dacca on the brink of chaos.

title: Suit Planned to Bar Rent Rises Here
description: A group of tenants organiza tions and legislators led by Representative Bella S. Abzug pledged yesterday to wage a court fight against the Federal Price Commission's ruling glow ing rent increases in controlled and stabilized apartments here.

title: Goldmann's Stand Cited
description: In an article in The New York Times Monday about Dr. Na hum Goldmann, who called on Jews throughout the world to stop urging Jews in the Soviet Union to leave for Israel, the last paragraph of the Reuters dispatch was dropped. It fol lows: A spokesman for the World Jewish Congress said later that Dr. Goldmann was not advocating a halt to immigra tion from Russia to Israel, which he recognized as some thing that would continue. Dr. Goldmann was emphasizing the right of Jews to remain and form a community within the Soviet Union, the spokesman said.

title: Amnesty in Newark?
description: A bizarre changing of the guard will occur at the Essex County Penitentiary tomorrow as 52 Newark public school teachers leave after a week in jail, only to be replaced by 130 others who will spend their Christmas holiday locked in cells.

title: Hayes Scores 44
description: PORTLAND, Ore., Dec. 21 (AP)Elvin Hayes scored 44 points os the Houston Rockets registered a 132119 victory over the Portland Trail Blazers tonight. It was Houston's seventh victory in its last eight games.

title: St. Louis: Prospect Is Cloudy
description: ST. LOUIS in a city where the highly diversified economy is not as buoyant as IS months ago hut is be ginning to improve, the big question on the minds of both consumers and business men in the year's final days concerns 1972, And the con sensus in a random sampling is that the prospect is cloudy.

title: Crew Retakes Shrimp Boat And 2 Hijackers Are Slain
description: PORT ISABEL, Tex., Dec, 21 (UPI)Two crewmen aboard commandeered shrimp boat re gained control of the vessel at sea as she was being hijacked to Mexico today. In an ex change of gunshots that en sued, two of the hijackers were killed and the leg of a woman companion was shattered.

title: NOVEMBER SALES OF FUNDS DROPPED
description: The nation's mutual funds registered a net cash inflow of $63million during November, a substantially slimmer margin, than in the preceding month, the Investment Company Insti tute reported yesterday. Sales and redemptions both declined from October's levels.

title: SECURITY COUNCIL NAMES WALEIM 10 SUCCEED illANT
description: UNITED NATIONS, N. Y., Dec. 21Kurt Waldheim of Austria was chosen by the Security Council today to suc ceed U Thant as Secretary General of the United Nations.

title: Ruling on Oswald's Effects
description: DALLAS, Dec. 21 (AP) Federal District Judge Joe E. Estes ruled today that the Fed eral Government need pay only $3,000 for Lee Harvey Oswald's personal effects instead of $17, 729. Both Oswald's widow and the Government had agreed the property was worth $3,000 be fore Oswald assassinated Presi dent Kennedy.

title: The Import Tax Comes Off
description: Just prior to his meeting with Prime Minister Heath in Bermuda, President Nixon formally announced the lifting of the 10 per cent import surcharge, which had been rightly criticized by foreign governments as an illegal act of protectionism. And in Washington, the Treasury announced the termination of the buy Ameri can clause In the 7 per cent investment tax credit. The two measures had been linked as weapons for forc ing other governments to realign their currencies, grant trade concessions to the United States, and assume a larger share of defense burdens.

title: Poland Shifts Exchange Rate
description: WARSAW, Dec. 21 (Reuters) The Polish Ministry of Fin ance said today that the offi cial exchange rate of the United States dollar would change to 22.08 zlotys from 24 zlotys, ef fective tomorrow.

title: FOREIGN AFFAIRS
description: PARISWhen President Pompidou returned from the Azores meeting with his American analogue, he was con vinced the danger of serious depres sion had been ended by his agreement with President Nixon under which the United States undertook to devalue the dollar.

title: L. I. Marine Crash Victim
description: TOKYO, Dec. 22 (UPI) United States military authori ties identified today the seven marines killed in the crash of a CH46 helicopter at the Yoko ta Air Force Base near here Monday. They included First Lieut. Michael C. Clark, 22 years old, of Smithtown, L.I.

title: NOTRE DAME SIX TAKES FINAL, 42
description: Notre Dame, making its first appearance in the tournament, won the 11th annual Holiday Hockey Festival last night at Madison Square Garden, beat ing St. Lawrence University, 42.

title: Pro Golf Sets Up DoubleHeader
description: The 1972 professional golf tour will have what officials yesterday described as doubleheader. It will be held at the Country Club of North Carolina, Pinehurst, N. C., Aug. 24 through 27 and the total prize money will be $250,000.

title: The Backgrounder for Propaganda
description: WASHINGTONThe Nixon Admin istration has perfected the background news conference as both an offensive and defensive weapon. From the priv ileged sanctuary where sources may not be named, anonymous officials have been threatening on some occa sions and explanatory on others.

title: News Analysis
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 21The parting jest from a Washing ton official had put it quite simply. No need to travel around the world, he said, just to discover that we are building bridges to our enemies and burning them to our friends.

title: Apache Reports Oil Find
description: The Apache Corporation re ported yesterday a flow of oil at the rate of 360 barrels a day on its test of an exploratory well northwest of the Cameron field in Cameron Parish, La. Apache holds a 37.5 per cent working interest in the well. Other interests are held by the Coastal States Producing Corn pany, the Winston Producing Company and the McCormick Oil and Gas Company.

title: 20TH ITALIAN BALLOT ON PRESIDENT FAILS
description: ROME, Dec. 21The 20th ball't of Italy's electoral col lege failed tonight to name a President after the Christian Democratic party decided to drop former Premier Amintore Fanfani as its official candidate.

title: U.S. Pushes Common Market on Trade
description: BRUSSELS, Dec. 21  With some tensions between the United States and Europe re moved by the currency realign ment and suppression of the American import surcharge, the United States told the Euro pean Common Market today that the bloc's trade offers re mained unsatisfactory.

title: JEWISH STUDENTS TERMED PASSIVE
description: GROSSINGER, N. Y., Dec. 21 Campus directors of the B'nai B'rith Millet Foundations re ported today that the present generation of Jewish students had become passive about so cial issues and generally in different to the developing political campaigns.

title: Literature in Ladino Gets Another Life
description: Recent discoveries of texts from the JudcoSpanish ver nacular known as Ladino some of which had been lost for almost four centuriesare being made available in Eng lish for the first time.

title: Obituary 1  No Title
description: Obituary 1  No Title

title: L. C. Gentile Weds Catherine Duncan
description: The marriage of Miss Catherine Marie Duncan to Lawrence Charles Gentile took place Monday at United States headquarters in Naha, Okinawa, where the bride groom is head of the mathe matics department for schools operated by the De partment of Defense for overseas dependents.

title: RoundUp by Indian Troops
description: DACCA, Dec. 21 (UPI)In dian troops began confiscating weapons carried by Bengalis to day and rounding up youths without proper identification papers in a move to ward off the possibility of massacres of collaborators with the Pakistani Government.

title: Liquor Is Coming to W.C.T.U. Citadel
description: EVANSTON, Ill., Dec. 21 Liquor, banned from this home of the Women's Christ ian Temperance Union for more than a century, moved toward legality today after the City Council decided last night to permit its sale in Evanston's clubs, restaurants and hotels.

title: Yale Trims Wake Forest
description: WINSTONSALEM, N. C., Dec. 21 (AP)Yale jumped to a 17 point halftime lead tonight and held off Wake Forest for an 8575 victory.

title: STRICT LIMITS SET ON AIR POLLUTION IN FIVE INDUSTRIES
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 21 William D. Ruckelshaus, ad ministrator of the Environmen tal Protection Agency, an nounced today Federal air pol lution performance standards for new and modified plants in five categories.

title: Thaler Indictedfor Receipt Of Stolen Treasury Bills
description: Seymour R. Thaler, who served as a State Senator from Queens for 13 years until he was elected last month as State Supreme Court justice, was indicted here yesterday on charges of criminally receiving $R0n, nnn in stolen United States Treasury bills.

title: Penny Is Planning to Sell A Parcel to Hanover Trust
description: PHILADELPHIA, Dec. 21 Trustees of the Penn Central Railroad announced today they had entered into a contract to sell the front parcel of the Manufacturers Hanover Trust Building in New York for $3,350,625.

title: Pay Board Adjourns in a Deadlock Over Aerospace Wage Ruling
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 21The Pay Board deadlocked tonight on the key aerospace wage is use. Despite intensifying pres sure for a tough stand, it was unable to decide whether to enforce its guidelines against a 12 per cent raise.

title: Suns Down 76ers
description: PHOENIX, Ariz., Dec. 21 (AP) The Phoenix Suns rallied twice in the second half tonight for a 124.119 victory over the Philadelphia 76ers.

title: Greater Protection Of Asian Art Urged
description: Distressed by the renewed, intense fighting in Cambodia with some rockets falling into Pnompenh, the capital, a committee of distinguished American art experts has ap pealed urgently to the De fense Department to take fur ther action to protect impor tant artistic monuments in Indochina.

title: OTB TO BE BILLED BY YONKERS TRACK FOR DROP IN BETS
description: Yonkers Raceway has drawn up a bill for $650,943.60 it says the Offtrack Betting Corpora tion owes it as reimbursement for lost parimutuel revenue.

title: U.S. PLEA REPORTED ON TAIPEI NEWSMEN
description: UNITED NATIONS, N. Y., Dec. 21George Bush, the United States delegate, was re ported today to be urging Sec retary General Thant to recon sider the expulsion of the two Chinese Nationalist correspond ents who had worked at the United Nations.

title: Hanoi Condemns U.S.
description: HONG KONG, Dec. 21 Bombardments of North Viet nam were condemned anew in Hanoi yesterday as four Amer ican pilots were shown at a news conference.

title: Ashbrook Picks Up Support Of Loeb in New Hampshire
description: MANCHESTER, N. H., Dec. 21 (AP)Representative John M. Ashbrook, Republican of Ohio, who is reportedly being urged by conservatives to run against President Nixon, visited New Hampshire today and picked up the support of the publisher of the state's largest newspaper.

title: Guyana's HisandHer Team at U.N.
description: UNITED NATIONS, N.Y. the household of Am bassador Frederick H. Talbot of Guyana and his wife, Dr. Sylvia Talbot, they both in sist there are no hangups about his career and her career.

title: U.S. Concedes at Least One Jet Was Lost Near Hanoi
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, Wednesday, Dec. 22  The United States command con firmed this morning that one and possibly two of the four Air Force fighterbombers shot down or lost over the weekend crashed inside North Vietnam east of Hanoi while evading North Vietnamese MIG's that shot down another jet over Laos.

title: Dog, Hunted for 3 Days, Is Captured at Kennedy
description: Larry, a German shepherd dog who has been eluding captors since Sunday in the weedy marshes of Kennedy International Airport, was caught there at 10 o'clock last night in a grassy area alongside the Van Wyck Expressway.

title: C.B.S. to Halt Manufacturing Of Electronic Video Recorder
description: Lower labor costs in Eng land and Japan have prompted the Columbia Broadcasting Sys tem to dispose of the manufac ure and marketing of its inven tion of electronic video record ing.

title: Six Private Colleges Ruled Eligible for State Funds
description: ALBANY, Dec. 21 (AP) State Education Commissioner Ewald B. Nyquist ruled today that six previously ineligible private colleges will receive state financial asistance.

title: Hofstra Triumphs, 6056
description: HEMPSTEAD, L. I., Dec. 21 Hofstra turned back a late rally by Massachusetts to score its third straight triumph tonight, 6056.

title: WARREN LEVERETT OF NATIONAL ZINC CO.
description: CHATHAM, N. J., Dec. 21 Warren H. Leverett, who retired as president of the National Zinc Company, Inc., in 1958, died today in Overlook Hospi tal, Summit, after a long illness. He was 85 years old and lived at 5 Holly Drive.

title: Cambodia Reports Gain
description: PNOMPENII, Cambodia, Dec. 21 (AP)A Cambodian task force reported breaking through today to relieve a garrison be sieged for 10 days on the north east Cambodian front.

title: Hanrahan Assesses Race
description: CHICAGO, Dec. 12 (AP) Edward V. Hanrahan, Cook County (Chicago) state's attor ney, whom Democratic organi zation slatemakers dropped because he is under indict ment, said today that he would announce tomorrow whether he would seek reelection in 1972. Mr. Hanrahan said, The aboutface of Mayor Rich ard J. Daley and the Demo cratic slatemakers is a shock ing disappointment to me.

title: U.N. Council Backs IndiaPakistan Troop Pullback
description: UNITED NATIONS, N. Y., Dec. 21The Security Council, meet ing in a night session, called today for the withdrawal of Indian and Pakistani forces as soon as practicable to their respective territories and de manded that the ceasefire re main in effect until then.

title: US, AUTHORIZES OIL IMPORT RISE
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 21  President Nixon increased to day the authorized level of oil imports for 1972 into states east of the Rocky Mountains by 100,000 barrels a day to total of 1,550,000 barrels a day.

title: STOCKS ADVANCE AS TRADING FALLS
description: Big gains in individual issues featured a stock market yester day that generally consolidated its sweeping Monday advance.

title: Duane Thomas, Cowboys Angry Man, Is Gunning for the Vikings
description: Duane Thomas fumbled on the goal line, an error that cost the Dallas Cowboys a touch down and possibly victory in last January's Super Bowl game won by Baltimore, 1613. Thomas has never been quite the same, although once more he will be a key figure in the playoffs leading to the Super Bowl.

title: TV: Hard News Documentaries on Home Screen
description: You want news specials? You'll get news specials until you cry I Love Lucyat least during this week, which, as even television executives concede, traditionally loses viewers to the bustling activi ties of the holidays.John Chancellor as corre spondent, N.B.C. cameras spent a day with President Nixon, his family, his advis ers and his various visitors. One catch: Whenever the conversations became confi dential, N.B.C. was locked out.

title: Economic Analysis
description: After the Washington mone tary agreement, which Presi dent. Nixon described as the most significant in the history of the world, joy reigns on Wall Street. But in many for eign finance ministriesand at the United States Treasury  elation is lacking. Government officials have a deeper appreelation of the prob lems that still con front the United States, Europe and Japan. The United States has no intendon within the foreseeable future of restoring convertibil ity to the dollar.

title: GOVERNOR ADOPTS A FIRM TAX STAND
description: Governor Rockefeller said yesterday that if the Legisla ture did not act on the state's fiscal crisis at a special session he has called for next Monday I'll call them back.

title: Advertising:
description: The Harvard Business Re view is going into its 50th year with a shot in the arm a new editor who is also its first publisher and a man who is looking for growth.

title: Who Knows How Many Millions Have Been Killed in the East?
description: DACCA, Pakistan, Dec. 21 (AP)The whole country is a mass grave. Who knows how many millions have been killed?

title: Mine Union Loses in Court
description: PITTSBURGH, Dec. 21 (UPI) Federal District Judge Wil liam W. Knox signed yesterday an order awarding triple dam ages, totaling $420,000 to the Solar Fuel Company, Hoovers vile, Somerset County, against the United Mine Workers and its District 2. The award con cluded the trial of a suit filed two years ago by the company, which alleged that more than $300,000 worth of personal property was destroyed in period of labor trouble.

title: Fanny May Directors Vote A FourforOne Stock Split
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 21 (UPI) The Federal National Mort gage Association announced to day that its directors had voted a 4for1 stock split for holders of record Jan. 17, 1972. The new shares will be distributed Feb. 18.

title: LLOYD MASON, 77, OF PAINE, WEBBER
description: PHOENIX, Arix., Dec. 21 Lloyd W. Mason, former manag ing partner of Paine, Webber, Jackson & Curtis, member of the New York Stock Exchange and other exchanges, died yes terday. He was 77 years old.

title: 28 KILLED IN CRASH OF AIRLINER IN SOFIA
description: SOFIA, Bulgaria, Dec. 22 (UPI)At least 28 persons were killed last night in the crash of a Bulgarian airliner shortly after take off from Sofia Airport on a flight to Algeria, the Bulgarian Government announced today.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor: The Price Commission review of rate increases for gas, electricity and telephone service approved by Federal and state regulatory agencies may be the new force needed to overhaul the obsolete utility ratemaking process.

title: SlumRepair Unit Dismisses 3 Aides
description: Three officials of the city's emergency housingrepair programincluding the No. 2 man were dismissed yesterday because of charges involving improper financial transactions with contractors.

title: Good Will Toward Men? Well...; Thefts and a Strike Mar Season for Salvation Army
Fickle Weather Playing Tricks On Operators of Skiing Areas
description: Favored by subfreezing weather, ski area operators from the Poconos to northern New England kept their maintenance crews busy making snow last night. The thermometer plunged to below zero at Stowe, much to the delight of Sepp Ruschp, the head of that popular Vermont center. The appearance of the frigid weather, however, found Hans Thorner, the colorful, Swissreared Magic Mountain entrepreneur, nursing mixed emotions. He also had his snowmaking guns going full speed. But he appeared a little suspicious.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor: Two Dec. 12 articles provide an interesting perspective on participative decisionmaking as a solution for controversial social problems. In the first, The Times reports that group of engineers and environmentalists has concluded that there is crying need for such decisionmaking in the siting of electric power plants to assure minimum adverse environmental impact. The group recommends forums modeled along the lines of the old town meetings.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor: Unless he fulfills his obligation to provide adequate care for all delivered through his intervention the appointment of Prof. Robert M. Byrn as legal guardian of any fetus smacks of irresponsibility.

title: Disputed Bronx Site Sold to Russians
description: A heavily wooded tract in the Riverdale section of the Bronx, long the proposed site of a controversial highrise housing project, has been sold instead to the Soviet Union.

title: Cuban Delegation Opens Talks With Soviet Leaders
description: MOSCOW, Dec. 22 (Reuters)  Cuban and Soviet leaders began talks today on Communist party relations and economic cooperation.

title: New Rules for Pilots
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 22, (Reuters)The Defense Department acknowledged today shift in policy, giving United States combat pilots greater freedom to attack antiaircraft missile sites in North Vietnam.

title: Transit Authority Focuses On Improving Production
description: The Transit Authority emphasized in labor negotiations yesterday its desire to work with its unions to improve productivity and overall performance.

title: 3 Sons of Policemen Indicted In Killing of Animals in Zoo
description: WHITE PLAINS, Dec. 22 (AP)Three youths, all sons of policemen, who were arrested last August for killing and mutilating animals in the children's zoo in nearby Harrison were indicted today by a Westchester County grand jury.

title: TaxExempt Fund Gives City $12,000 Donation
description: The Twentieth Century Fund, with assets of $28million, announced yesterday that it would give the city treasury $12,000 in lieu of real estate taxes, from which the fund is exempt.

title: State Considering Making Regents Exams Optional
description: The State Board of Regents is considering major changes in the concept and conduct of the 106yearold Regents examination program, including proposal that the tests no longer be generally mandated for high school graduation.

title: Death Off Amchitka
description: The dictionary defines cavitation as 'the rapid formation and collapse of vapor pockets in a flowing liquid. Cavitation was the cause of death for approximately thousand sea otters in the waters off Amchitka Island in the Aleutians following the nuclear test last month. This loss is ten to fifty times higher than that predicted in the Atomic Energy Commission's environmental impact statement last June or than the even smaller number the A.E.C. estimated immediately after the explosion.

title: Private Connecticut Colleges Report Drop in Enrollment
description: HARTFORD, Dec. 22EnIrollment in independent colleges in Connecticut has fallen for the first time in more than 20 years, a report from the State Board of Education indicated today.

title: Pay Board to Cut Raises For Aerospace Workers
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 22A majority of the 15man Pay Board has determined that wage settlements in the aerospace industry must be cut back, board sources disclosed today.

title: WNET to Relive an Era in A Murrow Retrospective
description: A Murrow Retrospective, it weeklong look at Edward R. Murrow, the late television journalist, and his crusading documentaries, will be televised on Channel 13 nightly from Jan. 3 through Jan. 7. In addition, the entire program will be repeated on Saturday, Jan. 8, from 3:30 to 8 P,M.

title: Powell, Rehnquist Get Commissions of Office
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 22 (UPI)President Nixon presented framed certificates of office today to the newly confirmed Supreme Court Justices, Lewis F. Powell Jr. and William H. Rehnquist. He admonished them to put the law first, without any political considerations.

title: An Ombudsman at Columbus High School Is Helping Solve Crises in Classrooms
description: Eighteen year old Sharon had just come from an angry shouting match with her history teacher and she was upset. There was no doubt about that.

title: 47 OIL CONCERNS GET NORTH SEA LICENSES
description: LONDON, Dec. 22 (UPI) The Department of Trade and Industry has granted 47 companies petroleum production licenses for the continental shelf of the southern basin of the North Sea, it was announced today.

title: Swarthmore Gets Gift To Tune of $1Million
description: ARMONK, N. Y., Dec. 22 (AP)Eugene M. Lang who can't carry a tune said today that he had given ?? million to Swarthmore College for a music center because music is the art form that is most participatory and the one that is easiest for most people to enjoy.

title: News Policy for the Vietnam War: As Little as Possible
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, Dec. 22The American air war over Indochina has taken serious turn in recent months. The situation became dramatically apparent last weekend with the loss of four planesbut the news came first from Hanoi, not Saigon or Washington. The bombing campaign, as American officials in Washington and in South Vietnam h a v e been taking great pains to explain recently, is only half as big in numbers of planes and bomb tonnages as it was at the peak of United States involvement in 1968. The losses may have come as news to the American public but not to the North, Vietnamese, who continue to bear the brunt of heavy bombing on their supply trails in Laos if not in North Vietnam.

title: U.S CONCERN GETS SOVIET CONTRACT
description: MOSCOW, Dec. 22  The Soviet Union today signed a contract with SwindellDressler Company for the design of steel foundry at what Moscow plans as the world's largest truck factory near the Kama River.

title: Tailor, an Instant Millionaire, Planning an Instant Retirement
description: VINELAND, N. J., Dec. 22 Tomorrow, Thomas Mazzola says, ho will take down the Mazzola's Tailor Shop sign, but that is the only definite plan he has made since learning that he and his wife had won $1tnillion in New Jersey's State Lottery today.

title: Browns Lowest in League In the Area of SelfEsteem
description: On a cold gray December afternoon with at least 70,000 Browns fans in the stands, the craggy old Cleveland Municipal Stadium has a quality all its own. John Unitas will remember. On such an afternoon in 1964 the Unitas team the Baltimore Colts inexplicably lost the National Football League championship to the Browns 270 in a major upset.

title: LINDSAY HITS BACK ON POLICE CONTROL
description: Mayor Lindsay attacked yesterday the petty piranhas of the political marketplace who have tried to interfere with what he described as his long battle to establish the principle of civilian control of the police.

title: CANADIAN FUGITIVES ARRESTED IN QUEENS
description: Three Canadian fugitives, including one wanted for murder and another classified in Montreal as among the 10mostwanted criminals, were arrested in a Queens apartment last night by state troopers and New York City policemen.

title: AUSTRALIA SHIFTS CURRENCY'S VALUE
description: SYDNEY, Australia, Dec. 22 The Cabinet decided tonight to increase the value of the Australian dollar against the United States dollar by 6.32 per cent. Since some of Australia's major trading partners have increased the value of their currencies by an even greater amount, the net result for Australia's dollar is an effective devaluation of 2.25 per cent as viewed against the background of her overall trade.

title: Books of The Times
description: In Natalie Natalia, Nicholas Mosley has conveniently collected, all in one volume, an impressive number of the tricks, techniques and affectations that make avantgarde novels both more tiresome and more provocative than conventional ones. You can't say he doesn't warn you, for he begins the book with one of the most demanding of the new devices: the openended incident. This consists of an encounter or an experience that may mean anything, everything or nothing. It may simply be mood noises, with no attempt at relating to the theme of the book In this instance, Anthony Greville, a Conservative Member of Parliament currently embroiled in African politics, is offered a lift in limousine as he is leaving a building. The offer comes from an African: He refuses it, and the African gets out and behaves in way that might equally be interpreted as mocking, intimidating or beseeching Greville runs from the African and accidenfatly strikes his head against a stone, drawing blood. The passage, though often alluded is clarified.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor: Inasmuch as New York State is facing a deficit necessitating increased taxes and reduced services perhaps our concerned legislators would leadthe way by rescinding the salary increase they so readily voted themselves this year.

title: Walsh Resigns as Fordham's President
description: The Rev. Michael P. Walsh has resigned as president of Fordham University, effective next June 30.

title: 98 G.I.'s From Vietnam Visit Home Free
description: Unflawed holiday air travel, something usually reserved only for the most important dignitaries, was lavished yesterday at Kennedy International Airport on 98 servicemen home from Vietnam for the holidays.

title: PARK'S FOES IN SEOUL BEGIN PROTEST SITIN
description: SEOUL, South Korea, Dec. 22  Opposition legislators began a sitin in the National Assembly chamber today in a desperate attempt to prevent passage of a controversial bill that would give President Park Chung Hee special emergency powers.

title: DALILA SUNG AT MET BY SANDRA WARFIELD
description: Sandra Warfield, a mezzosoprano who was a member of the Metropolitan Opera from 1953 to 1957 before leaving it for several years, is hack with it again now and on Tuesday night took over the role of Dalila for the first time in the company's production of SaintSaens's Samson et Dalila. She had sung the part in the Metropolitan's concert performances of the work in the, parks in 1968.

title: New Zealand to Follow
description: WELLINGTON, New Zealand, Dec. 22 (Reuters)The Minister of Finance, Robert Muldoon, said today that New Zealand would follow Australia an devaluing her dollar.

title: Lionel Trilling Named to Deliver Jefferson Lecture in Humanities
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 22Lionel Trilling of Columbia University, the writer and teacher, was named today to give the first of the yearly Jefferson Lectures in the Humanities, which carries an award of $10,000.

title: Boys From Syracuse Are GiantKillers
description: Syracuse University's exciting little basketball team keeps bucking up against the odds and the big players. The Orange has drawn Louisville, the pretournament favorite, for Monday night's opening round of the 20th annual HoliFestival at Madison Square Garden. Last winter Syracuse met Penn in the opening round of the Quaker City tourney at Philadelphia and extended the unde feated Quakers to overtime before losing to the tournament favorite and eventual winner.

title: Bridge: Some New York Experts Use Interesting Bidding System
description: An interesting extension of a wellknown bidding device has been developed by some of the younger New York experts. The idea is to designate a jump response of three hearts or three spades after a one notrump opening as a splinter, promising at most a singleton in the suit. This jump shift is relatively useless in a natural sense., especially if TwoWay Stayman or Jacoby transfer bids are being used.

title: Price Unit Acts to Limit Insurance Premium Rises
Bonuses Are Allowed If Pattern Has Existed
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 22 (AP)Most Christmas yearend bonuses will not be covered by the wage and salary guidelines if the employer has given the bonuses previously, the Internal Revenue Service said today.

title: Siesel E. Canaday Is Dead; Formed Cooler Company
description: Siesel E. Canaday who retired in 1951 as president of the Canaday Cooler Company which he had organized in 1927 died Tuesday at his winter home in Miami Beach. He was 82 years old and lived at 10 Sturges Road in Bronxville N. Y.

title: Oilers Drop Hughes
description: HOUSTON, Dec. 22 (AP) Ed Hughes was let go as the Houston Oiler head coach today only hours after Bud Adams, the club's owner, said Hughes would return if he and the coach could agree on two issues.

title: RESERVES OF GAS SUBJECT OF STUDY
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 22The Federal Power Commission announced today that it had started a major study of United States gas reserves.

title: GEORGE E. GABA
description: George E. Gaba general credit manager of J. P. Stevens & Co., Inc., textile manufacturer and distributor died of a coronary attack yesterday in Roosevelt Hospital. He was 61 years old and lived at 12 Cedars Road Caldwell, N. J.

title: Arthur Daley
description: Amid the cascade of Christmas mail was a white envelope from Jack Lang, the house mother for the Baseball Writers Association of America. In his role as secretarytreasurer he was issuing formal ballots to the lodge brothers for the 1972 election to the Hall of Fame at Cooperstown. This has always been one of the more solemn responsibilities of the pressbox tenants and I find myself often amazed at the frequency with which these highly intelligent and knowledgeable men botch their assignment. Last year, for instance the writers elected no one and that was a genuine shocker. Among the candidates for the first time was that blithe spirit, Yogi Berra. Since Yogi not only had all the performance credentials he needed along with enormous popularity with the voters everyone assumed he would be a shooin.

title: Ferdinand Roth Is Dead at 65; Was Real Estate Commissioner
description: Ferdinand Roth, president of the real estate management concern of Wm. C. Walker Sons and City Commissioner of Real Estate from 1960 to 1962 died Tuesday apparently of a heart attack at his home 11 Stuyvesant Oval. He was 65 years old.

title: Soled ad Trial Delayed
description: SAN FRANCISCO Dec. 22 (UPI)Superior Court Judge S. Lee Vavuris ordered a delay today in the trial of the two Soledad Brothers when the defense presented a doctor's certificate that Richard Silver attorney for Fleeta Drumgo had acute bacterial bronchitis and a high temperature.

title: U.S. COURT SCORES STATE MINORS LAW
description: A threejudge Federal court here set aside the convictions of 200 wayward minors yesterday on the ground that they had been punished under unconstitutionally vague state law.

title: Text of Price Unit's Statement on Rents
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 22Following is the text of Price ComMission policy statement, issued today, governing rent increases in the nation:

title: Is Yugoslavia in Danger?
description: There was a time when speculation about Yugoslavia's future centered around the question whether a unified country could survive the passing of President Tito. But even though he is still very much alive, the survival of a unified Yugoslavia today is more serious doubt than at any time since World War II.

title: Legislature in Westchester Approves a 1% Sales Tax
description: WHITE PLAINS, Dec. 22 The Westchester County Board of Legislators today passed 1 per cent sales tax, the first in the county's history, to take effect on Sept. 1, 1972.

title: C.A.B. Chiefs'
description: The chairman of the Civil Aeronautics Board, Secor D. Browne, predicted yesterday, that the nation's major airlihes, which went into a disastrous slump in 1970, would make a beforetax profit of $325million to $350million in 1972.

title: Bundesbank Rate Cut % To 4% to Spur Industry
description: BONN, Dec. 22West Germany's Bundesbank, or central bank, today lowered its bank rate to 4 per cent from 4 per cent in a determined effort to help West German industry adapt to the mark's higher value. The new rate will take force tomorrow.

title: White House Report Applauds Nixon's 3d Year
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 22 (UPI)  The White House said today that the third year of Richard Nixon's Presidency had produced such large conceptions, daring innovation and substantial progress that the Democrats in Congress would find that the best way to get reelected was to support Nixon programs.

title: Brandt, in Talk With Nixon, To Stress U.S.Europe Ties
description: BONN, Dec. 22Chancellor Willy Brandt said today that he was going to visit President Nixon next week with one big question how West Europe and the United States could maintain close relations.

title: Star Spangled Girl' on the Screen
description: It's been precisely five years since Neil Simon's "Star Spangled Girl" first was staged on Broadway like a decorative, sparkling, largely gag-filled Christmas stocking. But time and Hollywood have not done wonders for his exuberant but still essentially lightweight comedy. The movie version that turned up yesterday at the Ziegfeld and other houses around town, is, like the joke about a chop suey dinner, something that's only momentarily satisfying.Soon after the opening, when one of our impecunious heroes is slickly filching food from a supermarket, a viewer begins to hunger for fare more solid than the constant, if cheerful, repartee and frenetic, sometimes aimless, movement of its supercharged principals. Under the lacklustre direction of Jerry Paris, the frothy, comic idea of a pair of bright young liberal operators of an underground weekly involved, romantically and otherwise, with the square, cute, patriotic "Star Spangled Girl," becomes a pedestrian affair despite all the running and shouting.The scene has been changed from San Francisco to Los Angeles, which really doesn't make things sunnier. The uninspired adaptation of Simon's antic is a basically contrived affair that may get a share of chuckles but not many hearty laughs. Mr. Simon's slight but effervescent jape has been reconstituted in the manner of a standard television situation comedy dependent on often banal sight gags that rarely are as funny as some of the film's rapidly delivered lines.Sandy Duncan, the pert heroine of commercials ("Noxema," etc.) and TV's "Funny Face," is not especially comic as the Olympic swimming aspirant from Cypress Gardens, Fla., who, quite innocently, disrupts the lives of her bill collector-harried neighbors, Tony Roberts and Todd Susman, shoestring publisher and writer of "Nitty Gritty." Miss Duncan looks great in hot pants but her artificial, corn pone accent and bland expression hardly make her the convincing beauty who would churn the emotions of her opposite numbers.The curly-haired Tony Roberts is glib, flip and superficially precise as the driven publisher.And Mr. Susman, a frustrated dynamo, generates little but buzzing action. As a minimally effective gag, Elizabeth Allen plays their man-adoring landlady as a sporting type who drags a suffering Mr. Roberts along on her motorbike, surfboard and plane without speaking a word.The words constantly emanating from "Star Spangled Girl" often are funny but what this embroiled trio projects is rarely merry even during a holiday season.

title: Wedding in South For Miss Godfrey
description: WINSTONSALEM, N. C., Dec. 22In the Centenary Methodist Church here tonight Miss Judith Godfrey, daughter of Mrs. Richard Calvert Godfrey and the late Mr. Godfrey, was married to Yeoman 3d Cl. David Henley Day, who is serving with the Coast Guard at Governors Island, New York. He is the son of Mrs. Henley French Day and the late Mr. Day. The Rev. Roland Barnhardt performed the ceremony.

title: Boston U. Blanks R.P.I. To Win Hockey Tourney, 40
description: BOSTON, Dec. 22 (AP)Don Cahoon set Dave Wisener up for a breakaway goal in the second period tonight to start Boston University en route to a 4.0 victory over Rensselaer Tech for the Eastern College Athletic Conference Christman Tournament championship at the Boston Garden.

title: O.E.C.D. EXPERTS EXPRESS CAUTION
description: PARIS, Dec. 22  As the exchange markets slid into preChristmas doldrums, specialists of the Organization for Economic Cooperation and Development struck a note of caution today about the impact of the weekend currency realignment on the United States.

title: Offer by Kerkorian Seeks 240,000 Shares of. MGM
description: Kirk Kerkorian, the West Coast financier, announced yesterday he would seek to purchase, within the next few days, 240,000 shares of the common stock of MetroGoldwynMayer, Inc., through tender offer at $19 a share. The offer will expire on Jan. If all 240,000 shares were tendered, they would increase his holdings in the motionpicture and distributing company from 40 per cent to about 44 per cent.

title: Foreign Governments Owe U.S. $50Billion
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 22 (UPI)The Treasury reported today that foreign governments owe the United States $50billion in debts incurred in World War I and later.

title: Congratulations From Vienna
description: VIENNA, Dec. 22President Franz Jonas, whom Mr. Waldheim opposed in the Presidential election last April, said in a cablegram to Mr. Waldheim:

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor: I read with interest Jack Chen's The Lin Piao Mystery (OpEd Dec. 3) that is the disappearance of Lin Piao and a few others from the public scene. I agree with him that this by no means indicates that China is coming apart at the seams under the stress of a power struggle... Yet. I am not so sure that it is due solely to a reorganization after the Cultural Revolution.

title: Evacuation in Laos
description: VIENTIANE, Laos, Dec. 22 (UPI)The commander of the Government's Second Military Region, Maj. Gen. yang Pao, ordered the evacuation today of about 10,000 civilian and military dependents from Long Tieng, a key base on the Government's defense perimeter that has been under attack since enemy troops reoccupied the strategic Plaine des Jarres Saturday. Long Tieng is on the southern edge of the plain.

title: Soviet Charges That China Encourages Expansion of U. S. Aggression in Indochina
description: MOSCOW, Dec. 22Pravda, the authoritative Communist party newspaper, charged today that China had given the United States a green light for the expansion of aggression in South Vietnam, Laos and Cambodia by bringing her foreignpolicy positions into line with Washington on number of other issues.

title: Record '72 Winter Wheat Crop Forecast by Agriculture Unit
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 22 (AP) The Agriculture Department forecast today the 1972 winter wheat crop at a record 1,291,428,000 bushels, up 11 per cent from this year's production.

title: A Placement by A.T.&T To Raise Record $ 1 Billion
WALDEN WARNS U.N. ON PROBLEMS
description: UNITED NATIONS, N. Y., Dec. 22Kurt Waldheim, the Austrian career diplomat newly elected as Secretary General, and U Thant, retiring after 10 years, today underscored the political crises and desperate financial condition confronting the United Nations as the 132 members ended the 26th General Assembly session.

title: Pakistan Criticizes U.N.
description: RAWALPINDI, Pakistan, Dec. 22 The Foreign Office tonight sharply criticized the United Nations Security Council resolution as weak and inadequate.

title: OTC LIST RISES, BUT AMEX EASES
The New Secretary General
description: The most remarkable feature of the election of Kurt Waldheim as Secretary General of the United Nations the fact that the deeply divided world organization was able to agree on anyone at all as a successor to U Thant.

title: Trade Commission Questions Toothpaste Ad Claims
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 22The advertising claims of eight leading brands of toothpaste and three denture cleaners were called into question today by the Federal Trade Commission.

title: Negro Educators Aided in Upgrading
description: COLUMBUS, Miss.When schools were integrated in Utica, Miss., last year, Mrs. Mildred M. Gettis, like hundreds of other black educators around the South, began to worry about her job.

title: L. C. GUMBINNER, 73, AD AGENCY FOUNDER
description: Lawrence C. Gumbinner, a founder of the advertising agency that bore his name died Tuesday at his home 215 East 68th Street. He was 73 years old.

title: Handwriting Expert Challenges Witness For Dowdy at Trial
description: BALTIMORE, Dec. 22Prosecutors in the bribery trial of Representative John Dowdy, Democrat of Texas, presented today a handwriting expert who challenged the authenticity of documents produced by a defense witness.

title: Dr. Clarence Little, Cancer Researcher, Dies at 83
description: BAR HARBOR, Me., Dec. 22  Dr. Clarence Cook Little a leading geneticist and founder of the Roscoe B. Jackson Memorial Laboratory for cancer research here, died of a heart attack in the Maine Coast Memorial Hospital. He was 83 years old and lived in nearby Trenton.

title: Putting Teeth Into Controls
description: In signing the extended Economic Stabilization Act, President Nixon has expressed confidence that the battle to halt inflation can be successfully completed in the next twelve months. The country will surely benefit that forecast proves accurate; but so much confusion still surrounds almost every aspect of the control program, especially on the wage side, that it is difficult to share the President's optimism at this point.

title: Large Soviet Art Show Will Tour U.S.
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 22The largest exhibition of ancient and contemporary art objects ever sent abroad by Soviet authorities will begin a United States tour in Washington next month as part of the SovietAmerican exchange program.

title: 2 New Encyclopedias Are Aids To Fanciers and Breeders Alike
description: Two Impressive works, helpful to both the amateur fancier and the professional breeder have made their appearances recently on the book marts.

title: MARGIN IS RAISED IN WHEAT FUTURES
description: The Chicago Board of Trade yesterday increased the initial margin for wheat futures from 10 cents to 12 cents a bushel. The change became effective immediately.

title: Bride Offers Her Gifts As a Reward in Murder
description: A young Bronx bride Mrs. Miriam Mitzner offered her wedding gifts yesterday as reward to anyone who would bring to justice the murderers of her shopkeeper father Izzy Pacht.

title: Cambodian Battle in 3d Day
description: PNOMPENH, Cambodia, Dec., 22 (AP)A Cambodian military spokesman said today that as a battle for the riverside village of Peam Chhkork, 46 miles north of here, entered its third day, North Vietnamese forces were so close to Government lines that allied warplanes were unable to bomb and strafe effectively.

title: Castro Says Freighter Captain Admits Being Agent for C.I.A.
description: MIAMI, Dec. 22 Premier Fidel Castro of Cuba announced tonight that the captain of Miamibased freighter seized last week by Cuban gunboats had confessed to being an agent for the Central Intelligence Agency.

title: Anita Samen Is Bride Of Steven W. Morse
description: HARRISON, N. Y., Dec. 22 Miss Anita Marian Samen and Steven Wayne Morse were married this evening at the Jewish Community Center of Harrison by Rabbi Norton Shargel.

title: FARES FOR MILITARY REDUCED BY PAN AM
description: FRANKFURT, West Germany, Dec. 22 (UPI)Pan American World Airways today announced a special reduced fare package on transAtlantic air travel for United States military personnel based in Britain and West Germany.

title: EQUITY FINANCING
description: ICM Realty raised an indicated $23million with the sale yesterday through a Loeb, Rhoades & Co. group of one million shares of beneficial interest. This was the realestate investment trust's initial public offering. It specializes in equity investments.

title: PRICE PANEL SETS RENT GUIDELINES; RISES OF 3% SEEN
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 22The Price Commission issued new rent regulations today and said that tenants whose units were not covered by state or local controls would probably pay to 3.5 per cent a year more.

title: Advertising:
description: Carl Spielvogel is moving back to the Interpublic Group of Companies headquarters and into the newly created job of executive vice president for operations. He starts on Jan. 3.

title: Personal Finance
description: In the good old days when insurance was something that everybody more or less took for granted, insurance men conceived of a new kind of gimmick to sell more coverage and eliminate claims.

title: William Denman Eberle
description: On the day that the Senate confirmed William Denman Eberle as President Nixon's special representative for trade negotiations about a month and a half ago, he took off on his first mission for the Government.

title: Gilligan of Ohio Backs Muskie; May Carry Big Delegate Bloc
description: COLUMBUS, Ohio, Dec. 22Gov. John J. Gilligan of Ohio endorsed Senator Edmund S. Muskie for President today, but there was no chorus of assent from other Democrats in the nation's fifth biggest state.

title: $36,000 Taken at L.I. Bank
description: NEW CASSEL, L. I., Dec. 22 A total of $36,000 was taken today from the Chemical Bank branch at 1055 Old Country Road by a man armed with a handgun. The holdup mandescribed as black, 6 feet 2 or more and about 175 pounds with a goatee, mustache and a pockmarked complexionwas met outside by an accomplice waiting in a car.

title: Democratic Leaders Say Party Is Unified for Session on Taxes
description: Democratic leaders of the Legislature insisted yesterday that despite their party's caustic division last week over reapportionment its members would be able to bargain as unit next week should the Republican majority leadership have to turn to them for fiscal votes.

title: LORD STONHAM, 68, EXLABOR MINISTER
description: LONDON, Dec. 22Lord Stonham Minister of State at the Home Office in the former Labor Government died here tonight. He was 68 years old.

title: SCHWEITZER ACTS TO RETIRE JAN. 24 TO AVOID HARING
description: State Supreme Court Justice Mitchell D. Schweitzer announced yesterday that he was retiring from the bench as of Jan. 24the day the Court on the Judiciary was to have begun its hearing into his fitness as a judge  to avoid the stress and strain that the hearing would have.caused him.

title: CLERGY IN SPAIN CRITICAL OF CURBS
description: MADRID, Dec. 22The major claim of the leadership of Generalisimo Francisco Francothat it has given peace to Spain has been bitterly contested by an official document drawn by the Spanish Bishops Committee on Peace and Justice.

title: FIRST ROUND ENDS IN TALKS ON TRADE
description: BRUSSELS, Dec. 22 (Reuters)  The United States and the Common Market today ended their first round of negotiations on trade restrictions with little change in opposing positions, informed sources said.

title: Gierek, Consolidating Rule, Replaces 5 Ministers
description: WARSAW, Dec. 22  Five Government ministers were replaced today in a major reshuffle that further consolidated the leadership of Edward Gierek, the head of the Polish Communist Party.

title: PHILIP BENSON
description: NEW BEDFORD, Mass., Dec 22Philip Benson retired president of the Emerson Investing Company of Boston died today at St. Luke's Hospital after long illness. He was 75 years old and lived in South Dartmouth.

title: Nonrabbis Recruited by Hillel To Counsel Jewish Students
description: GROSSINGER, N. Y., Dec. 22 In a departure from its usual practice, the B'nai B'rith Hillel Foundation has begun to recruit nonrabbinical personnel to cope with the needs of Jewish campus generation grown massive and diverse.

title: H. &
description: Shareholders of the Hudson and Manhattan Corporation at a special meeting yesterday voted to adopt a plan of complete liquidation of the corporation and approved and authorized its dissolution. The company will make an initial distribution in complete iiquidaton in the amounts of $12.82 a share of Class A stock and $66.77 a share of Class B stock to be paid Dec. 30 to holders of record Dec. 27.

title: Gift for Green Thumbs: 1,200 Live Ladybugs
description: How would you like to wake up on Christmas morning and find that someone had sent you 1,200 live ladybugs? Beats, that business about the partridge in the pear tree and all its concomitants, doesn't it? Well, those bugs might happen to you if some well wisher should wander into Bloomingdale's new nature shop, called The Right Things Around Us, on the seventh floor. The thought behind the gift would be ecologicalladybugs are supposed to be just great for spring gardens. And all 1,200 of them would cost just $5. For the same amount of money in the same place it is possible to walk off, for $5, with a package of mushrooms that are supposed to grow if only water is added. (No dank cellars required.) Also in the shop are handwoven wool rope tassel planters for $120, dome terrariums, complete with plants, for $17.50, shells in all sizes, natural straw baskets, earthenware, clay ovenware, natural wooden accessories and cactus plants.

title: SAIGON TO FREE 689 IN HOLIDAY AMNESTY
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, Dec. 22The South Vietnamese Government announced plans today to release 689 politcal prisoners as part of a holiday amnesty.

title: Notes on People
description: Cardinal Cooke, Roman Catholic Archbishop of New York, left last night for his annual visit with American servicemen in Southeast Asia, and on the way will visit Israel and the Near East.

title: ATTICA SUIT SEEKS TO TRY GOVERNOR
description: A group of Attica prison inmates sued in Federal Court here yesterday in an attempt to force the state to prosecute Governor Rockefeller and other state law and penal officials for their handling of the uprising at the prison in September.

title: Melinda Moon Married in France
description: Miss Melinda Messmore Moon and Christian ClementBayard were married Tuesday in France. A civil ceremony was performed in the morning in the Neuilly Town Hall and an Episcopal ceremony, at which a Roman Catholic priest assisted, took place in the afternoon at the American Church in Paris.

title: IN THE NATION
description: The Knapp Commission has been painting an unsavory picture of police corruption in New York City and of police and civil administrations that failed to act as vigorously and as promptly as they should have to clean up the mess. Undoubtedly as the detailed testimony shows, there is a lot of truth in this picture.

title: Executive Changes
description: The Bankers Trust Company announced yesterday that four senior executives will assume new responsibilities beginning Dec. 31. Chester Baylis Jr., who has been chairman of the executive committee, will become chairman of the executive committee of Bankers Trust New York Corporation, the bank's parent company. John W. Hannon Jr. was elected executive vice president and a member the office of the chairman. Charles C. Smith, now senior vice president, was made administrative vice president, and John H. Millikin, senior vice president, will take on the additional duties as chairman of the bank's advisory committee.

title: Lefrak Agrees to Take Welfare Tenants
description: Welfare recipients may not be barred from renting available apartments In Brooklyn controlled by the Lefrak Organization, one of the largest building concerns in the country, under a consent order entered yesterday in Federal District Court in Brooklyn.

description: THE PRESIDENT
