Ten Thoughts for '72
description: WASHINGTONThis is the time of year to compile lists of ten What are the ten greatest changes that we are likely to see in the year ahead?

title: Market Place: A Fresh Slant On Steep Dips
description: Let's face it, if you were the specialist in a Big Board stock like Wrigley, that rarely had enough volume to, make traders take notice you wouldn't be anxious to eat stock, as they say in Wall Street, by the carload if the institutions suddenly soured on it.

title: Refugees to Be Returned
description: CALCUTTA, India, Dec. 22Helped by Indian advisers here in Calcutta, the provisional Bengali government for East Pakistan has prepared a program of action for the reconstruction of the warravaged state.

title: BATELLE EXCELS AS RANGERS BEAT PENGUINS, 4 TO 2
description: In a struggle filled with vignettes of viciousness the Rangers gained a 42 decision over the Pittsburgh Penguins last night, but it wasn't easy.

title: Fruitcakes Are Recalled Because a Few Are Unfit
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 22 (UPI) The Food and Drug Administration announced today the recall of about 4,000 Barton's fruitcakes in twopound tins because a few samples were contaminated with moths and moth larvae.

title: Pollution Program Slated
description: The Union Camp Corporation announced yesterday that it would undertake a $34million, threeyear program to reduce air pollution from its pulp and paper complex in Savannah, Ga. The new program would bring total committed expenditures for environmental protection at Savannah to $56million.

title: JULES GOLDSTEIN, 80, AN APPAREL OFFICIAL
description: Jules Goldstein a lawyer who had been executive secretary of the National Outerwear and Sportswear Association since the formation of the industry group in 1942 died Tuesday in University Hospital. He was 80 years old and lived at 77 East 77th Street.

title: Roman Candles Backfire
description: MILAN, Italy, Dec. 22 (UPI) The Italian League ruled today that Livorno was a 20 winner over Catania in a Second Division soccer game suspended last Sunday when fans invaded the field at Catania and hurled lighted fireworks at officials who had declared a Catania goal invalid. Catania also was ordered to pay damages to a linesman hit by a rock.

title: Film by Cassavetes Takes Friendly Jabs
description: "Minnie and Moskowitz," John Cassavetes's sixth and, in many ways, most ambitious film, is also his friendliest, in the dish-throwing, door-pounding, exclamation-pointed manner of a comic strip. Every frame depicts a bodily assault or an exchange of angry words, representing love.Because it means to be so friendly, and because Mr. Cassavetes has exercised imagination and discipline that lift the film out of the neo-realist rut of "Husbands" and "Faces," I wish I liked "Minnie and Moskowitz" more than I do. It's as open and vulnerable as someone who tells an elaborate ethnic joke, in an accent that isn't very authentic, with a point that isn't very funny.The fact is that although I admired specific things about the film, I never laughed very much and only felt slight, distant tremors of the joy that, I assume, rocked everyone connected with the movie during its production."Minnie and Moskowitz" is a contemporary fairy tale about a youngish, eccentric, parking lot attendant (Seymour Cassel), who is essentially a middle-class Jewish prince in hippie disguise, and the very beautiful, mixed-up, middle-class gentile princess (Gena Rowlands), whose hand he wins in what is certain to be an idyllic, Maggie-and-Jiggs sort of marriage.They meet in a parking lot when Moskowitz steps in (and is immediately flattened) as he attempts to stop Minnie's blind date from beating her up. Thereafter, Mr. Moskowitz, when he isn't pushing Minnie around to prove how much he loves her, gets pushed around by people trying to protect Minnie. They scream at each other, share sudden moments of tenderness, and spend what seems to be an extraordinary amount of time ordering and eating in roadside lunch stands.Mr. Cassavetes's use of exaggerated slapstick gestures to underscore the loneliness and fears of his characters is more interesting in theory than funny or moving in actual fact. This may well have to do with the heavy literalness with which the supposedly comic brawls are photographed (people do get hurt that way), and with the apparent disparity between the characters and their environments.Minnie, for just one example, works at the Los Angeles County Museum and lives in a posh, book-lined duplex, yet she seems to have the mental equipment of Edgar Kennedy's bird-brained wife in those old two-reelers. It doesn't quite fit.To the extent that the material allows them to be, Mr. Cassel and Miss Rowlands are most appealing. However, all of the performances are quite special and this, I think, is Mr. Cassavetes's strongest point.As an actor, he appreciates actors and their mysterious art, as well as their awful dependency on the work of others. This explains why he casts his films so abundantly, using very fine actors in what are practically throw-away roles, or would be throwaway roles in the film of a less fond director."Minnie and Moskowitz" is loaded with small, sometimes lovely, sometimes odd-ball bits, by people like Tim Carey (as a nut in an all-night restaurant), Val Avery (as Minnie's aggressive blind-date), and even by members of the Cassavetes-Rowlands families. Two of the best performances of the film are given by the director's mother, Katherine Cassavetes, as Moskowitz's indulgent Jewish mum, and Mrs. Cassavetes's mother, Lady Rowlands, as Minnie's very starchy, WASPy parent."Minnie and Moskowitz," which opened yesterday at the Cinema II, does reverse one usual movie procedure in that it improves as it goes along, instead of falling apart. Like Minnie and Moskowitz themseves, the movie attempts to fight its way out of the lower depths, but it's not as lucky as its prince and princess.

title: Killer Sentenced to Life
description: BOSTON, Dec. 22 (AP)Robert J. Ejorkman, 21 years old, of Framingham, a construction worker, was sentenced yesterday to life imprisonment for the slaying of Ernest M. Hunt, a Boston lawyer, who was found strangledin his apartment in May, 1970.

title: Theater: Double Bill Inaugurates New Playhouse
Feeding Those Holiday Skiers When They Come Off the Slopes
description: HILLSDALE, N. Y.From here, it's only six miles to the Catamount ski area. And it's here, atop a hill overlooking the Junction of three states and the Berkshire foothills, that the Leonard Birnbaums who do a lot of skiing and a lot of entertaining of skiing friends, have made their country home.

title: Jersey High Court Limits Contingency Legal Fees
description: TRENTON, Dec. 22The New Jersey Supreme Court set limits today on the fees lawyers may charge under contingency arrangements, ending a freemarket system that has seen some attorneys collect as much as half of a client's $100,000 settlement.

title: Confidence on War Ebbs In the Cambodian Army
description: PNOMPENH, Cambodia, Dec. 21A growing awareness of the ability and toughness of North Vietnamese troops fighting in this country and a realization of the frailties of the Cambodian Army are causing deep uneasiness among many Cambodian commanders, who privately admit they are no longer confident about the outcome of the war.

title: Screen: Dirty Harry and His Devotion to Duty
Two Paper Companies in State Get Federal Pollution Mandate
description: The Federal Environmental Protection Agency moved against two large New York State paper companies yesterday in the first step of a major new program that will take over pollution control activities from what are considered lagging state efforts.

title: BUSINESS BUREAUS SCORED IN REPORT
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 22 Representative Benjamin S. Rosenthal today accused the nation's 139 Better Business Bureaus of have little value to the buying public. He charged that their reports to consumers were misleading, inaccurate, incomplete and couched in vague generalities.

title: 2,300 Voices Join in Messiah SingIn
description: They came to sing at Lincoln Center 2,300 vocalists some trained, some untrained and united only by a need to sing and a love of good music. But for a few brief and joyful hours the generation gap was crossed and 2,300 individual voices discovered that they had become a community.

title: 22 Men Are Indicted Here In Plot to Defraud Banks
description: An alleged scheme in which a number of banks in the metropolitan area may have been bilked of $2million in the last several years was disclosed yesterday by the indictment of 22 men in Manhattan and the Bronx.

title: A Christmas Story Translated into Stamps
description: Twas a night or two before Christmas 35 years ago that Joseph Fernandes started to illustrate Clement Clarke Moore's A Visit From St. Nicholas with postage stamps.

title: OUSTER OF NEWSMEN BY U.N. IS PROTESTED
description: CHARLOTTE, N. C., Dec. 22 (AP)  The president of the American Society of Newspaper Editors, in a telegram to Secretary General Thant, has protested the withdrawal of the accreditation of two Chinese Nationalist correspondents at the United Nations.Charlotte Observer, said that if Mr. Thant's decision was allowed to stand, it would mean that he or his successors can oust any correspondent of any nonmember state in political disagreement with any member state.

title: Passports Are Impounded
description: RAWALPINDI, Pakistan, Dec. 22Pakistan's new President, Zulfikar Ali Bhutto, today ordered the impounding of passports belonging to the nation's 22 richest families and to their relatives and dependents.

title: Police vs. Courts
description: The exchange of charges and countercharges between Police Commissioner Patrick Murphy and representatives of the courts and the bar naturally contains elements of selfjustification on both sides, which is to be expected in the face of public criticism.

title: TWO PLANS OFFERED FOR FOREST HILLS
description: State Senator Martin J. Knorr, a Queens RepublicanConservative, said last night that he would submit legislation next year to require the State Urban Development Corporation to build a school or a middleincome housing project on the Forest Hills site now scheduled to be used for 840 units of lowincome housing.

title: Stirred Controversy Often
description: Educator birth control advocate in the 1920's liberal skeptic and cancer researcher Dr. Clarence Cook Little was rarely unembroiled in controversy. This was not because he was a contentious or cantankerous scientist so much as because his views at the times he uttered them tended to be nonconforming.

title: Many Hopes Disappointed In Historic U.N. Assembly
description: UNITED NATIONS. N. Y., Dec. 22The 26th General Assemoly ended its session today, going down in history as the Assembly that admitted mainland China to the United Natans and expelled the representatives of Nationalist China.

title: India Links World Recognition Of Bangladesh to Troop Pullout
description: UNITED NATIONS, N. Y. Dec. 22  Foreign Minister Swaran Singh of India called today for immediate negotiation between India and Pakistan and made it clear that his Government, though pressing for the release of Sheik Mujibur Rahman, did not make this a precondition to the opening of talks.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor: Aba Adnan's Dec. 16 letter, Rights of Palestinians, makes an analogy of the recent history of Palestine with a mass of aliens descending on the Vatican and expelling the Italians. If this abysmal ignorance of history is representative of the viewpoint of most Arabs, it could explain the lack of Palestinian entity today.

title: The Holiday Season Is Gloomy in Belfast
description: BELFAST, Northern Ireland, Dec. 22The Christmas season this year is melancholy in Belfast. The pubs openat 11:30 A.M.and the men :drink beer sullenly.

title: Next Paris Session Dec. 30
description: PARIS, Dec. 22  The North Vietnamese and Vietcong delegations at the peace talks here announced today their acceptance of an. American proposal to hold the next plenary session Dec. 30.

title: Florida 9281 Victor
description: GAINESVILLE, Fla., Dec. 22 (AP)Florida combined a fullcourt press with some sparkling secondhalf shooting to down the Louisiana State Tigers, 9281, in a Southeastern Conference basketball game tonight. Tony Miller was the Gator's scoring star for the evening with a 36point effort.

title: The Under achievements of Congress
description: WASHINGTONCongress has been a continuous underachiever. It would be difficult to overstate the extent of abdication to which Congress has been driven by external and internal forces. Contrary to its preeminent constitutional authority and constitutional stature as the branch of Government closest to the people, it has been reduced to a puny twig through which flows the allocation of a massive taxpayer treasure chest of over $200 billion in appropriations, largely at the beck and call of executive branch and special interest advocacy and pressure. It reacts to the executive far more than it initiates.

title: Soviet Sextet Arrives Here For World Cup Tourney
description: The Soviet Union's national hockey team arrived at Kennedy Airport last night, checked into the Howard Johnson's Motor Lodge and was scheduled to leave this morning for the first roundrobin games in the World Cup Hockey Tournament in Colorado Springs next Monday, Tuesday and Wednesday.

title: Record Winning Marks In the Major Leagues
description: Here is a list of the longest winning streaks in the four major league professional sports:

title: News Analysis
description: Public broadcasting, which since 1951 has been struggling to become established and now has 214 stations, faces the new year with serious problems. The Administration of President Nixon is opposed to the establishment of a fourth national network with Federal funds and next year's financing of noncommercial television probably will not be determined until February. Deep budget cuts are in prospect.

title: HARVARD'S CREW TRIUMPHS ON NILE
description: CAIRO, Dec. 22 (AP)Harvard University's eightman crew beat Yale, Oxford, Cambridge and Egypt again today on the Nile River.

title: CLARION PRESENTS MUSIC OF CHRISTMAS
description: With all the goodwill of the season, it was impossible for this listener to warm to Clarion Concerts Christmas program of early Baroque music in Tully Hall on Tuesday night. Newell Jenkins, the music director, had chosen works by Praetorius, Schutz, Scheidt, Schein and Giovanni Gabrieli, highly respected names of the period.

title: Dollar Firm Abroad
description: LONDON, Dec. 22 (UPI)Currency operators sat on their profits from the dollar's devaluation today and the United States currency rode high for the second day on some of Europe's main exchange markets.

title: U.S.Warned by Pompidou On FarmTrade Demands
description: PARIS, Dec. 22President Georges Pompidou warned the United States tonight that France would make no trade concessions that weakened or eliminated the European Economic Community in agriculture. The French leader declared in a television and radio interview that if the common agricultural market were to be shaken, then I tell you there will be no hope for monetary and economic union, no prospect for political union.

title: Firemen's Overtime Could Total $500 In the New Contract
description: Firemen could earn up to an extra $500 a year in overtime under a provision of the proposed contract between the city and the Uniformed Firefighters Association, according to Herbert Haber the city's Labor Relations Director.

title: Disorder Is Added to Deadlock In Italy's Voting on President
description: ROME, Dec. 22Wild shouting and scuffling, held in check by burly Chamber of Deputies attendants, all but broke up the 21st round of voting for the next president of Italy tonight.

title: Consumer Prices Up a Bit Here
description: consumer prices in the metropolitan area rose modestly last month as the price freeze appeared to take hold, the Bureau of Labor Statistics reported.

title: City Taxi Commission Asks $2.9Million in New Budget
description: Submiting its first expensebudget request yesterday the new Taxi and Limousine Commission asked for $2.9million for the 197273 fiscal year and estimated it would take in about $7.5million in fees.

title: TOUR OF HOSPITALS SHIFTS TO QUEENS
description: Ninety per cent of the 1,210 beds at the Queens Hospital Center do not meet state health standards, the executive director of the center told a delegation of public officials, doctors and nurses that toured the city institution late Tuesday night.

title: Florida Judge Orders Halt In Mining in Area of Spill
description: BARTOW, Fla., Dec. 22 (AP)  Polk County Circuit Judge Gunter Stephenson today halted phosphate mining operations at the Cities Service Company's 10,000acre Fort Meade plant, where a dam burst Dec. 3, spilling a billion gallons of sludge.

title: Price Index Rises By a Small Amount For a Third Month
Saban in Line for Bills Job;
description: Lou Saban will be named head coach of the Buffalo Bills today, The Associated Press reported last night.

title: INCO CHIEF REPORTS USE OF NICKEL FELL
description: Nickel consumption in the nonCommunist world appears to have declined by 15.3 per cent this year, Albert E. Gagnebin, president of the International Nickel Company of Canada, Ltd., indicated yesterday in his annual review

title: Wagner Will Speak Today At Memorial for Kazan
description: A memorial service for Abraham Eli Kazan a pioneer in middleincome cooperative housing, will be held at the Cooperative Auditorium, 551 Grand Street today at 2 P.M. Mr. Kazan, who was 82 years old, died on Tuesday at Beth Israel Hospital.

title: FREEPORT MINERALS IS SET FOR PROJECT
description: The Freeport Minerals Company said yesterday that it will proceed immediately with the development of a large nickelcobalt deposit at Greenvale in Queensland, Australia.

title: TITO ASSERTS ARMY CAN END DISSIDENCE
description: BELGRADE, Yugoslavia, Dec. 22 (UPI)President Tito told the nation today that he would not hesitate to use the army to crush dissidents who threaten the unity of Yugoslavia.

title: Advertising:
description: Judging by the words of its leadership, the Direct Mail Advertising Association is making progress in eliminating three areas of consumer complaint unwanted mall, pornography and advertisers who don't produce as promised.

title: Olivier Fascinating in London Long Day's Journey
description: LONDON, Dec. 22At the last gasp of the old year, the National Theater has redeemed its dismal West End season witha superb version of O'Neill's Long Day's Journey into Night.

title: Austria Sets Parity
description: VIENNA, Dec. 22  The Austrian National Bank today followed the Swiss example and in effect revalued upward its currency, the schilling, visavis the United States dollar while keeping its gold parity unchanged.

title: Wood, Field and Stream
description: With the New Year approaching, those concerned with the welfare of the world's wild creatures would do well to resolve to join forces in the common cause. To be specific, it is time for asinine conflict between hunters and nonhunters to end.

title: Report by Pennsy Points to Progress As Crisis Lingers
description: The bankrupt Penn Central Transportation Company disclosed in a yearend report released yesterday that the railroad was making solid progress but that it could not be. concluded that the Penn Central crisis had passed.

title: Gang That Couldn't' Opens Here
description: Since Jimmy Breslin wrote it, "The Gang That Couldn't Shoot Straight" must have been brighter and funnier as a novel. The movie version opened yesterday and what a tasteless mess it is! Obviously intended as farce, the film is more of an insult to Mafia efficiency than to small-time Italian criminals in Brooklyn.Most of the time, a group of shady dimwits scoot around bumblingly, trying to do in a rival kingpin, played by Lionel Stander. After a fast, jaunty start, the kidding and the playing, both, soon become elephant broad. The gags, with one or two exceptions, are threadbare. And the movie ends, quite literally up in the air, with nowhere else to go.The cast, headed by Jerry Orbach, strives mightily. Paired off as sweethearts, Leigh Taylor-Young and Robert De Niro manage to emerge winningly. As a growling mama, Jo Van Fleet is terrible. Brooklyn, there in the background, looks real enough.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor: I found your Dec. 3 news article about elevenyearold Michael Edmonds simple and beautiful, as simplicity often is.

title: Catholic Group Puts Up Bail for 64 L.I. Prisoners
description: EAST MEADOW, L. I., Dec. 22  Sixtyfour inmates of jails in Nassau and Suffolk Counties whose inability to raise bail confronted them with the prospect of Christmas in prison were released today through the intervention of the St. Vincent de Paul Society.

title: Hanrahan, Defying Daley, Says He'll Stay in Chicago Primary
description: CHICAGO, Dec. 22  State's Attorney Edward V. Hanrahan, defying Mayor Richard J. Daley, announced today that he would remain a candidate for reelection.

title: OBSERVER
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 22For several years, writes a man in Chicago, I tried unsuccessfully to solve my identity crisis through psychiatry and finally gave It up not because it was excessively expensivewhich it was but because it took too much out of me. Lying around on a couch I mean wondering who in the world I was.

title: Common Cause Shifting Thrust To More GrassRoots Activism
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 23Common Cause, the reformist lobby, is ending its first year of fullscale activity with major shift of goals, focus and method, brought on partly by membership and budget problems.

title: Executive Changes
description: John J. Maloney Jr. was elected yesterday president of Thomson & McKinnon Auchincloss, Inc., succeeding William E. Ferguson, who was made chairman and continues as chief executive officer. Mr. Maloney was previously an executive vice president. James C. Barnes, Roger Cortesi and J. Ronald Morgan were named executive vice president.

title: Christmas for a Carolina Boy
description: Every time a Jewish organization tries to knock Christmas pageants out of the public schools this reporter suffers a cringing compulsion to get them on the phone and beg them to cut it out.

title: Hecker Dismissed As Coach of Giants
description: Alex Webster yesterday discharged Norb Hecker, his No. 1 assistant and the defensive coach of the Giants for the last three seasons. Webster, the head coach, described the dismissal as a question of differences in coaching philosophy.

title: MOVE BY RESERVE OUTS BILL RATES
Monetary Reserves Of U.S. Remained Stable in November
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 23United States international monetary reserve assets remained essentially stable again in November at $12.1billion, the Treasury disclosed today.

title: TRAINING IS URGED FOR DAYCARE JOB
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 23The Office of Child Development is working to create a new type of daycare professional whose credentials would consist of a demonstrated competency in working with children, rather than the completion of a college education.

title: 4 Dead and 3 Hurt in Blast At Louisiana Chemical Plant
description: LAKE CHARLES La., Dec. 23 (AP)Four men were killed three others were badly burned and an eighth worker was missing in an explosion today at a chemical plant of the Pittsburgh Plate Glass Industries The company said that damage was exteansive.

title: South African Girl Upsets Sharon Walsh by 62, 86
description: EAST LONDON, South Africa, Dec. 23 (AP)Ilanana Kloss, an unseeded South African teenager, upset thirdseeded Sharon Walsh of San Rafael, Calif., 62, 86, today in the women's singles quarterfinals of the Free State Sugar tennis championships.

title: U.S. Combat Deaths Listed; Toll Below 10 for 11th Week
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, Dec. 23 (UPI)  The United States command said today that seven Americans were killed on the battlefields of Vietnam last week, the 1 1th week in a row in which there were fewer than 10 American combat deaths.

title: TWIN SUPERFECTA PUZZLES BETTORS
description: Those identical $2,470.20 payoffs on Wednesday night's two winning superfecta combinations at Monticello Raceway resulted from a regulation that requires equal distribution in the event of a dead heat.

title: 2d Bus Driver in 2 Days Is Robbed in Morrisania
description: Holdup men for the second successive day flagged down bus in the Morrisania section of the Bronx early yesterday and robbed the driver and his passengers.

title: SEOUL AIDE WARNS OF MARTIAL LAW
description: SEOUL, South Korea, Dec. 23 A Government spokesman warned today that President Park Chung Hee might declare martial law if the National Assembly failed to pass a bill to give him broad powers to cope with national emergencies.

title: Alois Lang of Oberammergau, Passion Play Christus, Dead
description: OBERAMMERGAU Germany Dec. 23 (UPI)  Alois Lang local hotelkeeper associated for more than 50 years with the famous Oberammergau Passion Play, died today after a long illness, friends said. He was 80 years old.

title: China Keeps Sterling Parity And Revalues Against Dollar
description: HONG KONG, Dec. 23China is keeping her currency at parity with the pound sterling and the Hong Kong dollar, thereby upvaluing the jenminpi in terms of the United States dollar.

title: For Some, a Hot Christmas
description: RIO DE JANEIRO, Dec, 23 (AP)It was 94 degrees downtown today, on the second day of summer. One suburb reported 104.

title: The Spirit of Tevye
description: It is Sholom Aleichem who has given to the world, for its everlasting edification, the prototype of the Yiddishspeaking East European Jew whose natural condition Was that of the loving, sardonic, conforming, and contumacious child of God and His people. It is true that by the grace of that same God, Tevye the dairyman escaped from semidestitution into semidemiaffluence. But all his days he remained the original Tevye, whose inquiring mind and challenging spirit mirrored the physical neediness and spiritual indestructibility of the Yiddish masses.

title: ST. JOHN'S TAKES LOBO FINAL, 9592
description: ALBUQUERQUE, N. M., Dec. 23St. John's University defeated the host team, New Mexico, 9592, tonight in the final of the seventh annual Lobo invitation basketball tournament before 14,000 fans.

title: SUIT SEEKS RISE IN AID TO HUNGRY
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 23In an unusual courtroom alliance, the City of New York and the state of Pennsylvania joined with representatives of the poor today in a suit that could force a $600million increase in Federal spending to combat hunger.

title: Stanley Stoler Weds Alice Joan Weinstein
description: Miss Alice Joan Weinstein was married here yesterady afternoon to Stanley Stoler. Rabbi Nathan A. Perilman performed the ceremony in his study at Temple EmanuEl.

title: WASHINGTON
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 23At the end of the year, the pronouncements of the political leaders in Washington sound like comniuniques from a battle. field. The Republican leaders on Capitol Hill summon the press to announce that 1971 was an unqualified triumph, which is bound to assure the reelection of President Nixon in 1972, and the Democratic leaders call the boor reporters back to insist that 1971 was an economic disaster, which is certain to doom Mr. Nixon in November to the retirement and oblivion he deserves.

title: Ryu Knocks Out Barrea
description: TOKYO, Dec. 23 (AP)The Orient welterweight boxing champion, Sorimachi Ryu of Japan, knocked out Refugio Barrea of Mexico today in the fifth round of a nontitle bout.

title: PACIFIC DOCK PACT EXTENDED TO JAN. 10
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 23 (AP)  Pacific Coast longshoremen agreed today to extend their present contract until Jan. 10, heading off a possible resumption of the 100day strike on Christmas day.

title: Revived L.I. Basin Open to Clamming
description: GREENPORT, L. I., Dec. 23  For the first time in eight years, the clam diggers were out in Stirling Basin today.

title: Bail Plea for Miss Davis
description: SAN FRANCISCO, Dec. 23 (AP) Attorneys for Angela Davis have asked the United States District Court here to release the black militant on bail pending the start of her trial Jan. 31. She is awaiting trial in Palo Alto on murder, kidnapping and conspiracy charges stemming from the Aug. 7, 1970, shootout at the Marin County courthouse in which judge and three others were killed.

title: 'Tis the Season of Tinsel From Tokyo to Thailand, Too
description: MANILA, Dec. 23At the top of the escalator in the central department store on Bangkok's Silom Street a large, artificial snowman greets shoppers with a jaggedly sketched smile. Outside the store the temperature is close to 90 degrees. From a ceiling speaker fleets the strains of White Chirstmas.

description: WASHINGTON, Dec, 23 (AP) President Nixon signed today a bill extending for six months the Government's authority to fix an interest rate higher than 6 per cent on Federal Housing Administration and Veterans Administration loans.

title: The Taj Mahal Opens; Camouflage Removed
description: AGRA, India, Dec. 23 (AP) The Taj Mahal opened today for the first time since the IndianPakistani war began.

title: Heath in Ulster for Day To Raise Troop Morale
description: BELFAST, Northern Ireland, Dec. 23Prime Minister Heath paid a surprise visit to British troops in Northern Ireland today surrounded by tight security.

title: Article 2  No Title
description: WACO, Tex., Dec. 23 (AP)Grant Teaff, 38 years old, who developed football programs at McMurry College and Angelo State, was named head football coach at Baylor University tonight.

title: AMADORE PORCELLA
description: ROME, Dec. 23 (UPI)Prof. Amadore Porcella art critic and archeologist, died today at the age of 65.

description: Incense and African music filled the room with the only light coming from the red and green candles on either side of the table.

title: DANIEL J. PRESSMAN OF TEXTILE CONCERN
description: Daniel J. Pressman president of Prestex, Inc., a textile concern at 245 Fifth Avenue died yesterday at his home in the Riverdale section of the Bronx. He was 53 years old.

description: Fred C. Hart, deputy commissioner of the Air Resources Department, will become its Acting Commissioner tomorrow, replacing Robert N. Rickles who resigned, it was announced today.

title: Arrives in St. Louis
description: ST. LOUIS, Dec. 23 (AP)James R. Hoffa arrived here by air tonight and immediately went to suburban Glendale for a reunion with his wife, daughter and grandchildren.

description: BELFAST, Northern Ireland, Dec. 21The British Army command and the professional soldiers who patrol the shabby streets of Belfast and the soft, green countryside of Northern Ireland believe they are making solid progress in their battle. against the Irish Republican Army.

description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 23Government officials said today that while they were not informed in advance of Bob Hope's private efforts to win the release of United States prisoners of war, he was free to pursue them.

description: There's clear evidence that, despite the bath millions of traders took in Wail Street during the 196970 bear market, an exciting idea can still draw enthusiasm in abundance.

description: Allen E. Abrahams has been appointed Vice president of the New York Mercantile Exchange, it announced yesterday. Mr. Abrahams, formerly professor of industrial management at the Polytechnic Institute of Brooklyn, joined the exchange last May.

Moreover, he foresees imminent admission tothe. U.N. of both Germanysperhaps next year.

title: U.S. Railroad TonMileage Down From a Year Earlier
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 23Freight traffic on United States railroads last week was below the yearearlier volume. Intercity truck tonnage increased last week.

title: Chamberlain Sculpture Evokes an Earlier Day
description: An exhibition billed as a major review of the sculpture of John Chamberlain, who is alleged (by the organizer of the exhibition) to be a major sculptor, has just opened at the Solomon R. Guggenheim Museum, Fifth Avenue at 88th Street. Somehow, though, the show is not a major show.

title: From Artist's Soup to Publisher's Pie
description: Last June, the 60 or so editorial employes of Alfred A. Knopf, Inc., the publishing house, held their annual Central Park picnic, and the conversation was almost totally culinary.

title: U. S. Hopeful on Trade Talks
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 23 (Reuters)The United States is confident that a satisfactory settlement will be reached in negotiations between it and the European Economic Community on trade problems the White House said today.

title: Patrolman Is Suspended After Gun Duel in a Bar
description: An offduty patrolman was suspended early yesterday after allegedly brawling and exchanging shots in a Brooklyn bar with an offduty Transit Authority patrolman. A third offduty policeman was slightly wounded by a bullet, the police reported.

title: Indian Looks With Sorrow to Departure of Pakistani Refugees
description: NARENDRAPUR, India, Dec. 23The young Hindu who looks after 3,000 refugees from East Pakistan at the Ramakrishna Mission camp here is a sad man today.

title: Iraq Wants Half Egypt's Troops Deployed in Syria and Jordan
description: BEIRUT, Lebanon, Dec. 23Iraq has called on President Anwar elSadat of Egypt to deploy half of his country's armed forces along the Arab eastern front with Israel.

title: Red Smith
description: Bob Beamon, who reached an unreachable star three years ago, is about to attain another goal that sometimes seemed hopelesly remote. He will get a degree in sociology and anthropology next month from Adelphi University. After that, there must be a decision: to sell his height and speed and agility to the Harlem Globetrotters as a professional basketball player, to concentrate exclusively on some other job that would support his family, or to devote time and effort toward winning a place on the 1972 Olympic team and assaulting his own implausible world record in the long jump.

title: LORD STONHAM, 68, EXLABOR MINISTER
description: LONDON Dec. 22Lord Stonham, Minister of State at the Home Office in the former Labor Government, died here Wednesday. He was 68 years old.

title: I Cannot Rejoice
description: 1962We were such newlyweds we counted Christmas day as our fourmonth anniversary. My husband had just begun Medical School. We didn't buy a tree (saving money) until at ten that night. We made much of trimming, then admitted that we missed our big family celebrations. The sleet turned to snow. By early morning we were on our way to our parents house.

title: Neediest Get Gift of $100 From South
World War Veterans'
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 23Veterans of both world wars with military insurance policies will be paid a total of $286million in dividends in 1972 the Veterans Administration announced today.

title: Governor Seen Available for U.S. Post
description: As Governor Rockefeller begins his 14th year in office, the state's most knowledgeable Republicans are convinced that he still wants to Move his political career to Washington.

title: NOFAULT AUTO PLAN IS BACKED BY OLIVIERI
description: Assemblyman Antonio G Olivieri DemocrateLiberal of Manhattan announced yesterday the formation of the Citizens Committee for NoFault Automobile Insurance and plans to introduce his own nofault insurance bill in the Legislature.

title: Advertising:
description: The Sun Products Corporation, which you may recognize as the manufacturer of Hoppity Hop, has decided to hippity hop its advertising account over to Helitzer Advertising.

title: Nixon Sees Peace Gains
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 23 (AP) President Nixon issued Christmas season forecast today that events in 1972 would be a great step forward toward world peace.

title: Front Page 1  No Title
description: MY CHRYSLER IMPERIAL IS A PILE OF JUNK.DeeId Merrlak, ADVT.

title: Kidnapped':Douglas Cast as David of Stevenson's Work
description: People who deplore the dreadfulness of new movies can take comfort in Delbert Mann's "Kidnapped," which opened Wednesday at the RKO Twin 2 and Penthouse Theaters, and which is dreadful in a manner almost wholly reminiscent of the ways they made movies before, say, 1936. "Kidnapped" is loosely based on the Robert Louis Stevenson novel and on a sequel, "Catriona," which includes further adventures of the 18th-century Scottish patriot Alan Breck and the coming to manhood and eventual marriage of Stevenson's young narrator, David Balfour.Far from trying to hype up the material of Stevenson's novels, the movie version of "Kidnapped" mostly depresses it. There is almost as much plot, but there are many fewer people and much less actionto the degree that you sometimes don't know what is happening because of the sheer immobility of what ought to be the moving pictures on the screen.Everything bespeaks low budget, in the sense that many of the shots making up individual sequences don't fit together and that some of the costumes don't fit at all. Except for the locations, which are real, and the color, which is color, the whole thing suggests the dim listlessness of the late late show edging toward the catatonia of 3 A.M.Lawrence Douglas is David, and Vivien Heilbron is his beloved Catriona, and under different auspices maybe they both can act. Several Stalwarts of the British stage and screen offer embarrassed cameos in "Kidnapped," including Trevor Howard, Jack Hawkins and a loony faced Donald Pleasance. But real admiration goes to Michael Caine, who plays the swashbuckling Alan Breck with a refinement of indifference so sublime that it is often difficult to tell whether he has been rapt into stillness by his role or has merely mastered the art of sleeping with his eyes open.

title: Hudson Jury Indicts Grandson Of Kenny on Embezzling Charge
description: JERSEY CITY, Dec. 23 (AP) John K. Hanly, the grandson of the Hudson County political boss, John V. Kenny, was indicted by a Hudson County grand jury today on charges of embezzling public funds.

title: TWO SHIPS COLLIDE OFF JERSEY COAST
description: An American cargo ship and a Russian fishing trawler collided last night 26 miles off New Jersey; the Coast Guard reported.

title: Resort Proprietors Make Gains With SnowProducing Devices
description: With no major snowstorms forecast for the next few days, skiminded Christmas tourists will have to do their shopping wisely this weekend. As in football, statistics snowmaking onesshould be kept in mind.

title: William C. Mentzer Dead; United Air Lines Official
description: PALO ALTO, Calif., Dec. 23 (UPI)William C. Mentzer retired United Air Lines official, died today at Stanford Medical Center. He was 64 years old.

title: Environment Aide Sworn In
description: Mayor John V. Lindsay swore in M. Paul Zimmerman, a former Peace Corps official and noise expert, as his new deputy administrator of the Environmental Protection Administration yesterday. Mr. Zimmerman, 37 years old, will get $37,500 a year. He actually took over the post three months ago, but as frequently happens, the swearingin was delayed.

title: OTC AND AMEX DECLINE A LITTLE Tax Selling, Holiday and Profit Taking Cited
$1M1LLION REPAID TO THE CITY BY OTB
description: The Off track Betting Corporation presented a check for $1million to Mayor Lindsay yesterday, reducing the balance still owed the city to $1.2million.

title: Hoffa Freed
description: It would be nice, but naive, to believe that the spirit of Christmas and James R. Hoffa's unblemished record as a prisoner were the only factors that influenced yesterday's decision by President Nixon to let the former leader of the Teamsters Union out of jail.

title: PAUL KENNEDY, 84, EDUCATOR, DEAD
description: Paul A. Kennedy who retired in 1958 as assistant superintendent of the New York City Board of Education died yesterday in a nursing home in New Jersey. He was 84 years old and lived at 298 Ridgewood Avenue Glen Ridge, N. J.

title: Text of Solzhenitsyn Letter to the Swedish Academy
description: MOSCOW, Dec. 23  Following is the text of a letter written Dec. 4 by the Nobel Prize novelist Aleksandr I. Solzhenitsyn to Dr. Karl Ragnar Gierow, permanent secretary of the Swedish Academy, suggesting an open ceremony in Moscow for the presentation of his Nobel medal and his Nobel lecture. The translation from the Russian was prepared by The New York Times.

title: Freehold, Thenand Now: Christmas Charm Is Gone
description: FREEHOLD, N. J., Dec. 23A loudspeaker mounted high on the light stanchion at the intersection of South and East Main Streets gave out a scratchy version of It Came Upon a Midnight Clear.

title: Washington: For the Record
description: THE PRESIDENT

title: Tariff Cuts on Schedule;
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 23 (AP) The Treasury Department said today the final stage of the reciprocal international Kennedy Round tariff reductions will become effective as scheduled Jan. 1.

title: Suspect Charged In a Slaying on Line Visiting Santa Claus
description: CLEVELAND, Dec. 23 (UPI) The police said today that a suspect had admitted that he got into an altercation with John E. Fitzpatrick while they were standing in line with their children to visit Santa Claus but he denied that he had stabbed Mr. Fitzpatrick.

title: BURDEN SAYS HABER LEAKS CITY PACTS
description: City Councilman Carter Burden criticized Herbert L. Haber, Director of Labor Relations for the city, yesterday for piecemeal leaking of contract terms between the city and the fire and sanitation unions.

title: Pope Appeals for Extension of Mideast CeaseFire
description: ROME, Dec. 23Pope Paul VI in a Christmas message to the world's Cardinals appealed today for an extension of the ceasefire in the Middle East and for new talks to seek an Understanding between Israel and the Arab states.

description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 23 President Nixon today appointed John E. Sheehan, a Louisville, Ky., businessman to the newly created vacancy on the Federal Reserve Board.

title: How Bhutto Attained Sweeping Power
description: RAWALPINDI, Pakistan, Dec. 23In the space of only four days Zulfikar Ali Bhutto has imposed an iron hold on all the reins of power and has undertaken to transform Pakistan into virtually a new nation.

title: The Stage: The Country Girl by Odets
MGM Sued by ExOfficer
description: Benjamin Melniker, who had been a vice president of MetroGoldwynMayer, Inc., until he resigned earlier this year, filed a $3.5million suit yesterday against MGM and three of its officers charging a breach of his employment contract. The film company had no immediate comment on the suit, which was filed in the United States District Court in Los Angeles.

title: ' Hildur and the Magician' at the Whitney
description: About the only fairy tale films surfacing these days are those crude, imported horrors hastily dubbed into English and slapped into circuit theaters on week-ends for a fast-buck children's hour. Discerning parents can relax, finally. A good onein some ways a real beautyhas turned up at the Whitney Museum in the current series by new American filmmakers. Titled "Hildur and the Magician," the 90-minute feature will be shown through Jan. 2.A group of California people, headed by Larry Jordan, the director-writer-photographer-editor, have emerged from a forest with a sensitive, lovely work that must have cost a dime. Exquisitely photographed (in good old black-and-white), threaded by a tactful narration and soothing music, the film gracefully pantomimes the tale of a kidnapped little princess, a wandering fairy queen and a bumbling magician.As an excursion into never-never land, the picture is never stiff, starchy or self-conscious. Nor are the players. Mr. Jordan has directed his cast, reportedly family and friends, well. Even the costumes show imagination and skill.Above all, the picture moves simply, clearly and interestingly, projecting an ethereal spirit. The catch is the lengthabout 30 minutes too much. But at the movie's best its texture and tone suggest Cocteau's "Beauty and the Beast" and this is high praise indeed. Let's hope we can say soon that here comes Mr. Jordan again.

title: SUGAR FUTURES ADVANCE BY LIMIT
description: Prices of the world sugar No futures contract rose as much as 50 cents per 100 pounds, the trading limit, yesterday on the New York Coffee and Sugar Exchange.

title: Defendant Gets Brimful: 3 Years of HatTipping
description: LOCKPORT, N. Y., Dec. 23 A 36yearold man convicted of resisting arrest was ordered by a judge yesterday to tip his hat to every policeman he meets for the next three years.

title: South Carolina Wins
description: PITTSBURGH, Dec. 23 (UPI) Kevin Joyce scored 24 points and Tom Riker 18 tonight in pacing undefeated South Carolina to a 69.59 victory over Pittsburgh.

title: 8 Panthers on Coast Acquitted Of Plotting Murder and Assault
description: LOS ANGELES, Dec. 23 (UPI)A jury acquitted Elmer Pratt, Southern California leader of the Balck Panther party, and seven other defendants today of conspiracy to commit murder.

title: Gallery Editor Weds Mrs. Martin
description: ROCKVILLE, Md., Dec. 23 Mrs. Moira A. Martin, a painter and sculptor, was married here today to Theodore Amussen, editor in chief of the National Gallery of Art in Washington. The civil ceremony was performed at the Court House.

title: Gov. Askew May Play Vital Role In Democratic National Politics
description: MIAMI, Dec. 21  His name is hardly a household word outside his own state, but Reubin Askew, Governor of Florida, is a man Democrats will be watching in 1972.

title: Carlson to Start for North
description: MIAMI, Dec. 23 (AP)Dean Carlson of Iowa State was named today to start at quarterback for the North in Monday night's NorthSouth Shrine football game.

title: U.S. Aides Say Soviet Offered New Proposals at Arms Parley
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 23Administration officials reported today that the Soviet Union in the last few weeks has made several proposals toward resolving differences at the talks on limitation of strategic arms.

title: Governor Frees Attica Inmate Who Gave Medical Aid in Riot
description: Walter (Tiny) Swift, a convicted murderer who has been serving a life sentence in the Attica Correctional Facility since 1956, was granted clemency by Governor Rockefeller yesterday for volunteering to give medical aid to hostages and inmates during the uprising at the prison in September.

title: Youth Robs Bank of $1,950
description: A young man entered the branch of the First National City Bank at 4240 Broadway, in Washington Heights, at 2:20 P.M. yesterday, told a woman teller he had a weapon and demanded money. She handed $1,950 to the youth, who escaped.

title: $1,931 Payroll Stolen
description: A woman employe of the Rutherford Dye and Chemical Company of 189 Franklin Street was struck on the head by a man and robbed of a $1,931 payroll at 11:40 A.M. yesterday when she returned from a nearby bank. The police identified her as Mrs. Shirley Morrell, 50 years old. She was treated at BeekmanDowntown Hospital and released.

title: HOLDERS APPROVE RIEGEL PAPER BID
description: Shareholders of the Riegel Paper Corporation and the Federal Paper Board Company at separate meetings yesterday approved the previously announced plan for Federal Paper board to acquire the properties comprising the Riegel paper group.

title: Scene at Prison
description: LEWISBURG, Pa.. Dec. 23 (UPI)James R. Hoffa beamed and waved to his former fellow inmates as he left the penitentiary today.

title: Clash South of Border
description: DUBLIN, Dec. 23  Security forces of the Irish Republic clashed last night in Ballyshannon with I.R.A. sympathizers.

title: NIXON COMMUTES HOFFA SENTENCE,CURBS UNION ROLE
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 23 President Nixon commuted today the prison term of James R. Hoffa, former president of the International Brotherhood of Teamsters, Hoffa walked free from the Federal Penitentiary in Lewisburg, Pa., after serving 4 years, 9 months and 16 days of a 13year term.

title: BOTANY ARRANGES DEBT DEFERMENT
description: Botany Industries, Inc., announced yesterday that it had completed arrangements with its lending institutions and certain trade creditors to defer $14,835,000 worth of shortterm and longterm obligations. These obligations will also be subordinated to certain new extension of credit.

title: Champagne in Detroit
description: DETROIT, Dec. 23 (UPI)Detrot labor leaders celebrated James R. Hoffa's release from prison today with champagne, and the festivities lasted into the night.

title: Bridge: Rule of Four Provides Guide For Making Preemptive Bids
description: A simple guide to preemptive bidding might be called the Rule of Four. If the hand fits the basic patterna long, fairly strong suit and little outside strength bid four less than the number of cards in the suit.

title: HALFBILLION ESTATE LEFT BY MRS. BRUCE
description: The late Mrs. Ailsa Mellon Bruce daughter of Andrew W. Mellon the banker and philanthropist left a gross estate of $570,648,725 according to state and Federal tax reports filed yesterday in Manhattan Surrogate's Court.

title: Making Instant Art By Jiggling a Cube
description: Shake that transparent block of plastic and the thousands of tiny ball bearings locked inside move in swirling patterns. Shake it again and again and again. The rivulets, the threads, the geometric patterns formed are never the same. Atomix, as this adult toy is called,

title: SUIT IS PLANNED ON RENT INCREASE
description: Representative Bella S. Abzug announced yesterday that she would initiate court action, probably next week, to force the city to accept the Federal Price Commission's new guidelines for rent increases rather than the larger increases scheduled under rent control and rent stabilization.

title: NETS BOW,124123, AS CONDORS WIN ON CARTER'S SHOT
Explosion at Con Ed Substation Injures and Sets Off Oil Fire
description: An explosion at, a Consolidated Edison substation on the East Side injured three workers last night and ignited a smoky oil fire with flames six stories high.

title: PRICE PANEL CUTS BLUE CROSS RISE IN FEDERAL RATES
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 23The Price Commission, applying new insurance guidelines for the first time, trimmed rate increase on health and medical coverage for 1.6 million Federal workers from 34.1 per cent to 22 per cent.

title: 8 Nations Get $200Million In Loans From World Bank
description: LONDON, Dec. 23 (Reuters) The World Bank group announced here today approval of $200million in loans and credits to assist nine economic development projects in eight countries.

title: Greetings by Shuttle Conductor Spread Good Cheer
description: The faces on the subway passengers riding the shuttle between Times Square and Grand Central are for the most part expressionless, eyes are generally cast down and the riders are remotely intent on their own destinations, chores and thoughts.

title: Australians to Sail In Challenge Round Of America's Cup
description: PERTH, Australia, Dec. 23 (AP)The Royal Perth Yacht Club confirmed today that the Spirit of the West syndicate would take part in the elimination series for the 1974 America's cup challenge to he held by the Royal Thames Yacht Club,

title: Muhammad (Ali) Takes To the Mountain (Swiss)
description: ZURICH, Switzerland, Dec. 23After an."orgy of autographsigning at a department store yesterday, Muhammad went to the mountain again this morning.

title: Cowboys, Chief s Favored In Tomorrow's Playoff
description: The Dallas Cowboys and the Kansas City Chiefs are the favorites in tomorrow's first pair of National Football League playoff games. In the betting odds, the Cowboys are the choice by one point over the Vikings, in the best matchup, at Bloomington, Minn. The contest will be televised here, on Channel 2 at 1 P.M., followed by the Miami Dolphins against the Chiefs in Kansas City, Channel 4, at 4 P.M. On Sunday, Baltimore at Cleveland will be on Channel 4 at 1 P.M., and then Washington at San Francisco, Channel 2 at 4 P.M.

title: Wood, Field and Stream
description: For one of you, my daughters, there is the doll you wanted, and for the other the dress that caught your fancy. The tree we cut that cold, wet day, when beads of fog gleamed on its green needles, is gay with lights and fragile globes of colored glass.

title: AUTO SALES SLOW IN DEC, 1120 SPAN
North Carolina Five Wins In Madrid Tourney, 8774
description: MADRID, Dec. 23 (AP)Bobby Jones, with 19 points, led the University of North Carolina to an 8774 victory over Juventud of Badalona today in the opening game of a threeday international Christmas baskethall tournament. The favored Americans led, 44 40, at the half.

title: Books of The Times
description: Once again in this slack season of the gift book, teddy bear and calendar, let me offer you an item that I had been avoiding like the pox up until nownamely, Barry Commoner's The Closing Circle: Nature, Man and Technology. Why had I been avoiding it? Last spring, I think it was, I was horrified to read in Sports Illustrated about the discovery of a trout that had grown to misshapen adulthood engirdled by the ring of a poptop beercan opener it had apparently tried to swim through while still a fingerling. Well, that was enough for me. And if Dr. Commoner wished to report that the circle was closing even tighter, I for one preferred not to hear it. I was al ready sold on the factthat ecology is the paramount issue of our age. But on the other hand, if a poptop can opener floating in a brook is the distillate of all human historyas a number of recent commentators have led us to believe and as I fully expected Dr. Commoner to further underscorethen what could one person do to reopen the circle? Open another book? No, ho hum till Doomsday comes.

title: Sarnoff Estate Tops Million, With Most Going to His Widow
description: David Sarnoff, the radio broadcasting pioneer and former chairman of the RCA Corporation, who died at the age of 80 on Dec. 12, left an estate valued at more than $1million, according to a will filed for probate yesterday in Surrogate's Court in Manhattan

title: Rumsfeld Says Price Rules Apply to Rise in Mail Rates
Price of Wallboard Will Be Increased By GeorgiaPacific
description: The GeorgiaPacific Corporation said yesterday it would increase the price of gypsum wallboard by an average of about $2 per thousand square feet, effective in late January.

title: City Places Sign on Site Of Forest Hills Project
description: A red, white and blue sign went up yesterday in the Forest Hills section of Queens announcing that a fencedin area is the site of a lowincome housing project.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor: My interest in Spain goes back to 1937, when I volunteered to fight with the Lincoln Brigade. So, of course, Herman Diaz Nov. 26 letter extolling life in Spain caught my eye.

title: JERSEY TEACHERS BEGIN JAIL TERMS
description: NEWARK, Dec. 23A group of 128 Newark teachers were mugged and fingerprinted today and driven to the Essex County Correctional Center in Caldwell to spend the next eight days in jail for defying court order to end their strike in 1970.

title: Tully Hall Resounds to AllCity High School Choir
description: Exuberant musicmaking of a kind not customarily associated with Lincoln Center was heard at Tully Hall Wednesday night as the AllCity High School Concert Choir presented the opening event in the Commutiny Holiday Festival by Lincoln Center and sponsored by Con Edison.

title: WALTER A. SHINN
description: Walter A. Shinn building manager of Coliseum Office Towers, who was associated with the real estate concern of Douglas, GibbonsHollyday & Ives, died Tuesday in Boston after heart surgery. He was 63 years old and lived at 180 Hardenherg Avenue, Haworth N. J.

title: Lights Go On and Off For 2 Holiday Customs
description: YONKERS, Dec. 23One old neighborhood Christmas tradition has been affirmed, and another brought to an ignominious end These are two stories of Christmas in Westchester County, 1971.

title: BID TO LIMIT TOMBS TO CITY MEN DENIED
description: The State Supreme Court denied yesterday a motion by the city Board of Correction to bar the state from sending any more prisoners to the Manhattan House of Detention for Men, or the Tombs, because of serious overcrowding there.

title: Kosygin Attacker Convicted
description: OTTAWA, Dec. 23 Gera Matrai, a Toronto store clerk who emigrated from Hungary, was convidted today of common assault on Premier Aleksei N. Kosygin of the Soviet Union The Premier was attacked here, Oct. 18 as he walked beside, Prime Minister Pierre Elliott Trudeau of Canada.

title: RideaBus Week Is Set
description: PHOENIX, Ariz. (AP)Mayor John Driggs has proclaimed a Phoenix Ride A Bus Week. Th mayor urged all citizens to take advantage of the bus system and to accept their responsibility for insuring its success.

title: Dollar Up at London
description: LONDON, Dec. 23 (UPI)The dollar climbed today to its highest point on the London market since its devaluation.

title: The British Connection
description: An old alliance is like an old marriage: it has to be worked at. But the useful work President Nixon and Prime Minister Heath did in Bermuda to repair the AngloAmerican alliance, damaged by six months of unilateral American economic and diplomatic action, will not restore the partnership of the past. For in the interim, the context in which future relations between the United States and Britain must evolve has been profoundly altered by two events: London's decision to enter the Common Market and Mr. Nixon's Aug. 15 announcement of a new foreign economic policy.

title: U.S. Jets Fire Missiles At 3 North Vietnam Sites
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, Friday, Dec. 24The United States command said today that Air Force F 105 fighter bombers fired three missiles yesterday at three radar sites in the southern panhandle of North Vietnam near the Laotian border.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor: As one who for many years has worked and spoken for more housing in our city, and specifically for lowrent housing in the middleincome areas of Queens, I greatly regret your editorial stand against the planned buildings on the edge of Forest Hills.

title: Procedures Agreed On
description: WASHINGTON, Dec, 23Negotiators for the United States and Japan agreed today on procedures for continuing trade talks ?? countries.

title: CONTROLS ARTICLES CONTAINED 2 ERRORS
description: Typographical errors appeared in two dispatches relating to rent and other economic controls that appeared in some editions of yesterday's New York Times.

title: WBAIFM Series Sharply Questions Public TV
description: Last night at 8:15 on WBAIFM, the third program in a series called Feedback considered the subject of public televsion, sharply questioning its development under the guidance of the Ford Foundation since 1951 and under the Public Broadcasting Act of 1967.

title: Teacher Held Up in Class
description: Miss Gail Gardet, a mathematics teacher at Theodore Roosevelt High School in the Bronx, was conducting a classof students yesterday when an armed robber invaded the room, held her up and ran off with her wristwatch and change purse. She said the intruder had pointed a gun at her and had demanded her pocketbook. The students sat in silent astonishment as the bandit fled.

title: J.&
description: The Jones & Laughlin Steel Corporation confirmed yesterday reports that it intended to make sharp cutbacks in the work force in parts of its Pittsburgh works.

title: Dr. Leslie Brooker Is Dead; A Pioneer in Color Film, 69
description: ROCHESTER, Dec. 23 (AP)Dr. Leslie G. S. Brooker, a pioneer in the development of color photographic film died yesterday. He was 69 years old.

title: An Evolving Christmas for Puerto Ricans
description: Christmas in the city's Puerto Rican community will be a mixture of Caribbean traditions and concessions to American yuletide practices.

title: Strong Gains in Sales Cited by Stores Here
description: In the country's largest city the 1971 Christmas selling season is winding up today with strong gains by major department stores over last year. Most of them successfully generated value promotions during the 25day holiday season to attract inflationconscious consumers in New York and the metropolitan area.

title: Energetic ExTeamster Chief James Riddle Hoffa
description: This is a man who never knows when to stop. He'll keep going up until he reaches the 102d floor and, then, not realizing he's at the top, he'll step off and break his neck, That is how a friend described James Riddle Hoffa in 1957. It was a critical year for the little fellow, and it contained the seeds of both his rise and his fallwhich were equally spectacular. In 1957, Hoffa was elected to the presidency of the I.7millionmember International Brotherhood of Teamsters. With a truckdriver's iron grip, he transformed it from a Federation of fiefs into the biggest, strongest, toughest union in the country.

title: Fiscal Crisis Imperils U.N. Aid for Palestine Refugees
description: SAIDA, Lebanon, Dec. 20Palestinian refugees earning a bare living at this ancient Phoenician port still talk of home and plan for the future, apparently unaware that even their meager support is threatened.

title: Debacle of Military Justice
description: When the horror of the events at a South Vietnamese hamlet named Mylai 4 was first disclosed two years ago, the sickening story of women, babies and old men murdered by American soldiers jolted the nation's conscience. President Nixon called it a massacre. Lieut. Gen. William Peers, who conducted a careful inquiry into the Army's preliminary handling of the charges, described Mylai as a tragedy of major proportions.

title: Foe's CeaseFire Starts
description: SAIGON, Dec. 23 (AP)The Vietcong's threeday Christmas ceasefire went into effect at 1 A.M. today (noon, Thursday, New York time), but it was not expected to lessen hostilities in South Vietnam.

title: 47 Firms Ask S.E.C. Bar To Institutional Brokers
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 23A group of 47 brokerage firms, styling themselves the Committee for the Martin Report asked the Securities and Exchange Commission today to act promptly to ban membership on stock exchanges by brokers affiliated with financial institutions.

title: Hoping for a White Christmas? Just Keep Dreaming
description: There will be no white Christmas in New York City this year, the National Weather Service predicted yesterday.

title: 2 Saturn Sites at Kennedy Put on Sale by Government
description: WASHINGTON Dec, 23 (AP)  The Government wants to sell two multimilliondollar rocket launching complexes at Cape Kennedy.

title: Critic of Soviet Stand on Israel Freed, Goes There
description: TEL AVIV, Dec. 23 (Reuters) Boris L. Kochubiyevsky, a Soviet electronics engineer who served in a labor camp after protesting against Moscow's antiIsraeli policy, arrived today as an immigrant.

title: Article 1  No Title
description: UNITED NATIONS, N. Y., Dec. 23Christopher H. Phillips of the United States delegation made an oral protest today to Secretary General Thant over the disaccreditation of the two Chinese Nationalist correspondents.

title: Murphy's Amnesty Clears 100 Policemen of Charges
description: Police Commissioner Patrick V. Murphy dispensed Christmas largess to 100 members of the force yesterday announcing he would grant amnesty to those facing departmental trials not involving corruption or other criminal offenses.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor: In January the Site Selection Committee for Manhattan (Controller, Borough President and representatives of the Mayor) will have a public hearing on selection of an area adjacent to the Tombs for a second Tombs. At an estimated cost of $50$60 million, this facility would greatly increase the city's capacity to hold men in detention before trial. Money for it is already allocated in the city budget ($43 million). Little publicity has attended the city's commitment for a new Tombs, and January may be the last occasion for open consideration of what seems to me a misguided and regressive use of public money.

title: High Court Turns To Delayed Cases Early Next Month
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 23 (UPI) The Supreme Court announced today that it would hear arguments in January on challenges to the, death penalty and other difficult cases that it delayed until, it was at full strength.

title: City Ballet Lists Premieres By Massine and Robbins
description: The New York City Ballet will present the premiere of Lorca Massine's ballet, Printemps and Alexandra Danilove's staging of Fokine's Chopiniana on Jan, 13 as its first two new productions of the season at the State Theater. On Jan. 20, the company will give the premiere of Watermill, a ballet by Jerome Robbins to a score by Teijo Ito.

title: Nixon Signs Cancer Bill; Cites Commitment to Cure
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 23President Nixon signed today a bill to implement a muchexpanded research attack on cancer, saying it might prove to he the most significant act of his Presidency.

title: Military Purge Continues
description: RAWALPINDI, Dec. 23President Bhutto continued a purge of highranking military officers today, retiring the commander of the navy, five other ranking naval officers and three army major generals.

title: THALER ENTERS NOTGUILTY PLEA
description: Seymour R. Thaler pleaded not guilty in Federal Court here yesterday to charges that he took part in a fraudulent scheme to receive, transport and sell stolen Treasury bills.

title: Stans Sees Retail Volume In U.S. Rising by 8% to 9%
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 23 Secretary of Commerce Maurice H. Stans said today that available data indicated that retail sales in the Christmas season would be 8 to 9 per cent higher in real volume than a year ago the largest increase since 1966. He based his estimate on weekly retail statistics running through last Saturday and a telephone sample of leading retailers.

title: CALENDAR TRACES U.S. BLACK HISTORY
description: People buy books and leave them on the shelf, said Mrs. Mattie T. Evans.

title: M'GOYERN OFFERS PLAN ON WELFARE
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 23 Senator George McGovern proposed today that every American, regardless of other income, receive a monthly payment from the Government.

title: ALBERT WALLING, 53, A BANKING OFFICIAL
description: Albert Walling assistant treasurer of the East River Savings Bank died Wednesday of a heart attack at his home 229 Woodlawn Avenue Deer Park L. I. He was 53 years old.

title: EU. DROPS STUDY OF A.T. &
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 23 The Federal Communications Commission said today that it was dropping an investigation of the rates charged by the American Telephone and Telegraph Company for interstate longdistance telephone calls because it did not have adequate staff or resources.

title: A Christmas Message Issued by White House
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 23 (UPI)The White House issued today President Nixon's Christmas message. It said:

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor: Tito's rationale in ordering massive repression in Croatia of students, intellectuals and progressive Communists was that their Croat chauvinism, if left unchecked, would lead to the renewal of fratricidal civil war between the national groups and eventually to the breakup of the Yugoslav state. [Editorial Dec. 23.]

title: Hyperbole of Hansel and Gretel Comes to Life on Stage of the Met
description: Humperdinck's Hansel and Gretel, which the Metropolitan Opera revived on Wednesday night, is a Christmas display window  a panorama of toys, sophisticated, magical, childishly simple and stickily sentimental. Anyone can find something that appeals to him, but no one will like it all. For the opera mixes children's tunes with a rich Wagnerianstyle orchestration and a fairy tale that is by turn charming, saccharine and funny.

title: Secretary to Kunstler Engaged To Inmate She Visited in Attica
description: BUFFALO, Dec. 23A secretary to William M. Kunstler the civil rights lawyer and her flailed, an inmate in solitary confinement in the Attica state prison who is serving life for murder filed suit in Federal Court here today seeking to obtain correspondence and visiting privileges.

title: ROGERS DECLARES U.S.WILL CONTINUE ASIAN AIR STRIKES
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 23Secretary of State William P. Rogers said today that United States warplanes would continue their strikes against enemy positions in Laos and Cambodia during 1972 to blunt the new North Vietnamese offensives in those areas.

title: MESSIAH MILESTONE FOR ORATORIO GROUP
description: The Oratorio Society reached something of a milestone Tuesday night in Carnegie Hall with its 150th presentation of Handers Messiah. The group's first performance under Leopold Damrosch in 1874, when Messiah was invariably treated as a piece of massive Victorian furniture, was doubtlessly quite different from the trim 1971 edition led by T. Charles Lee. Mr. Lee has serupulously incorporated most of today's accepted baroque stylistic practices into his unabridged reading, and almost always to good effect.

title: 115212 Wins in Jersey
description: VOORHEES TOWNSHIP, N.J., Dec. 23 (AP)  The winning number in this week's New Jersey State Lottery is 115212. Holders of tickets with all six digits in the correct order win $50,000.

title: Bills Give Saban a LongTerm Contract
description: BUFFALO, Dec. 23 (AP)Lou Saban, who coached the Buffalo Bills to two titles in the old American Football League, returned to the team today as head coach, vice president in charge of football and a member of the board.

title: DEMOCRATS FACE DELAY ON MEETING
description: A State Supreme Court justice yesterday issued a temporary restraining order barring the Democratic State Committee from meeting next Tuesday to elect a successor to John J. Burns, whose resignation as state chairman becomes effective that day.

title: Buffalo Theater Losing Aid in Dispute on Hair
description: Because the Studio Arena Theater, Buffalo's resident professional company, sponsored appearances of a touring version of Hair in that city earlier this year, it has become embroiled in a struggle over censorship and is losing a badly needed $26,250 grant from the Erie County budget for 1972.

title: Tramunti and 4 Are Acquitted in Stock Fraud Case
description: Carmine Tramunti and Vincent Aloi, reputedly major Mafia figures, won acquittal yesterday on charges of participating in a massive stock fraud that allegedly included strongarm tactics to gain control of a Miami investment company.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor: My letter published Dec. 17 contained a typographical error; a group of 100 addicts might be expected to steal $750,000 annually rather than $75 million.

title: THREAT SEEN IN BAN OF NEWSMEN BY U.N.
description: GENEVA, Dec. 23The International Press Institute said today that Secretary General Thant's cancellation of the credentials of two Chinese Nationalist correspondents at the United Nations constituted a dangerous precedent.

title: A Joyous Sound on West 83d Street
description: If the wind that whips along Riverside ,Drive has not carried the ornaments away, then neighborhood residents, hurrying home to their own celebrations tonight will see, just beyond the 83d Street entrance to Riverside Park, a little blue sprucewith a low white picket fence around itcovered with homemade paper chains, paper angels, tops of tin cans dangling from red ribbons, and decorated paper plates.

title: E.V.R. PHASING OUT ARRANGED BY C.B.S.
description: The Columbia Broadcasting System completed arrangements yesterday to phase out the processing operations of its electronic video recording and concentrate eventually on program production. As previously reported, Imperial Chemical Industries, Ltd., and CIBAGeigy, Ltd., of London will gain North American distribution rights for E.V.R. and also negotiate with Japanese electronic concerns.

title: Books of The Times
description: Norman Fruman has written a book that is relentlessly and devastatingly polemical and one of the most exciting I have read in years, It's one of those that changes the configuratiOns in the literary heavens, so that the starry arrangements don't appear quite as they did before. It's a book on the order of Dewey's Art as Experience, or. J. Dover Wilson's What Happens in Hamlet'." or Bernard Knox's Oedipus at Thebes. They did so much to indicate the problems and complexities of the subjects under discussion that all subsequent argument about art and perception or Hamlet or Sophocles's tragedy inevitably led back to those volumes.

title: U.S. Is Offering Concessions to the Micronesians Demands for Home Rule
description: SAIPAN, Mariana Islands, Dec. 17After a lengthy impasse over the political status of the 2,141 islands and atolls of Micronesia, under American administration as a United Nations trusteeship, the United States has offered substantial concessions to Micronesian leaders insistent demands for home rule.

title: Advertising:
description: More products were dropped from the shelves of New York area supermarkets than were added during the year ended Sept. 9, according to a study by Sales Area Marketing, Inc.

title: Pakistani President Calls Mujib to Capital for Talks
description: RAWALPINDI, Pakistan, Dec. 23 Sheik Mujibur Rahman, the detained East Pakistani leader, has been brought to Rawalpindi for negotiations with President Zulfikar Ali Bhutto, official sources said today. It was not disclosed when the two men would meet.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor: The Times Dec. 14 editorial in support of a bill ordered reported by the Senate Foreign Relations Committee to codify the war powers appears to me to be unfounded in American history or case law. The Supreme Court has never ruled that the President can be stopped by either the courts or Congress in the course of an ongoing conflict from using military forces to defend America's interests. It has never held that the only way hostilities can be initiated is through a declaration of war. On the other hand, the High Court has stated, Congress cannot direct the conduct of campaigns... and that Congress cannot impair the authority of the President as Commander in Chief.

title: Mediators Warn Lindsay Of Cliffhanger on Transit
description: The three mediators in the transit negotiations held out little hope yesterday for a resolution of the dispute before

title: Lightning Hits Airliner
description: SAN FRANCISCO, Dec. 23 (UPI)  A bolt of lightning struck a Pacific southwest Airlines plane with Lieut. Gov. Ed Reinecke aboard last night as it was about to land here. The craft was going from Los Angeles to Sacramento.

title: Hope Sees a Hanoi Aide in Laos; Seeks $10 Million Prisoner Deal
description: BANGKOK, Thailand, Dec. 23 (UPI)  Bob Hope made a surprise visit to Vientiane, Laos, today to discuss with North Vietnamese officials the possibility of going to Hanoi to try to negotiate the release of. American prisoners of war in a $10million charity arrangement.

title: Miss Rice Is Bride Of Douglas Brandt
description: MADISON, N. J., Dec. 23Miss Christina Rice, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Francis X. Rice of Florham Park, was married here today to Douglas E. Brandt, son of Mrs. Philip H. Brandt of Morristown and the late Mr. Brandt. The Rev. William Neiman performed the ceremony in Grace Episcopal Church.

title: Nationalist China Planning Election, Its First Since '47
description: TAIPEI, Taiwan, Dec. 23 (AP)Nationalist China's ruling party, the Kuomintang, has decided to hold the firest national elections since 1947, but details will not be decided until after President Nixon visits mainland China in February, party officials reported today. The decision is a concession to intellectual and press circles, which have been calling for political reforms since Nationalist China was expelled from the United Nations Oct. 25.

title: God Rest Ye Merry...
description: It is probably just as well that Christmas comes but once a year. People are capable of dispensing and absorbing just so much good cheer, and by a Gresham's Law of its own, the real thing can easily be driven out circulation by a synthetic product generated by canned caroling, Santa Clauses standing on the sidewalks and even outsize doctors bills bearing Christmas seals on the envelope.

title: PETERSON NAMED COACH OF OILERS
description: HOUSTON, Dec. 23 (AP)Bill Peterson said tonight he had accepted an almost life'time contract to become head coach, of the Houston Oilers of the National Football League on the condition that he would be released from the remaining four year of his contract with Rice University.

title: Lindsay Sees 1972 as Year of Opportunity
description: Mayor Lindsay said with a grin yesterday that he envisioned 1972 as the Yea! of Opportunity and then hastily told chuckling city hall newsmen that he meant for the city.

title: Money Turmoil Has Acted as Depressant
description: Santa Claus has brought a mixed bag of goods to many of the world's leading capitals during the current holiday season.

title: Earthquake in Alaska
description: PALMER, Alaska, Dec. 23 (AP)An earthquake shook an area centered 50 miles southwest of Anchorage today, the Palmer Observatory reported. A spokesman said there was no indication of damage.

title: U.S. Acts to End Air Strike
description: SAN FRANCISCO Dec. 23 (UM)  Hughes Airwest said today that Federal mediators had intervened in a mechanics Strike that has curtailed more than 90 per cent of its service A spokesman for the airline said it had received a telegram asking both sides to meet with members of the National Mediation Board in Washington next Tuesday.

title: Dan Rather Will Interview Nixon for C.B.S. RadioTV
description: An hourlonk Conversation With President Nixon will be broadcast live from the White House at 9:30 P.M. Sunday, Jan. 2, over the radio and television networks of the Columbia Broadcasting System.

title: The Season: Movies That Talk Back
description: In Stanley Kubrick's A Clockwork Orange, we are asked to care about a teenage hoodlum, a child of tomorrow who terrorizes his family by day, mugs a lot of helpless old citizens by night and talks largely in Nadsat, a language that is unheard of at Berlitz, although it's fairly comprehensible within the context of the film.

title: Former HousingRepair Official ls Arrested on Perjury Charges
description: Marvin Schwartz, who was second in command of the city's emergency housing repair program until his dismissal Wednesday, was arrested yesterday on perjury charges for allegedly lying about financial transactions with contractors.

title: BostonMiami Train Derails; 15 Passengers Are Injured
description: ST. PETERSBURG, Fla., Dec. 23A 15car BostontoMiami Amtrak train., with 5,0 passengers aboard derailed tonight at a switch that had apparently been tampered with three milesnorth of this Gulf Coast resort.The police said that 13 persons had been injured, none seriously.

title: Japan Recession End Seen
description: Four experts took a hard look at the Japanese economy yesterday and concluded that its growth will be strong enough to lift the country out of a recession despite the 17 per cent upward revaluation of the yen.
