title: Solzhenitsyn Suggests Small Nobel Ceremony Be Held in Moscow
description: MOSCOW, Dec. 23Aleksandr I. Solzhenitsyn, the Nobel laureate in literature for 1970, has proposed that he receive his Nobel medal and be given a chance to deliver his Nobel lecture at a small, open ceremoney, at the Swedish Embassy here.

title: Homely Greek Fare in a Simple Setting
description: Restaurants reviewed on this page on Friday are rated both for their food (four stars to none) and for their atmosphere. service and decor (four triangles to none).

title: Tired Knicks Back Home After Fruitful Coast Trip
MARTIN CHASE DIES; DISCOUNT OFFICIAL
description: BOSTON, Dec. 24 (AP)Martin Chase, a discount store executive whose marketing techniques set the pace for the industry, died today at Massachusetts General Hospital. He was 65 years old.

title: On 16th Day, Leone Named Italy's President
description: ROME, Dec. 24  Giovanni Leone, a Christian Democratic moderate and a conciliator, was named the sixth President of Italy today on the 16th day of a wearisome election that strained the nation's democratic system.

title: Books of The Times
description: V. S. Naipaul's writings about his native Trinidad have often enough been touched with tolerant amusement. His is an attitude that is affectionate without being overly kind. In The Mystic Masseur, A House for Mr. Biswas and in some of the essays, one felt that the spoofing was not always gentle, that there was present an irritation with the land and its People, an impatience with sluggish folkways. The endless striving for improvement was made to seem hollow, fruitless. On his own, Mr. Naipaul made no secret of his alienation from his native island. When I was in the fourth form, he wrote in Middle Passage, I wrote a vow on the endpapers of my Kennedy Revised Latin Primer to leave within five years. I left after six. And for many years afterwards in England, falling asleep in bedsitters with the electric fan on, I had been awakened by the nightmare that I was back in tropical Trinidad. That sounds final.

title: A Democratic Study Finds 3 Million Youths Register
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 24 (Reuters)About three million youths in the newly enfranchised 18to20yearold group have already registered to vote, although the Presidential election is still more than 10 months away, the Young Democrats said today.

title: U.S COURT UPSETS TEXAS SCHOOL TAX TIED TO PROPERTY
description: A special panel of three Federal judges has declared unconstitutional the Texas public school financing system and ordered the State Legislature to devise a new one. The system, in its essentials, is like that in every other state except Hawaii.

title: Blast Destroys Power Unit
description: BELLEVUE, Iowa, Dec. 24 (AP)  An explosion and fire destroyed the municipal power plant here today. Estimates of damage ranged to $200,000. Four workmen at the Bellevue Municipal Water and Electric plant escaped without injury, a spokesman said. The cause of the blast in this town of 2,366 people was not determined.

title: HIROHITO TO OPEN WINTER GAMES
description: TOKYO, Dec. 24 (AP)  Emperor Hirohito, as patron of the 1972 Winter Olympics, will open the games at a ceremony on Feb. 3 in the Makomanai indoor skating rink in Sapporo, Hokkaido, Japan's northernmost main island.

title: Workers Banned at Tunnel
description: DETROIT, Dec. 24 (UPI)A Federal court order has been issued requiring workers to remain at least 100 feet from the Lake Huron water ?? where 21 men were killed in a gas explosion Dec. 11 until adequate safety precautions are taken. The temporary order was issued yesterday by District Court Judge John Feidens in response to a motion by Secretary of Labor James D. Hodgson.

title: BELGRADE TO EASE U.S. INVESTMENT
description: The Yugoslav Government is prepared to allow select American corporations to own 50 per cent or more of Yugoslav businesses established under jointventure arrangeMents, as opposed to the maximum 49 per cent foreign ownership now permitted.

title: Teachers in Boston Win Raise of 5.5% in New Pact
description: BOSTON, Dec. 24 (AP)The city's 5,000 public school teachers will get 5.5 per cent pay increases under a contract agreed to by the School Committee and the Boston Teachers Union.

title: A Detroit Riot Victim Gets $250,000 in Compensation
description: DETROIT, Dec. 24 (AP) Ulysses Lawson, 23 years old, who lost his left leg and two fingers of his right hand after being shot in a police raid in Detroit riots of July, 1967, has received $250,000 from the city in an outofcourt settlement.

title: Fast Trip for Jetliner
description: MINNEAPOLIS, Dec. 24 (AP)  A Western Airlines flight from San Francisco to MinneapolisSt. Paul, scheduled for 3 hours 9 minutes, was covered in 2 hours 22 minutes yesterday, an airline spokesman said, because a storm system that caused unusually high jet stream tailwinds pushed the Boeing 720B jetliner at unusually high speeds.

title: Iraqi Regime Gaining SelfConfidence
description: BAGHDAD, Iraq  Traq's stern Baath Arab Socialist party appears to have firmly conits rule and is beginning to relax a little.

title: Saigon Reports  Violations Of the Holiday CeaseFire
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, Saturday, Dec. 25Christmas ceasefires were in effect on both sides of the Vietnam war today, but the South. Vietnamese command said there had been 26 enemy violations of the truce.

title: Pakistan's Loss: A Disaster or a Blessing
description: RAWALPINDI, Pakistan, Dec. 24Before her two sectors were parted, Pakistan was sometimes likened to a pair of Siamese twins, one of whom was diseased and constantly at death's door.

title: FARM UNION ADMITS IT HECKLED CAVETT
description: Dick Cavett told his audience Thursday night that the interruption of his program by hecklers Wednesday night had been caused by representatives of the United Farm Workers of California, the migrant workers union headed by Cesar Chavez.

title: Dr. James E. Mendenhall Dies; Expert on Consumer Education
description: Dr. James E. Mendenhall, a leader in consumer education, died yesterday in White Plains Hospital. He was 68 years old and lived at 1348 Midland Avenue, Bronxville, N. Y.

title: Witcher 49ers '
description: SAN FRANCISCO, Dec. 24 (AP)The San Francisco 49ers used Dick Witcher, a wide receiver, on a season long sleeper play. John Brodie threw to him so seldom that Witcher, a five year starter, was as unnoticed as the offensive guards some days.

title: Screen Academy Attacks Promotion In Seeking Oscars
description: The board of governors of the Academy of Motion Picture Arts and Sciences has urged the movie industry to refrain from using excessive advertising and solicitation in order to win Oscar awards,

title: It Wasn't Planned That Way, Batt They Reunited for Christmas
description: NORTH LIME ROCK, Ark., Dec. 24  James Paul Harris, who has been living alone with his 9yearold son, placed an advertisement in the classified section of a newspaper here Dec. 8 looking for a needy family of children with whom to, share their Christmas.

title: Holiday for Markets
description: Stock exchanges and commodities markets were closed yesterday for the holidays. Pennsylvania banks and Canadian exchanges will be closed on Monday.

title: CHINA RUSHED ARMS, PAKISTANIS ASSERT
description: RAWALPINDI, Pakistan, Dec. 24 (AP)  In the final days of the war with India, the Chinese flew in more than 200,000 rounds of tank and antiaircraft ammunition for Pakistan, authoritative Pakistani military sources said today.

title: CHRISTMAS TREES VEX THE ALLERGIC
description: Thousands of Americans who are the victims of Christmas tree allergy are wheezing and sneezing.

title: Thursday Night Fights
description: Tokyo  Sorimachi Ryu, 149 pounds, Japan, knocked out Refugio Barrea, 149, Mexico, 5 rounds.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: To a Strudel Profes,sional, It's Easy
description: Admittedly, making strudel dough is a challenge to amateur bakers. But Gilda Latzky is a strudel professional, and to her, whipping up a strudel is like taking candy from a baby.

title: By FOX BUTTERFIELD
description: MIRPUR, Pakistan, Dec. 24Thousands of nonBengalis are crammed together in this town on the outskirts of Dacca, surrounded by hostile Bengali guerrillas and cut off since the beginning of this week from food, water and electricity.

title: Italy: No Cause for Elation
description: There is little cause for elation in the fact that. Italy's electoral college has finally been able to choose the sixth President of the Republicthough it is no reflection on Giovanni Leone to put it that way. Senator Leone lacks the national stature of Enrico de Nicola and Luigi Einaudi, the first two Presidents after. Italy voted out the monarchy in 1946, but he measures up well to his three immediate predecessors.

title: Cambodia Force Shelled
description: PNOMPENH, Cambodia, Dec. 24 (UPI)  Communist troops continued shelling and harassing attacks against the forward Cambodian ?? on Route at Taing Kauk, 50 miles north of Pnompenh, field officers said today.

title: North Carolina 8765 Victor Over Chile Five in Madrid
description: MADRID, Dec. 24 (AP) Bob McAdoo scored 21 points and Bobby Jones 18 to lead the University of North Carolina to an 8765 victory over Union Espanola of Santiago, Chile today in an international holiday basketball tournament.

title: AT HOME ABROAD
description: LONDON, Dec. 24Off Essex Road in the London borough of Islington. there is a small street where flowers and fruit and vegetables are sold from barrows. The flower man is George Robertson: sixty years old, wellweathered face, not too many teeth left, cloth cap pulled down hard.

title: A French Priest's Vietnam Christmas
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, Dec. 24It pleases the Rev. Claude Collaudin that the creche made by Vietnamese children for his church shows Mary as an Asian woman, and Joseph in Vietnamese clothes. The children, uncertain of how the stable in Bethlehem might have looked instead built a but of dried coconut leaves, and the priest thought that was fine.

title: Rites for Mrs. Sternberger
description: A funeral service for Estelle M. Sternberger, wellknown radio commentator, will be held at the Universal Funeral Chapel, Lexington at 52d Street, tomorrow at noon. She died on Thursday at the age of 85.

title: Psychiatrist Compares Slums in U.S. and Ulster
description: BELFAST, Northern Ireland, Dec. 22A Belfast psychiatrist who recently visited Harlem and Watts has concluded that ghetto residents in the United States are more hopeful and less angry then the slum dwellers here.

title: Civilians Quit Laos Base
description: VIENTIANE, Laos, Dec. 24, (Reuters)More than 2,000 civilians were evacuated from the key Laotian base of Long Tieng today as Government forces retreating from the neighboring Plaine des Jarres hurriedly formed a defense line on a mountain ridge to block advancing Vietnamese troops.

title: SUSPECT ELUDES FOUR DETECTIVES
description: Four detectives waiting for a bankrobbery suspect near his Queens home held their fire late Thursday night as he tried to run down one of them, because they feared they might hit his wife or child seated in the car beside him.

title: GLEN E. WALLICHS, MUSIC EXECUTIVE
description: LOS ANGELES, Dec. 24 (AP)  Glenn E. Wallichs, cofounder of Capitol Records, Inc., and chairman of the board of Capitol Industries, Inc., died yesterday at Hollywood Presbyterian Hospital after a long illness. He was 61 years old.

title: SovietU.S. Ship Collision Is Being Investigated here
description: A board of investigation began yesterday to check into the collision Thursday night off the New Jersey coast of a United States cargo ship and a Soviet fishing trawler.

title: Tale of Two Schools
description: The decision by a threejudge Federal court in San Antonio, Tex., that financing local school districts on the basis of property tax valuations is unconstitutional moves this fundamental issue closer to definitive ruling by the Supreme Court. The argument brings into contention those who believe that local control of the schools is an overriding American principle and those who reply that any system of insuperable economic inequities directly conflicts with basic democratic rights.

title: CHARLES WYMAN; LED PANTASOTE
description: Charles A. Wyman, chairman of the board of the Pantasote Company, a plastics concern, in Passaic, N. J., died yesterday at University Hospital after brief illness. He was 57 years old and lived at 860 United Nations Plaza and in Holmes, N. Y.

title: Loeb Prediction
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 24William Loeb, the conservative newspaper publisher who was one of the most powerful forces pressing for the release of James R. Hoffa from prison, said today that now that the former labor, official was free, he would quickly become an active figure in American life.

title: Mayor and City Aides Attend Rites for Murdered Patrolman
description: Hundreds of policemen and policewomen from New York City and surrounding communities and a delegation of city officials led by Mayor Lindsay crowded into a little Baptist church in the Brownsville section of Brooklyn yesterday for the funeral services of a Housing Authority patrolman.

title: Hear Ye! Hear Ye!
description: Throughout the whole Kingdom to far and near the order went out. For days and weeks, the mighty and the humble. toiled. No effort was too arduous to be spared. Nothing was too small to be overlooked.

title: Two Hitchhikers are Killed On the Thruway at Nanuet
description: NANUET, N. Y., Dec. 24John Williams, 22 years old, of Groton, Conn., and Robert Spendolini, 24, of East Hartford, Conn., were run down and !instantly killed here last night !while hitchhiking on the Gov. Thomas E. Dewey Thruway near the Palisades Interstate Parkway intersection:

title: Bucknell's New Board Track Will Aid Entire School
description: LEWISBURG, Pa., Dec. 24 Safety and physical fitness have made gigantic strides at Bucknell University with the erection of a board track on the soccer field.

title: Film Unveiling Delayed For Carnal Knowledge
description: Opposition to the showing during the Christmas holiday of Carnal Knowledge, the Mike NicholsJules Feiffer film, has resulted in a delay of its opening at the Amityville (L.I.) movie theater.

title: JEWISH GROUP ASKS FOREST HILLS STUDY
description: The Synagogue Council of America called on the Lindsay administration yesterday to halt work on the controversial lowincome housing project in Forest Hills, Queens, until a group of experts could study it.

title: Antiques: Yule Greetings
description: The earliest dated Christmas card was commissioned by one of the first advocates of design reform in the 19th century. Henry Cole, who worked hard to initiate design reform in England before 1850, commissioned the card from John Horsely, a Royal Academician, in 1843. It was a handcolored lithograph showing a family with glasses raised to wish the world a Merry Christmas. Although letters of Christmas greeting had been sent earlier, Cole's card marked the beginning of what was to become a big industry.

title: Plane Carrying 93 Missing Over the Mountains of Peru
description: LIMA, Peru, Dec. 24 (UPI)A Peruvian airliner with 93 persons aboard disappeared and was presumed to have crashed in mountainous terrain today on a domestic flight between Lima and Iquitos, about 625 miles to the northeast.

title: LABOR UNIT SETTLES A HOUSING QUESTION
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 24 (UPI) The Labor Department has decided to allow farmeremployers to comply with either of two standards for migrant labor housing in 1972.

title: Italy's New Leader: Humor in His Politics
description: ROME, Dec. 24The Quirinal Palace will become one of Italy's best places for espresso coffee when Presidentelect Giovanni Leone moves into that former residence of Popes and Savoy kings at the start of his sevenyear term next Wednesday. The chances are that the head of state will personally supervise the brewing of the coffee to his exacting standards for important visitors. During the frequent interminable negotiations between the parties and factions of Italy's labyrinthine politics it became a tradition that at particularly tense moments a voice with a marked Neapolitan flavorMr. Leone'swould placidly say: What about a little cup of coffee?

title: Real Note, $83.80, First In Liberty Bell Handicap
description: PHILADELPHIA, Dec. 24 A Father and son teamed up to pull off the shocker of the winter meeting at Liberty Bell track today when Roland AKstone Sr's Real Note, ridden by Menotti Aristone, captured the $28,175 Hessian Handicap by three lengths from Mrs. William G. Christmas's Terrible Tiger.

title: Some Imprisoned Soviet Jews Are Reported on Hunger Strike
description: MOSCOW, Dec. 24 Jewish sources reported tonight that some of the Jews sent to labor camps for participation in the 1970 plot in Leningrad to hijack a Soviet plane have gone on hunger strikes to protest their sentences and camp conditions.

title: MEDICAL ALLIANCE WIDENED IN BRONX
description: Two major institutions in the Bronx have joined forces in a move to create broader opportunities for medical training and a more effective utilization of health care.

title: A Grocer Disarms Robber And Shoots His Accomplice
description: A Brooklyn store owner disarmed one man and shot another after they had robbed him of $300 yesterday evening.

title: $75,000 Paid to Man For Wrongful Jailing
description: HARRISBURG, Pa., Dec. 24 (Reuters)A 53yearold unemployed longshoreman was presented with a $75,000 check by the state government today as compensation for 13 years of wrongful imprisonment.

title: Pilot Lands on Highway
description: BEDFORD HILLS, N. Y., Dec. 24 (AP)  Mark Hamilton, pilot of Bennington, Vt., made forced landing on Interstate 684 here today after his single engine Cessna ran out of fuel while attempting to reach the Westchester County Airport. No one was injured.

title: A Week Off at Christmas: U.S. Trend?
description: DETROIT, Dec. 24A new lifestyle might be developing in Americaa midwinter week's vacation with pay between Christmas and New Year's Day.

title: Article 3  No Title
description: BELFAST, Dec. 24 (Reuters) An unidentified man risked his life today to drive a boobytrapped gasoline tank truck away from a busy Christmasshopping area. Before soldiers could remove the bomb a man jumped into the truck's cab and drove the tanker to an open space, then disappeared without giving his name.

title: Notes on People
description: When visitors troop through the White House next week they'll see the Red Room draperies as the President sees them. And that's an order. From Mrs. Richard Nixon, no less, who insisted on removal of nylon net shields placed over the new draperies to protect them from fingering by tourists. I understand, but I don't like them, Mrs. Nixon said of the shields to Rex Scouten, the White House usher. And there really isn't anything that would be proper. I want the public to see them [the draperies] as the President sees them. Off came the shields. Should the draperies wear out before their time, Mrs. Nixon is ready to act. If necessary, she said, I'll just have to raise the money to replace them.

title: HIJACKER OF 707 SEIZED IN CHICAGO
description: CHICAGO, Dec. 24A longhaired young man commandeered a Boeing 707 jet in flight today with the apparent intention of parachuting off it with $300,000 in ransom money.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: MRS. IRVING FRISCH
description: PLAINVIEW, L. I., Dec. 24Mrs. Leonora Frisch, editor of The Cold Spring Harbor Laboratory, a technical journal, died today in Memorial Hospital in New York. She was 54 years old and lived at 3 Kalman Court.

title: Hoffa, Freed, Rejoices With His Family
description: ST. LOUIS, Dec. 24 (AP)James R. Hoffa walked with his 8yearold granddaughter down a tree lined street in the suburb of Glendale the day before Christmas and they talked about Black Gold.

title: Taylor Traded to Royals
description: PHOENIX, Ariz., Dec. 24 (AP)The Phoenix Suns of the National Basketball Association traded a reserve guard, Fred Taylor, today to the Cincinnati Royals for a future draft choice. Taylor, in his second year with the Suns, had seen limited action this season.

title: Happiness Is a Winter Day on a Ranch
description: WALKILL, N. Y.Thirty New York youngsters, between the ages of 5 and 12, jostled, jiggled and tumbled their way off a chartered bus, here to find out. what Mystery Day entailed for members of the Winter. Vacation Day Camp. It was a real bonanza.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: FIRE AT INDIAN POINT LAID TO GUERRILLAS
description: COMMACK, L. I., Dec. 24A group calling itself Project: Achilles Heel, said today that the Indian Point Guerrillas were responsible for a fire at the Consolidated Edison nuclear generating plant on the Hudson River south of Peekskill on Nov. 4. The fire caused $10million in damage.

title: Pike and Ryan Get High Voting Marks
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 24An unofficial attendance check of the 41 New Yorkers in the House shows that Representatives Otis G. Pike of Suffolk County and WilLiam F. Ryan of Manhattan, both Democrats, have missed the fewest votes during the recently adjourned first session of the 92d Congress.

title: Cowboys'
description: BLOOMINGTON, Minn., Dec. 24 (AP)Roger Staubach gets a chance to make Tom Landry's preseason prediction come true for the Dallas CoWboys while Bud Grant sends Bob Lee to quarterback the Minnesota Vikings tomorrow in a National Football Conference playoff game.

title: In Bethlehem, Carols in the Rain
description: BETHLEHEM, Saturday, Dec. 25The star in the east was of neon, the church bells tolling the carols came from a scratchy loudspeaker but it was still Christmas in Bethlehem, where Christians, Moslems and Jews came together in peace.

title: LINDSAY TO RUN; READY TO ENTER 2 PRIMARY RACES
description: Mayor Lindsay will announce his candidacy for the Democratic Presidential nomination Tuesday morning in Miami, sources close to the Mayor reported yesterday.

title: MUNICIPAL UNION AND CITY IN PACT
description: The city and the municipal employes union have reached tentative agreement on a threeyear labor contract that is expected to cost the city a total of $60million, Mayor Lindsay, announced yesterday.

title: Baldwin Hawes Dies at 52; A Sculptor and Illustrator
description: SANTA MONICA, Calif., Dec. 24Baldwin Hawes, illustrator, sculptor and song writer, died Wednesday of a heart attack. He was 52 years old and lived here and formerly in New York.

title: CHILE IS ENJOYING SUMMER'S BOUNTY
description: SANTIAGO, Chile, Dec. 22Despite the beating of empty pots by housewives here recently to protest foodsupply problems, the streets, market places, and welltilled countryside have a bountiful appearance these sunny days.

title: Browns'
description: CLEVELAND, Dec. 24 (AP) A relatively inexperienced Cleveland Browns offensive line will be under its greatest pressure of the season Sunday when it tries to hold off the Baltimore Colts defense in an American Football Conerence playoff game.

title: Bell Nears 100 Millionth Phone
description: The Bell System expects to reach a major milestone sometime next week when somewhere in this country the 100 millionth telephone will be installed on the lines of an operating company of the American Telephone and Telegraph Company.

title: A Florida Hotel Evicts Davidoff Because of Dog
description: Sid Davidoff, a former City Hall aide who is organizing Mayor Lindsay's unannounced Florida primary campaign, was evicted from a Miami Beach hotel this week because of his dog.

title: Bar Owner Found Shot to Death In Car in Midtown Parking Lot
description: The body of a Manhattan bar owner, shot three times in the right side of the head, was found yesterday behind the wheel of a car in a midtown parking lot, the police said.

title: First Letters From G.I.'s Held by the Vietcong Sound Much Alike
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 24The first letters ever to reach the United States from American prisoners of war in South Vietnam tend to sound much alike, generally refecting a tone of assurance that the prisoners are being adequately cared for.

title: I.R.A. WARNS ULSTER OF TROUBLE TO COME
description: BELFAST, Northern Ireland, Dec. 24 (UPI)The outlawed Irish Republican Army released a Christmas message in Londonderry today saying that Ulster citizens must be prepared to suffer inconvenience, trouble and nerve strainperhaps deathat the hands of British soldiers.

title: Christmas: Child of Time
description: Christmas is at once the most ecumenical and the most personal of holy days. It reaches outward to the universal hope for peace and inward to the private satisfaction of life. And so it is altogether fitting that the enduring symbols of Christmas are the star and the child, one the shining goal for the destiny of man, the other the living hope for the future of the world. Even the pragmatic or the cynical, who may discount the star, cannot ignore the promise of the child.

title: A Way to Speed Up Computers Is Invented
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 24A technique that was patented this week speeds up a computer by having it do two things at once. The inventor is John D. Newton, staff engineer at the Systems Development Laboratory of the International Business Machines Corporation in Kingston, N. Y. Patent 3,629,853 concerns the instructions or programs that tell a computer what to do. The machine may be ordered to perform an operation such as addition or subtraction.

title: TRANSIT SESSIONS AT CRITICAL PHASE
description: Negotiations move into the critical phase next week as representatives of the Transit Authority and its employes attempt to reach a, new agreement before their present contract expires on New Year's Eve.

title: Fire Heavily Damages ??  East Side Boys Home
description: For more than three years the boys of Bonitas House on the Lower East Sidea home for orphans, addicts in rehabilitation and wards of the courts, all 16 to 20 years oldhave worked with hammers, saws and paint brushes to renew and furnish a fivestory brownstone at 606 East Ninth Street, between Avenues B and C.

title: Texas Ruling: Old System on Trial
description: With Thursday's Federal Court ruling holding the Texas system of public school financing unconstitutional, the whole controversial question of whether local property taxation is an equitable way of supporting public education appears headed for ultimate resolution by the United States

title: Gamblers Ask Official Voice
description: PORT of SPAIN, Trinidad, Dec. 24 (AP)The Punters Association, which represents about 500,000 race track gamblers in Trinidad, asked the government today to be represented on the racing commission. It claimed that members are being exploited by betting, shop operaors and that they wanted representation in an attempt to correct the situation.

title: CHIEFS PLACE 11 ON PRO BOWL TEAM
description: Len Dawson of the Kansas City Chiefs, and Bob Griese of the Miami Dolphins, who will be firing passes from opposite sides in today's playoff game, were named yesterday to the American Conference All Star team for the A.F.C.N.F.C. Pro Bowl in Los Angeles, Jan. 23.

title: FREDERICK C. HECKEL, A WRITER, LECTURER
description: SPRING VALLEY, N. Y., Dec. 24  Frederick C. Heckel, writer, lecturer and former reporter for The New York Times, who was prominent in organic farming circles, died here today. He was 65 years old and lived on Hungry Hollow Road.

title: TWO SINGERS BOW IN MET CAVALLERIA
description: In the performances of Mascagni's Cavalleria Rusticana this week at the Metropolitan Opera, two singers came into leading roles of the work for first times with the company. Elinor Ross took over the part of Santuzza and Batyah Godfrey that of Lucia. Seen together In the Thursday night performance, both made favorable impressions.

title: David Bayard du Pont Weds Barbara L. Freeman in Paris
description: Miss Barbara Lee Freeman and David Bayard du Pont, who expect to receive master's degrees in May from the Wharton School of Finance and Commerce of the University of Pennsylvania, were married yesterday in a civil ceremony in Paris. After a skiing honeymoon in Europe, the couple will reside in Wallingford, Pa.

title: President Signs Measure On River Basin Programs
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 24 (AP) The White House announced today that President Nixon had signed a number of bills passed by Congress before it adjourned last week.

title: Students Challenge Regime
description: DACCA, Dec. 24 (UPI)Ben?? students today issued the first, open challenge to the new Bengali government and to Indian Army officials trying to reestablish order in Dacca. The students announced that they would not surrender their weapons until the Bengali political leader, Sheik Mujibur Rahman, was released from prison in West Pakistan.

title: Vatican War Aid $10Million
description: ROME, Dec. 24 (AP)  The Vatican charity office, Cor Unum, announced today that Roman Catholic charities had received over $10million to help victims of the IndianPakistani conflict.

title: Plane Crash Kills Jerseyan
description: ALLENTOWN, Pa., Dec. 24 (AP)The pilot of a singleen gine plane was killed today when the craft crashed and burned on top of a mountain two miles from Allentown's Queen City Airport. The pilot was identified as Robert William Lantz, 47 years old, of Monmouth Beach, N. J. A former Allentown resident, he was a civilian employe of Fort Monmouth.

title: Jake Ehrlich, Criminal Lawyer Who Won Murder Cases, Dies
description: SAN FRANCISCO, Dec. 24 (UPI)  J. W. (Jake) Ehrlich, the San Francisco criminal lawyer whose courtroom skills earned him the nickname of The Master, died today at the age of 71.

title: Affidavits Tell of Talks on Allegations of Bribery
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 24 (AP) Affidavits filed with the Senate say that a man accused of trying to bribe a Utah political leader on behalf of the El Paso Natural Gas Company consulted with the company's top lobbyist about how to answer a Senate investigation of the charge.

title: Bridge:  A Christmas Card Provides Some Problems for Sender
Curtiss Gets G.M. Payment On Wankel Engine License
description: The CurtissWright Corporation announced yesterday that the company had received payment of $4,545,000 as an installment from the General Motors Corporation against its nonexclusive license from Curtiss to manufacture the Wankel rotating combustion engine in the United States, Canada and Mexico.

title: Dance: Still a Pleasure
description: Tchaikovsky's The Nutcracker has become a Christmas tradition, just like Scrooge. Undoubtedly many young Americans make their first acquaintanceship with dance through The Nutcracker, which is produced in a bewildering diversity of styles by an equally bewildering diversity of companies all across North America. Each Christmas sees 100 to 150 productions of The Nutcracker, but for New York City Ballet and George Balanchine.

title: Fire Rips Through Seoul Hotel, Leaving 26 Dead and 58 Injured
description: SEOUL, South Korea, Saturday, Dec. 25At least 26 persons were killed and 58 were injured in a fire that ripped through a 21story downtown hotel here this morning.

title: Theater: Calderon's Life Is a Dream
China Sees a Dollar Crisis
description: HONG KONG, Dec. 24Last week's devaluation of the American dollar and the realignment of world currencies was depicted in Peking today as a manifestation of the crisis of capitalism and the decline of United States imperialist hegemony.

title: Bomb in Tokyo Injures 12
description: TOKYO, Dec. 24 (Reuters)A homemade bomb, believed planted by leftwing extremists, exploded in a busy street today, injuring 12 people, two of them seriously. The blast, second in a week, occurred as thousands of people were shopping in one of Tokyo's busiest areas.

title: STARS PROVING JINX FOR RANGERS Minnesota Only N.H.L. Team New York Hasn't Beaten
description: Professional athletes like policemen, firemen, journalists and other essential servants of entertainers work on holidays, and the New York Rangers are no exception.

title: Mrs. Latzky's Recipe for Making It All Happen
description: Here is Mrs. Latzky's recipe for Hungarian strudel. GILDA LATZKY'S STRUDEL Dough

title: Mrs. Meir Meets Senators
description: JERUSALEM, Dec. 24 (Reuters)The Israeli Premier, Mrs. Golda Meir, conferred today with Senators Jacob Javits, Republican of New York, and John Sherman Cooper, Republican of Kentucky, on Middle Eastern problems. Both Senators, members of the Foreign Relations Committee, arrived last night on what Senator Javits said was a factfinding visit.

title: 4 ARE CONVICTED IN SMUT MAILINGS
description: SAN DIEGO, Dec. 24  The country's leading publisher of illustrated sex magazines and three associates were convicted in Federal Court here yesterday of mailing obscene advertisements for a Government report on pornography that they had enlivened by adding more than 500 lurid photographs to its text.

title: Dave Anderson
description: REDSKIN PARK, Va., Dec. 24Inside the twostory brick headquarters of the Washington Redskins compound, there is a small plastic Christmas tree on a table near the switchboard operator. It is George Allen's one concession the season.

title: CITY IS CRITICIZED ON GIRLS SHELTER
description: State Senator Roy M. Goodman charged yesterday that the Lindsay administration had dropped from the city's draft capital budget an $8million item for a new children's shelter in upper Manhattan to replace the outmoded Callagy Hall in the East Village.

title: Arab Federation Announces A Cabinet for Integration
description: CAIRO, Dec. 24The Presidential Council of the new Federation of Arab Republics, linking Egypt, Syria and Libya, announced today the formation of a federal cabinet to supervise integration of the loose alliance.

title: BHUTTO APPOINTS BOARD OF INQUIRY TO STUDY DEFEAT
description: RAWALPINDI, Pakistan, Dec. 24  President Zulfikar Ali Bhutto announced today that a commission had been appointed to inquire into the circumstances leading to the military debacle in East Pakistan and the ceasefire in the west.

title: Nixon Is Appreciative
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 24 (UPI) President Nixon said today that he deeply appreciated Bob ;Hope's effort to seek the freedom of American prisoners of war.

title: Hope Admits Doubt North Will Permit A Visit to P.O.W.'s
description: CAMP EAGLE, South Vietnam, Dec. 24 (AP)  Bob Hopel said today that he and a North Vietnamese diplomat in Laos had discussed a childrentochildren aid program and prisoner exchange.

title: Oil Man on Pay Board Terms Profit Vital
description: Maintenance of adequate profit incentives for the nation's employers will create new jobs, and is more important than any action taken by the Administration's Pay Board, according to one of that panel's five business members.

title: Paintings by Daugherty Recall an Era
description: The history of modernist art in America is still being writtenand indeed, rewritten. Reputations rise and fall, and sometimes rise again. Names make their appearance as old ones fade into oblivion. You would sometimes think we were in the process of uncovering the history of a lost civilization instead of an episode in art history only half a century or so distant from the present moment.

title: Humphrey Asserts Nixon Turns Back on Rural Poor
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 24 (AP) Senator Hubert H. Humphrey, Democrat of Minnesota, said today that the Nixon Administration has turned its back on the nation's rural poor in the last three years.

title: Bengali Tribunals Set
description: LONDON, Dec. 24 (Reuters) The new Bengali regime, in an announcement over the Bangladesh radio monitored in London, said today that tribunals were being set up to try accused enemy agents.

title: Pentagon Delays Decision On Releasing Mylai Report
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 24 (AP)  The Pentagon said today that a decision on whether to make public the full Army report of the Mylai killings would be made after all legal appeals and reviews in the case were completed.

title: Drivers Get Another Week
description: ALBANY, Dec. 24The State Department of Motor Vehicles has granted motorists a oneweek extension for renewal of driver's licenses and auto registrations that expire in December, the department announced today. Motorists will have untiil midnight Jan. 7, although continuous insurance coverage will be required. The extension was required, according to spokesman, to Implement a new program of registering taxicabs and other forhire vehicles.

title: Cooke Reported Ready To Accompany Hope
description: William D. Fugazy, a travel agency executive, said yesterday that if Bob Hope succeeds in going to Hanoi to negotiate the release of American prisoners of war Cardinal Cooke will accompany him.

title: For Christmas Rental: Dad Offers 7 Children
description: BROUGHTON, England, Dec. 24 (UPI)Peter Curtis has offered to rent his seven children for Christmas.

title: Rumanjan Seeks Asylum
description: BONN, West Germany, Dec. 24 (Reuters)A Rumanian novelist, Nicolas Breban, who failed to return home after attending the Cannes, France, film festival in May, has applied for West German citizenship, his brother said In Munich tonight.

title: There's Ali, There's a Referee, And There's This Fellow Blin
description: ZURICH, Switzerland, Dec. 24Who is Juergen Blin, the West German who will be the third man in the ring here Sunday with Muhammad Ali and the referee in the Great Mismatch?

title: Catholic Schools Are Challenged By Unionization of Lay Teachers
description: The nation's Roman Catholic schools, already financially hardpressed, appear about to face a growing, new challenge: unionization of their rapidly increasing number of lay teachers.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: ADM. HARDING, 62, OF COAST GUARD
description: Rear Adm. Chester L. Harding, a retired Coast Guard commander, a flier and an aeronautical engineer, died of a heart attack on Sunday at the Florida Hospital in Orlando, Fla. He was 62 years old and lived at 50 Pickwick Road, Marblehead, Mass.

title: Priest Reclassified As 1A in the Draft By Memphis Board
description: MEMPHIS, Dec. 24 (UPI)The Memphis draft board has declared a Roman Catholic priest is subject to induction and has rescinded his draft exemption. The action came less than a week after a Memphis Bishop announced his support for the antiwar movement.

title: LOUIS SCHEHR
description: GREAT NECK. L. I., Dec. 24  Louis Schehr, vice president of the Fabric Leather Corporation of Glen Cove, died today of cancer at his home, 15 Norfolk Road. He was 57 years old.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: Con Edison Fire Put Under Control After 12 Hours
description: A smoky fire touched off by an explosion at a Consolidated Edison substation Thursday night was finally brought under control yesterday, 12 !hours after it began.

title: Chiefs Are Picked Against Dolphins
description: KANSAS CITY, Dec. 24On the front of the large Christmas cards Hank Stram sent this year, a short, chubby Santa Claus who is wearing a Chiefs cap and could be taken for the Kansas City coach, is depicted stuffing footballs into stockings.

title: More Said to Quit in Croatia As Autonomy Crisis Eases
description: BELGRADE, Yugoslavia, Dec. 24 (Reuters)  More resignations were reported here today from Zagreb, capital of Croatia, Yugoslavia's second largest republic, where the political situation is being brought under control after a crisis over demands for more autonomy.

title: RETAIL SALES UP FOR LOS ANGELES
description: In the sprawling metropolis of Los Angeles, where unemployment has run as high as 7.3 per cent earlier this year, the consumer has been buying in recent weeks. As a result, in sharp contrast with last year, major stores in the city and the metropolitan area are reporting their best Christmas results in the last two years.

title: 200 in Midtown Hotel Flee Smoky Fire in Restaurant
description: More than 200 residents of Midtown hotel fled a twoalarm fire early yesterday in a street level restaurant that sent smoke billowing throughout the 20story structure.

title: Dr. Karl Dallenbach Dies; Edited Psychalogy Journal
description: AUSTIN, Tex., Dec. 24 (AP) Dr. Karl Dallenbach, for 42 years the editor and owner of the American Journal of Psychology, the oldest existing journal in psychology, died yesterday. He was 84 years old.

title: SALMON CURB ASKED BY U.S. AND CANADA
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 24 (AP) Voicing fear for the survival of Atlantic salmon, the United States and Canada called today for an immediate halt to Salmon fishing in international waters.

title: Christmas With John Doe
description: I HAVE kept (among a store of jovial, genial, heartstirring returns of the season) some very dismal Christmasses. I have kept Christmas inConstantinople, at a horrible hotel, where I attempted the manufacture of a plumpudding from the. macaroni soup they served me for dinner, mingled with some currants, and a box of figs I had brought from Smyrna; and where I sat, until very late at night, en, deavoring to persuade myself that it was cold and Christmassy (though it wasn't), drinking Levant wine, and listening to the howling of the dogs outside, mingled with the clank of a portable fire:engine, which some soldiers were carrying to one of those extensive conflagrations which never happen in Constantinople oftener than three times a day. I have kept Christmas on board a. Boulogne packet, in company with a basin, several despairstricken females, and damp steward who, to all our inquiries whether we should be in soon, had the one unvarying answer of pretty near, to give.

title: School Offers Parker Retrospective
description: The current exhibition of the paintings of Ray Parker at the School of Visual Arts, 290 East 23d Street, is called a retrospective. Although the show says it considers four years of the painter's oeuvre, it, in effect, covers only three, from 1959 to 1962.

title: Children's Activities Canceled Because of Strike at Y.M. H. A.
description: A strike by professional, clerical and maintenance workers has caused the cancellation of children's holiday activities at the normally bustling Young Men's and Young Women's Hebrew Associations at 92d Street and Lexington Avenue.

title: Inquiry on Aliens Urged
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 24 (UPI) Representative Peter W. Rodino Jr., Democrat of New Jersey, asked Attorney General John N. Mitchell today to investigate allegations that an international ring was selling forged documents to allow aliens to enter the United States illegally. Mr. Rodino is chairman of a House subcommittee on immigration and nationality.

title: Thermal Boring Device Melts Away Granite
description: A boring device that can melt its way through granite at 30 inches an hour has been developed by the Los Alamos Scientific Laboratory. On Thursday, in a trial run, it penetrated 12 feet through solid rock.

title: U.S. Custom House Here Is Dedicated as Historic
description: Hundreds of employes witnessed the dedication yesterday of the United States Custom House at Bowling Green as an historic building, in a ceremony that also marked the last Christmas that customs would spend there. The operation is scheduled to move early next year into the. World Trade Center.

title: Bronx Girl, 3, Dies in Fire In Bedroom of Apartment
description: A 3yearold girl died early yesterday morning in a fire in the bedroom of a basement apartment at 1114 Ard Avenue, the Bronx, the police reported. Three firemen of Battalion were injured in a futile effort to rescue the girl.

title: CHRISTMAS HUSH FALLS OYER CITY
description: A Christmas hush began de scending over the city yesterday as the last travelbound New Yorkers left by road, rai and air and arriving visitors were quickly swallowed up in reunions with family and friends.

title: Job Corps, Its Funds Reduced, Is Facing an Uncertain Future
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 24The Job Corps, a major training program for youths under the Johnson Administration, is today in an anemic condition, its future uncertain.

title: Judge Bars Waste Discharges Into Nonnavigable Waterways
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 24 (AP) A Federal district judge here has declared all waste discharges into nonnavigable waterways illegal and has barred the Federal Government from legalizing them with discharge permits.

title: Art: Ventures in Print
description: When dealers begin writing and telephoning to tell you not to miss an exhibition at a competing gallery, you go. Prints: Problems of the Multiple Image at the Martin Gordon Gallery, 1063 Madison Avenue, is such a show. Not a commercial venturenothing is for sale and there is no admission charge it turns out to be quite strictly a didactic introduction to technical (rather than esthetic) print connoisseurship.

title: Jelke's Heir, Held in Arson, to Get Mental Test
description: NORWALK, Conn., Dec. 24 (AP)Michael J. Brody, charged wIth arson and threatening the life of President Nixon in separate incidents, was ordered today to undergo a mental examination.

title: Troubled Youths Thrive in Homes of Their Own
description: TOPEKA, Kan., Dec. 19At first glance, it seemed no more than another happy American home, complete with a sparkling Christmas tree and kids just in from school.

title: Soviet Shifts Ruble Rates;
description: MOSCOW, Dec. 24 (AP)The Soviet Union realigned its nonconvertible ruble with 22 foreign currencies today, lowering the value of all of them except the Japanese yen.

title: Robbers Flee With $6,075 In Thefts at Chemical Banks
description: Two Manhattan branches of Chemical Bank were held up within an hour yesterday and thieves made off with an estimated total of $6,075, the police reported.

title: First National Cuts Rate
description: The First National City Bank announced yesterday that its minimum charge on business loanswhich floats in relation to the rate on 90day commercial paperwould be 5 per cent for the week beginning Monday, down from 5 per cent during the week just ended. The Irving Trust Company said that its floating prime rate would remain at 5 per cent next week.

title: Dallas Community Chest Gets Gift of $4Million
description: DALLAS, Dec. 24  The family of the late Granville C. Morton, a man known in Dallas as the potato chip king, gave almost $4million to the Dallas Community Chest trust fund yesterday.

title: EDWIN M. STANLEY, FEDERAL JUDGE, 62
description: GRENSBORO,N. C., Dec. 24 (AP)Judge Edwin M. Stanley, chief judge of the United States District Court for the Middle District of North Carolina, died at his home last night, aparently of a heart attack. He was 62 years old.

title: Hugh Mulligan's Sentence For Contempt Is Stayed
description: A stay in the execution of a threeyear jail sentence that Hugh Mulligan, a reputed gambler, was to have begun serving this Monday was ordered yesterday, a spokesman for the Manhattan District Attorney's office said last night.

title: RETIRED PILOT HELD IN DRUG SMUGGLING
description: A retired Air Force pilot, deported from Greece after serving 16 months in prison for flying 1,426 pounds of hashish from Lebanon to the island of Crete, was held in $100,000 bail yesterday on his arraignment in Federal Court in Brooklyn on a hashish indictment.

title: Birth of a Nation
description: The birth of a nation could hardly be less auspicious than the emergence of Bangladesh as the third major independent state of the Indian subcontinent.

title: DOLPHINS DEPART, NEBRASKA ARRIVES
description: MIAMI, Dec! 24Typifying the flurry of activity building for New Year's, one championship football team left this tropical city as another arrived today.

title: Common Market's Policy On Agriculture Imperiled Mounting Pressures From Within E.E.C., Monetary crisis and U.S. critisism Are Spurs to Operating Woes
description: PARIS, Dec. 24The bulky, unwieldy apparatus that the Common Market invented to keep its peasants happy down on the farm is In danger of cracking because of dissidence from the interior and mounting pressures outside, mainly from the United States.

title: Market Place : Optimistic View On Phone Stock
description: Ever since the Federal Communications Commission restricted the American Telephone and Telegraph Company's return on invested capital to 7 per cent about four years ago, the company's stock has been sleepingwhen it hasn't been actually falling out of bed.

title: Leaders in Custody
description: NEW DELHI, Dec. 24 (Reuters)  Abdu Mutaleb Malik, former governor of East Pakistan, several of his ministers and officials were taken into custody today by the new Bengali government.

title: Workers Banned at Tunnel
description: DETROIT, Dec. 24 (UPI)A Federal court order has been issued requiring workers to remain at least 100 feet from the Lake Huron water tunnel where 21 men were killed in a gas explosion Dec. 11 until adequate safety precautions are taken. The temporary order was issued yesterday by District Court Judge John Feldens in response to a motion by Secretary of Labor James D. Hodgson.

title: TESTS SHOW NIXON IS IN GOOD HEALTH
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 24 (UPI) President Nixon underwent a threehour physical examination at the Bethesda Naval Hospital today and then declared not only that he was in good shape but also that the country is in better health this year than it was last year.

title: Ann Gambling and C. P. Janelli, Fellow Students, Are Betrothed
description: PLANDOME, L. L., Dec. 25 The engagement of Miss Ann Bradley Gambling to Chris Pettengill Janelli has hten announced by her parents, Mr. and Mrs. John Gambling of this community. Miss Gambling's father is a radio broadcaster with WOR in New York.

title: Three Different Childhoods
description: Short story collections are relatively rare in the young adult (execrable phrase) market, I am told. At hand are three such collections. They vary in quality, but I hope they presage more of the same. Admittedly, collections of short stories for bona fide adults are, unless by a name writer, regarded by publishers with the gelid stare a banker reserves for a bad credit risk applying for a loan, and I suppose the same balancesheet thinking obtains in the juvenile game. Nonetheless, the short story provides an economy, intensity and catholicity of subject matter for the writer; and, for a young reader, stories can project a series of illuminations of his territory like a Fourth of July display, as opposed to the inexorably rising sun of a good novel.

title: Miss Tibbals Plans Nuptials
description: PRINCETON, N. J., Dec. 25The engagement of Miss Rosana Tibbals to A. Dix Leeson Jr., son of Mr. and Mrs. Leeson of Wayland, Mass., has been announced by the future bride's parents, Mr. and Mrs. Lester Tibbals Jr. of Princeton. A wedding next June is planned.

title: Royal Crown Bounces Back
description: COLUMBUS, Ga.  When William C. Durkee was named president and chief executive officer of the Royal Crown Cola Company in July of 1969, it was like icing on the first birthday cake of a new life for the nation's thirdlargest softdrink company.

title: Nolan Gets Wallack Trophy
description: Mark Nolan of Summit, N.J., Rutgers crosscountry captain, has been named winner of the Lester Wallack Sr. Trophy as the most improved runner on the 1971 team. The award was established by the father of the Rutgers coach in 1962 and was presented by the donor at the annual fall sports dinner.

title: Letters
description: To THE EDITOR;

title: POSTEL ASKS STUDY OF CITY HOUSING
description: Governor Rockefeller was urged yesterday by City Councilman Robert I. Postel to impanel a blue ribbon commission of housing and accounting experts to investigate the city's Housing and Development Administration.

title: Art
description: REALISM, Delacroix observed in 1860, is the great resource of the innovators at those periods when the schools are becoming languid and turning to mannerism; through it they awaken once more the blaso taste of the public, while the schools turn in the circle of the same conventions. Bernard Shaw, though speaking of the theater rather than of painting, affirmed the same principle several decades later. When art becomes effete, he wrote, it is realism that comes to the rescue.

title: A Chinese Demonstration Ends in Minor Skirmishes
description: A peaceful march down Mott Street by about 200 Chinese who believe Taiwan should be taken over by China ended with minor skirmishes in Chatham Square yesterday.

title: 2 BELGRADE EDITORS ARE OUSTED IN PURGE
description: BELGRADE, Yugoslavia, Dec. 25 (UPI)The editor and assistant editor of a Belgrade humorous newspaper, both criticized for Serbian nationalism, have lost their jobs, local news reports said this week.

title: Miss Dember Engaged To Frederic Leffler
description: Mr. and Mrs. David Y. Dember of Jamaica, Queens, have made known the engagement of then. daughter, Miss Marjorie Beth Dember, to Frederic Charles Leffler, son of Mr. and Mrs. Louis Leffler of Jamaica Estates, Queens.

title: Setting the mood
description: New Year's Eve... crowded with memories of the year past and heady with anticipation of things to come. And that's the feeling created by the silver and white decorations shown below for a midnight dinner in a Fifth Avenue apartment. The designer created a glistening combination of sophistication and simplicity with bows and streamers of perforated silver ribbon that pick up the moonbeam glow of dozens of white candles. Daisy nosegays add a demure contrast to the glitter. And the air is scented with oranges and cloves from the pomander balls resting on crisp napkins at each plate. The silver and white mood accents coral walls and greenenameled chairs.

title: South Bronx to Get A Housing Project With School Center
description: A combined sevenstory lowincome and moderateincome apartment house and preschool center will be constructed in the South Bronx for 114 families, the Department of Housing and Urban Development announced yesterday.

title: French Corners, 63 to 1 , Captures Tropical Stakes
description: MIAMI, Dec. 25French Corners, a 63to1 shot who appeared hopelessly outdistanced on the backstretch, took the long way home in the $25,000 added Christmas Handicap at Tropical Park today, but he got there in plenty of time and paid $128 for $2 to win.

title: Movie Mailbag
description: To THE EDITOR:

title: GEN. STEVENSON; LED GUARD HERE
description: SAYVILLE, L. I., Dec. 25Brig. Gen. Charles G. Stevenson, New York National Guard retired, formerly State Adjutant General and Vice Chief of Staff to the Governor, died today of cancer here. He was 68 years old and lived at 108 Elm Street.

title: The Nation
description: As we give to one another, in the spirit of Christmas, let us give of ourselves. President Nixon delivered himself of those words in a holiday message last week from the White House, where he spent Christmas day with his family.

title: Let History Judge
description: I put down Roy A. Medvedev's book with the same feeling of glazed horror that comes when reading of a tidal wave in West Bengal, an earthquake in the interior of Turkey or a cholera epidemic in preCommunist China. Stalin's terrible impact on the world, specifically the world of Russia but spreading far beyond its borders to touch almost every human being in one way or another, is so monumental, so epic in its evil that even now, nearly two decades after his melodramatic death, we find ourselves like archeologists on site still trying to trace out its colossal dimensions.

title: 5 TRAINMEN INJURED IN FREIGHT COLLISION
description: MOUNT MARION, N. Y., Dec. 25 (UPI)Two loaded Penn Central freight trains crashed head on and burned today near this Ulster County illage. Two crewmen were seriously injured and three suffered minor injuries.

title: Study Blames Officials for Bias Against Migrants
description: DENVER, Dec. 25 (UPI)  A report this week on migrant workers in the Southwest said that state and Federal officials were responsible for tremendous discrimination against field workers and substandard housing that cut their lifespans by more than 20 years.

title: Miss Goldman Weds K. D. Kemper
description: Miss Diane Goldman and Kenneth D. Kemper were married here last night in the St. RegisSheraton by Rabbi Ronald B. Sobel of Temple EmanuEl.

title: Dietz Among Stars To Row on Friday At Orchard Beach
description: Crews prepping for the Olympics in Munich next August plan an early start on the chilly Orchard Beach Lagoon Friday with a New Year's Eve regatta sponsored by the New York Rowing Association.

title: Coins
description: TWO coins to commemorale Jamaica's 10th anniversary of Independence in 1972 will he introduced for general circulation early next year, it was announced at the Royal Canadian Mint, which will manufacture the monies.

title: The World
description: SAIGON North Vietnam's challenge to United States air power last week signaled a new and potentially more dangerous phase for President Nixon's air policy in Indochina.

title: Education
description: The 10week summer vacation from school is an anachronism left over from the days when children were needed to help on the farms of an agrarian society. Lately the system has been questioned. Can the schools of a modern, industrialized society, hardpressed for money, afford to leave a multibilliondollar establishment stand largely idle for a quarter (counting other vacations) of the year?

title: Television
description: THE offices were dark and foreboding. Henry Dark and Lester Foreboding tapped each other's forehead thoughtfully as they waited for the other executives to arrive. Finally, the door burst open, bruising a finely chiseled secretary named Frieda Frontispiece, and the other members of the network's braintrust entered.

title: Transit Strike Approval By Workers Is Expected
description: Union transit employes are expected to authorize a strike on the city's subways and buses at a meeting today in Manhattan Center to plan a contract job action against the Transit Authority.

title: Belgium's Drug Problem
description: BRUSSELS, Dec.25 (Reuters) More than one in 10 Belgian students take drugs, according, to a survey published in the Belgian magazine Vrijdag. The survey was carried out by the National Center for the Study of Juvenile Delinquency.

title: Dogs Used Here to Combat Crime
description: Beware of the Dog, printed in a bright glowing orange, is the most prevalent sign on Mapes Avenue, closely followed by a more officiallooking one: This Property Is Protected by Guard Dogs.

title: Behind the mask of the plain country doctor
description: It has been said that the second largest industry in America is education. Like most industries of great size, it functions by subcontracting. In the English department there have long been flourishing little subcontracted industriesthe Lawrence industry (D. H. and T. E.), the Henry James industry, the Eliot industry, the Pound industry. One of the most active growth stocks is the W. C Williams industryonly a short while ago a phenomenon no larger than a man's hand. Williams lends himself readily to such exploitation or explication, not so much as Eliot or Pound, but more than most. Pound and Eliot, like Browning in Sordello, wrote with such an end in view. They planned it that wayto keep posterity busy. Williams did not.

title: CANADIAN FARMS SOW MARIJUANA
description: OTTAWA, Dec. 25 (Reuters) More and more. Canadian farmers are starting to grow marijuana as a cash crop, census officials say, but, bound by pledges of secrecy, the officials are not telling who or where.

title: Campaign Notes
description: SAN FRANCISCO, Dec. 25  Gov. Ronald Reagan of California is expected to decide next week whether to sign a reapportionment bill passed by the Democraticcontrolled Legislature. The date of the California primary next year hangs on his decision. The bill provides for a oneweek delay in the primary, from June 6 to 13, to allow time for the complex job of re vamping voter lists and ballots to conform to new Congressional, district lines.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: Dance
description: THE past couple of weeks I have been thinking about black approaches to dance, having seen the Alvin Ailey Company and its new works, and also the latest New York performance of Arthur Mitchell's Dance Theater of Harlem, which seems to be doing splendidly.

title: LONG OCCUPATION OF EAST PAKISTAN FORESEEN IN INDIA
description: NEW DELHI, Dec. 25Indian officials say their Government feels it will have to keep its army in East Pakistan for many months before conditions there are stable enough to remove it.

title: Architecture Mailbag
description: To THE EDITOR:

title: Horse Show News
description: An antidrug rule in California has been signed into law by Gov. Ronald Reagan and Albert E. Hart Jr., president of the American Horse Shows Association, has hailed the legislation as a major step forward in the control of drugs on show horses.

title: Pope Sees World in Need Of Message of Christmas
description: ROME, Dec. 25Pope Paul VI, in a Christmas statement to the world, pleaded with modern man today not to turn away from Jesus and His message.

title: Letters
description: To THE EDITOR:

title: Dolphins Are Held in Esteem by Miami Fans After Years of Rejection and Ridicule
description: MIAMI, Dec. 25  Archie Stone surveyed the 58,000 empty seats in the Orange Bowl and seemed on the verge of tears.

title: Why They Live to Be 100, Or Even Older, in Abkhasia
description: NOT long ago, in the village of Tarnish in the Soviet Republic of Abkhasia, I raised my glass of wine to toast a man who looked no more than 70. May you live as long as Moses (120 years), i said. He was not pleased. He was 119.

title: Busing Plan In Nassau Thwarted By Parents
description: EAST MEADOW, L.I..The immediate question was whether some 500 children should be bused from tthe Bowling Green Elementary School to two others nearby, clearing the way for a districtwide administration building in the old grammar school.

title: Juvenile Court Counselor Files a Suit to Regain Job
description: CHARLOTTE, N. C., Dec. 25 A Juvenile Court counselor, dismissed after he criticized the Charlotte Mecklenburg school board's handling of recent disruptions and helped organize a local committee to free Angela Davis, filed suit this week for reinstatement.

title: BROWNS RIDING STREAK OF FIVE
description: CLEVELAND, Dec. 25 (UPI) The Baltimore Colts, victors in the 1971 Super Bowl, take their first step toward another possible super bowl appearance tomorrow in a playoff game against the Cleveland Browns.

title: Recording
description: THE year just fading has treated Wagner extremely well on the turntable. The Bayreuth Parsifal conducted by Pierre Boulez appeared, followed by a new Lohengrin guided by Rafael Rubelik, and now fresh releases of Tannhiluser and Die Meistersinger bid for attention. These last two can he scored as one and a half rejoicings. There is no doubt that the earlier of these works, Tannhiiuser, is today the least popular Wagner opera in the active repertory. Its conflict of frozen piety versus disembodied lust seems an unpalatable Victorian morality dish to a modern audience, and everyone has had it with the Evening Star. A pity, because the score from beginning to end is not only masterful but very exciting, the product of a time when Wagner's youthful verve was beginning to he affected by a more introsophistication.

title: Gallup Says Humphrey Leads Democrats With Kennedy Out
description: If Senator Edward M. Kennedy stays out of the Democratic Presidential field, Senator Hubert H. Humphrey of Minnesota is the leading choice of Democrats, the Gallup Poll reported yesterday.

title: Cheerless Holiday Trip Home for Italy's Jobless
description: ROME, Dec. 25  Special trains are rolling south these days, as they do every year, carrying thousands of Italian migrant workers from the industrial countries in Western Europe to spend Christmas in their home towns in Calabria and Sicily. This year, many of the migrants are traveling without return tickets.

title: Critic's ChoiceTen Best Films of '71
description: MAKING up a list of the socalled best films of any year is like doing a crossword puzzle. It involves a lot of concentration, anguish and effort, none of which does much to improve the state of the intellect, even though it is supposed to involve the exercise of the intellect. This year I've had no trouble in picking the top 10they more or less picked themselves as the year went bybut I find myself with a number of movies left over that, for one reason or another, I liked, but that won't even make the list of the dozen runnersup.

description: When an officer of a women's organization was asked the other day if the 925 or so members included many housewives, she answered, with mock seriousness, You mean there are still some of those around?

title: Photography
description: W HAT difference does the man behind the camera make? At the Philadelphia Museum of Art, through Jan. 30, the results of Paul Strand's lifelong involvement with the camera are spread out for public inspection in a gargantuan exhibition of nearly 500 photographs. Strand himself worked closely with Michael Hoffman, the Museum's photography adviser, in preparing the exhibition, and it is certainly the definitive exposition of his work. Many of the pictures, both early and late, have never or seldom before been publicly shown, and I can think of only one period that is not covered, the pre1915 apprenticeship when Strand was still experimenting with the misty impressionist effects of pictorial photography.

title: Movie Mailbag

title: Market Faces Fish Charge
description: The Consumer Affairs Department accused a Brooklyn supermarket yesterday of selling frozen seafood as fresh fish. Commissioner Bess Myerson said inspectors checking the Peter Reeves Supermarket at 125 Montague Street, in Brooklyn Heights, found five containers of shrimp, six packages of filet. of sole, seven halibut steaks and 12 salmon steaks, all of which had been frozen, under a sign that said fresh fish.

title: Gardens
description: WHEN I was a boy in Connecticut, I decided it would be nice to have a bouquet of spring flowers for my mother's winter table. So I picked a few bare sprigs of forsythia about the end of October and set them in a vase in the living room. My plan was to have them blossom around Christmas time.

title: Pros Top Cougars, 110102
description: MEMPHIS, Dec. 25 (AP) Wilbert Jones scored 24 points, to lead the Memphis Pros to a 110102 victory tonight over the Carolina Cougars. Joe Caldwell scored 28 points for the. Cougars.

title: Nickel Phone Call May End

title: Home Improvement

title: VIOLENCE HALTS ANTIPOLIO SHOTS

title: The Last Word: Beyond The Waste Land
description: If the needful years and health are granted to me, wrote a fortyish Hunter College professor of English in 1939, I shall devote a series of studies to religious thought and feeling as reflected in English poetry from the eighteenth century to the twentieth. Thus the Preface to Hoxie Neale Fairchild's first volume of Religious Trends in English Poetry. The needful years and health were granted (plus an unusual degree of dedication and perseverance), and 30 years and a millionplus words later the sixth and final volume of this extraordinary work appeared.

title: New Law Aids Consumers
description: Attorney General Louis J. Lefkowitz said yesterday that beginning Jan. 1 consumers must receive a receipt on demand when leaving personal property to be repaired, rebuilt or reconditioned. A new law requires service businesses such as dry cleaners, shoemakers and TV repairmen to issue a receipt if the customer demands it or face a fine. The law is designed to aid consumers in receiving compensation for goods lost because of fire or theft.

title: England and Russia eyed each other, and Germany eyed them both
description: Who is to be master of Central Asia? That, so Lord Palmerston thought, was a vital question that could be decided only by force of arms. It had seemed to him inevitablewhen Queen Victoria was still a girlthat sooner or later the Cossack and the Sepoy, the man from the Baltic and he from the British islands, must meet and fight to determine the future of India. it still seemed to him inevitable when he died in 1865. By then, the Queen herself had long since learned to share his Russophobia. Towards the end of her own long life she exploded in exasperation when Gladstone suggested that the British Government might adopt a more friendly attitude towards Russia. The Queen most strongly deprecates any such notion, she told him angrily. She is our real enemy and Rival... Beware of trusting her!

title: Doctoring Themselves
description: The Abkhasians practice an elaborate folk medicine, using more than 200 indigenous plants to cure a wide variety of ills. They apply plantain leaves to heal severe wounds, take ranunculuses for measles, use poligonaceae as an anticoagulant and asafetida (also known as Devil's Dung) as an antispasmodic. When all else fails, a doctor is called and the aged Abkhasian is taken to the hospital but always with the expectation, including his own, that he will recover. They never express the fatalistic view, Well, what do you expect at that age? Sickness is simply not considered normal and natural. S.B.

description: Before Western businessmen can understand the Japanese way of lifeessentially one of socialism run by private enterprise  they must look beyond the economic barriers to investment in Japan to the nation's history and culture.

title: 14 Men Selected For Bobsled Team By Olympic Group
description: PLATTSBURGH, N. Y., Dec.1 23 (UPI)  William Hall, John Mulholland and Kenneth Morris are among those who have been named to the United States Olympic bobsledding team.

title: CAMBODIANS NEED AID FOR RED CROSS
description: PNOMPENH, Cambodia, Dec. 21Officials of the Cambodian Red Cross say that they have received no important donations from private American welfare agencies or individuals except $200 raised at a bazaar last month by wives of United States officials here.

title: Crossing Algeria's Desert Through Rain and Red Tape
description: THE teacher of a writing class I attended long ago once told usto illustrate the importance of selecting le mot justethat Shakespeare did not write the arid desert, but the idle desert. The lesson was to forsake the obvious arid find, among human attributes, if necessary, the single evocative adjective that summed up all that one wanted to say.

title: Seoul Receives Assurances From Nixon on China Talks
description: SEOUL, South Korea, Dec. 25 President Nixon has assured President Park Chung Hee in a recent letter that he would not make any deal concerning Korea with Chinese leaders during his forthcoming visit to Peking, Foreign Minister Kim Yong Shik has reported.

title: News of Dogs
description: A city dog, whose weekday training consists of romps in the New York University parking lot in the Bronx before his master leaves for work in the morning, gave a lesson to his country cousins when he led a field of the 20 top Brittany spaniels in the United States and Canada to win the international Brittany spaniel open championship. The orange and white is Carey's Freckles and he is owned by John J. Carey Jr., an industrial buyer for Esso International.

title: Linda Boffa Fiancee of Paul Peters
description: SECAUCUS, N. J., Dec. 25 Mr. and Mrs. Emil Boffa have announced the engagement of their daughter, Miss Linda Marion Boffa, to Paul Leone Peters, son of Mr. and Mrs. Leone J. Peters of Manhasset, L. I., and New York, where the father of the future bridegroom is board chairman of the real estate firm of Cushman & Wakefield.

title: A scheme that will make millionsor will it?
description: A pundit once asserted, The crowning work of our civilization is the cash register. And now the Zemachs put in their two cents worth in A PENNY A LOOK (Farrar, Straus & Giroux, $4.95. Ages 5 to 8) as they tell about the two fellows, below, chugging along in their Tin Lizzie. The one driving with the cigar and confident smile is a redheaded rascal, the hustler after a quick buck; the other one with his mouth down in a sulk is his lazy goodfornothing brother. Their pet scheme? Pure P. T. Barnum. All we have to do is go... and capture a oneeyed man... put him in a cage... and charge a penny a look. We'll make millions! And why not? Well a gogetter should get it or should he? But that's the Zemachs surprise.

title: MUSKIE PICKS UP LEADERS BACKING.
description: HARTFORD, Dec. 25 Many Connecticut Democratic leaders favor the nomination of Senator Edmund S. Muskie of Maine for the Democratic Presidential nomination, according to a statewide check of top party chiefs.

title: Cairo Opera Ruins Sold
description: CAIRO, Dec. 25 (Reuters)The charred ruins of Cairo's Opera House, destroyed by fire two months ago, will be sold to a demolition contractor for $48,100.

title: What Would the Late George Apley Have Made of It?
description: CONSIDER the scene: A penthouse apartment in the West 70's, not fashionable in the least. Geared for work, mainly. A grand piano, a large hifi unit, a couch, table, desk, chairs, many hooks. Things in disarray. A small place, really, with a huge terrace. Just now, the stereo set is going fullblast. The music, a strange, mad jazz, with basses, trumpets, trombones , saxophones, strings and piano crashing into one another, producing thick, bristling sounds eons removed from the familiar pre fifties improvisational sets around a familiar tune. This is jazz that jars the nerves, music that explodes into myriad fragments.

title: Movie Mailbag
description: To THE EDITOR:

title: Samuel Mathes Jr. To Wed Leslie Nee
description: WESTPORT, Conn., Dec. 25 Mr. and Mrs. Joseph F. Nee have made known the engagement of their daughter, Miss Leslie Nee, to Samuel Rhea Mathes Jr., son of Mrs. Mathes of Pensacola, Fla., and the late Mr. Mathes. A spring wedding is planned.

title: SQUIRES DEFEAT CONDORS, 133126
description: HAMPTON, Va., Dec. 23 (AP) Charlie Scott scored 21 of his 3S points in the first period tonight as the Virginia Squires took a 15point lead and never trailed in posting a 133126 American Basketball Association victory over the Pittsburgh Condors.

title: Drama Mailbag
description: To THE EDITOR:

title: New Limits Restricting Researchers of the Sea
description: Scientists who go to sea in the purstiit of knowledge are growing increasingly concerned over new restrictions and limitations on the traditional freedom of the seas for research.

title: The Day After
description: So we come to the day after and we gather up the tinsel and the tissue and we look at the wreaths and the tree and the lights and the bright decorations, and we wonder at the purpose of it all. Then we think of the other things, lumping them in one sad categorythe evils hatred and distrust, of violence and brutality and war.

title: Shelley Markham Will Be a Bride
description: RICHMOND, Dec. 25 Dr. and Mrs, Jerome David Markham have announced the engagement of their daughter, Miss Shelley Markham, to Michael PintoDuschinsky of of Oxford and London.

title: GEORGE S. KAUFMANN
description: George S. Kaufmann, a leader in the international hide and skin business and chairman of the board of the Kaufmann Trading Corporation of New York, died Friday at his home, 50 Sutton Place South. He was 73 years old.

title: MADISON AVE.
description: Merle Johnson, wearing a wide psychedelic tie, has come to the Biltmore Hotelon Madison Avenue. Let's help Merle factually: there are over 200 art galleries on or near the Avenue. And I'll skip details of the Avenue's hypnotic bazaar of shops and boutiques.

title: Drake Hotel Is Robbed of $15,000
description: Three robbers invaded the fashionable Drake Hotel early yesterday, gagged and handcuffed three members of the hotel staff and escaped with more than $15,000 in cash and an undisclosed amount of jewelry.

title: Architecture Mailbag
description: To THE EDITOR:

title: BOB HOPE AWAITING HANOI AIDE'S REPLY
description: BANGKOK, Thailand, Dec. 25 (AP)  Bob Hope, returning from his annual Christmas tour in South Vietnam, said today that he was still trying to arrange for a visit to prisonerofwar camps in the North.

title: Miss Davis Smokes Pipe
description: PALO ALTO, Calif., Dec. 25 (UPI)Angela Davis, the black militant, has taken up a pipe in an effort to cut down on her threepackaday cigarette smoking.

title: Future Social Events
description: Tickets for the following events may be obtained from the beneficiaries unless otherwise indicated:

title: Janet Wyman Is Betrothed
description: BROOKLINE, Mass., Dec. 25The engagement of Miss Janet Cutter Wyman to William Caldwell Coleman 3d has been announced by Mr. and Mrs. Franklin Wyman Jr., parents of the future bride. Mr. Coleman is the son of Mrs. David Wilder of Boston and Little Compton, R. I., and the late Mr. Coleman Jr. of Baltimore.

title: The World
description: NEW DELHI  Not until last Wednesday, six full days after the Pakistani forces surrendered to the Indian Army and East Pakistan became Bangladesh, did the five gray men of the Bangladesh government fly from their exile headquarters in Calcutta to their own capital, Dacca.

title: Ithaca's Record a Winner
description: Ithaca College's varsity basketball team has a 420309 wonlost record against college teams in 4U years of competition.

title: Douglas Fir (Just Call Him Doug) Brings Joy
description: If all goes according to the game plan, I'm sitting right now in the living room enjoying my family still enjoying their gifts while we're all enjoying our very first Douglas fir.

title: Job Training Offered. For Bronx Veterans
description: Veterans in the Bronx may take job training programs and receive numthly stipends of nearly $400 under a program announced this week by the city's Manpower and Career Development Agency.

title: WASHINGTON
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 25 In his Christmas message to the American people, President Nixon said this was a time for reflection, and spoke of that special grace that makes this a time of giving and forgivinga time of goodwill, when we know the true peace that lodges in the heart. As we work toward peace in the world, let us do so both inspired and strengthened by this peace in the heart.

title: Drama Mnilbag
description: To THE EDITOR:

title: Tommy Loves Cincy
description: FROM The Medium to Macbeth to Die Meistersinger is one way to symbolize the career of Thomas Schippers. He made his debut as conductor with Menotti's The Consul in 1950, but shortly thereafter did the film version of the same composer's Medium. Macbeth, with which Menotti and Schippers opened the first Festival of Two Worlds at Spoleto, Italy, stands for the many Verdi works that have commanded Schippers's attention. (He is in the middle of a project to record all the Verdi operas for RAI in Rome.) Tomorrow night he conducts Meistersinger for the first time at the Metropolitan Opera. It is not his first Wagner therehe has done Der Fliegende Holldndernor his first Meistersinger, which he has led at Bayreuth.
