title: Samuel Reber , Career Diplomat For the State Department, Dies
description: PRINCETON, N. J., Dec. 25Samuel Reber, a Foreign Service career officer who had been Acting High Commissioner for Germany, died today in the Princeton Hospital after a brief illness. He was 68 years old and lived at 13 Campbeilton Circle.

title: Flight Procedures for C5A Modified To Ease Stress and Extend LifeSpan
description: Deeply concerned about the life expectancy of the wings of the huge and controversial C5A cargo plane and the possibility that major changes might have been needed before long, the Air Force has ordered a series of new flying procedures to cut down structural wear and tear.

title: Islands
description: HONOLULUFor the American with an escapist bent, capital in hand and an adventurous disposition, the far frontiers of the South Pacific loom as one of the most enticing investment possibilities in real estate abroad.

title: Conflict Over Election Upsets West Bank
description: JERUSALEM, Dec. 25Palestinian politics on the occupied west bank of the Jordan have been thrown into turmoil by a public test of wills between Israel and Jordan over the holding of municipal elections.

title: LETTERS
description: To the Financial Editor:

title: Movie Mailbag
description: To THE EDITOR:

title: Hoover, Almost 77, Declares He Never Thought of Resigning
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 25 (UPI)J. Edgar Hoover, who will celebrate his 77th birthday on New Year's Day, says he has never considered stepping down as director of the Federal Bureau of Investigation despite nearly a halfcentury of service.

title: Nation
description: WASHINGTONA month or so ago, when Ohio's Governor, John J. Gilligan, was trying to decide what to do about the 1972 Presidential race, he suggested to a friend that if he and Senator John V. Tunney of California and a few others came out for Senator Edmund S. Muskie early enough, they could all but assure Mr. Muskie the nomination.

title: The Nation
description: WASHINGTONGenerally with a sigh of relief, the world's traders and international money exchangers returned to something approaching normalcy last week following four months of often painful uncertainty.

title: Donna Smith Fiancee
description: WESTON, Conn., Dec. 25The engagement of Miss Donna Looram Smith to Charles Alexander Downie, son of Mr. and Mrs. Theodore A. Downie of Pomeroy, Ohio, has been announced by the future bride's parents, Mr. and Mrs. Clifford D. Smith of Weston. The prospective bridegroom is a teacher in Middleport, Ohio. A June wedding, is planned.

title: Miss Cordelia Exton Fiancee Of Leslie Carter, Law Student
description: SOUTHPORT, Conn., Dec. 25  Miss Cordelia Wheeler Exton of Rome, formerly of New York, plans to be married next October to Leslie Stuart Carter of Pittsburgh.

title: Sports of The Times
description: Two weeks ago, early in the game between the Baltimore Colts and the Miami Dolphins, Johnny Unitas flipped a short pass to Tom Matte, the experienced running back who was all alone near the sideline. Matte dropped it. As he returned to the huddle, he noticed Unitas glaring at him from inside his face mask.

title: There'll Always Be an Abkhasia
description: The Abkhasian culture has survived intact despite centuries of warlike raids by, and against, neighboring herdsmen, and domination by the Greeks, Turks and Russians; in Abkhasian history, the rule of the Turks was especially cruel. Many Abkhasians were sold as slaves, but it is a certainty that that depredation left Abkhasian vigor intact. In the 5th century, under Justinian, orthodox Christianity was imposed on the Abkhasians, and in the 15th and 16th centuries, the Sunni sect of Islam. Traces of those religions remain, and some Abkhasians will identify themselves as Christians or Moslems. But they always have been pagans, and their underlying belids are pagan, connected to the family structure. They make animal sacrifices at family shrines. Asked to reconcile paganism with the mid20th century, Abkhasians smile and say, Oh, we don't believe in it. It's just a tradition.

title: Mrs, Fischer Has a Son
description: SILVER SPRING, Md., Dec. 18A son was born Nov. 20 to Dr. and Mrs. David John Fischer at the Washington Hospital Center.

title: 11 Fillies to Race in $28,375 New Hope Stakes at Liberty Bell Tomorrow
description: PHILADELPHIA, Dec. 25 An 11horse field with a number of familiar names will start in the $28,375 New Hope Stakes Monday in the first of two addedmoney events this week at Liberty Bell Race Track.

title: Courts:
description: New Yorkers have long since learned that Police Commissioner Patrick V. Murphy has the exquisite sense of timing of a successful actor or politician. He demonstrated that knack once again last week. On the final day of the Knapp Commission hearings into police corruption, Mr. Murphy went before a meeting of the Association of the Bar of New York and delivered a speech that grabbed headlines, took a bit of the heat off his troops and stirred up a controversy that was still resounding at week's end.

title: New nose job
description: It is an old theater adage that plays are not written but rather rewritten. It is also a nice truism that plays are not translated so much as adapted. Even the most literal transliteration into another tongue still betrays the genius of the new language touched by the temperament of the adapter. While the original may never date, translations have a way of tarnishing quickly. Each new generation deserves a new interpretation of a work. This is especially true in the theater, where the foreign repertory cries out periodically to be newly and appropriately translated.

title: Miss Kimless Fiancee
description: WOODMERE, L. I., Dec. 25 Mr. and Mrs. Clifford H. Kimless have announced the engagement of their daughter, Miss Karen Sue Kimless, who is with Interior Design magazine, a division of Whitney Communications, to Jeffrey S. Feldman, an assistant district attorney in the Kings County office. He is the son of Mr. and Mrs. Dan Feldman of East Rockaway. A March wedding is planned.

title: Football Rivals Break Bread
description: PALO ALTO, Calif., Dec. 25 (UPI)  Members of the East and West Shrine teams sat down together for a traditional Christmas dinner today after morning workouts. The teams, preparing for their battle next Friday at Candlestick Park, drilled in rainy weather, but coaches of both units said they were pleased despite the muddy going.

title: Writer Says U. S. Intimated Reduction of Forces in Taiwan
description: WASHINGTON, Dec, 25The United States has intimated to mainland China that it will further reduce its forces on Taiwan by the time President Nixon arrives in Peking, a Harvard specialist says in an article on his recent visit to the mainland.

title: Penguins Win, 4 to 2
description: PITTSBURGH, Dec. 25 (UPI) Greg Polis scored on a 25foot slap shot midway through the third period to secure a 42 victory by the Pittsburgh Penguins over the Montreal Canadiens and snap the Penguins eightgame victoryless streak tonight.

title: America's Mute Conscience
description: The outrages perpetrated in South Asia should be seen in the perspective of other horrors of this century and the failure of a succession of American Presidents even to raise an official voice in protest. As the eighteenth century was one of enlightenment and the nineteenth one of industrial formai tion, the twentieth may all too appropriately be characterized as the century of massacre.

title: Women Managers and Marriage
description: If the presidents of two billion dollar corporations were to marry each other, what would their family life style be? Obviously, different from the traditional workobsessed husband and homebound wife relationship.

title: Tensions Easing Between Ugandans And Tanzanians
description: KAMPALA, Uganda, Dec. 25 (Reuters)Refugees from villages along the UgandaTanzania border are returning home and life is slowly coming back to normal along the frontier after several months of sporadic clashes.

title: President Names 5 to Board Of Three Military Academies
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 25 (AP)  President Nixon announced this week five appointments to vacancies on the Board of Visitors to the armed services academies.

title: cQueen  The Man Who Got Away
description: FRANKLIN J. SCHAFF. NER, director of Patton and the current Nicholas and Alexandra, will focus on still another character from real life in his next film. Beginning in June, he will get busy in the Bahamas and Guatemala, putting Papillon, Henri Charriere's stranger than fiction account of his own escapes from French penal colonies, before the cameras. William Goldman has written the screenplay, and Steve McQueen will star.

title: State U. Weighs Fiscal Options To Meet Any Spending Freeze
description: ALBANY, Dec. 25 (AP)Trustees of the State University system are considering dozens of options to comply with any state spending freeze, including increased tuition, closing a campus and leaving, new buildings unoccupied, a university spokesman said this week.

title: Doris M. Jami To Wed in June
description: Mr. and Mrs. Kurt Jaml of New York have announced the engagement of their daughter, Miss Doris Muriel Jami, to Richard Anthony Licht, son of Mr. and Mrs. Licht of Providence, R. I. A June wedding is planned.

title: Vast U.S. Raids Foreseen
description: SAIGON, Sunday, Dec. 26 (AP)The United States is planning vast new air strikes against previously untouched military targets in North Vietnam, Representative Gillespie V. Montgomery, Democrat of Mississippi, said today.

title: TAXI AGREEMENT STILL NOT SIGNED
description: The 15day, 1970, taxi strike ended a year ago last week when Harry Van Arsdale Jr., president of the taxi drivers union, told 4,500 cheering union members that an agreement had been reached with the taxi fleet owners.

title: Manton Prepares To Battle Delaney
description: A few days after Thomas J. Manton celebrated his 12th birthday in 1944, James J. Delaney was elected to the House of Representatives.

title: Art
description: CIIRISTMAS art exhibltions are really sort of a pain. Whether they go in for the religious motif (The Nativity Through the Ages) or secular jollity (Celebrating Christmas in Many Lands), their rehash seldom works out. They carry all the emotional impact of that box of last year's Christmas cards that you saved for the addresses. Something about them reduces to banality works of art that during the rest of the year may move you, hold you, and enlighten you. Even a masterpiece you have always loved takes on temporarily the air of a prop in a Sunday School pageant. It shouldn't be this way, but the commercial stripmining of Christmas has gone on for so long that aspects of the season unconnected with it suffer by association.

title: Wife Presents Tradeau With Son for Christmas
description: OTTAWA, Dec. 25 (UPI)Mrs. Pierre Elliott Trudeau gave birth to a 6pound, 9ounce boy tonight, the Prime Minister's office announced.

title: Letters
description: To THE EDITOR:

title: A Playboy Hotel Goes to Mountain Seeking Profits
description: McAFEE, N. J.The world of Playboy insinuated itself into this quiet corner of northwestern New Jersey this month with the opening of a 700room resort club and hotel opposite the Great Gorge ski resort.

title: Much U.S. Mail to P.O.W.'s Ends Up in a Paris Cellar
description: PARIS, Dec. 25 (AP)Just over a year agO, 10yearold Mary Hendrix painted a pinkandgreen Christmas card sprinkled with snowflakes and mailed it to An American prisoner in North Vietnam.

title: Interior Auto Safety Rules Asked for Common Market
description: BRUSSELS, Dec. 25 (AP)Proposed safety rules for the interiors of automobiles have been announced by Common Market authorities.

title: How to Reach The Pinnacle of Your Golf Game
description: AFTER years of goofing my way around golf courses, I have finally reached the top. What I mean is that I have played golf on a mountainMontAgel, in France, on course perched high above the principality of Monaco. From the seventh tee, you turned around and slammed the ball the wrong way (down off the mountain, that is) you might just possibly break a window in Princess Grace's boudoir, which would be a drive of approximate ly one mile.

title: 2 Africans Stoned to beath
description: TZANEEN, South Africa; Dec. 25 (Reuters)Two men were stoned to death after a witch doctor named them as having been responsible for lightning that killed two people, the police said. The men were killed at,Maalca,. near here, and 94 Africans were arrested in connection with the incident this week, the police added,

title: A. Faxon Henderson Jr. Fiance Of Miss Nancy Glenn Morris
description: VILLANOVA, Pa., Dec. 25 The engagement of Miss Nancy Glenn Morris to A. Faxon Henderson Jr. of Washington has been announced by Mr. and Mrs. I. Wistar Morris Jr., father and stepmother of the future bride. Her fianc is the son of Dr. and Mrs. Alfred F. Henderson of Palm Beach, Fla.

title: CHRISTMAS TRUCE ENDS IN VIETNAM
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, Sunday, Dee. 26 (UP)Alfed troops went back to war yesterday after a 24hour Christmas truce, No American combat deaths were reported during the holiday ceasefire that ended at sundown.

title: Unchaste, Unchased
description: Is chastity a requisite to maintenance of the landlordtenant relationship"? That was how a Manhattan Civil Court judge last week summed up the nub of the case before him; a landlord seeking to evict an unmarried woman tenant who had from time to time... engaged in sexual intercourse with a certain gentleman.

title: Leafs Beat Wings, 53
description: TORONTO, Dec. 25 (UPI)Billy MacMillan achieved a threegoal game for the first time in his N.H.L. career tonight to pace the Toronto Maple Leafs to a 53 victory over the Detroit Red Wings.

title: A Boom in Tourism Transforms Guam
description: AGANA, Guam, Dec. 17Political uncertainties in the Far East, coupled with a spectacular growth in tourism and related business here, have abruptly transformed this sunny Western Pacific island from a somnolent United States military outpost into a bustling, cosmopolitan center for Asian and American investment capital.

title: Success story, with Freudian overtones
description: America has been remarkably generous to Freud. Both as the author of an elaborate intellectual system and as the founder of a lucrative psychiatric business, he has achieved more spectacular success in the United States than anywhere else in the world. Among Europeans perhaps only the English have rivaled the Americans in their enthusiasm for psychoanalysis, while Freud's native Austria, ironically, has turned into a psychoanalytic wasteland.

title: PHILLIPS TO RETURN TO TEXAS U. LINEUP
description: MESQUITE, Tex., Dec. 25 (AP)Eddie Phillips, who is back in good health, is listed as the probable quarterback for the University of Texas in the Cotton Bowl against Penn State on New Year's Day.

title: U.S. AIDE DEFENDS NOMINEE INQUIRY
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 25 (Reuters)  The Justice Department has denied an allegation by the president of Harvard that one of the university's faculty members was intimidated by an agent of the Federal Bureau of Investigation after he had criticized potential Supreme Court candidate.

title: Preventive Medicine
description: Five American industries got their first taste last week of new air pollution standards that will eventually be extended to 35 or 40 industriesand they were less than happy with the sample. Some complained that they could be met only through heavy capital and maintenance expenditures.

title: About Motor Sports
description: When Mark Donohue said that 1971 was not the kind or year we wanted to have, he said so because he is a perfectionist. or perhaps because he is being modest. Whatever his own appraisal, Donohue's performance was good enough to win the Jerry Titus Memorial Trophy as the leader of the 10 race drivers selected for the 1971 all America auto racing team. Donohue, who is 34 years old, earned 152 of 169 votes to top the annual poll of the American Auto Racing Writers and Broadcasters Association.

title: A Dog's Life in City Is Tougher in Coops
description: The gradual emergence of cooperatives in the city is having at least one littlementioned side effecton dogs and dog ownership.

title: Monsignor Farrell Eleven To Get Holy Cross Trophy
description: The Holy Cross College Club of New York has picked Monsignor Farrell High School of Staten Island as the winner of the Crusader Trophy. This trophy is awarded annually to the outstanding Catholic high school football team In the metropolitan area.

title: The atheist who lost his faith
description: More than almost any other public figure, C. P. Snow has concerned himself with the relationship between science and the rest of our culture. The present volume brings together his main writings on the problem, in a collection that, though stimulating, is ultimately unsatisfying. As always, Snow combines fairmindedness, rationality and lucidityqualities not often found together in writing on either science or public affairsyet the elegant surface of his prose conceals what seems to me a superficial analysis of the problems he seeks to elucidate.

title: ALLENDE IS LOSER IN CROWD COUNTS
description: SANTIAGO, Chile Dec, 22The antiMarxist opposition has clearly won the battle of the crowds against Chile's leftwing Government.

title: Of Time and the Rivers
description: The dispute now blowing up between the Administration and Congressional environmentalists over the Federal Water Pollution Control Act Amendments of 1971 seems rooted more in rhetoric than in reality. Stripped of some grossly exaggerated charges about the cost enforcement, the difference boils down to an academic wrangle over whether or not the proposals will make the country's waterways unnecessarily pure fourteen years from now, to the possible detriment of the national economy. The minuscule progress made so far gives such objections a rather dreamlike quality.

title: Television
description: OLD AUNT Ada Doom, tyrant of the Starkadder clan of Cold Comfort Farm in Howling, Sussex, is crazy like a fox. She has been off her rocker ever since as a child she saw something nusiy in the woodshed!

title: DEFEAT BY PENN SPARKS HARVARD
description: The turning point that ultimately propelled Harvard's soccer team to national prominence and a berth in the National Collegiate Athletic Association final in Miami on Tuesday was a defeat by Pennsylvania that resulted in the loss of the Ivy League title.

title: Catholic Schools:
description: The body count tells the story of the monthlong lay teachers strike against New York City's Roman Catholic schools that ended quietly last week. The union simply could not muster sufficient strength to make a great impact.

title: Play About Bay of Pigs To Run Here
description: The actual testimony of nine Cuban witnesses to the Bay of Pigs invasion is the basis for The Interrogation of Havana, a new play by Hans Magnus Enzensberger that starts a limited run tomorrow night at the Chelsea Theater Center, the resident company at the Brooklyn Academy of Music.

title: Movie Mailbag
description: TO THE EDITOR:

title: KICK BEATS CHIEFS
description: KANSAS CITY, Dec. 25Garo Yepremian, a baldishi leftfooted Cypriot who makes neckties in the offseason, kicked a 37yard field goal in the second quarter of suddendeath overtime today, giving the Miami Dolphins a 2724 victory over the Kansas City Chiefs in the longest pro football game ever played.

title: Bond Is Back  and Diamonds Got Him
description: IAN FLEMING was one of John F. Kennedy's favorite authors, and, when you think about it, the JFK years were often a lot like Ian Fleming's novels, with sexy personalities, amazing technologies and an atmosphere of constant, cosmic peril. Remember the Missile Gap, the Bay of Pigs, the Cuban Missile Crisis, the Green Berets, crash funding for NASA, Red aggression in Vietnam? It was great theater, involving vast expenditures of money and adrenalin, and a national audience teetered between exhilaration and panic. It was also about that time that two bright men named Harry Saltzman and Albert R. Broccoli cashed in on this audience's hunger for more of the same by commencing to produce James Bond movies.

title: The Jesus Movement Spreading on Campus
description: PALO ALTO, Calif., Dec. 25 A new interest in religion, which in some ways resembles the rise of radicalism in the late nineteensixties, is taking root on many of the nation's recently becalmed college campuses.

title: Mary Engle Fiancee Of Thomas J. Flynn
description: Mr. and Mrs. Francis Engle of Bayside, Queens, have announced the engagement of their daughter, Miss Mary Elnora Engle, to Thomas J. Flynn. He is the son of Mrs. Martin F. Flynn of Jamaica, Queens, and the late Mr. Flynn.

title: 4 9ers Colts Are Favorites in National Football League Playoff Games Today
description: SAN FRANCISCO, Dec. 25 (AP)  The Washington Redskins, strangers to National ball League postseason competition since 1945, are underdogs against the San Francisco 49ers in tomorrow's playoff opener.

title: He told howthe why would come out in the telling; The War for the Union; Vol. 111, The Organized War, 18631864. Vol. IV, The Organized War to Victory, 18641865.; (Vols. VII and VIII of Ordeal of the Union.) By Allan Nevins.; Illustrated. 532 and 448 pp. New York: Charles Scribner's Sons. $15 each.
description: Not long before he died last March at the age of 80, Allan Nevins finished the major work of his long life, his history of the American Civil War. The first of the eight big volumes of Ordeal of the Union appeared in 1947, and now 24 years later the last two, a thousand more pages, are published posthumously. They bring to an end a remarkable enterprise, the last of many remarkable enterprises, and an even more remarkable career.

title: OPTICAL SAFETY
description: TO THE EDITOR:

title: BumpingOr, Why You Won't Be on Flight 602 to Jamaica
description: SENATOR George McGovern was winging into La Guardia Airport in a private plane one night last fall trying to catch the 10 P.M. shuttle to Washington. The pilot radioed ahead, asking Eastern Airlines to hold the plane and reserve two seats for the Senator and an aide. Eastern agreed.

title: Article 1  No Title
description: BELGRADE, Yugoslavia, Dec. 25 (Reuters)The Croatian cultural weekly Hrvatski Tjednik, denounced by President Tito for spreading nationalism, has been closed by the publishing house Mntica Hrvatska, it was announced in Zagreb today.

title: Trading Stamps: A Long History
description: Take care of the customers and they will take care of us.

title: Again, Rolling Thunder
description: Escalation of American bombing of North and South Vietnam, Cambodia and Laos in recent days flies in the face of Administration promises that the United States is withdrawing from a combat role. The Demilitarized Zone has become a phantom; American fighterbombers are ranging closer to Hanoi in operations that call up memories of the heavy air war of the past. The risks are formidablefor the engaged fliers and for the chances of peace.

title: Stamps
description: AN award winning Peace Corps poster by David Baltic of Yellow Springs, Ohio, was adapted by Bradbury Thompson of Riverside, Conn., for the design of an Sc commemorative stamp honoring the Peace Corps that will be issued on Feb. 11 at Washington.

title: Auto Risk Rates Down?
description: Consumers who have been complaining in recent years about the cost of buying auto insurance or the difficulty of getting  and keepingcoverage may soon find that rates will be turning downward. However, there is a big if.

title: HIGHLIGHTS OF THE WEEK
description: PRESIDENT NIXON increased the authorized level of oil Imports for 1972 into states east of the Rocky Mountains by 100,000 barrels a day.... John W. Mecom appears to have salvaged much of his oil and realestate empire; a reorganization plan developed with Signal Oil and Gas was presented to a Federal District Court.

title: Stamps
description: CHRISTMAS greetings through postage stamps have become standard fare for many countries, with colorful designs ranging from adaptations of old master's to more modern expressions of Peace on Earth and Goodwill to All Men by today's artists.

title: Miss Bachrach's Troth
description: Mrs. Sidney Bachrach of Brooklyn has announced the engagement of her daughter, Miss Sharon Joyce Bachrach, to Ralph Irwin Solomon, son of Mr. and Mrs. Joseph Solomon of Oceanside, L. I. The future bride is the daughter also of the late Mr. Bachrach. She and her fianc are graduates of the State University at Stony Brook, L. I.

title: Photography
description: ACOMBINATION storage unit and carryall for photographic slides is now available from Sears Roebuck and Company in modular form. Made of fiberboard with a woodgrain vinyl finish, the basic unit consists of two drawerlike trays (they do not slide out like drawers, but they stack one above the other like drawers) with hinged fronts that fold clown as shown tO expose the slide containers on the inside. The two trays lock together on top of each other, and they have a removable lid with a carrying handle on top. The dropdown doors have blank, cards on the inside so that the slides in each tray can be catalogued and each tray will hold either round or oblong slide holders containers.

title: Front Page 1  No Title
description: Mr. ?? New YORKER IS A GREAT AUTOMOBILE ANDY STEWARTADVT.

title: Miss Gleason Is Affianced
description: VALDOSTA, Ga., Dee. 25Mr. and Mrs. Neil.Arden Gleason have made known the engagement of their daughter, Miss Kathleen Helen Gleason, to Lieut. Douglas Hubbard Crosby, U.S.A.F., son of Mr. and Mrs. Gordon E. Crosby Jr. of New York. The wedding will take place on Wednesday at the Park Avenue United Methodist Church here.

title: Just add caviar
description: Pancakes are not just for breakfast. The Russians taught the French to make them as a very elegant first course with sour cream, caviar and melted butter as garnishes. These small disks of buckwheat batter are famous as the first course in one of the most celebrated dinners in literature, the blini au caviar meal in Brideshead Revisited, the novel by Evelyn Waugh. Palacsinta have no such lineage, but all over Central Europe  in Austria, Hungary and Czechoslovakia they hold pride, of place on dessert menus. Rolled around apricot jam, dolloped on top with sour cream and sprinkled with almonds, these thin pancakes are both light and rich.

title: Bulls Top Blazers, 10988
description: PORTLAND, Ore., Dec. 25 (AP)Bob Love scored 20 of his 26 points in the second half tonight to pace the Chicago Bulls to a 10988 triumph over the Portland Trail Blazers.

title: ROMAN BATH FOUND BY VATICAN EXPERTS
description: ROME, Dec. 25 (Reuters)Vatican archeologists have uncovered a large room and a Roman bath underneath the palace and baptistery of St. John Lateran.

title: MRS. JAMES A.ROE JR.
description: Mrs. Marie Oliver Roe, widow of State Supremo Court Justice James A. Roe Jr., died Friday at Sloan Kettering Institute for Cancer Research. She was 47 years old.

title: DiGregorio Is Latest in a Line of Starring Guards at Providence
description: Since 1057 a steady flow cf talented guards have brought Providence College 10 seasons of 20ormorP basketball victories and an equal number of postseason tournament berths.

title: TALKS WITH MUJIB BACKED IN PAKISTAN
description: RAWALPINDI, Pakistan, Dec. 25 (AP)  The new Pakistani administration appeared today to be creating a climate to make talks by President Zulfikar All Bhutto and Sheik Mujibur Rahman, the East Pakistani leader, acceptable to West Pakistanis.

title: Handler Will Conduct Dressage Clinic on Jan. 8
description: DARIEN, Conn., Dec. 25Michael Handler, son of Col, Hans Handler, director of the Spanish Riding School of Vienna, will conduct a dress. age clinic at the Ox Ridge Hunt Club on Jan. 8.

title: Fee, Fi, Fo, Fum  How About a Little Fun?
description: SO far as I am concerned, they can throw away the rest of Inner City and just let a lady named Linda Hopkins stand there all night, tapping one foot slightly, opening her composed mouth to let miraculous sounds come out of it, reaching out her arms to the balcony as though to complete its curve and make the whole world come full circle, shaking her head very slightly in deep private worry as she stalks to the portals, done with a song. She is magnificent. She is also a person, not a poster.

title: HOFFA DISCLAIMS ANY LABOR PLANS
description: ST, LOUIS, Dec. 25 (AP)James R. Hoffa said today that he had no plans to seek to lift (restrictions on his activity in labor unions imposed by President Nixon as a condition of his release from prison.

title: Dog Got Welfare Check
description: SAN BERNARDINO, calif., Dec. 25 (AP)Peggy McGinnts has pleaded guilty to a welfare fraud charge, saying she collected $740 in welfare payments in the first half of this year for her dog, Thomas. She told Superior Court Judge J. Steve Williams Tuesday that she had entered the dog as her son in the welfare application. Sentencing was set for Feb. 1.

title: State Offers Shrubs at Low Cost
description: Long Island homeowners who have resolved to landscape their property with shrubs in 1972 have a friend in the State Department of Environmental Conservation. Or so an announcement from Frederick J. Gerty Jr., the senior forester, suggests.

title: John Tunney, Kennedy's Friend In Muskie's Corner
description: WASHINGTON.

title: Water cress and trout lilies grow wild in New York City
description: This is a book full of good news. Even at this moment, when human existence itself too often seems threatened in New York City, Elizabeth Barlow reminds us that the red fox, the pheasant, the muskrat, the bald eagle live here in the wild; that water cress, trout lilies and jackinthepulpits sprout from our municipal earth. Even now, when Model Cities fills welfare hotels by tearing down housing in Brownsville, she tells us that all is not destructionnature in its own inexorable way is adding a mile of virgin beach every 23 years to Breezy Point or the western end of Rockaway peninsula.

title: Pop
description: HERE it is, the day after Christmas, and how many times do you suppose the music from Jesus Christ Superstar was played yesterday in the living rooms of America? Endlessly, no doubt, and what an appropriate companion it is for the televised football games that have become as much a part of the Yule season as turkey and cranberry sauce. The Superstar musicwith its rock that doesn't offend, its hip Jesus, and (especially important in a society that is fascinated by athletes salaries and recordsetting film budgets) its moneymaking track recordis as much in the American grain as Richard Nixon and the Washington Redskins. Like them, 'Jesus Christ Superstar, in all its manifestations, from Tom O'Horgan's Broadway monstrosity to the easy listening recordings of I Don't Know How To Love Him, represents success, success, success. And when it happens on that large a scale, it's enough to make even such old hands at the religion merchandising game as Billy Graham sit up and take notice.

title: MacArthur Advice On Hirohito's Role In Peace Revealed
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 25 (AP) All hope of introducing modern democratic methods in Japan would have disappeared had Emperor Hirohito been tried as a war criminal, Gen. Douglas MacArthur warned in a top secret message.

title: Japanese Study Begun
description: A group of economists specializing in United StatesJapanese economic relations has embarked on a comprehensive analysis of trade, monetary and equitycapital issues affecting the two countries under the auspices of the Japan Society, Inc.

title: On the trail
description: If you cherish snowy winter silence, try crosscountry skiing. You can lone it or make it a family affair; almost anyone, old or young, who's limber can do it. This Nordic skitouring frees you from skitow queues and crowded resorts. It's as close as the nearest open spaces. Your clothing should be light, loose and in layers you can strip off. Your equipment will be lighter in weight and cost than for downhill skiing. A knapsack of food, perhaps wineskin, and a gliding stride, somewhere between walking and running, will make a bitterly cold day warm.

title: Pakistanis Held in East May Start Home Today
description: DACCA, Pakistan, Dec. 25 (Reuters)  West Pakistani soldiers who surrendered to India at the end of the 12day war in East Pakistan will be repatriated in a largescale operation starting tomorrow or Monday, informed military sources said today.

title: The women and children have to be heroes
description: Ever since the Six Day War, Israel's critics, and its advocates, have usually expressed themselves in harsh, doctrinaire terms, Each group has been so busy making a casethat the society is open and flourishing, or that it's closed and repressivethat they've rarely portrayed Israel's people, or shown the subtle problems that confront them. So it has been almost impossible for an American to understand what has happened there in the past few years, let alone to form an intelligent opinion about the country.

title: FOREIGN AFFAIRS
description: PARISGeorges Pompidou appeals to the less flamboyant side of the French character, which stresses pragmatism over panache. In this respect he relates historically to such chiefs of state as Henry of Navarre and LouisPhilippe, renowned for common sense, to say nothing of many subsequent Presidents. One might call him an intellectual Rend Coty. Coty was the last President before the Gaullist regime.

title: New Library Branch
description: The Brooklyn Public Library will open a new branch in Sunset Park on Jan. 6. The branch, at 5108 Fourth Avenue, will replace a facility at 5114 Fourth Avenue that was damaged in a fire last year.

title: A New Salvage Method
description: Since the morning of July 26, 1956, when the Italian Line's Andrea Doria sank after a collision off Nantucket, her name has carried a promise of salvage and a litre of riches.

title: Phrasemaker Agnew provided the title
description: Reading syndicated columnist Pete Hamill's collection of columns and magazine pieces of the last 10 years is like taking part in an allnight, nonstop barroom argument with a garrulous, selfrevealing friend: excessive, bristling with life, frequently outrageous, but always committed to his argument and always ready for another round. Hamill emerges from these pages as a passionate, convincing man. At once a hamische Irishman rooting out the ponderous and the blarney, a Brooklyn boy on the spoor of metaphor, a boxer manique and a macho idealist.

title: P.S. 233 Serves Women Inmates on Rikers Island
description: One day recently at Public School 233, after watching a skit on a television monitor, 15 students were discussing how the mother in the skit should have reacted when her two daughters came home and told her they had been caught stealing bubble gum from a candy store.

title: Travel Notes: Devaluation Will Cost You About $3 More a Day Abroad
description: AKNOWLEDGEABLE travel industry spokesman estimates that the average American vacationing abroad will have to spend about $60 more on his trip as a result of the devaluation of the dollar and revaluation of other currencies.

title: WERNER TITEL
description: BERLIN, Dec. 25 (Reuters)Werner Titel, one of East Germany's 10 deputy Prime Ministers, died of a heart attack today, East German television reported. He was 40 years old.

title: Architecture
description: AS predicted, the fight is on for bits and pieces of Chicago's Old Stock Exchange. Now that Adler and Sullivan's nonlandmark landmark (it was never designated by the city in spite of the repeated official urging of its Landmarks Commission) is in the process of coming down, fragments of the building that wasn't worth keeping are going to the highest bidder.

title: New Hope for Ulster
description: Britain is still acting too deliberately in the Northern Ireland tragedy; but at least it has now adopted Harold Wilson's proposal for new interparty talks next month with a wide open agenda. This means that Mr. Wilson's plan for possible unification of Ireland over fifteen years can be discussedif only the necessary parties will come to London to discuss them.

title: SAFETY HOT LINE GOES UNANSWERED
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 25An emergency hot line telephone answering and recording device to take mine safety complaints has been left untended and untranscribed for nearly two months, Government mine safety officials acknowledged today.

title: MALAYSIAN CABINET ADDS 4 MINISTRIES
description: KUALA LUMPUR, Malaysia, Dec. 25 (UPI)Prime Minister Abdul Razak added four ministries to his Cabinet this week, including one for national unity to handle racial problems between the Malay majority and the Chinese minority in Malaysia.

title: Peking Cites Good Harvest Despite Natural Disasters
description: HONG KONG, Dec. 25 (Reuters)China overcame serious natural disasters this year to reap a good harvest for the 10th successive year, according to Hsinhua, the Chinese press agency.

title: French Penal System Is Under Increasing Attack
description: PARIS, Dec. 25The French penal system is under increasingly sharp criticism for what a prison psychiatrist has called the idiotic and arbitrary discipline it tries to impose.

title: Kerr Off Broadway
description: ODD that the American Place Theater should celebrate the birth of its spanking new playhouse  down an escalator at 111 West 46th Street to a spacious gallerylike lobby and a handsome paneled interior  with two new plays about the ravages of age. Wherever we go we seem to carry the sad sands of time with us these days.

title: Arab Emirates Union Among Richest. U.N. Members
description: UNITED NATIONS, N. y., Dec, 25At a recent diplomatic dinner party a guest jestingly, suggested that one small countrythe Union of Arab Emirates could alone shoulder with ease the United Nations crushing financial burden.

title: East Hampton From the Catbird Seat
description: In my neck of the woods, at the eastern end of Long Island, there dwells and thrives a tough old cat with no fixed abode and no visible means of support, who has been christened by an aelurophiliac neighbor of mine, Wild Gray Kitty. Sometimes we call him Wild Gray for short and sometimes, W.G.K. It is not quite true that he has no visible means of support because he feeds like a trencherman at Neighbor H's house, and when she is away (in the wintertime she grandly goes to Africa to look at the big cats through a spyglass, or she goes to the Isles of Greece to work among the poorthe poor cats that is) he comes to my house. God knows how many other freeloading stations this smart old greedyguts hobo has.

title: North Carolina Five Beats Madrid, 83.77 in Final
description: MADRID, Dec. 25 (AP)The fifth ranked University of North Carolina Tar Heels basketball team beat Real Madrid of Spain, 8377, today to win the International Christmas tournament.

title: Art
description: THE four paintings and especially the one huge sculpture by Nancy Graves now on view at the Museum of Modern Art  thanks to the Modern's laudable Projects series of small exhibitions of new work by young artistscomprise an odd show. But then, Graves has for the past few seasons been one of the most seemingly eccentric artists active in the often pretty bizarre milieu of contemporary sculpture. She is also one of the most problematic artists of any stripe to have lately achieved prominence in the art world  which, again, is saying something.

title: Bailey Likely to Be Target If Alabama Throws a Lot Against Nebraska
description: MIAMI, Dec. 25  David Bailey, who caught more passes for Alabama last year than the Tide completed this season, may become the key figure in next Saturday night's national collegiate title game with topranked Nebraska in the Orange Bowl.

title: WAVES Center to Move
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 25 (AP) The Navy has announced plans to transfer its WAVES training facilitioes from Bainbridge, Md., to the Naval Training Center at. Orlando, Fla. The Navy said the move would affect 62 military personnel assigned to the Navy Recruit Training Command at Bainbridge and about 500 women recruits. The change is expected to be completed by July 3.

title: Karen McDonough Plans Nuptials
description: NEWBURGH, N. Y., Dec. 25 Mr. and Mrs. William W. McDonough have made known the engagement of their daughter, Miss Karen Louise McDonough, to Second Lieut. Jeffrey Robert Sturges, U.S.A., son of Mr. and Mrs. Robert E. Sturges of Oberlin, Ohio, and Twichell Lake, N. Y. A June wedding is planned.

title: Venezuela Pardons 200
description: CARACAS, Venezuela, Dec. 25 (Reuters)President Rafael Caldera pardoned 200 prisoners this week, including some political leaders and army officers. Among those released was Gen. Pablo Antonio Flores, arrested seven months ago on the charge of rebellion in the armed forces. Others freed were a former guerrilla leader, Freddy Carques, and the editor in chief of the leftist weekly, Revention, Carlos Farias Ramirez.

title: Wood, Field and Stream: On Blinds
description: From time to time, through most of my adult life, I have endeavored to fashion a worthwhile portable waterfowling blind.

title: Black Legislators Group Balks at Service Cuts
description: The state's 12 black legislators announced yesterday that they will oppose any budget cuts in essential services and that they would offer their own fiscal program as an alternative to Governor Rockefeller's program.

title: China Plans Loan to Sudan; Will Write Off Trade Deficit
description: KHARTOUM, the Sudan, Dec. 25 (Agence FrancePresse)China has agreed to lend the Sudan 14million (about $36.5million) and to write off a trade deficit of 6million, it was announced here this week.

title: Madagascar Sets Election
description: TANANARIVE, Madagascar, Dec. 25 (Agence FrancePresse)  Madagascar's presidential election will be held on Jan. 30, it was announced here this week

title: Helping Them Write Songs
description: CHICAGO.

title: RHODESIA WEIGHING IDENTITYCARD PLAN
description: SALISBURY, Rhodesia, Dec. 25, (Agencd FrancePresse) The Rhodesian Government is examining a plan to issue identity cards to adults living and working outside their designated racial areas in order to control the flow of blacks into towns and cities.

title: T. C. CAMERON JR., DIPLOMAT, 57, DIES
description: MONTGOMERY, Ala., Dec. 25 (AP)Turner C. Cameron Jr., whose career as a State Department diplomat spanned almost 30 years, died yesterday in a Montgomery hospital. He was 57 years old.

title: New York
description: The Knapp Commission inquiry into police corruption ended last week in an atmosphere filled with explosive political overtones.

title: Sports of The Times
description: Among the more enduring memories of a football season that is now highballing toward its grand climax Is the image of Otis Taylor flitting across the television screen and making catches that leave millions of;armchair quarterbacks marveling at his wizardry. The wide receiver for the Kansas City Chiefs has a flair for the dramatic and the happy knack of producing the big play at the right time. The longer an observer follows football, though, the more con vinced he becomes that there is really nothinging the big play at the right time. The longer an observer follows football, though, the more con vinced he becomes that there is really nothing new in the game. Sometimes the old stuff is giVen new wrinkles. Sometimes the old stuff is reintroduced so completely unwrinkled that it seems new. But where does the sensational Otis fit into that scheme of things? Is he a distinctive product of this modern age?

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: Letter to the Editor 3  No Title
description: To THE EDITOR:

title: Midnight Mass in City Still Attracts Crowds
description: It was late Christmas Eve and in a half hour midnight mass would begin at St. Jean Baptiste Roman Catholic Church, Lexington Avenue and. 76th Street. The Rev. Adrian Hebert, the pastor, was sitting in the empty rectory nervously drumming Hs fingers on a dining table.We just don't have the attendance we used to, he said with a sigh. This neighborhood has changed so. Many of our parishioners are older people, and there are the families we used to have from Westchester, the Bronx, Queens. Now they're all afraid to go out at night.

title: White and Rostello Compete Today for Role in Congressional Cup Sailing
description: With the snapping of Tom Pickard's reign as the Congressional Cup matchracing champion last weekend, two other California sailors are engaging in a final sailoff today to determine the representative of the host, Long Beach Yacht Club.

title: George Andrews of Alabama, 28 Years in the House, Is Dead
description: BIRMINGHAM, Ala., Dec. 25 (AP)  Representative George W. Andrews, Democrat of Alabama, a 28year member of Congress, died todayat University Hospital here where he recently underwent heart surgery. He was 65 years old and lived in Union Springs.

title: Bullets Beat 76ers, 117.114
description: PHILADELPHIA, Dec. 25 (UPI)Archie Clark sank a jump shot with I8 seconds remaining to give the Baltimore Bullets a 117.114 victory over the Philadelphia 76crs last night.

title: Hecker's Ouster Only the Start?
description: While those concerned with other teams can think about pursuing championships or highround draft choices, those involved with the New York Giants can think only of 1972and last week's coaching change provided plenty of food for thought.

title: WOMAN IN BUSINESS
description: The question is heard no more in the board rooms of Detroit and Pittsburgh, but in the nineteenfifties more than one auto or steel company chieftain was asking, What could a woman possibly tell me about my business?

title: WASHINGTON REPORT
description: WASHINGTONCe n'est que le provisoire qui dure (It is only the provisional that lasts)French aphorism long applied to matters international, whether political or economic.

title: AROUND THE
description: Here are just a few pointers on taking care of gift plants. Poinsettia, probably the most popular Christmas gift plant of all time, should be kept in a draftfree place. If the plant is near an entry door that opens and closes frequently, move it to a more sheltered site. Keep the soil fairly moist as poinsettias are thirsty plants, but allow the soil to dry out slightly between waterings. Bright light, not sun, will help the blossoms to last longer. Mist the leaves with room temperature water every few days to keep moisture high.

title: A Former Honor Student Facing Charges of Hijacking in Chicago
description: CHICAGO, Dec. 25 (UPI) Everett Leary Holt, a onetime high school honor student in Indiana, sat in a Chicago jail cell today while the authorities prepared to bring him to court on a charge of attempting a $300,000 ransom hijacking of a Northwest Airlines passenger plane yesterday.

title: Migrant Workers to Get Aid
description: CHICOPEE, Mass., Dec. 25 (AP)The New England Farm Workers Council says it has received a $250,000 grant to aid migrant workers in Massachusetts and Connecticut from the Office of Economic Opportunity. The council says it will hire 13 staff members to pro. vide education, transportation, employment counseling, legal aid and housing to migrant workers employed by tobacco farms in the Connecticut Valley each summer.

title: Two Groups Back Plan to Cut Elitism In Foreign Service
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 25H Two private organizationsthe American Foreign Service As! sociation, and the Carnegie Endowment for International Peacehave joined in a program to help relieve the insularity and elitism that both believe afflicts America's diplomatic corps.

title: WORLD OF SEVENTH AVE.
description: Seventh Avenue has had a good coat season this year but it is already in the throes of figuring what It is going to do next year. Now the fabric houses are burning the midnight oil to determine patterns, textures, colors and weaves to offer for the fall of 1972.

title: Mad River Glen's Skiing Secret Is All in the Family
description: FAYSTON, Vt., Dec. 25Considering that Mad River Glen was designed in postWorld War II days to cater to sophisticated skiersand still doesSanta Claus has become surprisingly important at this central Vermont playground.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: Music
description: David Randolph, left, conducts the Masterwork Orchestra and the Chorus, right, in its final performance of Handel's Messiah Tuesday at Philharmonic Hall. Other groups offering Christmas music this week include the American Symphony, with Leopold Stokowski conducting, Wednesday at St. Patrick's Cathedral, and the New York Chamber Soloists, with Charles Bressler, tenor, Thursday at the Metropolitan Museum.

title: Anne C. O'Neil and Daniel Look, Students in Ohio, Are Engaged
description: EASTON, Conn., Dec. 25The engagement of Miss Anne Carol O'Neil to Daniel Cleveland Look has been announced by Dr. and Mrs. Thomas Joseph O'Neil, parents of the future bride. Her fianc is the son of Mr. and Mrs. Allen M. Look of West Tisbury, Mass., and a grandson of the late Dr. Hugh Auchincloss, the New York surgeon.

title: Letters
description: TO THE EDITOR:

title: ExPolitical Leaders Urge Greece to Free 2 From Jail
description: ATHENS, Dec. 25 (UPI)Nine former political figures, recently freed from jail or exile, have asked for the release of two political leaders still imprisoned by the militarybacked Greek Government. They said the Government had no intention to restore democracy in Greece.

title: Miss Hachey Is Affianced
description: Miss Kathleen M. Hachey plans to be married to Walter Anthony Brickman. Their engagement has been announced by Mr. and Mrs. William L. Hachey of Newcastle, New Brunswick, where Mr. Hachey is the operator of Newcastle's Pines Lodge.

title: Maine Files Suit to Retrieve Three Historic Stones
description: BATH, Me., Dec. 25Maine has filed a civil complaint in Sagadahoc County Court against a Massachusetts man in a move to retrieve three historic stones found on a beach near here.

title: Breaking in and out of self
description: Hugh Seidman and Paul Zweig, in their first books, provide a study in poetic opposites, one writing to break into self (thus pushing away emptiness by filling it with poetry), the other aware of the need to break out of self (already crowded with the corrosive evidence of personal disaster).

title: COURT IS PRAISED BY JEWISH GROUP
description: The American Jewish Congress has hailed as a major victory for religious freedom and churchstate separation the unanimous decision of the New Jersey Supreme Court that state funds could not be lent for the construction of any facility used for religious instruction or worship.

title: Smythe Reported Improved
description: INDIANAPOLIS, Dec. 25 (AP) William J. Smythe, the executive director of the United States Auto Club, was reported considerably improved today at Methodist Hospital after suffering a [Mart attack last Sunday.

title: So Big
description: The American Telephone and Telegraph Company is the world's largest private corporation. Just how big it is was indicated in Washington last week when the Federal Communications Commission announced that was dropping an investigation of the rates charged by the company for interstate longdistance calls. The reason offered: The commission does not have adequate staff or resources for the task.

title: Attica Epilogue
description: On New Year's Eve, 1951, Walter (Tiny) Swift and a companion staged a holdup in Central Park. In the process, they battered a youth to death with a baseball bat; their profit: $1. Arrested a year later, Swift was brought to trial, where he admitted his guilt and begged to be sent to the electric chair. Instead, he was sentenced to life in prison and in 1953 entered Sing Sing. Three years later, he was moved to Attica.

title: Christmas Is Quiet Day For 1,292 in The Tombs
description: Forty Cents and Bulletproof watched television and lounged around the cellblock; Amando X. Johnson, on drums, joined Cisco Perez, on bass, and Willie Metcalf at the piano for some jazz before and after mass, and John McGruder stayed in his cell studying a heavy tome of law.

title: Art Notes
description: MAY Hoving and Paley get gold union cards; may each artist give art to a stranger

title: Announcements 5000
description: COHENJay and Helen (nee Goldin) Joyfully announce the birth of Larry's brother, Andrew Garret, Dec. 17, 1971, at Mount Sinai Hospital, New York City.

title: Criminals At Large
description: Two things are soon apparent about R.J. White's A SECONDHAND TOMB (Harper & Row, $5.95): it keeps the reader wondering what, exactly, is going on; and it has a peculiar kind of charm. English characters are all over the place, but they are neither clich types nor exaggerated. The writing comes from the grand line of the literate British novel, including offhand allusions to Mozart, Eliot, Keats, Dickens, Horace and what not. None of this seems dragged in as a show of erudition. Here, it is the normal complement of intelligent speech.

title: P.B.A. Suing to Recover Fines in January Protest
description: The Patrolmen's Benevolent Association and its individual members challenged in State Supreme Court yesterday the constitutionality of that section of the state Civil Service Law under which policemen were fined for taking part in what the city called a strike last January.

title: In Contempt of the Constitution
description: Since World War II, the United States has had the privilege of refueling its military planes at an air base in the Portuguese Azores. This arrangement included port facilities for the U.S. Navy. A socalled executive agreement was entered into between this Government and Portugal and regularly renewed until 1962, when the Portuguese allowed it to lapse because of their resentment against the Kennedy Administration's anticolonial policy in Africa. Use of the facilities continued, however, without a formal agreement. About 1,500 American servicemen have been stationed in the Azores for many years.

title: A MARCH AND A FAST MARK DAY IN ULSTER
description: BELFAST, Northern Ireland, Dec, 25 (Reuters)Nearly 1,000 people marched through Belfast today to protest the government's policy of internment without trial.

title: It's Time for a Change Of Political Slogans
description: IN 943 A.D., a horde of Scottish Highlanders massed on a hilltop in what is now a peaceful English countryside, poised to attack an opposing army.

title: Thant Sends U.N. Aide To Help on Subcontinent
description: UNITED NATIONS, Dec. 25 (Reuters)Secretary General Thant has named a. toplevel United Nations official as his special representative in India and Pakistan and instructed him to go immediately to the subcontinent to deal with urgent humanitarian problems.

title: THE WEEK IN FINANCE
description: THE nations of the Western world received an early Christmas gift last week when representatives of the leading industrial countries wrapped up a new currency realignment package with remarkable speed and then proceeded to consider more deliberately the other elements of the programtrade adjustments and defense burdensharingthat need solutions to restore economic stability in the International area.

title: World
description: UNITED NATIONS  Are you going to be an activist Secretary General? Kurt Waldheim was asked at a news conference last week after his nomination to that post by the Security Council.

title: Ann Back Betrothed
description: DARIEN, Conn., Dec. 25The Rev. Dr. Robert Nelson Back, rector of St. Luke's Episcopal Church here, and Mrs. Back have announced the engagement of their daughter, Miss Ann Louise Back, to Mark Monroe Beckwith, son of Mr. and Mrs. Andrew Madds Beckwith. Miss Back attends Smith College, and her fianc is a junior at Amherst College. His father is with the Lindenmeyr Paper Company in Long Island City, Queens.

title: Tables Turned
description: In his 13 years as a Democratic State Senator from Queens, Seymour R. Thaler won a reputation for his persistent, sometimes abrasive official investigations, A tireless, muchpublicized inspection of New York City hospitals in 1966, for example, found him engaged in a fingerjabbing grilling of doctors. Such performances helped win him election last month as a State Supreme Court justice, scheduled to take office Jan. 1.

title: Full Entry, 3,046, Set for Westminster
description: The limit of 3,000 entries was received on Fridday for the 96th Westminster Kennel Club show to be held at MadiSon Square Garden Feb. 14 and 15. This is two weeks before the official closing date. Since all entries that arrived in the mail with No. 3,000 were accepted, the figure reached 3,046.

title: Television
description: TELEVISION's one sturdy tradition in this country has been to provide an irresistible object for disparagement. This disparagement, professional and general, ranges from the genially apathetic to the viciously personal.

title: L.I. Passengers Suffer As Crews Call in Sick
description: Passengers trying to catch a train home last night might have had trouble if they were riding the Long Island Rail Road, which was forced to cancel 12 trains when the crews didn't show up for work.

title: Drama Mnilbag
description: To THE EDITOR:

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: PROGRAM TO TRAIN LEADERS FALTERS
description: Four years ago New York University began an experimental program designed to train students as urban leaders people who could become not only political leaders, but also hospital administrators, planners, civic activists. Such a program, It was hoped, might replace the regular undergraduate liberal arts curriculum.

title: WARRIORS LOSE
description: While the noisiest appreciation was reserved for Earl Monroe, whose contributions to the result were marginal, another capacity crowd at Madison Square Garden last night took New York Knick excellence for granted in a 11489 rout of the Golden State Warriors.

title: ISRAELI STUDENTS AN ORDERLY BREED
description: TEL AVIVThe wave of student unrest that swept the world has bypassed Israel.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the.Editor:

title: Nation
description: WASHINGTONAs the Senate's only woman member, Margaret Chase Smith of Maine likes to cast herself in the role of the conscience of that august institution. Last week, after her colleagues had fled town for vacations or global junkets, Mrs. Smith issued a scolding statement criticizing the moonlighters, junketeers and prima donna? whose absenteeism had delayed the business of the Senate.

title: NIXON MAPS SHIFT IN FARM AGENCIES
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 25The Department of Agriculture will be 110 years old next year, but it could be starting a new life under President Nixon's reorganization plan.

title: Miss Anne Marie Ryan Betrothed
description: BALDWIN, L. I., Dec. 25 Mr. and Mrs. James J. Ryan have announced the engagement of their daughter, Miss Anne Marie Ryan, to James A. Beha 2d, son of Mr. and Mrs. James J, Beha of New York. A June wedding is ,planned.

title: The atheist who lost his faith
description: When C. S. Lewis died in 1963 (the same day that President Kennedy was assassinated), he was renowned as a writer whose range of scholarship and imagination has rarely been equaled. Lewis had taught at both Oxford and Cambridge, where he held the chair of Medieval and Renaissance English. His scholarly work included The Allegory of Love, An Experiment in Criticism and the third volume in the Oxford History of English Literature.

title: Miss Lavine Plans Bridal
description: Miss. Cammie Caroline Edwards Lavine and Atlee Stephan 3d plan to be married Jan. 14 at the Fifth Avenue Presbyterian Church.

title: Airline Gives Up Turtle Soup
description: LONDON, Dec. 25 (UPI)The British Overseas Airways Corporation has decided to withdraw turtle soup from its menus

title: FRANCIS CALLERY, OIL EXECUTIVE, 73
description: Francis A. Callery, oil executive and former investment banker, who was a founder of the ConsolidatedVultee Aircraft Corporation, now part of General Dynamics, died Friday on a visit to Delray Beach, Fla, He was 73 years old and lived at 133 East 64th Street.

title: Blues Tie Sabres, 44
description: ST. LOUIS, Dec. 25 (AP)Gary Unger's goal with 27 seconds to play gave Al Arbour, the new St. Louis. Blues coach, an unexpected Christmas present, a 44 tie with the Buffalo Sabres tonight.

title: Singh Warns Bhutto
description: NEW DELHI, Dec. 25 (Reuters)  Foreign Minister Singh said today that President Bhutto would be making a grievous mistake if he believed the eastern region was still part of Pakistan.

title: Bird Count Up During Annual Yule Tally on L.I.
description: GARDINERS ISLAND, L.I., A hardy band of birdwatchers braved heavy seas last week to journey here and participate In the National Audubon Society's annual Christmas bird census. Their reward for their efforts was the sighting Of more birds than had been seen in recent years.

title: Announcements 5000
description: COURET OBUSHKEVITCH OVLOVOVSMr. and Mrs. JeanPaul CouretDuMourIvet have the honor of announcing the engagement of their son, JeanPaul Fernando CouretDuMourivet to Miss Krishna ObushkevitchOviovovs. JeanPaul CouretDuMourivet is exambassador to the UN. Their son is now serving his military term In the US army. The wedding will take plats a year from this coming April when he will have finished his military term.

title: Grounding the Kite
description: A Great Neck, L.I., matron drives to New Hope, Pa., for a Monday of shopping for antiques. She buys an $850 chair, and gives the dealer a. check, knowing that she has only a few dollars in her checking account.

title: Peter S. Milhaupt Will Marry Miss Rose P. Lynch in February
description: Miss Rose Peabody Lynch and Peter Stuart Milhaupt, 1971 graduates of Princeton University, plan to be married in February. Announcement of their engagement has been made by Mrs. R. Parsons Lynch of New York and R. Vincent Lynch of Dallas, parents of the future bride. Her fianc is the son of Mr. and Mrs. Thomas Milhaupt of Greenwich, Conn.

title: Form for Income Tax Started Through Mail
description: ANDOVER, Mass., Dec. 25 (AP)Income tax form 1040 has been unloaded on the Postal Service and will start appearing in taxpayer's home beginning Monday, the Internal Revenue Service says. The spokesman said today the post office had been asked to have all forms delivered by Jan. 6.

title: 64 Families Are Be ginningto Rebuild A Jordanian Town Shattered by War
description: KARAMEH, Jordan, Dec. 10  Sixtyfour families have moved back to this crushed shell of a city on the east bank of the Jordan River that was virtually abandoned until last spring.

title: DEMOCRATIC CHIEF NOTES NIXON GAIN
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 25 (UPI) The Democratic National Chairman, Lawrence F. O'Brien, acknowledged today that President Nixon gained political strength in 1971. He said any Democratic assumption that the President would defeat himself in 1972 could guarantee a Republican victory.

title: U.S. SAID TO DELAY FILM ABOUT TIBET
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 25The United States Information Agency spent $73,000 and devoted eight months to a 13minute film documentary that is being suppressed, according to reliable informants here, at White House orders.

title: Couple Sends $500 to Neediest In Lieu of Buying Christmas Gifts
description: Although the donors of small contributions made up the mass of contributions to the New York Times Neediest Cases Fund recorded yesterday, those who could, did give more.

title: LETTERS
description: To the Financial Editor:

title: Miss Wendy Davis Nierenberg And Robert L. Gibney jr. Wed
description: CHAPPAQUA, N. Y., Dec. 26The marriage of Miss Wendy Davis. Nierenberg to Robert Lawrence Gibney Jr., son of Mr. and Mrs. Gibney of Meriden, Conn., took place here this afternoon. Walter Lawton, leader of the Ethical Culture Society of Northern Westchester, performed the ceremony at the home of the bride's parents, Mr. and Mrs. David E. Nierenberg.

title: Washington and Warwick Of Vikings Face Surgery
description: BLOOMINGTON, Minn., Dec. 26 (UPI)While most of the Minnesota Vikings players prepared to head for home after their defeat by Dallas in the playoffs yesterday, at least two were facing surgery.

title: Scant Increases Seen for 1971 In Major Banks Operating Net
description: Net operating earnings of major banks, taken as a group, will show little or no increase in 1971 as compared to 1970, two leading firms specializing in bank securities predicted over the weekend.

title: Miss Ferretti A Bride Here
description: Miss Andrea Vivian Ferretti, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Andrew Ferretti of Nutley, N. J., was married here yesterday to Sargis Khoobiar, son of the late Mr. and Mrs. Amijohn Khoobiar of Teheran, Iran. Msgr. John Hanley performed the ceremony at a nuptial mass in Our Lady of the Rosary Roman Catholic Church.

title: CURRENCY VALUES MAY CHANGE AGAIN
description: PARIS, Dec. 26A new pattern of currency values has emerged from the Washington Meeting of finance ministers, but the gnomes of Zurich and London and Frankfurt, whose job it is to spot incipient strength and weakness, are convinced there will be some changes made before too long.

title: McCafferty and Browns Praise Defense of Colts
description: CLEVELAND, Dec. 26 (UPI) Don McCafferty, coach of the Baltimore Colts, credited a fantastic defense for his team's 20.3 victory over the Cleveland Browns today.

title: Orders in Machine Toots, Up 20% in November, Doable 1970 Pace
description: The pace of ordering for machine tools, one of the first indicators of how business and industry view the economy, quickened markedly in November.

title: American Mutual Change
description: The American Mutual Insurance Companies of Wakefield, Mass,, haS named Ronald J. Brewer, vice president and controller, to the additional post of secretary, it was announced over the weekend. He succeeds Robert Clinton, who is retiring.

title: Four Black Players Rejoin Cornell Five
description: ITHACA, N. Y., Dec. 26Four black players, who quit recently, rejoined Cornell University's basketball team tonight under Coach Jerry Lace.

title: Mrs. Stephen Haynes Dies; Active in Philanthropies
description: MILL NECK, L. I., Dec. 26  Mrs. Catharine Mumford Haynes, who had been aotive in many philanthropies, died Friday at her home here, She was 78 years old and also lived in Mount Desert, Me.

title: WALDHEIM PLANNING TO TALK WITH NIXON
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 26 Kurt Waldheim, the United Nations Secretary Generaldesignate, said today that he planned to meet with President Nixon and Congressional leaders to discuss financial and other problems of the world organization.

title: News Analysis
description: The climactic stage of New York's biennial transit drama is at hand, but there are some new twists in the old script.

title: CORRUPTION FOUND IN SEWER PERMITS
description: The State Commission of Investigation charged yesterday that complicated and timeconsuming procedures for obtaining sewer construction permits from the city had fostered conspiracies, payoffs and other irregularities involving city employes and contractors on Staten Island.

title: Polarization in Chile
description: The accelerating polarization between Chile's Marxistdominated Government and its opponents clearly puts one of Latin America's most durable democratic systems in jeopardy, Perhaps this was inevitable, given the extremist elements in President Allende's coalition, the fact that he was elected with barely a third of the popular vote, and the control of both houses of Congress by the opposition.

title: I've Had a Wonderful Time. And I Feel Like I've Helped a Lot of People
description: BOWLING GREEN, Ky.In the old clays, when so many men used to visit the red brick house at 627 Clay Street, the girls were the star attraction, of course.

title: Hanoi Legal Official Charges Corruption At Important Levels
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 26 North Vietnam's chief lawenforcement officer has charged that corruption, waste and defiance of. Communist party pol icies are occurring on important levels in North Vietnam.

title: Ali's Right Cross in 7th Halts Blin's Spirited Bid
description: ZURICH, Switzerland, Dec. 26  Muhammad Ali didn't quite put on a oneman show and the Great Mismatch wasn't quite as onesided as expected tonight as Juergen Blin proved to be an exciting foil for the former world champion.

title: Brandt Flies to U.S. Today For Talks With President
description: BONN, Dec. 26 (AP)Chancellor Willy Brandt flies to the United States tomorrow for two days of talks with President Nixon and a brief vacation in Florida.

title: Police See More Military Arms in Use
description: Police officials say that the use of a United States Army fragmentation grenade against two policemen last Monday was symptomatic of an upsurge in the illegal use and possesion of Vietnam wartype military equipment in the city.

title: Miss Hubbard Wed To Charles Oakley
description: STAMFORD, Conn., Dec. 26In the chapel of the First Presbyterian Church here today Miss. Susan Barnes Hubbard, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Earl Otis Hubbard of Edina, Minn., was married to Charles Gregory Warner Oakley, son of Mr. and Mrs. William Forrest Oakley of Stamford. The Rev. Donald F. Campbell performed the ceremony.

title: SOVIET LIFTS BAN ON A DARING FILM
description: MOSCOW, Dec. 26Soviet censors have quietly lifted a ban on a controversial Soviet movie Andrei Rublev, a daring and grimly realistic film that won a Cannes filmfestival prize in 1970 but was deemed too sensitive for showing to Soviet audiences since its completion in 1966.

title: OTB Racing Schedule For the Holiday Week
description: The following holiday schedule has been announced by the Offtrack Betting Corporation for action at its 36 shops:

title: Kenneth E. Davis Dies; East Hampton Official
description: EAST HAMPTON, L.I., Dec. 26Kenneth E. Davis, a former East Hampton town supervisor, died Friday morning in Southampton Hospital. He was 80 years old and lived at 47 Cooper Lane.

title: Murphy Suggests Investigation Of the Criminal Justice System
description: Police Commissioner Patrick V. Murphy yesterday suggested an investigation of the whole criminal justice system.

title: Samuel Rothbort, 89, Dies; Artist Was Also Sculptor
description: Samuel Rothbort, a Brooklyn artist perhaps best known for his series of shtetl paintings based on his memories of life in Volkovisk, Russia, died yesterday in University Hospital. He was 89 years old and lived at 823 Avenue S in Brooklyn.

title: Final Sale for an Old Firm
description: When the 66yearold jewelry firm of Trabert & Hoeffer, which has been in a little twostory building at 407 Park Avenue since 1935, decided recently that it could not afford the terms of a new lease and would have to go out of business at the end of this year, it notified its customers of a private sale. To the surprise of Paul Russo, present owner of the shop the place, itself, looks like a jewel boxnot many of his illustrious customers wanted to buy anything. Instead, they wanted him to include some of their more valuable pieces in his sales. Evidently at least some of the very rich have decided that big emeralds, diamonds and rubies no longer fit into their present pattern of living.

title: lsraeli Aide and. Wife Killed
description: SANTO DOMINGO, Dominican Republic, Dec. 26 (UPI)The Israeli Ambassador to the Dominican Republic, Alexander Dothan, and his wife Rachel were killed in a twocar collision in which two other persons were killed last night, the Israeli Embassy said today.

title: FILION SETS RECORD WITH SEVEN WINNERS
description: WINDSOR, Ontario, Dec. 26 (AP)Herve Filion set a world record at Windsor Raceway today when he won seven of the 10 races at the harness racing track. No one else has won more than six on a single card.

title: Jews Are Urged to Go to Israel To Study Her Life and Culture
description: The newly established Labor Zionist Alliance called on young American Jews yesterday to spend a year studying the cultural and social life of Israel to strengthen the ties between American Jews and those in Israel.

title: Kathryn Krisch Has Nuptials
description: ROANOKE, Va., Dec. 26Miss Kathryn Jane Krisch, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Joel. Krisch, was married in Temple Emanuel here at noon today to Jack Loeb Jr., son of Mr. and Mrs. Loeb of Montgomery, Ala. Rabbis F. Berry Silberg and David A. Baylinson officiated.

title: Bracken Battles Losses In a Most Tragic Role
description: MIAMIEddie Bracken sat silently in a hotel cocktail lounge the other day and swirled his drink, a margharita, and watched the tequila and lime juice dissolve the girdle of crusted salt inside the rim of his glass.

title: Bridge:Scientistsand the Bashers  Reign in 2 Different Fields
Laurence Goodman, 69, Led Veterinary Association
description: MANHASSET, L.I., Dec. 26Dr. Laurence W. Goodman, former president of the Long Island Veterinary Medical Association and New York Veterinary Medical Association died yesterday in Manhasset Medical Center Hospital. He was 69 years old and lived at 400 Hunt Lane here.

title: Nixon Is Designated As Man of the Year By Time Magazine
description: A President of the United States should he cool and sober in a crisis and a family man who likes a good time, according to President Nixon.

title: City Hall Notes
description: Mayor Lindsay, who steered clear of the recent legislative session on reapportionment, expects to become deeply involved in the special session on fiscal affairs that begins in Albany today.

title: Attacks Called Prelude
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 26A United States official who declined to be identified said today that the raids on North Vietnam were a prelude to intensified United States strikes against the North Vietnamese ground forces fighting on the Plaine des Jarres in northern Laos.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: Negotiations Over Sinai
description: Two principal routes toward a negotiated settlement in the Middle East remain open now that the General Assembly has finished its debate and Egypt and Israel, despite belligerent noises, are again examining the prospects for private talks. But the efforts of Ainbassador Jarring, the U.N. mediator, have been bogged down since February and are less likely to be revived successfully right now than the American attempt to achieve an interim Suez agreement.

title: CITY SETS '72 TEST OF RELIEFAID PLAN
description: In an experiment to cut welfare fraud and red tape, some relief clients in the city in 1972 will pick up cash allowances instead of checks at pay stations equipped with an 'almost foolproof identification system, the city's Human Resources Administrator said yesterday.

title: CANADA JET SEIZED; IT HEADS FOR CUBA
description: TORONTO, Dec 26 (AP)A gunman hijacked an Air Canada jetliner tonight on a flight from Thunder Bay, Ontario, Yet the 83 passengers off here while the plane was refueled, then forced the crew to take off for Cuba.

title: Hanoi Sources in Laos Negative on Hope Visit
description: VIENTIANE, Laos, Dec. 26 (Agence FrancePresse)Sources at the North Vietnamese Embassy here said today that there was absolutely no chance that Bob Hope would be allowed to enter North Vietnam under present circumstances.

title: Economist Hopeful
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 26 (AP)  Dr. Carl H. Madden, chief economist of the United States Chamber of Commerce, said today in his forecast:

title: On the Las Vegas Strip, the Glitter Dims and the Gambling Wanes at Christmas
description: LAS VEGAS, Nev., Dec. 26 On the night before Christmas, all through the gambling houses steelyeyed croupiers and blearyeyed gamblers waged the battle that never stops on the Strip.

title: Arts Abroad
description: MADRIDThe stage is a vast tarpaulin, the color of leafmold, suspended on cables. It pulls up into sudden hills, falls into hollows and vibrates in counterpoint each time Yerma, Federico Garcia Lorca's barren woman, strides, gesticulates or speaks. On the soft, nearly breathing stage is Nuria Espert, Spain's finest actress, who is being increasingly recognized throughout Europe. Barefoot, in a dun garment, Miss Espert expands and contracts like the stage beneath her. One moment she is a tiny huddle of misery, the next, huge and strident. It is her face, however, that marks her.

title: CANADA TAX LAW IS AIMED AT U.S.
description: OTTAWA, Dec. 26Canada's policy on foreign ownership of its industry, which Prime Minister Pierre Elliott Trudeau says might subject him to new charges of 'antiAmericanism, will remain a Government secret until sometime in the new year.

title: The Farm RevolutionI
description: The short but sharp fight over the confirmation of Earl L. Butz as Secretary of Agriculture turned the spotlight on some unhealthy longterm trends on the nation's farms. Despite his estimable personal qualities, Mr. Butz encountered opposition because lie epitomizes the rapidly growing power of giant conglomerate corporations which have extended their activities into agriculture and are already in a position to dictate the price, quality and variety of many foods.

title: Miami Hails Hero Kicker as Holder Basks in Shadows
description: MIAMI, Dec. 26 Garo Yepremian was the toast of the town today after his winning 37yard field goal yesterday ended the longest pro football game ever played.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: 2 LINDSAY RACES TO COST $1MILLION
description: Mayor Lindsay is, budgeting $1million for the Florida and Wisconsin Presidential primaries, City Hall sources said yesterday as the Mayor and his aides prepared for the announcement of his Presidential candidacy in Miami tomorrow.

title: The Absentees
description: It is one of the paradoxes of public life that men and women eagerly aspire to be in Congress, but, once elected, often miss rollcalls even on important issues. Senator Margaret Chase Smith of Maine proposes a constitutional amendment to require Congress to expel any member who missed more than 40 per cent of the votes in any session. This would be a bit extreme, but Mrs. Smith's drastic suggestionwhich she herself probably doesn't mean to be taken too seriouslypoints up the problem.

title: Mills Consider inventory Depletion to Be Main Reason for Gains
description: PITTSBURGH, Dec. 26Steel shipments will rise by a million tons in January, said a mill analyst last week.

title: Oliphant Finds Foreign Investors Returning
description: QUESTION: There has been a tremendous interest in the activity of foreign investors since the dollar devaluation and the realignment of currencies agreed to during the third week in December. In the experience of your firm, what is happening abroad at the present time?

title: Tax Session Opens Today; G. O. P. Seeks Rivals Help
description: A week of intense bargaining and political maneuvering begins in Albany today when the Legislature convenes in the special session to deal with Governor Rockefeller's plan to stave off an estimated 15 month budget deficit of $1.5billion.

title: Colts, 49ers Win Football Playoffs
