description: The Baltimore Colts and San Francisco 49ers won National Football League playoff games yesterday.

title: HARASSER OF GIRLS SLAIN BY PATROLMAN
description: An offduty patrolman, seeing a man harassing three teenage girls, shot and killed the man after he lunged at the policeman with a knife Saturday night, the police reported.

title: Trapped Motorist Saved
description: LOS ANGELES, Dec. 26 (AP) Using a truck and a winch, more than 20 persons worked for an hour in darkness and rain to rescue a 300pound motorist trapped in his car after it had gone over a 150foot cliff. They lifted Ramsey Russell, 35 years old, from Eton Canyou in mountain foothills in the Altadena area last night. He suffered a broken leg and a concussion.

title: Man in the News
description: The smoky, masculine atmosphere at Manhattan Center yesterday erupted with cheers and waving placards.

title: India Weighs Bengali Plea To Try Pakistani Officials
description: DACCA, Pakistan, Dec. 26India is uncertain whether to hand over the former leaders of the Pakistani Government here to Bangladesh officials for trial as war criminals, India's special envoy here indicated today.

title: Red Smith
description: Pigskin eye is a common seasonal ailment, painful but seldom fatal, characterized by distention of the eyeball and a corresponding shrinkage of the cerebral cortex, caused by incessant focusing on moving figures on a screen. Patient complains of an aching sensation in the cornea and sees a pattern of lateral white stripes. Occurs most frequently during playoffs for quarterchampionships, halfchampionships and superchampionships of professional football. Relief can usually be effected by having patient lie down with cold compresses of boric acid over the eyelids while attendant or a recorded voice repeats flag on the play, doing a great job and crucial turnover in a soothing tone.

title: London Group Provides Army Intelligence to All
description: LONDON, Dec. 23  The colonel who runs a section of Israeli intelligence said the figures on Egyptian tank strength must be right: That's what the institute says they are and the, institute is very accurate.

title: Article 2  No Title
description: MIAMI, Monday, Dec. 27 (Reuters) hijacked Air Canada jetliner landed safely at Havana's Jose Mart! airport last night after a flight from Toronto, the Federal Aviation Administration said here early today.

title: Advertising:
description: Herbert D. Strauss, senior executive officer of Grey Advertising, and his wife, Sarann, have a Christmas card that is especially worthy of comment. It shows each of them astride a camel in the midst of a desert and the message is, We had trouble parking them until we found a Camelot.

title: AT HOME ABROAD
description: LONDON, Dec. 26Under the heading Richard Nixon's third year, two of the President's lieutenants have issued a long list of claimed achievements in 1971. According to them was a year of bold, daring, substantial, large, sweeping and historic acts of American leadership.

title: U.S. PLANES STAGE LARGESCALE RAW ON NORTH VIETNAM
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, Monday, Dec. 27 States Air Force and Navy planes attacked military installations in North Vietnam yesterday and today, the American command announced.

title: GRAEBNER IS NO. 1 IN EAST TENNIS
description: Clark Graebner of New York, who has found his fortune as an independent tennis professional, heads the pastern men's ranking for the third straight year.

title: Phoenix Mutual Sales
description: Group life insurance sales of the Phoenix Mutual Life Insurance Company exceeded $1billion in 1971, the company said over the weekend.

title: Gen. Emmett (Rosy) O'Donnell Is Dead; Led Squadron in Fight for Clark FieldWon Medal for Attack
description: McLEAN, Va., Dec. 26Gen. Emmett (Rosy) O'Donnell, who distinguished himself in Pacific combat in World War II, died of coronary arrest this morning at his home here. He was 65 years old.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: Sanitationmen Get DoubleTime Pay For Holiday Work
description: All those ribbons, wrappings and boxes that brought joy to millions of New Yorkers Saturday morning brought groans and doubletime pay to 5,000 sanitationmen yesterday.

title: Transit Situation at a Glance
description: PARTICIPANTSThe public agencies involved in the contract negotiations at the Americana Hotel are the Metropolitan Transit Authority and its subsidiary, the Manhattan and Bronx Surface Transit Operating Authority. They operate the city's publicly owned subway and bus lines. Both are arms of the Metropolitan Transportation Authority, the state agency that also supervises operations on the Long Island Rail Road and the city's bridges and tunnels.

title: Personal Finance: A Taxpayer's Home
description: When is a home not a home? It apparently happens sometimes when the Internal Revenue Service makes a decision that would give the Government more taxes.

title: PuppetHater Gives Up
description: Bil Baird has done the impo'ssible. The wretched man has converted me to puppets. I hate puppets. I am totally unable to relate to people who are not people, and believe me, puppets are not people. Some of my best enemies have been puppets. And yet Mr. Baird stubbornly refuses to show me where I was right. He and his puppets are totally marvelous, and against every single better judgment I have in my head, I unreservedly love his performances.

title: Nixon Aides Ask Transport Strike Curb
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 26(Reuters)  Administration officials have attacked Congress for its outrageous failure to give the President stronger emergency powers to prevent strikes in the transportation industry.

title: Postal Service Is Plagued By Woes of Predecessor
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 26 The burden of delivering the growing volume of mail swiftly and cheaply is proving as heavy for the United States Postal Service as it did for the Post Office Department that it replaced six months ago.

title: 2 U.S. YACHTS LEAD RACE FROM SYDNEY
description: SYDNEY, Australia, Dec. 26 (Reuters)  The big American yawls Kialoa II, owned by Jim Kilroy of San Francisco, and Ondine II, owned by S. A. (Huey) Long of Larchmont, N.Y., were in the lead in the 650mile SydneyHobart yacht race tonight, racing together under full sail in an eightknot breeze.

title: WADE H. HAISLIP, WAR COMMANDER
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 26 Gen. Wade H. Haislip, who commanded the 15th Corps in World War II and smashed across six rivers from the Mayenne to the Moselle after having brought his troops through the congested Avranches Corridor, died Thursday in Walter Reed Army Hospital after a series of strokes. He was 82 years old.

title: Taking the Outdoors to Court
description: My number one priority for the New York State Legislature is a welldrawn citizens suit provision granting responsible citizens and organizations standing to sue in New York State courts to enforce public environmental rights.

title: SOUTH KOREAN G.N.P. UP 10.2% THIS YEAR
description: SEOUL, South Korea, Dec. 26  South Korea's gross national product grew 10.2 per cent this year, the final year of the country's second fiveyear economic plan, according to a tentative estimate announced by the Bank of Korea during the weekend.

title: Foe said to Rise Crops on Trail
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, Dec. 26A recent account of an effort to improve the morale of North Vietnamesetroops bn the Ho Chi Minh supply trail describes the growing of green vegetables and the raising of chickens and small hogs by troops on operations.

title: Naples NotSoSilent Nights: Fireworks Defeat Police Drive
description: NAPLES, Italy, Dec. 26Operation Quiet Christmas, which the police opened here several weeks ago, has been a total, earpiercing failure.

title: Carol Jane Rothschild Is Married
description: TEANECK, N. J., Dec. 26In Temple Emeth here this afternoon, Miss Carol Jane Rothschild, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Charles J. Rothschild Jr., was married to Steven Jeffrey Shuster, son of Dr. and Mrs. Harold M. Shuster of Freeport, L. I. Rabbi Louis J. Sigel performed the ceremony.

title: UTAH STATE BEATS JAPAN ELEVEN, 456
description: OSAKA, Japan, Dec. 26 (UPI) Utah State University's football team today defeated a team composed of players from West Japan's universities, 456, before 10,000 spectators at Oshien Stadium.

title: Blessings Lead to Aid To Neediest
Nixon Makes Call To Sad Redskins: Don't Look Back
description: SAN FRANCISCO, Dec. 26 (AP)The word from the White House to the Washington Redskins, pro football's surprise team of 1971, today was, Don't look back.

title: Gerulaitis Registers Upset At Orange Bowl Junior Net
description: MIAMI BEACH, Dec. 26 (AP) The third, fifth and seventhseeded players in the 18andunder division were upset today in the Orange Bowl junior tennis tournament.

title: Vietnam CeaseFire Period Is the Quietest of the War
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, Dec. 26 (Reuters)  Christmas ceasefires on Vietnam's battlefields dnded tonight after the war's quietest truce period. Thirteen South Vietnamese soldiers were reported killed. No American deaths were reported.

title: Open Covenant
description: Of all the exasperating elements in municipal labor relations, perhaps the most indefensible is that the public never is let in on the details of union contracts entered into by the city until after they are signedand sometimes not even then.

title: Advertising:
description: A spot check among some of the bigger agencies shows, generally, no dancing in the streets, but a bit of optimism about the coming year.

title: Taiwan Export Zone Criticized
description: TAIPEI, Taiwan, Dec. 26 The Export Processing Zone in the southern city of Kaohsiung is still one of Taiwan's economic showpieces. The 170acre area, which can be roughly described as a combination free port and industrial park for export industries, is now near capacity. It has 156 factories, mostly operated by foreign investors, employing 42,000 workers. This year it is exporting an estimated $180million worth of goods. Two additional zones are now under development.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: Missing Peruvian Airliner Believed to Have Crashed
description: LIMA, Peru, Dec. 26 (Reuters) An airliner missing for more than two days in northern Peru with 92 persons abOard was reported today to have crashed in an almost inaccessible area of mountains and jungles.

title: Nader Asserts Thousands Are Killed or Injured Annually in Part Because Safety Act Is Not Fully Enforced
description: PHILADELPHIA, Dec. 26Ralph Nader charged today that each year thousands of American workers were being killed and maimed needlessly in part because the Federal Occupational Health and Safety Act of 1970 was not being fully implemented.

title: Philippines Mayor Killed
description: MANILA, Dec. 26 (UPI)The new mayor of suburban Malabon, 34yearold Jose Cruz, died tonight in the explosion of a Christmas gift handed to him by an unidentified man. Mr. Cruz was elected Nov. 8 after a heated campaign against the incumbent mayor, Lucio Gutierrez.

title: JOHN H. FLAGG, LED GEAR MAKERS GROUP
description: ENGLEWOOD, N. J., Dec. 26 John H. Flagg, a past president of the American Gear Manufacturers Association, died on Friday in Naples, Fla. He was 73 years old and resided at 240 East Palisade Avenue and at Point O'Woods, Fire Island, N.Y.

title: Chess:Hypermodern Pirc Defense Gives Bishops More Scope
Queens Man Is Wounded By Burglar Invading Home
description: A 42yearold Queens hospital attendant, surprising a burglar who had broken into his home, was shot and critically wounded by the burglar early, yesterday morning.

title: For Them, the FourDay Week Has ArrivedAnd They Love It
description: On a recent Friday, John Fountain poked around the city, met his wife for a leisurely lunch and bought a few records. Robert Djerejian looked after the children and painted a wall in his Bronxville house. Mrs. Robert Burgess visited museums, and Linda Brown shopped for furnishings for her new apartment.

title: Treasures of Ancient Art Unearthed on Aegean Isle
description: ATHENS, Dec. 26  A rich 3,500yearold city, discovered by Greek archeologists under a thick layer of volcanic fallout on the Aegean island of Thera, has turned out to be a veritable prehistoric art gallery.

title: MAC COHEN
description: Mac Cohen, vice president and general sales manager of the Sheridan Silver Company, Inc., of New York, who was a metropolitan Amateur Athletic Union sprint champion in the nineteentwenties, died yesterday of a cerebral hemorrhage in Roosevelt Hospital. He was 70 years old and lived at 1824 East 26th Street, Brooklyn.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: Jersey Youth Slain Near Times Square
description: A New Jersey youth was shot to death last night on 45th Street near Times Square.

title: HispanicAmerican Group Cuts Its Ties With Riverside Church
description: The 12 year old HispanicAmerican ministry at Riverside Church came to an end yesterday with the chairman of the group's information committee expressing some bitterness and the church administration expressing regret.

title: Books of The Times
description: DEALER. By Richard Woodley. 210 pages. Holt, Rinehart & Winston. $5.95.

title: JANUARY INDUCTIONS VIEWED AS UNLIKELY
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 26 (AP) Selective Service officials say it is virtually certain that nobody will be drafted in January.

title: Post, Bridgeport Fives Reach Tourney Semifinals
description: UPPER MONTCLAIR, N.J., Dec. 26 C. W. Post and Bridgeport gained the semifinals of the New Jersey Kiwanis basketball tournament at Montclair State College tonight.

title: Air War Intensifies
description: HONG KONG, Dec. 26The air strikes against North Vietnam followed by a week Serious intensification of the air war over Laos, when North Vietnamese MIG21 jet fighterbombers crossed the border and clashed with Amerlean planes supporting Laotian ground troops on the Plaine des Jarres.

title: Politician Goes From Albany to Stage
description: This place is a hellhole that makes me physically sick. I'm going to do my damnedest to close it. This blast at the local House of Detention for Women came from the chairman of the State Assembly's Committee on Penal Institutions in 1965.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: State Regents'
description: An inquisitive highway patrolman recently stopped a member of the State Board of Regents, whose car was adorned with the emblem of his office, and asked, What's a Regent?

title: What Comes Inside Cuckoo Clocks and Candles? A Growing Flow of Illicit Drugs
description: More and more people, according to the postal authorities, are trying to use the mails to move illicit drugs into the United States, packing the contraband in talcumpowder cans and inside cuckoo clocks or concealing it in jacket linings and hollowedout candles.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: UNION MEN UNEASY OVER GUIDELINES
description: DETROIT, Dec. 26  The harsh criticism that top national labor leaders leveled in the beginning at President Nixon's economic stabilization program is being heard now among union men at lower levels around the country.

title: Sailor Back From Exile a Symbol of Deserters Plight
description: BOSTON, Dec. 26  Jimmy Zwicker, carrying the scars of combat, has come home from the war, in shackles.

title: Hawaii Resort Venture
description: A. joint venture for a 1,500acre resort community in Hawaii has been completed between Alexander & Baldwin, Inc., a Honolulu land developer, and the Northwestern Mutual Life Insurance ompany, it was announced over the weekend. Francis E. Ferguson, president of the. Milwaukeebased insurer, said construction would cost between $15million and $18million.

title: Down on the Farm
description: CAMBRIDGE, Mass.  The recent heated discussion on the qualifications of the new Secretary of Agriculture neglected consideration of the builtin conflicts of interest inherent in the aims and structure of the United States Department of Agriculture.

title: A Transit Policeman Kills Suspect After BMT Holdup
description: A holdup suspect was shot and killed by a Transit Authority patrolman at 3 A.M. yesterday in the Chambers Stret station of the BMT after a change booth clerk had been robbed of $5.

title: War Foes Seize Statue of Liberty
description: Sixteen antiwar veterans seized control of the Statue of Liberty last night and vowed to stay there until New Year's Eve as a protest against continuation of the war in Vietnam.

title: Spain's Communists, Though Strong, Are Divided by a War Between Leaders.
description: MADRID, Dec. 26  The Spanish Communist leadership, attacked by proMoscow groups as revisionist, has recently established friendly relations with the Chinese.

title: Barbara Davis's Bridal
description: SHORT HILLS, N.J., Dec. 26Miss Barbara Ann Davis, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Morton Davis of South Orange, was married here this afternoon in Temple B'nai. Jeshurum to Richard Gary Schwartz, son of Mrs. Bernard D. Lefrak of South Orange, and the late Herman Schwartz. Rabbis Eli Pilchuk and Barry Greene officiated.

title: Muskie on Skiing Vacation
description: KINGFIELD, Me., Dec. 26 (UPI)  Senator Edmund S. Muskie, Democrat of Maine, began a skiing vacation with his family today at Sugarloaf Mountain. Mr. Muskie, who is expected to announce his Presi'that candidacy Jan. 4, said he had not skied since his student days at Bates College.

title: Last '71 Eurobond Offering Finds a Boom Atmosphere
description: BRUSSELS, Dec. 26  With only one new straightdollar offering still to be priced, the Eurobond market said goodbye to 1971 last week on a recordsmashing note.

title: Educational Gain for Negroes Reported
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 26Young Negroes made striking educational gains between 1960 and 1971, a 55 per cent jump according to one measurement, the Census Bureau reported today.

title: Mrs. Trudeau and Son Fine'
description: OTTAWA, Dec. 26 (UPI)Mrs. Pierre Elliott Trudeau was repoted making fine progress and congratulatory messages begun pouring in today following the birth. Christmas night of a healthy 6pound 9ounce son.

title: Pakistan Pledges Action
description: RAWALPINDI, Pakistan, Dec. 26Pakistan's new leaders enjoined their people today from looking for scapegoats for the recent military defeat by India, and indicated that no speedy action would be taken against the former ruling generals.

title: GAS FIND ROUSES CANADIAN HOPES
description: TORONTO, Dec. 26A discovery of natural gas in the Arctic Islands a few days ago has improved prospects that this increasingly popular fuel will flow one day from Canada's far north to the United States.

title: Hoffa Goes to Detroit Today For Parole Board Hearing
description: ST. LOUIS, Dec. 26 (UPI)Morris A. Shenker, chief legal counsel for James A. Hoffa, former president of the International Brotherhood of Teamsters, said today that he would accompany Hoffa to Detroit tomorrow for the unionist's appearance before the Federal parole board.

title: F.B.I. DATA BANK HELD WASTEFUL
description: WASHINGTON, Dec, 26The Federal Bureau of Investigation's new nationwide criminal history data bank, in operation less than a month, has become the center of a new controversy over the use of computers by the police.

title: ROBBER IS SHOT DEAD BY INTENDED VICTIM
description: A young man wearing a stocking mask was shot to death yesterday afternoon during an attempted robbery in a four story tenement at 400 Grand Street on the Lower East Side.

title: Israeli Religious Tensions Nearing a Showdown
description: JERUSALEM, Dec. 26 Endemic tensions between ultraOrthodox and secular Jews in Israel are moving the country toward a serious political confrontation.

title: Nancy Elliott Is Bride
description: Miss Nancy Marie Elliott and Michael Malagold were married here yesterday afternooh at the Terrace on the Park in Flushing Meadow, Queens, by Cantor Sidney Sterling. The bride and her husband are graduates of the State University of New York at Stony Brook, L.I. Mrs. Murray Alexander and Howard Elliott are parents of the bride. Mr. and Mrs. Raphael Malagold of New York are the bridegroom's parents.

title: Dudley D. Shoenfeld, 78, Dies; Chief Mount Sinai Psychiatrist
description: Dr. Dudley D. Shoenfeld, a former chief psychiatrist at Mount Sinai Hospital, died there today. He was 78 years old and lived at 320 Central Park West.

title: Seoul Emergency Bill Rammed Through
description: SEOUL, South Korea, Monday, Dec. 27  Legislators belonging to the ruling Democratic Republican party rammed a controversial bill to give President Park Chung Hee broad emergency powers through the National Assembly this morning in a predawn session. No Opposition members were present.

title: ROBERT LOWERY, 57, FILM ACTOR, IS DEAD
description: HOLLYWOOD, Dec. 26 (AP) Robert Lowery, who played in scores of films in the 1930's and 1940's in roles ranging from newspaper reporter to gangster, died today at his apartment here. He was 57 years old.

title: Bomb Injures 2 in Belgrade
description: BELGRADE, Yugoslavia, Dec. 20 (Reuters) bomb exploded when an oldage pensioner tried tb open a package he found in a Belgrade street today, the Yugoslav press agency Tanyug reported. The man and his granddaughter were injured.

title: Dollars and Diplomacy
description: Only a few weeks before the Washington monetary agreement, when the economic crisis was at Its grimmest, a European statesman compared the United States to the Florentine prince who, as he lay dying, was asked whether he did not wish to confess his sins. I have nothing to confess, he replied. Then did he wish to forgive his enemies? I have no enemies, he said. I killed them all.

title: Golding Killed in Crash
description: MUSKOGEE, Okla., Dec. 26 (UPI)Joseph G. (Junior) Golding Jr., a halfback for the 1941 and 1946 Oklahoma football team, was killed in a onecar rollover south of Muskogee on United States Highway 69 early today. A State Trooper, Richard Parker, was unable to explain the accident, in which Golding's auto careened along a muddy drainage ditch more than 400 feet. He never hit his brakes, said Parker. He just left tracks across the muddy earth.

title: TRANSIT WORKERS AUTHORIZE STRIKE ON NEW YEAR'S DAY
description: Five thousand members of the Transport Workers. Union authorized their leaders, yesterday to call a strike on the city's subways and bus lines if they do not have a new contract on New Year's Day.

title: RICHARD F. SENTNER, U.S. STEEL AIDE, DEAD
description: PITTSBURGH, Dec. 26 Richard F. Sentner, former executive vice presidentcommercial of United States Steel Corporation, died today at his home in Sewickley.

title: Fecteau Meets Relatives
description: LYNN, Mass., Dec. 26 (UPI) Richard G. Fecteau, who was released from imprisonment in China earlier this month, visited quietly with relatives and friends here on his first Christmas at home in almost two decades. Mr. Fecteau was imprisoned as a spy after his plane was shot down in 1952. His former wife, Margaret, who met with him yesterday, said: He looked marvelous.

title: Article 1  No Title
description: KEY BISCAYNE, Fla., Dec. 26 (UPI)  President Nixon flew to Florida tonight for talks with Chancellor Brandt.

title: SAMUEL SMALL
description: Samuel Small, president of the S. & A. Small Real Estate Agency, Brooklyn, and a real estate broker and builder in Brooklyn and Queens for 60 years, died today at his home, 1818 Newkirk Avenue, Brooklyn. His age was 85.

title: 2 Killed in Jersey Collision
description: LINDEN, N.J., Dec. 26 (AP)Two young persons who had announced their marriage engagement earlier in the day were killed Saturday in an automobile collision, the police said. They were identified as Mary Ewing, 19 years old, and John Orzechowski, also 19, both of Elizabeth, N. J. The driver of the other vehicle, Robert Wilson, 50, of Newark, was charged with assaulting a policeman, drunken driving and causing death by auto, according to authorities.

title: MortgageMoney Supply Is Seen as Ample for 1972
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 27 (AP) Home buyers can look forward to an ample supply of mortgage money at attractive rates in 1972, Preston Martin, chairman of the Federal Home Loan Bank Board said today.

title: Research Ships Get Grant
description: BOSTON, Dec. 27 (AP)A $2.2million grant from the National Science Foundation to the Woods Hole Oceanographic Institution was announced today by the office of Senator Edward W. Brooke, Republican of Massachusetts.

title: Tass Says Oxygen And Hydrogen Exist In Vicinity of Mars
description: Soviet spacecraft have discovered the presence of hydrogen and oxygen atoms in the upper atmosphere of Mars, according to a report from Tass, the Soviet press agency.

title: Article 6  No Title
description: MILWAUKEE, Dec. 27 (AP)Marquette, after shooting just 20 per cent in the first half tonight, roared back in the second and trounced Georgetown, 8844, in the opening round of the Milwaukee Classic. It was Marquette's seventh triumph.

title: Emery Klineman Weds Mrs. Botway
description: Mrs. Helen Botway, an artist of New York, East Quogue, L. I., and Acapulco, Mexico, was married here yesterday to Emery E. Klineman of New York, who was chairman of the board of Majestic Specialties, manufacturer of women's sportswear, when it was sold to Genesco, the conglomerate, five years ago when he retired.

title: Miss Tuero Loses Net Final
description: EAST. LONDON, South Africa, Dec. 27 (AP)Ilana Kloss, a 15year old from Johannesburg, beat Linda Tuero of Metairie, La., 63, 62, today for the women's singles title in the Free State Sugar tennis championships.

title: Paper Bag Players Spending the Holidays Abroad
description: During the holiday season New York parents and children have usually been able to exult in the imaginative theatricalities of the Paper Bag Players. But this Christmas The Bags are not in residence in their home city. Instead, they are playing the Young Vic, the experimental wing of Britain's National Theater.

title: Hanoi Report Describes Shooting Down of 2 Jets
description: PARIS, Dec. 27 (UPI)The North Vietnamese delegation to the Paris peace talks released today what it described as an eyewitness account written by the Vietnamese News Agency of how two American Phantom jets were shot down Dec. 26 at the bridge of Hamrong. The unidentified journalist, under a Hanoi dateline, wrote in part:

title: Wood, Field and Stream
description: Dozens of salt water lures festoon the east wall of my cellar and at least half need attention before next spring and early summer when the striped, bass and bluefish will return.

title: Duck Shooters Stir Larchmont Strife
description: LARCHMONT, N.Y.The lovely picturebook harbor here has become a battleground between 115 residents who live on the waterfront and duck hunters who blast away with shotguns from a small, rocky island less than 1,000 feet from shore.

title: Hecht Company Announces 4 Management Promotions
description: Four top management promotions affecting the Hecht Company department stores in Washington and Baltimore were announced yesterday. Both are large divisions of the May Department Stores Company, St. Louis.

title: HOFFA CAN SPEAK ON UNION ISSUES
description: DETROIT, Dec. 27James R. Hoffa will be able to renew his many friendships in the giant teamster union and speak out on issues affecting the union without violating the conditions of the commutation of his sentence, according to a Justice Department official in Washington.

title: Theater of the Deaf Accepts Bid to Paris
description: The National Theater of the Deaf, this country's only professional company of deaf actors, has been invited to work in Paris with Peter Brook's International Center of Theater Research from May 8 through May 27.

title: Market Place: Richfield Stock And Alaskan Oil
description: Remember how everyone got excited about the Alaskan North Slope when it turned out that there was lots and lots of oil up there? Everyone heard that the Atlantic Richfield Company would be one of the biggest winners and the ,company stock took off like gangbusters.

title: Power Spending Set
description: FERGUS FALLS, Minn., Dec. 27 (UPI)The Otter Tail Power Company will spend $95million on construction in the period 197276. About $18million will be spent next year. More than half the $95million total will be spent on the 440,000kilowatt station being built at Millbank, S. D., by Otter Tail, the Northwestern Public Service Company and the MontanaDakota Utilities Company.

title: Dogs Save Boy From Bull
description: OSSIAN, Iowa, Dec. 27 (Reuters)Two stray dogs saved the life of Thomas Holtaus, a 19yearold farm boy, by leaping on a 1,900pound bull as it attacked him. The youth was charged by the bull yesterday as he drove cows into a barn on his father's farm. The beast butted him in the chest and knocked him down.

title: Rousseau and Sather a Joy to Rangers
description: The Cheshire grin on Coach Emile Francis's face widened yesterday as he discussed finesse, as personified by Bobby Rousseau, and plain grit, as typified by Glen Sather.

title: Treasury Bill Rates Off at Weekly Sale
Forecast for 1971 French Wines: They'll Cost More
description: PARIS The wine handicappers who chart French vintages by the year will have a particularly awkward time with 1971. Perhaps the best symbol would be a dollar sign.

title: Cooke Visits Bengalis In Squalor of Camps
description: CALCUTTA, India, Dec. 27 (AP)These people are the whole of humanity's concern, Cardinal Cooke said today as he walked among some of the poorest people on earth.

title: RATES ARE LOWER IN CREDIT MARKET
Prices Decline on Amex and OTC
Red Cross Offers Help
description: GENEVA, Dec. 27A spokes, man for the International Committee of the Red Cross said today that its representatives in Dacca would try to obtain good treatment for former East Pakistani officials who have been turned over to the Bangladesh regime by the Indian Army.

title: Man in the News
description: ALBANY, Dec. 27About 25 years ago Dr. Thomas Norman Hurd, then a subaltern in Thomas E. Dewey's administration, was working late in the Capitol on a complicated farm laborfood shortage problem when he thought he smelled a gas leak. He was rebuffed in his alarm by a skeptical guard, but the odor persisted and so did Dr. Hurd, all the way to a leaky valve downstairs in the cafeteria, which he took care of. Now, as Director of State Operations, Dr. Hurd is carefully sniffing the air for Governor Rockefeller in this critical and final week of what he terms the most difficult year of the Rockefeller administration.

title: Preliminary Hearing Held In Cleveland Store Killing
description: CLEVELAND, Dec. 27 (AP)  Tyrone Howard, 21 years old, who is accused of killing another man while the Iwo waited for their children's visit to Santa Claus in a downtown department store last week, was bound over to the Cuyahoga County grand jury today on a seconddegree murder charge.

title: Leading Restaurant Listed as Health Code Violator
description: Pointing to serious Health Code violations in the Peking Restaurant, considered one of the best Chinese restaurants in the city, the Health Department threatened yesterday to close the eating place unless the infractions are corrected by Jan. 17.

title: 70,000 to 100, 000 Young Men Could Face Prosecution
description: BOSTON, Dec. 27Although exact figures on the total number of Americans who are deserters or draft evaders are not available, the following statistics give an idea of the scope of the problem:

title: S. FOSTER DAMON, EXPERT ON BLAKE
description: PROVIDENCE, R.I., Dec. 27S. Foster Damon, professor emeritus of English at Brown University and the author of several books on William Blake, the poet, died yesterday in the Waterman Heights Nursing Hotne, Smithfield, where he had been living. He was 78 years old.

title: Miss Davis Does Not Feel She Will Get a Fair Trial
description: PALO ALTO, Calif., Dec. 27 In about a month, Angela Davis goes on trial for her life.

title: NEWHEARINGS HINTED ON INTEREST CONTROL
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 27 (AP) Representative Wright Patman, chairman of the House Banking Committee, has written President Nixon that a finding of no present necessity for interest controls does not meet the requirements of the law extending Presidential economic authority.

title: Some HardBoiled Answers to J B. Priestley; Whence came his knowledge of America?
description: To the. Editor:

title: ARCHIBALD GALBRAITH
description: EASTHAMPTON, Mass. Dec 27 (AP)  Dr. Archibald V. Galbraith, headmaster of Williston Academy from 1919 to 1949, died Saturday in Northampton at the age of 94.

title: Bracken's Theater in Miarni Put in Receiver's Hands
description: MIAMI, Dec. 27A judge placed the financially troubled Coconut Grove Playhouse in the hands of a redeiver today and prospects for a winter season were bleak.

title: Manhattan Bows, 7670, In Quaker City Tourney
Bill Giving Park Special Powers Signed into Law in South Korea
description: SEOUL, South Korea, Dec. 27 President Park Chung Hee signed into law today a controversial bill that gives him broad powers in a state of national emergency, which legislators from his party rammed through the National Assembly in a hasty session before dawn this morning.

title: Jesuit Seminarians Adjust to City Life
description: William Harrison enrolled in Woodstock College to study Roman Catholic theology, but found that his assignments included cooking dinner once a week for himself and six other students.

title: Some HardBoiled Answers to J B. Priestley
description: To the Editor:

title: Japan Export Dip Seen
description: TOKYO, Dec. 27Japan's exports will drop by 1.7 Per cent and her imports will increase by 6.8 per cent in the next fiscal year over the current fiscal year, ending March 31, because of the upward revaluation of the yen, a leading Japanese trading concern predicted today.

title: 2 Beavers Are Star Performers For Holiday Visitors at the Zoo
description: School holidays and unseasonably mild weather combined to lure mothers and small children and dozens of couples to the Central Park Zoo yesterday.

title: Some HardBoiled Answers to J B. Priestley
description: To the Editor:

title: OBSERVER
description: WASHINGTQN, Dec. 27  Women who feel aggrieved by the present organization of society now have a new magazine. It, is called Ms. And if you are uncertain how to pronounce it and hate to sound dumb at the newsstand you can ask for it by its subtitle, which is The New. Magazine for Women.

title: Miss Carole R. Neri Is Married in Jersey
description: TENAFLY, N. J., Dec. 27 Miss Carole Rose Neri, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. James Neri of Englewood, was married here this morning to Gregory L. Lembo, son of Mr. and Mrs. Lawrence W. Lembo of New York and Spring Lake, N. J. The Rev. Eugene O'Neil, cousin of the bride, performed the cere. mony at the Roman Catholic Mission Chapel.

title: STORES ARE TOLD BASE PRICE LISTS MUST BE ON VIEW
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 27The Internal Revenue Service warned all retailers today that they must post lists of base prices prominently for the convenience of customers before next Sunday, Jan. 2.

title: William C. Cannon Dead at 98; Member of Bar Here 71 Years
description: William C. Cannon, a member of the New York bar for 71 years, died Sunday at his home in Salisbury, Conn. He was 98 years old.

title: CHINA WIDENS AID; RUSSIA CUTS BACK
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 27 (UPI)  A State Department study said today that China made a bid for a greater role as an international power by greatly increasing her aid to developing countries in 1970 to a total of $709million.

title: STOCKS UP A BIT IN LIGHT TRADING
FIESTA BOWL WON BY ARIZONA STATE
COURT APPEAL FILED BY LAZARD FRERES
description: Lazard Freres & Co. has formally appealed to the Supreme Court to reverse a lower court decision that has sent shock waves through the mutualfund industry.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: Dance Season: A Slow Pace at First
description: Just as the drama got off to a start that only charity could call leisurely, so the dance also moved with the speed of a discreet waltz rather than a hectic gallop. For one thing, everything was a little retarded, including this season's opening. The City Center Joffrey Ballet opened a couple of weeks later than usual, and the American Ballet Theater, which in recent years has spent Christmas in town, is this year in Washington and will not reach New York until after the new year.

title: Donations to Neediest Are Below 1970 Pace
Nixon Mourns O'Donnell; Calls Him Foremost Patriot
description: KEY BISCAYNE, Fla., Dec. 27 (UPI) Nixon today mourned the death of Gen. Emmett (Rosy) O'Donnell, whom he described as one of this country's foremost patriots.

title: Nedda Casei Is Wed to Professor
description: SCARSDALE, N. Y., Dec. 27Nedda Casei, mezzosoprano of the Metropolitan Opera, and Prof. John A. Wiles Jr., baritone, who is a professor of voice and director of opera staging at Michigan State University, were married here yesterday afternoon. The Rev. Dr. James S. Stewart performed the ceremony in the Hitchcock Memorial Presbyterian Church.

title: Artists Have Mixed Feelings About Irish Tax Haven
description: DUBLINTwo years after Ireland became the first country to exempt artists from income taxes, a total of 262 writers, painters and composers have found a haven with uncertain blessings.

title: Article 2  No Title
description: DETROIT; Dec. 27 (UPI)Four Stanford players combined for 61 points tonight as the Indians beat Bowling Green of Ohio, 9082, in the, first round of the Motor City tournament.

title: Appeal for Damages Upheld After Refusal of Operation
description: A Federal court has ruled that a hospital can be held liable for proved damages for pain and suffering and for violation of constitutional rights caused by refusal to perform a sterilization operation on a woman.

title: U.S. Again Relying Heavily on Airpower to Achieve Its Objectives in Indochina
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 27Nearly seven years after President Lyndon B. Johnson began sustained bombing of North Vietnam in an effort to save the South, another American President is relying heavily on airpower to achieve his objectives in Indochina.

title: Troops Cut to 158,300
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, Dec. 27 (UPI)The United States command said today that American troop strength dropped to 158,300 men as of last Thursday.

title: Korea's Real Emergency
description: The extraordinary powers President Park Chung Hee has just obtained from the National Assembly through a series of secret and highhanded Maneuvers apparently are designed to deal with an imminent period of painful adjustment in South Korea's economy, politics and international status rather than any threat from the North. Outside observers, including the State Department and the American Embassy in Seoul, have detected signs neither of the North Korean preparations for an early invasion of the South, which Mr. Park professes to see, nor of a stepup in infiltration of agents and Communist terrorism.

title: Heavy American Bombing Of North Goes Into 3d Day
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, Tuesday, Dec. 28Heavy American bombing raids against North Vietnam went into the third consecutive day this morning while the United States command kept its official silence about details of the attacks and allied losses.

title: 3,000 U.S.Medical Students at School Abroad
description: GUADALAJARA, Mexico, Dec. 13Claude D'Alberti of Fort Lee, N. J., had a solid B average when he was graduated from Queens College in June as a biology major.

title: 18 ARAB COUNTRIES BEGIN CAIRO TALKS
description: CAIRO, Dec. 27 (Reuters) Delegates of 18 Arab countries held intensive discussions today in an attempt to coordinate military and economic strategy against Israel.

title: KIALOA HOLDS LEAD IN RACE TO HOBART
description: SYDNEY, Australia, Dec. 27 (Reuter)The American yacht Kialoa led the SydneyHobart race into Bass Strait tonight with many other yachts almost in line abreast in the greatest battle for line honors in the 27year history of the race.

title: No Draft Calls in January; Delay Till April Is Possible
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 27  Defense Secretary Melvin R. Laird said today there would be no draft calls in January and perhaps none until April. Two military pay increases totaling $3billion a year, Mr. Laird said, are expected to lead to increased enlistments and decreased departures from the active duty forces.

title: Queens Collision Kills One
description: Mrs. June Bostic, 40 years old, of 11459th Street, Hollis, Queens, was killed yesterday when the car in which she was riding and another collided on the Interborough Parkway in Richmond Hill, Queens, the police reported. Her husband, Joseph, 50, suffered two broken legs in the mishap.

title: TV: Black Paper on White Racism Is Questioned
description: Black Journal is produced by black people to black people for the liberation of black people. It is a tool in the struggle for dignity and pride in ourselves.

title: 3 Debutantes Presented
description: Three young women were presented at the seventh annual debutante ball of the Metropolitan Club last night. They were the Misses Perry Lee and Warren Waite Barber, twin daughters of Mrs. James Laurance Barber and the late Mr. Barber, and Louellen Mulligan, daughter of John B. Mulligan and the late Mrs. Mulligan. All three are related to club members. Mrs. Paul Porzclt was chairman for the event, held at the club.

title: Patricia M. LeClair Bride in Riverdale
description: Miss Patricia Marie LeClair, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Marshall LeClair of Putnam, Conn, was married yesterday afternoon to Gregory Arthur Sullivan, son of Mr. and Mrs. Edmund Burke Sullivan of Rumson, N.J.

title: Congressmen Score Bombings
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 27Antiwar forces on Capitol Hill reacted quickly to the news of the massive bombing raids on North Vietnam.

title: OUTPUT OF STEEL DECLINES FOR WEEK
description: Production of steel in the week ended Saturday was 1,948,000 tons, the American Iron and Steel Institute reported yesterday. This was a decline of 3.9 per cent from the 2,028,000 tons produced the week before.

title: 33 INMATES REBEL Al CIVIL JAIL HERE
description: The inmates of Manhattan's Civil Jail seized all but the reception foyer of the fourstory lockup on West 37th Street last night in a raucous, occasionally violent protest against conditions in the jail and long delays in their court cases.

title: PANEL PROPOSES OTB FOR SUFFOLK
description: HAUPPAUGE, L.I., Dec. 27A $250,000 offtrack betting. system for Suffolk County, independent of New York City's, was proposed today to the County Legislature.

title: 25 War Protesters Are Held After Seizing Betsy Ross House
description: PHILADELPHIA, Dec. 27Twentyfive antiwar demonstrators occupied the Betsy Ross House here for an hour today in protest against continuation of the war in Vietnam. All were arrested.

title: Merger News
description: The Cerro Corporation announced yesterday it had signed an agreement giving it the initial option to buy 2.91 million shares of the Behring Corporation's common stock, or about 55 per cent of Behring's shares outstanding. The stock belongs to Kenneth E. Behring, president and chairman of Behring, a Flori d a residential construction a n d community development company. C. Gordon Mur phy, president of Cerro, a major metals concern, said the option was in force until Jan. 31, 1972, at 5 a share, payable in cash and notes. Behring closed yesterday on the American Stock Exchange at 8, up .

title: Behan's Last Play Complete as Wife Uncovers 20 Pages
description: DUBLIN, Dec. 27 (AP)Twenty sheets of manuscript discovered in a briefcase have completed Brendan Behan's last play. It will be performed at next year's Dublin Festival under the title Richard's Cork Leg.

title: About as Mini as It Can Be
description: Jean Muir, the London designer, has a. new fashion idea that's enough to make a microoriented teenybopper blush. It's a miniculotteblack mat jersey with big batwing sleeves and a tiny, pleated culotte skirt that comes to a point in front and is cut up on the sides to well beyond the modesty mark. (Which is probably why Miss Muir recommends wearing it over opaque tights.)

title: Fall Kills Rhode Island Man
description: CRANSTON, R. I., Dec. 27 (AP)Claude D. Ridhard, 33 years old, of Pawtucket, plunged 155 feet to his death today when a wooden platform atop a chimney at the power plant of the Rhode Island Medical Center gave way. Mr. Richard, a steeplejack, was working on top of the chimney.

title: Some HardBoiled Answers to J B. Priestley
description: To the Editor:

title: Monmouth Gains in Jersey
description: UPPER MONTCLAIR, N.J., Dec. 27Four foul shots in the last 31 seconds by Pete Cusick, a guard, carried Monmouth College into the semifinals of the sixth annual New Jersey Kiwanis tourney tonight at Montclair State College as the Hawks downed Hartwick of Oneonta, N.Y., 7875.

title: State Democrats Barred From Meeting on Burns
description: RIVERHEAD, L. I., Dec. 27State Supreme Court Justice Frank P. DeLuca issued an injunction today prohibiting the State Democratic Committee from holding a special meeting tomorrow to elect a successor to the state Democratic chairman, John J. Burns.

title: Black End Fits In Smoothly at Alabama
description: MIAMI, Dec. 27  When Coach Paul (Bear) Bryant phoned John Mitchell Jr. person to person and invited him to visit the University of Alabama as a football prospect earlier this year, Mitchell was flattered, but not awed.

title: LINDSAY 72 BASE CLOSED TO PRESS
description: Mayor Lindsay's campaign headquarters in midtown Manhattan have been locked to outsiders.

title: Library's Technical Unit Needs $76,000 to Stay Open
description: One of the world's largest and most comprehensive collections of science and technology matedais  750,000 books and documents, none of them duplicates is scheduled to be closed to all users after Friday by the New York Public Library.

title: Tired Transit Scenario
description: The legacy of the blustery Michael J. Quill, who died a few weeks after the 1966 subway strike, is the nonsensical tradition that transit union negotiations must always wind up in a New Year's Day cliffhanger. That threadbare scenario is being played out again this week, even though Mr. Quill's successor as head of the Transport Workers Union, Matthew Guinan, is an eminently practical man with neither flare nor appetite for melodramatics.

title: Landscaping Their Yard With Scavenged Relics
description: Bits of New York structuresa lintel here, a carved head, there, a piece of Westchester side Walkdot the landscape, around the home of Marvin and Lilli Ann Killen Rosenberg. For the eight years they have owned a yellow shingle house on a hilly street in Little Neck, Queens, they have been scavenging at demolition sites and bringing home the decorative architectural fragments they found. Even the bricks that pave part of their front yard and form the paths and steps that, go down the side of the hill alongside their house were picked up one by one.

title: Pact to Disarm Bengali Rebels Reported
description: DACCA, Pakistan, Dec. 27India and the new regime proclaimed by the Bengalis in East Pakistan have worked out a major agreement under which the Bengali guerrillas will be reorganized and disarmed within the next 10 days and the Indian forces in East Pakistan withdrawn in two to three months, an authoritative Indian source said today.

title: HUMPHREY URGES HALT IN BOMBING
description: PHILADELPHIA, Dec. 27Senator Hubert H. Humphrey accused the Nixon Administration today of escalating the war in Southeast Asia and called for a total cessation of the bombing of North Vietnam.

title: TOKYO DEFERS VOTE ON OKINAWAN BILLS
description: TOKYO, Dec. 27 (Reuters)A special session of the Japanese Pariament ended tonight without the Government's having won approval for legislation vital to the United States return of Okinawa to Japanese rule next year.

title: Chinese Charge Indian Forces Entered Tibet Again
description: HONG KONG, Dec. 27 China today charged new intrusions by Indian forces into Tibet and lodged a strong protest with the Indian Government.

title: GAS FELLS FIREMEN FIGHTING FILM BLAZE
description: Laughing gas formed by burning film overcame a dozen firemen yesterday as they fought flames in a fivestory commercial building at 145 Reade Street in lower Manhattan.

title: The Farm RevolutionII
description: A million familysized farms were consolidated out of existence in the 1950's and another million in the 1960's. For exfarmers, the postwar revolution in agriculture has doomed their cherished way of life. Small towns which live by serving farmers have also suffered. It has been estimated that one smalltown businessman goes under for every six farmers who quit farming.

title: Puerto Rico Contract
description: Combustion Engineering, Inc., said yesterday its Lummus division had been chosen by the Upjohn Company to design and oversee construction of a $30million pharmaceutical complex in Puerto Rico on a 60acre tract 50 miles from San Juan.

title: Customs Bureau Reports Increased Seizures of Drugs
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 27 The Customs Bureau of the Department of the Treasury said today that it had achieved notable success in 1971 against the smuggling of heroin and other dangerous drugs.

title: Some HardBoiled Answers to J B. Priestley; We prefer a white egg with [the] truth.
description: To the Editor:

title: Protest at Hospital
description: TRAVIS AIR FORCE BASE, Calif., Dec. 27 (UPI)Eighteen Army drug patients and four civilian sympathizers abandoned today their barricade of a secondstory ward in an Air Force hospital and were driven away in a military bus.

title: LAIRD WARNS BIG U.S. RAIDS IN NORTH MAY BE REPEATED TO PROTECT G.I.'S IN SOUTH
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 27Secretary of Defense Melvin R. Laird warned North Vietnam today that largescale bombing raids like the ones mounted by American bombers over the weekend might be repeated occasionally.

title: About Pro Football
description: Of the four teams that lost in the division playoffs last weekend, the Minnesota Vikings need the most profound pondering of their position. Perhaps what the Vikings need also is Francis Asbury Tarkentonthe return of the prodigal one to the land of 10,000 lakes. The Browns were not expected to beat the Colts. The Chiefs provided half the actors in the best game of this season, or possibly any other, and lost only because one of the sport's top kickers, Jan Stenerud, missed a 31yard field goal. The Redskins went as far as George Allen could prod or push them, further than most people thought possible.

title: STATE ADDS EIGHT TO CHECK CON ED
description: The Public Service Commission said yesterday that it had assigned eight additional staff members to its New York office to help Consolidated Edison resolve a mushrooming number of consumer complaints about overcharging.

title: African Lands Taking First Small Steps to Preserve Environment
description: DAKAR, Senegal, Dec. 27The police have finally succeeded in chasing local building contractors away from one of this city's magnificent beaches, which they had been digging up as a source of sand.

title: Some HardBoiled Answers to J B. Priestley
description: To the Editor:

title: Police Begin a Systematic ,Check on Individual Prostitutes and Pimps in Drive to Cut Crime
description: Police Department officials said informally yesterday that the department's public morals administrative division had set about systematically collecting information on individual prostitutes and their pimps in an effort to combat major crimes associated with prostitution.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: Horace Mann and Barnard Plan To Merge Schools in The Bronx
description: The Horace Mann School and the Barnard School for Boys, both oldestablished private day schools with adjoining campuses in the Riverdale section of the Bronx, are planning a Merger that would eventually produce a coeducational institution with grades from nursery through high school.

title: Snow and Rain Hit Coast; 300 Cars Stranded in Pass
description: LOS ANGELES, Dec. 27 (AP) A storm struck Southern California today, with more than a foot of snow that stranded hundreds of motorists on a mountain pass highway and with coastal rain that caused flooding and mudslides. But there were no reports of deaths or serious injuries.

title: 2 Turks Doomed in Slaying
description: ISTANBUL, Turkey, Dec. 27 (AP)  A martiallaw court handed down death sentences today to two men and three women, including a husband and wife, for their part in urban terrorism that led to the kidnapping and slaying of the Israeli Consul General, Ephraim Elrom, in May. The court then commuted the sentences of the three women to life imprisonment.

title: GEORGE A. LOEB
description: George A. Loeb, who had retired from Burnham & Co., investment bankers, died Sunday of a heart ailment at his home in Sarasota, Fla. He was 61 years old and a former resident of Rye, N. Y.

title: Strikers Reject Offer
description: PHILADELPHIA, Dec. 27 (AP)Some 300 striking toll bridge workers have rejected the latest offer of the Delaware River Port Authority. The members of the Transport Workers Union voted 299 to 1 last night to continue their onemonthold strike.

title: Accounting Board Publishes Proposal
description: The Accounting Principles Board published yesterday the text of a proposed ruling that will allow many multinational corporations to postpone recognition of profits or losses resulting from the devaluation of the dollar.

title: South Ends North Winning Streak on Late Score,76
description: MIAMI, Fla., Dec. 27 (AP)Tommy Durrance of Florida slammed over from the 1yard line late in the last quarter and Tennessee's Bobby Majors kicked the extra point that gave the South a 76 victory over the North in the Shrine allstar college football game tonight.

title: City Gets $2Million In Interest Earnings On Pay Deductions
description: The city earned $2.6million interest in the last 14 months on payroll deductions of city employes held by banks in trust funds, Controller Abraham D. Beame said yesterday.

title: Sports of The Times
description: The name of Ebenezer Scrooge does not appear on the roster of any team in the National Football League. Nor it listed on any tabulation of frontoffice hierarchy, including the top command post on Park Avenue. But it almost seemed over the weekend as if pro football had reached all the way into Charles Dickens's touching Christmas Carol to capture the spirit of Ebenezer Scrooge. He despised everything about Christmas. Bah! Humbug! were spat out in scorn. Christmas is the one day in the year that has the overriding motif of peace and goodwill to men. Maybe the football fathers had their arms twisted by the television ogres who own them. Assigning the exact responsibility probably isn't even that important, but the fact remains that the violence of pro football spilled into millions of homes all over the land on Christmas Day, and that has to be fundamentally wrong.

title: Article 4  No Title
description: CHARLOTTE, N. C., Dec, 27 (UPI)Robert McAdoo scored 28 points to lead North Carolina to a 9678 victory over Harvard tonight before a crowd of 11,462. Jim Fitzsimmons of Harvard was the game's high scorer with 32 points.

title: AU DRAWS 2 BIDS FOR MARCH BOUT
BRANDT IS IN FLORIDA TO TALK WITH NIXON
description: TAMPA, Fla, Dec. 27 (Reuters)Chancellor Willy Brandt of West Germany arrived today for talks with President Nixon at the. Florida White House in Key Biscayne.

title: Project Crime Rate Called Less Than Neighborhood's
description: The city's Housing Author, ity contended yesterday that on the basis of official crime index statistics for the city in the first six months of 1971, the crime rate in public housing projects was invariably lower than [in] the surrounding neighborhoods.

title: John J. Robinson, Broker, Was Star Football Center
description: GARDEN CITY, L. I., Dec. 27 John J. Robinson, a former member of the New York Stock Exchange, who was allAmerica center of the University of Notre Dune football team in 1934, died today of a heart attack at his home. He was 58 years old and lived at 111 15th Street.

title: ALEXANDER H. BARTH
description: POUND RIDGE, N. Y., Dec. 27Alexander H. Barth, former president of the Bear Mill Manufacturing Company, textile convertors, and former vice president of the Barth Equipment Company, died Saturday at his home here. His age was 71.

title: G.E. Will Raise Most Appliance Prices
description: The General Electric Company announced yesterday that it will raise prices by an average of less than 2 per cent on most General Electric and Hotpoint major appliances, beginning Jan. 1.

title: Text of the Pay Board's Statement on Executive. Compensation
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 27Following is the text of the report of the Executive Compensation Committee adopted by the Pay Board (announced Dec. 17), edited to reflect changes made by the Pay Board staff in order to have the report conform to recently enacted legislation:

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: Turnover Sets Mark In Checking Accounts
description: The turnover of checking accounts at the nation's banks soared during November to a new alltime high, the Federal Reserve Board reported yesterday. In 233 metropolitan centers across the country, demands deposits turned over 87 times at a seasonally adjusted rate, the report said, up from a revised rate of 83.3 times in October and 75.6 times in November, 1970.

title: ChristmasTree Burning Called Worst Disposal
description: The state's Commissioner of Environmental Conservation, Henry L. Diamond, warned yesterday against the illegal disposing of Christmas trees by open burning.

title: Joseph Evans, Editorial Editor Of Wall St. Journal, Dies at 52
description: Joseph E. Evans, editorial page editor of the Wall Street Journal since 1969, died yesterday, apparently of a heart attack. He was 52 years old and lived at 450 Highbrook Avenue in Pelham Manor, N.Y.

title: PostChristmas Shoppers Jam Stores
description: On the first shopping day after Christmas, the big stores in New York were almost as jammed as the days before Christmasonly there was a bit of a difference.

title: Peace on Earth? Not on Fifth Ave.
description: The special of the day in a delicatessan window was still Peace on Earth instead of tunaonrye yesterday, but the crowds on Fifth Avenue and in the city's department stores were not distractedthey headed straight for the sale counters and the refund desks.

title: Dacca Is Still Isolated From Rest of World
description: DACCA, Dec. 27 (AP)Nearly two weeks after the Pakistani surrender, Dacca remains almost cut off from the rest of the world.

title: An Agent Who Defected to U.S. Goes Back to Soviet
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 27A Soviet intelligence agent who defected to the United States in October returned to the Soviet Union last night after eluding his American escorting officer, the State Department announced today.

title: Some HardBoiled Answers to J B. Priestley
description: To the Editor:

title: Some HardBoiled Answers to J B. Priestley
description: To the Editor:

title: 67% in Survey on Caney Say Most People Would Shoot Civilians if Ordered
description: PHILADELPHIA, Dec. 27A Harvard survey of public attitudes toward First Lieut. William L. Calley Jr. has found that twothirds of those questioned said that most people would shoot unarmed civilians if ordered to do so.

title: TransAtlantic Transplant Of. a Kidney Is Completed
description: SAN FRANCISCO, Dec. 27 (AP)  The first transAtlantic kidney transplant has been successfully completed after a kidney from a man who died Christmas Eve was given 37 hours later to a recipient in Holland.

title: Article 3  No Title
description: KANSAS CITY, Dec. 27 (AP) Colorado scored the game's first 9 points and continued to an 8362 victory over Oklahoma State tonight in the first round of the Big Eight Conference basketball tournament.

title: 8 Arrested in South Korea In Hotel Fire Fatal to 158
description: SEOUL, South Korea, Tuesday, Dec. 28 (UPI)South Korean authorities arrested eight persons before dawn today in connection with the Christmas fire in a 22story hotel that killed 158.

title: Screen: For the Young
description: The Movies for Kids program that opened Sunday at Alice Tully Hall, Lincoln Center, is generally an excellent roundup of features that have already proven their worth for young audiences. Sadly, the one premiere of the batch titled Tiki Tiki and showing this afternoon at 3 o'clock, is the one catch to, the whole endeavor, sponsored by the center's Film Society. Wise parents will take the childrenor is it vice versa?to that marvelously funny Mr. Hulot's Holiday instead, at 11 o'clock this morning.

title: Financial Daily Goes Weekly
description: The Media General Financial Daily is suspending publication of its daily, editionsTuesday through Fridaywith the Dec. 31 issue but will continue to publish the weekend edition. Alan S. Donnahoe, president and publisher, said in Richmond yesterday, Demand in the immediately foreseeable future is not enough to justify continued publication on a daily basis.

title: Some HardBoiled Answers to J B. Priestley; Tut why do you have to print this stuff?
description: To the Editor:

title: Advertising:
description: Ralston Purina, St. Louis, has given a nice big additional piece of business to a hometown agency, D'ArcyMacMan usIn termarco.

title: Commodity Price Index Up 0.6 From WeekAga Level
Cash Change Barred To Food Stamp Users
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 27 (AP)The Agriculture Department has decided to kill a yearold rule allowing food stamp spenders to collect up to 49 cents in change when they turn in coupons for for groceries.

title: St. Louis Trounces Yale
description: ST. LOUIS, Dec. 27 (AP)St. Louis University mounted decisive drives in both halves tonight in coasting to 9570 victory over Yale in the opening round of the Billikens holiday basketball tournament.

title: A 94.3% OnTime Record Is Reported by the L.I.R.R.
description: The Long Island Rail Road released figures yesterday claiming an ontime record of 94.3 per cent for its trains during 1971. On time, the railroad said means no more than five minutes late.

title: HIGH SOVIET OFFICIAL OPENS VISIT TO CHILE
description: MOSCOW, Dec. 27The Soviet Union, after a year of striving not to embarrass Chilean Marxists with too rapid an embrace, today sent its first toplevel delegation to Chile since the election victory of President Salvador Allende Gossens.

title: After the Knapp Hearings
description: The Knapp Commission has performed an extraordinary public service. Though its final report and recommendations are yet to come, It has already moved two basic issues out of the realm of guess and rumor: Corruption in the Police Department transcended rotten apple dimensions; and the department's machinery for supervision and investigation, as well as the city administration's capacity to press for reform, were proved gravely deficient prior to the appointment Commissioner Murphy.

title: Ziegler Team Reported About to Go to Peking
description: KEY BISCAYNE, Fla., Dec. 27 (UPI)An advance team of White House aides and technicians, including the Presidential press secretary, Ronald L. Ziegler, will leave for Peking on Wednesday to prepare for President Nixon's planned Feb. 2128 visit, the Columbia Broadcasting System said today. The Florida White House refused to confirm or deny the report.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: Penny Coleman Wed in Vermont
description: WINHALL, Vt., Dec. 27Miss Patricia Coleman and Daniel O'Donnell of Santa Barbara, Calif., were married this afternoon at the home here of her parents, Mr. and Mrs. C. Payson Coleman of Winhall and Lawrence, L.I. The ceremony was performed. by Samuel Ogden Landgrove, Winhall Justice of the Peace. The bridegroom is the son of Mrs. James Joseph O'Donnell of Palm Springs, Calif., and the late Dr. O'Donnell, a general practitioner in geriatrics at the Desert Hospital there.

title: Bhutto Meets With Mujib; Says He'll Continue Talrs
description: RAWALPINDI, Pakistan, Dec. 27President Zulfikar Ali Bhutto said tonight that he had met with Sheik Mujibur Rahman, the detained leader of East Pakistan's Bengali separatists.

title: Laotians Evacuate 30,000 From Periled Long Tieng
description: VIENTIANE, Laos, Dec. 27 (Reuters)The Laotian Government has evacuated 30,000 women and children from Long Tieng, site of the military base that is seriously threatened by North Vietnamese troops following their sweep across the nearby Plaine des Jarres.

title: News Analysis
description: A prominent Wall Street bond specialist, asked to comment recently on the financing of the New York City Transit Authority, said: The Mad Hatter and Mr. Micawber, working together, could never dream up anything as strange.

title: Soviet Denounces Raids
description: MOSCOW, Dec. 27 (UPI)The Soviet press agency Tass today called the intensified United States bombing of North Vietnam provocative and adventuristic.

title: Article 5  No Title
description: OKLAHOMA CITY, Dec. 27 (UPI)Army defeated Indiana State, 8375, tonight in the opening game of the 36th annual AllCollege basketball tournament.

title: John W. Edelman, Former Head Of Senior Citizens Unit, Dies
description: ARLINGTON, Va., Dec. 27John W. Edelman, a pioneer trade unionist and consumer advocate, died today at his home here. He was 78 years old.

title: Chemists Find Analysis Of Poison in Shellfish
description: BERKELEY, Calif., Dec. 27 (AP)The poison that makes it so dangerous to eat shellfish at certain seasons has been analyzed by University of California chemical researchers in a 10year study, the university announced today.

title: Some HardBoiled Answers to J B. Priestley
description: To the Editor:

title: Appeal Against Reprisals
description: DACCA, Dec, 27 (UPI)The Bangladesh government appealed to Bengalis today not to take revenge upon those who had collaborated with Pakistan.

title: JACKSONVILLE RIOT CAUSES INJURY TO 5
description: JACKSONVILLE, Fla., Dec. 27 (UPI)At least five persons, all white, were injured today when a crowed of about 400 blacks battled the police and motorists for about an hour in an incident apparently ignited by pranksters.

title: SWEDES WILL END ASSEMBLY LINES
description: PHILADELPHIA, Dec. 27To reduce the dehumanizing effects of modern factory life, it was reported here today, two Swedish automobile makers, Volvo and Saab, have begun to eliminate that pillar of mass production, the assembly line.

title: November Trade Deficit Had Sharp Improvement
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 27The deficit in the nation's balance of. trade showed a sharp improvement in November but the figures continued to be distorted by dock strikes, the Commerce Department reported today.

title: Tracks Upheld on TV of Races; OTB to Extend Monticello Show
TESTIMONY ENDS AT DOWDY TRIAL
description: BALTIMORE, Dec. 27  Testimony in the briberyconspiracy trial of Representative John Dowdy ended today in United States District Court, where the defendant's principal accuser denied that he once bragged of falsifying evidence against the Texas Democrat.

title: Transit Negotiations Center on Working Conditions
description: Transit negotiators sought yesterday to resolve questions relating to working conditions before turning to the critical economic issues later in the week.

title: Books of The Times
description: Let HISTORY JUDGE, The Origins and Consequences of Stalinism. By Roy A, Medvedev. Translated by Colleen Taylor. Edited by David Joraysky and Gsorge Haupt. 566 Pages. Alfred A. Knopf, $12.50.

title: U.S. Concerns Still Seek To Expand Into Europe
description: PARIS, Dec. 27Even after a currency realignment that bas made acquisitions with dollars about 10 per cent more expensive, international American companies still are looking fondly at expansion in Western Europe.

title: A. G. GRANT JR. DEAD; POPULARIZED KAYAK
description: BEDFORD, N. Y., Dec. 27Alexander Galt Grant Jr., who retired last year from Swissair and who helped introduce the folding kayak or foldboat in this country, died yesterday in Northern Westchester Hospital. He was 57 years old and lived on Greenwich Road.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: ASHBROOK, HARTKE SET FOR 1972 RACE
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 27 Two pending announcements about the 1972 Presidential race have marked the political talk in the capital in the quiet holiday absence of Congress.

title: National Drive Seeks Amnesty For Deserters and Draft Evaders
description: BOSTON, Dec. 27  A national debate is growing around the issue of amnesty for thousands of young men who have avoided or deserted from service in the Vietnam war.

title: Advertising:
description: A year ago last October, Robert 1. Kesner at the age of 55 gave up the world of advertising and marketing, which had him commuting to New York every day, to stay home and become a newspaper publisher.

title: WOMAN, 28, HELD IN STRANGE DEATH
description: A 28yearold woman, a graduate psychology student at City College, has been held in $100,000 bail since Nov. 30 as a material witness in connection with a grand jury investigation of another woman's death last September, it was disclosed yesterday.

title: U.S. Copters Downed
description: SAIGON, Tuesday, Dec. 28 (AP)  Communistled forces shot down seven United States helicopters supporting South Vietnamese militiamen in a daylong operation yesterday 27 miles northwest of Saigon, military spokesmen reported today.

title: Colts Out to Beat the. Heat, Then Dolphins
description: With the Super Bowl preliminaries half over, Mrs. Willie Ray Smith of Beaumont, Tex, mother of Bubba and Tody is halfway toward getting her wish.

title: LEGISLATORS OPEN SESSION IN ALBANY ON BUDGET CRISIS
description: ALBANY, Dec. 27The Legislature met briefly and ceremonially in special session today on Governor Rockefeller's proposal to bridge an estimated 15month budget deficit of $1.5billion.

title: 5 Police Officers Cleared of Failing To Shut Bottle Club
description: A police inspector, a deputy inspector, a captain and two lieutenants were cleared yesterday of rharges that they had failed to take action against an illegal Harlem bottle club.

title: Rum Customer Victor; Earnings at $1,001,448
description: AURORA, Ill., Dec. 27 (AP) Rum Customer, driven by Del Insko, won the. $5,000 Millionaire Mile purse at Aurora Downs today making him the richest moneywinning p acer in history.

title: Coast Colleges to Get Fund For FreeStudy Experiment
description: The California State Colleges will receive $451,428 from the Carnegie Corporation of New York to initiate experimental undegraduate projects under a grant announced yesterday.

title: IN THE NATION
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 26In the yearend flood of selfcongratulation now flowing from the Nixon Administration, there seem to be one or two currents really worth talking about. This is fortunate, for the end of 1971 and the dread onslaught'of 1972 mean that the season of hyperbole is upon us; what the Republicans say. they have wrought, the Democrats must soon put asunder, and heaven help the man in search of calm appraisal or sweet reason.

title: MARTIN STUDY HIT BY 19 ECONOMISTS
description: A group of 19 prominent economists led by James H, Lorie of the University of Chicago has attacked the report of William McChesney Martin Jr. on the securities markets and has urged Congressional leaders to oppose it.

title: Legislators in Albany Look to Their Homes
description: ALBANY, Dec. 27State legislators arrived here today seemingly More concerned whetherthey would be home for New Year's Eve than whether the state's fiscal problems would be solved this Week.

title: Cologne Bank Robbed; Police Hostages Freed
description: COLOGNE, West Germany, Dec. 27 (UPI)Three men armed with submachine guns robbed a bank of some $96,700 today and fled with two police officials who had volunteered themselves as hostages.

title: Excess Mercury Found In Ancient Fish Remains
description: PHILADELPHIA, Dec. 27Preserved samples of fish taken from archeological sites ranging In age from 300 to 2,000 years contained concentrations of mercury comparable with those found in living fish today, Dr. Edwin Wilmsen, a University of Michigan scientist, reported today.

title: Wife Reported Seeking Divorce From Dayan
description: JERUSALEM, Dec. 27 (UPI)The Jerusalem Post said today that the wife of the Defense Minister, Moshe. Dayan, has begun divorce proceedings after 36 years of marriage.

title: Top Executives Confident on 72
description: Top executives of several leading corporations expressed confidence yesterday that 1972 would be a good year and that the trade and monetary problems, which endangered the United States and world economies in 1971, were on their way to resolution.

title: Emily A. Fowler Becomes a Bride In Pennsylvania
description: BRYN MAWR, Pa., Dec. 27The Chapel of the Bryn Mawr Presbyterian Church was the setting this afternoon for the marriage of Miss Emily Arthur Fowler, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. David Anderson Fowler, to William Price Newhall 2d, son of Mr. and Mrs. Paul Kurtz Newhall of Riverside, Conn. The ceremony was performed by the Rev. David S. Watermulder.

title: Brimmer Urges Reserve Not to Aim at Single Goal
description: NEW ORLEANS, Dec. 27ikndrew F. Brimmer, a member of the board of governors of the Federal Reserve System, said today that it would be extremely risky for the Federal Reserve to base its policy decisions and actions on any single objective  the money supply or any other.

title: WHEAT FUTURES DECLINE IN PRICE
description: Secretary of Agriculture Earl L. Butz's opposition to a bill that would increase wheat and feed grain price support rates to farmers by 25 per cent stimulated selling of grain futures on the Chicago Board of Trade yesterday.

title: At 11th Cornelia Cotillion, 19 Make Bows
description: Nineteen young women were presented to the Right Rev. Jonathan Goodhue Sherman, Episcopal Bishop of Long Island, at the 11th Cornelia Cotillion in the WaldofAstoria's Grand Ballroom last night. The presentation ceremony was, in past years, held at the Episcopal Cathedral of the Incarnation in Garden City, L.I., and followed by a cotillion at the now defunct Garden City Hotel.

title: Executive Changes
description: Walt Disney Productions, Burbank, Calif., has elected Donn B. Tatum, chairman of the board and chief executive officer and E. Cardon Walker, president and chief operating officer, Both served with the late.Roy 0. Disney on the corporation's executive committee. Mr. Tatum formerly, was president, and Mr. Walker, executive vice president and chief operating officer. Richard T. Morrow, recently named an advisory director of the company, has been elected to a full membership on the board.

title: McCreary Stays With Bluest
description: ST. LOUIS, Dep. 27 (AP)Bill McCreary, dismissed last Saturday as head coach of the St. Louis Blues, said today he would remain with the National IIdckey League club as assistant general manager.

title: Providence, Louisville Victors With St. Peter's and Fordham
Some HardBoiled Answers to J B. Priestley
description: To the Editor:

title: Excerpts From Laird's News Conference on Bombing of North and Defense Department Activities in 71
description: Following are excerpts from a news conference by Secretary of Defense Melvin R. Laird in Washington yesterday, as recorded by The New York Times through the facilities of A.B.C. News:

title: Mrs. John Curry, 87, Dies; Widow of Tammany Leader
description: Mrs. John F. Curry, widow of the former Tammany leader, died Sunday at her home, 1010 Fifth Avenue. Her age was 87.

title: India Says She Is Weighing Trials of Pakistani Troops
description: NEW DELHI; Dec. 27The Indian Government said tonight that it would consider the holding of warcrimes trials of Pakistani military personnel charged with heinous crimes in East Pakistan.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: SeaLand's Rate Offer Called Ruinous
description: American Export Isbrandtsen Lines has complained to the Federal Martime Commission that the rates a major competitor has filed to carry United States military cargo on the Atlantic are so low as to be predatory.

title: Greenpoint Detour On Today
description: The Greenpoint Avenue Bridge in Brooklyn, linking Long Island City, Queens, with Greenpoint, will be closed to all traffic for emergency repairs from 9:30 A.M. today until Thursday, the Traffic Department said yesterday. The department listed alternative routes for motorists as Pulaski Bridge. which links McGuinness Boulevard in Greenpoint with Jackson Avenue in Long Island City, and BrooklynQueens Expressway, which connects Brooklyn and Queens by way of the Kosciusko Bridge to the Long Island Expressway. Buses will be detoured from the Greenpoint Avenue Bridge to the BrooklynQueens Expressway.

title: War Foes Reject U.S. Plan to Reopen Statue of Liberty
description: Vietnam veterans barricaded inside the Statue of Liberty yesterday rejected a Government compromise designed to reopen the historic monument to the public while allowing the veterans to continue their antiwar protest.

title: MRS. FULTON CUTTING
description: Mrs. Mary I. Amory Cutting, the widow of Dr. Fulton Cutting, a pioneer in the development of radio who died on Dec. 4, 1967, died yesterday at her home, 15 East 88th Street. She was 84 years old and had homes also in Brookville and Southampton, L.I.

title: A OUBLE CROSS CHARGED ON FARE
description: ALBANY, Dec. 28  Democrats accused Republicans today of a double cross in the wording of legislative proposals for a 35cent transit fare in New York City.

title: 60,000 in Coast Union
description: SAN FRANCISCO Dec. 28 (AP)The I.L.A. lists about 50,000 members.

title: Six Key Sales Executives Promoted at Loews Hotels
description: The Loew's Corporation announced yesterday the promotion of six key sales executives at the Loews Hotel divisions.

title: Sports of The Times
description: Among friends, Mrs. Grantland Rice didn't mind telling of the night her squire was missing and unaccounted for until those desperate hours when the dawn, on silversandaled feet, crept down Fifth Avenue like a frightened girl. Kit Rice had perfect faith in her guy, but she was a wife, so she worried. When at long last she heard him enter the apartment above Central Park, there was an edge of panic in her voice.

title: BENGALI SUGGESTS TIES WITH THE U.S.
description: DACCA, Pakistan, Dec. 28 The acting president of the Bengalis East Pakistan regime said today that his government would welcome the establishment of diplomatic relations with the United States, but that the United States must take the initiative.

title: Candidate Lindsay
description: Mayor Lindsay has now officially joined the growing band of Democrats who believe they can defeat President Nixon in 1972 and would like the privilege of trying.
