In spite of the Mayor's brief life as a Democratfour monthshis entering the race for his party's nomination is neither whimsical nor unreasonable. Whatever his chances of getting it, he should have no trouble in making a case.

title: Dayans Given a Divorce After 36Year Marriage
description: TEL AVIV, Dec. 28 (Reuters)Israel's Defense Minister, Moshe Dayan, and his wife, Ruth, were divorced today after 36 years of marriage.

title: LINDSAY, IN RACE, SCOPES HIS RIVALS
description: MIAMI, Dec. 28  Mayor Lindsay announced today his candidacy for the Democratic Presidential nomination and at the same time attacked the Nixon Administration and his prospective Democratic rivals.

title: Nixon Signs Welfare Bill And Hails Value of Work
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 28President Nixon signed today a bill requiring most ablebodied welfare recipients to register for jobs or job training, beginning July 1. The President praised the work fare provisions and said, In my judgment, they reflect the national interest.

title: Gerulaitis Reaches Final In Orange Bowl Tennis
description: MIAMI BEACH, Dec. 28 (AP)  Corrado Barrazutti of Italy and Vitas Gerulaitis of New York achieved semifinal victories today in the 18yearsandunder division of the Orange Bowl international junior tennis championships.

title: Advertising:
description: More students in the country's journalism schools are studying advertising than preparing for jobs on the news side, according to Billy I. Ross, chairman of the Department of Mass Communications of Texas Tech University, Lubbock.

title: MAYOR OF ATLANTA URGES ANNEXATION
description: ATLANTA, Dec. 28  Mayor Sam Massell announced yesterday a plan that would more than double the size of this city's land area and change its black majority into a minority.

title: A 2D TRANSIT STRIKE IS THREATENED HERE
description: The threat of a second transit strike in the city at the start of the new year was posed last night when the employes who man the two bridges and seven tunnels under the jurisdiction of the Triborough Bridge and Tunnel Authority authorized a walkout at 1:50 P.M. Friday.

title: Youth Killed in Pakistan
description: KARACHI, Pakistan, Dec. 28 An 18yearold youth was shot and killed and seven other persons were injured today in Quetta, the capital of West Pakistan's Baluchistan Province, in a clash between supporters of President Zulmkar Ali Bhutto's Peoples party and political opponents.

title: Mrs. Ruth Abel Smith Married in Bahamas
description: Mrs. Ruth Abel Smith was Married in Nassau, the Bahamas, yesterday to Harold E. Fitzgibbons Jr., an investment banker with Lehman Btothers here. The Registrar General of the Bahamas performed the ceremony in the garden at the home of Mrs. Donald McKinney, sister of the bride.

title: Clockwork Orange Wins Critics Prize
description: A Clockwork Orange was voted the year's best motion picture and its director, Stanley Kubrick, was named 1971's best director in the 37th annual poll yesterday of The New York Film Critics. Three of the critics seven awards went to The Last Picture Show.

title: State Beef Industry Watching 30 Bulls
description: POUGHQUAG, N. Y.Thirty pampered baby bulls are living a life of luxury, eating and drinking to their hearts content, here at the only bull testing station in New York State in the milling hills of southern Dutchess County, less than two hours from Times Square.

title: SOYBEAN FUTURES RETREAT IN PRICE
description: Heavy selling pushed prices of soybean futures down near the close of trading on the Chicago Board of Trade yester day, and the prices were off 1 cents to 4 cents a bushel.

title: 3 Broadway Musicals to Close This Weekend After Long Runs
description: Three big Broadway musicals, representing a total capital investment of several million dollars, will end their runs this weekend. Two of the, trioPromises, Promises and Companyhave paid back their investors and then Some, while a third, The Rotlichilds, has returned only 25 per cent of the backing.

title: Astrophysicists Support Evidence of Black Hole
description: PHILADELPHIA, Dec. 28Thirtytwo years ago, J. Robert Oppenheimer and Hartland S. Snyder proposed that a great assembly of matter, as in a large, burned out star, would collapse into something so dense that it would become invisible.

title: PLATEAU TOWN LOST TO THE FOE IN LAOS
description: VIETIANE, Laos, Dec. 28 (UPI)North Vietnamese troops scored another victory today in a drive southward through Laos, capturing the town of Paksong and giving them control, of virtually the entire Boloven Plateau.

title: Schuler and Schmidt Gain Post Wrestling Semifinals
description: BROOKVILLE, L. I., Dec. 28Two defending champions, Tom Schuler of Navy and Brian Schmidt of Westchester, gained the semifinals of the C. W. Post invitation wrestling tournament yesterday.

title: I. C. C. Backs Illinois Central Rail Link
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 28 (AP)The Interstate Commerce Commission gave its conditional approval today to the merger of the Gulf, Mobile & Ohio Railroad Company and the Illinois Central Railroad Company into the 9,400mile, 13state Illinois Central Gulf Railroad Company.

title: Dance Courses Urged in Soviet Schools
description: MOSCOW, Dec. 28A former director of the Bolshoi opera troupe has proposed compulsory ballroom dancing courses in Soviet high schools to uplift the taste and manners of Soviet youth and to counteract the influence of Western dances favored in bars and nightclubs.

title: 3 SUSPECTS SEIZED IN SUBWAY HOLDUPS
description: Two teams of Transit Authority plainclothes men on stakeouts in Brooklyn subway stations last night thwarted holdup attempts against change booth clerks and wounded three put of four suspects.

title: Fordham Rallies to Oust. Providence in Overtirne
Prices Make Recovery on Amex; Counter Stocks Also Finish Up
Misericordia to Dismiss 85 at Fordham Hospital
description: Misericordia Hospital anriounced yesterday that it would dismiss on Monday 85i physicians and other personnel assigned to Fordham Hospital under an affiliation contract, because of what it described as ai $1.4million cutback by the city's Health and Hospitals corporation.

title: Teacher Weds Susan C. Dodge
description: ST. LOUIS, Dec. 28Miss Susan Clytie Dodge, daughter of Dr. and Mrs. Philip It Dodge, was married here today to Robert Bruce Peters, son of Mr. and Mrs. Arthur King Peters of Bronxville, N. Y.

title: FINANCIAL PLANS MERIN ALBANY
description: ALBANY, Dec. 28Proposals to solve the state's money problems were spread about the Capitol today like leaflets advising an enemy to surrender.

title: Group Cab Rides Asked If Transit Union Strikes
description: The Metropolitan Taxicab Board of Trade yesterday proposed a groupriding plan for all medallioned taxicabs in the event of a masstransit strike on New Year's Day. The board represents the city's taxi fleet owners.

title: Hoff a Says Phase 2 Has Not Bothered Teamster Members
description: DETROIT, Dec. 28James R. Hoffa, former president of the teamsters union, said today that Phase Two of President Nixon's economic program so far had not bothered the teamsters.

title: Bioculture Concern Accused by S.E.C.
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 28 (AP) The Securities and Exchange Commission said today that the American Bioculture Corporation of New York had violated antifraud, proxy and recording provisions of Federal securities laws.

title: Mass., Colby Sixes Win
description: WILLIAMSTOWN, Mass., Dec. 28The University of Massachusetts and Colby scored firstround victories in the Williams invitation hockey tournament tonight. Massachusetts turned back the defending champion, Oswego State, 20, and Colby defeated Williams, 112.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: Nurse's Death Here Under Investigation
description: The Manhattan District Attorney's office is investigating the circumstances surrounding the death of a 30yearold nurse two weeks after she took out a $100,000 life insurance policy.

title: Enthusiastic Hosts Fete Texas Debutante Here
description: The village of Salado, deep in the heart of Texas, has 336 registered voters, vast expanses of land, and a dress shop that does an annual business of about $500,000. Two of the voters and landowners, one of them also the owner of the dress shop, threw a party at the Sign of the Dove restaurant Monday night for the debutante daughter of dear friends and 150 other friends, acquaintances and strangers.

title: The Pace Accelerates
description: WHITE PLAINS, Dec. 28In the first two years of its life, the Westchester County Board of Legislators has surprised many county residents by making the public aware ofand giving it access towhat used to be a level of government hidden by a lack of concern.

title: When a Bouchere Is Really a Boucher
description: PARISThe entry of women into what used to be masculine trades has caught the French language with its genders down. If she refuses to be a coiffeuse, vendeuse or masseute, a girl now may become a professeur (teacher) but never a professeuse, or un avocet (a lawyer) but seldom une avocate.

title: U.S. Steel Renovation
description: PITTSBURGH, Dec. 28 (UPI)The United States Steel Corporation announced today it has started a major renovation of the No. 21 coke battery at its Clairton, Pa., coking plant, the source of coke for steelmaking in the Monongahela Valley. The renovation will take a year and will cost about $8million. The battery contains 86 ovens in all while the Clairton plant has 1,350 coking ovens.

title: Paul K. Randall Jr., 43, Dead; Vice President of B.R.D. &
description: DALLAS, Dec. 28  Paul K. Randall Jr., vice president of Batten, Barton, Durstine & Osborn, Inc., international advertising agency, and manager of the Dallas office, was found dead in his apartment yesterlay. He was 43 years old.

title: FIRESTONE SETTLES LEESONA CORP. SUIT
description: WARWICK, R. I., Dec. 28 (AP)The Firestone Tire and Rubber Company today settled its lawsuit against the Leesona Corporation, a Warwick manufacturer of textile machinery, Leeson said. The suit involved Leesona's right to collect royalties from licensees under its stretch yarn patents.

title: Italy's South Gaining, but Still Lags Far Behind
description: METAPONTO, ItalyDonato Montanaro used to earn $15 and 80 pounds of grain a month as a hardworking farmhand. Today he owns a model farmhouse, 10 acres of irrigated land, a garden tractor and a motorbike, employs five seasonal workers, makes $10,000 a year and raises rabbits as pastime.

title: SEALAND IS ORDERED TO EXPLAIN ITS RAMS
description: The Federal Maritime Cornmision yesterday ordered SeaLand Service, Inc., one of the country's biggest containership operators, to show cause why the rates it set by competitive bidding on military cargo in the North Atlantic should not be overturned as unreasonably low.

title: Miss Lippincott Becomes Bride Of R. A. Jones
description: RYE, N. Y., Dec. 28The marriage of Miss Helene McCord Lippincott and Robert Alan Jones, freelance journalists in San Francisco, took place in Christ's Episcopal Church here this afternoon. The Rev. Dr. Wendell Phillips performed the ceremony.

title: Ulster Parents Warned On Children's Toy Guns
description: BELFAST, Northern Ireland, Dec. 28 (AP)The British Army distributed thousands of leaflets to parents in Northern Ireland today, warning: If your child plays with a toy gun in the streets he may be killed.

title: Article 1  No Title
description: PORT ELIZABETH, South Africa, Dec. 28 (AP)Topseeded Patti Hogan of La Jolla, Calif., was upset by a littleknown South African in the Free State Sugar tennis tournament today.

title: Louisville Five Refuses To Stand for Anthem
description: Louisville's basketball squad refused to leave the dressing room and stand with the rest of the crowd last night when the National Anthem was played at the Holiday Festival tournament at Madison Square Garden.

title: Kentucky Beats Notre Dame
description: LOUISVILLE, Ky., Dec. 28 (AP)The 12thranked Kentucky Wildcats opened up a 23point lead in the first half and coasted to an 8367 victory, its sixth in eight games, over outmanned Notre Dame tonight before 17,269 fans.

title: Bridge: The Withdrawal of Trumps Upsets Novices and Experts
More Pilots Reported Captured
description: HONG KONG, Dec. 28The Hanoi radio, in a broadcast monitored here today, quoted the North Vietnamese Army newspaper Quan Doi Nhan Dan as having said that more United States pilots had been captured and that no American pilots held in North Vietnam would he freed as long as President Nixon continued the war.

title: Gas Station Near Jail Held Up Amid Rebellion
description: While almost 100 policemen were massed inside and in front of the Civil Jail early yesterday morning during some inmates rebellion, three gunmen robbed a gasoline station half a block away.

title: STATEAID FREEZE HEED CITY U. BLOW
description: ALBANY, Dec. 28Governor Rockefeller's proposed freeze in state spending would cost New York City $71million in expected revenues from Albany and would put an end to open enrollment in the City University, according to Richard A. Brown, Mayor Lindsay's legislative representative here.

title: FLU BREAKS OUT IN CONNECTICUT
description: An outbreak of chills, headaches, fever, sore throats, aching muscles and occasional vomiting and stomach cramps has swept through Connecticut, causing absenteeism at work an jamming emergency rooms in hospitals.

title: Student Suspension Upheld
description: PHILADELPHIA, Dec. 28 (AP) The decision of a Susquehanna County school board to suspend a student for wearing his hair too long has been upheld by the United States Court of Appeals for the Third Circuit. Jerald Gere of Great Bend was suspended from Blue Ridge High School last year for violating a dress code drafted by faculty, administration and students.

title: Man in the News
description: RAWALPINDI, Pakistan, Dec. 28Within the last two weeks, Abdul Rahim Khan, a former fighter pilot who commands Pakistan's Air Force, has emerged as the strongest military influence in the country.

title: 12 Women on L.I. Bow At the Regina Cotillion
description: Twelve young women from Nassau and Suffolk Counties were presented to the Most Rev. Walter P. Kellenberg, Bishop of the Roman Catholic Diocese of Rockville Centre, L. I., at the 14th annual Regina Cotillion last night.

title: Decisions Made, Arabs Say
description: CAIRO, Dec. 28 (Reuters)Representatives of 18 Arab countries, who conferred here yesterday on coordinating economic and military strategy against Israel, issued a brief statement that appropriate decisions on joint action had been taken.

title: Muskie Wins the Support Of Connecticut Democrat
description: HARTFORD, Dec. 28 Mrs. Margaret Weinberg of Stamford, a member of the Democratic State Central Committee who supported former Senator Eugene J. McCarthy of Minnesota for President in 1968, announced today her support of Senator Edmund S. Muskie of Maine in 1972.

title: Soviet Athlete of Year
description: MOSCOW, Dec. 28 (AP)Vasilv Alexeyev, European and world weightlifting champion in the superheavyweight class., was named Soviet athlete of the year today in a poll of the Federation of Sports Writers.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: TERM LIMITS SET IN JAIL REBELLION
description: Judges, District Attorney's and mayoral aides, in a swift response to Monday night's rebellion at the Civil Jail, announced today that the cases of material witnesses held there would be reviewed within a month and that no such witness would be held there more than 90 days.

title: Merger News
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 28 (UPI)The Tandy Corporation, Fort Worth, Texas, agreed today to sell 36 electronicproducts retail stores it acquired last year in its multimilliondollar takeover of the Allied Radio Corporation of Chicago.

title: Vergil's Aeneid (on TV) Is Baffling the Italians; Vergil
description: ROME, Dec. 28  Italian television fans are being baffled by a sevenpart primetime serial retelling Vergil's Aeneid,

title: ITALIANS MAY DELAY GOVERNMENT SHIFT
description: ROME, Dec. 28  Premier Emilio Columbo is due to offer his resignation to Presidentelect Giovanni Leone tomorrow, but is expected to stay in office for at least a few more weeks. Parliamentary informants said today that Mr. Leone, who will be inaugurated tomorrow for a sevenyear term, would in all likelihood ask Mr. Colombo and his ministers to carry on in the way of a caretaker government pending a political showdown some time next month.

title: Dennison Steps Down
description: RIVERHEAD, L.I., Dec. 28Suffolk County Executive H. Lee Dennison delivered his farewell address today after 12 years as the county's top leader, He recommended drastic changes in the county's political organization, a comprehensive new highway network and a severance of all county ties with the Long Island Rail Road.

title: Historians Convene Here
description: History may be kind to kings, princes and even an occasional President, but at the moment it is not very kind to historians.

title: College Head Resigns
description: MANCHESTER, N.H., Dec. 28 (UPI)St. Anselm's College announced today that the Right Gerald F. McCarthy had resigned for health reasons as chancellor.

title: 87 Arrested in Protest At Lincoln Memorial
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 28Eightyseven members of the Vietnam Veterans Against the War were arrested for disorderly conduct today after blocking the entrance to: the Lincoln Memorial.

title: About Motor Sports
description: In the interests of safety and showmanship, the 1972 running of the Indianapolis 500 will require four pit stops instead of the present three. The primary purpose is to make it unnecessary to fill fuel cells chockfull. A fuel system filled to the brim is dangerous because the impact of a collision with another car or the wall converts the system into a powerful hydraulic force the fluid, being pushed, has to go somewhere. The weakest links of the fuel system are couplings and tubing, and if these burst under hydraulic pressure of the fuel, the car is vulnerable to a dreadful fire hazard. On the other hand, if the system is not quite full, the fluid will not exert pressure on its container.

title: FOREIGN AFFAIRS
description: PARISA new allied crisis over Maltaor, at any rate, another flareup of the old onecan be regarded as probable. The strategically located island republic has not figured much in recent newsbut only because has been negotiating with Britain and NATO. These negotiations appear to have failed.

title: Rumania Woos U.S. Car Buyers
description: Most Americans may not know it but Rumania has a small Detroit of its own that is setting out to win automobile customers here.

title: ROBERT E. M'GANNON, EXFIRE OFFICIAL, 84
description: TRUMBULL, Conn., Dec. 28  Robert E, McGannon, a former deputy fire chief of the City of New York, died today at the age of 84.

title: Democrats Comment on Lindsay Is Varied
description: Mayor Lindsay's announcement yesterday of his candidacy for the Democratic Presidential nomination was received by his fellow Democrats with a variety of comment some politic and some not so politic.

title: Max R. Steiner, Film Composer Who Won 3 Oscars, Dead at 83
description: HOLLYWOOD, Dec. 28 (UPI) Max R. Steiner, the motionpicture composer who won three Academy awards for best musical score, died today at the Mount Sinai Hospital. He was 83 years old.

title: Nuclear Corp. Sets Split
description: Shareholders of the Nuclear Corporation of America at a special meeting in Charlotte, N. C., yesterday approved a oneforfour reverse split of the stock and a name change to the Nucor Corporation, both effective Jan, 1. The company, now traded on the Amex, plans to file an application for listing on the New York Stock Exchange.

title: Market Place: GAC Is Making Some Writeoffs
description: Remember how the GAC Corporationone of those land development companies flew over the Cuckoo's Nest during the bull market of 1967 and 1968?

title: The Liberation of U Thant
description: In a farewell to the United Nations General Assembly the other day, Secretary General Thant said: I feel a sense of great relief, bordering on liberation... on laying down the burden of office.

title: Actor Enters Guilty Plea In Assault Case on Coast
description: LOS ANGELES, Dec. 28 (AP) Keefe Brasselle, actor, pleaded guilty today to a charge of assault with a deadly weapon in connection with a barroom shooting in which another man was wounded.

title: Draft Board Quits in Protest
description: NORRISTOWN, Pa., Dec. 28 (AP) All five members of a local Selective Service board in this Philadelphia suburb have resigned in protest against new Selective Service guidelines that include mandatory retirement at the age of 61 years and the inclusion of 18yearolds on boards. The resignations, all effective by the end of next week, were sent to the state draft director, Robert Ford.

title: Dowdy Described as Set Up; Deliberations Expected Today
description: BALTIMORE, Dec. 28 (UPI)  Defense attorneys characterized Representative John Dowdy today as a conscientious Congressman who was set up on a $25,000 briberyconspiracy charge by selfserving con men.

title: Viva la Policia!
description: I'm here because I'm a policeman, and it is just very hard to say it, but these have been a lonely five years for Frank Serpico, Paul DiLees and me. I've had a lot of time to think about what being a cop means to me, and maybe you can understand better some of the things I've said.

title: U.S.BOMBING RAIDS ON NORTH VIETNAM ENTER FOURTH DAY
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, Wednesday, Dec. 29 United States bombing raids on North Vietnam went into a fourth day this morning, continuing the longest sustained series of attacks since the daily bombing ended in 1968.

title: Young Socialists Meet on '72 Strategy
description: HOUSTON, Dec. 28  The Young Socialist Alliance, a frequent target of the Texas Ku Klux Klan, opened its annual convention in Houston today with a plea that delegates be a little extra cautious and a little extra courteous,

title: Hindu Refugee Returns, Finds Ruins in East Pakistan
description: RANGPUR, Pakistan, Dec. 25Chandrakant Jodt:ar returned home today after living for eight months and eight days in a concrete pipe at a refugee camp in Calcutta.

title: ANTHONY DANCERS DEPICT THE NATIVITY
description: The real pleasures offered by welltrained dancers along with precision and craftsmanly care in choreography are always an integral part of the Mary Anthony Dance Theater. On Monday evening at the Theater of Riverside Church the company offered a new work created by Miss Anthony, A Ceremony of Carols.

title: CHARLES KING &
description: A spokesman for Charles King & Co. of 61 Broadway said yesterday that the brokerage concern was gratified that a taxevasion indictment against it had been dismissed by the Government.

title: Ellen M. James Wed in France
description: Miss Ellen McNair James, daughter of Winfield H. James, president of The Daily News, and Mrs. James of Larchmont, N. Y., was married in Rennes, France, yesterday to Daniel Jean Yvon Demeure, son of the late Mr. and Mrs. Marcel Demeure of Rennes. The civil ceremony was followed by a religious ceremony in the Roman Catholic Church of St. Augustin, performed by the Rev. Joseph Gabon.

title: DR. JOHN DINGMAN
description: SPRING VALLEY, N. Y., Dec. 28Dr. John Dingman, who had been a general practitioner in Rockland County for 64 years, retiring in 1968, died today in a nursing home in Nanuet. He was 90 years old and lived at 164 Central Avenue.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: KELANNE IS FIRST IN SWEEPS UPSET
description: LEOPARDSTOWN, Ireland, Dec. 28 (AP)Kelanne won the Irish SWeepstakes Hurdle today, a horse race that made lucky ticketholders around the world rich.

title: Welcome Home, Professor
description: CAMBRIDGE, Mass,As Paul McCracken goes back to private life as a University of Michigan professor, the nation owes him thanks for a thankless job as chairman of President Nixon's Council of Economic Advisers.

title: DR. CHARLES SOKOLOVE
description: Dr. Charles Sokolove, a general practitioner in Staten Island for 40 years, died Sunday in Doctors Hospital of Staten Island, of which he was a founder. He was 67 years old and lived at 239 Heberton Avenue, Port Richmond, S.I.

title: Noneconomic Differences Are Focus of Transit Talks
description: Mediators and negotiators in the transit talks worked through the day and into the night at the Americana Hotel yesterday to dispose of workrules and productivity differences as they pressed for a new contract before a New Year's Day strike deadline.

title: KING OF CRICKET VICTOR ON COAST
description: ARCADIA, Calif., Dec 28. (UPI)King of Cricket scored a sixlength victory in the $33,400 Palos Verdes Handicap today as Santa. Anita opened its winter meeting in a rainstorm.

title: The Uniform, Spruced Up and Called Career Apparel
description: There is something about a uniform that is intriguing corporation executives all over the country.

title: Aide in Boston Discloses Rates In New NoFault Insurance Plan
description: BOSTON, Dec. 28 (AP)State Insurance Commissioner John G. Ryan disclosed today the rates for the new nofault property damage insurance plan tentatively scheduled to go into effect Jan. 1.

title: Interest Rates Are Down On a Broad Front Again
Index Shows Small Rise From Revised Figure of Month Earlier
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 28The Government's composite index of leading indicators of the economy was essentially flat in November, the Commerce Department reported today.

title: The Season: Shift in Museum Exhibitions
description: This has been a season when American museums talked poor even while some of them acted rich. The undisputed kingpin of them all, New York's Metropolitan Museum of Art, had it both ways, paying a record sum of $5,544,000 for an old master, Velazquez's portrait of Juan de Pareja, while apologetically collecting its new admission charge. The Metropolitan's seeming selfcontradiction was only another example of a truth familiar to administrators of educational institutions of all kinds: It is easier to find million for a big, showy project than a hundred thousand for an ugly little operating deficit.

title: Economic Analysis
description: The allocation of capital, a wise man once remarked, is the rudder by which a society steers itself into the future. Flaw the available pool of resources is divided among competing userswhether to finance schools, or sewers, or steel mills, or housing, or whateverwill to a significant degree determine the future shape of at least the physical outlines of our environment. Albert M. Wojnilow er, the erudite economist of the First Boston Corporation, has argued that just as war is too important to be left to the generals, and the economy to the economists, so the allocation of capital has much too profound an influence on everyone's future to be left to the capitalists.

title: Federal Suit Says Mississippi Aides Barred Some Votes
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 28The Department of Justice filed a suit today charging Mississippi officials with refusing to count hundreds of ballots in predominantly black Humphreys County in, last Novembees elections.

title: Both Sides Cancel Session of Paris Peace Talks
description: PARIS, Dec. 28The stepup in the air war over North Vietnam led to a further breakdown in the Paris peace talks today as both sides rushed to cancel the session scheduled for Thursday.

title: Indictment for Hijacking
description: CHICAGO, Dec. 28 (UPI)Everett L. Holt, 25 years old, of Indianapolis, accused of the Christmas Eve hijacking of a Northwest Airlines jet, was indicted by a Federal grand jury today for air piracy, kidnap,ping, intimidation of a flight crew and assault with intent to commit murder.

title: P.D.Q. BACH BACK ATTACKING SENSES
description: New Yorkers have a way of bouncing back after strikes, blackouts and similar catastrophes, so they will probably recover from the double dose of P.D.Q. Bach administered Sunday and Monday nights at Philharmonic Hall.

title: LESLIE WILKINSON, RETIRED ACTOR, 72
description: Leslie Wilkinson, a retired stage and television actor, died on Sunday while on a visit to his daughter in Santa Ana, Calif. He was 72 years old and lived at 18IF Howard Drive, Bergenfield, N. J.

title: Outlays of $72Million Set By Toledo Edison in 1972
description: TOLEDO, Ohio, Dec. 28 (UPI) The Toledo Edison Company said today that it would spend $399million over the next five years to expand its powergenerating and other facilities in northwestern Ohio.

title: Cuba Frees 26 Sailors; Holds Skipper and Ships
description: PANAMA, Dec. 28 (AP)Twentysix crewmen of two freighters seized earlier this month by Cuban gunboats arrived in Panama last night, but Cuba is still holding the captain of one boat on espionage charges.

title: Otis Taylor Named Player of the Year
description: Otis Taylor of the Kansas City Chiefs was declared yesterday as winner of the United Press International player of the year award in the National Football League American Conference.

title: Crangle Is Selected To Lead Democrats
description: Joseph F. Crangle, chairman of the. Erie County Democratic organization, was elected the party's state chairman yesterday in a contest with national political overtones..

title: The Proceedings In the U.N. Today
description: SECURITY COUNCIL Meets at 10:30 A.M. to discuss Rhodesia.

title: Presidential Post Filled
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 28 (UPI)  Louis Weintraub, a New York public relations executive, has been reappointed to the President's Committee on Employment of the Handicapped, a committee spokesman said today

title: Ack Ack Is Horse of Year in Combined Poll
description: Two seasons ago, a Cain Hoy Stable colt named Ack Ack was withdrawn from the Kentucky Derby despite the fact he had set a track record four days earlier while winning the onemile Derby Trial.

title: Bridges Advocates Merger of Two Dock Unions
description: SAN FRANCISCO, Dec. 28 (UPI)Harry Bridges, leader of the West Coast waterfront workers, advocated today a merger of his independent union with the International Longshoremen's Association, which represents East and Gulf Coast dock workers.

title: Notes on People
description: Two of the world's leading string musicians, Pablo Casals, the cellist, and Lionel Tertis, the violist, are celebrating their 95th birthdays today.

title: Two Rockets on Waivers
description: DENVER, Dec. 28 (AP)Two fonvards, Julian Hammond and Steve Mix, were placed on waivers today by the Denver Rockets of the American Basketball Association.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: SEDGMAN SCORES A TENNIS UPSET
description: MELBOURNE, Australia, Dec. 28 (UPI)A pair of former Wimbledon champions, Frank Sedgman and Neil Fraser, advanced to the round of 16 in the Australian open tennis championships today. Fraser, 37 years old, upset an Australian Davis Cup player, Geoff Masters, 16 years his junior, by 75, 75, 62.

title: Soviet Denounces U.S. Raids on North
description: MOSCOW, Dec. 28The Soviet press today sharply stepped up its protests against American bombing of North Vietnam and accused China of maintaining an awkward silence apparently because it did not want to spoil the atmosphere for President Nixon's visit to Peking in February.

title: Unwrapping a Tax Package
description: The tax package the state's lawmakers are wrestling with at their second special session in Albany is one that adds no joy to the holiday season. This is an emergency package, tied together by the necessity for bridging an imminent budgetary gap that Governor Rockefeller now estimates at close to $1, billion in the current fiscal year, a sharp rise from the $770 million he announced previously. The gap through the next fiscal year is estimated at $1.5 billion.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: SoldOut House at Met Greets Revival of Tie Meistersinger
description: It takes nearly five hours of performance time to get from the opening C major chord of Die. Meistersinger to the same chords that bring it to a close, but what Wagner put ibto that spar makes it one of the glories of the operatic literature. Nine years ago the Metropolitan Opera gave it a splendid and worthy new prodtiction that is still with us. It was revived Monday night after a threeseason absence, With several new elements, A soldout house, which is unfortunately news these days at the Met, greeted it rapturously. It was conducted by Thomas Schippers, who had not led it here before. He has conducted it at the Bayreuth Festival, that Wagnerian mecca, and his reading was authoritative and Dersonal. For one thing, it Stressed the text. Mr. Schippers leave the singers plenty of time to make the words clearoccasionally too much time, as a few of the artists seemed bent on rattling ahead of him.

title: Books of The Times
description: HAUSSMANN: PARIS TRANSFORMED. By Flowarci Saalman. 128 pages. Illustrated. Braziller. $5.95. Paperbound, $2.95.

title: Pennsy Postpones Meeting
description: The Penn Central Company announced yesterday that its annual meeting scheduled to convene on Thursday will be further adjourned until Jan. 14 at 9:30 A.M. This will mark the fourth adjournment for the company's meeting since Nov. 29.

title: EGYPT'S LEADERS PRESS DIPLOMACY
description: CAIRO, Dec. 28Egypt's political leadership gave a green light today to President Anwar elSadat to carry on with diplomatic efforts to achieve settlement of the conflict with Israel, seemingly reversing earlier vows that a settlement must be reached by the end of 1971 or Egypt would stop talking and resort to war.

title: MRS. MICHAEL LAMESTA
description: Mrs. Grace Antonelli Lamesta, director of the Lamesta Funeral Home, 646 Liberty Avenue, Brooklyn, died yesterday at the age of 90. She and her husband, the late Michael Lamesta, founded the funeral home more than 65 years ago. He died in 1955. Their home was at 29 Ridgewood Avenue.

title: Executive Changes
description: The National Aviation Corporation, a closedend investing company, has elected Donald C. Burr as president. He succeeds Harvey Gaylord, who will resign Jan. 1 but continue with the company as a consultant. Howard E. Buhse, formerly director and chairman of the executive committee, has been elected chairman of the board of directors. The lastnamed also is chairman of the board of the directing partners of Hornblower & WeeksHemphill, Noyes, stock brokers.

title: Academic Meetings: Scientists Hear of Violent Monkeys;
description: PHILADELPHIA, Dec. 28Monkeys raised in isolation from other monkeys during a critical phase in their youth grow up unable to control their tendencies for violent behavior, a team of animal behavior researchers reported today. They suggested that there may be a similar phase in human development.

title: Japan's Bank Rate Trimmed to 4.75%
description: TOKYO, Dec. 28Japan decided today to lower her official discount rate from 5.25 per cent to 4.75 per cent. The new rate will go into effect tomorrow.

title: McDonald Goes to Farm
description: DETROIT, Dec. 28 (AP)The Detroit Red Wings assigned today a left wing, Ab McDonald, to the Tidewater Wings, Detroit's farm club in the American Hockey League.

title: Kissinger Deputy Heads Team Going To Peking Today
description: KEY BISCAYNE, Fla., Dec. 28 The White House announced today that a delegation of American officials would leave tomorrow for a week's stay in Peking to arrange details of President Nixon's meeting with Chinese leaders in February.

title: Council Due to Vote Today to Mandate Labor Arbitration
description: A bill to make New York the first major city in the nation to require arbitration of labor disputes involving most municipal employes is expected to he passed by the City Council today.

title: Soviet Orbits Cosmos 470
description: MOSCOW, Dec. 28 (AP)The Soviet Government announced today that it launched yesterday the 470th satellite in its Cosmos series. It was the tenth Cosmos craft put into orbit [this month. The announcement said that the orbit ranged between 169 miles and 121 miles above the earth, its inclination to the Equator was 65.4 degrees and the orbital time was 89 minutes. This was similar to the orbit of Cosmos 469, launched Saturday.

title: Fanny May Rates Decline For 10th Consecutive Week
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 28Mortgage interest rates declined slightly further at this week's auction of the F??ral National Mortgage Association, it was disclosed today.

title: The Jewish Morning Journal, Begun in '14, Succumbs
description: The Day Jewish Morning Journal, the largest Yiddishlanguage daily newspaper in the United States, with a national circulation of about 38,000, abruptly ended publication yesterday after a 57year existence.

title: Homebuilding Contracts Lift Total Value of Construction 24%
description: Residential building contracts, breaking all records in November, gave a big increase to the total value of all construction contracts awarded in the month, the F. W. Dodge division of the McGrawHill Information Systems Company reported yesterday.

title: FRED DUNNING
description: STAMFORD, Conn., Dec. 28 Fred Dunning, retired executive vice president and secretary and treasurer of the former Yale and Towne Manufacturing Company, died today at St. Joseph's Hospital. He was 79 years old and lived at 11179 Newfield Avenue.

title: TWO MORE SEEK N.H.L. FRANCHISE IN NEW COLISEUM
description: Two surprise applicants, Thomas E. Dewey Jr. and William Levitt, the builder, put in bids yesterday to acquire the National Hockey League franchise awarded to the new Nassau Coliseum for next season.

title: LIZ TORRES, SINGER AND COMIC, ON STAGE
description: The mixture of fascination and frustration that one can experience watching an obviously talented performer trying to find the right vehicle for that talent is being roused to an acute degree by Liz Torres, who is appearing once each evening this week at Bud Friedman's Improvisation, 44th Street at Ninth Avenue.

title: A Captain Is Buried With Yacht in Atlantic
description: DAYTONA BEACH, Fla. Dec. 28 (AP)The last voyage of the yacht Miss Flagler ended today 40 miles out in the Atlantic when the vessel was scuttled with her captain's body on board.

title: CUBA'S PRESIDENT ENDS VISIT TO SOVIET
description: MOSCOW, Dec. 28 (Reuters) President Osvaldo Dorticos Torrado of Cuba left for home today after agreeing with the Kremlin on future economic and trade links.

title: Olympic Ski Trials Shifted
description: DENVER, Dec. 28 (UPI)The United States Ski Association said today a lack of snow at Lake Placid, N. Y., had forced the shifting of Friday's first Nordic Olympic tryouts to Lyndonville, Vt.

title: NEW $260,000 EVENT PRO GOLF'S RICHEST
description: The $260,000 Jackie Gleason Inverrary Classic, one of four new tournaments on the 1972 Professional Golfers Association tour announced yesterday, will surpass the Westchester Classic as pro golf's richest.

title: U.S. Reports Gains in Fight On. World Narcotics Traffic
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 28 Nelson Gross, the State Department coordinator for international narcotics affairs, said today that at least six tons of heroin and related materials were confiscated in the last year through the direct or indirect efforts of United States authorities. He said this would have been enough to supply this country for one year.

title: Friedman Predicts Policy Of MoneySupply Growth
description: NEW ORLEANS, Dec. 28Milton Friedman, the University of Chicago economist, predicted today that the Federal Reserve System would soon switch back to a policy of permitting a greater growth in the money supply.

title: Guerrillas Seek Lost Relatives
description: DACCA, Pakistan, Dec. 28 For a week, Abdul Hossain, a tough, wiry unshaven man in a dirty white shirt, has been sitting in the fashionable Dacca Ladies Club building interviewing an endless line of men, most of whom are equally tough and unkempt.

title: 15 Veterans Leave the Statue of Liberty, Claiming a Victory in TakeOver
description: Proclaiming victory for their gesture with cheers and raised fists, 15 antiwar veterans ended their occupation of the Statue of Liberty yesterday.

title: NEW GROUP SEEKS STOCK DEPOSITORIES
description: The formation of a new securities industry group to speed the settlement of stock and bond transactions through the use of regional depositories was announced yesterday.

title: WILLIAM MITCHELL
description: William Mitchell, a retired makeup man on the composing room staff of The New York Times, died yesterday at Astoria General Hospital. He was 64 years old and lived at 4165 75th Street, Elmhurst, Queens.

title: 65Foot Tree to Be Recycled
description: The 65foot balsam fir that has glittered at Rockefeller Center during the Christmas holidays will be recycled when it is removed next Monday, it was announced by the Center yesterday. The tree will be trucked to a nursery and chipped for use as mulch or ground cover. The expected two ton s of mulch will be turned over to the New York State Environmental Conservation Department.

title: Pia Lindstrom Is Wed Here to Joseph Daly
description: Pia Lindstrom, daughter of Ingrid Bergman and Dr. Peter Lindstrom, was married yesterday afternoon to Joseph Daly, a realestate broker whom she met six months ago during a weekend at the beach. Msgr. James Wilders celebrated the nuptial Mass in the Church of St. Thomas More. About 100 friends and members of the families attended workers a couple of years ago because of her predilection for wearing pants suits to work. But she had no thought of wearing pants to her wedding, however.

title: Commodity Firm Accused
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 28 (UPI)A Kansas City commodity futures commission firm and two officers have been accused of mishandling customers securities and making false statements on a report to the Commodity Exchange Authority, the Agriculture Department said today.

title: KIALOA II LEADING IN SAIL TO HOBART
description: HOBART, Tasmania, Dec. 28 (AP)The 73foot American yawl, Kialoa II, is leading the fleet in what could be a record time for the SydneyHobart yacht race.

title: The Talk of the A.A.A.S.
description: PHILADELPHIA, Dec. 28The perennial convention of the American Association for the Advancement of Science, afflicted since the middle nineteensixties with screaming demonstrations, has hit on an empirical method to resolve its problems this year. It is letting the dissidents talk themselves o u t rather than throwing them out. The lieins, teachins and shoutins of the clenchedfist science for the people group featuring an air war caucus and the radical ecology program are less rowdy at the 138th annual meeting here this week, in part because the antieverything movement has peaked, in part because it has won a major objectivethe right to he heard.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: EVANSTON TO REVIEW APPROVAL OF LIQUOR
description: EVANSTON, Ill., Dec. 28This Chicago suburb, site of the national headquarters of the Women's Christian Temperance Union, will apparently retain its 116yearold ban on liquor sales for at least a month or two.

title: ITALY BACKS DOWN ON GRAIN IMPORTS
description: PARIS, Dec. 28Italy has bowed to powerful French pressure and reversed a decision that would have opened up Italian ports to increased imports of grains from the United States and other food exporters.

title: News Analysis
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 28It has become evident here, despite varying official explanations for the renewed heavy bombing of North Vietnam, that the central purpose of the Nixon Administration is to stave off a major military setback in Indochina. The Administration apparently has coneluded that even in an election year the domestic political price f or such limitedduration raids against the North by hundreds of planes will be less than the political consequences of a major military defeat in Indochina.

title: OTB Racing Schedule Through Saturday
description: The following holiday scliedule has been announced by the Offtrack Betting Corporation for action at its 36 shops:

title: Treasury Bill Rates Fall at Monthly Sale
Dolphins to Vary Defenses in Bid to Foil Unitas
description: MIAMI, Dec. 28  Tighter coverage and a mixture of defenses appear to be the Miami Dolphins strategy for stopping John Unitas in Sunday's American Football Conference championship game with the Baltimore Colts at the Orange Bowl.

title: Article 2  No Title
description: AKRON, Ohio, Dec. 28 (UPI) The Ohio Edison Company and its subsidiary, the Pennsylvania Power Company, plan $148,4million in capital expenditures for 1972, the concerns said.

title: L.I. MAN SHOT DEAD IN LOVER'S QUARREL
description: WILLISTON PARK, L. I., Dec. 28A reputed underworld figure under indictment for refusing to testify before a Nassau County grand jury investigating organized crime was killed here today in what was described by the police as a lover's quarrel.

title: Beatrice Foods Profit Up 17% In Quarter on 14% Sales Gain
Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: U.S. Plywood Sees Net Off In Last. Quarter From Third
description: Fourthquarter earnings of U.S. PlywoodChampion Papers, Inc., are expected to be down from the $14,076,000, or 40 cents a share, earned in the third quarter this year, the company said yesterday.

title: Mediator Sees His Role as Obstetrician
description: Serving as a mediator, Michael I. Sovern said yesterday, is a little like being an obstetrician for a woman who has already had a few children. If all goes well, he's a friendly companion,. Only if there are complications does he have to play a more professional role.

title: Nixon Reassures Brandt on Issue of Troop Reduction
description: HEY BISCAYNE, Fla., Dec. 28President Nixon assured Chancellor Willy Brandt of West Germany today that he would not strike any separate bargains with the Soviet Union on troop withdrawals from Europe when he meets with Soviet leaders in Moscow In May.

title: ENFORCE GUIDELINES, U.S. AGENCIES TOLD
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 28The Administration warned all Federal agencies today that they were expected to do business only with contractors who observed the guidelines established for President Nixon's economic stabilization program.

title: Limited Air War?
description: Three days of largescale American air attacks against North Vietnam have dramatically shattered the Administrationfostered myth that President Nixon is effectively winding down the war in Indochina. They also refute assertions by Secretary of State Rogers and Secretary of Defense Laird that the President's program of Vietnamization has been a success.

title: City Has Many Ways to Hail '72
description: Mrs. Bea Duffy, who lives in the McLean Heights section of Yonkers, said New Year's Eve in her neighborhood was just a lot of househopping  this year we'll stay home and be one of the houses that gets hopped in on.

title: Knicks Trounce Pistons For 7th in Row,119100
Lindsay and the Presidency
description: Most of the public comments about John Lindsay's bid for the Presidency illustrate the tyranny of the political parties, and add to the confusion about how to pick a President of the United States in 1972.

title: Zellerbach Sets Price Rise
description: SAN FRANCISCO, Dec. 28 (UPI)The Crown Zellerbach Corporation announced today a price increase of $8 a ton for standard newsprint sold in the 11 Western states as well as in Hawaii and Alaska. The company said the increase amounted to 5.1 per cent. On July 29 Crown Zellerbach announced a similar increase effective Nov. 1 but deferred the move during Phase One of President Nixon's wageprice freeze.

title: Purina's Cat Dinners Switch to Wells, Rich
description: In addition to the switch'es reported here yesterday, Ralston Purina has moved its Purina Cat Dinners from Gardner Advertising to Wells, Rich, Greene. The product bills in the over $3million class.

title: Dedications Accompany. Many Gifts to Neediest Cases Fund
MSGR. GILMARTIN, 59, DECORATED CHAPLAIN
description: THIELLS, N.Y., Dec. 28 (AP) Msgr. James M. Gilmartin, senior Roman Catholic chaplain at Letchworth Village here, died at Good Samaritan Hospital in Suffern last night after a short illness. He was 59 years old.

title: About Pro Football
description: Bruce Taylor, the San Francisco allpro cornerback, has a badly sprained ankle and is a doubtful performer for the 49ers against the Cowboys in the National Confereace championship game at Dallas on Sunday.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: Hartke Delays Decision on '72 Bid
description: MANCHESTER. N. H., Dec. 28Senator Vance Hartke, Democrat of Indiana, teetered today an the brink of announcing his candidacy in New Hampshire's Presidential primary next March 7.

title: Fuld Finn on May 1 Start for Fast Trials
description: The chief judge of New York said yesterday that he intended to put the state's new speedytrial rules for criminal cases into effect on May 1 as scheduledeven if he has to shut down the state's civil courtrooms and eliminate judges vacations to make the rules work.

title: WALLACE PETERS OF CORNELL DIES
description: SUMMIT, N. J., Dec. 28 H. Wallace Peters, a former provost of Cornell University, died yesterday at his home, 16 Sherman Avenue. He was 79 years old.

title: S. E C. REQUESTS GREATER POWER OVER EXCHANGES
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 28The Securities and Exchange Commission asked Congress today for greater regulatory powers over the securities industry to protect investors from a recurrence of the crisis that struck Wall Street in 196970.

title: Budget Rise for More Firemen Is Asked
description: The Fire Department yesterday requested a $313.2million 197273 expense budget, an increase of $13 million that would bring the firefighters almost to their maximum strength of 11,363 men.

title: Some on Pay Board Find Panel Largely Ineffectual
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 28The Pay Board, by the testimony of a representative crosssection of its members, has been ineptly led, acrimoniously divided and largely ineffectual in the first months of the second phase of President Nixon's economic stabilization program.

title: Gingermint Pays $100.20
description: PHILADELPHIA, Dec. 28Gingermint, an absentee from winners circles since the spring, won the $9,000 Falls Creek sprint by a neck from Restless Wave today and paid $100.20 $39.60 and $12.40 at Liberty Bell race track.

title: GREAT SOUTHWEST ELECTS PRESIDENT
description: The Great Southwest Corporation, a realty development concern, announced yesterday the election of Bruce C. Juell as president.

title: JOSEPH SAFRASIAN
description: Joseph Safrasian, an advertising artist on the staff of the New York Times since 1966, died yesterday in New York Hospital. He was 64 years old and lived at 511 East 86th Street.

title: Chiefs Defeat Red Devils In Roller Derby, 4843
description: COMMACK, L. I., Dec. 28The Chiefs defeated the Red Devils, 4843, in an International Roller Derby League game before a capacity crowd of 4,500 tonight at the Island Garden.

title: Revised Japanese Surplus
description: TOKYO, Dec. 28 (Reuters)The Finance Ministry announced today Japan had a revised balanceofpayments swplus in November of $271million compared with $76million in November of last year.

title: Wings Rout Sabres, 73
description: BUFFALO, Dec. 29 (AP) The Detroit Red Wings scored three times before Buffalo put a shot on goal, saw the Sabres tie the game at 33, then moved to a 73 victory tonight.

title: Nixon Praises Harlan As a Giant of the Court
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 29 (UPI)President Nixon, in a statement from his Key Bis cayne, Fla., home, said Justice John M. Harlan, who died today, was one of the 20th century's giants on the Supreme Court of the United Statesa man whose lucid intellect and consistently clear reasoning won him the highest respect of his judicial colleagues, of the legal pro fession at large, and of the nation he served with such selfless dedication.

title: Dock Talks Recessed
description: SAN FRANCISCO, Dec. 29 (AP)  Negotiations toward a contract agreemnt with the in dependent West Coast long shoremen's union were recessed today to allow union leaders to confer with the International Longshoremen's Association, which covers the East and Gulf Coasts.

title: Academic Meetings: Curb on Energy Demand Advocated;
description: PHILADELPHIA, Dec. 29  While Others reported techno logical advances toward new sources of energy, a panel of experts today suggested the need to eventually relieve the nation's energy shortages by reducing the demand for power, not by increasing the supply.

title: Bankers Trust Co. Floats Rate
description: The Bankers Trust Company announced yesterday a new and complex formulareplete with spreads and trigger points to set its minimum charge on business loans in relation to rates in the money market.

title: Indian Train Reopens CalcuttaJessore Run
description: CALCUTTA, India, Dec. 29 Six coaches pulled by a steam locomotive rattled along a 70mile track from Calcutta to Jessore today, reestablishing after six years the rail link between India and East Pakistan, which Bengali separatists now call Bangladesh.

title: Illinois Court Rules NoFault Insurance Invalid
description: CHICAGO, Dec. 29 (AP) Illinois's nofault insurance plan, which was scheduled to take effect Jan. 1, was declared unconstitutional and void to day by Circuit Court Judge Daniel A. Corelli. State offi cials said the ruling would be appealed.

title: MISS Higgins Wed in Duluth
description: DULUTH, Minn., Dec. 29 Miss Elizabeth Butler Higgins, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Raymond J. Higgins, was married here this evening to Lieut. LeRoy Lewis Little 3d, U.S.A.F., son of Mr. and Mrs. Little of Pittsburgh.

title: Bruins Down Hawks, 51
description: CHICAGO, Dec. 19 (UPI) Mike Walton, Johnny Bucyk and Phil Esposito scored in a span of 2 minutes 50 seocnds of the first period tonight to pace the Boston Bruins to a 51 victory over the Chicago Black Hawks.

title: The Right to Secede
description: This summer, along the borders of West Bengal with East Pakistan, I visited the camps which hold the mil lions of refugees generated by the Pakistani Government's military at tempt to cope with the threat of secession endorsed in free elections by almost the whole population of East Pakistan. These demands, which now find expression in Bangladesh, form perhaps the most solidly founded assertion of the tight to secede which has emerged since World War II.

title: POET IS REPORTED CURBED IN SOVIET
description: MOSCOW, Dec. 29In a new round of the battle between Soviet literary conservatives and liberals, the Soviet Writers Union has reportedly expelled a poet who publicly challenged the official ostracism of the Nobel prizewinning novelist, Aleksandr I. Solzhenitsyn.

title: Pause in Draft Would Let Thousands Escape Service
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 29  Tens of thousands of men with low draft lottery numbers will be able to escape military serv ice if no one is drafted in the first three months of next year, as Defense Secretary Melvin R. Laird hinted earlier this week.

title: Cavaliers Gain Top
description: HERSHEY, Pa., Dec. 29 (AP) Butch Beard scored on a driv ing layup with 24 seconds to play tonight to give Cleveland a 103102 victory over the Philadelphia 76ers and put the Cavaliers in first place in the Central Division.

title: McGovern  on Holiday
description: CHARLOTTE AMALIE, V.I., Dec. 29 (UPI)  A doctor was called today to attend Senator George McGovern, who was re portedly suffering from a fever while vacationing here.

title: Georgia Plane Crash Kills 3
description: CALHOUN, Ga., Dec. 29 (AP) A father and two teenage sons have died in an airplane crash in northeast Georgia near Carter's Dam. Coroner Jack Hughey of Gordon County iden tified the Victims as Richard L. Carver, 43 years old, Richard L. Carver Jr., 16, and Tommy Car ver, 14, of Harrisburg, Ill.

title: AMERICAN PLANES BEGIN A FIFTH DAY OF RAIDS IN NORTH
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, Thursday, Dec. 30  United States planes began their fifth successive day of bombing and strafing over North Vietnam this morning as the heaviest air raids against the North in more than three years con tinued without letup.

title: ALBANY'S LEADERS IN FRAGILE ACCORD ON NEW TAX PLAN
description: ALBANY, Dec. 29Governor Rockefeller and the legislative leaders of both parties have tentatively agreed on a revised tax plan.

title: JEWS ARE URGED TO SHUN REVELRY
description: American Jews were called upon yesterday to avoid all forms of revelry and self indulgence on New Year's Eve because this year the festive holiday coincides with the Jewish sabbath, which tradi tionally begins at sundown on Fridays.

title: L.I. Group Calls Quotas for Production Of Amphetamines 7 Times Higher Than Needea
description: HUNTINGTON, L.I., Dec. 29 A group of Long Island phy sicians and private citizens has petitioned the Department of Justice to reopen hearings on limiting the production of am phetamines, contending that quotas set were seven times higher than that which is con sidered medically necessary.

title: CANADIENS SCORE OVER SEALS BY 32
description: MONTREAL, Dec. 29 (UPI) Frank Mahovlich's 50foot drive midway through the sec ond period tonight broke a 11 deadlock and the Montreal Canadiens went on to defeat the California Golden Seals, 32.

title: Bermuda Gets Black Leader
description: HAMILTON, Bermuda, Dec. 29 (AP)Sir Edward Richards, a black man, was sworn in today as Government leader, succeeding Sir Henry Tucker, who resigned for reasons of age.

title: Fiery Attempt at Murder Laid to Village Resident
description: A Greenwich Village man was accused of arson and at tempted murder yesterday for allegedly throwing kerosene on a sleeping roommate and igniting it.

title: GEORGE PICKEN, 73, ARTIST AND TEACHER
description: PITTSFIELD, Mass., Dec. 29George Picken, a painter, died of cancer yesterday in St. Luke's Hospital here. He was 73 years old and had lived in Tyringham since 1965.

title: MRS. GANDHI OFFERS AMITY TO PAKISTAN
description: NEW DELHI, Dec. 29 (Reu ters)  Prime Minister Indira Gandhi today offered friend ship to Pakistan but warned that while the Indians wanted peace they were prepared to fight if attacked.

title: Article 2  No Title
description: ST. LOUIS, Dec. 29 (UPI) Rick Billik scored a field goal and a free throw with nine seconds left to give Southern Methodist an 8180 victory over Yale tonight in the con solation final of the St. Louis Holiday invitation basketball tournament.

title: Republic Steel Will Develop a Coal Mine
description: The Republic Steel Corpora tion and the Alabama Power Company announced yester day that they had signed a con tract calling on Republic Steel to develop an underground coal mine in Fayette County, Alabama, to supply about 50 million tons of coal over a span of 25 years to the utility.

title: Illinois Gator Bowl Victor
description: JACKSONVILLE, Fla., Dec. 29 (UPI)Jim Krelle hit an 18 foot jump shot with 11 seconds left tonight to give Illinois 7675 victory over previously unbeaten Florida and the Gator Bowl basketball championship.

title: Summary of Study on Changing, and Declining, Role of U.S. in World Economy
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 29 Following is the summary of the study on the international economic situation of the United States presented to the President, the Cabinet, members of Congress and now to the public by Peter G. Peterson, Assistant to the President for International Economic Affairs:

title: MRS. JOSEPH MANN
description: Mrs. Ceil Wonderman Mann, who was associated with her husband, Joseph Mann, in man aging the Peoples' Symphony Concerts series in the audi torium of Washington Irving High School, died Tuesday in University Hospital. She was 73 years old and lived at 920 Riverside Drive.

title: Advertising:
description: How far is it from Third Avenue and 46th Street to Fifth Avenue? Well, if it's from your carpenterfather's apartment to the president's office of an ad agency it'll take longer than a four block walk. For F. Henry Larson, who has been in just such an office at Ross Roy of New York, Inc., for the last couple of months, it's been a 48year trip.

title: District Attorneys' Unit Scores Rigidity of SpeedyTrials Plan
description: Bronx District Attorney Burton B. Roberts, speaking on behalf of the 62 District At torneyi throughout the state, assailed the Judicial Conference yesterday for its decision to put new rules for speedy trials into effect May 1.

title: Halting Nuclear Tests
description: Adjournment of the Strategic Arms Limitation Talks (SALT) in Vienna, without the yearend agreement to which the White House and Kremlin committed them selves last May, demonstrates again the slow pace of progress in curbing the atomic arms race. It brings into question the wisdom of delaying other nuclear negotia tions that could contribute to this goal and, particularly, exploration of a comprehensive treaty banning all nuclear tests, including those underground.

title: PRESBYTERIANS URGE REFORMS IN TAIW AN
description: TAIPEI, Taiwan, Dec. 29 The Presbyterian Church of Taiwan today urged the Gov ernment to adopt thorough in ternal reforms to strengthen the country's ability to with stand outside pressures and keep Taiwan free from Com munist oppression.

title: BAIL REDUCTION PLEA OF WITNESS DENIED
description: A State Supreme Court jus tice yesterday denied an ap plication to free or reduce bail on a woman held as a material witness in the mysterious death of a nurse who died a few weeks after she took out a $100,000 life insurance policy.

title: HISTORIANS ASSESS PENTAGON PAPERS
description: The Pentagon papers were roundly criticized as poor historywriting here tonight by Ernest R. May, a Harvard his tory professor.

title: Miss Susan Kritzler Married to Student
description: RIDGEWOOD, N. J., Dec. 29  Miss Susan Elizabeth Kritzler and Raymond Stanley Borowicz Jr. were married this afternoon in the First Presbyterian Church by the Rev. Dr. Charles A. Platt.

title: 8 NATIONS IN BIDDING FOR FISCHER MATCH
description: The deadline for bids for the world chess championship match between Bobby Fischer of New York and Boris Spassky of the Soviet Union, the world champion, is midnight tomor row.

title: Newcombe and Miss Goolagong Advance in Australian Open
description: MELBOURNE, Aastralia; Dec. 29 (UPI)  John New combe and Evonne Goolagong, the Wimbledon champions, ad vanced today in the Australian open tennis championships.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: Suns Stop Rockets, 124106
description: HOUSTON, Dec. 29 (AP)  The Phoenix Suns getting 27 points each from Clem Haskins and Dick Van Arsdale, defeated the coldshooting Houston Rockets, 124106, tonight.

title: Ohio Nuptials for Ellen J. Philips
description: DAYTON, Ohio, Dec. 29 The marriage of Miss Ellen Jane Philips to Stephen Allen Schwarzman, son of Mr. and Mrs. Joseph Schwarzman of Huntingdon Valley, Pa., took place here this evening. Rabbi Victor Reichert per formed the ceremony at the home of Mr. and Mrs. Jesse Philips, parents of the bride.

title: Thefts of Relics Detailed
description: PHILADELPHIA, Dec. 29 As dusk fell on the Guatemalan jungle a few months ago. Pedro Arturo Sierra, for years a loyal assistant to the British arche ologist Ian Graham, left his tent for a moment only to be flung back by a burst of gun fire into his chest.

title: Higher Jobless Benefits Set for ExServicemen
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 29 (UPI) Many servicemen will be eligible for higher unemploy ment benefits under the recent military pay increase voted by Congress if they are not able to find Jobs when they get out of service, a Labor Department official said today.

title: ARCHDIOCESE GAINS A HIGH SCHOOL PACT
description: A oneyear contract was agreed upon yesterday by ne gotiators for the Catholic High School Association, represent ing 12 archdiocesan high schools, and the Lay Faculty Association, representing 348 lay teachers in the same schools.

title: Musso Counts on Alabama Offense to Beat Nebraska
description: MIAMI, Dec. 29Johnny Musso said one way for Alabama to beat Nebraska in the Orange Bowl Satur day night is to outhit em.

title: Bhutto Promises an Effort To Draw New Constitution
description: KARACHI, Pakistan, Dec. 29 President Zulfikar Ali Bhutto said today that he wanted to move toward the drawing up of a new constitu stion as rapidly as possible, but he did not give a date.

title: Dr. Vincent Aloia, 49, Dead; Southampton College Dean
description: SOUTHAMPTON, L. I., Dec. 29Dr. Vincent Aloia, dean and professor of political sci ence of Southampton College, died Dec. 21 after a heart at tack. He was 49 years old and lived at 449 Hill Street.

title: BROCKINGTON NAMED N.F.C.'S TOP ROOKIE
description: John Brockington of the Green Bay Packers, whose 1,105 yards rushing is the highest sea son total ever achieved by a firstyear player, was named yesterday the National Football Conference rookie of the year by United Press International.

title: OBSERVER
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 29The follow ing letter came in the mail yesterday from the editors of Time magazine: Sir:

title: Floridians Beat Pacers
description: MIAMI BEACH, Dec. 29 (AP) Larry Jones and Ira Harge broke open a close game with 9 straight points midway in the fourth quarter tonight and lift ed, the Floridians to a 123112 victory over the Indiana Pacers.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: MATTHEW J. HICKS
description: Matthew J. Hicks, retired secretarytreasurer of the Dela ware & Hudson Railroad, died Tuesday while visiting his daughter in Hawaii. He was 71 years old and lived at 13 River Road in Albany.

title: Dreyfus Accord Backed
description: Judge Edward C. McLean of the Federal District Court here approved yesterday a $5million settlement of a suit brought by shareholders of the Dreyfus Fund against 10 original share owners of the Dreyfus Corpora tion, manager of the mutual fund.

title: MidContinent Telephone Sets Financial Agreement
description: An agreement under which the MidContinent Telephone Corporation would provide fi nancial and management sup port to the North Carolina Tele phone Company was announced yesterday.

title: MET ADDS BERRY TO CAST OF COSI
description: For its performance of Mo zart's Cosi fan tutte on Tues day night, the Metropolitan Opera had planned to bring one singer into the cast who had not previously done his role here. This was Walter Berry, who appeared as Don Alfonso and, as might have been ex pected, proved excellent in the assignment.

title: British Announce Pullout In Dispute on Malta Bases
description: LONDON, Dec. 29Britain announced today that she would withdraw all her forces from Malta and end her long military connection with the Mediterranean island. Prime Minister Heath and his Gov ernment made the decision after receiving what they con sidered an ultimatum from the Maltese Prime Minister, Dom Mintoff. It demanded imme diate payment of $11million for use of base facilities.

title: OTB Handle Surpasses $1Million First Time
description: The Offtrack Betting Cor poration, in business since April 8, went over the $1million handle mark yes terday for the first time. The previous high for a day, ac cording to Irving Rudd, pub lic relations director, was $980,000.

title: Ceylon Presents Draft Charter Severing All Ties With Britain
description: COLOMBO, Ceylon, Dec. 29 A draft constitution that will sever all links with Britain and declare Ceylon a sovereign and independent republic dedicated to social democracy was pres sented to Parliament today.

title: Bewilderment Rife at Control Agencies
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 29 The first frame of the car toon strip posted on the door of the Price Commission's in formation office shows a young man talking to his wife. The two age through the next five panels until, at the end, both are in an ad vanced stage of wrinkled de crepitude. The wife, now a crone, speaks:

title: U.S. Copter Shot Down
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, Dec. 29The United States command reported today that an Army light observation helicopter had been shot down just inside Cambodia while sup porting a South Vietnamese operation and two American crewmen were wounded.

title: 2 New Divisions Formed By the Cerro Corporation
description: The erro Corporation has formed two new divisions to replace the present Cerro Cop per and Brass Company divi sion, it was announced yester day.

title: Holiday Mail Reduction
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 29 (AP) The United States Postal Serv ice will handle only Special De livery mail Saturday, New Year's Day. No regular window, delivery or collection services will be provided Saturday, but the normal weekday schedule will be in effect Friday, and regular Sunday services will be provided Jan. 2, the Postal Service said.

title: DR. OTTO SCHLECHTWEG
description: NEW CANAAN, Conn., Dec. 29Dr. K. Otto Schlechtweg, who had practiced dentistry here for 47 years, died yester day in Norwalk Hospital. He was 72 years old and lived in Wilton.

title: 66 Young Women Presented At International Debutante Ball
description: While many debutante parties fall by the way and those that survive have few er presentees, the Interna tional Debutante Ball is en joying its best year ever. Sixtysix young women were presented at the 17th annual event at the WaldorfAstoria last night. The number would have been 67 had not Miss Robin Upjohn. Ley of Engle wood, N. J., been taken ill and canceled out.

title: LINDSAY STARTS WISCONSIN RACE
description: EAU CLAIRE, Wis., Dec. 20 Mayor Lindsay conceded to day that he did not have the support of colorful, bigshot officials in his lonely fight for the Democratic Presidential nomination.

title: F.B.I. SAYS CRIME CONTINUES TO RISE
description: WASHINGTON, Dec; Statistics released today by the Federal Bureau of investigation showed that the volume of serious crimes reported to the police continued to rise during the first nine months of this year.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: Sports of The Times
description: Every once in a while the selection committee for one of the bowl games on New Year's Day gets lucky, some times even inordinately lucky. Because the ground rules demand that invitations to the various bowls must extended before college seasons are over and before na tional rankings have taken final form, the danger guessing wrong and coming up with only half an attraction or worse is omnipresent.

title: Article 3  No Title
description: BATON ROUGE, Dec. 29 (AP) Mayor Sam Yorty of Los An geles said today that his Presi dential candidacy represented the moderate alternative that would bring the South back into the Democratic fold.

title: Cardinal Cooke Begins Visit to G.I.'s in Vietnam
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, Dec.29 (AP)Cardinal Cooke arrived in Saigon. Today to begin his fourth Christmas season trip to Vietnam.

title: The Proceedings In the U.N. Today
description: SECURITY COUNCIL Meets at 3 P.M. on Rho desia.

title: 9 YOUTHS ARRESTED IN A BRONX SLAYING
description: Nine youths were arrested in the. Bronx last night in connec tion with the rape and murder of a woman and the critical wounding of two men.

title: U.S.Diplomats in Vietnam Said to Face Moral Issue
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 29As signments to Vietnampar ticularly to the pacification programs therehave caused many young career diplomats to face a serious moral dilem ma, according to an article in the December issue of the For eign Service Journal.

title: Penn Defeats St. Bonaventure In Kodak Tourney Final, 7069
description: ROCHESTER, N.Y., Dec. 29 (UPI)Bob Morse scored 23 points and hotshooting Penn sylvania led all the way tonight to defeat St. Bonaventure, 70 69, and win the Kodak basket ball tournament.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: ASHBROOK ENTERS PRESIDENCY RACE
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 29 Representative John M. Ash brook of Ohio, accusing Presi dent Nixon of breaking cam paign promises and endangering national security, announced to day that he would seek the Republican Presidential nomi nation and would run in two primaries.

title: Germans Glum About 1972
description: COLOGNE, West Germany, Dec. 29 (AP)West German industry is generally pessimistic in its outlook for 1972, with some sectors forecasting a de cline in business activity.

title: Stars 106102 Victors
description: SALT LAKE CITY, Dec. 29 (AP)Red Robbins, came into the game in the final three minutes tonight and scored nine of the Utah Stars last 15 points to give Utah a 106102 victory over the Dallas Chaparrals.

title: JEREMIAH A. MUSILEK
description: Jeremiah A. Musilek, retired chief of the performance divi sion of New York City's Budget Bureau and a former resident of Little Neck, Queens, died on Dec. 24 in Sun City, Ariz. He was 62 years old.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: Stage: Sad Memories
description: Faced with the awesome ?? of Memphis Store Bought Teeth, one can only wonder why such a dis mal offering was produced.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: In Literature of Food, 2 Books to Satisfy a Reader's Appetite
description: Most books written about food are cookbooks, books with recipes in them. But there is a higher form of gastro nomic literature, one which has no name, is rarely seen, and speaks not to the cook but to the epicure: in other words, to everyone who wants to eat well.

title: ROCKEFELLER SAYS HE MAY RUN AGAIN
description: ALBANY, Dec. 29  Gover nor, Rockefeller said today that he was seriously considering running for a fifth term.

title: Egyptian Aid Reported
description: BEIRUT, Lebanon, Dec. 29 Informed diplomatic sources said here today that Egypt was about to give Palestinian guer rillas substantial military as sistance to help them resume operations against Israel.

title: Rain Dance
description: President Nixon's signing of the workfare bill rounds out a strange political rain dance. Conservatives are convinced that hidden among the nation's welfare recipients are great crowds of healthy, qualified men and women well able to support themselves by their own efforts. To bring forth these hidden potential work ers, conservatives induced Congress to pass this bill requiring most welfare clients to register for jobs or for job training, beginning next July 1.

title: Transit Situation at a Glance
description: PARTICIPANTSThe public agencies involved in the contract negotiations at the Americana Hotel are the New York City Transit Authority and its subsidiary, the Man hattan and Bronx Surface Transit Operating Authority. They operate the city's publicly owned bus and subway lines. Both are under the supervision of the Metropolitan Transportation Authority, a state agency.

title: Lawmakers Wait for Something to Do
description: ALBANY, Dec. 29  There is nothing extraordinary about the second extraordinary legis lative session of 1971 except the frustration, Assemblyman Guy R. Brewer observed, sour faced after the Assembly met and adjourned today in less than a minute.

title: Major Impact Is Seen
description: Insurance industry sources said that the Illinois ruling, if upheld, could have a major impact on a nofault law going into effect on Jan. 1 in Florida and another that is in effect in Massachusetts.

title: Hey Kid, You Need Anything?
description: The new men were just being brought into the housing block to the quarantine section of the prison. As these fish were passing through the large barred doorway, they were scrutinized by the housing block help and the oldtimers. The oldtimers, seeking a new acquaintance, were known as the prison wolves.

title: U.S. Is Accused of Ignoring Law In Naming a Mine Safety Panel
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 29  The Interior Department was charged today with ignoring a. conflictofinterests provision of Federal law in appointing for the anthracite industry an advisory committee on mine safety reforms whose chairman and most of whose members had economic interests in min ing companies.

title: MRS. ROBERT GESSNER
description: Mrs. Doris Lindeman Gessner, widow of Robert Gessner, the first professor of cinema at New York University, died yesterday in University Hospital. She was 57 years old and lived at 235 East 22d Street.

title: Decline in Profits Expected by Sohio
description: Yearend statements were made yesterday by a number of companies in the energy field, including the Standard Oil Company (Ohio), the American Electric Power System and the Peoples Gas Company.

title: U.S. Group Off for Peking
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 29 (UPI) A group of American experts left for Peking today to make final technical arrangements for President Nixon's visit to China next year. Headed by Brig. Gen. Alexander M. Haig, chief assist ant to Henry A. Kissinger, the group of about 25 men will ar rive in Peking Jan. 3.

title: Magnanimity in Nigeria
description: In a world still scarred at year's end by war, violence and retribution, the Nigerian Government's generous treatment of officers who served seceisionist Biafra deserves attention. One authority says it would be neces sary to go back to the American Civil War to find a precedent of comparable magnanimity. The detailed deci sions of Nigeria's Supreme Military Council reflect pains taking case studies as well as the strong humanitarian impulses of General Yakubu Gowon.

title: COLLEGEHEAD, BOARD NAMED IN CONSPIRACY
description: WEST CHESTER, Pa., Dec. 29 (AP)  The new president and the board of trustees of West Chester State College have been charged with crimi nal conspiracy in a case involv ing the appointment of the col lege president.

title: Two Killed and 26 Injured In New Rochelle Explosion
description: NEW ROCHELLE, N. Y., Dec. 29At least two men were killed and 26 other persons were injured in an explosion and fire that leveled a two story auto sales and service building and destroyed an ad joining structure on this city's main thoroughfare today.

title: Transit Chief Is Named
description: KANSAS CITY, Mo., Dec. 29 (AP)Leo J. Cusick, former general manager of the Massa chusetts Bay Transportation Au thority has been named acting resident manager of the Kansas City Area Transportation Au thority The appointment was announced by David L. Ringo, president of the ATE Manage ment and Service Co., of Cin cinnali, which has been hired to manage operations here.

title: White Population in City Fell by 617,127 in 60's
description: There was a net outward migration of nearly one million white people from New York City during the decade of the niniteensixties according to a new breakdown Of 1970 census totals. But because of more births than deaths among whites who remained in the city, the Overall decline in white population Was some 600,000.

title: MARKET ADVANCE SLOWS SLIGHTLY
description: The stock market changed gait yesterday as it continued to move upward. Glamour is sues fell in profit taking after their strong performance earlier this week. The market's main strength, meanwhile, spread over a much broader list of stocks.

title: Drugs as an Aid in Understanding the Past
