description: Like wow Prof. James B. Parsons of the University of California (Riverside) says historians should use psyche delic drugs for their trips to the past.

title: PRICELIST RULING SPARKS CONFUSION
description: In attempting to clarify what it wants from retail stores in the way of posted price, lists beginning Sunday, the Internal Revenue Service apparently has only added to the retailers' confusion.

title: Market Place: Bearish Opinion Of Stock Market
description: If you're getting geared, up for a big upward thrust in the stock market in the weeks ahead, let Julius Mager temper your enthusiasm with thoughts on the bearish side.

title: BONDS TURN MIXED AS A RALLY EASES
description: The credit markets' headlong rush to lower interest rates lost momentum yesterday as some traders took profits and began to tidy up their yearend books.

title: MRS. WILLIAM CORREA
description: CLEVELAND, Dec. 29Mrs. Elizabeth Baird Correa, widow of William H. Correa, who had been a vice president of the MobilSocony Oil Company, died today at St. Francis Hos pital, M'ami. She lived in Cleve land Heights, and previously in New York and Washington.

title: 1971 Has Seen Soviet Sharply Ease Curb on Emigration to Israel
description: MOSCOW, Dec. 29So dra matic has been the change in Soviet policy toward Jewish emigration during 1971 that, Muscovites tell of a woman who changed her nationality of ficially a few years ago from Jewish to Russian with a dis creet bribe, but who now wants, her Jewish nationality back in order to emigrate.

title: ExPoliceman Is Acquitted in Jetliner Hijacking
description: A former city policeman ac cused of hijacking a New York bound jetliner last May was acquitted in Brooklyn Federal Court last night of air piracy and flight interference charges by virtue of insanity. The jury failed to reach a decision on a third charge of kidnapping.

title: 2 Children, From Birth to B.A., Estimated to Cost $80,000 Up
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 29It costs the typical American family between $80,000 and $150,000 to raise two children and put them through college, according to a Federal research study obtained today.

title: Athens Board Accuses 6 In Ferry Fire Fatal to 25
description: ATHENS, Dec. 29The Greek shipowner Costas Efthymiadis, one of his ship captains and four crewmen were accused today of negligence by a mari time board of inquiry for a fire aboard the overcrowded car ferry Heleanna last Aug. 28 that resulted in the death of 25 persons.

title: Paterno: Stopping Wishbone Is No Snap
description: DALLAS, Dec. 29Joe Pa terno, the eternal optimist, the coach who usually feels his Penn State football team can win the big ones and does not shy away from saying so, is either running scared or play ing a new game of psychology. He has never sounded as pessi mistic as he doeS in prepara tion for Penn State's date with Texas in the Cotton Bowl on Saturday.

title: Common Market Raises Farm Limit Fee
description: BRUSSELS, Dec. 29 (AP) Common Market authorities an nounced today that farm im ports from outside the com munity would have to pay a new and higher set of fees to make up for the devaluation of the United States dollar.

title: Merger News
description: The All American Life and Fi nancial Corporation announced yesterday that it had agreed to purchase the interest of Wheel abratorFrye, Inc., in the Gen eral United Group, Inc., an insuranceholding company, for $18.2million in cash and notes.

title: Guyana Budget Sets Record
description: GEORGETOWN, Guyana, Dec. 29The Guyanese Parlia ment last night approved record budget calling for capital and current expenditures total ing approximately $113million in 1972. During the new year. it is estimated, foreign aid will include $9.8million from the United States.

title: Allen Named Coach of Year
description: ST. LOUIS, Dec. 29 (UPI) George Allen of the Washing ton Redskins was named today as coach of the year in the National Football League in a poll of league coaches con ducted by the Sporting News.

title: The Stormy History of Malta Is a Reflection of the Island's Strategic Position
description: LONDON, Dec. 29The stormy history of the island of Malta has been linked through the ages with its geographical position  right in the middle of the Mediterranean.

title: STUDY FOR NIXON BACKS NEW RULES IN WORLD TRADE
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 29  A White House report pointed the way today to major interna tional negotiations that would establish new rules for world trade, reform the world mone tary system and establish new codes for international business investment.

title: AMEX ADVANCES FOR SECOND DAY
description: The American Stock Ex change and the overthecoun ter market scored their second consecutive advance yesterday in steppedup trading.

title: NETS' RALLY TOPS CONDORS, 105102
description: WEST HEMPSTEAD, L. I., Dec. 29Johnny Roche scored 13 of his 18 points in the fourth quarter tonight to spark the New York Nets to a 105102 victory over the Pittsburgh Con dors in an American Basketball Association game at Island Gar den before 6,684 fans, the largest home crowd in the Net's history.

title: Mrs. Diana Fulton Wed
description: GREENWICH, Conn., Dec. 29  Mrs. Diana Fulton, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Cyrus L. Fulton of Lancaster, Ohio, was married here, this afternoon to Roscoe K. Fawcett Jr., son of Mrs. Fawcett of Greenwich and Mr. Fawcett of Pompano Beach, Fla. The Rev. Donald Poole, a Presbyterian minis ter, performed the ceremony at the home of the bride's brotherinlaw and sister, Mr. and Mrs. Perry L. Burns

title: Gelfand Urges Withholding Of Emergency Repair Pay
description: Councilman Bertram R. Gel fand urged Controller Abraham D. Beame yesterday to with hold all payments to con tractors in the city's emergency repair program until work had been checked for completion.

title: GERULAITIS BOWS IN TENNIS FINAL
description: MIAMI BEACH, Dec. 29 Coni Ensor, queen of the Or ange Bowl festivities, playfully tapped Vitas Gerulaitis on the head with a tennis racquet to day after the finals of the 25th annual Orange Bowl junior championships.

title: JOHN J. GILGANNON
description: RAHWAY, N. J., Dec. 29  John. J. Gilgannon, an adminis trative assistant with Merck & Co., manufacturing chemists here, and a member of the Rahway City Council, died yesterday at his home here aft er a brief illness. His age was 53.

title: S.E.C.'s Request Arouses Little Surprise in Wall St.
description: The decision of the Securities and Exchange Commission to seek broader regulatory powers over the securities industry met with little surprise in Wall Street yesterday and even in spired some favorable com ments from financial leaders.

title: Warren DuBois, Lawyer, ??; Headed Historical Associations
description: Warren C. DuBois, a lawyer here since 1915 and a leader in several historical and fraternal associations, died yesterday in Brooklyn Hospital. He was 80 years old and lived at 751 St. Mark's Avenue in Brooklyn.

title: ELECTRIC CABLES GROUNDED BY P.S.C.
description: ALBANY, Dec. 29  The Public Service Commission issued regulations today requir ing all new residential devel opments across the state to be served by underground elec tric and telephone cables in stead of the tangle of over head wires that characterize most of the state's villages and suburbs.

title: Theater Season: Strange and Tough
description: Although the current thea ter season is only half com pleted, already the trends have been set, some kind of pattern is emerging, and we can even now see a shape of the year that, with their odd halfandhalf accounting, the atrical historians will call New York Theater 1971 72.

title: Soviet Photos Show Mars Capsule
description: The Soviet Union has re leased photographs and dia grams of the Mars 3 descent capsule and a sketch of its landing technique.

title: Indignation in Peking
description: HONG KONG, Thursday, Dec. 30China today expressed ut most indignation at the latest upsurge of American bombing in North Vietnam and promised continued firm and unshak able support of the forces in the Indochina war arrayed against the United States.

title: Hanoi Identifies U.S. Pilots
description: PARIS, Dec. 29 (AP)  The North Vietnamese News Agency today gave the names of two American airmen reported killed when their Phantom jet was shot down Sunday. The names were given as Capt. Lawrence Gene Stolz, serial number 316464799 FR, and Lieut. Dale Francis Koons, serial number 275468109 FV.

title: POLICE INVESTIGATE SLAYING IN PRISON
description: SOMERS, Conn., Dec. 29 The state police are investigat ing the circumstances surround ing the death yesterday of Louis Annunziato, 39, of New Haven, an inmate at the state prison here who was serving a 10year sentence for theft and carrying a dangerous weapon.

title: Havana Paper Reduces Size
description: HAVANA, Dec. 29 (Reuters) Granma, the organ of the Cuban Communist party and Havana's only morning paper, announced today that it was reducing the number of its pages for the next few days because of a paper shortage. The newspaper, which normal ly has eight pages, had only four today.

title: Claire's Knee, Jane Fonda and Finch Picked by National Critics
description: Claire's Knee, Eric Rohmer's Frenchmade corn edy, yesterday was voted the best movie of 1971 in the sixth annual poll of the National So ciety of Film Critics, compris ing 24 reviewers for national publications.

title: Evil Spirits Warded Off In City Hall Inauguration
description: A striped, colorful dancing lion leaped and cavorted, cymbals clanged, gongs rang, drums beat rhythmically and firecrackers exploded at City Hall yesterday.

title: McDonnell Delivers 12 Jets
description: ST. LOUIS, Dec. 29 (Reuters) The McDonnell Douglas Cor poration said today it delivered 12 new jetliners with a total value of approximately $110 million in December. Eleven went to American Airlines, United Airlines, National Air lines, Scandinavian Airlines, AeroTransporte Italiane and Austrian Airways. One was delivered to the Air Force.

title: PAKSONG RETAKEN, LAOTIANS ANNOUNCE
description: VIENTIANE Laos, Dec. 29 (Agence FrancePresse)A Lao tian force today reoccupied the Government stronghold of Pak song, which was evacuated yesterday by four battalions under heavy enemy fire, mili tary sources said here.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: HARLANDIES AT72; ON CORT 16 YEARS
description: John Marshall Harlan, the reserved and scholarly 89th Justice of the United States Supreme Court, died in Wash ington yesterday afternoon of cancer. Justice Harlan, who re tired on Sept. 23 because of failing health, was 72 years old.

title: Roosevelt's Answer to OTB: Cable TV From Garden
description: In a maneuver designed to prevent what it called offtrack erosion, Roosevelt Raceway disclosed yesterday it would offer its patrons cable telecasts of all important sports events at Madison Square Garden.

title: Dooley Ousted as Head Coach With Year Left on Bears' Pact
description: CHICAGO, Dec, 29 (AP) Jim Dooley was dismissed to day as head coach of the Chi cago Bears by the club's owner, George Halas, who had picked Dooley as his successor four years ago.

title: SCHULER PINS BAKER TO RETAIN MAT TITLE
description: BROOKVILLE, L. I., Dec. 29 Tom Schuler of Navy success fully defended his 118pound title by pinning Dave Baker of Central Connecticut early in the second period last night before a crowd of 800 at the finals of the C. W. Post wrestling tourna ment.

title: Bridge: Greeks Had a Way for It When Tourney Needed Aid
description: Tournament organization in the United States is carried out in professional fashion by professionals. In other parts of the world, most of the work is done by amateurs, and is sometimes amateurish.

title: Report's Author Known As Economic Kissinger
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 29 The author of the massive new study of world trade and monetary problems, Peter G. Peterson, is known around the nation's capital as the economic Kissinger.

title: Article 1  No Title
description: PORTLAND, Ore., Dec. 29 (UPI)Michigan, sparked by Wayne Grabiec and John Lockard, moved away from Oregon late in the game and posted a 9385 victory tonight in consolation play at the Far West basketball classic. Wash ington defeated Dartmouth, 10075, in the first consolation game.

title: SEX BIAS IS SEEN FOR ECONOMISTS
description: NEW ORLEANS, Dec. 29  John Kenneth Galbraith, the newly installed president of the American Economic Associa tion, said today that one of his main objectives would be to make the association a strong moral barrier against sex dis crimination.

title: Miss Mary K. Fleeson Married To 2d Lieut. Peter D. Weddle
description: ARLINGTON, Va., Dec. 29 St. Andrew's Episcopal Church was the setting here this afternoon for the mar riage of Miss Mary Kathleen Fleeson, who graduated from Skidmore College earlier in the month, to Second Lieut. Peter David Weddle, U.S.A., a June graduate of the United States Military Academy. The Rev. Robert H. Andrews per formed the ceremony.

title: Kin of 3 Slain Men Unite Here to Fight Crime Across U.S.
description: Three men whose brothers were slain in the city have formed a citizens' committee to follow Presidential aspirants around the country to compel them to address themselves to the nation's No. 1 problem crime and violence.

title: A Way of Life and Thought
description: Those who keep their ears close to the ticking heart of the times have an epochmaking discovery to report now adays. The middleclass way of life, they tell us, is done for it is hollowed out, finished, condemned to death, doomed, and destined to be devoured root and branch by a new world that has risen in thei East. Certainly a tre mendous wave of change is sweeping over Europe todaythis we can all feel and experience. It is a wave of what is called the world revolution, a fundamental upheaval of our whole view of life, sped by all the moral, scientific, economic, political, techni cal and artistic devices at the command of the twentieth century. It is progressing with such rapidity that our children, born before the war or after it, are actually already living in a new world and no longer know very much about the world from which we sprang. But it is one thing to acknowledge that a world revolu tion is taking place and another to say that the way of life of the German bourgeoisie is seriously, condemned to destruction by it. That way of life is far too closely bound, up with the idea of humanity and of all human culture for it ever to be alien, ever to be dis pensable, in any humane world. This dire prognosis is based on an erro neous overemphasis upon economic classes. For what we mean is the mediate position of the German burgher spirit, and not the bourgeoisie as a middle class in economic terms.

title: Scene Is Familiar in Americana, The Biennial Transit Battlefield
description: Some time tomorrow, Mayor Lindsay will move into a suite at the Americana Hotel for what he hopes will prove a brief stay.

title: Flyers Beaten By Rangers,51
description: In a final tuneup for Sun day's main event against the Boston Bruins, the Rangers last night got all their goals in an 11minute span of the first pe riod while scoring a 51 victory over the Philadelphia Flyers.

title: Bengalis Encircle 30,000 Biharis in Mill
description: NARAYANGANJ, Pakistan, Dec. 29 (AP)Thirty thousand Biharis  workers and their families  are under virtual siege within the walls of the world's largest jute mill, near here surrounded by a vengeful Bengali populace.

title: Man in the News
description: Joseph F. Crangle, the man who will have the job of trying to coax and browbeat the state's traditionally con tentious Democrats into a semblance of unity for at least the next six months, is often described as one of a new breed of political tech nicians. Although he may use new and sophisti cated techniques, there is something familiarly old fashioned about his approach to party loyalty. During a spe cial session of the State Leg islature last spring, Mr. Cran gleassigned, as an aide to Assembly Minority Leader Stanley Steingut of Brooklyn, to maintain the united Demo cratic front against Republi can tax proposalscalled the one Democratic defector a Judas Iscariot. new and sophisti cated techniques, there is something familiarly old fashioned about his approach to party loyalty. During a spe cial session of the State Leg islature last spring, Mr. Cran gleassigned, as an aide to Assembly Minority Leader Stanley Steingut of Brooklyn, to maintain the united Demo cratic front against Republi can tax proposalscalled the one Democratic defector a Judas Iscariot.

title: A New Newspaper In Yiddish Makes Appearance Here
description: A new Yiddishlanguage eve ning daily newspaper, the Yid dishe Zeitung, published its first issue of 10,000 copies yes terday, which were distributed throughout the metropolitan area, according to its editor and publisher, Sender Deutsch.

title: Jury Deliberates 8 Hours In Dowdy's Bribery Trial
description: BALTIMORE, Dec. 29  A Federal District Court jury re tired tonight after failing to reach a verdict in its initial eight hours of deliberations in the trial of Representative Jhon Dowdy, Democrat of Texas ac cused of conspiring to accept a $25,000 bribe in 1965 from the owner of a Washington home improvement company attempt ing to avoid prosecution for fraud.

title: 4 Responses Listed
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 29 (AP)  The responses Representa tive Ashbrook listed today as signals that President Nixon was adopting a more conserva tive course, and under which he indicated he would abandon his candidacy if they occurred, were:

title: McGOVERN TO ENTER FIRST RACE TUESDAY
description: MANCHESTER, N.H., Dec. 29 (AP)Senator George McGov ern, Democrat of South Dakota, will officially enter New Hamp shire's Presidential preference primary, the first of 1972, when he files candidacy papers next Tuesday, his headquarters said today.

title: H &
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 29  H & R Block, Inc., has consent ed to a Federal Trade Commis sion order prohibiting the firm from illegally using the name and addresses of customers.

title: TV BLACK JOURNAL CHALLENGES CRITIC
description: The producers of Black Journal replied yesterday to a review by John J. O'Connor, television and radio critic of The New York Times, of a re cent program in the series. The review appeared in Tuesday's editions.

title: Saving the Library
description: The scheduled closing tomorrow of the New York Public Library's science and technology division is a seri ous blow to the city's status as a center of research, scholarship and industry. The collection's 750,000 books and manuscripts represent one of the world's most impor tant sources of information in areas crucial to modern progress. Lack of funds is about to turn this priceless depository into a scientific Fort Knoxone where treasures of the mind will be stored but not used.

title: Disputed Harding Love Letters Will Be Locked Up Until 2014
description: COLUMBUS, Ohio, Dec. 29  Heirs of President Warren G. Harding have agreed to do nate to the Library of Congress a series of unpublished love let ters from him to the wife of a Marion, Ohio, department store owner, in return for a guaran tee that they will remain sealed until the year 2014.

title: U.S. Is Disappointed
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 29  The State Department said to day that it believed Britain's offer to Malta was fair and responsive to the interests of all concerned and that the United States was disappoint ed that the talks had broken down.

title: Cancellations Assailed
description: BOSTON, Dec. 29 (AP) Cancellation notices sent to as many as 200,000 Massachusetts motorists by automobile insur ance companies are invalid, State Attorney General Robert H. Quinn said today. He said the companies would have to continue coverage after the of the year.

title: KIALOA  IS FIRST TO REACH HOBART
description: HOBART, Australia, Dec. 30; Thursday (Reuters)  The American team competing in the Southern Cross yachting series took three of the first four places in the Sydneyto Hobert yacht race, which ended early today.

title: John C. Linsenmeyer, 67; Led Gulfstan Corporation
description: RESTON, Va., Dec. 29John Cyril Linsenmeyer, former executive vice president of American Standard, Inc., and subsequently president of the Gulfstan Corporation, died to day in Fairfax (Va.) Hospital. He was 67 years old and lived at 1146 Orchard Lane.

title: ANTHONY DANCERS OFFER SIX WORKS
description: Six works by four members of the Mary Anthony Dance Theater made for an uneven but always interesting program Tuesday night at the Riverside Church. Miss. Anthony's com pany will perform there through tomorrow night.

title: News of Dogs
description: Dr. and Mrs. Harold L. Huggins are firm believers in a dog also having a social life. We have had as many as 30 dogs at a time and every one had his turn in the house, said the physi cian. We would have three or four with us, the rest in the kennel. We believe a dog should so cialize with the family. The Denver couple comprise one of the few hus bandandwife judging teams in the country. However, we frequently judge at dif ferent shows, said Huggins. I'll be on the West Coast and my wife on the East.

title: Manitoba Hydro Gets Loan
description: WINNIPEG, Manitoba, Dec. 29 (Canadian Press)A sixmonth loan of 100million marks (about $30.6million) has been nego tiated with West Germany for power development by Manitoba Hydro. Finance Minister Saul Cherniack said today the loan, at 4.95 per cent, extends the present 3year loan, which has a cost of 6.85 per cent.

title: Shop Talk
description: In the French court of the 18th century, especially dur ing the time of Marie Antoin ette, dcoupage, the art of cutting out designs and then applying them, was not only a pastime but an important source of decoration. Dcou page was also a hobby among the fashionables in England during the 18th and 19th centu ries, and Queen Victoria was a collector of it. Now it is possible for anyone in New York to get all the materials needed, and instruction too, in order to practice this not too diffi cult but intensely personal art. Like collage, it can ex press one's hobbies, prefer ences, longings and regard for others. It can also reveal pretty mercilessly how good an eye one has for design and color.

title: SILVER FUTURES REGISTER A GAIN
description: Commission house short covering, new buying and some light trade buying helped the advance of silver prices on the Commodity Exchange here yes terday. Prices opened about 1 cent an ounce higher, and at the close ranged up 2.20 cents to 1.60 cents an ounce, on a total trade of 2,289 lots. The January, 1972, contract closed at $1.3710, up 2.20 cents an ounce.

title: Agnew Is Guest of Sinatra
description: PALM SPRINGS, Calif., Dec. 29 (UPD)Vice President Ag new arrived in this Southern California desert resort today to spend the New Year's holi day. Mr. Agnew and his wife, Judy are guests at the home of Frank Sinatra, the singer in nearby Cathedral City.

title: Dowling Gets Nassau Post
description: MINEOLA, L. I., Dec. 29 The appointment of Dr. John J. Dowling as Commissioner of the Nassau County Health De partment was announced today by County Executive Ralph G. Caso. Dr. Dowling, a 50year old resident of Syosset, will succeed Dr. Joseph H. Kinna man, who is retiring at the end of the year. Dr. Dowling will serve a sixyear term in the $38,000ayear post.

title: Mrs. Knauer Calls for Ratings To Improve Repairs on Autos
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 29 (UPI)Mrs. Virginia H. Knauer, President Nixon's Adviser on Consumer Affairs, asked repre sentatives of consumer groups, the industry and Government today to help devise a public rating system to aid motorists in finding the best garages to repair their cars.

title: Loeb Calls Teamster Loan In 1960 Properly Secured
description: MANCHESTER, N. H., Dec. 29 (UPI)  William Loeb, pub lisher of The Manchester Un ion Leader, has said that charg es that he borrowed $2million from the International Brother hood of, Teamsters without se curity are inaccurate.

title: Notes on People
description: In my opinion, they were trying to break my spirit, said James R. Hoffa, the for mer Teamsters Union presi dent, charging that while serving a Federal prison term he was kept in maximum security for almost three years on orders from Wash ington.

title: Swiss Reject Plea By U.S. for Return Of Timothy Leary
description: GENEVA, Dec. 29Switzer land refused today to grant a United States request for the extradition of Dr. Timothy Leary, who escaped in Sep tember, 1970, from a California prison where he was serving an indeterminate sentence of three months to 10 years for possession of marijuana.

title: Priest Slain Alter Counseling A Veteran Is Buried in Jersey
description: MOUNT HOLLY, N. J., Dec. 29The Rev. John L. Wessel, who the police said was fatally wounded by a distraught Viet nam veteran he was trying to help, was buried today in St. Mary's Cemetery.

title: Educational Testing Service GetS $250,000 Ford Grant
description: The Ford Foundation an nounced yesterday a grant of $250,000 to the Educational Testing Service in Princeton to establish a Center for Statewide Educational Assessment.

title: Lombardo Tuning Up for His 43d Auld Lang Syne
description: Tomorrow night, just as midnight approaches and the bright hall on the Allied Chemical Building starts de scending to tick off the re maining seconds of 1971, Guy Lombardo and his Royal Canadians will finish off the old year for the 43d time by playing Auld Lang Syne.

title: HEMPSTEAD ASKS HOUSING REVIEW
description: HEMPSTEAD, L.I., Dec. 29 The Secretary of the United States Department of Housing and Urban Development was asked by the Town of Hemp stead today to reverse an arbitrary decision by the de partment's regional adminis trator to withhold Federal funds from the town because of its insistence on building housing for the elderly rather than low income housing for families.

title: SNIPER ON ROOF KILLS A SOLDIER IN ULSTER
description: LONDONDERRY, Northern Ireland, Dec. 29 (Reuters)A British soldier was shot and killed by a sniper firing from a roof on the outskirts of the Roman Catholic district of Borgside in Londonderry today.

title: MURPHY REVISING DUTIES FOR 25,000
description: Police Commissioner Patrick V. Murphy said yesterday that the duties of most of his 30,000 men would be changed Satur day to give detectives more time to concentrate on the more serious crimesespecially violent crimes.

title: Cases Cited By 2 Donors To Neediest
description: We hope this will help one of the cases in your files, wrote Mike and Bar bara Land in a note that accompanied their $100 do nation to The New York Times Neediest Cases Fund.

title: Crangle Is Expected to Play the Leader
description: Several Democratic leaders said yesterday that they ex pected Joseph F. Crngle, the newly elected state chairman, to take command of their party, in contrast to the subordinate roles played by recent party chairmen.

title: BUCKS TROUNCE BLAZERS, 12384
description: MILWAUKEE, Dec. 29 (AP) Kareem AbdulJabbar led balanced scoring attack with 32 points as the Milwaukee Bucks broke a mild slump with a 12384 National Basketball Association victory over the Portland TrailBlazers tonight.

title: Nassau Policeman Is Slain Responding to a Holdup
description: SOUTH FARMINGDALE, L.I., Dec. 29A 22yearold Nassau County policemen was fatally shot tonight as he responded to a call that the County Line Deli on South Main Street was being held up.

title: HalfTon Man Stricken While Putting on Show
description: HOUSTON, Dec. 29  A sideshow performer who is reported to weigh nearly half a ton was stricken during his show this morning and taken to Ben Taub Hospital here, where he is undergoing tests to determine the nature of his illness.

title: St. Louis, Howard to Meet In N.C.A.A. Soccer Final
description: MIAMI, Dec. 29 (UPI)St. Louis University will seek its third straight National Col legiate Athletic Association soc cer championship tomorrow night when it plays Howard University in the Orange Bowl.

title: ANTITRUST LAWSUIT INVOLVES PANASONIC
description: A dispute over the marketing of Japanesemade electronic products, including television, radio and home appliances, became a Federal Court law suit yesterday, with a distrib utor alleging antitrust viola tions by the Matsushita Elec tric Corporation of America and its sales representatives in the New York area.

title: ARBITRATION BILL VOTED BY COUNCIL
description: A bill requiring binding arbi tration of deadlocked labor dis putes involving some 300,000 city employes was approved yesterday by the City Council, 34 to 3.

title: 2 Win $100,000 Prizes In Lottery's Drawing
description: ALBANY, Dec. 29 (UPI) Two $100,000 prizewinners were picked today in the nexttolast monthly draw ing of New York State's $1 lottery tickets.

title: Wood, Field and Stream
description: Recently, some venerable merchandising houses have reproduced their catalogues of yesteryear and the re sults, while not inspiring, have always been interest ing.

title: General May Be Given No. 2 Post in the C.I.A.
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 29 President Nixon is reported to be considering the appoint ment of an Army major gen eral, Vernon A. Walters, to be Deputy Director of Central Intelligence.

title: Nixon and Brandt End Talks in Florida
description: KEY BISCAYNE, Fla., Dec. 29President Nixon and Chan cellor Willy Brandt of West Germany ended two days of talks here by reaffirming the close partnership between their two nations and pledging a strong, joint commitment to the North Atlantic Treaty Or ganization.

title: Warriors Halt Royals
description: CINCINNATI, Dec. 29 (UPI) Cazzie Russell scored a game high of 33 points tonight as the Golden State Warriors dealt the Cincinnati Royals their ninth straight loss, 107102.

title: Chess: Budapest Defeated by Moscow By 3 Points in Annual Match
description: The annual team match be tween two great Eastern Euro pean chess centers, Moscow and Budapest, ended this year in a narrow victory for Mos cow, the usual result. The final score was 2522.

title: ALCOA PRODUCTS FACE PRICE RISE
description: The Aluminum Company of America announced yesterday that it had put into effect a new pricing schedule applica ble to 70 per cent of its fabri cated product shipments.

title: LEONE INSTALLED AS ITALY'S HEAD
description: ROME, Dec. 29Italy's new President, Giovanni Leone, stressed national unity and loyalty to the Western alliance in his inaugural address today, and asked the cabinet of Premier Emilio Colombo to stay in office.

title: U.S. Appeals Court Refuses to Reopen TV Case in Boston
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 29 (AP) The united States Court of Appeals for the District of Co lumbia denied today a request by the Federal Communications Commission to reconsider the agency's award of Boston's tel evision Channel 5 to Boston Broadcasters, Inc.

title: Day of Terror for 50,000, Bengalis: Thousands Were Slain, Homes Razed
description: KHOLAMURA, Pakistan, Dec. 28On Friday, Dec. 3, a digni fied, wrinkled man named Ha jiuddin who has a patriarchal white beard had just finished washing himself in preparation for evening prayer when a squad of West Pakistani sol diers burst into his family mosque.

title: IN THE NATION
description: President Nixon's chosen policy of Vietnamization has greatly reduced the number of American troops and casualties in Indochina, while the non Communist Government in Saigon has remained in power andsome say strengthened itself. Can it be said, therefore, that Vietnamization has been a success?

title: U.S. Still Refusing to Give Any Details on the Bombing
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 29De spite mounting criticism, the Nixon Administration con tinued its refusal today to pro vide any information about the details or duration of the in tensified bombing of North Vietnam.

title: EQUITY FINANCING
description: Winnebago Industries, Inc., the Forest City, Iowa producer of recreational vehicles, mar keted 1.25 million common shares yesterday priced by Dean Witter underwriting group at $48. Of the total, the company sold 500,000 shares, while 750,000 were sold on behalf of existing stock holders. The closing New York Stock Exchange price was $48, down .

title: Conspiracy Is Alleged
description: Four subsidiaries of the American Electric Power Com pany filed suit yesterday in the Federal Court in New York alleging conspiracy in violation of the Sherman Antitrust Act by both the General Electric Company and the Westinghouse Electric Corporation.

title: LOUISVILLE FIVE SINGS NEW TUNE
description: The Louisville basketball team will be on the Madison Square Garden floor tonight during the playing of the National Anthem before it meets Fordham in the final of the Holiday Festival.

title: LOWER BAIL DENIED IN MYSTERY DEATH
description: A State Supreme Court Jus tice yesterday denied an appli cation to free or reduce bail on a woman held as a material witness in the mysterious death of a nurse who died a few weeks after she had taken out a $100,000 life insurance policy.

title: Gilmore Sparks Colonels
description: LOUISVILLE, Ky., Dec 29 (AP)Artis Gilmore scored 30 points and helped throttle late Memphis rally tonight as the Kentucky Colonels posted a 125111 victory over the Pros.

title: Equity Theater Is Aided
description: The Equity Library Theater, the showcase for professional performers, has received a gift of $6,000 from the Whitford Kane Professional Committee of Lincoln, Ill. The money will be used to help defray the thea ter's expected deficit. Mr. Kane was a noted character actor and an original member of Or son Welles's Mercury Theater.

title: Cheech and Chong Show Comedic Skill On ShaNaNa Bill
description: Carnegie Hall rocked with surprisingly compatible mixture of humor and nostalgia Tuesday night. The nostalgia came from the songs and antics of Sha NaNa, the humor from a com edy duo called Cheech and Chong.

title: Couve Is Hospitalized
description: SAINTRAPHAEL, France, Dec. 29 (AP)Maurice Couve de Murville, former foreign minister and premier of France was taken to a hospital today suffering from a chest conges tion. Physicians said his condi tion gave no cause for worry.

title: Syrian Delegate Accuses J.D.L. Of Continuing Its Harassment
description: A Syrian delegate to the United Nations charged yes terday that the Jewish Defense League was continuing its ha rassment tactics against mem bers of the Syrian Mission, which was vandalized Tuesday by two intruders.

title: La Fonda del Sol Is Passed In Final Health Inspection
description: La Fonda del Sol, threatened with a shutdown because of serious Health Code viola tions, has passed its final in spection with flying colors, Health Department inspectors reported yesterday.

title: Advertising:
description: Although he probably won't do anything official until Monday, starting Saturday Gordon N. Morford, the for mer publisher of Harper's Bazaar magazine, will be vice president of LanvinCharles of the Ritz.

title: Yahya Is Reported Detained
description: RAWALPINDI, Pakistan, Dec. 29 (AP)A Pakistani news paper reported today that for mer President Yahya Khan was under house arrest and would remain under detention during an inquiry into his wartime leadership.

title: Mrs. Frances Smith Shapli, ExWife of Egyptian Aide
description: HACKETTSTOWN, N. J. Dec. 29  Mrs. Frances Smith Shapli, who had been married to the late Gen. Aziz el Masri, Chief of Staff of the Egyptian army before World War I, died yesterday in Heath Village, a retirement community here. She was 77 years old.

title: 18 Veterans Arrested At Consulate on Coast
description: SAN FRANCISCO, Dec. 29 (AP)Eighteen members of the Vietnam Veterans Against the War barricaded them selves inside the South Viet namese consulate today to protest renewed American bombing of North Vietnam and to demand an end to the war. They were arrested for trespassing.

title: SONG RECITAL GIVEN BY AYALONS QUARTET
description: The style of the Ayalons, quartet from Israel that is cur rently appearing at El Avram on Sheridan Square, very often approaches that of the Ritz Brothers at their zaniest. Yet the overall message that comes from their frequently frenetic performances is a reiteration of the brotherhood of man.

title: 1 Dead, 11 Lost in Nile Fire
description: CAIRO, Dec. 29 (AP)  A sidewheel paddle steamer that once belonged to King Farouk caught fire and sank during a tourist excursion on the upper Nile River last night, killing crewman and injuring 53 oth ers. Eleven more sailors are missing. The vessel, the Kased Kheir, was carrying French and Belgian tourists, but most of them had left to visit a temple in the Aswan area.

title: A RULING UPHOLDS PRIMARY IN TEXAS
description: FORT WORTH, Dec. 29 Attorney General Crawford Martin has cleared the way for an unofficial Democratic Presi dential primary in the only major state that does not permit voters to give their Presidential preferences.

title: 3 U.S. Men Beaten
description: PORT ELIZABETH, South Af rica, Dec. 29 (AP)Linda Tuero and Sharon Walsh were the only Americans left in the Free State Sugar tennis tournament today.

title: Books of The Times
description: COLE. Edited by Robert Kimball. Biographical essay by Brendan Gill. Designed by Bea Feitler. Illustrated. 283 pages, New York: Holt, Rinehart & Winston. $25.

title: News of Skiing
description: In the wake of one of the warmest Decembers since schussboomers, in number, began hightailing down slopes some four decades ago, many metropolitan New York ski shop owners are singing the blues.

title: Teachers in Yonkers Vote To Strike Monday Over Pay
description: Walter Tice, president of the Yonkers Federation of Teach ers, announced yesterday that his union's membership would strike Yonkers' 44 public schools on Monday.

title: SOVIET PLANTOAID FATAH REPORTED
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 29. The Soviet Union, which long kept Arab guerrilla organiza tions at arm's length, has re cently shifted its strategy, ac cording to analysts in the State and Defense Departments.

title: Moss Plans Insurance Bill
description: SALT LAKE CITY, Dec. 29 (UPI)Senator Frank E. Moss, Democrat of Utah, said today that he would introduce legis lation to give Federal employes a broader choice of medical insurance plans in an attempt to lower absolutely outrage ous premiums.

title: Connecticut Names Aide
description: HARTFORD, Dec. 29Barry L. Savitz of New York, 24 years old, a former block trader for Donaldson, Lufkin & Jenrette, was appointed today as an as sistant chief investment officer in the State Treasurer's Office. He will be in charge of fixed income securities in Connecti cut's $640million pension and trust funds.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: Nixon Fills Health Post
description: KEY BISCAYNE, Fla., Dec. 29 (UPI)President Nixon to day appointed R. Heath Larry, vice chairman of the United States Steel corporation to be chairman of the President's Committee on Health Educa tion.

title: Miss Adler Is Bride of Jay S. Pearlman
description: PARIS, Dec. 29Jay S. Pearlman of West Hemp stead, L. I., and Miss Fran coise Adler of Vitrysur Seine were married Monday at the town hall of Vitry surSeine, a Paris suburb, by Alain Audoubert, the deputy mayor. A religious ceremony was presided over by Grand Rabbi Henri Schilli at the Rabbinical School of Paris.

title: More Grass Races on 1972 N.Y R.A. Schedule
description: Horseplayers who do their playing at Aqueduct, Belmont Park and Saratoga can look forward to a substantially re shaped 1972 stakes schedule.

title: United Aircraft Expects Loss in '71 of $35Million
description: The United Aircraft Corpora tion will have an estimated net loss in 1971 of from $35million to $40million after a writeoff of as much as $125million before tax credits, according to a statement by William P. Gwinn, chairman in a letter being sent to stockholders to day. The tax credit is estimated at $60million.

title: Conversion Terms Given For New I.C. Preferred
description: Illinois Central Industries, Inc., parent of the Illinois Cen tral Railroad, plans to create a new series of $6 cumulative convertible preferred stock, Series A, to effect the planned merger of the I. C. with the Gulf, Mobile & Ohio Railroad.

title: Kings Set Back Canucks
description: LOS ANGELES, Dec. 29 (AP) Juba Widing and Eddie Joyal scored secondperiod goals and Ralph Backstrom added an in surance tally with five minutes left tonight to lead the Los An geles Kings to a 31 victory over the Vancouver Canucks in a battle between lastplace Na tional Hockey League teams.

title: Blues Top Leafs, 63
description: TORONTO, Dec. 29 (UPI) Gary Unger scored his 19th and 20th goals as the St. Louis Blues posted their first victory ever at Maple Leaf Gardens to night, trouncing Toronto, 63.

title: Pilots Describe Shooting War In Skies Over Indochina Now
description: DANANG, South Vietnam, Dec. 29 (AP)American pilots bombing North Vietnam are en countering more MIG's, sur facetoair missiles and anti aircraft fire than they ever have seen before in Indochina.

title: Ninety Days Are Enough
description: Chief Judge Stanley H. Fuld of New York has held his first press conference in 26 years on the bench, by way of underscoring the importance of enforcing sched uled reforms in the state's criminal justice system. This is a disgracefully neglected, dangerously creaky system that cries out for reform, one that has helped feed the high rate of crime and fostered prison riots.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: MRS. M. N. BUCKNER
description: SARATOGA, Calif., Dec. 29 Mrs. Paula Kellerman Buckner, the widow of Mortimer N. Buckner, who was chairman of the board of the New York Trust Company from 1921 until his death in 1942, died on Sun day. The couple were married in 1908.

title: Stockholdings Of Insiders
description: The American Stock Ex change yesterday issued its latest report on changes in stock ownership by major stock holders, directors and officers of listed companies. The New York Stock Exchange has is sued no list this week.

title: Executive Changes
description: Roswell L. Gilpatric, partner in the law firm of Cravath, Swaine & Moore, has been designated chair man of the board of directors, Federal Reserve Bank of New York, and Federal Reserve agent for 1972 by the board of governors of the Federal Reserve System. At the same time, Ellison L. Hazard, chair man of the executive committee of the Continental Can Company, was appointed a class C director for the unexpired portion of a term ending Dec. 31, 1972, and named deputy chairman of the bank board for 1972. Mr. Gilpatric, as chairman and agent, suc ceeds Albert L. Nickerson, former chairman of Mobil Oil Corporation, who is resigning from the board tomorrow.

title: When G.I.'s Come Home, So Do Pets
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam When many G.I.'s leave Vietnam, they do not leave behind their loved ones. In 1969, for example, American soldiers took home 270 dogs, 33 cats, 19 reptiles, 20 monkeys, 26 birds, one fox and three lizards.

title: Pentagon Says Hanoi Bans Some Parcels for P.O.W.'s
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 29 The Pentagon said today that North Vietnam had refused to accept 900 packages mailed to American prisoners of war and men listed as missing in action.

title: Personal Finance
description: If you have been searching for ways to cut your month ly expenses, why don't you take a fresh look at your automobile insurance policy.

title: Top Transit Negotiators Advance to Economic Issues
description: Negotiators in the city's tran sit dispute, faced with a New Year's Day strike deadline, be gan toplevel discussions of economic issues yesterday.

title: MATTE OF COLTS RATED DOUBTFUL FOR GAME SUNDAY
description: TAMPA, Fla., Dec. 29 With a sprained and swollen left knee, Tom Matte joined the Baltimore Colts' other regu lar at running back, Norm Bu laich, in the questionable category today for the Ameri can Football Conference cham pionship game Sunday with the Dolphins in Miami.

title: Youth Indicted in a Slaying
description: George Peterson, 18 years old, of 1240 Franklin Avenue, in the Morrisania section of the Bronx, was indicted yes terday on charges of murder, illegalweapon possession and acting in concert in connec tion with the death of Cornell Benjamin. Mr. Benjamin, 25, was killed Dec. 2 while at tempting to mediate a dispute between youth gangs in the Bronx, Mr. Peterson was ar raigned yesterday before Law rence Bernstein, acting State Supreme Court justice, who set no bail and adjourned the case to Jan. 6 for pleading.

title: Louisa D. Surut Becomes Bride Of Army Officer
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 29 Miss Louisa Day Surut was married here this afternoon in St. David's Episcopal Church to Second Lieut. Charles Rising Carey, U.S.A.

title: Pope Deplores Bombings
description: ROME, Dec. 29  Pope Paul  implicitly condemned the United States air strikes against North Vietnam in an address during his weekly general au dience in the Vatican today.

title: ST. JOHN'S BEATS HARVARD, 94 TO 88
description: COLLEGE PARK, Md., Dec. 29St. John's received a bat tle from a stubborn Harvard team tonight before turning back the Crimson, 9488, before 14,000 in the opening round of the Maryland invitation basket ball tournament.

title: Squires Down Cougars
description: Raleigh, N. C., Dec. 29 (AP) The Virginia squires beat the Carolina Cougars tonight for the second night in a row when they overcame a 5point Cougar lead early in the fourth quarter to register a 126117 victory.

title: Sadat Confers With Cooper
description: CAIRO, Dec. 30President Anwar elSadat conferred here today with Senator John Sher man Cooper, a member of the Foreign Relations Committee, who is on a tour of the middle east. Senator Cooper, Repub lican of Kentucky, arrived in Cairo two days ago after a visit to Israel.

title: NORTH STARS, BRUINS PLAY TO A 22 TIE
description: BLOOMINGTON, Minn., Dec. 30 (AP)Jude Drouin's goal at 2:55 of the third period earned the Minnesota North Stars 22 tie with the Boston Bruins tonight in a National Hockey League game.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: HENRY BROOKS
description: LOUISVILLE, Ky., Dec. 30 (AP)Judge Henry L. Brooks of the United States Court of Appeals for the Sixth Circuit, died today at his home here. He was 66 years old.

title: Threat Is Seen to the Will of Journalists to Speak Out
description: GENEVA, Dec. 30  The International Press Institute re ported today that in the demo cratic world the will of the journalist to say what he thinks is being slowly and im perceptibly weakened.

title: Small Quake in Alaska
description: PALMER, Alaska, Dec. 30 (AP)A small earthquake, with a preliminary magnitude of 3.7 on the Richter scale, occurred 20 miles southwest of Anchor age today, the Palmer Observa tory reported. The observatory spokesman said the magnitude and location of the quake were not sufficient to generate a tidal wave.

title: Paula Carroll, Nurse, Is Wed
description: LARCHMONT, N. Y., Dec. 30Miss Paula Marie Car roll, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Paul Bertrand Carroll, was married here this after noon to Garry Philip. Cuoco, son of Mrs. Philip Cuoco of Yonkers and Mr. Cuoco of Miami. The Rev. Vincent P. McShane performed the cere mony in St. Augustine's Ro man Catholic Church.

title: Bridge: Barry Crane Again Registers Top OverAll Record for Year
description: On the American: tourna ment scene the Most remark able individual performance in 1.971 was by Barry Crane of Los Angeles, who in pri vate life produces Mannix and other television pro grams.

title: REGENTS OUTLINE FREEZE'S EFFECTS
description: ALBANY, Dec. 30The State Board of Regents said today that education in New York will be severely curtailed by Governor Rockefeller's pro posed freeze on spending.

title: Red Wings Drop Wall
description: DETROIT, Dec. 30 (UPI) The Detroit Red Wings today dropped Bob Wall, a defense man, and shipped him to their American Hockey League farm team at Tidewater, Fla.

title: I.R.A. Man Killed in Dublin
description: DUBLIN, Dec. 30 (Reuters) A prominent member of Sinn Fein, the political wing of the Irish Republican Army was killed tonight when a explosion ripped the roof off his rented garage here.

title: Pravda Portrays Santas Here As a Gang of Grubby Grinches
description: MOSCOW, Dec. 30 (UPI) The Communist party newspa per Pravda today portrayed in New York in Christmastime as a strange city of hopes and despair where phony sidewalk Santas ask for money instead of giving gifts.

title: Miss Walsh Advances
description: PORT ELIZABETH, South Africa, Dec. 30 (AP)Sharon Walsh of San Rafael, Calif., and Linda Tuero of Metairie, La., moved into the semifinals of the Free State Sugar tennis championships today.

title: Executive Changes
description: The Manhattan Life Insurance Company an nounced the appointment of Donald M. Fordyce as executive vice president. Previously a vice presi dent agency administration, Mr. Fordyce in his new position will be assisting Thomas E. Lovejoy Jr. chairman and chief executive officer, in administer ing company affairs and promoting Manhattan's sale image. Robert E. Broderick was appointed sec ond vice president and Shirley Rodder was named assistant vice president.

title: Vienna Choir Boys Add Modern Works To Their Concerts
description: The Vienna Choir Boys are back with us for another series of their annual holiday con certs, and by the time they finish at Philharmonic Hall on Sunday, they will have entered the 40th anniversary year of the first Vienna Choir Boys ap pearances in this country. Sol Hurok introduced them to the United States in 1932.

title: Eugenia King Wed To David P. Reader
description: OKLAHOMA CITY, Dec. 30  Miss Eugenia King, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Arthur Ellis King Jr., was married here this evening to David Parker Reader, son of Dr. and Mrs. George Gordon Reader of Rye, N. Y. The Rev. Mackenzie Thompson, a Methodist minister, per formed the ceremony in the Bishop Angie Smith Chapel of Oklahoma City University.

title: Barbiturate Effect Is Cited In Mysterious Death Here
description: Police officials said yesterday that an autopsy on the body of Gail Richards, a 30yearold medical assistant found dead under mysterious circum stances, had revealed barbit urate Poisoning.

title: Shop Talk
description: The sleek, hardedge geo metries that dominated dcor in the sixties are about to be eclipsed by nature themes. A profusion of floral, animal and bird motifs dominate in most major collections of fabrics, wallcoverings and carpets introduced here re cently. The romantic revival turns up in both period and mod ern interpreta tions of garden blooms, jungle foliage, feathers and animal forms and stripes appearing in woven or print ed materials. Certainly the liveliest collection of fabrics and wallcoverings document ing the trend is Ellen Leh man McCluskey's Animol ogy for KB Designs, 979 Third Avenue (at 58th Street). Mrs. McCluskey is partial to strong graphic detailing in her prints of peacock feath ers, vines and flowers, mon keys and stylized trees played against a zebra stripe.

title: 5thTerm Announcement Has Joker in the Deck
description: ALBANY, Dec. 30 (AP) Governor Rockefeller may be saying that he might run for a fifth term, but his Christ mas gifts to employes in the Capitol contained another hint.

title: ROSEWALL, STONE GAIN IN AUSTRALIA
description: MELBOURNE, Australia, Dec. 30 (AP)Secondseeded Ken Rosewall defeated Jean Paul Meyer of France, 64, 64, 62, today and Alan Stone eliminat led Mark Cox of Britain 61, 62, 63, leaving only one nonAus tralian in men's singles play at the Australian open tennis championships.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: NIXON SIGNS BILL FOR JOBLESS PAY
description: KEY BISCAYNE, Fla., Dec. 30 President Nixon has signed into law a bill providing $454million in extra unemploy ment benefits to 732,000 idle Workers. But he said he had serious misgivings.

title: Prudential Loses a Round Of Trust Suit in Boston
description: The Prudential Insurance Company has been denied motion to dismiss an antitrust suit filed against it my the Manhattan Life Insurance Com pany, it was disclosed yester day. The ruling was banded down in Boston by United States District Judge W. Arthur Garrity Jr.

title: Soviet Weather Satellite
description: MOSCOW, Dec. 30 (AP) The Soviet Union launched a weather satellite yesterday, and all instruments on board are operating normally, Tass, the government news agency, said today.

title: C. A. B. Moves to Allow Anyone To Fly on LowCost Charters
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 30  The Civil Aeronautics Board took action today designed to make lowcost charter flights available to anyone, regardless of membership in a special club or society.

title: WALTER E. DIETZSCH
description: TEANECK, N. J., Dec. 30 Walter E. Dietzsch, executive director of the Embroidery Manufacturers Promotion Board, died yesterday at the Holy Name Hospital. He was 57 years old and lived at 783 Cedar Lane.

title: NEGRO ENSEMBLE LISTS 2D OFFERING
description: As its second venture of the 197172 season, the Negro En semble Company is offering a Works in Progress program next month under the direction of Michael Schultz.

title: McCracken Sees More Controls
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 30 The outgoing chairman of Presi dent Nixon's Council of Eco nomic Advisers said today that there will have to be a contin uing Government role in the wage and price area after the current Phase Two program of controls ends.

title: COMMODITY PRICES LISTED FOR WEEK
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 30The Bureau of Labor Statistics re ported today the following spot primary prices for the week ended Dec. 21:

title: U.S. and Europe Touchy on Trade Aims
description: PARIS, Dec. 30  I cannot conceive of the European Eco nomic Community ever being antiAmerican, an official of the Common Market said re cently in Brussels, but I can conceive of it being more inde pendent of decision making by Washington.

title: UConn Beaten, 7464
description: TULSA, Okla., Dec. 30 (AP) Al Faber's scoring and re bounding helped East Carolina down the University of Con necticut, 7464, tonight for third place in the Oral Roberts tournament.

title: Gertrude Blumenthal, Publisher And Editor of Messner, Is Dead
description: Gertrude Blumenthal, the publisher and editor of Julian Messner, a division of Simon & Schuster, Inc., and vice presi dent of the parent concern, died of a heart attack on Monday while vacationing in the Yuca tan.

title: Historians Debate Secrecy by Government
description: Historians at the American Historical Association meeting here yesterday maintained that Government secrecy was a blanket designed to cover the sublime as well as the ridicu lous, matters of state and mat ters that are rarely stated.

title: City Plans New Year's Eve Party in Park
description: With the promise of no rain today and the threat of a sub way and bus strike notwith standing, New Yorkerswill be out in force tonight to greet the new year.

title: Wide Change Seen In Securities Field In 1972 by Kolton
description: Significant longrange changes in the operation of the securities industry are likely to occur in 1972, ac cording to a yearend state ment yesterday by Paul Kolton, president of the American Stock Exchange.

title: Thant Puts In a Working Day And Departs Quietly From U.N.
description: UNITED NATIONS, N. Y., Dec. 30U Thant departed as Secretary General of the United Nations today as quietly as he had served for 10 years.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: REAPPORTIONMENT VETOED BY REAGAN
description: SACRAMENTO, Calif., Dec. 30  Gov. Ronald Reagan vetoed today Democraticdraft ed reapportionment plans for both houses of the California Legislature and the state's 43 Congressional districts.

title: Money, Poverty and Peace
description: Twelve leading economists from North America, West ern Europe and Japan have warned that, despite the monetary and trade agreement negotiated by the Group of Ten in Washington, the underlying and basic issues remain. They fear these will lead to what could become a still more serious crisis, both economic and political.

title: PROF. MARY M'GRATH, SPEECH TEACHER, 80
description: Prof. Mary T. McGrath, former chairman of the speech department of James Madison High School and assistant prin cipal of New Utrecht High School, both Brooklyn, died Tuesday in University Hospital, Boston. She was 80 years old and lived at Newton Centre, Mass.

title: LOAN OF $120MILLION TO MEXICO ARRANGED
description: SAN FRANCISCO, Dec. 30 (Reuters)The Bank of Amer ica said today it was heading an international banking con sortium that has put together a $120million mediumterm fi nancing package, repayable in 10 years, to support develop ment projects of three public agencies of the Mexican Gov ernment.

title: Wood, Field and Stream
description: When we left home long before dawn the nearlyfull moon hung in the western sky like a great orange egg and a gentle northerly wind; had swept the heavens clean of the clouds.

title: Browns' Schafrath Retires
description: CLEVELAND, Dec. 30 (AP) Dick Schafrath, an offensive tackle, announced his retire ment today from professional football, ending a 13year ca ?? with the Cleveland Browns.

title: Billie Jean King Abandons Suit Against U.S.L.T.A.
description: EMERYVILLE, Calif., Dec. 30 (UPI)Mrs. Billie Jean King said yesterday she was drop ping her $54,000 damage suit against the United States Lawn Tennis Association.

title: HomeMade Atom Bombs?
description: An important but complicating factor has been added to the national debate abaft alternative energy sources. At the current meeting of the American Association for the Advancement of Science in Philadelphia, several scientists have raised the possibility of criminal diver sion of fissionable material plutonium or enriched uraniumfrom existing atomic power stations or from the many others about to be built. The specter of home made atomic bombs being created for political or other reasons by thieves of fissionable material was presented seriously. Existing security at nuclear power plants often lax; only a few pounds of nuclear raw material is needed, and the basic knowledge for building atom bombs is now widespread.

title: BUS LINES LOOKING FOR RISE IN FARES
description: The operators of the eight private bus lines in the city are participating in the current contract negotiations at the Americana Hotel, but their real interest lies in what happens after the contract talks end.

title: Slayer of 5 Sentenced to Die
description: REDWOOD CITY, Calif., Dec. 30 (AP)John Linley Frazier, a 25yearold convicted murderer, was sentenced today to die in San Quentin's gas chamber for the murders of five persons. Judge Charles S. Franich of Su perior Court refused to reduce a jury's sentence. Frazier was convicted of murdering five per sons at a mansion in the Santa Cruz hills in October, 1970, and dumping the bodies in a swim ming pool.

title: Advertising:
description: You remember 1971, don't you? That was the year where most of the smiles around were on yellow lapel buttons.

title: Ole Miss Sinks Ga. Tech In Peach Bowl, 41 to 18
description: ATLANTA, Dec. 30 (UPI) Two sophomore quarterbacks, Norris Weese and Kenny Lyons, led Mississippi to a 4118 tri umph over Georgia Tech to night in the rain and mud in the Peach Bowl game.

title: ROCK CONCERT GIVEN BY BEAUTIFUL DAY
description: When a rock group is called It's a Beautiful Day, every per formance they do provides a tempting invitation to make snide remarks. I will resist the temptation, however, and sim ply say that the San Francisco rock band's concert at Carnegie Hall Wednesday night was a disappointment.

title: Musicians, Seeking Raise, Strike Baltimore Symphony
description: Musicians of the Baltimore Symphony Orchestra went on strike Wednesday for the sec ond time in the orchestra's 57 year history.

title: Raw Product Prices Paid to Farmers Rose 2% in Month
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 30 (AP) Prices farmers received for raw products rose 2 per cent in December, the third succes sive monthly increase, an aver age of 12 per cent more than a year ago, the Agriculture De partment announced today.

title: European Rights Agency Is Building a Body of Law
description: STRASBOURG, France  Cynics maintain that the Nurem berg trials only enforced an an cient precedent: Vae victis (woe to the vanquished). But Ireland, suing Britain over the alleged violation of human rights in Ulster, is hardly rely ing on military force. Instead the Irish are appealing to a tribunal based on a law holding that the rights of individuals can be superior to the sovereign ty of nations.

title: Suspect is Seized in the Slaying Of a Nassau County Policeman
description: SOUTH FARMINGDALE, L.I., Dec. 30The police appre hended before midnight today a 22yearold North Amityville man who is a prime suspect in the slaying last night of Richard B. Rose, a Nassau County pa trolman.

title: ALFRED J.ROSS DIES; LED BANKING HOUSE
description: Alfred J. Ross, chairman of the board of Roosevelt & Son, Inc., investment banking house, died of a heart attack yester day at his office, 72 Wall Street. He was 65 years old and lived at 130 Aldershot Lane, Manhasset, L. I.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: NASA AND RUSSIA TO EXCHANGE DATA
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 30 The National Aeronautics and Space Administration and the Soviet Academy of Sciences have agreed to a detailed ex change of information on the biological effects of space flight.

title: In Cortland County They Remember the Servicemen
description: CORTLAND, N.Y., Dec. 30 You think you'd get used to it, but you never do, mused Mrs. Grace Lindley, who for the last 14 years has always had at least one of six sons away in military service.

title: Transit Negotiators Urged By Mayor to Step Up Pace
description: Negotiations aimed at averting a subway and bus strike tomorrow moved toward a climax yesterday, but the two sides remained far apart on critical money matters. Mayor Lindsay warned that the time was very short and urged the parties to intensify their bargaining efforts in the re maining hours before tomor row's 5 A.M. deadline for a possible walkout of 40,000 bus and subway workers rep resented by the Transport Workers Union and the Amal gamated Transit Union.

title: I.R.S. WILL CHECK ON PRICE POSTING
description: In the first move of what was described as a firmer policy of more vigorous enforcement of price stabilization rules, 200 Internal Revenue Service agents will begin Monday a storeby store check on the posting of base prices.

title: Working Capital Climbed $5Billions in 3d Quarter
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 30 (Reu ters) The Securities and Ex. change Commission reported to day that net working capital of corporations increased by $5 billion in the third quarter of 1971, compared to $5.9billion in the second quarter and $41 billion in the third quarter of 1970.

title: WASHINGTON
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 30Nineteen hundred and seventyone went out with a bang and a doubt. Between Christmas Eve and New Year's Eve, President Nixon appealed first for human peace and pity, and then ordered the heaviest bombing of North Vietnam in over three years, and no body was quite able to reconcile the gentle words, and the destructive bombs.

title: STOKELY REPORTS GAIN IN EARNINGS
description: StokelyVan Camp, Inc., fruit and vegetable packers, re ported yesterday for the six months ended Nov. 28 net in come of $3,095,000, or 81 cents a share, up 9.8 per cent from $2,819,000, or 72 cents a share, for the preceding year's pe riod.

title: MISS KUSNER HURT IN LAUREL SPILL
description: LAUREL, Md., Dec. 30 (AP) Kathy Kusner suffered a frac tured nose and lacerations of the face today when she fell from her mount in the first race at Laurel Race Course.

title: Decision to Resume Sales Of F4's to Israel Reported
description: WASHINGTON, Dec.30 The United States has decided to resume the sale of F4 Phantom warplanes to Israel, Administra tion sources said today.

title: CITY AWARDS PACT FOR SEWAGE PLANT
description: Mayor Lindsay announced yesterday the award of a $228 million contract that is expect ed to start construction within six weeks on the controversial North River Pollution Control Plant.

title: Texas Nuptials for Susan Strauss
description: DALLAS, Dec. 30At Temple EmanuEl here to night Miss Susan Strauss and Philip Maxwell Robertson Jr., students at the University of Texas, were married by Rabbi Gerald Klein.

title: Japan's Rail Plans at Full Throttle
description: TOKYOIn 1854, when Com modore Perry sailed into Tokyo Bay and ended centuries of Japanese isolation, he brought a spectacular gifta working miniature steam railroadas an example of American technol ogy.

title: On Bobby Fischer's Mind: The Match Site, Spassky and Money
description: Bobby Fischer, the 28year old American chess wizard, said yesterday that he would like it best if an American city was the high bidder for next spring's world title match with Boris Spassky, 34, of the Soviet Union.

title: Rockets Defeat Hawks
description: HOUSTON, Dec. 30 (AP) Elvin Hayes scored 42 points and Rudy Tomjanovich took down a career high of 23 re bounds tonight to lead the Houston Rockets to a 129115 victory over the Atlanta Hawks.

title: News of Skiing
description: With maintenance crews in much of the North Country engaged in Operation Snow pack as a result of a major storm yesterday that blank eted much of New England and upper New York, Alan Fleischman of Big Vanilla at Davos found himself again wondering when his luck was going to change.

title: 9 Antiwar Veterans Seized
description: BOSTON, Dec. 30 (AP)Nine members of the Vietnam Vet erans Against the War were arrested today after they and others occupied a Marine Corps recruiting station. The veterans occupied the station along with members of the People's Coali tion for Peace and Justice and supporters of both groups.

title: Chief Executive Is Named By Bank of North America
description: John H. Vogel, president and chief administrative officer of the National Bank of North America, has been named chief executive officer of the bank, a C.I.T. Financial Corporation affiliate.

title: 9 Soviet Prisoners Ask Red Cross Intervention
description: MOSCOW, Dec. 30Nine Soviet political, prisoners, in cluding Simas Kudirkas, the Lithuanian seaman who tried to defect and was handed back by the United States, have circu lated an appeal seeking the intervention of the Internation al Red Cross to improve condi tions in their labor camp.

title: Rich Is Named to Start for East; Marinaro Reported to Be Upset
description: SAN FRANCISCO, Dec. 30 (UPI)Ed Marinaro and John Reaves, two of the biggest stars of the 1971 college football sea son, won't be in the starting lineup tomorrow for the 47th Shrine EastWest game at Candlestick Park.

title: State Accuses Landlord Here Of AntiWoman Discrimination
description: The State Division of Human Rights has found probable cause to credit the complaint of a 29yearold Brooklyn teacher that a landlord had re fused to rent her a Greenwich Village apartment because of her sex.

title: NEW ZEALAND CRAFT TAKE TOP 3 PLACES
description: SYDNEY, Australia, Dec. 30 (Reuters)  New Zealand was declared the unofficial winner of the Southern Cross Cup to night, the fourrace yachting series that ended with the 650 mile SydneytoHobart race.

title: Ellsberg Indicted Again in Pentagon Case
description: LOS ANGELES, Dec. 30Dr. Daniel Ellsberg was indicted by a Federal grand jury again today, on 12 criminal charges, including conspiracy, for re leasing the controversial Penta gon papers to the news media.

title: 6 of Besieged Biharis Suspected of Cholera
description: DACCA, Pakistan, Dec. 30  Six suspected cases of cholera were reported today in the jute mill where 30,000 Biharis, members of the non Bengali minority, and their families have been trapped for weeks.

title: CITY SUSPENDS AIDE ON BRIBERY CHARGE
description: A city engineer was suspend ed yesterday on charges that he had accepted $3,700 from two companies while he was in charge of the Water Re sources Department's Staten Is land drainage section.

title: Two American Inmates Wed in a Beirut Prison
description: BEIRUT, Lebanon, Dec. 30 (AP)Two Americans serv ing threeyear prison terms on charges of hashish smug gling were married here today in a prison cell.

title: TV: Beethoven's Birthday on C.B.S.
description: Some yearend notes on a few matters that, for one reason or another, merit noting:

title: MONEY ADJUSTED BY 100 COUNTRIES
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 30  The agreement Dec. 18 of the Group of 10 leading industrial nations (which effectively de valued the United States dollar) required currency exchange rate decisions by nearly 100 countries, the International Monetary Fund disclosed today.

title: Greenfield Is Still Contractor On Huron Tunnel Project
description: PORT HURON, Mich., Dec. 30 (AP)The Associated Press, in an article reporting a gas explosion in a newly construct ed water tunnel under Lake Huron near here on Dec. 11, said the $13million tunnel project had been given to Greenfield and Associates and then withdrawn after unsatis factory performance.

title: The Most Admired Women
description: PRINCETON, N. J., Dec. 30 The Premier of Israel, Mrs. Golda Meir, is the woman most admired by the Ameri can people, according to a Gallup Poll taken earlier this month. In last year's survey, she was third among the top 10; in 1969, fourth.

title: Finality in City Labor
description: The City Council has finally declared its independence of union pettifogging by passing Mayor Lindsay's long stalled requirement for binding arbitration of dead locked municipal labor disputes. The measure represents the most decisive step any major city has yet taken to assure that rational process, not force, will determine where equity lies in controversies that cannot be resolved at the bargaining table.

title: Mrs. Holmes Married
description: BRONXVILLE, N. Y., Dec. 30Mrs. Pattie Porter Holmes of Bronxville and Shelter Is land, widow of John Pharr Holmes, was married here this afternoon to Gray Thoron, professor at the Cor nell Law School in Ithaca. The Rev. Charles Copenhaver performed the ceremony at the Reformed Church

title: Notes on People
description: After being hailed as Fakhr al Islam  pride of Islam  Muhammad Ali ful filled the dream of all Mos lems by visiting Mecca. At the Red Sea city of Jidda, Prince Faisal ben Fand, head of Saudi Arabia's youth wet fare department, told the boxer: Your conquests in the ring have proven you are a sports miracle and made ev ery Moslem throughout the world proud of you. There fore, since you are here, we hail you as Fakhr al Islam,

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: A Day When Bargain Hunters Took Aim on Furs
description: It was bargain day yester day as the prestigious fur house of Maximilian offered its wholesale and boutique samples in the first public auction sale in its history.

title: RESERVE EXTENDS VOLUME OF CREDIT
description: The Federal Reserve System pumped $2.8billion in tempo rary credit into the money mar ket this week to offset seasonal pressures at yearend, the cen tral bank's weekly statement showed yesterday.

title: Howard Captures N. C. A. A. Soccer, Stopping St. Louis
description: MIAMI, Dec. 30 (UPI)Led by Trinidad's Alvin Henderson, Howard University became the first black university in the 65 year history of, the National Collegiate Athletic Association to win a national sports title, scoring a 32 upset tonight over St. Louis, America's dominant college soccer power for the past three years.

title: Miss Adele Lee Hall Married To Carl Uddo Zachrisson Jr.
description: Miss Adele Lee Hall and Carl Uddo Zachrisson Jr. were married here yesterday afternoon in St. James' Episcopal Church by the Rev. Dr. Eugene Carson Blake, general secretary of the World Council of Churches.

title: Dance: New Group From Dartmouth
description: Pilobolus, a dance group formed by four Dartmouth men as an outgrowth of dance classes at the college, made an informal debut here Wednesday night at the LouisNikolais Dance Theater Lab, 344 West 36th Street.

title: Miami Kicker Won't Yield a Foot
description: MIAMI, Dec. 30  Despite the Baltimore Colts' success at blocking seven of 13 fieldgoal attempts this year, the Miami Dolphins won't alter Garo Ye premian's placekicking style or increase the yardage to where the ball is spotted be hind the line of scrimmage Sun day in the American Football Conference championship game.

title: Israelis Doubt a Soviet Role in Combat
description: TEL AVIV, Dec. 30Israel says her military strategists be lieve that the Sovet Union has decided to keep its forces in Egypt aloof from any resumed combat that President Anwar elSadat might try to initiate across the Suez Canal.

title: Paris Has First Snow
description: PARIS, Dec. 30 (Reuters) With all France in an icy grip, Paris had its first snow of the season today.

title: Medici Denies Brazil Is Seeking Domination Over Latin America
description: RIO DE JANEIRO, Dec. 30 Brazil has declined the role of leader in Latin America that was in effect extended to her by President Nixon early this month.

title: Sports of The Times
description: In the bright lexicon of racing, Leon Greenberg is a name as bitter on the tongue as HotHorse Howie Samuels. As president of Monticello Raceway, Greenberg made deal permitting HotHorse Howie's Offtrack Betting Cor poration to televise three races a night for the special edification of OTB cilents playing the superfecta.

title: NEW ROCHELLE TOLL IN FIRE REACHES 3
description: NEW ROCHELLE, N. Y., Dec. 30A third man died early to day as a result of the fire and explosion that destroyed two automobile agencies at 162 Main Street in the downtown section here yesterday.

title: Franco on TV Threatens To Curb Liberals in Church
description: MADRID, Dec. 30General Franco warned today that he was prepared to take action against the growing liberal mil itancy of the Spanish church.

title: U. Mass. Tops Williams, 83, To Win Hockey Tourney
description: WILLIAMSTOWN, Dec. 30 The University of Massachu setts defeated Williams Col lege 83, tonight to win the Williams invitation hockey tournament.

title: Court Moves to Bar Harding Love Letters
description: COLUMBUS, Ohio, Dec. 30 (AP)Love letters that Presi dent Warren G. Harding wrote to Mrs. Carrie Phillips, wife of a Marion, Ohio, de partment store owner, were legally barred today from public view until the year 2014.

title: One U.S. Combat Death Is Lowest Toll Since '65
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, Dec. 30 (UPI)One American soldier was killed in combat in Indochina last week, the United States military com mand reported today. It was the lowest, figure since Feb urary, 1965, when no one was killed. The command also re ported 29 wounded in the week ended Saturday.

title: Boe Awarded L.I. Franchise
description: Roy Boe and 10 partners who helped raise $10million for the team were awarded the Nation al Hockey League franchise for Long Island yesterday.

title: Exchange Names Aide
description: The New York Mercantile Exchange, trader in commodity futures, yesterday announced the appointment of Allen E. Abrahams as vice president.

title: ERIC RYAN, 41, DIES; COLGATE PROFESSOR
description: HAMILTON, N. Y., Dec. 30 Eric J. Ryan, chairman of the Fine Arts Department of Col gate University, died of pneu monia in Community Memorial Hospital on Monday. He was 41 years old.

title: Alison Eames Is Bride
description: RYE, N. Y., Dec. 30Miss Alison Margaret Eames, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Arthur B. Eames of Lynch burg, Va., was married this afternoon to Edward Louis Martin, son of Mr. and Mrs. Stanley Martin of Rye. The Rev. Joseph P. Bishop per formed the ceremony in the Rye Presbyterian Church with the Rev. Donald W. Poole assisting.

title: Miss Ferdinand Is Bride Of Bolling W. Haxall Jr.
description: BASKING RIDGE, N.J., Dec. 30Miss Marcia Anne Ferdi nand, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Louis J. Ferdinand, was married here this morning to Bolling Walker Haxall Jr., son of Mr. and Mrs. Haxall of Riverdale, the Bronx, New York, The Rev. Joseph Wade performed the ceremony at a nuptial mass in St. James Roman Catholic Church. Serv ers at the mass were Greg ory Ferdinand, brother of the bride, and Christopher Durso, cousin of the bride.

title: NOLAN PLOTTING A 49ER SURPRISE
description: REDWOOD CITY, Calif., Dec. 30 (UPI)The San Francisco 49ers put the final touches on their offensive game during a long workout today and Coach Dick Nolan said he was satis fied the team would be at its best for Sunday's National Football Conference title game against Dallas.

title: City Block: For Many, A Season of Despair
description: It was a dirty gray morn ing on 85th Street between Central Park West and Col embus Avenue yesterday. A fitful cold rain was splatter ing the postman, some swol len bags of gattage were threatening to burst and in some apartments, at least, New Year's Eve hung ahead like a cloud, or maybe a mi asma.

title: Massachusetts Buying Pennsy Track
description: BOSTON, Dec. 30 (AP) Massachusetts today announced plans for state acquisition of 145 miles of railroad rightsof way in Massachusetts from the Penn Central Transportation Company. The deal, which in cludes options to purchase an additional 90 miles, is to cost some $19.5million and is con tingent on a Federal loan. It also is subject to approval by regulatory authorities and the Federal court overseeing the Penn Central reorganization.

title: Commodity Price Index Up 0.2 From WeekAgo Level
description: The Commodity spot market price index of foodstuff and in dustrial materials rose to 107.3 from 107.1 last week.

title: New Values of World's Currencies
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 30The following tables show the new values of the world's currencies in the aftermath of the Dec. 18 agreement among the Group of 10 industrial nations on a realignment of their currencies, leading to an effective devaluation of the United States dollar.

title: Dorothy Comingore, an Actress Seen in Citizen Kane, Is Dead
description: STONINGTON, Conn., Dec. 30 Dorothy Comingore, who took the role of Susan Alexander, Orson Welles's leading lady, in the 1941 motion picture Citi zen Kane, died today after a long illness.

title: Merger News
description: The KimberlyClark Corpora tion announced yesterday it has agreed to sell its Niagara Falls, N. Y., operations to the Cellu Products Company, Patterson, N. C., a privately owned com pany that makes cellulose wad ding and other interior packag ing materials. The terms of the sale were not disclosed. The Niagara Falls prop erty includes a coated printing pa per mill, a tissue manufacturing and converting plant and a groundwood pulp mill.

title: LOUISVILLE BEATS FORDHAM BY 9682
description: Louisville's height and inside scoring strength won out over Fordham's hustling zone press last night in the final of the Holiday Festival before crowd of 12,333 at Madison Square Garden.

title: Hearings Set on Welfare Bill
