description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 30 (AP)  Senator Russell B. Long, chairman of the Senate Finance Committee, said today that the committee would open hearings Jan. 20 on the Administration's welfare reform bill, a measure that the Louisiana Democrat said would worsen the wel fare mess.

title: Article 4  No Title
description: PHILADELPHIA (UPI)Tom Ingelsby, the game's high scorer with 28 points con verted two free throws with six seconds remaining tonight as Villanova defeated South Carolina, 7776, for the Quaker City tournament championship. Earlier, Tennessee took third place, edging Boston College, 6160 and La Salle beat Massa chusetts, 8275, for fifth place.

title: Rome Offers Free Transit Rides in Test to Reduce Auto Traffic
description: ROME, Dec. 30Buses and streetcars carried passengers free today as the city started an unprecedented nineday ex periment with public transit. But many Romans spurned the free rides or suspected some gimmick.

title: Price Panel's Statement on Rules on Rent
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 30 Following is the text of the supplemental guidance on rent regulations issued today by the Price Commission:

title: Nine Persons Are Injured As S.I. Ferryboat Hits Pier
description: Nine persons were injured yesterday when a Staten Island ferryboat sideswiped a pier at the foot of Whitehall Street, the police reported.

title: Transit Situation at a Glance
description: PARTICIPANTSThe public agencies involved in the contract negotiations at the Americana Hotel are the New York City Transit Authority and its subsidiary, the Man hattan and Bronx Surface Transit Operating Authority. They operate the city's publicly owned bus and subway lines. Both are under the supervision of the Metropolitan Transportation Authority, a state agency.

title: Saigon Ends Cambodia Drive
description: SAIGON, Dec. 30 (AP) Some 25,000 South Vietnamese troops today ended a 39day drive in eastern Cambodia against staging areas of three North Vietnamese divisions. The campaign along Route 7 was designed to head off a dry season offensive into Military Region of South Vietnam, which includes Saigon and 11 surrounding provinces.

title: Canadiens, Forum And A.H.L. Farm Sold by Molsons
description: MONTREAL, Dec. 30 (Cana dian Press)  The Montreal Canadiens of the National Hockey League were sold today by J. David Molson and his brothers, William and Peter, to a group headed by Jacques Courtois, a Montreal lawyer and a director of the Bank of Nova Scotia.

title: OTC POSTS GAINS AS AMEX DECLINES
description: The overthecounter market did somewhat better than the American Stock Exchange yes terday as prices of most counter issues advanced while the listed issues were slightly lower.

title: Historian Says Pius Tried to Help Hitler's Foes
description: ROME, Dec. 30 (Reuters)  An American Jesuit historian here has reported that Pope Pius XII acted as intermediary for a group of Germans plot ing to overthrow Hitler in 1940 and also warned Britain and France four days in advance of Germany's May 10 invasion of France, the Netherlands and Belgium.

title: St. John's Beaten, 9069, As Maryland Wins Title
description: COLLEGE PARK, Md., Dec. 30The University of Maryland won its first invitational tour nament tonight as it Upset St. John's 9069, before 14,000 fans at Cole Field House.

title: STOCK PRICES DIP IN SLOW SESSION
description: Seasonal crosscurrents af fected stock prices yesterday to send the market moderately lower. Today will mark the final trading session for 1971.

title: Man Convicted in Stabbing; Victim Needed 915 Stitches
description: A 41yearold man stood convicted yesterday of wield ing a utility knife to inflict 160 cuts over the body of a friend that required 915 stitches.

title: TENANTS ALLOWED TO REFUSE TO PAY SOME RENT RISES
description: WASHINGTON, Dec, 30The Price Commission, issuing its specific regulations governing rent controls, told tenants to day that they may refuse to pay landlords any rent increase in January unless they have al ready paid a higher rent prior to Dec. 29.

title: McCarthy Supporters File
description: SACRAMENTO, Calif., Dec. 30 (AP)A committee backing former Senator Eugene J. Mc Carthy for President filed pa pers yesterday with the Cali fornia Secretary of State to enter a Democratic delegation in the state's primary next June, Mr. McCarthy announced in Boston on Dec. 17 that he would try for the nomination but has not said whether he would en ter the California primary.

title: Accounts of U.S. Air Attacks Broadcast by the Hanoi Radio
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, Dec 30The trembling voice of a 14yearold North Vietnamese girl saying that members of her family were killed by American bombs was broadcast several times yesterday and today by the Hanoi radio.

title: For an Honest French Meal, or Inexpensive Chile
description: Restaurants reviewed on this page on Friday are rated both for their food (four stars to none) and for their at mosphere, service and dcor (four triangles to none).

title: Bullets Stop Knicks, 110 to 102
description: The latest sevengame win ning streak of the New York Knicks ended yesterday at Madison Square Garden in a 110102 loss to Baltimore, but not before the Knicks showed a capacity crowd of 19,588 that even a 30point deficit isn't necessarily insurmount able in a National Basketball Association game.

title: Soviet Blast Indicated
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 30, (Reuters)The United States Atomic Energy Commission said it picked up seismic sig nals believed to be fromx a Soviet underground nuclear ex plosion today.

title: What to Expect in 1972
description: CHICAGOMore of the same oceans of rhetoric, punctuated by sporadic violenceis what any ra tional prognosis for public affairs in 1972 ought to emphasize. Big turning points in history are rare. Some cast a shadow in advance, as did both the start and end of World War II. Others pass unnoticed until long afterward when, looking back, men can detect some slower ebb or flow beneath the froth of everyday events. The chance of encountering a big surprise that makes a lasting difference in public life in 1972 is therefore so small that any rational man, looking ahead, ought to discount the possibility en tirely.

title: Moscow Assails U. S.
description: MOCOW, Dec. 30The So viet Government denounced today the fiveday bombing campaign of the United States against North Vietnam and said it belied the assurances of Washington that it sought to withdraw from the conflict in Indochina.

title: Family of Eight in Tent Gets RentFree House
description: NATIONAL CITY, Calif., Dec. 30 (UPI)A family of eight, which had been living in a tent on Mission. Bay for four months, was in a rent free, 10room house today. Thomas Gibson, a shoe shop operator, read of the plight of the Eugene Nichols fam ily and offered them the two story structure until Mr. Nichols could get on his feet.

title: Solution for Solzhenitsyn?
description: I speak from the mind. If Aleksandr Solzhenitsyn had been here to speak from the heart, all of us would be the better for it: every individual, every country, without exception. So spoke Prof. Paul Samuelson of M.I.T. a year ago at the Stockholm ceremony at which he and the other 1970 Nobel laureatesexcept Solzhenitsyn received their prizes. Now another annual cycle of Nobel awards has passed into history. But Solzhenitsyn still does not have his Nobel diploma and medal; his Nobel lecture remains unread.

title: Dr. Vikram A. Sarabhai Dead; Led India's Atom Energy Body
description: NEW DELHI, Dec. 30Vik ram A. Sarabhai, chairman of India's Atomic Energy Commis sion, who had an international reputation in cosmic ray and space research, died in his sleep this morning at the Kovalam Palace, a Government tourist hotel in southern Kerala state. He was 52 years old.

title: Article 6  No Title
description: BUFFALO, N. Y., Dec. 30 (UPI)Canisius, trailing by 12 points in the first half, scored a victory 8676 over Long Island University tonight in the first round of the Queens City invitational basketball tourna ment.

title: CARL W. PAINTER, A LEADING LAWYER
description: Carl Wesley Painter, for 38 years a partner in the New York law firm of Cravath, Swaine & Moore, died yester day in Doctors Hospital. He was 79 years old and lived at 175 East 79th Street and Shafts bury, Vt.

title: Greetings Are Limited To Neediest
description: Although most of the con tributions recorded yesterday by The New York Times Neediest Cases Fund were from individuals or families, several came from groups of workers employed in the metropolitan area.

title: Rockefeller's Ultimate Threat
description: For ambitious Republican politicians, seeking reelection or even elevation to higher office, is there anything worse than voting for higher taxes in the face of an increasingly conservative mood among voters? Governor Rockefeller thinks so. And some of his Republican col leagues in Albany seem to agree.

title: Players See Through the Cotton Fluff
description: DALLAS, Dec. 30The 36th annual Cotton Bowl game on Saturday, in the opinion of the men who will play in it, will be nothing more than a big game between a good Texas football team and a good Penn State team.

title: U.S. EFFORT TO AID PAKISTAN IS CITED
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 30 An account of a White House strategy meeting, published to day, asserts that during the re cent war between India and Pakistan, Administration offi cials proposed to let Jordan or Saudi Arabia quietly transfer Americanfurnished arms to Pakistan.

title: Academic Meetings: Study of War Urged;
description: PHILADELPHIA, Dec. 30 William P. Bundy, one of the influential policy makers of the Vietnam war, conceded today that American military plan ners might have let convention al war get out of hand in their direction of the conflict in Southeast Asia.

title: U.S. BOMBERS END INTENSIFIED RAIDS ON NORTH VIETNAM
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, Dec. 30The United States command announced today the end of its intensified bombing of North Vietnam after five days of raids. It also stated for the first time that the targets of the heaviest attacks against the North in three yearsin volving 1,000 strikeswere air fields, supply depots and anti aircraft sites.

title: News Analysis
description: In his first two days on the Presidential campaign trail this week, Mayor Lindsay unveiled not only his candidacy but also the theme that will support it through at least two Presiden tial primaries. The 50yearold Mayor will attempt to go to Washington by fighting Wash ington. He portrayed and will continue to por tray himself as the champion of the people in the struggle against the unknowing and uncaring Washington power centers, reminiscent of the unnamed power brokers whom the Mayor inveighed against in the early years of his City Hall regime.

title: Farmer White's Brown Eggs (Cont.)
description: To come upon an article in The Times called The Meaning of Brown Eggs was an unexpected pleasure. To find that it was by an Englishman, J. It Priestley, gave it an extra fillip. And to happen on it while returning from the barn carrying the day's catch of nine brown eggs seemed almost too pat.

title: Article 2  No Title
description: GREENVILLE, S. C., Dec. 30 (AP)Holy Cross College, led by Gene Doyle, Buddy Venne and Stan Grayson, defeated Furman, 10488, tonight to win the consolation game of the Poinsettia basketball classic.

title: TEXAS GULF SUITS REACH AN ACCORD
description: The Texas Gulf Sulphur Com pany announced yesterday that it had reached an agreement to settle the majority of the private damage litigation ac tions brought by former stock holders with regard to the com pany's ore discovery in 1964 near. Timmins, Ont.

title: Czechoslovak Evening at Philharmonic Has Radiance
description: There is a radiance about Czechoslovak music at its best that touches its listen ers in a most welcome way, and at Philharmonic Hall Wednesday night this radi ance was generously sup plied in Karel Ancerl's con cert with the New York Philharmonic.

title: Book Promotion: Success Isn't Sure
description: A declaration of bankrupt cy last month by Bernard Geis Associates, a house set up to publish the promot able and run on the princi ple that publicity sells books, has raised the question of whether the promotion of books by authors and pub lishers really works.

title: I.R.A. BURNS HOME OF AN ULSTER M.P.
description: BELFAST, Northern Ireland, Dec. 30 (AP)Guerrillas of the Irish Republican Army bombed and burned the country home of the Speaker of Northern Ire land's Parliament today in re prisal for what they called the wrecking of workingclass homes by the British Army.

title: COLONELS TRIUMPH AS ISSEL SCORES 42
description: MIAMI BEACH, Dec. 30 (AP) The Kentucky Colonels rolled to their eighth victory in nine games with a 11189 American Basketball Association victory over the Floridians tonight be hind the 42point performance of Dan Issel.

title: Bhutto Criticizes India
description: KARACHI Pakistani, Dec. 30  President Bhutto said in La hore today that Pakistan wanted to live in peace with all her neighbors, particularly India, but not in the manner in which India wants us to live.

title: Hoffa Seeks Active Union Role
description: DETROIT, Dec. 30James R. Hoffa said today that he would fight in the courts so that he could again become active in the International Brotherhood of Teamsters.

title: Brooklyn Milkman Found Slain as Dog Guards Truck
description: When the police arrived at 465 Georgia Avenue in Brook lyn yesterday, they found Rob ert Callahan dead in the hall way and his dog outside, guard ing the milk van Mr. Callahan had driven through the streets of East New York for the last 15 years.

title: LAKERS TRIUMPH FOR 30TH IN ROW
description: SEATTLE, Dec, 30 (AP)Jim McMillian scored 34 points as the Los Angeles Lakers defeated the Seattle Supersonics, 122 106, tonight and extended their National Basketball Association record winning streak to 30 games.

title: Retail Store Sales Up
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 30 The Department of Commerce reported today that retail stores sales for the week ended Dec. 25 were an estimated, $9,865,000,000, an increase of 12 per cent above the $8,865, 000,000 sales for the cor responding week last year.

title: PHONE COMPANY SEEKS MEDIATION
description: The New York Telephone Company has asked J. Curtis Counts, director of the Federal Mediation and Conciliation Service, to enter the negotia tions in the 25weekold strike between the company and 23 state locals of the Communica tion Workers of America.

title: Man in the News
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 30  The most interesting aspect of. the White House advance party that is on its way to China to complete the prep arations for President Nixon's journey may be the fact that the delegation is led by some one other than the Presi dent's assistant for national security affairs, Henry A. Kissin ger. The man in charge is the next best thing Kissinger's Kis singer, as he was described here today. He is Brig. Gen. Alexander M. Haig Jr., a but tondown, Ivy Leaguestyle career Army officer who is, above all, loyal to the next man up in the chain of com mand.

title: Nancy Brookes Wed in Tennessee
description: LOOKOUT MOUNTAIN, Tenn., Dec. 30Miss Nancy Newton Page Brookes, daughter of the late Mr. and Mrs. John St. Claire Brookes of Vienna, Va., was married here Tuesday to William Thorpe McKenzie, son of Mrs. William Charles Mc Kenzie of Lookout Mountain and the late Mr. McKenzie, who was vice president and general manager of The Chat tanooga Times.

title: Old and Alone in a Big City
description: Left behind by the younger, the richer and the mobile, lonely elderly people live scattered around New, York in neighborhoods that were better in their younger years.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: Suns Beat Braves, 123102
description: PHOENIX, Ariz., Dec. 30 (AP) The Phoenix Suns out scored the Buffalo Braves, 208, in the final six minutes of the first period and then coasted to a 123102 victory tonight.

title: Freeburg, Managing Editor Of Chicago Tribune, Quits
description: CHICAGO, Dec. 30. (Reuters)  Russell Freeburg, Managing editor of The Chicago Tribune, resigned today, the newspaper reported tonight.

title: The Individual as Institution: I
description: TORONTOWe all have become so used to certain clichs that even in going beyond them we still cling to themas if they were the trellis upon which wildness depends. No clich is more basic to the age than that the individual is powerless in the face of the huge corporations of the postin dustrial state.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: DEMOCRATS BRACE FOR JERSEY FIGHT
description: NORTH BRUNSWICK, N. J., Dec. 30  A major struggle be tween Senators Edmund S. Mus kie of Maine and Hubert H. Humphrey of Minnesota for New Jersey's crucial support at the Democratic National Con vention surfaced here this eve ning at a meeting of the state's Democratic county leaders.

title: Bridgeport Wins Title
description: UPPER MONTCLAIR, N. J., Dec. 30A layup by Paul Waters with 18 seconds left won the New Jersey Kiwanis basketball championship at Montclair State College's Pan zer Gym for the University of Bridgeport tonight as the Purple Knights downed C. W. Post, 6866.

title: John Kessler Marries Miss Bergquist
description: Miss Brenda Bergquist and John Whitlock Kessler of New York were married yester day in St. Paul's Chapel of Columbia University by the Rev. Edward Lynaugh, the Roman Catholic chaplain.

title: FOREIGN AFFAIRS
description: PARISWhen Joseph Luns, NATO's huge new Secretary General, comes here to confer with President Pompi dou, he will obviously try to strength en French ties with the Alliance and just as obviously not succeed.

title: CREDIT MARKETS NEAR STANDSTILL
description: The bond and money markets, which customarily drop into deep slumber during the final week of the year, finally started to doze yesterday, following three sessions of abnormally heavy activity in which interest rates had moved sharply lower.

title: Sporting News Cites Trevino
description: St. Louis, Dec. 30 (UPI) The Sporting News today named Lee Trevino as sport's man of the year.

title: Squires Again Top Cougars
description: HAMPTON, Va., Dec. 30 (AP) Charlie Scott missed a field goal with 12 seconds left, but hit two free throws with six seconds remaining tonight to give the Virginia Squires 124120 victory over the Caro lina Cougars.

title: Contingency Transit Plans Made
description: With memories of the 1966 transit strike still fresh in their minds, city and railroad offi cials have prepared elaborate plans to cope with a shutdown of buses and subways if to night's midnight strike dead line is passed without a con tract.

title: Books of The Times
description: DUCE! A Biography of Benito Mussolini. By Richard Collier. 447 pages, Viking. $12.50.

title: Stock Exchange Group Favors Martin's Call for Public Voice
description: A highlevel committee of the New York Stock Exchange called yesterday for a sweeping reorganization of the ex change's governing board to give a greater voice in manage ment to the public.

title: CAMBRIDGE, MASS., BARS RENT CURBS
description: CAMBRIDGE, Mass., Dec. 30 The Cambridge City Council refused today to reconsider the 5to2 vote it took Wednesday that wiped the city's yearold rent control law off the books, but four Councilors said they would test the legality of the repeal action.

title: Bhutto Said to Offer East a Loose Union
description: RAWALPINDI, Pakistan, Dec. 30 (AP)Highly placed Govern ment officials said today that President Zulfikar Ali Bhutto had proposed to Sheik Mujibur Rahman that Bangladesh and West Pakistan reunite in a loose federation similar to the one in which Egypt, Syria and Libya have joined.

title: Knittle, Landes in Net Final
description: Steve Knittle will meet Jim Landes in the final for 18year olds in the Eastern indoor tennis tournament at the Port Washington (L. I.) Tennis Acad emy today. Knittle defeated Philip Kadesch, 76, 46, 75, and Landes beat John Voikos, 62, 64, in semifinals yesterday. John Hayes, who beat Larry Lefrot, 61, 61, and Michael Grant, who beat Buddy Gal lagher, 61, 62, will play for the 16yearolds' title.

title: CatholicAnglican Dispute Over Communion Is Ended
description: After four centuries of sepa ration and theological contro versy, leaders of the Anglican and Roman Catholic Churches announced yesterday that they had reached agreement on the essential teachings about Holy Communion.

title: Peabody Enters Race For VicePresidency
description: CONCORD, N. H., Dec. 30 (AP)Former Gov. Endicott Peabody of Masachusetts, a Democrat, announced today that he would run for Vice President.

title: Federal Land Given to City
description: KEY BISCAYNE, Fla., Dec. 30 (UPI)  President Nixon an nounced today that about 85 acres of Federally owned land at the Veterans Administration hospital in North Little Rock, Ark., valued at about $20,000, would be turned over to the city for park and recreational use.

title: GOLD LAUDS RULES ON SPEEDY TRIALS
description: District Attorney Eugene Gold of Brooklyn yesterday en dorsed the new rules for speedy trials that are to go into effect May 1 and opposed proposed legislation to modify their rules.

title: MarketPlace: Dumping Stock: Some Solutions
description: Can institutions be dis suaded from the practice of dumping a stock by the tens of thousands of shares so that the auction can stay on an even keel?

title: Chaparrals Score, 10299
description: DENVER, Dec. 30 (UPI) Donny Freeman and Steve Jones combined for 19 of Dal las's last 29 points in the fourth quarter to give the Chaparrals a 10299 victory over the Mem phis Pros tonight.

title: Mayor Calls for Amphetamines Cutback
description: Mayor Lindsay called on Fed eral authorities yesterday to order a 90 per cent cutback in the production of ampheta mines by the country's drug manufacturers.

title: Theater
description: The invasion of the Bay of Pigs is one of the most exciting failures in modern history. The political, military and moral questions it raises are profoundly complex. The end, in disaster, is the es sence of tragedyor perhaps tragicomedy  particularly for those Cubans who delud ed themselves, or were de luded, into thinking the inva sion would be successful.

title: FUTURES IN CORN REGISTER A GAIN
description: Prices of corn futures on the Chicago Board of Trade rose  cent to  cent a bushel yes terday, the highs of the trading session.

title: Vietnamese Called Ellsberg CoConspirator Is an Economist
description: UNITED NATIONS, N. Y., Dec. 30  Vu Van Thai, named today as a coconspirator with Dr. Daniel Ellsberg in the case of the Pentagon papers, is now in Dakar, Senegal, working as a consultant on a river devel, opment project for the United Nations Development Program.

title: WILLIAM J. BYRNES, TRANSIT AIDE HERE
description: William J. Byrnes, assistant to the executive officer for construction administration of the New York City Transit Authority, died Monday of a heart attack in St. Peter's Hospital, New Brunswick, N. J. He was 58 years old and lived at 25 Innes Road, East Bruns wick, N. J.

title: 400,000 TENANTS AVOID INCREASES
description: Because their landlords failed to file for an increase or were disqualified for not clearing up violations, tenants in 400,000 controlled apartments here will not have to pay a rent increase next month.

title: Plan Panel Sends Mayor A Budget of $2.2Billion
description: The city's proposed construc tion budget shrank by $100, million yesterday because of bookkeeping error, but $250,000 was added for the Shakespeare Theater, which had never re quested the money publicly.

title: ALBANY PUTS OFF VOTE ON TAX BILL; DUE TO ACT TODAY
description: ALBANY, Dec. 30After more than 15 hours of fruitless po litical pulling and tugging, the Legislature recessed shortly after 11 o'clock tonight with out mustering enough votes on a $413million tax plan to help meet an anticipated 15month budget deficit of $1.5billion.

title: Article 3  No Title
description: OKLAHOMA CITY, Dec. 30 (AP)  Santa Clara defeated Army, 6661, to take third place at the 36th AllCollege basketball tournament tonight.

title: 119063 Wins in Jersey
description: VOORHEES TOWNSHIP, N. J., Dec. 30 (AP)  The winning number in this week's New Jer sey State Lottery was 119063.

title: Article 1  No Title
description: CHARLOTTE, N. C., Dec. 30 (UPI)  John Somoygi scored 24 points and Vinnie Roundtree 20 as Rutgers defeated Georgia Tech, 9164, in the consolation round of the Charlotte invita tional basketball tournament tonight.

title: Stock Exchanges Open, But Many Concerns Shut
description: The New York Stock Ex change and other major securi ties exchanges throughout the United States and Canada will be open as usual today and Monday, but some commodities exchanges, banks and other businesses will have extended holidays around the New Year's weekend.

title: Bob Hope Reads a Eulogy By Nixon at O'Donnell Rites
description: COLORADO SPRINGS, Colo., Dec. 30 (Reuters)Bob Hope read a eulogy from President Nixon today at the funeral of retired Air Force Gen. Emmett (Rosy) O'Donnell.

title: DOWDY CONVICTED OF TAKING A BRIBE
description: BALTIMORE, Dec. 30A jury today found Representative John Dowdy, Democrat of Tex as, guilty on all eight counts in his bribery, conspiracy and perjury trial in United States District Court here.

title: Article 5  No Title
description: SPRINGFIELD, Mass., Dec. 30Late free throws by Arnie Berman and Rich Cureton gave Brown University a 7069 vic tory over Morris Harvey and the championship of the Hall of Fame holiday festival. Ber man, who scored 24 points, was voted the tournament's most valuable player.

title: WILLIAM JENSEN
description: William Jensen, an architect associated with Skidmore, Owings & Merrill, died of a heart attack Tuesday in Puerto Vallarta, Mexico, while on vacation. He lived at 185 West End Avenue.

title: Advertising:
description: Foote, Cone & Belding will begin the new year with a new accountthe industrial development and tourism ad vertising business of Puerto Rico's Economic Development Administration. Industrial will bill $1million and tourism $1.5million.

title: Ellsberg Denies Charges
description: Dr. Ellsberg contended yes terday that the Government's charges against him were false and that he was not aware of having violated any criminal statutes.

title: Menus to Help Inaugurate New Year
description: In the menus below, the dishes marked with an as terisk are followed by a recipe.
